reviews.review: Great day with Nabeel. We booked the full day Cape tour and started our journey with 7 others on the half day tour, Nabeel was friendly and informative about everywhere we went. We got the opportunity to stop at numerous places to explore and take photos with Nabeel always keeping a watchful eye on us. We took some slight detours so we could view antelope in the wild and dip our feet in the sea!We left the rest of the group at Boulders beach and we're lucky enough to have the tour bus to ourselves, we went for lunch followed by wine tasting.Shortly after leaving the wine tasting we were stopped at a police road check, the police man was very rude to him for no reason and I thought this was very unfair to Nabeel. He was nothing but polite to the policeman. All in all we had a great day out we learnt lots about the region. I would highly reccomend the tours especially with Nabeel :)

We had a great experience. We were met at the airport upon arrival from Australia and transported to our hotel.Our driver was well presented and the car was spotless.On our second day we joined a small tour group for a half day "City and Table Mountain" tour which was well organised and ran smoothly. The next day we did a full day tour to "Cape Point and the Peninsular" This showed us a wide range of breath- taking scenery showing a wide contrast of rugged conditions, broad sandy beaches and Kirstenbosch Gardens.Another highlight was visiting Boulder Beach and seeing the Penguins - something quite special. We were picked up at our hotel on our last day and taken to the airport for our next part of our South African holiday.We were always notified the day prior to our trip and notified of the time we would be collected the next day. In all they could not be faulted.Vehicles clean and the staff very professional and well presented.

Private all day Cape penisula tour. Ilios was lined up by our travel agent for airport trasfer to and from our hotel. Spotless clean, late model cars and professional drivers. We ended up booking an all day penisula tour and was again very happy and impressed with Ilios.

Your experience depends on your guide. We took 3 tours with Ilios. Our first went well, the guide was knowledgeable and engaging. Very courteous, and attentive to our needs, providing water and stops when needed. the tour was good but there were some places we would like to have stayed longer.Our second tour was with another guide and we couldn't wait for it to end. The guide's accent was so heavy we gave up trying to understand him. He was nice but, not like our previous one. We asked for water and it was given reluctantly, saying it was for him and the driver. We had determined that if the same person was our guide for the third tour we wouldn't go. Fortunately our third tour was with our first guide.It all comes down to the fact that your experience is dependent on the guide and not the tour company.

An "unfortunate" experience. Whilst in Cape Town had daily contact and tours pre-booked with Ilios. Summing up let me tell you that we had to chase their office every day to get a pick up time for the next day. We believe that their office staff don't actually talk to the tour guides. Twice a guide came to the hotel when we were not due to take a tour and once advice from the office was not correct according to the tour guide who arrived a little later. This last mix up caused us a loss of at least half an hour on our Table Mountain visit. We did have some good days but overall Ilios, which is a large organisation, leave a lot to be desired.

Super staff. We had a half day tour and three airport collections with this company.The guys who collected us / brought us on tour were so chivalrous and full of craic, would highly recommend for their professional yet fun attitudes

BEWARE!. Worst travel company! Pick up was late more than two hours. Customer service is terrrible. Attempted to follow-up with driver's location but was put on hold several times, followed by shouting because I wanted in explanation for why the driver was late. Very unprofessional company! Go elsewhere for your tours. BEWARE!!! Ended up not going after all the drama!

Timely--Courteous--Informative. A great group of people assisted us from Ilios Travel. They picked us up from Cape Town airport in the fanciest of cars Mercedes-Benz and it was a short trip to our hotel as he pointed out things to see and do. Our transports that assisted us the 2 other times during our stay in South Africa were great as well. For 2 days during our stay in Cape Town we were with Paul Plastow. He is one of the best individuals that we met our trip. He was so well informed about the history of Cape Town and South Africa. Not limited to politics but animals, nightlife, the people and agriculture. He truly made our experiences in Cape Town special as he showed us many of its offerings while tailoring the tours to us. He assisted with lunch & dinner reservations all done with a smile. Paul was a true gem and we found it a privilege to be with him during our time in Cape Town. When we return to Cape Town we will hands down 110% be requesting Paul to assist us.

Highly Recommended Tour Company. In late September we had 3 days to explore Cape Town and booked two, full day tours with Illios. The communication with the company prior to making the bookings was prompt and efficient, we liaised with Busi. We booked the Cape Winelands full day tour and the Cape Point Peninsula Tour. Both were excellent!Reggie was our guide for the Winelands, we were picked up promptly, in an immaculate vehicle and had a wonderful day. Great commentary along the way, giving us history on the areas we were travelling through. Our first stop for coffee was at Stellenbosch, a town which had a wonderful shopping strip where I made a few lovely purchases of goods which I did not see elsewhere in Africa during our four week five country visit. The wine tastings were very well conducted during the tour and of a high standard (my husband works in the wine industry and was impressed). Reggie managed to slip in a couple of extra wine stops along the way which he said were his favourites. The restaurant where we had lunch (at our expense) was very pleasant. A thoroughly enjoyable day.The second tour we were picked up by Phillip promptly in another clean detailed vehicle, and taken to the Cape via the west coast, (Atlantic Ocean) Camps Bay beaches, Chapman's Peak drive and onto the Cape, returning via the east coast (Indian Ocean), Cape Point,lighthouse and the penguin colony. We had another enjoyable lunch stop (at our expense). Again the commentary given along the way by Phillip was excellent, however, try as he did, Phillip did not convince me, an Australian, that South Africa has the best beaches in the world! Another thoroughly enjoyable day.Can highly recommend Illios Tours to anyone visiting Cape Town. Great way to make the most of your time there and learn more about the areas in this wonderful part of the world.You can never cover the distance yourself if you chose to self-drive, nor meet the people you do, nor hear the commentary supplied.Thumbs up Illios.

Excellent from start to finish. Just returned from a great holiday thru Trailfinders, they use Llios travel what a great choice, We did Great tour of South Africa starting at JoBurg ending up at Cape Town I have been travelling since early 1970,s and this ranks with one of my best holidays .Dont be put of by the bad press South Afirica gets it is a great place with great people,great food and wine ,give it a try .Special thanks to Riaan Willams plus the driver what a great double act

Great tour guides!. We did 1. half day city tour, 2. full day cape peninsular trip, and 3. full day Stellenbosch winery tour with Ilios Travel.The drivers/guides and vehicles were great! Pleasant, punctual and very professional!They made great suggestions for eating options and provided plenty of history and information about the locations and sites. Thanks to Phillip on our full day peninsular tour for the ostrich encounter, the advice on procuring a successful seal encounter and rescuing a small person on our trip from a wasp!And many thanks to Ashraaf who showed us most of Cape Town ( including Table Mountain) and Stellenbosch. His choices of vineyards were superb and lunch spot was amazing. We really appreciated his efforts- he has enhanced our South African holiday!!We will recommend Ilios to our friends!

Highlights of the Cape tour with Avril and James. We were only in Cape Town for 5 nights and wanted to see as much as possible, so we booked a full day tour covering the highlights. This tour didn't disappoint! We booked a standard tour that ended up being private, which was great as it meant that we could squeeze in 3 wine tastings at the end! We were lucky enough to have 2 guides on our tour, Avril and James. They were both fantastic and really knew their stuff about every place we visited. You drive past so many interesting places and some amazing views! But while going past, you are being told what you are seeing and the history behind it which was very interesting. The enthusiasm that james has for the S African culture and history comes across and he made very entertaining. We had a lot to get through so we didn't get a lot of time in each place, but our guides made sure we had plenty of time for photo opportunities and to take in the experience.Everything we did on the tour was included in the price of our ticket, which was excellent value for money. The only thing we paid for on the day was our lunch and souvenirs.We had a fantastic day and would highly recommend this tour. Both Avril and james were great and did everything they could to make sure it was a memorable day.

What can you say. The organisation of our trip was great.Our Driver from Ilios was a very knowledgeable gentleman.He was well presented and nothing was to hard for him. We had a bit of bad weather , so he organised other places to explore. The company should be proud of Mikes Tour Driver.

Fantastic. We booked llios travel for our connections in kruger from airport and return. Great service, almost like going on another game drive. Saw giraffe, lions, etc.... driver knew where to go and look for the wildlife. great service ,, thank you

Memorable Garden Route Tour. Our extended private Garden Route Tour proved to be an amazing experience mainly due to the flexibility and knowledge of our guide Faizel. He soon realized our preferences and with thoughtful planning provided us with some special excursions, nothing was too much trouble. His professionalism and jovial manner contributed to having such a fun time. Also used this company for a number of transfers in various towns and were always provided with exceptional service. Therefore would highly recommend using Ilios Travel

Our airport transfer did not turn up! An hour later a Mercedes appeared!. We had a pre-booked airport transfer organised but after 45 minutes of waiting we had to ring them at great expense from a UK mobile. They said they would get back to us in a few minutes but they didn't. Then after another 15 minutes a black Mercedes arrived with a top-notch driver! He had great people skills and had been sent to ,sort things out but we felt we had been left for too long not knowing what was going to happen.

Professional. Every guide and tour was through Ilios travel. The guides were always on time, always very professional and informative. The vehicles were always in perfect shape and water was always available. We loved our tours and never felt unsafe or in harms way. Great service and thanks Nelly
Dependable. Did a half-day city tour, and Cape Tour. Our guide (Shareef) was very personable, knowledgeable and flexible. Highly recommended

A great overview of the Cape Town Peninsula. We took the all day Cape Town Peninsula Tour and found it very valuable for an overview of the area with an expert guide as we did not want to rent a car. We were picked up (and returned) to our hotel and were in a van with 2 other couples (total 6 people). Our guide had some very interesting insights into the culture, history, and real estate of the area. We first stopped in a village along the waterfront with souvenir stalls and the possibility of a boat ride out to an island, then it was on to the cape where we watched playful baboons and ostriches along the way. We took the tramway for views, then a photo by the Cape of Good Hope sign. After that it was off to lunch (on your own) at a waterfront location, a visit to see the penguins, and finally a visit to the world famous Kirshenbosch Gardens. As this was a full day packed with sights, we had approximately 2 hours at the Gardens, but were told how easy it would be to return another day if one wanted an extended visit. We left at 8 in the morning and were back at our hotel by 6:30. Long day, but well worth it.
Quality . Used them 3 times, Robben Island & City Tour, Cape Peninsula Full day tour and Aquila Safari. All 3 tours on time, with good transportation and great staff.

Dependable and Informational. I have used them twice, once for an airport pickup and then again for the half day Capetown/Table Mountain tour. Both times they were on time with clean comfortable cars, both the guides were friendly, knowledgeable and easy to get along with. Overall 2 good experiences.

We have now used them several times. On this vacation for transfers between various airports and hotels in South Africa and for a day long tour. We have been delighted. On time, helpful, friendly and polite. Will definitely use them again.

Sept, 2016. When I come back to Cape Town, I will definitly be using Ilios travel! AND I will be requesting Avril! SHe was our personal guide for several days. Ilios gave her the freedom to indivisualize our tour. She found out what we were interestedin, and then developed a wonderful experience for us. She was extremely knowledgeable about the history and culture of CapeTown, as well as the current politics and future of the area. We saw so much and learned so much. I only wished we had more time! Our tours of Cape Town areas was definily one of the high points of our trip. We owe this to Avril who did so much planning and teaching. She will be remembered for a log time as our friend in Cape Town!

Avril O'Connor is the BEST!!. My mom, sister, and I had the GREAT PLEASURE of having Avril as our host/guide for three days while we were visiting Cape Town. She stole our hearts with her knowledge of the area, her pleasant demeanor, and how well she took care of us--we truly hated to leave her to fly home! Ilios does a wonderful job....and we truly think AVRIL is the best...ask for her, you won't regret it!!!

Best customer service . I travel a lot. It also takes a lot to impress me. I was beyond impressed with our tour guide Abdul. He was incredibly incredibly incredibly knowledgable on the city's history, culture and things to do in the area. I understand this is what a tour guides role entails however his attitude is what set him apart. He was immensely kind and patient. Abdul thought outside of the box thinking of additional things we could do with extra time. We initially booked our trip through a US travel agency, if I would have known booking through Ilios was an option that would have been my first choice. I know our trip would have been much different without Abdul. He truly made it enjoyable by asking questions and understanding what we wanted to get out of the trip. I will definitely recommend Ilios to anyone I know traveling to the South Africa area.

On Time Every Time.... We used Ilios Travel on a pre-booked basis as follows:-Skukuza airport to Simbambili game lodge and return, andCape Town airport to Table Bay hotel and return.In all cases the vehicles arrived on time, and were clean with the drivers being very professional in ther driving.I highly recommend them.

Guide Provided by Ilios Travel. Ilios Travel provided us with a great guide while in Cape Town. She was flexible, funny, willing to talk about any subject, and a great companion for two days of touring Cape Town and surrounding areas, including the Winelands. Extremely knowledgeable. We learned a lot!

I've never had such a bored guide and chaotic arrangements. I chose the full day Walk to Freedom tour, which was booked online very easily. However, although the pick-up was prompt, the guide was not interested in answering questions, his body language told us it was just a "job". At the District 6 Museum we did not have time for more than a 20 minute taster. We spent a long time at Langa township walking around in the hot sun - rather voyeuristic. The talks by the artists at the craft centre were interesting and about the right length. We were then taken to the waterfront for lunch - but as the boat to Robben Island left at 1 o'clock we had about half an hour to grab a take-away - not at all satisfactory [there is a place on the island to buy drinks but not to stop for a meal - I suggest a packed lunch to eat on the boat]. The instructions on how to get from the drop-off point to the boarding point were useless - I would have got lost if my companions had not known the area. Then on the return a different person picked us up and stopped at a different place so finding him was difficult - in the process leaving behind one person as he had not been given a proper list.

Excellent service. We have just returned from a holiday in South Africa and Zimbabwe. The holiday was booked by Trailfinders and all excursions, pick ups and drop offs were arranged in advance with Ilios Travel. They were fantastic, always on time. The guides for our two excursions - half day Tour of Cape Town and full day Walk to Freedom Tour - were very friendly and knowledgeable. Wouldn't hesitate to use this company again or to recommend them to others.

Great touring and the best guide ever . My wife and I, along with three other couples visited Cape Town from 9/10-9/15. We toured the winelands, the full Cape tour, Table Mountain and a couple of other side trips. The sights were magnificent but more importantly, our guide, Zunaid "Z" Arnold was the best. He went way out of his way to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. It was obvious that he is quite proud of his country and city and his positive approach to every day was the best. He was efficient, informative, and I believe all of us felt that we made a great friend. Ultimately it was Ilios that was smart enough to hire Z and therefore I would recommend Z specifically and Ilios in general for an incredible job. You made our trip great. Thanks!

KwaZulu Natal Highlights. We had a good 7 day tour with Cyril, our tour guide from Ilios Travel. We enjoyed all of the week visiting the battlefields and the mountains, plus a safari at the end of the tour.We had one hiccup and that was with our dietary requirements that had not been fully communicated to the relevant personnel/ hotel staff etc. However, Cyril was excellent in helping sort the problems out for us. Would do another trip with Ilios,

Stay Away. My wife and I recently visited Cape Town for our honeymoon. Prior to our visit, we booked a private shuttle to and from the airport, a private cape point tour and a private wine lands tour through Ilios Travel. Also during our visit, we booked a whale watching tour through Ilios Travel. On our first day during the Cape Point tour, we toured the typical sites, but at the end of the tour, the tour guide took us to a Jewelry store in Cape Town. This was obviously a scam where if we would have purchased jewelry, either the tour guide or Ilios Travel would have made a commission on the sale. If I wanted to buy jewelry while in South Africa, I could have went to the jewelry store myself vs. paying a private tour guide. This leads me to believe there are other scams of this type in all of their tours! Beware!The next day, we went on the Whale Watching tour which was amazing, but my wife started getting sick by the end of the trip so we decided to cancel our private wine tour which was scheduled the following day. Since we did not cancel the tour with 24 hours’ notice, Ilios Travel only refunded $25 of approximately $1,000. They claim they could only refund $25 associated with the "entrance fees portion of the trip" because the remainder of the cost was spent on "sales team processing enquiries, time and effort spent" and "operations planning". What about the money that would have been spent on gas to drive to a from the winelands? That money was never spent! I've been in sales for the past 11 years and continually work with my customers when issues like these arise. I completely understand there are certain costs which are already spent, but to only refund $25 of approximately $1,000 is unacceptable, especially when a customer booked all their Cape Town activities through your company. In my opinion, this is extremely poor customer service so I highly recommend staying away from Ilios Travel, unless you're in the market for some jewelry!

Great one stop shop for all Cape Town tour needs. We used Ilios for both of our major tours in Cape Town. First was our full day wine tour with Jean and it was a ridiculously fun experience. He knew his stuff and was chock full of energy and jokes the whole time, even after we were feeling a bit woozy from all of the rose! They gave us plenty of time to explore, and made us feel very welcomed the whole day. On our next tour we had Reggie take us to the Cape of Good Hope, and as with Jean he was friendly, knowledgeable, and gave us plenty of time to explore. Overall we were very happy with the service we were given and happily recommend Ilios to future tour-goers!
Always on time. My travel agent used them in both Johannesburg and Cape Town. Never a minute late. Vehicles are in good condition, and drivers are friendly.

A lot to fit into one day!. We were left a message the night before as to the pick-up time and the mini bus arrived on time.The commentary as we were driven around was interesting and informative. Our guide and driver were keen to accommodate us and make the tour as pleasant as possible.If your finances permit then lunch at the Two Oceans restaurant is worthwhile because not only is the food excellent but the presentation is exemplary.There is a lot to fit in on this tour and whilst we would have liked to spend more time at some of the places visited we appreciate that this wasn't possible.In summary, this tour is ideal if you want a quick taster of the Cape but is equally useful to see some places that you would want to return and spend some more time.

Great half-day tour to the Cape of Good Hope. We loved our half-day tour with our guide, Jean-claude. They picked us up at our Sea Point accommodation, then we rode in a van with 4 other guests. We stopped at Camps Bay for photos, then Houts Bay for more photos & souvineer shopping. We had 2 stops at the Cape, then enough time with the Boulder's Beach penguins before heading back to Cape Town. We loved JC's stories about the history of the area, the landscape, etc. And he made sure everyone was comfortable along the way. The trip was great value for money.

Outstanding Value for the Money. On a recent visit to Cape Town, I took an Ilios full-day tour of the Cape, which included round trip bus transportation from the V & A Waterfront to the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point Lighthouse. I was so impressed, as the views are stunning and the tour price also included admission to Boulders Beach for penguin viewing and Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. There is also time built into the schedule for lunch and individual sightseeing. Jonathan was our tour guide and he was extremely pleasant, informative, and entertaining. I highly recommend this tour for any first-time visitors to the area. It was so much more relaxing to not have to worry about driving or traffic on a guided tour.

Superb service. Cannot praise highly enough the experience we had with Ilios Travel on their Grand Tour of South Africa. Our guides Walter, for the first week, and Danson, for the second, we're both knowledgeable, engaging and very helpful and friendly; and knew the best "Kodak moments". The accommodation was without exception excellent, although special mention should go to Ghost Mountain Inn and Hunter's Lodge both of which had a unique ambiance. The itinerary provided a wonderful mix of wildlife (game drives, river safaris, conservation reserves), scenic drives, historical and cultural experiences, with a good balance of city and country making for a truly memorable holiday.We had hoped for a trip of a lifetime, Ilios not only delivered but exceeded our expectations, and we hope to return to South Africa. Our thanks to Trailfinders who we booked through, Ilios and particularly Walter and Danson.

5 different drivers, 5 great experiences. We used Ilios for airport pickup/dropoff as well as for transportation to and from Hermanus and Cape Point. On all occasions the drivers were very professional and above all knowledgeable of the area.
Private drivers/transport. The drivers for our numerous journeys have been excellent. Knowledgable, helpful and very punctual. Our journeys were made very easy with their help.
Great service !. Our intire roundtrip was organised by Illios travel , great service !!! Nice and friendly guides and drivers who do their job with passion .

Very professional guide, driver and comfy new vehiclrd. Very impressive tour company. Guide Adiel was excellent, easy to understand, good explanations and humorous. Driver Bongani drove safely around the spectacular coastal route to cape of good hope and cape point. Do the full day trip. Picked up at guest house and dropped at end. I noticed at stops all their cars, minibuses and larger ones were very new and clean. Very professional in communication unlike my tour with a different company the day before.

UK family travelling with teenagers. Not wanting to drive whilst on holiday we pre-booked all tours and transfer with Ilios. A warm welcome at the airport was a sign of the level of service we were to receive through out our time in the Cape. Travelling on small mini-bus with extremely well informed guides, we saw some amazing places. Strongly recommend the Cape Point tour, I cant remember the names of our two guides (Thursday 11 August), but they were so much fun and really informative, really making us feel that they were proud to be showing us their home!All other tours were excellent, and transfers to/ from Franschhoek felt like an additional tour. Don't drive, see the country, hear about what you are seeing, use Ilios Travel.

Great Company. We had several hours to spend in Cape Town. We were picked up at the airport and our guide was just amazing. We spent the afternoon sightseeing and had time for lunch. We were then taken back to the airport for our international flight!

A great couple of days!. We did a private cape peninsula tour and a winelands tour with Peter. We were a party of 9 people. We had a great couple of days. The programme was varied and tailored very well to our party which included 4 children between the ages of 6 and 11. I would definitely use them again and highly recommend them.
Excellent. My agent uses Ilios for me. They are professional, courteous, and on-time. Vehicles are top notch, safe drivers, and well dressed. Highly recommend.
Travel Guides - Ilios Travel. We had an Ilios guide/driver for five days through Garden Route and Cape Town. Excellent, Wonderful. Knowledgeable, friendly and flexible. Will use them again.

Naser our guide. Our Trip to Cape Town and Knysna was just amazing and our guide was one of a kind. We enjoyed it more because of him. He worked so hard to make sure we were entertained plus the kids loved him. We would definitely recommend this tour guide for any visits to western or eastern cape. And Bongani our driver to knysna was a sweet one and drove us very safely. I loved Ilios Travel, I will always recommend it to my family and friends.
Safe and dependable. They were always on time to pick us up. Our guides were very knowledgeable and easy to talk to. We learned a lot from them.

"Cape and Peninsula tour". Experienced a thoroughly interesting and informative full day tour with our driver/guide Michael. Even my teenager commented on all the interesting facts he provided us with. The weather may not have been perfect with cloud cover being persistent throughout the day but this didn't dim our enjoyment in anyway. We saw a plethora of creatures baboons, ostriches, antelope and penguin. The scenery was stunning particularly Chapman's Peak. Would recommend this travel company highly they contacted us to confirm pick up times and the service provided was prompt, professional and enjoyable.

A little bonus. Just spent 2 weeks touring South Africa.Started in Cape Town.Met by Ilios rep at airport and transfered to hotel.Rep kept us informed of all that was happening. Next couple of days were spent with Rory our Ilios guide who took us on various trips and visits. Rory was very knowledgeable and full of little pieces of information. We then carried on down the garden route under Rory,s guidance,we finally said good bye to him in Port Elizabeth. We then flew up to Johannesburg where we met Nelson our new guide. We spent the next couple of days with Nelson working our way down the panorama route. Nelson was also friendly and full of little snippets of information. We finally said good bye to Nelson in Hazyview where we went on to a Nature Reserve for a few days before flying home. If Rory and Nelson are typical of Ilios guides I would happily recommend them to all. They made an interesting time great.

Cape Point and Peninsula tour . The tour was interesting with a very knowledgeable tour guide. We spent the entire day driving around the peninsula . The van had no speaker system which made it hard to hear him in the back seat . The guide used excellent time management and ensured we saw everything despite traffic . We saw baboons , ostriches and whales . It was a lot of driving which would have been dull without the question and answers from the group .

Our Ilios Guide - Abdul Clarke. My family and I travelled the garden route from Port Elizabeth to Cape Town with our Ilios guide, Abdul Clarke. Abdul, you were superb and I thank you for showing us a great time and creating such a wonderful experience on this trip. You went out of your way to make sure that our every request was met, genuinely cared for our welfare and many times went over and beyond the call of duty to make sure that we were happy, satisfied and safe. You even treated our kids like they were your own and that was special. If you use Ilios and have a chance to pick your guide, I would highly recommend Abdul. Par excellence.

grand tour of south africa. I did a 2 week tour with illios travel ( booked through Rainbow tours UK) in south Africa and found them to be very reliable and informative and punctual. The grand tour itself was mostly very interesting, didn't much like Durban and Swaziland but the rest was fantastic.I recommend them and I never felt unsafe with them

Efficient transfers and informative tours. Our UK based travel company - Audley- had used Ilios as their South African partner for all our airport transfers and for the two tours we had requested in Cape Town. Ilios were always on time, the vehicles were clean, safe and comfortable and the guide informative and candid about South Africa. Our two tours were to the wine lands and to the Cape Peninsula. Both were well organised and fitted in with our requirements. We were a group of 11 so we were able to agree to the itinerary and to the restaurants and finish times. This was easily accommodated. The Big Easy restaurant in Stellenbosch and the Two Oceans restaurant at Cape Point were booked by the guide (Sharif) with our agreement and both were excellent.

Great tours. I did the tours to Cape Point and also to the Winelands with Ilios Travel and it was a great experience. Both tours were very well organized, with good guides, I had lots of fun. The wine tasting was great, and the tour to the Cape of Good Hope was very informative. I would highly recommend them!

A tale of 2 extremes. We began our time in Cape Town by using Ilios to pick us up at the airport. The driver/guide we on time and very helpful. He was our first introduction to the beautiful city and did a fantastic job. The next day things changed. We booked, via Expedia, a full day city tour which was to include Table Mountain, Robben Island, multiple museums as well as a guided city tour. We were told that Table Mountain was weather dependent. It was a beautiful sunny day. When we were picked up by our guide we were immediately told that the likely hood of getting up TM was doubtful because of the lines. Other guides wait inline for clients, not Ilios. Were were driven to TM and told that if we wanted to do Robben Island we could not do TM. Ridiculous!!!! This was why we booked the tour! Each museum we stopped at we were told that we did not have time to take the provided tours because we would miss Robben Island. What incredibly poor planning for a tour. Also...we paid for round trip transportation to our hotel. However, we had to beg to be taken back. Awkward!!! All in all this was extremely disappointing.

Reliable, informed and comfortable. We had a number of occasions to use Ilios during our recent trip to South Africa. They were booked by Go2Africa (whom we heartily recommend), were always early, had full knowledge of the day's trip (whether driving to a safari lodge, wine tasting in Stellenbosch, or touring Soweto). Our adolescent children learnt a great deal about the Apartheid era, the struggle, Mandela, and the post-struggle evolution of the country without ever feeling lectured or criticised for honest questions.

Very good service. Ilios collected us at the airport and the driver was exceptionally polite and helpful. We then took a private day tour down to the cape of good hope. Our driver jorges was very informative and knowledgable and gave us a great tour. The vehicle was first class and as new. Highly recommend.

Omar was great. We visited Cape Town for a four day visit, doing Table Mountain, the cape and the wine region. Omar was our guide and did a great job getting us around the sites in an easy and relaxed way. We saw everything and Omar made sure that we were well looked after. His involvement made sure we had a lovely time

Great tour guides!. We did the 1/2 day wine tour and the full day Cape Peninsula tour. Henry was our tour guide and he was wonderful! He was knowledgable and pleasant and willing to accommodate us in whatever way possible. Despite having very cold, rainy weather, Henry made sure we had a great day. Nasir drove us back to the airport and he was very funny and even got there earlier than planned so that we could ensure we would make our flight.

Airport Transfers & Tour Guide. These are the notable points about Ilios Travel:They were waiting at the airport despite my 6 hour delayStylish super clean white land roverInformative guideProfessional Bottles of cold water waiting for you in the vehicleNo weirdness about tips etc. No tip req'd I used Ilios for a handful of journeys and had a great experience on each occasionHighly recommended. 5 stars

Reliable & great experience. We used Ilios Travel to get all around Cape Town during our honeymoon. Their crew took us to and from airports, cities and all over Cape Town. SHOUT-OUT to their guide Ash who was incredible and so knowledgeable. He took us around for a day and half and took beautiful pictures for us. He was so kind and he made our experience memorable. Highly recommend this company!

Exceptional!!. Our tour guide Naser was extremely outgoing and reliable. Unfortunately our whale watching excursion was cancelled due to weather conditions, but our guide improvised a most enjoyable day/experience. Would 10/10 recommend Ilios travel and especially Naser!

The best city day trip. I look the full day tour of the peninsula and it has to be one of the best day trips you can do from any city anywhere in the world. Starting with the stunning Twelve Apostles and moving on through beautiful Hout Bay (including a boat trip to the seal island), the iconic Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point, charming Simon's Town and nearby Boulder's Beach with its adorable and hilarious penguins, finishing up in the shadows of Table Mountain at peaceful Kirstenbosch Garden. Our guide Michael barely took a breath all day as he told so many interesting stories and funny jokes about the places we visited, which really added to the enjoyment of the sites, and he was very patient any time we wanted to linger at one place a little longer. Definitely recommend taking this journey, and with Ilios you'll enjoy it even more!
Reliable. We booked our tour through Trailfinders and they contract transfers to Ilios. They were 100% reliable, the drivers were smart, felt safe and some acted more like guides than just drivers.

Excellent travel agent!. Ellio travel did all my tours for me while in Capetown and Johannesburg! What a great travel agency. Very professional, will take you to all the major nice places for a reasonable price. Very reliable, safe drivers, great communication! Lots of travelers traveling by themselves. Elios pick you up at the hotel and bring you back as well. If you need to speak to a live person on the phone, there's a 24 hour operator. WILL recommend Elios Travel 100%. I

Great service. Our travel company booked our transfers with Ilios whilst in South Africa and I can't recommend them highly enough. A driver picked us up from the airport and took us to our hotel in central Cape Town, then another returned us to the airport for our flight to the Eastern Cape and Port Elizabeth. They transferred us to our game reserve and finally back to the airport for our flight home. All the drivers were on time, helpful, courteous and very knowledgeable about the area - more like tour guides really! The vehicles were clean and comfortable and I would recommend Ilios to anyone.

A snapshot only - Capetown half day city tour. Our friendly guide Avril picked up us first thing after breakfast. We're glad we got to the Table Mountain cable car before it opened at 9am as the queues were already forming. She kept us to a good schedule and pace as we had a lot to fit in in our half day tour arriving at the perfect time for the midday cannon. We found the District 16 museum fascinating and shocking. Would have liked to have had more time to spend wandering the Bo-Kaap streets by foot, and skipped the sciencey museum all together. Avril shared her own stories and personal experiences which made the historical facts that much more interesting and moving. A terrific warm and knowledgeable guide!

Fantastic friendly service. Our driver Ishmael (hope I spelt this right) was friendly and helpful for the two days he showed us round Capetown and the surrounding area. He was knowledgeable and tried to show us what we were most interested in - overall our stay in Capetown would not have been complete without his help, plus he was great company. The driver who took us to and fro the airport was also a really friendly guy - so thank you Ilios Travel - really recommended !

5 days with Henry Booysen from Ilios. We drove around with Henry from Cape Town till Port Elisabeth and visited lots a of places. He asked what we wanted to see and made suggestions. He was by far the best guide we had on our 3 week trip through South-Africa. A very good guide who knows a lot! He explains things during the drive and at the places, gets things done (when for example people were working slow and we were losing time) and knows a lot of people. With our family of 8 we were very happy that Henry was our guide!
Great traveling with Illos and Adeal. We were in Cape Town for a few day and A deal was our Guide/Driver. He was fantastic following what we wanted to see and adding his special spots to stop at.

Cape Point full day tour. Good tour. Loved the penguins and Simontown. Icraam was excellent guide with good knowledge. The tour company had pre booked a restaurant in Simonstown. Restaurant. The restaurant was fairly expensive and the service was rushed and the woman in charge not friendly. I would have preferred to have chosen for myself one of the more interesting places in the street. We wished we had said no to the restaurant and gone off on our own. Food was OK but not worth the cost and the rush. The tour part of the trip was excellent.

Asleep!. I was supposed to be picked up at Skukuza airport and found no one waiting for me. After everyone else on my flight had gone, and went out to the parking lot to find my driver asleep at the wheel. Not happy!

Excellent tour, brilliant guide. We booked onto the half day trip to the Cape of Good Hope, which included a visit to the Boulders Beach Penguin Colony and were picked up promptly from our hotel by our wonderful guide Avril. The minibus was spacious and comfortable and we were thoughtfully provided with maps and a cooler, from which we could help ourselves to bottles of water. Avril was very friendly, lively and informative and patiently answered our endless questions, whilst skilfully negotiating the winding roads of the Atlantic Seaboard. The tour included many breathtaking sights and Avril knew exactly where to find the best photo opportunities en route. This tour is excellent value for money and I would definitely book another trip with this company next time I'm visiting South Africa

Our guide, Naser Elkurdi, made the city an environs come alive.. I have traveled many countries in the world and rarely do you find a guide like Naser. Truly he loves Cape Town and he makes you love it too. His enthusiasm for the views and the beauty is unvarnished. For 3 days we looked forward to the next adventure. We shared laughter and Naser shared stories and the history of the area. If you are able to choose a guide, contact Ilios and ask for Naser. You will not regret it.

Excellent guide. We did the full day Cape tour with Phillipe and we loved it. The tour itself was excellent, so much was comfortably fit into the tour. Phillipe was more than just knowledgeable about the places we visited, he also helped us with some slang, driving tips and some of the local politics. He was very friendly and entertaining. Our tour was supposed to end at 5pm and we had to pick up a rented vehicle at 6. It should have been enough time however one of the other tour members delayed us and we panicked a little, not sure of our car situation that we HAD to get that night. Phillipe raced us over safely and gave us some much needed traveling tips and assistance. He not only saved that day for us, but the next as well as his information made all the difference in getting to our next location. We will never forget this above and beyond service!

Best tour guide ever . When traveling to a new place you want to make sure you see all the best spots but knowing what the best spots for you are, can be difficult. Naser was our guide. He was creative, helpful and went that extra mile. He took a standard "cape day trip" and customized it. He knew our 11 year old loved animals so he pulled off of the road at this conic view where he knew baboons hung out. Just little things that set him apart. If you will be visiting Cape Town i recommend requesting naser.

Excellent Tour Guides. Our tour guide Faizel Abrahams was excellent during our Tour of the Garden Roue from Cape Town to Port Eliz. He really made the trip suggesting great places to visit and restaurants to eat at. We have had 5 pickups from ilios at different cities and they all have been on time and provided info about tours of the city ...... and not necessarily with them. Now that's service. We us them whenever we are in South Africa.

Great 2.5 days with Peter. We had 2.5 days of private tour for a group of 8 with Peter Meyer from Ilios. He provided an excellent your for us! Our first segment was a half day during which we went up Table Mountain and visited the slave museum. We then walked through town and briefly visited the South Africa Museum. He never rushed us and in fact accommodated us going a bit overtime.Our next two days were fabulous and Peter did an excellent job of pointing out highlights, putting them in the context of his own family history, and adjusting the itinerary based on our interests and when the Robbin Island boat was cancelled due to weather. I highly recommend Peter and based on our experience would use this company again. Hopefully I will return to Cape Town some day!

Abdul Clarke-outstanding guide. Abdul Clarke met our large group (6 adults and 6 teens) at Port Elizabeth airport on June 27, and for the next six days, became an honorary member of our families as we traveled the Garden Route and toured Cape Town. His knowledge captivated us with facts about the history of South Africa and the settlement and development of Cape Town, punctuated by his (well justified) pride and passion for this lovely and vibrant city. No question went unanswered, and we really tried to stump him! He indicated that he prepares diligently for his clients, researching their home countries and also participates in various continuing education programs. We enjoyed his quick wit and humor, which made the long drives fly by. Although only scheduled to be with us for four days, he asked to be assigned to us on tours of the Cape and Wine Region (on his scheduled days off) which were outstanding. Above all, his concern for our safety, keeping us on time (which was challenging with our group) and his flexibility on excursions and schedule was his priority. I cannot say enough great things about how our families (young and not-so-young) bonded with Abdul. While our trip to South Africa will provide us with lasting memories, Abdul will certainly be one of our favorites. We will strongly recommend him to family and friends traveling to South Africa.

Great Tour Company for a Honeymooning Couple. Ilios Travel set up a few full/half day tours including Cape Town, Cape of Good Hope, whale watching and Stellenbosch for my husband and I. Our guide, Naser, did a great job touring us around, providing interesting explanations and adjusting the itinerary to our points of interest as we went along. We definitely recommend Ilios!

Outstanding Guide. During our recent trip to South Africa, we had the most wonderful guide, Tracey De Koster. Tracy is bright, informative, humorous, and energetic. She never tired of sharing her knowledge and the love of her country with me and my 5 traveling companions. She answered our endless questions and ensured that we saw all that we wanted to see in 3 jam-packed days. My only regret is that we didn't schedule more time in Cape Town. Thank you Tracy for making our trip all the more memorable!!

Excellent service, great value. Ilios provided us with a number of services on our recent trip to Cape Town - airport pick up and drop off and tours to Cape Point and the Winelands. The services were, without fail, excellent. The airport pickup and dropoff were seamless, the drivers pleasant, the vehicles of the highest standard. The kind touch of the driver welcoming us with a coll bottle of water on our arrival was much appreciated. The tours were also great. If I have a comment it is more by way of a recommendation - I didn't know that there was a cash-only payment add-on on the Cape Point tour, a trip on a boat to Seal Island. Luckily I had enough cash on me, and I would have brought warmer clothes if i had known. However I think that was probably a missed communication between our travel agent and us. I would definitely recommend this company's services.

16 day escorted tour of South Africa. Amazing holiday. The guides, places we visited, hotels, food, in fact everything was wonderful. The scenery was beautiful. We added 4 days and flights to Victoria falls which was also amazing.We booked our holiday through Travelbag and everything went smoothly. They used a tour company in South Africa which was Ilios tours and we can thoroughly recommend them. No huge coaches. Comfortable mini buses and on our tour there were only 8 of us. Well done Travelbag and Ilios Tours.

Garden route. We booked a five day tour of the Garden Route with Ilios Travel for June 2016 . Jean Martin was our guide and what a great guide he was! From the moment he introduced himself he was informative, helpful, polite, pleasant and couldn't do enough to help us get the best out of the trip. He has a wonderful sense of humour and kept us laughing! We would thoroughly recommend Ilios Travel judging from the wonderful experience we had!!

Incredible tour of Pretoria and Jo'burg. Leonard from Illios Travel spent a full day with us showing us the sights of both Pretoria and Johannesburg. He is incredibly knowledgeable about the cities and all aspects of the country. He tailored our day so that we could see and visit everything that was of interest to us. His driving tour of Johannesburg included both the beautiful northern suburbs and the "real" city centre which is a stark contrast to what we had seen in the rest of Southern Africa. Illios certainly knows how to treat visitors to South Africa.

Fabulous Tailored Tours of Cape Town. We had Lynn from Illios Travel as our guide for three full days in Cape Town the last week of May 2016, and she was a wonderful guide and shared her love and knowledge of her city with great passion and charm. We did the Cape Town tour which she customized to allow us to see exactly what we wanted, and then did the full day Cape Peninsula and Winelands tours. She was always early and had excellent recommendations for lunches and activities after she dropped us off at the end of the day. Illios also handled all our airport transfers and were a pleasure to work with, with their kind drivers and spotless vehicles. I would highly recommend Illios and Lynn to anyone visiting Cape Town.
Excellent ground services. We did site inspections in Cape Town alongwith Table Mountain tour and winelands tour. Shamiel made our trip even more interesting. Thank you Ilios Team.

Fantastic company!. We recently did two tours with this company, the half day city tour with Icraam and the Peninsula and Cape Point tour with Jean and Azeem.The half day tour was really good but unfortunately the weather was very overcast and foggy and we weren't able to go up Table Mountain. Icraam was a fantastic guide! However, the one downside was the other family on our tour who continually interrupted and lagged behind and generally wanted to be anywhere but on the tour. I realise this is out of the company's control but it's a shame inconsiderate people ruin it for others.Again, the peninsula tour was great but the weather wasn't great again and it poured rain and was very windy. Regardless we had a great day and the sun came out later in the day. Jean was a great guide and had some great jokes interspersed in his commentary. Again out of the company's control, but I thought I'd put it in as a recommendation, the place we stopped for lunch (sorry, I can't remember it's name) had a very racist lady serving who referred to the three Asian looking guys on our tour as 'The Chinese'. I know it's one person but feedback should definitely be given because that's a really bad way to conduct yourself in a professional environment.

Very informative guide. We took a day tour round the cape. My husband has a stamina problem so walking is difficult, our guide was excellent and mad the day memorable. She also chatted to us about South Africa giving us a good insight into the country

Good service and prompt email reply. We decided to visit the Cape of Good Hope at the very last minute and booked a half day tour with Ilios Travel a day before. I was worried that the booking didn't get through and dropped them an email. The reply was prompt and the pick up was on time. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable. It was indeed a good choice.

Cape Peninsula Tour was great. We did the Cape Peninsula Tour on May of 2016. Our guide, Mervynn, was very good at giving us information, good to have a conversation with and good with knowing when to just let us be to explore. We stopped at Boulder Beach first where the penguins are. Then we went to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope and Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. The tour was excellent and very enjoyable.

14 day grand tour of South Africa. From the time Ilios met us in Johannesburg for our 14 day grand tour ending in Cape Town we were so well looked after, all of the driver/guides were amazing ensuring we had the very best experience, their knowledge was amazing as was their friendly good humour. The service we received was seamless, punctual and extremely enjoyable. Thank you Ilios for an unforgettable holiday

Tailor your trip to what you want to see. We hired a driver from Ilios to tour Cape Town and surrounding area for 2 days. Our driver provided history of the city and let us know about museums or other points of interest that may not have been mentioned in our guide books. One rainy day that was meant for Table Mountain but couldn't be attended due to weather turned into a personalized tour tailored to what we wanted to see - we should have requested this first. We went to Cheetah Outreach and our guide knew of some great wineries with food pairings that were of interest to us.

Unforgettable day trip with guide Peter Meyer. Kristin at Audrey Travel arranged a full day private excursion with IIios Travel. We had the good fortune of having long time guide Peter show us the highlights of the Cape as well as lunch at the boating community of False Bay. Recommend traveling thru Chapmans Peak where the coastal drive is reminiscent of Hawaii! Stellenbosch architecture and wineries were magnificent. The chocolate paired wine tasting at Waterford was delightful. Try the funicular to the top of the Peninsula and see the meeting of the Indian and Atlantic oceans. The penguin colonies at Boulders Beach were so playful and sweet-take the time to see them just off the boardwalk.

Cape Day Tour - Highlight Cape of Good Hope & Boulder Beach Penguin Colony. As this was my first visit to the continent and first in South Africa, my Cape Highlights Tour was fantastic. The Ilios Tour Guide was not only knowledgeable and experienced, he was also very friendly and helpful throughout the entire day

Great Tour of the City and Surroundng Area. Our guide, Shamiel, did a fantastic job of giving us a taste of Cape Town. His van was clean and he wore a headset to everyone could hear him. Our two and 1/2 days ended up being three full days. We saw so much, and he gave us so much personal information. A wonderful experience.

Ilios was the best for us!. We can't rave enough how much we enjoyed our tours with Ilios Travel. Our family of four took four different private tours with this company. We took the Cape Point and Peninsula, Robben Island and City Tour, Cape Winelands, and Cape Rivera & Whales Full Day Tours. Our guide/driver, Shareef, promptly arrived every morning, and was extremely knowledgeable and professional. He made suggestions of excellent restaurants when we made stops, and was very personable and fun. We never had to think about what was next, he took care of us. He gave us extra time when we were more interested at an attraction. We were actually too early to see whales in Hermanus, so he took us to see more penguins at Betty's Bay because I love penguins. We wanted to go to a specific restaurant in Cape Town, and he dropped us off there instead of our hotel, which saved us a taxi fare. We also had transfers from airports set up with Ilios, and our drivers met us with signs as soon as we arrived. The drivers were all professional. One even took us to a good place to exchange our money to South African Rand. We highly recommend Ilios Travel and Shareef!!!

LOVED CAPE TOWN AND ILIOS. We (four adults) arrived in Cape Town from our Safari tours and were met promptly at at airport by Ilios Tours. We had organised a wine tour and Cape Point tour.Omar was our driver and he was fantastic. Very informative, friendly and humorous.We were taken to Fairview Winery and had a great wine tasting with cheese and then onto lunch at Babylonstoren and a walk around Stellenbosch.Next day we did the Cape Point tour. Because of the fog Omar decided to reverse the order of the tour. We had a very good seafood lunch at Two Oceans at Cape Point and came home via the scenic route past Camps Bay.Great two days - thanks Omar and still remember your four must haves - Trust, Respect, Loyalty and Communication.

Cape Town tours - the nicest way. My wife and I had a wonderful 17-day visit to South Africa. Over this period, our airport-to-hotel transfers as well as a number of Cape Town tours (Winelands, Cape Town City Tour, Cape Peninsular ) were provided by Ilios. On all occasions we were very happy with the services provided in terms of reliability, punctuality, cleanliness of vehicles, friendliness, knowledge and expertise of the guides and drivers, and the manner in which our overall experience was made most interesting and enjoyable. Would definitely use Ilios again when in South Africa.

Worst experience of my life. I booked day tour for Pilanesberg National Park and Game Drive. The driver arrived one hour late while reaching the park I was apprised that the safari vehicle has already left as we arrived an hour late. I was then taken for game drive in the same non safari vehicle which was too low and the driver had no idea about the park and where to spot all the animals. it was total waste of my day. I have never imagined such unprofessional service and attitude. Would not recommend it to anyone.

Ilios Travel for Cape Town Excursions. I just returned home from a three week trip to South Africa and Namibia. The first 16 days was a business trip with a group. I decided to stay a few days longer so I could also visit Cape Town. As I was traveling alone on this leg of the journey, I wanted to make sure that I had airport transfers and tours lined up in advance of my trip. I booked through Expedia and the travel company (which had good reviews) was Ilios Travel. Here are my impressions:1. Airport transfer: I arrived at 9:30pm from Johannesburg. My driver was 25 minutes late. While I realize that a driver can be late for a multitude of legitimate reasons, it is important to make sure that there is good communication with the client. I would recommend that Ilios make sure that they have a specific protocol so that the client is informed. Because I was traveling alone and had been warned about not getting into a vehicle with just anyone, it was important to me to have my transfer arranged in advance. That said, when I called the after hours number, there was a response and the agent on duty was able to contact the driver, so I was able to get to the hotel without making alternate arrangements. I did complain to the company and they delivered a nice bottle of wine to me with their deepest regrets. The transfer back to the airport was early, which was great, and I was delivered to the airport in plenty of time (I don't mind having extra time at the airport!).2. Full day Robben Island & City Tour: The driver, Michael, picked me up promptly and in time to get me to the ferry terminal for the 9am tour. The tour itself was OK--because it represents what I think is a sad time in South African history, the tour was not a fun time, but it was interesting and informative. The ferry was a full hour later than Michael expected getting back but he was waiting for me. We picked up a few more people for the city tour and changed vehicles and the tour was great. Although most of the day Table Mountain had been shrouded in fog, at 4pm the fog lifted and we were able to go up in the cable car and spend an hour at the top. It was great. Highly recommend!3. Full Day Cape Tour: I was the last passenger picked up and while it was a full van, it was comfortable and pleasant. The driver and guide (I don't know how to spell his name but he said you could remember it if you could remember "red wine") were great. The weather was spectacular and we took the short boat trip to see the seals, had a great time at the cape and cape point, and then saw the penguins before a great seafood lunch at Simons Town. The last thing we did was to go to the botanical gardens--it was the least interesting thing to me on the trip because of the time of year (not many flowering plants) but it is a beautiful place. Highly recommend!4. Cape Wine Tour: What an awesome day! On time pick up by the great tour guide Jean Martin. I was picked up first at my Cape Town hotel and we drove to Stellenbach where we picked up the others who joined the tour. It was a delightful group from Australia and I had so much fun! The wineries on the tour (and the wine) were a delight! The time we had to walk around the towns was adequate. The real treat came with the last winery of the day who had great pairings with chocolate! After the others left to go back to their hotel, Jean took me to a great jewelry shop because I told him I hadn't had a chance to do any shopping for a particular piece that I wanted. He was great. Ilios Travel in Cape Town is a class act. Highly recommend!Booking in advance through Expedia was great and although there was some concern when I first arrived, I was very happy with Ilios Travel and the staff. I really enjoyed my time in Cape Town!

Memorable private your experience. Nazim was great, very knowledgeable and friendly. Our peninsula tour was ruined by the poor stormy weather but Nazim salvaged it for us with his alternative recommendations. He brought us around the city in the afternoon and shared a lot, also spoke about his personal experiences during apartheid which really enriched our understanding of Cape Town and it's history. We had another day tour with him to the wine regions and he brought us to a lovely restaurant called roca for lunch. Great view, good food, in fact nazim even helped book some tables for other guests with Ilios (but of course he saved us the best seats!) Very satisfied and more than happy to tour with nazim again in the future, will specially request for him and you should too!We were picked up by others from Ilios during our transfers to/fro Hermanus. Trusty drivers (safe, professional, very punctual) with excellent service!

Excellent tour guides. As part of our holiday we had three tours booked with ilios & we had three different guides. Tour 1: half day Cape Town tour with Simpawe(sim). Very knowledgeable, informative guide. He was very friendly & answered any questions. His driving was excellent. Was taken the the military museum of which half was closed so would have perhaps been best to have taken us somewhere else but I think this is more a company thing than the drivers choosing. Tour 2: full day Cape Point & Simons Town tour with Phillipe. Phillipe is hilarious. We had a great day of laughter with all his funny stories & sayings he would tell us. Also very informative & gave us plenty of information about the areas we were visiting. Had plenty of time to enjoy each activity we did as well. Tour 3: Winelands tour of Stellenbosch with Omar. Omar was our favorite guide. Just when we thought the tour guides couldn't get better they did. If I ever book anything through Ilios again this guy would be my first choice. Had a fantastic lunch booked for us at La Petite Ferme with the best table in the house. Went to wonderful wineries as well with great experiences booked in. Again knowledge was fantastic & he was very friendly. Highly recommend this company.

Airport transfer and cape point trip. We used Ilios travel for airport/hotel transfers and a day trip to cape point peninsula. Service was average with friendly enough drivers although everything was done to their time. On the cape point trip the weather was foggy which meant that we didn't spend as long as cape point as scheduled, however later in the day this time wasn't given back to the tour and we arrived back at our hotel an hour earlier than advertised. Our airport transfers were arranged with more than enough time before our flight but when our hotel concierge questioned the pick up time as being too early, Ilios travel lied about our flight departure time bringing it forward by 30 mins meaning more wasted time in an airport departure lounge. They aren't a bad company to use but if you are spending limited time in South Africa just be aware of their approach to scheduling.

Great Wine Tour !!!!!!. I had only one day and I wanted to go to the wineries. This tour is amazing. Small groups. Pick up at your hotel. The best wineries and great explanations. I strongly recommend this tour.

Grand time!!!. We appreciated having a tour expert take charge of our tour day at Robben Island!!! Philippe catered to our every need! He and the team at Ilios travel went the extra mile to ensure a wonderful experience!! It's been an impactful and heart enriching experience at The Robben Island tour. We are reminded of a strong heritage!!

Cape winelands tour - Icraam. Went on the full day tour with Icraam. The guide took us to three different winery towns and three different wineries overall. Throughout the trip he explained about the areas we were driving through and the history of the regions. He picked out really lovely wineries and gave us an explanation about these as well. He was really knowledgeable with very pleasant demeanour. He also gave us a bit of time to explore two of the towns we visited, which was lovely. Each winery was a different experience, accompanied with a few other goodies along the way (I won't say what so as not to spoil the surprise!).I'd highly recommend this tour and Ilios travel to anyone looking took book tours in the region.

Ilios-Henry. For three days (2.–5. of may 2016) our guide Henry from Ilios travel took us around Cape Town and the Winelands. He made a memorable impression to us. He had a fantastic knowledge of the area. Always he listend to our vishes and needs. Everyvhere we Came we could se he was a popular man greatet by the locals. He showed us all, from the Capetown area to the Cape of Good hope, Cape Point, and further out to the Winelands and to Drakenstein prison, where Mandela was released in 1990.Henry was a great man with a good sence of humor, and during the drive and many kilometers we could feel the great feling and pasion he had for his job and his country.Thank you Henry for all the good pictures you tookWe are now back in Denmark trying to digest all the inpressions he left to us. We wish all the best to Ilios Travel and Henry.Vivi and Jorgen Erik Jorgensen

Airport Transfers - Cape Town. Ilios Travel arranged for both my arrival and departure airport transfer in Cape Town. Excellent service - car was clean, very friendly driver was on time picking me up in the "middle" of the night when flying into Cape Town as well as when departing. Service without fault. Can only recommend.

Wine tour. What a wonderful day visiting two of Stellenbosch's beautiful vineyards. Spectacular scenery great wine and out guide Peter was very informative, friendly and helpful.
What a pleasure to be with a guide who is so passionate about his job.
Our 3 day tour Guide. We used this company for three days, their guides were very knowledgeable and we visited many places, from the Cape Poin to the Stennenbosch wineries.

Cape highlights day trip. Great day trip , to see the Cape and surrounding coastline. visited a winery on way home, Our driver Jean was entertaining and knowledgable. Definitely a must if you have limited time in the area.Good value for money .

A Brilliant Experience. We were visiting Cape Town on a cruise holiday and contacted Glenn at Ilios Travel regarding booking a trip whist in Cape Town. We carried out all our business on-line and found it very easy especially with the prompt replies from Glen. We were booking for up to 8 people, some of which were already on the ship somewhere around Australia but with the help from Glen there was no problem regarding payment. When we arrived in Cape Town we were met by Johnathon, our guide and driver, who turned out to be a very knowledgeable person and had an extremely good sense of humour which went down very well with us all. Our trip was for 9 hours and the price was 50% less than that of the one run by the tours on the ship. Admittedly, lunch was not included but we did have a lunch stop in a restaurant in Simonstown but the cost for 2 people, including drinks, was only 300 rand (approx £15). Our day was never dull and full of surprises around every corner and every stop. Top marks to Ilios Travel and Johnathon. This is a company we would certailny use again and have no problems in recommending them to anyone.

Great Day Trip from Cape Town. Our group of 2 couples pre-booked the tour and, as always, wondered about what we would end up with for our trip to Cape of Good Hope and the Stellenbosch winery district.Our tour guide (please don't call me the driver) Jean Martin arrived right on time, and immediately put our minds at ease and we knew we were in for a good day. After picking up the other three passengers we headed through the Cape Town traffic to Mariners Wharf for some seal spotting before going through Chapmans Bay area and down to Cape Point/Cape of Good Hope. Jean displayed his wealth of knowledge along the way and was very happy to answer our queries and questions plus tell some jokes and funny stories.The vehicle was comfortable, as was the timeframe that allowed us to spend enough time at each scenic spot, and not feel rushed.The drive to Cape Point was interesting and we did see baboons, ostrich and zebras along the way. Jean was happy to stop and enable us to take the obligatory photos of these rare sightings.After making our way to the penguin colony near Simons Town, we then continued around False Bay and up to Bilton Wines, outside Stellenbosch. We were treated to a decadent tasting of wine and chocolate - a real treat!It was then time to headed back to Cape Town, via the N1 motorway. The 10 hour day was very much worthwhile and a must for anyone visiting Cape Town and wants to see what is to offer in the western cape.

Just the right tour for me. We had booked a short four hour tour from home for our first day in Cape Town to get our bearings and be safe whilst jet lagged. It was really good. we saw parts of Cape Town I wouldn't have otherwise, and our guide Tracey was such fun and very informative and most of all loved her city and country. To finish with table mountain was perfect and I thoroughly recommend them. On time, informative, and fun. Thanks ilios

great company to travel with. an amazing company to travel with, went out of their way to make you enjoy a fabulous holiday. No amount of questions about destinations or products went unanswered. Any problems(very very few) were dealt with very quickly. Our health and safety were their top priority. We had 2 fantastic gentlemen on our route.

Amazing Full Day Cape Peninsula Tour. My mum, sister and I had the time of our lives on this tour. We had a short time in Capetown and wanted to make the most of it and this trip dud just that. Tge places we visited were breathtaking. Our guide Simphiwe was very knowledgeable about Capetown and the places we visited. He was also very funny and entertaining. I would highly recommend this tour.

Highs and lows!. The highs... Comfy minibuses and friendly driver. Lows... Some timing and organisation issues which made for an awkward start to our first day visit up Table Mountain. We were about 2 hours late in total because people were told at the start of the visit they needed to buy entry online and print out. Apparently, the printer in the hotel was broken and thus set off a chain of unfortunate events. People were irritated by the loss of time which could have been avoided with forethought. As a group, we became increasingly concerned when we were not updated about the timings and itinerary for the day . If there were delays due to lack of clear communication the fault was never with Ilios although in fact, it was. This was annoying and upsetting for the group who began to feel that they were there for the convenience of Ilios rather than than the opposite case since we had paid the company for our convenience. A lot if grumbling was unsettling and not what anyone wants on their holiday. We lost opportunities to do and see things which were on the itinerary because Ilios worked to their own convenience and not ours. This improved after our concerns were voiced. We were using Ilios from the Durban route to Johannesburg and it was a much better experience all round. Lutendo was a wonderful guide. Clear, well organised , couldn't do enough for us. He was magnificent and reaffirmed our faith in the company yo put the client first. The drivers were all very good. I'd use Ilios again if I could guarantee I'd be led by Lutendo. Thank you! I hope you get the pay rise you deserve Lutendo. We were all impressed by your knowledge, clarity and professionalism. Thanks again.

Henry made a special day visiting The Cape absolutely perfect!. After a super 3 week cruise from Singapore to CapeTown we spent a day visiting The Cape Peninsular with Ilios Travel - hosted by our driver/ guide Henry. His knowledge, helpfulness and pleasant demeanour made for an exceptional end to your holiday. I would highly recommend Ilios Travel for any day tour planned in the Cape Town area and would suggest asking for Henry to be your guide for a perfect day in a glorious part of the world.

Numberous trips in Cape Town including airport pick-up and drop-up. We booked the tours via an agent in my home country and had never heard of the company before. From what we observed during the numerous tours we took while staying in Cape Town, Ilios Travel appeared as a medium scale company and was expanding. We took tours organised by the company for four consecutive days visiting places such as Cape Point, Robben Island, Township, District Six, City Tour and Wine Tour. The services they provided exceeded my expectation. The tours were well-organised and they would leave you a message the night before with your hotel concierge informing in the event that there was a change of pick-up time. The guides were all professional and knowledgeable. They were mostly locals who grew up in the town and their narrations were like telling their own stories which were highly intriguing. They were extremely punctual and vehicles used were clean and of good condition. I highly recommend this company.

Informative, friendly and well looked after. Avril looked after us for 2 of our days in Cape Town. She took us on a half day city tour and a full day down the peninsula.She was absolutely lovely to us and so great with our children.She shared lots of interesting information that we would never have discovered without her, I think having a local guide is essential to truly experience a new city.

Excellent Experiences. We booked the Walk to Freedom Tour with this company and were not disappointed. We were picked up from our hotel on time and then visited but then had to go out to Camps Bay to pick up 2 guests who had not been ready earlier, but in fact it gave us an extra view of Table Mountain. We visited Bo Kapp. District Six Museum(excellent), district six and ended up at the waterfront for a lunch break as were were booked on a tour to Robben Island early afternoon. I cannot fault the tour at all, it was excellent value and a real education.

We were group of 4 and did 12 days in SA-Jhoberg, Cape town and Garden route. We had excellent service from Ilios Travels-from airport pick up and drops, tours and drops to local restaurants in Cape town. Drivers cum guide were very professional , courteous and in smart uniform.They had good knowledge.Naser was very entertaining and help us sort out trip to Roben Island,. In Capetown ,we had Ashley who took us to various Indian Restaurants and was very polite. Also we had issue at one restaurant ie. slow service and next day he flaged it up with Ilios. Also on the Garden route we had Henry, who made our trip enjoyable as he allowed us to play Hind song cds. Also all the hotel booked were good and no issues. Satish Shah London

Airport collection. We were met at the airport and it was an early flight so we came into Cape Town in the middle of the morning rush hour. The driver who collected us was good and informative. However on collection they didn't really send a big enough vehicle so obviously he reported back that a larger vehicle would be necessary for the return journey and we got a larger vehicle back. Again we were collected well on time for the flight back.

Spoiled Rotten in South Africa. Booked our South African trip through Audley Travel and they set up an aggressive itinerary. Our first day experience with Ilios was amazing and we enjoyed every subsequent experience with them. Honestly, they were the meat and potatoes to our trip as we relied upon them to get us to airports on time, pick us up and take us to our new accommodations and show us the area via private tours. Talk about feeling like a queen....picked up in Mercedes SUV's, first class all the way. Stop at an ATM and you feel like the Secret Service has got your back keeping too friendly locals or confused tourists from getting TOO close. One of my friends is relatively well known and when he joined us, Ilios just stepped it up a notch even more. Now, as far as guides, Shamiel is the most amazing guide ever. We spent a full day with him exploring the winelands and he is a blast. Felt like hanging out with an incredibly bright, hysterical friend! Besides knowing so much about local culture, cuisine, the best beaches, camera parts and where to go for them, he is so funny and just a genuinely GOOD man that loves his job and loves his family. We miss that guy! Our other favorite was our young driver Enslin out of Port Elizabeth. This guy is very outgoing, a great driver, protector of the clueless and can really yell in Afrikkans (inside joke in case he is reading this!) All of our Ilios guys were awesome, but had to give these two a special shout out! When we return, Ilios is a must. I don't know what we would have done without them. When my friends told me I was crazy bringing my teenage daughter with me to South Africa (just us 2), I knew we were in safe hands with Ilios.

Best Travel Company. We did three tours with Ilios they were all FANTASTIC! First day we did the city tour and Table Mountain - very good altho the only criticism I would have would be the 'castle' we visited... Was rubbish and not worth going there at all! Second day - Winelands- This was incredible we went with an incredible tour guide - he was so funny, can't remember his name but was bald and had a very loud voice haha! Our trip was fantastic with 18 tastings- in three completely different wineries! My fav tour I've ever done! Also was great to view the small towns around the vineyards too! Absolutely awesome!Day three we went to Cape Point with Danny! An excellent guide! Went to a beautiful restaurant before going upto Cape Point! An excellent tour for anyone visiting Cape Town! Was also fantastic going to Boulders beach to see the penguins. A MUST DO TRIP! This company were also our airport transfer- ALWAYS on time and so so organised! Couldn't recommend them more!!!
