Fantastic!!!!!!

A Story off two Halves. We were staying in Capetown and booked two tours through the Ilios rep in our hotel. The rep was helpful and informative and the bookings went well. So...lets start with the good part. Our first tour was a day wine tasting around various vineyards in the Franschhoek region. We were picked up at the hotel as arranged. The vehicle was very comfortable and roomy. Our guide for the day was nothing short of fantastic and really made the day special. We visited a chocolate factory, three Vineyards and had a lovely lunch in Franschhoek. Overall the day was outstandingly good. The following day we had booked the the 'Walk to Freedom' tour and things didn't go quite as well as they should have. Our guide and vehicle were great and the morning went well with visits to District 6, key locations in Capetown and Langha...so no issue there however the second part of the day was a trip to Robin Island. Everyone else on the bus had tickets for the one PM ferry however our tickets were absent and we were later told we had been booked on the 3pm Ferry. This had never been communicated to us at any time so completely spoilt the day and in any case we already had plans which meant a late ferry was not possible. Their plan had been to let the group go, return us to the hotel, let us kick our heels for a few hours and then put us on the later ferry with no pick up afterwards.... Ok...so sometimes things go wrong and I accept that ... but the way we were subsequently treated by the Ilios Manager, Rasheed, was nothing short of a disgrace. He promised to call us within the hour after speaking to him at the hotel when we got back..no call came. We spoke to another rep later in the evening and again we were promised a call back from him... Nothing. When we got back late that evening, a bottle of wine and a rather defensive apology letter was waiting but the letter completely missed the point we had made. The following day we again asked to speak to the manager, he was called and promised a call back within the hour...no call came. After having checked the hotel bill, we had been charged for the full days tour so that evening, we insisted on speaking to the manager on the phone...the phone was passed and his apology for never phoning us back was half hearted and frankly insulting. I insisted that they adjust the bill, as they had said they would do two days earlier and it took my insistence to get it finally sorted. The point I make here is that, given the excellent offering this company makes in terms of guides and tours, on this occasion they were badly let down by a Manager that clearly couldn't have cared less about communicating with his customers. Whilst I had a particular issue with their service, I have still given the rating I have because I do believe the company provides good tours and if Rasheed had been more focused on his customers and had just done what he promised to do, it would have been a faultless review from me.

Top Notch Service. I used Ilios for airport shuttle, Cape Point and Peninsula tours, and Wine tours. The drivers were outstanding and professional. The guides on the Cape Point and Wine tours provided a lot of useful information about South Africa and were personable an humorous. Both tours provide great value for the price. I'd definitely sign up for another Ilios Tour anytime.

All round great experience with Ilios Travel. We arranged for our airport transfers and a Robben Island and City Tour with Ilios and I recommend this company highly. We were met on schedule at the airport and taken to our hotel by a friendly and knowledgeable driver. The Robben Island and City Tour was great and we must thank our guide Rhiaan (I hope I spelled that correctly) for a great day out and an education itself on the history of the country. Sadly we had to come home and our driver for the return airport journey was there in plenty of time to collect us, thankfully he had planned this early arrival as there had been a big accident on the way to the airport - fortunately his knowledge of the roads was great and he managed to circumnavigate most of the traffic to get us to the airport on time. Thank you Ilios and your team for a great holiday

Interesting well organised tours. We went on the Wine Tasting and the Cape Point trips. Each trip had 16 guests in a small minibus. The guide was well informed, the trips were well organised and each location on the trip was good. An enjoyable way to see some things outside the centre of Cape Town

Professional and proficient. Twice every year I take a group of between 15 to 35 exchange students from around the world on the Garden Route Tour to see our beautiful country.I am always impressed at the service Ilios provides. The quality of the driving, guiding and organization is outstanding. I want to thank Ilios for their continual outstanding service.Comments from the students included; " This has been the best week of my life@Thank you Abdul, Mansoer and Ilios.Sue Stein and Herschel Girls School

Highly recommended!. We used Ilios travel in 3 different ways: 1 -For transfers to and from airports and game reserve. 2-Small 4 day escorted tour of the Garden Route. 3-Day tour of the Cape Peninsular. In every case the driver was knowledgeable and courteous, and we liked the fact that they would inform us of any change to pick up times. Our day trip was full-on with so much so see and learn. Special thanks to Olga who made our 4 day trip along the Garden Route memorable. if you are reading this with a view to using them, go ahead and book it!

Cape Peninsula, Robben Island, Table Mountain and City tours. Booked with Expedia for two full day tours with Ilios Travel consisted of:Cape Peninsula - tour around Hout Bay, Chapman's Peak, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, Boulders Beach, Simon's Town and Kirstenbosch. Tour included hotel pick up and drop off which started at 8:30am and ended at 6pm. Driver picked us up on time but had troubles finding another guest's accommodation which caused a bit of delay, we had to join the coach at Camp's Bay and the tour started just after 9am. Tour guide was very knowledgeable and friendly, the tour was enjoyable and the scenic routes was absolutely amazing! Entry to Boulder's beach (penguins) and Kirstenbosch included in the tour price.Robin Island, Table Mountain and City tour - there was a mix up with the booking and we had to wait for half an hour for the driver to pick us up which we almost missed the 9am ferry from V&A waterfront to Robben Island. We were supposed to be on a group tour, but ended up going to Robben Island on our own without a tour guide from Ilios. Disappointed with the mix up and how we were left on our own but this didn't stop us from enjoying Robben Island as there was a tour guide at hand for all the visitors. Tour consisted of two parts: inside the prison talk and bus tour around the island; lasted approx. 3 hours. Took ferry back to V&A where a driver came to pick us up and drove us to Table Mountain along with 4 other guests. We started quite late for Table Mountain due to waiting around for other guests which meant we had a very short city tour and did not get to visit the museums that was part of the tour.Overall, drivers and tour guides were knowledgeable but there was disorganisation particularly with our booking and as a result, some delays that cost us missing out on museum visits. I would still recommend booking tours when visiting Cape Town to make the most of the wonderful views and historical places to visit.

Excellent and informative. We had a full day tour of the winelands and a half day of Kirstenbosch Gardens. Our driver was excellent, very knowledgeable, and understood the sort of day we wanted very quickly. Highly recommended

Highly recommend for Airport Transfers. Ilios Travel were recommended to us for our transfers and it was a pleasure to deal with them. Shameem greeted us at the airport - a friendly and organised guy. Olga was our driver who was professional and friendly and the vehicle was in an excellent condition.We thought we were going to the Cruise Terminal to board our cruise but they knew that check-in was actually at the Convention Centre – imagine if we hadn’t used their services! Would highly recommend Ilios!

Great Tours!!!. We spent three days in Cape Town and we had the same guide Shareef Noble everyday. The guy was fantastic!!! The places we went to were amazing and we saw so many fantastic sites. What was really great was that Shareef allowed to go at our own pace. We stopped when we wanted to and we changed plans on the fly. It was great. When we go back to Cape Town we know who we are going to use for everything.

Ilios Grand Tour South Africa - 16 days of Fantastic experiences.. Well, how many superlatives can we use about our holiday in South Africa? It was an experience of a life time.We flew into Johannesburg, where Ilios arranged an extra trip around the city, including Soweto. The next day we joined a group and travelled by mini bus to Kruger Game Reserve and went on 2 game drives there (seeing the big 5 and so much more). From there we went on a further safari and 2 wetland safaris, on through Swaziland. We visited a genuine Zulu village where we met Justice who was so enthusiastic about explaining the Zulu culture. we flew from Durban to Port Elizabeth. How could the holiday improve, but it did! We were met by Dino, our amazing guide, who was to spend the second week taking us on down to Cape Town, via the Garden Route and the wine lands. Dino was a mine of information who made the trip not only informative, but also fun. He joined in with all our banter and was flexible in allowing us to choose variations to the itinerary. While the whole Ilios team were highly efficient and helpful, Dino was a star act. Thank you all, for a fabulous experience - good hotels, stunning scenery, with a wide range of cultural experiences. From Robben Island, through incredible wild life and people, to the beauty and vibrancy of Cape Town. (not to mention being able to play with a cheetah!). What would I have left out? The glass making factory and candle shop, but that is me being picky. A big positive about SA is the exchange rate between the rand and pound, everything is so cheap. The food is amazingly good value and so tasty.Thank you again Ilios.

Personable and knowledgeable guides. My husband and I did a private full day Cape Peninsula tour with Zunaid (or as we called him, Z). This was the highlight of our time in Cape Town! We had a great time driving down the coast, seeing the Cape, penguins and beautiful harbor and mountain views, as well as eating a delicious lunch. In addition, we also did a group half day wine tour and a private half day township tour - both of which were excellent.

Ilios Showed us the Ins and outs of Capetown. Our tour guide, Thys, was excellent. We had him for three days and everyone in our group LOVED him. Very knowledgable. He made a great presentation and he was able to handle us.
First class. We used IIios travel for the 16 days we were in SA and found them to be first class and always on time.

Great Guides and Trips. Our travel agent booked my husband and I several Cape Town tours with Ilios while we were in Cape Town and they were great. We did Lion's Head, the Fort, and then a day trip to the Cape of Good Hope, Simon's Town and the Botanical Garden. Our guides were friendly, knowledgeable, and engaging. Ilios also made things so easy by picking us up at our hotel each morning and dropping us off back at the end of the day One day our guide actually dropped us at the Waterfront when we requested a modification to the itinerary based on some unexpected wind craziness. Great company offering really fun and interesting ways to get to know Cape Town!

The best guide in Capetown. Our tour guide Abdul is magnificent. He is very knowledgable about all there is to know about South Africa...history, flora and fauna, geography and restaurant and attractions

Excellent tours & Guides. We did 2 tours with Ilios one the Freedom walk tour and our guide was Icram. He was excellent and took us to the Township of Langa and tours of District 6 & the museum and then put us on Ferry to Robben Island he was so informative & knowledgable it really made the tour Excellent. Our Second tour was with Jean Martin and again he was excellent on Cape peninsular tour and was able to make the day with very interesting and informative commentary.We loved both tours and would thoroughly recommend Ilios.

A Mixed Bag. We took 2 trips with Ilios, one the Cape City Tour which was a waste of money. We spent far too long in the Castle and were therefore short of time for other more interesting venues. The trip to the Cape peninsula was really good, but I would bypass Simonstown as a venue for a snack. Boulders Beach and the penguins were a highlight. Our guide on this trip was really good whilst the City tour guide was below par. Best advice for Capetown is to the Red and Blue bus trips...absolutely brilliant. especially the Wineland trip to Constantia

Good Service. Ilios Travel set up a day tour to the cape of Good Hope for our family of six. Our Guide did a great job driving us, providing interesting explanations and adjusting the itinerary to our points of interest as we went along.

Great guided day trip to Cape Point. We had a lovely day exploring Cape Point with Birgit of Ilios Travel. She was knowledgeable, friendly, and very flexible in adapting the day to what we wanted to see and do.

Used them for personalized trip. Used them for personalized trip from Bokaap to Langa to Stellanbosch. Very long day and they were terrific. Had to make some itinerary changes due to timing at the vineyards and they made excellent choices for us. Highly recommend.

Ilios Travel Services - Cape Town, South Africa. We just returned from a two week vacation to South Africa. First week was on a safari in Zulu Nyala, second week in Cape Town. What an amazing experience!! Our guide Peter Ray? With Ilios Travel Services was a great guide and a pleasure to spend time with during our visit. He made our visit extra special. Thanks to Ilios and to Peter for a trip of a Lifetime!!
Excellent service. I used Ilios for two tours and the service was impeccable. As a lone traveler, they made sure I was safe at all times.

Very professional. My husband and I had experienced Ilios on our last guided visit to South Africa and, although travelling independently this time, I decided to contact them again as we were now a party of six. From the very first email Carla van de Walt was incredibly helpful. Following my request she also arranged for us to have the same guide, Mervyn, who is amazing - really friendly, patient and professional, who ensured we saw everything on our "to do" list. Our flight times changed at least three times but when we arrived at Cape Town International the Ilios transfer was there ready to take us to our hotel. A fabulous start to yet another fabulous holiday.

Great professional company. We had booked our transfers with Ilios (through Trailfinders) and all were excellent. We also booked a full day tour which included visiting the township (Langa) and Robben Island. We were taken to Langa in the morning and shown around by a local resident. it felt very safe and it was very interesting to see how the people live. We met various locals who lived in shacks and housing. We then visited district six (where people were forcibly removed) which was really interesting particularly the museum. The guide was great throughout and provided useful insight. We were then dropped at the Robben Island ferry. After we had finished on Robben Island we were picked up and dropped to our hotel,

Our tours were terrific. We took both a half day tour of Cape Town and a full day tour that took us to the Cape of Good Hope and surrounding towns. Ashrun, our guide was wonderful. It was great to have a private tour with just my husband and myself. That way we were able to see things that were most interesting to us.

Saw & learned so much of great interest. Ash was our guide, and we enjoyed a day of delight. His knowledge of the flora, fauna and seas is impressive. From the Cape Point & Cape of Good Hope to Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden, we saw and learned so much. Other highlights were the penguin colony at The Boulders, Chapman's Drive, The 12 Apostles, Simon's Town, Camps Bay, and spotting 4 zebras grazing in the nature preserve. We highly recommend Ilios Travel and their guide Ash.
Tranfers - Excellent. Ilios did all of our transfers and we were very impressed with service. They were very prompt, very clean vehicle with smart and professional (yet friendly) drivers

Great tours. We had 1 full day and 1 half day tour with Peter Meyer from Ilios, both were excellent. Peter has great knowledge of Cape Town, which meant we could avoid queues. Peter also has some good dinner recommendations.

The best way to see Cape Town. I've never been one to trudge round a place clutching a guide book and hoping for the best. Leave it to the experts, that's what I say - and these people are the experts. It's because we used their super door to door service that we saw as much of Cape Town as we did and, with the help of their guides, were able to enjoy it as much as we did. Certainly beats the do it yourself trips in my book.
Good company to book with. This company were good when on our Garden Route Tour, our Guide Rian & Driver Nichole looked after us well. They took us to some fabulous locations.

Transfers thought this company were without fault. During our stay in South Africa, we had several transfers between airport, hotels etc organised through this company and they were fantastic. No issues with finding them at the airport, always on time for pick up. Our driver from Cape Town Airport to our hotel was particularly good in pointing out sights and sharing some of South Africa's history with us.

Winelands tour. Wonderful day with Naseem our guide who was so knowledgable about the whole area - not just the winelandsVisited a few winelands and converted us to pinotage and my wife to Sauvignon Blanc (quite an achievement) but the South African wines were certainly better here than the wines we usually get in uk. Booked us a fantastic lunch with views over the mountains and was charming all thru the dayWould recommend Naseem to all out thereEnjoy as much as we did and a great time awaits you Thanks again Naseem :-)

We were given a tour of Cape Town, S. Africa. City Tour, Table Mountain, Cape of Good Hope, Wine Country. Our Guide Ashraf was the best. Couldn't wait for him to pick us up in the mornings.He was so informative regarding the history of Cape Town, and S. Africa, the civil war, the landscape and foliage, the wildlife, the wine country. We learned so much from Ash….mostly because of his journey there, his story and his love of country.

Very Informative - Great Guide. We had all day to spend in J'burg and were lucky enough to have Ephraim as our personal guide. His knowledge and expertise in relating the more recent history of South Africa was for us, outstanding.Visiting the Apartheid Museum, the Hector Pietersen Museum, Mandela House and a comprehensive tour of Soweto gave us a new and more up-to-date economical/social understanding of the current political situation of this controversial part of South Africa.What it certainly did was emphasise the wonderful and emphatic man that was Nelson Mandela - there will never be a person like him.Great tour, great guide - a very educational experience for us.

Hard to beat. We took two Ilios tours while in Cape Town: to the Winelands and to the Peninsula & Cape of Good Hope. Both were excellent. The private Winelands tour included stops at Stellenbosch, Franchhoek and Paarl, and wine tasting at four very different wineries; the guide (Avril) was superb. The Peninsula & Cape tour is not to be missed: great scenery, the wild and windy cape, and a very informative guide.

Excellent! . My husband and I booked two days with Ilios to explore Cape Town as part of our honeymoon, we wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.Our guide Ashraf was superb, his knowledge and enthusiasm were great and we enjoyed the tours thoroughly.Day one included Table Mountain, a city tour and Robben Island followed by Cape Point, Boulders Beach, Kalk Bay, Houts Bay and Kirstenbosch botanical gardens on day two (and much more along the way!) I would recommend all the places we saw and by using a guide we really got the best out of our visit.Keep up the good work and we hope to visit again soon!

True guides. Our guide, Thyce, was a fountain of information and fun facts. He was a delight to spend two days with even when the weather changed our plans at the last minute. Always ready with the next idea of what to do. Fun!

Bad experience. We booked a day trip to Table Mountain and Cape Town through Trailfinders and they use Ilios Travel. We were given a time of an 8:30am pickup from the hotel, which was reconfirmed but the hotel. We came down to reception at the Bay Hotel only to be told by the Ilios driver and tour guide that we should have been there at 8:15. Apparently the driver was overheard being told on the phone to go without us as we were late. Anyway, the driver waited, and we hopped onto the tour bus only to be subject to a tirade of abuse by an absolutely revolting Irish woman, who was there with her husband and 2 children. Obviously she blamed us for being late, which was absolutely not the case.We could not bare the atmosphere on the tour bus and asked to get off immediately.Clearly, Ilios can't do anything about revolting people, but it can sort out its communication of pickup times. When I spoke to a girl at Ilios she seemed content to blame our hotel for the error without any sort of apology for the unpleasantness that the situation created. And when I asked for a refund, it was refused. Very very poor service.We ended up paying for a private tour so we are out out pocket twice. Not happy!! Ilios, you are a customer service provider with no customer service!! Wake up!! and where's my refund?

Best ever. We did a Stellenbosh wine tour with Ishmael and it was fantastic. We did a half day and wished we had done a whole day. Ishmael was a superb host and obviously had a passion for his job and South Africa good and bad. I would definitely recommend it.

Five amazing days. My husband and I spent four amazing days touring the Cape Town area in September. We enjoyed a tour of the city, Robben Island, the Marine Big 5 of the Sea, and a wine tour. We very much appreciated our guide, Khanyiso. He was full of information about the area's history and culture, and always had answers to our questions. He was very professional and very personable.

Exciting innovative tours with a smile. We have leveraged this company as r commended from our travel agent for s verbal,tours whilst in South Africa. On all occasions they were prompt to collect us, very knowledgable about all South African history and trivia, and highly accommodating to special requests while on tour. If you have the time and interest, they will plan everything you need. Just bring your interests, imagination, and camera. Highly reputable and recommended.

Scenic 1/2 Day Stellenbosch Wine Tour. Jonathan from Ilios arrived promptly at our hotel in Cape Town, and whisked us away for our half day wine tour. I'll preface by saying in hindsight I wish we had time for the full day because the tour was a wonderful experience. We ended up visiting 2 different wineries who were well prepared with a great selection of wine and cheese pairings. Not only was our guide very informative about South Africa (he's originally from Cape Town), but he also made the time pass easily along the route with great conversation and recommendations. The views were stunning and wine was tasty! We definitely brought a few bottles back.
Wine tour was good. We took the 1/2 day wine tour. We've been on a number of winery tours elsewhere but this was a first for the chocolate pairing with wine tasting. Enjoyed it.

Beauty, History, Food & Adventure in Cape Town. Ask for Naser!. I recently got married and the trip to South Africa was our honeymoon. If you are looking at tour companies, I probably don't need to sell you on the destination. I'm not so familiar with Ilios as a company, as it was they were contracted by our trip planner, but we did have 5 extremely fun, informative and beautiful days of private tours with one of their guides named Naser. Our trip in South Africa took us from a safari in Kruger to the winelands region outside of Cape Town to Cape Town proper. We had Naser as our guide in the winelands and Cape Town. Within an hour of meeting him, on the way to a whale watching tour, Naser already got to know us, what sort of sites and experiences we were interested in, and also had us laughing despite being early in the morning. From the first day, he gave us thoughtful, personal recommendations of places to see and activities to try. The vineyards he suggested were amazing for different reasons - whether for the quality of the wines, the historical context or just worthwhile for a picture or two, he gave us amazing options to choose from. Even when we were based in Cape Town, he helped us pick and choose experiences that made for unforgettable days. One day, we started by paragliding from Lion's Head (a mountain) to Camp's Bay, went to a jewelry store to browse some Tanzanite pieces and grab a coffee, and then in the Malay section for colorful houses and amazing Cape Malay cuisine. Another day, we went ziplining, had lunch at one of the best restaurants in the country (La Colombe; which he secured a very last minute booking for us), and ended up strolling the Company Gardens in Cape Town. He was very entertaining, but also knew how to give my new bride and I space to enjoy experiences on our own. He was extremely kind, and always willing to take pictures for us. He also has photography experience, so the pictures turned out great! He was like the mayor of Cape Town. Everywhere we went, he knew people, was able to get great tables, and skip lines. It's a great sign when people smile when they would see him coming. We highly recommend private tours with Naser no matter what you are looking for – upscale dining, spontaneous adventures, natural beauty, historical narratives, or any combination of them all.
Brilliant tour!. We did the Cape Point and Peninsula Tour and it was great. A long day but the guide was entertaining and informative.

Knowledgable tour guides!. I enjoyed two one day tours with Ilios. The first was a tour of the city of Cape Town as well as Robben Island. I was collected from my hotel by a very professional driver and driven to the Robben Island Ferry. Once the tour was over I was collected by my tour guide for the rest of the day. My tour actually turned into a private tour of the city of Cape Town. It was a wonder days spent driving around the entire city. My second tour was the all day Cape Point tour with Phillip. Phillip was incredibly knowledgeable about all the sights we saw and gave great suggestions about things to see and do around Cape Town!
In good hands. We used this company for two tours- Cape Point and Peninsula tour and the Wineland tour.Very efficient and on time pick up from hotel. Guide very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful.

Great company with excellent guides (especially Ismaeel Davis!). Tremendous tour company, great vehicles. I highly recommend private tours with this company. We visited both the Cape of Good Hope, Kirstenbosch, and the Winelands. The vehicle was great (BMW) and Ismaeel really knew his stuff. He put us in the right place at the right time and knew all the facts to keep us interested.He recommended the best place for lunch on the wine tour (La Pettite Ferme), not to be missed.Highly recommend.

Superlative guides!. We had the pleasure of having Ilios Travel guides throughout our trip to South Africa. They were knowledgeable, personable and gave us tremendous insights. After 10 days, we felt that they were family. Thanks to Ash, Matt, Smith and Shamiel for a memorable visit!

Cape of Good Hope. An excellent day viewing beautifull scenery and lovely open views. The Cape itself was inspiring as was the trip to the lighthouse. We went up by the train and walked down. Food is available but limited to an expensive sit down restaurant, which we did not want or a simple but pleasant 'takeaway' which was fine. It can get very busy.

Recommended for tours and travel . We used Ilios for our travel arrangements when in Cape Town and found them to be excellent. We were met at the airport and given such a lovely tour of the city on the way to the hotel and the driver was so nice. They did the transfers for most of our tours and travel around the city too. Always on time and always very friendly staff.

Abdul from Ilios was the best guide ever. Abdul of Ilios took us on tours to Table Mountains, Cape Point and the Winelands. He was an absolutely great guide. He was knowledgeable about the area, the country, the history, and the culture. Plus he had a fun sense of humor. He made our stay really special.

A good way to see things. I will say we took 3 tours with this company and were only happy with 2 of them. The city tour was absolutely too rushed. Saw lots of things for about 5 minutes each. The museum we only had 20 min! But the peninsula tour and wine lands tour were fantastic. Our drivers were Lynne, and Phillip and feisel who were fantastic. Overall happy just don't take the city tour.

Cape Highlights Tour. On honeymoon in Cape Town we were looking for a tour to squeeze in as much as possible & the Cape Highlights tour did exactly that. Our tour guide, Reggie was excellent. His knowledge of the areas we visited was exemplary & he also gave some great insights into wider South African history. He was incredibly personable which really made our day a 5/5 experience. The tour takes in a huge number of areas along the Atlantic Coast followed by Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope. Reggie then brought us to Boulders to the penguin colony and we finished in Stellenbosch for a wine tasting. All in all it was a great day and this is the trip to take if your time in Cape Town is limited. We even got to see two ostriches mating although Reggie had never seen that before so don't bank on it

Excellent Company. Did winelands tour - experienced 3 Wineries and tasted some quality wines. The guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. Walk to Freedom tour - Did a tour of a township and was guided by a lady who lived in the township. Toured District 6, the guide was very good at explaning the history of the area

Prompt, friendly informative guide. We spent three days with Mervin in the Cape Town area. Mervin is from the Cape Town area. Everywhere we went he knew the local people and had stories to tell. He was a font of information about Cape Town and South Africa and suggested places to visit that we hadn't thought of.
Great!. Great company. Guides are all prompt, very organized, and knowledgeable. We did a Peninsula Tour and Winelands Tour. Highly recommend!

Poor communication and disorganised. We would not recommend this company. On our first tour, the guide told us he doesn't give a running commentary but just answers questions. After we were picked up, we had no idea what was going on as he didn't speak or advise us that we were driving to pick up other customers...... On another transfer, they turned up on time, but had no idea that we would be way too early for the organised tour. On our last day, they were supposed to collect us at 12pm, but turned up at 11am. Luckily one of us was at the apartment to let them know that the others were still out but would be back in time for the 12pm pickup. If someone wasn't there to advise them, who knows what they would have done.... They need to get their act together: phoning and confirming the day before would be a good start.
Riding in style. We decided not to do the tour with a group and just have our own guide and go at our own pace. We had a fabulous driver and spent time where we wanted to. Worth the extra cost!

Cape of Good Hope tour. This was a great way to get down and see the Cape of Good Hope as well as other attractions along the way. Our driver was very knowledgable and took our photos so we could both be in them.

Very disorganized and negligent, decent guides and day tours. Trips with this company were booked for me as part of a larger tour package. They appear to be very disorganized as a company. The drivers and guides were supposedly not given names of the individuals booked on trips, only a number. And they did not seem to be able to count accurately because I was left behind on one trip when I ran back to my room to grab something and came back down at the meet time. Because they did not work to checklists by name (as does every just about every other company I have done day or partial day trips with around the world), I'm not surprised this happens and expect it is common with them. For another half-day afternoon wine tasting tour, the trip was cut almost half because the guide was running late on another booking and the wineries close by around 5 pm. The guides themselves were generally good and knowledgeable but I would have to discourage friends from using this company based on my bad experiences.

Great way to see the Peninsula!. Had a half day tour to the Cape of Good Hope with a stop at Hout Bay (too choppy to go to Seal Island that day), the Cape and Cape Point Light House with a stop on the way back at Boulder's Bay to see the Penguins. Ah-men was my driver and he was very knowledgeable.

Interesting Tours. The vehicles have been a high standard and the tour guides have had excellent knowledge of the local area and the history of the surroundings. Both the wine lands tour and the Cape peninsula tours are very interesting.

Staff are very professional, polite and very informative. Have spent the last week being looked after by Ilios. They collected us from airports, helped us move from hotel to hotel and taken us on two fantastic tours, the wine region and Cape peninsula. We've had 6 different drivers, all were very professionally, very knowledgable and most importantly, they all added to to make our first time in South Africa more pleasurable, more insightful and more educating that we'd expected. On both our personal tours we were chauffeured by Peter Meyer, without him, neither tour would have been as interesting and as enjoyable as they were. I can't recommend the service Ilios has provided enough, they've helped make our time in SA so memorable.

Inspiring day trip.. Our trip started at Bo-Kaap where the colours of the houses really stood out. Thorough education of the history of the area was given by Sharif and this continued at District 6 and then to the township of Langa where we saw projects to engage the population. The tour of Langa was such an eye opener. People were friendly and new housing is slowly improving lives but there's a long way to go.After this we visited Robben Island which was very humbling.

Wonderful South Africa. Our holiday experience in South Africa was greatly enhanced by the wonderful service provided by Ilios. We had the most excellent guides especially Danson and Ikram who we had on the garden route. They were great companions and we became firm friends on that trip. They were everything you would expect from a driver and guide but as a group we felt they were much more. They had marvellous people skills were well informed attentive mannerly and just nice guys. We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday thanks in no small way to all the Ilios staff.

Scenic Cape Town...book the trip and enjoy. We took the scenic Cape Town tour, incorporating the penguin colony, Simons Town, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, Botanical Gardens and we were stunned by the scenery and the wild life and were impressed with the friendliness of the locals wherever we visited. Our guide was friendly, knowledgeable of the flora and fauna and very personable. It was a full day tour, incorporating what we thought were most aspects of the area and we enjoyed every minute of it.

Excellent full day wine tasting tour. I scheduled a wine tasting tour with Ilios through my hotel. $71 USD for the full day of transportation and guide to three wineries and lunch in Franschnoek which is a lovely town. I was touring alone but mixed very well with 12 others on the tour. First we visited Anura where we sampled 6 wines with cheese, crackers, and jam. Next was Solms Delta where we enjoyed 10 (yes 10!) samples. Then an hour for lunch on our own in Franschnoek. And finally 5 wines paired perfectly with chocolate at Lanzerac. It was a very lovely day getting out into wine country of South Africa. Yes, $71 covered everything but lunch!

Day trips and airport transport. From the moment we stepped off the plane ilios were fantastic, our transfer driver told us all about the city whilst we drove to our apartment. Then each day we were in Cape Town we had a different tour booked. City tour, Robben Island and township tour, winelands tour and Cape tour. Each day ilios emailed up to date pick up times to our apartment who passed on the details to us. They were very prompt and always welcoming. Each tour was fantastic with amazing guides and drivers. 2 of our tours were done by Philip who was fabulous giving advice about places to eat, wines to try as well as having an excellent knowledge of the area. We also had tours from Adiel and Nazeem both fantastic. Due to bad weather we couldn't use the cable car to travel up table mountain or visit the botanical gardens on another trip, each time another option was discussed and arranged to fill our time. We can not recommend Ilios enough for making the start of our holiday so memorable. We have learnt so much from listening to your guides. Thank you!!!!

professional and great way to travel around. We had this travel option for transfers between the airport and where we were staying. For every transfer each driver was on time and lifted luggage into the vehicle as well as offering a guided tour of the area you are driving through with information about what you see. A great option for transfers and tours.

Two Days Around Town. Our travel agent arranged for our family (my husband and I and our 20 year old daughter) to have two days of guided tours around Cape Town. We were so lucky to have been placed with Omar Sarrs both days. He was extremely knowledgable, friendly, thoughtful, and was a very good driver. We learned so much about Cape Town and the surrounding areas that we visited. We traveled to the Cape of Good Hope, Hermanus, Stellenbosch, Wineland, and he even picked us up early on the second day so we could visit the Cheetah Conservation Center when he learned the cheetah was my husband's favorite animal. We enjoyed both of the restaurants he recommended we try and on the second day, we were able to convince him to have lunch with us. We really enjoyed our time with Omar and will remember him fondly as a great part of our trip to Africa.

Cape Highlights July 5th 2015. After being dazzled by the number of day tours and advice online I finally asked my travel agent who recommended Ilios. Good advice. The itinerary was well planned and paced, George was friendly and knowledgeable, had a lovely manner and a delight to spend a day with. A great way to begin my African holiday.

Half day city tour and day trip to the cape. Excellent service and very enjoyable trips. Comfortable minibus with plenty of room. Lively and friendly guide. Very informative. Safe driver. Great scenery. Would highly recommend.

Must do. We spent a day with Henry doing the Cape Loop. He was well versed in local history and spun a great story about he past. He questioned us as to interests (primarily fauna and flora) so we emphasized that. A highlight was probably the Boulders Penguins, but the whole tour was full of amazing sights. Even found a few early whales. Took us to a great restaurant for lunch. Made us eager to want to come back.

Beautiful and enriching Day Tour. I highly recommend Illos travel. Our guide, Ashram Bazier took us on a eventful and memorable tour of this gorgeous city. He provided us with the right combination of sights to visit, along with the interesting history of Cape Town. It was a very relaxed and comfortable way to tour this city. We commend him and would highly recommend Ilios Travel. All the arrangements made with Ilios were done professionally...all drivers were on time and very friends.

Jun 2014. Professional service. We booked the tour from the southern sun concierge, the team was very helpful and knowledgable. The guide was amazing, van was clean and they were on time. We dirt he peninsula tour with Boulder beach and Kirsten garden its recommended.

Guide really made Cape Town special!. We had 2 tours booked with Ilios Travel & Peter was our guide for both. Cape Town doesn't need any help to sell itself, but Peter's personal experiences and knowledge really made the tours unforgettable and special.
Reliable, punctual, knowledgeable. . We used Ilios travels for a winelands day tour. Philip our guide was knowledgeable and really witty. We enjoyed our tour.

Trip of a Life time to South Africa!. we used Ilios travel many times in the cape town area, from group tours to private tours to pickups airport transfers. all were very knowledgeable, safe and courteous! a plus, plus, plus goes to Collin ad Mervin!! Both had so much knowledge!!

Great tour guide. My group of 6 used Ilios for our day tours around Cape Town, down to Cape Point and also in the Wine Lands. Garth was our guide on all 3 days and I cant speak highly enough of his knowledge, passion and enthusiasm for his choice of career.The only thing I didn't like was the choice of vehicle used for the first 2 days of our touring. The Hyundai H1 was a nice car though not suitable for this type of touring. Garth would point out things of interest and unless you were in the front seat you couldn't see the landmark as the windows are very low. I wrote this on our feedback sheet after the first 2 days of touring and when we did our wine lands tour 3 days later we had a Mercedes people mover which has high windows and is a much better vehicle for this type of work Would I use Ilios again for touring, absolutely, they were fantastic

Good Day Out. Full day out to the Cape of Good Hope and various stops in between including Hout Bay and Botanical Gardens. We could have lived without the penquin colony to be honest but each to their own of course. Good guide - just a little time wsted picking up other customers at different hotels.

Great service. I used this company very much during my first trip (2014) and a different group of companies in 2015 - more than happy to go back to Ilios - they were always punctual, polite, and helpful.

Responsible Tour Guides. We took their day tour to see Bo Kaap, the district 6 museum, walking tour & Robben Island. We could have done it on our own with the hope on and hop off bus, but was recommended to get a guide from llios. They were very responsible, on time and friendly.

Request Omar!. We spent 2 days with Omar of Ilios Travel and he was a fantastic guide. So knowledgeable, friendly, and kind. It was nice having Omar for both days (we weren't sure if we were going to see him for our 2nd day, but we got lucky!). We spent one day touring the peninsula and one day touring the winelands. Both tours were relaxing and fun and we had a great time!

Quality service. Had a day tour 'robbed Island and Walk to Freedom'. A great experience from our excellent driver/guide Rory. Also a tour to the Winelands. Well planned, personal service, great value.

Great service!. The tour company we used for our Africa adventure (Siyabona) contracted with Ilios Travel for tours and transportation during our May 2015 Capetown visit. The drivers were prompt, friendly, knowledgeable, informative, professional and made our visit the trip of a lifetime. Thank you!

Day Tours. Had two tours both were excellent. The Winelands tour was superb as was our guide Tracy. She was very friendly and knowledgeable of all aspects of the day. Ilios travel were excellent and we would recommend them without reservation. Ken R

Great choices for day trips. We were holidaying with Great Rail Journeys who obviously hired Ilios Travel to act as our local guides during our stay in Cape Town. They certainly did us proud as all 3 day's tours were well organised and very interesting. The guide Rory was very approachable and informative.

Wineland Tour. I did a whole day wine land tour and Tracy was our guide. She was very knowledgable and eager to share her knowledge. The wine tastig was amazing. The first one was with cheese and we also had a tour of the winery. The last tasting was paired with chocolate and what a treat that was.I would highly recommened the whole day wine tour and especially if Tracy is your guide. If she is you are in for a treat.

Best tour guides in South Africa. I used Ilios Tours for several trips and found the guides to be very informative, friendly and receptive to questions and ideas. The transport vehicle was comfortable and clean. The group size was perfect, allowing everyone to get to know each other and ask questions. I particularly liked the Stellenbosch wine trip.

Wonderful Experience in Cape Town, Cape Peninsula, and Wine Country. I had a great 3 days of private tours plus airport transfers by Ilios while in Cape Town in March. My guide Avril was so informative, always on time, and pleasant. We covered a lot of ground in that time and I was well taken care of. The airport transfers were smooth and friendly. Thanks Ilios and Avril!

Good drivers. Ilios took our family to a number of different locations in the JB area. Each was an excellent driver, courteous and friendly. I believe all had been trained as tour guides and were clearly knowledgable when asked direct questions. We only wish that in general they had been more forthcoming with information about the country, their city and the destinations we were visiting.

Excellent Knowledgeable Guide. We organised a private half day city tour and full day tour of the Cape with I lips and we're very happy.Our guide Garth was very knowledgeable and a lover of nature which meant he was perfect for us. The tour was very flexible and tailored to cater for our individual interests, giving us a very informative and enjoyable experience. One minor criticism, the vehicle we were in was an eight seater which was less than the typical 11 seater we have been in previously, making for cosey travelling.

Tour Guide par excellent!. Our tour guide Garth was well informed and kept us rivetted with his knowledge of the local history, politics, architecture and relevant eateries and hot spots for fun, shopping and entertainment

The best. My travel agent uses ilios for personal tours. They are the best. Knowledgeable about everything in Cape Town and beyond. They are always ahead of schedule. Drivers are extremely courteous, and drive safely. I have used them for 7 tours over the last two years. Not one complaint.
Great Driver and Tours. Ishmaeel our driver was informative, friendly and a great courteous driver. He knew all the good spots and the people running stores and attractions.
These guys are the best. 2nd time in Cape Town and I use them every time for trips and transfers. They are the masters of Cape Town and the staff is the best. Never using anyone else.
Service, cars, guides. Always on time, great cars, very good guest relations and always worried about your experience!Try their Whale Watching!

Great day trip with a wonderful guide. We took a day trip to Cape Horn and had a wonderful time. Our guide was excellent and she really knew the history and the area. Had a good lunch stop close to the penguin reserve. Finished the day at the botanical gardens. Would highly recommend the trip when in Cape Town.

Great time in Cape Town. Our guide, Shareef Noble, was excellent. He was so knowledgeable ,polite, helpful ,and good company. We had city tours,including The path to Freedom, we went to the Cape of Good Hope and a trip to the wine lands which was very good. The company are very reliable and I would use them next time,we want to return!,

Highly knowledgeable driver/guides, late model cars, superb service. We had 3 different drivers for airport pickup, city and wine country tour and Garden route tour. Each of them was impressive in terms of knowledge of country/area,cheerful, helpful and a pleasure to be with. Faizel Abrahams who drove us on the garden route particularly stands out. The cars are clean and late model . The driving is safe and the quality of the road infrastructure is impressive. In spite of a little administrative snafu on one pick up point I was impressed by Ilios Travel and would definitely use them again on the next visit. The owner/manager of the company deserves plaudits for being able to attract, motivate and retain such top flight driver/guides. I have used tour companies in all parts of the world but the consistent quality of Ilios was impressive.

Private transfers with Ilios Travel - Shoutout to Mmeli. Our travel agent booked all our private transfers with Illios during our two week honeymoon in South Africa. Our first experience was with our private transfer drive, Mmeli Mtshali, who drove us 5.5 hours from Jo'burg to Kruger National Park. Mmeli made the long trip so enjoyable. Our conversations were interesting, he shared history of the country and of himself, and he made sure we were comfortable. We enjoyed his company so much so that we personally requested him for the transfer back where he took us a longer route (the Panorama) and we stopped to view some of the sites. By the end of these two drives we felt like we made a new friend. Mmeli asked to see wedding photos and we really connected. He is an amicable person who drove safely and made the experience even better. Thank you so much Mmeli! You are terrific!With 4 different arrangements made with Illios Travel I would say that as a company they are reliable, friendly, and a great way to enhance your South Africa adventure.

Reliable,punctual and always with a smile!!. We toured Cape Town, flew to the Kruger Park, Joberg, and Victoria Falls in April, and Ilios were responsible for all our transfers and excursions. All I can say is that they were brilliant!! They always kept us informed of pick up times, were never late, and with 7 flights throughout our stay, it took a weight off our minds, and contributed to our fantastic stay in South Africa. I would not hesitate to recommend this fabulous firm.

A wonderful day trip to the Cape Peninsula. We booked a private day trip to do the Cape Peninsula tour when we were in Cape Town. Our guide was Nazeem and he was fantastic. He arranged lunch for us, and knew how to balance giving us information, taking pictures, and yet also giving us time alone to explore some of the sites we stopped at.He was a true gentleman.We had booked through an agent in the UK, and Ilios had also done our airport transfers - the return journey was better than the first - but both were efficient and what you needed.Thank you Nazeem for a fantastic day out.

Two fantastic weeks!. We were booked on 2 7-day tours with Ilios - Cape Town, Cape Point, the Wine lands and the Garden Route; then Durban, the Elephant Coast, KwaZulu Natal, Swaziland, Kruger and a the Drakensberg Montains. Unbelievable value for money! How they did it for the money I'll never know! Great guides, great accommodation, great sites! Can't recommend them highly enough! So many memories!
Wine tour with IIios!. Constantia is the birthplace of the wine farming industry in South Africa. The route is an easy day trip and the farms provide quality restaurants for lunches and tea.

Grand South Africa Tour. Cant speak too highly of this company and their organisation. Two weeks in SA from J'burg to Kruger then on to Durban, Port Elizabeth and then the garden route to Cape Town. We had our own driver up to Durban and then again from Port Elizabeth. Both were very good- especially Ndodo, who gave us such a detailed and informed insight into the country. He was an outstanding guide and we are so glad that he was our driver. Very comfortable relaxing journeys.Accommodation chosen was very good.Tours in Cape Town were in a minibus with about 6 passengers. Did the winelands and also Table mountain. Again we were completely satisfied with the arrangements and organisation.
Friendly and informative. We had a great morning visiting The sights of Cape Town. Great transport, informed guide and safe happy driver!!

Best Limpopo trip ever!. 8 days we travelled from Johannesburg, to Magaliesburg, Vaalwater and Louis Trichardt. We had an great driver named Nelson, a comfortable minibus, an amazing guide named Ananda and this was our basis for an incredible South African experience. We stayed in the most incredible accommodations, experienced the province Limpopo to its fullest. I would like to get on a plane right now and come back and do it all over again!!!

Fam trip Johannesburg and Limpopo.. What a wonderful trip we had in Johannesburg and the Northern part of South Africa! Thanks to Ilios Travel and their lovely guide Ananda van der Merwe who made it all go very smoothly and an experience we never forget...We learned a lot from this part of the country which more tourists should go to and explore it. The wonderful nature, the friendly people and not forget the delicious food and the best hotels!Baie Dankie for everything!Lindy Slikkerveer ( Travel Trend Holland)

Fabulous Day Out on the Cape Point Tour. We had the best time with Rob and Cape Convoy. He skillfully avoided the crowds and as a result we enjoyed the best day out, seeing as much as we could without feeling rushed. The highlight for me was seeing the Penguins and Boulders beach, but loved seeing ostriches in the wild near Cape Point which is an awesome place. Rob had to stop the van to assist a tortoise who was crossing the road at the Cape of Good Hope, we loved that.Chapmans Peak Drive on the way back to Cape Town is stunning. Rob is a smashing guy who has great knowledge of the Cape and probably owes a lot of this knowledge to his Uncle Carl, a legend by all accounts! Thanks for a Fabulous day out Rob, it made our 30th Wedding Anniversary unforgettable. We will remember to bring you some pickled onion monster munch next time we visit Cape Town! Julie & Dave x

A Tour Company (and Guide) with Soul. I was fortunate enough to go on a full-day tour on 30 October 2016 and to say that it was a great experience would be an understatement. First, we were fortunate enough to have Rob as our tour guide - and while I'm sure all of Rob's guides are great, Rob's humor rivals that of John Oliver. In addition to being extraordinarily funny, Rob's knowledge of the sites was impressive. Having done this for a while, Rob was able to time our tour to avoid large crowds - so we could enjoy ourselves a great deal more.What truly sets Rob and Cape Convoy apart is the love of the area. So many tours feel robotic - where the guide(s) drone on in a monotone way, repeating the same thing they say every day. Rob's love of the area, however, is infectious, and as he explains things (and provides wonderful asides along the way,) you can hear (and feel) the passion, which only makes the experience even better.If you're looking for a tour that has surgical precision and gives only the facts and nothing more, you should look elsewhere (though I'm sure if you asked, Rob would accommodate). However, if you're looking for a guide/company that has soul - and will afford you both an educational and extremely enjoyable trip, Cape Convoy is the way to go. I'll be passing Rob's information on to anyone I know that's going to visit Cape Town - and I share my great experience with the TripAdvisor community as well, because you deserve to know where you can find the best.

Great tour from a real prospective!. We took the tour on Nov. 1 2016. Rob the owner/operator was awesome. Rob respected our time and made sure we saw everything and took us to the hotspots to beat the big tourist tours so we can enjoy the landscape and take our photos. The tour was organic. If nature was there, we stopped to take it in. For example, there were two ostriches by the coast on the way to the Cape. Rob stopped the van so we came take pictures and then tell us a bit about the ostrich. His attitude and presentation were great and lighthearted. Rob made sure everyone on the tour had a good time. I would totally recommend this tour to anyone. It is a great way to get another view on South Africa that is not a cookie cutter tour and can be as fun and interesting as the participants make it. Best of luck to you Rob and Cape Convoy!

Crazy Fun Day with Rob!. This is not only a great tour of the Cape sights, but a truly fun day out and about. Rob in not only is a wealth of historical info, but he is a blast to listen to. History, local facts, great views, personal anecdotes and funny jokes all mix to create a fun filled day. He adapted the day schedule to work with weather and crowds to make it effortless.Highly recommend this tour! Thanks Rob for a great time and tour!

Good day so far. Went with the tour and got lucky since it's only me and a lovely couple on the tour. We feel very privatea and Rob has done his homework on the weather so the trip arranged in perfect timing.Rob got so much energy. I can recommend this tour for anyone.

Great Day. Had a great day touring the surrounding areas of Cape Town (Cape of Good Hope, Simons Town, Boulders Beach, Chapman's Peak, etc). You can't really go wrong here with how beautiful the sights are but Rob really made the day memorable with his stories. He was a really funny guy that made the day extra special. Can't recommend this tour enough.

Memorable Experience. Rob is an absolute natural guide, who has the ability to entertain people from all walks of life. No matter how great the scenery on the Cape was, I would argue that I'll remember the day moreso for Rob's touring style. From young to old, the whole minivan was entertained for the whole (and I mean whole) day with engaging and thorough local history (you wouldn't have thought he was a Pom!), personal anecdotes and hilarious off-the-cuff one-liners. Excellent idea (moreso in hindsight) to have a single meeting point in the morning (you'll realise this when you do other tours in Cape Town). Great idea to hit the Cape first to avoid midday lines. Excellent decisions to stop off at some not-so-well-known but very scenic areas. And solid tips throughout the day to make the most of each stop-off.On the face of it, the tour price may seem comparatively on the high side; however, I do believe it's worth it. And Rob mate: Here's a random pic of a dassie to mull over (and the selfie as promised)

your choice of where to go. our booing for the Whale boat was cancelled due to weather but our hotel (Excellent Ellermen House) had obtained tickets for Table Mtn and we had Renee take us there first. No line ups and a wonderful trip. Don't miss going up the mountain but go early! Renee was very personable but we found her to be more of a driver and less of a guide as she would drop us off and then arrange a pick up time. More information and assisted touring of Hermanus would haven greatly appreciated.

Rob and Renee. Enjoyed the first day touring with Rob to the cape of good hope. Rob's enthusiasm is evident throughout the day! Rene took us on the wine tour and we loved her knowledgeable selection and relaxing experience.

Highlight of Trip to Cape Town. I had really high expectations and the actual tour surpassed them!The entire tour was constant natural beauty. Incredible. We drove down the west coast and then back up the east coast. Plenty of stops along the way to really soak everything in. I was amazed at how beautiful everything was the whole way. Cape Point was incredibly windy, but phenomenal. We successfully avoided the wild baboons! Just when you think you have seen all there is, you'd go to another awesome place. Lighthouse. Boulders Beach penguins. Muizenberg. Incredibe. Ebrahim was a really personable and knowledgeable tour guide.I'm so glad we did this tour!
Fun times. All I can say is that I had the best time of my life ,it was breathtaking the view is great the people are friendly

Beautiful and Fun Cape Point Day Tour. So happy we did this tour and chose Cape Convoy!We did the Cape Point tour and it was such an amazing day! First of all, the sights are amazing. Every stop you make is just as beautiful and breathtaking as the next - make sure to charge your camera batteries! We were fortunate to have Rob as our guide. He is very experienced, knowledgeable and entertaining. He planned the schedule perfectly as we always seemed to get to the sights before the big crowds - no time to waste! We had 7 people in our group and it was a good size. Rob kept us entertained throughout the day with just the right balance of history, politics, culture and fun facts and stories. You hit all the sights with plenty of time for each. Rob even has tips for some of the sights so you get the best views or avoid hassle/crowds. My only disappointment is that the tour doesn't include Seal island which would have been nice to visit. Having said that, the day was already jam packed without it so it might have been too much to have it in the schedule anyways.Overall - really really good tour. Highly recommend! I would even do it again.

Family holiday. We spent a lot of time researching a tour guide when we returned to Cape Town to show other members of our family the wonders of South Africa. Rob stood out as on our wavelength ( after seeing his You Tube feed - ably assisted by his daughter). We were not disappointed !!!!Rob arranged airport transfers for us with a lovely man Ibrahim who was early on both pick ups & very friendly and informative on our drive to the hotel & back.Our first tour was to the winelands. I had specifically asked for a particular 2 vineyards & asked for the location of the 2nd to be kept a secret until we arrived. (Which they did). Our guide Rene was absolutely wonderful. She booked us a masterclass at Fairview prior to meeting us but told us there was no obligation if we didn't fancy it. This was one of the highlights of the day, in a private tasting room they bring you 8 different wines from to taste in order with the 8 sample cheeses on your individual board and explain all about the wines you are drinking. Was fabulous with the wine barrels on view through a glass wall. We invited Rene to dine with us for a late lunch and declined a further vineyard so that we could enjoy her company and tales of life in Cape Town and of South Africa's history. A member of our party mentioned a township trip & a few days later Rene contacted me to say she had made a booking at a township restaurant Lelapa (again there would be no problem if we didn't fancy it). What a great experience. A buffet meal within a family house. Loved Sheila's take on the world ( and how we're ruled by watches) with a band playing xylophones and drums traditional & modern music. The variety on the buffet was completely unexpected & the food delicious. Our 2nd trip was with Rob to the Cape Peninsula. He tailored our trip to our party, taking us to a 2nd entrance for the Boulders Bay penguins so my mum wouldn't have to walk far. He planned the day to minimise the queues and regaled us with life observations and dodgy jokes. Would highly recommend Cape Convoy, everyone we met through them came across genuinely friendly and enthusiastic to share information about their town. Booking from England was easy & Rob always responded quickly to any queries. We were a party of 7 and all 3 vehicles used were modern, clean & comfortable. These guys work long hours to make sure you have a good experience and a full day. Thank you all x

So much fun and laughs. Rob was the best tour guide. He was funny but also knew the history and provided facts and tidbits on the area. We loved that the tour was intimate (only 10 people) rather than a tour bus. Rob knew where to go for what time in order to avoid crowds. We appreciated the group meeting at the waterfront instead of individual pick ups, that way we didn't waste time in the van. The cape point tour was a breath of fresh air in comparison to other tours we have done in the past. Fun tour guide + enthusiastic travellers= good times and memories. Thank you Rob!

Fantastic Day. Rob is funny and knowledgeable - a great combination. He has a great pace, and really seems to love his job. He's personable and happy to share his country. The tour was a lot of fun, a great value, and we learned a lot.

Full Day Cape Point. We were lucky enough to get Rob the owner as our host/guide for the day. He established a rapport with the group of very quickly with his wit, knowledge and interaction. It was a day just packed with things to see. Rob kept a watchful eye on the weather and our visits were expertly timed so we missed the crowd and had the best viewing. By coincidence there were four Americans, Brits and Canadians. Interesting group and all quite friendly so lots of interaction with the whole group. We enjoyed what was on the tour... Simon's Town, the Cape and the Penguins but saw much more than that including ostrich. This was a very full and most enjoyable day.... Consensus in our group for sure!

Thanks Rob and Rene.. We only had one day spare to do something in capetown because we were there for our daughters wedding. We could'nt even do the early start we wanted to did'nt get to do the Cape point tour . But Rob was so friendly and helpful on the phone prior to our trip and arranged for Rene to pick us up from our hotel and drive us where we wanted for the time we had.She drove us through the countryside and farmlands to Harm where we had time to shop and eat at this beautiful little seaside town. She then took us to the boat trip area where we spent a great 2 hours whale watching.Going home Rene drove the coastal route via Bettys Bay where we walked the route where thousands of penguins gather because of the abundance of fish there.The rest of the journey back to Capetown along the coast had views that were totally stunning and Rene would stop wherever we wanted to take photos.All through the day Rene was barraged with hundreds of questions from us and was more than happy to answer them and her knowledge and friendly helpfulness was much appreciated.I hope we can return to Capetown and when we do....Rob will be the first person i will call.

Great day out - thoroughly recommend it. I had a very short time in Cape Town and the tour meant I saw lots of stuff but at the same time we weren't rushed at all. Rob has great local knowledge which meant we got to Cape Point nice and early to beat the crowds and had 90 minutes so we could really appreciate it before it got too touristy. Also stopped at Good Hope, Simon's Town (great fish and chips), the penguins, Chapman's Peak and many others. What really made it interesting was Rob's insight into the history, the wildlife, the politics etc and I learned a lot. He is someone who is focused on making sure you have a great day. Would thoroughly recommend !

A great way to experience Cape Town & its surroundings. We had the pleasure of experiencing what Cape Town & its surroundings had to offer with 2 tours by Cape Convoy guides. Ebraham was friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating to our wishes. On the way to Cape Point, while making several stops a long the way to highlight different spots he gave us the history of the region. There was no rush, his time was our time. He even made an unscheduled stop for us to go to the top of Table Mt. On our second tour Rene, who was equally knowledgeable, friendly & accomodating took us to Hermannus , a beautiful seaside town. She & Ebraham are lifelong residents of Cape Town. It was great exploring with the " locals." I highly recommend Cape Convoy to guide you thru the area

Cape Point. We spent the day with Rob who is funny, engaging and informative. We had the opportunity to enjoy all of the expected attractions with just the right amount of time for each and Rob also made time for a few extras. Enjoyed the tour so much that we booked the Winelands tour for later in the week. Renae was also fantastic. Very informative and fun to spend the day with.

A fun day out!. We went on a day-trip to Cape Point at the end of August and had a really great day. We went to lots of places along the way and Rob was really keen to get us to Cape Point when the weather was good so that we could see everything. He's also really knowledgeable about South African history and threw in interesting facts along the way. This is probably not for you if you want a really structured tour but if you want to see lots of different places and have fun, choose this tour!Lunch is not included but we actually preferred this - we stopped at Simonstown and Rob pointed out a few places where we could get lunch. We found a little place where we had a great lunch overlooking the sea.All in all, a great day!
Cape peninsula tour . An excellent tour we were on a bus with people who all had a good time. Rob our guide was very informative and enthusiastic a fun day was had by all. Would highly recommend

Lives up to the hype of all these reviews!. I had the pleasure of spending the day with Rene. This tour was fanastic, a real world perspective from a local who has lived it and studied it so that she can relate the history and perspectives of the area to her guests. After a timely pick up and introduction to my travel mates for the day we headed out to see all the sites, learning about the specifics of how aparthtied played out in her family. Rene was friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. Our hike at Cape Point was a perfect stretch of the legs at midday (FYI - when you come to the first big fork in the hike don't go right across the pole that's laying down) and our Ostrich Farm lunch was an experience I’ve not had elsewhere.

Rugged heathland. I used to think that Cape Point was just a windswept outcrop stuck on the lower end of the Table Mountain plateau. But delve carefully into the fynbos, hardy creatures and birdlife and you will find a magic world which eludes most of the tourists who charge to take their photos at the Cape of Good Hope or the shops and restaurants.Read the fascinating accounts in the orientation centre of early travels, habitation and wartime importance. Search for the unusual Cape Otters, groups of wandering ostriches or seabirds which cling to the preciptous cliff faces. Marvel at the long stretches of white sand and the swell of the Benguela current.The best way to enjoy this nature reserve is pick a quiet spot then sit, watch and listen. You will be amazed!

A Great Day Tour. Thoroughly recommend this trip. We booked a private Peninsula Day Tour with Cape Convoy and was picked up at our hotel by Renee, who was our guide for the day. As this was a private tour we could set the itinerary ourselves, which was good as it meant we chose to spend longer at Cape Point with a lovely walk from the Cape of Good Hope to Cape Point and then a leisurely lunch at the Two Oceans restaurants. Renee was great, friendly, patient and full of information.

cape point tour. We booked a day tour around the Cape with Cape Convoy. As there were 4 of us (2 adults plus 2 teenagers) it worked out almost the same price to book a private tour. Our guide was Renee who was fanastic – very nice, very knowledgeable (having grown up locally) and flexible to allow us as long as we wanted in each place. We stopped at the Rhodes monument, Muizenburg beach, saw the Penguins at Boulders Beach, walked up to Cape Point (where she booked lunch at the Two Oceans restaurant which we requested and has fabulous views), Ostrich farm and back along the beautiful coastline. A great day and highly recommended as a way to see the sights. Thanks Renee

wine tours with Rene. We did the Wine tour with Rene. She is a very nice person and we could enjoy a lot our tour. It was just the 4 of us so it was really nice. Beautiful scenery and landscapes, and very nice tastings

Great tour to a beautiful place. We loved our day tour of the Cape peninsula with Rob. Rob is energetic and funny and worked hard to make sure we could see everything we wanted to in one day. This tour allows you to see so many wonderful places in one day, and completely takes away any worries about driving, parking, etc. We highly recommend Cape Convoy!

Just do it!!. We really enjoyed our day with Rob. He has a unique sense of humour which you seldom find with other tour operators! He made us laugh the whole way round, and made a real effort to get to everyone the group and get the conversation, jokes & banter in full swing!If you don't mind a bit of colourful language and some 'close to the mark stories', then I would highly recommend Cape Convoy, certainly different to every other tour we've taken and loved every minute of it!!Cheers Rob!!

Must do!!!. Rob is amazing and this was the best day in South Africa. He is hilarious and educational at the same time. We loved touring the cape, seeing all the sites and learning about the history. We got to see so much in one day and I am so happy we went with him! Highly recommend!

Fabulous tour with Rob. My sons (ages 16 and 19) my husband and I did the Peninsula tour with Rob. This was hands-down the boys favorite part of the trip. Rob is a riot and kept us laughing and entertained for 8 hours as he whisked us around Cape Point, the Cape of Good Hope, Simondstown and the Penguins (my favorite). He is full of entertaining stories, information and great questions and easily took a group of 12 and knit us all together. He handled all logistics, figuring out when the perfect weather was to hit each of the sights and timing our day perfectly. Really one of the best guided trips I have ever been on. Strongly recommended!
Amazing trip. Robert is a great guy and he really loves what he does. I had a day full of insights and amazing views. I totally recommend.
A view you cannot describe in words.... This is a breathtaking view from Cape Point. This scenery is one of the best places in Cape Town. All should see this when visiting Cape Town.

Hilarious Fun Filled Day. Booked the Peninsula tour with Rob, highly entertaining day. I recommend Rob and Cape Convoy if you want a private guide. If I ever make it back to Cape Town, I hope we can enjoy more laughs together, even though your like Mama June- f & u. Thanks for the great time!!!

Amazing trip!. Fully packed schedule with a nice and relaxed lunch break. Got the best of everything in just one day! Loved how energetic and informative Rob is. He was THE GUIDE who will make you love Capetown and South Africa!

Fantastic Day to Cape of Good Hope and Boulder Beach!. Booked with Cape Convoy for the Cape of Good Hope Group Tour - toured with Rob and a group of about 6-7. What an amazing day - the weather cooperated and we got great views of Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope as well as an awesome trip to Bolder Beach for the Penguins. As an added benefit we saw cape zebra, ostrich, a dassee, and whales. The drive back along Hout's Bay was also gorgeous - couldn't have asked for a better day or a better guide - Rob's enthusiasm was infectious and he encouraged lots of conversation among our group. Easy to book over email. Very reasonable in price. Gave plenty of time at each site. Would definitely recommend!

Amazing day. I checked for reviews here before booking with cape convoy. And they are absolutely true! We had an amazing day with Rene! She would explain from penguins to apartheid, stop at the best places for pictures and made the perfect schedule so that we could avoid all the big buses!!!At the end we had an amazing lunch, at an ostrich farm! Definitely going to come back and book it again with them!!!

Amazing day trips!. We booked 2 tours with Rob at Cape Convoy - the Cape Point tour and the Winelands.He took us for our day out to Cape Point - he was on time meeting us and full of enthusiasm for our day. We were a small group of 6 and he made sure we arrived at the Cape early in order to miss the coach tours when it would be really busy. We stopped for every photo opportunity and even waited for the sun to set so we could get great photos! Rob was a brilliant guide - he was entertaining and not only knowledgeable about the places we visited - we learned such a lot about South Africa and it's history - his passion for the country really came across.The next day we had Rene as our guide to the Winelands. She was lovely and again, very knowledgeable - not only about the places we visited but very informative about anything we asked! We started off at Ernie Els' winery which is absolutely beautiful. It was a sunny morning with not many visitors so we just sat on the terrace, tasted the wine and looked at the amazing views. As there were only the 3 of us, Rene was happy for us to take our time which suited us! We went to one other winery in Stellenbosch and then she took us to an amazing restaurant in Franschhoek for lunch.We thoroughly enjoyed both our tours with Cape Convoy - as well as visiting places on a map, we gained a real insight into South Africa and it's people and had 2 fabulous days which we will remember for a long time!

Amazing tour. We came from Kuwait to see Cape Town and didn't have much time so we booked a day tour with Rob around Cape Town and it was simply amazing. We covered so much in a single day, and the guy knows the town very well obviously, and he has a great sense of humor. But I feel that what really makes this tour so great is the way Rob just honestly wants you to have a good time.

So glad I went, Great Guide, Wonderful Tour. I must say I was a little bit hesitant to go on a tour by myself since you never know who else may be on the tour with you. It could be a fun group or sadly a quite boring group. Our group was awesome. The group was a mix of Americans and a couple from Singapore. Then our tour guide was the amazing Rob. We started early in the morning, then arrived back in the evening. The sights we saw were so many like Rhodes Monument, Signal Hill, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, Sky Harbor Beach, Boulders Park with the penguins, Cape Point Ostrich Farm, Simmons Town, Hout Bay, and Chapman's Peak. For an all day tour, it was jammed pack of great places in Cape Town. Not only were we able to see so many places, Rob had wonderful information about Cape Town and filled us in on history and answered any of our questions. Then we heard the fun stories of past tours. I was not able to do the Winelands tour with Cape Convoy, but I imagine it would be great as well. I highly recommend Cape Convoy and Rob as your tour guide. Rob added a lot to the trip with his fun, happy, honest personality. I am extremely lucky that he was our tour guide. You won't be disappointed if you select Cape Convoy Tours. I will definitely be doing future tours with only Cape Convoy Tours when back in Cape Town.

Absolutely amazing!. We booked with Rob for a day tour to the Cape of Good Hope before arriving in Cape Town and had a fantastic time.
