Our guide Rene was really knowledgable of the whole area and answered the many questions we had as we passed through lots of beachside villages. The scenery was nothing short of breathtaking and Rene knew all the best spots to stop for family photographs which she was more than happy to take for us. The whole family agreed that it was our favourite day spent in Cape Town. I highly recommend this tour!

Amazing tour of Cape Town . Rob was amazing. Great tour of the Cape, I can't believe how much he fit into 9 hours! The perfect tour if you only have a few days to see everything! Thanks Rob, remember if you're ever feeling down - you are made of star dust ⭐️⭐️⭐️!

We had a BLAST. We booked two tours with Rob - the Cape Point tour and the Winelands. Rob was helpful with communicating with us as we booked and made our plans, and was flexible when we wanted to change our booking days based on the weather. Rob switched the days of our scheduled tours to make sure we had the best weather for the Cape Point tour which was a treat. We saw beautiful sights, had time to walk to the Cape Point Lighthouse and beyond, and laughed the whole way. We wound up not doing the Winelands tour with Rob because of scheduling changes, but he made sure we were taken care of with another tour company. We can't say enough good things about Rob's customer service and humor - you'll laugh the whole way and learn a lot about Cape Town and surrounding areas.

An excellent day in CapeTown with an Excellent Tour Guide. First of all I would like to thank Rob for arranging the Cape Peninsula Tour for us on a special request for Monday as they I don't operate on Mondays . I am glad that I opted for Cape Convoy as our Guide Rene was excellent . She is very hospitable and knowledgable . She made sure that we enjoy to the fullest and take beautiful memories back with us . She stopped by the most scenic spots on the way to Cape Point . She acted as a photographer for us ;-) She is awesome . Thumbs up . We forgot our bag in the bus and she dropped it at our hotel which was a great gesture of hers despite of us collecting from her . Incase you are looking for a cape point tour then without any doubts go for Rene and CapeConvoy . Excellent operator with excellent people.

Disorganised but friendly. . Driver was very chatty and abnormally happy during the tour. But left us behind during start of the tour although we were there waiting on time. Had to scramble to call himAnd he turned back for us about 25 min later.

Fun day with Rob!. Our family of four (two teenage girls) booked the tour of the coast with Rob. The weather was bleak and rainy and Rob contacted us and offered to reschedule. Since we only had one more day in Cape Town we decided to go ahead with the tour. Two other people cancelled, so it was just the four of us with Rob. He kept an eye on the weather and managed to time all of our stops when it wasn't raining. Of course, the penguins were a favorite but we also enjoyed seeing Cape Point and all of the areas nestled along the coast. Bonus points for a sighting of two ostriches and a few baboons. Rob was a great tour guide, kept us laughing, and got us to all of the places we wanted to go. A great day!

Rene was a fantastic guide!. Make sure you visit the cape while in Cape Town! It's a don't miss place and Cope Convoy Tours provide a great tour at a reasonable price. We had a great day out with Rene as our guide. She is a knowledgable, kind and easy to understand.

Cape Peninsula trip. Thanks Rob for an awesome trip to the Cape Peninsula. Rob was really flexible with the itinerary which meant we could get the most out of the day. A beautiful part of the world so a must do on a trip to Cape Town.

a great day out. we packed so much into this day it was great..besides all the scienic views we past our guide was so informative..even pointing out one of the prisons that nelson mandela was inprisoned.We tuk in a penguin colony and a short but cheap boat trip to see the seals cape point and cape of good hope..cape point was difficult for me to climb although I did it I suffered with my muscles the following dayThis trip is well worth a day out,we even received information on s.a politics and the townships which I very much enjoyed ..one thing I did notice on our travels was that my friend and I were the only people to tip our driver who went out of his way...is this an English thing...I don't know but give credit where it is due..we were last off and he said it made his day!!

Amazing Day...even with a rainy start!. Rob is so much fun and so positive...we started the day with clouds and rain. He decided to push forward and sure enough by the time we got to Boulder Beach the skies cleared and penguins were plentiful! Rob was very knowledgable and taught us tons about SA as we drove from one location to another. Fantastic day with a fantastic guide! My whole family loved it.

Informative as well as hillarious tour. Rob gave us one of the most informative and hilarious tours I have ever been on! The tour was limited to a small group and we never had to do a line at the normally crowded attractions. We toured the Cape and visited all the great local hangouts as well as the world famous attractions. Beautiful vistas and photo opportunities thru-out the tour. The tour was relaxed and personal. Rob provided a great history listen on South Africa. His sense of humor is fantastic and laugh contagious. Everyone was on the floor of the van laughing by the end of the tour .

Cape Convoy - A Mixed Experience. My wife and I booked two day tours with Cape Convoy: the Cape Point Tour and the Winelands Tour. Rene was our tour guide on the Cape Point tour. The substance of the tour was great. The weather was very cooperative, and the Point itself with its funicular and views was spectacular. And on the drive to and from the Point we stopped at an Ostrich farm, stopped again and saw some penguins close-up, checked out a harbor and naval base, and also had a great seafood lunch. Rene was a good guide and she happily dropped us back at our CBD hotel after the tour. The only issue with the tour was meeting up at the very beginning. Our instructions were to be at the entrance to the Victoria and Albert Hotel on the waterfront from 0820 to 0840, and my wife and there were there waiting well before 0820. But Rene did not approach us until about 0845, and we were a bit worried that somehow we had made a location mistake. I am not sure why this meetup issue happened. There were many vehicles and people around the entrance to the hotel while we waited, so I think we just didn’t see each other. In the future, perhaps Cape Convoy should use one of those magnetic signs on the outside of its vehicles so the vehicle is obvious. Or perhaps the guides should wear a shirt or jacket that says “Cape Convoy” in large letters. Also, in fairness I should say that Rob, the owner of Cape Convoy, did try to contact us by text when Rene apparently couldn’t spot us at the meetup. Our cell phones, however, did not provide us cell access in South Africa, so Rob’s attempt did not work. Next time we go to South Africa we will make some sort of cell arrangement so that we have a working phone.Our second Cape Convoy tour, the Winelands tour, was scheduled for the next day. Rene told us, however, that because we were the only two who had booked the Winelands tour for that day, Cape Convoy had moved us to African Eagle, another tour operator. Our experience on the African Eagle wine tour was fine. Rob offered to provide us a partial refund because the African Eagle tour was a bit less expensive than the tour we booked directly through Cape Convoy but, as of the date of this review (fourteen days later), our credit card has still not been credited with the refund.

A fab fun filled day out!. We only had 2 full days in Cape Town so time was precious but this tour was worth every minute and every penny. Rob went out of his way to make sure we arrived at each stop on the tour at the best possible times so we missed the queues and saved the best weather for Cape Point. The scenery is breath taking and Rob is very knowledgeable so learned lots about the area, the history and the current challenges facing South Africa. The group we travelled with was small (8 of us) so there was little waiting around for people to return to the bus (our pet hate of any tour)! We cannot recommend Cape Convoy highly enough and would definitely book further trips with them.

Professional and small group tour.. We chose Cape Convoy Tours as we didn't want to be in a large group tour. As it was our tour only had 4 of us on it, which for us was perfect.Our tour guide was Renee and she was extremely friendly and professional, telling us a lot about the area from the current day and also many historical facts which we found interesting. During the day we took in, Hout Bay, Scarborough beach, Cape Point, Boulder Beach and Simons Town. We did the trek from Cape of Good Hope to Cape Point which takes about 30 to 45 minutes and is well worth the effort as there are some stunning views that you would not see if you went up via the road. Booking was simple and straight forward, we booked whilst still in the UK ahead of our trip. Rob was very responsive and checked in with us the day before the trip once we were in Cape Town. We would recommend the company and tour, which can be personalised to take in the sites you wish to visit.

Great tour guides. We booked two tours with Cape Convoy while we were visiting Cape Town - a Cape Point tour (with Rob) and a wine tour (with Ebrahim). Both tours were great, and we were very happy with our choice. Both tour guides were very customer-oriented, intelligent and knowledgeable. Not only did they focus on the major tourist attractions, but they also provided important insights into past and present of South Africa and all challenges this beautiful country has been going through.We highly recommend this agency to other SA visitors.

There's a reason Rob is #1!. We booked the classic Cape Convoy experience with Rob on our second day in Cape Town. Booking was easy and Rob made sure to tell us where to meet and at what time in Cape Town. The day started out rainy and Rob worked around the weather to make sure we were out at Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope at the perfect time of day. We meandered through other areas of the Cape, which were all enjoyable, and stopped for great photo ops along the way. When we did get to Cape Point, the weather was flawless and we got all of the pictures and experiences we came for. Rob even made sure we saw an Ostrich or two and that the pesky baboons didn't get into our van (with a close call of course). The way back through Chapman's Peak was stunning and it was great to get to see the other areas of Cape Town we hadn't been to yet like Hout's Bay and Camp's Bay. Overall the value of this excursion cannot be beat and Rob adds the character and excitement you look for in a great tour guide. Don't miss this tour!

Excellent private tour - full on fun. Rob coordinated our reservation and was super responsive - I swear the man is tied to his phone or laptop! booking was a breeze and we were notified of our guide the day before. Rene was spot on - we learned os much about Cape Town and S Africa, and we loved that being on a private tour meant we could spend as much or as little time as we wanted at the destinations. On the way back, there was an accident on the road ahead and Rene was a total pro managing the situation. We enjoyed her expertise and easy going way. Truly one of the best days to be had in Cape Town.

Great day on the Point Peninsula. We had a lovely day during our Cape Point tour. Our guide was Joe, who was very kind and knowledgeable. I am glad we did this tour with a guide company, because it would have been too much to do on our own. We did not have to worry about anything. The drive all the way to the Point is long (longer than I realized) but you stop pretty frequently at breathtaking sites. The place that was booked for lunch was also delicious and affordable (we use the US dollar). You should take the option to walk up the cliffs, as the view from the tops of each point are awesome. Thanks for a lovely and stressfree day!

Rene is the best. We had Rene tour us around for 2 days. Cape Point and surroundings and Wine tastings. She is wonderful, imformative, friendly, pleasant and obliging. She knew so much about so many things - incredibly interesting. She also picked us up punctually from our B&B. We had 2 delightful days with her. If you are going to use Convoy, ask for Rene to be your driver/guide.

Day on the Cape. I booked a private tour with Cape Convoy based on Trip Advisor reviews and I was not disappointment. The booking process with Rob was smooth and he also put us in contact with Shark Bookings so that we could have done Shark Cage Diving the morning before our tour. Unfortunately, we received word the day before the tour that due to low shark activity that the cage diving was canceled. Rob and his team was accommodating with the change. Renee was very helpful and accommodating. She even helped me obtain a memory card when I ran out of space in my old one. She was always very pleasant and kind throughout and took some amazing pictures for me.Thank you Renee for your hospitality and thank you Rob.

Best tour of Cape Town. My wife was recommended to book this tour as it's renowned as the best tour of Cape Town filled with fun, laughter, excitement and energy from start to finish.Our tour guide, Rob, was simply the amazing and kept the group moving at all times. It's not one of your old boring tour trips with someone talking like a typical tour guide, in fact he's more like a friend filling your mind with facts about Cape Town.During our trip we travelled to Simon's Town to Cape Town and saw Penguins, Ostrich, Birds and other living creatures you're liking to find in Cape Town. Also went through a Market where you can shop for arts and crafts. We also had plenty of time to wonder around with enough time to explore ourselves.I recommend you book this if you're travelling to Cape Town.

Excellent Tour guides. Rob was a terrific guide on the Cape Point trip. We stopped at all the key sites on a fabulous day. Plus he added a quick trip to an Ostrich farm for those of us who had never seen an Ostrich. The Penquins at Simon Town were a real highlight. The Cape is magnificent as is the entire coast. The size of the tour was perfect. There were 6 of us and we easily and comfortably fit in the van.We liked Cape Convoy so much that we did a private tour of the wine country with them the next day. They recommended several excellent vineyards plus we got to tour around Stellenbosch and Franschhoek. I highly recommend Cape Convoy. Great price, knowledgeable and friendly tour guides all together an excellent choice .
Great tour. Rene was great. She provided good information and was very friendly. We had a great experience hiking to the light house. This tour is a most!

A Must Do. Having just arrived in Cape Town late the previous night it was fantastic to see so much of the countryside in just 1 day with Rob.He gave excellent advice re walking the Cape of Good Hope,eating (Salty Dog Fish and Chips) and scenic points.Not only was he knowledgable and helpful he actually cared that we enjoyed ourselves(not that he would admit it).All in all a fantastic,fun filled day at a great price.

Amazing tour company. My family and I had the pleasure of using Cape Convoy Tours twice during our visit to Cape Town. Both Rene and Rob were amazing tour guides. Not only were they extremely knowledgeable, but they made our tours fun too. It felt like we were spending the day with friends. I would recommend using Cape Convoy Tours to anyone planning a trip to Cape Town.

Brilliantly Entertaining - never a dull moment. Me, my husband, sister and Brother in law booked this tour after a friend of ours had recommend him - i am so glad we did - we all had such a good day out - Rob really does know everything there is to know about Cape Town - We set out at around 8:30 and were dropped off at around 5pm - its a long day but so much to see on route to each destination - he even stopped off to find a loo for my sister - cant recommend highly enough

"A" star - Amazing experience. Had the pleasure of Rob Salmon (Cape Convoy Tours) being our guide when my husband and I booked a three night four day private trip.Rob is such a friendly chap and has an amazing ability to create a tour that is tailor made to what "you" want. Rob provided the ideas and then we decided what we would like to do, from Sailing in a thunderstorm..... ☺ truly amazing, watching dolphins playing in the surf, seals by the 100's, safari, oh and Ronnie’s Sex shop !! an experience never to be forgotten. Rob looked after us totally and when I left my Pashmina ( aka as Scarf thingy by Rob !! ) he very kindly traced it and returned it to me in the UK. Amazing service thank you Rob ☺We started out as clients but I feel we left as friends, such an approachable chap who is able to be discreet yet there when you need him.My husband I would definitely recommend Rob and will hopefully see him again soon. Book with Rob you will not be disappointed.

Truly deserves the number 1 spot on tripadvisor. We did the cape of good hope tour. Rob was enthusiastic, knowledgeable and engaging. He is highly people-oriented and went out of the way to make sure we had a pleasant tour experience. In fact, we had left a scarf behind on his minibus which he offered to post it back to us. I would strongly recommend Rob for the tour. Lovely guy!We are lucky to have chosen Cape Convoy Tours. Made our amazing trip... perfect.

Amazing tour!. Today I've been on an amazing day trip with Cape Convoy. Joe, who arrived perfectly in time at the meetingpoint, was a very good and friendly guide. He knows a lot about Cape Town, the history of South Africa and the places you visit on this tour. The guide drives a nice airconditioned minivan, with a soundsystem so everyone can here the guide talking, and takes you up, on this trip, to every sightseeing point on the Peninsula. I'd highly recommend Cape Convoy!P.S. The small groups are very nice!

Fantastic day at the Cape!. As a single traveller Inwas able to book a last minute tour of the Cape. My guide showed up on time and was very friendly and outgoing. His local knowledge and historical insights were great. We had a couple of older ladies on our trip and he went out of his way to accommodate them as well. He was able to keep us out of the crowds on a very busy day. Really seemed to love his job!

First time in Cape Town, wonderful and educational tour. I booked my tour in advance which I highly recommend since this tour company is popular among visiting travelers. I took the tour last week of April (winter season). Our tour guide was with Rene who is a local Cape Town'er, born and raised so she is very knowledgeable of the city, country and its political history. She arrived on time as she is well organized in starting the tour. FYI the tour bus does not have wifi for those of you who always need to be "connected". IMPORTANT FACT: this tour will take you to areas the "Red Bus tours" will not take you so this is wonderful!! We started on time and was dropped off at the time they promised they would have me back at the pick up area. Rene has a skilled talent for this job and she exceeded my expectations for this tour! I am so glad I booked with Cape Convoy tours! Well worth the time and price!

A must!. I found myself lucky enough to take a trip to South Africa earlier this year. I researched a lot when planning my trip to Cape Town. I found Cape Convoy during my search for a tour guide for a Cape Point tour, and had great reviews. Rob definitely knows his stuff! He's very knowledgeable, and knows just how to maximize your time on the tour. I loved the small tour size, which allowed us to really enjoy the time with the other members of our tour. If you find yourself planning a visit to the beautiful Cape Town area, definitely check out Cape Convoy. A great day to be had. And you will not be disappointed!

excellent choice. I only had one day in Cape Town for tourist activity so I booked a private tour to apportion time and sights for my interests. I had no problem booking a tour before I arrived in Africa. I got information on who would be the guide, confirmation of the time and meeting place. All went smoothly. I was completely satisfied with the experience of the guide, the response of the guide to my interests and time. I wanted to go down the peninsula, see Table Mountain if open, anything else to appreciate Cape Town and the area in one day. It was a fantastic day.

Yes, you should book this tour!. What fun we had! My husband and I did the Peninsula Day Tour (Cape Point, Boulder's Beach) on our first full day in Cape Town for our honeymoon. Our tour guide was Rene. She was so much fun, has a great sense of humor and is very knowledgeable about Cape Town and each spot we traveled. I appreciated her commentary - whether it was joking around with the guests or providing background on points of interest. She is also an excellent driver! It can be difficult to fight traffic or battle some of the roads in Cape Town - she did it like a champ! We saw so much, it's hard to believe the tour was only a day (8:30 to 4:30). Tips: Do the hike from Cape of Good Hope to the Lighthouse at Cape Point. Stretch the legs a bit and get to see some spectacular views. Views from the Lighthouse are wonderful, but this section of the hike is pretty steep. Be prepared. Currency exchange. We made a quick first stop at a shop for a passenger to exchange some currency. They don't charge any fees or commission. If you can wait to exchange money till you arrive, take advantage of this perk. Charge your cameras the night before! Have fun! And ask lots of questions.

One of the best days ever. The scenery was great and Rob was quite funny. Ensure you ask the name for the penguins in latin! Rob might have noticed some strange delaying behaviour from his guests late in the day as a surprise was late being organised. Overall a fantastic experience which we still talk about. I suspect Ron learned something too............

Wonderful tour. Went on the full day cape point tour. Had a wonderful day. Great way to see the cape. Also the Penguins were very cute! Rob is a great guide and kept us all laughing along the way. If visiting Cape Town would recommend this tour.

Loved this tour!. Rob took my wife and I and our 3 kids (ages 5 to 15) on a wonderful day tour of Cape Town. Although there were two other members of our party, Rob managed to modify our group's tour to accommodate kids' interests too. His knowledge of the area and ability to connect with strangers is impressive. Highly recommended!

Great tour, great guide.. I was glad I picked Rob and Cape Convoy. He was very informative about the places we visited and was quite funny along the way. I liked it that he drove us to points of interest and then let us explore the places how we wanted to until it was time to move along to the next. I would highly recommend Rob and Cape Convoy to anyone.

A great tour - Rob is great with kids. We booked a tour with Rob based on trip advisor reviews whilst in the UK and it didn't disappoint. He picked us up at our accommodation in Camps Bay and took us on a day trip to the cheetah outreach place and the wine lands.Rob was full of interesting info about South Africa and Cape Town as we drove around and didn't pressurise us at all for time at our various stops. He even entertained the kids for us at one of the vineyards!! I would highly recommend booking Rob for a tour...he is really interesting and has a genuine passion for showing you the best Cape Town and the area has to offer.

Amazing full day tour!. Had an absolutely wonderful day with our extremely knowledgeable tour guide Ebrahim! The tour was a brilliant way to see all the sites and learn a lot about SA's extremely diverse and interesting history.

Great One day tour ! 很棒的一日遊！. Rob is a very interesting people, during the day tour there's always laughing in the car. And he is a very experienced guide who will tell you the history of Cape Town, where is the best photo spot, also how to avoid being stuck in the traffic jam to Cape Point, we just finished Cape Point before the traffic become busy, which save us more time to visit other place. The most important reason that I would recommend Rob is although me and my wife are not native English speaker, Rob did not leave us alone and only talk to other people from America or England. I would say we had a great time with him. GOOD JOB ROB!Rob是一個非常有趣的人，這個旅程中一直充滿笑聲。另外，他也是一個很有經驗的導遊，會告訴你開普敦的歷史，哪裡是最佳拍照景點，還有如何避開好望角的車潮。我們再開始塞車之前就完成好望角的行程，也給了我們更多時間去拜訪其他景點。我會推薦Rob最重要的理由是， 即使我和妻子都不是以英語為母語，Rob也沒有把我們晾在一邊然後只跟其他美國人或英國人說話。我們和Rob度過了超棒的一天！

Cape Convoy 3/18/16. We had a great time with Rob. He planned the day so we missed the crowds and the clouds. He has a great way with people. Able to work well with disparate personalities. We didn't see any baboons, but lots of penquins. Had lunch at Bertha's in Simon's Town. Food was so-so, but nice location, staff. Sights were beautiful. Our group pic at Chapman's Point was one of the highlights. Highly recommend this tour.

Best tour I have been to.. Booked the whole day Peninsula trip and never felt sorry. Tour was great and offered everything that you could ask for. About Rob - you must meet him and hear his jokes and laugh! Sp funny and comfortable.

Cape point visit. We signed up with the tour based on the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor but have to say that we were quite disappointed with the tour. We were a family of four and there were three others on the tour with us; we were expecting a minivan but it was a MPV that showed up and it was quite cramped for 3 adults to sit in the third row. Manage your expectations guys. Cape point was beautiful though.

Wonderful tour of the Cape. Rob is hilarious and informative. I highly enjoyed this tour even as a solo female traveller! He was awesome at beating the crowds and took us to all the must see locations (Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope sign, penguins). He even made sure I made a 5:30pm pick up at V&A Waterfront. Thanks so much!

No better way to experience Cape Town. My favourite person Rob, is amazing. A funny, energetic, informed, zealous host one could ask for. He brings his personality and allows his guests to share their experiences- it's a unique potpourri when you take a day tour with Cape Convoy Tours.Firstly he was wonderful to accommodate my mum and me, on the tour. He is prompt with replying to his emails.We started early in the morning, and we had a day of leisure and an unforgettable experience.From starting at the perfect time to reaching Cape Point, and missing not only the other tourist crowds but also grey clouds was amazing.The treks to Cape of Good Hope, and then visiting the Ostrich Farms and watching happy little penguins and enjoying a scrumptious meal at Simmons Town and finally finishing off with a drive up to Chapmans peak and a drive to Haut Bay was in my opinion the best way to fall in love with Cape Town.I would in a heart beat recommend Rob and Cape Convoy Tours.

Cape Convoy Cape Tour. I had a fantastic day with Cape Convoy. The tour was well planned and excellently guided by Rene. Her knowledge and sense of humor made this day. I will most likely book a tour again next time, when I bring some friends to the beautiful Cape.

Cape Point & Cape of Good Hope. Rob Salmon certainly provides a full, fun day with his entertaining and informative tour to Cape Point and The Cape of Good Hope. The tour also included a visit to the penguins at Bolders Rock and Simon's Town. Well paced tour and well delivered.

Lived up to its reputation!. Chose this tour because of the TripAdvisor reviews and they were right! Rob is energetic and fun and his friendly manner draws everyone out so you all feel like friends by the end of the tour! (Great for single travelers). The best part is how he customizes the drive to get to places in the best conditions - depending on where the crowds are (not yet) and how the weather looks. Did the 1 day Cape Point tour, saw ostriches, baboons, and loads of penguins. Rob knows a ton of local lore and don't forget to ask him how to deal with an ostrich with red legs. Thanks Rob and all it was a great day!

Cape peninsula and wine tour. After much research into day trips from Cape Town I decided that cape convoy was the way forward. We spent 2 days with Joe the guide who I cannot praise enough. The Cape peninsula tour was a well planned and perfectly timed day. Joe was attentive but at the same time not intrusive and his knowledge of the area and the history of the Cape made a fascinating day. I felt quite sorry for joe on the wine tour day as we were a weary bunch that he picked up from the hotel due to one too many on the waterfront the night before. The day again was well planned. We only did 2 vineyards but that was our choice as we wanted more time in stellanbosch and franschoek. Joe was the perfect guide and he tailor-made both days for us still somehow sticking to the timetable that was agreed. Two very enjoyable and fascinating days. Will definitely be using cape convoy again on our return to the Cape.

5* fun, informative, friendly & great value... FAB!. I am unable to add much more to what has previously been said only to fully endorse and support all of the positive reviews for 'Cape Convoy'. I am in CT on business and want to experience as much as possible whilst here - as a solo traveller sometimes the tours can be very ... solo... with everyone keeping to themselves. Turns out, on this particular tour, 5 out of the 7 of us were solo travelers and Rob made sure to make us all feel included and we became firm tour buddies!No doubt Rob has a zest for life that is infectious, is totally in the right job and the tour was a huge highlight of my trip to Cape Town. note: Do not go on this tour if you want to have a *quiet* peaceful day out, or if you don't like participating or making friends with your fellow tour-mates. .. Rob will not let you and you may even find yourself in a great philosophical discussion ;-)

Great Cape Tour!. I took the tour around the Cape of Good Hope. My tour guide wasn't Rob, but was a wonderful guide. Tons of interesting facts, was able to answer questions helpfully, and really mad the tour a joy. 10/10 would take again.

Great day!. What a great company! From the first contact to the actual trip, CapeConvoy was so good! Rob was really nice when planning the tour and on the day Renee made it an amazing day. She planned the route so we would not have to wait anywhere too and told us loads of interesting stories. Fun, informative day for great value. If you are looking for someone to give you a highlight on your trip, don't look any further! Thank you so much!

Friendly and knowledgeable tour guide!. We did a full day tour with Rene and she was very friendly, knowledgeable and talkative. The vehicle was comfortable with plenty of room for luggage and 6 guests in total. We started at 8am taking a drive through Clifton to Camps Bay, and then to Haut Bay where we stopped at a local market to browse trader stalls and buy souvenirs. Rene explained much about the areas we passed through along the way and was able to answer all of our questions. We then headed out to the Cape of Good Hope and after quite a long drive via Chapmans Peak (fantastic views) we arrived; those who wanted to walk from the lower car park could do so, and those who preferred to be driven to the top stayed in the car. We opted to walk and explored the stunning coastline at our leisure, which was well worth it as the photo opportunities were epic! We walked all the way from the lower car park to the lighthouse at the very top, which took around 1hr 15mins. We then headed for the African penguin colony at Seaforth (Boulders Beach) near Simon's Town and also stopped for a late lunch at the Seaforth restaurant where a few beers and some local fish and chips went down very well! All admission prices to the various parks were included in the tour and overall it was a great day out which really improved our Cape Town experience! Highly recommend this tour to anyone.

A trip to remember. Rob Salmon is a highly educated/informed guide to the history and geography of Cape Town and the surrounding areas. Unquestionably the finest guide we have had the good fortune to meet/hire. We traveled with his assistance for 3 joyous and instructional days through Cape Town and the Cape of Good Hope. He is friendly, honest and thoughtful.We recommend and commend him in the highest regards.

Excellent wine tour of Stellenbosch!. Rob was well organised from the get-go allowing us to book a tour well over a month in advance. He contacted me the day before explaining pick-up time from our Newlands hotel. It was a full day private tour of 4 for 850ZAR pp. Great value!The driver, Ebrahim, was fantastic. He got us from winery to winery in a safe and prompt manner as well as giving us a bit of a back story on Stellenbosch and the surrounding areas. The whole day was custom built for our wants and needs, there was no strict time limit at any of the wineries which was great.We started off by going to some of the bigger estates (Ernie Els, Waterford) and then stopped by some of the smaller ones (Dornier, J.C. LeRoux, Peter Falke). Nearly all the tastings were included in the price. Ebrahim was very accommodating even when we had a little too much wine toward the end of the day! The wineries themselves were beautiful, serine and all had very different character. Needless to say, the wine was so good we came home with 10 bottles! Cannot recommend Cape Convoy Tours enough - facilitated a truly brilliant day.

Insightful and unmissable. Hard to add much to what's been said before but Rob truly is a fantastic guide and more than that he is just a wonderful guy to spend a day with. As a quiet person, I worried in advance that I might find him too chatty/full on but I couldn't have been more wrong. The whole day was filled with genuinely funny and open chats about every topic imaginable. Insightful and unmissable

Wonderful tour of Cape Town. My daughter, myself and a friend did the Cape Convoy Tour with a lovely guide called "Serena". Due to mishap with our flight Serena came to collect us from our guesthouse and we took the tour with three other people. We found Serena to be an excellent tour guide and found her knowledge about all the sights we visited very interesting. Seeing as it was our first day in Cape Town the tour gave us a wonderful oversight as to the geography of the city and we truly felt that we had seen all the major sights from Cape Town to the Cape of Good Hope. We started the tour at the Rhodes Memorial with coffee which set us up for the day. The sun shone when we visited the penguins at Boulders Beach (we had delicious ice-cream bought from a lady selling ice creams in her garden!). Loved the beach huts at Muizenberg, Chapmans Peak Drive and all the other wonderful locations. The trek at the Cape of Good Hope was quite exhilarating as it was a very windy day! Good value for money a great tour!

Great All Day Cape Town Tour. Cape Convoy Tours All Day Cape Town Tour was great. Rene, our tour guide, was cheerful, knowledgeable, friendly, professional, fun, accommodating and made sure we had a day we would remember. Working with Rob to set up the tour was easy. Highly recommend this tour group.

Cape day trip. What an awesome day. Fantastic organisation, Rob is the best tour guide I ever had and we saw places I would never have been to without his incredible geographical knowledge. Learned a lot about this country too! Keep being a legend Mr Rob - you are defo NOT boring :-)!!!

Fantastic full-on day out. Great day with Rob touring the Cape Peninsula. You get a very personal service - Rob tailors the day around the weather conditions and to avoid the masses of Chinese tourists so we got to see everything and largely avoided the crowds of other tourists. I would recommend Rob's tours to anyone.

Excellent day out. We met up with Rob at around 8.15 and he then structured our day to make the very most of the sights and sites we were visiting - so that we didn't arrive with the crowds wherever possible. It was a fairly comprehensive tour of the main things to see and Rob was an excellent guide - full of knowledge, humour and anecdotes. We saw penguins, the Cape lighthouse, the actual Cape of Good Hope, drove Chapman's Peak, watched windsurfers in fantastic surf, ostriches, seals. We had a fantastic day

Glorious Garden Route!!!. The 5 day 4 night Garden Route tour was an absolute blast!!! Rob, our amazing tour guide, showed us all the hidden treasures the garden route had to offer. Even when Lucy, our bus, got injured he still found a way to make this trip unforgettable. He is constantly thinking of ways to make the trip better and his flexibility is unparalleled. You honestly get a better experience with a smaller tour company than you do with a large one. What ever we wanted to go see or do Rob lead the way. You will not be disappointed in any of Cape Convoy's tours!

Highlflying by cable. Really enjoyed this outing. Suggest that you try and avoid windy days as it can be very chilly...unless you do this in mid summer. The trip to the top is very bumpy, beware if you have back issues. The guides we had were great and made the experience more enjoyable. Safety is well taken care of. The hike back to the pickup point can be tough if you aren't fit. Otherwise a great experience and the panorama is breathtaking.

Cape Day Tour. What an incredible day! I took a day Cape tour with Rob and absolutely had a ball. Rob was prompt, a TON of fun and made an effort to ensure we were able to see everything without the crowds. It's a beautiful tour where you have plenty of time to take in the views and really enjoy the scenery. A great break for lunch and a bit of shopping and tons of history, tips, and local info from Rob. I couldn't recommend his tour any more!!

Rob, you're right: It's the best day tour in the world!. We had a fantastic day with Cape Convoy on the Cape Peninsula. Rob is engaging, passionate, very well informed, and has infectious enthusiasm. We also had lovely company since we were a small group of just nine. Rob got us out of our hotels early so we could beat the tour bus hordes, and it was well worth it – we even made impromptu stops at the Rhodes Memorial and an ostrich farm. Rob kept the tour relaxed and flexible, while making sure that we got to see everything the stunning Cape Peninsula has to offer. So he’s right, it’s the “best day tour in the world!”
Rob you are so much fun. We loved our day with Rob, Rob know how to travel and have fun , what a perfect way to see the Cape and the peninsula , great energy and company , cant recommend him enough

Don't bother with anyone else!!. I couldn't decide what I wanted to do with our limited time in Cape Town but after a few emails with Bob, I booked us onto the Cape Point day trip. It was fantastic! Bob is very knowledgeable about the area (and has loads of random facts too!!!)One thing, Bob will arrange to pick you up about 730 - don't moan about getting up so early on your holiday!! This guy knows what he's doing and to get to the Cape Point sign when there's no-one else there is well worth the early alarm call!! All in all a fantastic day!!

January 2016 Cape Tour. Really fun tour - Rob got us out early to beat the crowds at Cape point so we got the place to ourselves and thus some fab photos. Otherwise Rob is knowledgeable and fun guide. I'd recommend Cape Convoy for your trip to the Cape.

Brilliantly constructed full day trip.. Five of us did the full day Cape Point tour with Rob.We went on 29th December. This is a very, very busy time of year in Cape Town. Rob structured the tour brilliantly. We avoided all the queues and crowds. Sure it was an early start (7.30am) but the day flew by.Cape Of Good Hope, Cape Point lighthouse, Boulders Beach, Simons Town, Chapmans Peak Drive, they are all covered on this tour. Rob even booked us a table for lunch in Simons Town.The group was small. Eight people in total. None of that coach party nonsense.If you are in Cape Town (and if you haven't been then I suggest you should) I cannot recommend Rob and Cape Convoy tours highly enough.A brilliant, unforgettable day.

Perfect Day Trip with Rob :). Nothing came close to the amazing day Rob gave us. We will never forget it.
Stay well & Many many thanks.
Best Regards,
Ashish & Remya - The Right INDIANS :-)
Toured - 28th December 2015.

great Peninsula tour with Rob!. My husband and I booked a private full day peninsula tour with Rob, and it was definitely a highlight of our two weeks in South Africa. We went on December 23rd, and while Rob's highly recommended start time of 7:30 was early for us, it was totally worth it in order to avoid the holiday crowds at all of the popular spots. We had perfect weather for the day, and were able to see all the main sites including Boulders Beach, Cape Point, Chapman's Peak drive, etc. He also arranged a lovely lunch spot for us in Simons Town. He knew all of the spots to hit, took some great photos for us, and we always managed to leave the sites right when the lines of cars and people trying to get in would build up. Thanks Rob for a wonderful day touring the beautiful cape peninsula!

On Point Rob!. My best friend and I spent a day with Rob and company in early December, 2015, on his day tour of the Cape, and I have to say, his ability to pull up points of interest, tell stories, make us laugh, and provide a laid-back day all combined to make this one of the best tours I've been on. I suggest getting in on this action--it's a great way to spend a day and see the famous sign at the Cape of Good Hope, do some hiking on Cape Point, and wave to the penguins...he also gives you a chance to have a leisurely lunch (fish and chips!), and make it back to the city with plenty of time to nap, have a drink, and make it out for dinner. I will recommend Rob to anyone I know going to Cape Town. Enjoy your trip!

Rob made me a believer in tour guides!. I am mostly a do-it-yourselfer when it comes to travel, but Rob's tour video convinced me that penguins wouldn't be nearly as fun without Cape Convoy leading the way. His hilarious website video didn't do justice to the great experience we had with Cape Convoy. In addition to being a fun tour guide, I was so impressed with how knowledgeable he is about countless topics. It made for a really interesting and educational tour. We feel so lucky that we had such a great experience with Rob and Cape Convoy. Thanks for the great day of laughter and learning, Rob!

Cape Point with Rob. Before we left UK were looking for a tour of Cape Point from Cape Town and having looked through various reviews decided on Cape Convoy Tours and could not have been more delighted. Spent a full day with Rob and his never ending stories, some of which I will need to verify on Google , and visited some wonderful sights, the most memorable for us being the penguins at Boulders Beach. Thanks again Rob, £45 each well spent.

tour to visit cape of good hope. We were 6 people in a mini van, our driver/guide Rob was super funny, knowledgable, prompt, courteous,and we really enjoyed our visit, partly because location is so historic, but mainly because of him.I would highly recommend this company.

You get it all with Rob on Cape Convoy Tours!!. Book your tour with Cape Convoy with Rob. He is fabulous! Watch his videos-you roll over laughing! We were in Cape Town In September 2015 and arranged a private day tour of Cape Town Peninsula for the four of us. Rob arrived on time, organized and ready to go! We started from Cape Grace Hotel (a lovely place to stay, but that's a different review). He had a plan so all we had to do was relax and enjoy the sights. Rob is very entertaining and informed about everything. Knows the history and current topics. He is fun, quirky and makes sure you are having a good day. Do-Not-Miss-Your-Opportunity-To-Tour-With-Rob!! As he says…it’s not brain surgery, it’s just a day trip! Sign up!

You won't go wrong with them!. We book a tour and had a day out with Joe and 2 other couples. Joe was fun and we enjoyed his sharing for the whole trip! He was hospitable and made us feel very comfortable. No pressures, fuzz free. Good!

Lots of fun with Rob . We spent a day with Rob in November visiting Cape Point, boulders beach and chapmans peak amongst other sites. The day is definitely to be recommended as Rob keeps it fun and makes sure you get to see everything. Rob made sure that the schedule was organised so that we avoided the traffic (there were roadworks on the main route) and saw Cape Point when the weather was at its best (it was a mixed day of weather so he planned around that) and the least crowded (since we set off early to avoid the main crowds). Well done Rob.

Highly recommended. This private excursion with Cape Convoy was one of my most looked forward to tour, and also my most worried tour.I look forward to this because I want to be the Southern point of Africa continent.  The most worried because this tour is a full day tour, 8-9 hours, and we are required to be back to the ship by 3pm for departure immigration procedures.  To enjoy this tour fully, one needs 8 hours or more. No one really wants to tour all day while worrying about missing the ship.I was ready to cancel the tour, because of this anxiety.  I figure we will meet the tour guide, and decide.I am glad I did!Robert, of Cape Convoy was sick and in bed.  He has his trusted colleague, Joe, to help him out.  After talking to Joe, I immediately felt comforted, and relaxed.  My group felt the same.  My husband, my mom, and friend, Charlene.  We knew we did not have to cancel this much-anticipated excursion.  I felt we were in good hands.  Joe was very understanding, and he assured us we would not have any problem being back in time, especially when we start at 7:30am.  (He had been hanging around since 7am)Joe was informative, patient, and responsive to our inquisitive personalities.  He answered all our questions.  He provided lots of information, and his perspectives, without being "political".His vehicle was spacious 7-seater Benz vehicle.  Comfortable and very clean.  It is a vehicle easy to get off and onto.  My mom, with arthritis knee, was able to get on and off with no problem.I like to mention a few incidents to illustrate Joe's attention to details and how he has our best interest at heart:The first and foremost was to assure us we will be back on time.  And he reconfirmed along the way.  He knew the order of the attractions, for our benefit.  We reached all the prime locations ahead of big crowds.  We had the penguin conservation, all to ourselves.  No problem taking pictures, and or videos.  No other tourist in the way.  Cape Point, My main focus.  and the momentous picture.  He took the time to take pictures of just us, despite of other tourists zooming in on him, all wanted to have pictures taken behind the famous marker signage.  He kindly asked others to wait for him to finish taking a few pictures of us.   As a result, we had wonderful pictures.  And amazing memory. As mentioned, along the way, he kept us abreast of our next stops and our timing.  "We are making good time.  Ahead of schedule."  He plans his route and the timing of his stops, by gagging our status and our feelings.  He promised we should be back to the terminal by 1pm.  That worked for us better than anticipated.Our safety.  There was a section of coastal drive where the tour usually includes.  Because of recent fire of hundreds of homes in shacks, and resulting unrest in a neighborhood, he did not feel it was safe driving through that section of the tour.  Also, at a stop, my mom did not want to get off the vehicle, he then stayed with mom, and the vehicle, while the rest of us roam around to capture the magnificent scenery.  He not only made us feel very safe, but also was vigilant in keeping us safe.We were back in the city before 1pm, he asked again if we want to go for lunch, or somewhere else, since we still have time.  He is paid the same amount regardless, and yet, he made us feel our interest is more important.  We opted to go back to the ship.  He obliged.  At the end of our 6 hour tour, we felt we are old friends. He genuinely love us to come back and visit Cape Town!In summary, I could not imagine the precious experience without Joe. Imagine what we would have missed had we chose to cancel this tour!  Thanks to Joe, my family and I are grateful we got to experience the best of South Africa, and the making of lasting memories.If you are looking for a local "friend" whom you trust to show you the best of South Africa, I highly recommend Cape Convoy, and ask for Joe Worship.  You are ensured that He has your best interest at heart!  We are so glad we did!I also recommend to really enjoy the tour, choose to do this tour when there was no time pressure.

Fantastic Private Full Day Tours in Cape Town Area. Our two private tours with Ebrahim were fantastic! For our Winelands tour, he picked us up on time, chose wineries based on our preference for red or white wine. When Ernie Els Winery was closed for a private function, he quickly chose another great one, Rust en Vrede. We visited three excellent wineries, Rust en Vrede, Waterford Estates, and Anthonij Ruppert—all very different and charming. We could enjoy the wine tastings without worrying about finding the wineries or driving after tasting the various wines. Ebrahim made lunch reservations for us at a lovely restaurant, French Connection Bistro, in Franschhoek. We weren’t rushed at any of our stops and were picked up at a cruise ship and dropped off at our boutique hotel.The second tour was Cape Point tour with Ebrahim arriving at our hotel on time, reviewing our request for places to visit, and customizing our tour to include Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. He wisely recommended that we take a shuttle car (golf cart) tour on a very hot afternoon (95 degrees F) through a hilly landscape at the garden. Ebrahim took us to Chapman’s, Bantry, Camp’s, and Hout Bays, along with Boulders Beach National Park to see the penguins, Simon’s Town, Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. He made every effort to time the visits to minimize the number of large buses at these various venues. Ebrahim scheduled all of our stops within our time frame and made sure we arrived at the airport on time.Private tours are great, because you can work with your guide to customize the itinerary. You are part of a small group with family and/or friends, not on a large, overcrowded bus. We were impressed with Ebrahim’s knowledge of the destinations, ability to plan various site stops to avoid large crowds, and maximize our enjoyment of the tour.
Awesome day with Ebrahim. We had an awesome day touring the point with Ebrahim. Our tour group was only 4 people, so he let us customize the tour for our interests.

Amazing day with Rob!. Rob Salmon ought to be a legend. This man runs an amazing tour of the Cape, and he will MAKE SURE you hit every "must-do" whilst cleverly avoiding the "rush hour" of the hot spots on the Cape. He took a van full of mixed nationality strangers, had us laughing and learning within minutes. And it's not just the sights, Rob just KNOWS everything about the history, the land, the baboons, where to eat, where to walk, the "off the path" places etc. HE IS THE MAN. I would book this tour well in advance, be prepared to have amazing day seeing the most beautiful landscape on the continent, meeting penguins, learning about the history.

Great experience with a personal and knowledgable touch. I recently had the pleasure of joining Cape Convoy on a day-tour along the Cape peninsula with Rob himself at the steering wheel. We were a small group of mixed nationalities (Hungary, Turkey, England, Spain and Denmark) in different ages and Rob knew from experience how to plan the day so that we got the best weather (very changeable locally during the course of the day) and avoided the larger groups to some extent, arriving in busloads. We had adequate time for our stops and walks and Rob was very knowledgeable and gave us a good understanding of South Africa before and now as we were driving along . When it comes to a fun and well-guided tour, it all depends on the guide. No matter which age - as long as you are young at heart and can do a bit of walking - you will have a fantastic day and a unique experience for lifetime. The Cape peninsula is simply stunning and one of South Africa's many gems.

Definite must do!. My husband and I did the Cape Peninsula full day tour with Rob a few weeks ago and can't say enough about Rob, the tour, and just the whole day in general! Rob made sure we saw all of the "must see" attractions (the penguins, the cape of good hope sign, etc), but he also made some "off the beaten path" stops that we would have never seen had we tried to do this trip on our own. On top of offering an awesome tour, Rob himself is just absolutely hilarious! Don't get me wrong, he definitely educated us about the history of SA, current history and events, and just the culture in general, but he also was so energetic and full of jokes. We highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting the area. It is well worth the time and money!!

Rob Salmon is amazing!. Rob Salmon is a bundle of energy and enthusiasm and an ocean of knowledge and humor. His infectious liveliness makes a tour with him a pleasure He is incredibly well informed and ensures that all guests have a great informative tour.

Amazing day!. Wow, what a day we had with Rob and 4 others yesterday doing the full day Cape Tour! It was such fun from start to finish. Rob is a splendid guide, he has just the right mix of local knowledge and personality to make for a great day. We had done a similar trip 6 years previous but Rob brought us to so many other beautiful places this time and managed to miss all the crowds ensuring that we had a fantastic day. Really efficient to deal with by email and picked us up from our hotel very promptly.Don't hesitate to book this tour with Cape Convoy!! You will not regret it!

Rob will make for an unforgettable day!. Rob's thick Essex accent and humour alone make for one memorable and hysterical day! I booked a private tour with my family to the Cape early in our trip, and we were talking about our experience with Rob for the rest of our holiday! I've never been with a tour guide who is so enthusiastic and dedicated to making sure the clients are happy and enjoying themselves. Mission accomplished!

Absolutely Amazing Tour... I loved the penguin!!. I visited Cape Town from the Dominican Republic from October 10th - 17th on business and I only had one day to take advantage of the trip and visit some of landmarks and must-see. I did my research and decided to go with Cape Convoy and their Cape Point day tour and I let me tell you that it was the right call!! First of all we had AMAZING weather on Friday 16th so everything was even MORE beautiful and enjoyable. Add to that the fact that Rob was the best tour guide, always keeping us entertained and informed throughout the whole tour. I was travelling solo and was lucky to be part of a group where I just totally blended in :) ... So much fun! The penguins were adorable (they had baby penguins too!!) and the views mesmerizing from Cape Point and through the whole day. We also saw ostriches with babies, baboons (yikes!) and a whale!As a tip: You should definitely hike up and down Cape Point and then to the Cape of Good hope sign. It is an easy one hike filled with great views!Rob, you are the BEST!

Cape Of Good Hope Tour. Had a brilliant day with Rob on this tour.Myself, my wife and my two 9 year olds embarked on this tour in the morning from our Cape Town Hotel in August 2015.We were lucky with the weather .and had a beautiful day apart from a bit of early morning mist on Chapmans Peak.We set off up to Lion point to look at the brilliant views and then onto some of the bays around the cape.Ron was extremely flexible throughout the whole day and you really felt like you could ask him anything, nothing was too much.We had a beautiful walk along Cape Point and went down to the sign for photos and a bit of time on the beaches.The great thing with this tour was how Rob organised the tour so we saw everything at the most optimal times and we went back to Chapmans Peak later in the day as it was a bit misty when we went through the first time.The kids loved the penguins at Boulders.Rob is an excellent guide, there is no doubt in my mind that the tour was very much enhanced by his flexibility and willingness to enjoy it all as much as we did.Cape Town and the Cape offer some of the most stunning accessible scenery on this planet

Be sure to get Rob. We took the full day Cape tour with Rob. He was fantastic. We had a winery tour elsewhere the day before and the difference was night and day in the guide experience. Rob was extremely entertaining and information and did lots of little things to make our day the best it could be. Great time!!!

Great Tour!. Such a fun and informative day trip to the cape peninsula! We booked with Rob based upon all of the great reviews on TripAdvisor and we are so happy we did! Rob has a lot of fun during his tours and he goes above and beyond with making sure you see all of the amazing sights there are to see in one day! We really liked that we had time to explore the cape of good hope and we never felt rushed on the tour. If you are looking for a day tour, book with Rob!

The best day tour ever. I found Cape Convoy tours via Trip Advisor and read many comments about Rob which were saying that the Rob is the best. After reading so many great comments, our expectations were really high. After we finished the tour, me and my wife agreed that this was the one of best days we had in Cape Town. Rob was beyond our expectations.Booking the tour was very easy, In 3-4 emails, we agreed where and how to meet, price etc. It was very quick and clear.On the tour day, We were thinking that the tour may be not so nice because rain was coming and the view can be really bad. When We met with Rob and other people who joined the tour, Rob explained his plan and how he will try to avoid the tourist horde and rainy weather. After some hours we understood what he means and we were really happy that we could avoid both. During the tour he keeps the energy of the group always high. He is a very happy, energetic, and knowledgable guy. The tour take almost 8-9 hours and he was always connected to the group.After the tour me and my wife were so happy. We had great time and saw many beautiful things. If We could go again, we will definitely book a day tour with Rob again.

Book with Cape Convoy!. STOP, I repeat, STOP looking at other tour companies. Cape Convoy is a must! If you can, request a tour with Rob. He is a fantastic guide and an even better person. We really enjoyed our tour with him and seeing all of the Cape Town highlights. He is sooo informative and funny! He had us cracking up the whole time. If we are in Cape Town again, we will definitely book a tour with him. No need to read any other reviews of other tour companies. Book Cape Convoy now. I promise you will not regret it. Thanks Rob! We had a fantastic time and really enjoyed getting to know you.

Rob: Going above and beyond!. Booked a Daytour around the Cape with Rob via email for 10/7/15. Rob modified the trip by adding a wineyard stop at the end of the trip. He was very easygoing, entertaining, educating with a lot of facts about the place and history! He is so modest and at the same time spectacular! Very funny indeed. he took us to usual traditional places like cape point but also breathtaking bays and seasides that no one besides us standing. He has energy and stamina that never lasts! From 8:30 till 5:30 it was nonstop fun! When I come back to Cape I am sure to call him in advance and book tours.Thanks again Rob for a spectacular day!
Tip Top Tour. Top bloke, top knowledge, top tour, top day out. If you want to see the Cape in all its beauty then Rob is the man to show you. You’ll also have a good laugh along the way.

Amazing Tour and Guide. The tour itself was amazing, we got a break in the weather and had a great day for Cape Point and going to see the penguins. What really made the tour stand out was Rob though, we'd just flown in the night before and had barely any sleep after a 40 hour travel day yet he managed to keep us awake and entertained lol. I know I'm repeating what hundreds of others have said but it's true he's phenomenal; interesting, funny, well rounded just fantastic.

BEST TOUR EVER!. I booked my tour because of the awesome reviews and am sooooo glad I did!!!! THIS IS AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE!! My husband and I went on the Cape tour. I have been on many tours and this was by far the best. Rob is so funny, warm, accommodating, and genuine. He works very hard to give every person a fantastic experience. His ability to get people to talk together creates a wonderful experience. He knows the area so well and is able to give you the best experience possible for whatever day you are visiting. There are A LOT of amazing things to see in one day, but Rob manages to get you to all of them. And somehow manages to do this without making anyone feel rushed and allowing for some extra time when someone is especially interested (or a family of ostriches with their chicks happen by).Can I mention that this tour was less than the "discounted" tour provided by my package? I think it was a bargain for twice the price - honestly! I laughed all day, and Rob somehow managed to help all these strangers make a connection.Thanks Rob, if my husband and I weren't clear enough. You brought us memories for a lifetime. Oh yes, book early, I was lucky enough to get in on a last minute basis, but I would book way in advance in the future so as to not miss out on the fun.

Rob was great, made for a top notch day.. We may have lucked out on the day, with great weather , but it would have been a great day no matter what as Rob was extremely knowledgeable , upbeat and a super tour guide. Travelled with my wife and two twenty plus daughters, and Rob connected well with everyone. From one Rob to another , thanks for a terrific tour.

Awesome Tour of Cape Point. After reading the reviews on the internet of Cape Convoy Tours, I contacted Rob and booked two tours with him, the Cape Point Tour and Winelands Tours. Rob was our tour guide for the Cape Point Tour and Joe took us to the Winelands. Both I must say were fantastic! Rob is an outgoing, fun loving person who will make your tour memorable. He is very knowledgable about the area, politics and the people of South Africa. After collecting us at our hotel we proceeded to Cape Point, to miss the tour buses and mass of tourists. We were fortunate to see baboons, an ostrich, and penguins during the day. The weather was beautiful and we were able to get out of the car for photo ops of the breath taking coastline. It was a fun, action packed day and one that I will always remember!

Organised, friendly, informative and professional.. Booked the trip over the Internet prior to arriving in Cape Town. Communication from Rob was excellent. I was in no doubt as to what the plans were. Rob kept me informed as to the timings and who would be conducting the tour. Bianca was our guide for the day. Lovely girl who arrived punctually and was a fountain of knowledge thoughout the tour. The day was filled with numerous different things to see and experience but conducted in a very relaxed way. We didn't feel rushed. The small group experience was just what we wanted. Great job guys. If any readers are considering a trip this company is a must do.

Awesome day. Im not one for tours i like to do things in my own time. After reading all the amazing reviews with Rob's cape point tour i had to give it a go. Infact after watching his video on his website i was looking forward to it. By God he did not disappoint. He met us on time in our hotel reception from the second we met him it was like seeing a long lost friend. The day was a misrable day in August and after the other family had cancelled he asked us if we still wanted to go because of the weather we still went. I cant tell you how cold it was so wrap up warm for this trip. He even lent my mum a beanie it was that cold. He is full of knowledge and humour i didnt want the day to end. My word of advice is if you dont want to have a laugh as well as being informed then book with someone else. At the Cape of good hope he made sure we beat the rush of bus loads of tourist's to ensure we got a photo (the one everyone wants). It was worth the money and he tailor makes the tour to suit everyone. Thank you so much for a great day out Rob your an amazing guy.Emma and Liz from Cheshire.

A Tour of the Cape with a Mate!. I had booked Cape Convoy Tours based on the many reviews here on TripAdvisors. I took my parents to celebrate their 40th wedding anniversary and one of the things my mom wanted to see we're the Penguins, one of her favorite animals. I booked the Cape Point day tour and after a couple of emails, we were all set to enjoy the tour a week later.I didn't have a mobile number while in Cape Town, but had mobile wifi access to easily check email and know we would be picked up late near our property rental.Follow the majority of the advice and take a fun tour that feels like you're hanging out with one of your mates down at the pub and listen to him give his view on the many changes going on in South Africa as you enjoy the scenery. I definitely learned a lot and got an insight on his view of the history and social psyche in the country.Our tour took us above to get a beautiful aerial view of Muizenberg Beach. Next we passed through Kalk Bay and learned a bit of history that it was initially settled by Filipinos who also built small Catholic churches before they left. The many highlights of our tour included: the Jackass Penguin colony at Boulder’s Beach, the hike up to Cape Point, the picture ops at Cape of Good Hope, an interesting meeting with 2 male and 2 female ostriches, and the many scenic and picturesque stops along the way.Heed the advice of fellow TripAdvisor members and book a tour with Rob!And yes, Texas is bigger than France!!!

Awesome Cape Peninsula tour with Rob. Rob is funny, energetic, organized, knowledgeable and entertaining. He knows the ins and outs of getting a group past crowds. We had so much fun with him, seeing the sites and being treated so well. He took us to beautiful spots, avoiding crowds, and knew the best places to take pictures for us. He also made sure to keep us safe from unpredictable animals. With joy and enthusiasm he showed us part of his country, and we even got to meet his kids when they happened upon us at a stop. I would go on another tour with him any time, any place.
must do. Rob was amazing. It is a small group, only 6 of us. Rob was knowledgeable and willing to make the tour custom to your wants and needs. If you have a chance this is a must do tour!!

Brings Cape Town to Life!. My wife and I took one of Rob's tours to try to see a lot of the surrounding area in just a day and it immensely surpassed our expectations. He took us to beautiful places, knew all the local tips and tricks to avoid sitting in long lines or competing for elbow room. We naturally progressed around town and the coast and he told us fact after fact and joke after joke. I literally cannot imagine a better tour. Book with Rob, everything else is a mistake by comparison.

Great day!. We took the tour with Cape Convoy with our 4 year old daughter. The day was filled with adventure and we really enjoyed our guide, Rob, who was very friendly and accommodating to us. Would recommend for sure to see a lot in a short period of time.

Redemption!!. Sitting in reception awaiting pick up for Cape point tour, and no show by them, phone call followed and rob had made muck up with my booking, and had us down for next day for some reason,which we could not go on as booked for following two days shark diving, so rob promised to make it up to us and booked us on a private tour three days later, and included table mountain and abseiling for my son , that morning Ebrahim,our tour guide for the day picked us up bang on time and took us up to table mountain, we went up in cable car and got my sons abseiling sorted out, while he did that Ebrahim and I went for a coffee, and he asked what I wanted to see and where I wanted to go to Taylor the tour for us, after a while my son appeared back,so we had a look round table mountain , all the time our Ebrahim explaining things to us, history,pointing out land marks etc. so back down mountain we went to start Cape point tour, after going through some spectacular scenery, we stopped at Hout Bay, we had walk round harbour into fish shop then along to fishing boats, I'm a fisherman and found this really interesting, we stopped and spoke to a local skipper for about an hour, something I could never have done on shared tour, we the went to the Cape and arrived to a glorious sunny day, and before the big rush of tourists as promised earlier, we then went to ostrich farm, and proceeded to false bay side, into Simons town then the Penguins at boulders beach, after that I got him to take us to Kalk bay, for anther fishing harbour tour, I was in my element, found another skipper an another hour passed, he then showed us long beach and muzienburg beach, at no point thru the day did we feel rushed,or did we go anywhere we didn't really want to go, so all in all rob,you really did redeem yourself,and in Ebrahim,you gave us a stocking good guide, very funny and informative, we both loved our day with cape convoy, I will be returning with my wife, so will look you up again!

Great tour by Rob, a great guide. I took the Cape Point tour with Rob. He is an excellent guide and fun to travel with. The weather was great and he added a stop at the Rhodes Memorial before we headed south to Simonstown. We had plenty of time to explore at Cape Point and experienced the incredible views of the coastline on the return up the Atlantic side of the peninsula. It was a great day out. Rob made sure everyone had their picture taken at the Cape of Good Hope sign.

Rob The Oracle - Genuine Guy, Excellent Customer Focus & Service!. You can't go wrong with Rob as a tour guide; he's knowledgeable, entertaining and definitely `seeks to please'. We booked the Cape Point Tour with Rob and very much enjoyed the day. Rob was very conscious of planning the tour around the weather to get the best out of the excursion, which was always going to be difficult on a SA winter's day. His execution was perfect ensuring we arrived at The Cape when the sun was at its brightest and the sky virtually cloud-free. On route we stopped at a number of Rob's suggested viewing points, all of which contributed to some great photo opportunities. Rob has hints and tips for everything such as how to navigate the Cape of Good Hope sign in and out like a military operation avoiding the `coach crowds', the best route to see the penguins and their chicks, good photo spots, nice locations for coffee breaks, etc. Throughout the trip he kept us entertained with trivia, anecdotes, stories of his upbringing (providing an interesting understanding of Afrikaan culture), jokes and much more; my wife and daughter had the giggles throughout the day! Due to serious roadworks Rob had to forgo an element of the tour but he not only graciously offered to reimburse us for the change in itinerary (which I was more than happy to give back as a tip) but went out of his way to make-up for something that was clearly out of his control. This truly demonstrated Rob's commitment to customer service and it's not difficult to see why Rob gets such good reviews. Rob was originally from the UK and I wasn't sure his humor would translate with the other 5 USA guests on the tour but they absolutely warmed to him demonstrating his international appeal. He mentioned that later in life he completed a history degree and his knowledge of the spots we visited was clearly evident; he's a walking history book and you won't be disappointed. He also plays to his audience and works hard to ensure he treats everyone with respect, courtesy and friendliness. I don't think you can go wrong with Rob and suggest you book him early. Rob gets the thumbs up from us! Thanks for a great day Rob, all the best if you are reading this - Sally, Dave & Jessica.

Rob the Great!. I'm still in Cape Town and had to set aside a few minutes on my vacation just to submit a review for Rob. He is by far the best tour guide that I've ever had. Great conversation, great book suggestions, great pictures, great suggestions for things to do on other days, great city, just overall great! Book him on your first day to get your vacation kicked off perfectly. Btw, Cape Town is just wonderful and I hope to one day retire here.

The best tour guide ever!!!. We did the cape peninsula one day tour with Rob. If you want to have a fun day you have to go with Rob! He is not just a tour guide doing his job, he is genuinely enthusiastic and excited about the places we visited as if it was his first time too, what a great ambassador of Cape Town, He treated everyone with respect and kindness. Dealing with him is like dealing with a friend, you can have complete trust in him.

Rob's great. Rob took my wife and I together with our twin girls aged 17 on a day's trip and we all thoroughly enjoyed the tour which was tailor made to what we wanted. Rob is entertaining, personable and knowledgeable. We couldn't have booked a better tour - thanks Rob.

Fabulous tour. There is a reason almost all the reviews of Cape Convoy are excellent. We had a fabulous day - Rob was a first rate host and guide. His enthusiasm, sense of humor, handling of logistics..were all excellent. I particularly liked that we had enough time at each site to explore a bit independently - and yet we also we able to see so much in one day. This day was one of the highlights of our stay in Cape Town. Thanks, Rob!

Awesome tour. We went on the Cape point tour with Rob. We had very changeable weather and Rob amended his schedule to make sure we had good weather for the more active parts. He knew a lot about the area and gave us interesting facts without being scripted or boring!Rob was very personable, he seemed genuinely interested in everyone, asking where we were from and what we did for a living etc.In the end this was our best day in Cape Town, thanks Rob for making it such a great day!

Fun & Knowledgeable. We booked two tours with Rob about a month in advance, largely based on Trip Advisor reviews. Our first was for the wine country. As Rob's tour was full, he referred this to another tour guide who proved to be terrific. The following day we spent with Rob to tour the peninsula including Cape Point and Boundary Bay. As it was Saturday, Rob planned the route and timing to avoid the crowds. We arrived early at Cape Point while there was still relatively few people which added to the experience. Rob was very knowledgeable, helpful, and personable. Highly recommended for Cape Town area touring.

The Cape of Good Humor. Because of his many favorable reviews, I had high expectations for Rob's all-day tour of the Cape Peninsula, and he did not disappoint. His vast knowledge and frequent quips informed and entertained us.He also provided information about the people and country that exceeded what I would have expected from such a tour. I just wish we had time to climb atop the Cape of Good Hope. Maybe next time.

Love Rob's Energy!. We booked Rob almost a year in advance to make certain we had him personally as our Cape Point tour guide. About 2 weeks before our tour, we received an email inquiring if we could move our day. We had a pretty tight schedule, but were able to switch our Monday and Wednesday tours around. Rob took care of everything to allow a smooth transition. He even got our Robben Island tickets exchanged, which I’m sure was no easy task.Rob arrived a bit early to start our Cape Point tour on a rainy day. However, he kept a positive attitude about the rain. He planned to alter our day as we went along, dependent on the weather. Obviously, Rob has done this trip many times and is quite familiar with the changing patterns. On the way to Cape Point, he informed us about the city and of course added in some humor as well as his outlook on life and society – which we totally enjoyed. Rob is a ball of energy! We saw some beautiful sites like St. James Bay and several other beaches. We had a break in the storm at the appropriate time, so he took us to see the penguins at Boulders beach first, which were adorable. Since it was so cold, he lent my mom his beanie!By then, it had started clearing up just like Rob predicted, so we headed off to Cape Point. Rob wanted us to get our funicular tickets before the tour buses arrived to save time – which we did. He told us where to go and what we might want to see and waited in the parking lot for us to return at our leisure. We were able to enjoy Cape Point’s amazing views with little rain.Next, Rob took us to the Cape of Good Hope. It was a little crowded but we managed to get a good picture with the sign despite the tour buses there. Rob then drove us to a more secluded area where we could enjoy the ocean. He waited in the van while we explored on our own.On the way to lunch, Rob stopped at a roadside stand for my dad to purchase a painted ostrich egg. Rob stayed with us while we negotiated a price to make certain we both reached a fair deal. While we were having lunch at Bertha’s in Simon’s Town, Rob received good news that the previously closed Chapman’s Peak drive was now open. We all really enjoyed this scenic drive, and Rob kept us entertained the whole way! We drove through Camp’s Bay on the way back to our B & B. It seemed a little rushed when we were dropped off, but we covered everything on our itinerary. The bad news is my dad forgot to get a family picture with Rob. Even though we didn’t get our picture, the tour memories will last a lifetime. Our day with Rob was filled with laughs and great sightseeing. His bubbly personality makes his tours unique and unforgettable.

Top tour for Cape Town!. This tour really does deliver 100% satisfaction. We were so pleased we had booked with Rob in advance and he was so helpful via email giving advice etc. Rob taught us so much on the day during the trip in a manner that was never boring or scripted. He is flexible and listens to people's requests if they want to stop and check something out. By the end of the day we felt like we all knew each other and had a laugh too. Thankyou Rob for a memorable trip,well organised,informative and mostly fun!

Cape Convoy = good times. Just traveled with Rob yesterday. Wonderful experience shared by everyone on the trip. Rob is both knowledgeable and engaging. The trip pace was very efficient without being rushed. Rob went out of his way to accommodate passenger requests. Can't give a higher recommendation.
