A lot of Fun and Very Informative.... Our family of four adults booked the tour with Rob from the United States. Everything went very well. There was good communication beforehand and he arrived to pick us up on time as scheduled. The weather was a bit dicey (scattered rain) - Rob's knowledge of the area helped us to enjoy the entire tour regardless of the weather and we spent 95% of the time outdoors rain-free. (Winter Trip)We saw beautiful views of the Cape of Good Hope and the surrounding areas. There were Monkeys and Ostriches up close. The tour included Boulders Beach where South African Penguins reside.Rob is an excellent ambassador for South Africa and if there is ever an unpredictable issue, he always has a "plan B" that is equally as fun. The original Winery where we intended to go was unexpectedly closed, the alternate winery we arrived at was Top Notch - 100%.If you love to relax, have fun and enjoy learning something about the country you are visiting, Rob is your man...Thanks Rob!

The best day. Took the Cape Point tour with Joe and was amazed. Not only was the scenery spectacular, but Joe made the day absolutely incredible. He was knowledgable, funny, polite, and extremely helpful with local tips and tricks of the trade. All the places we stopped for pictures were amazing and he even volunteered to be photographer for many shots. Overall it was an incredible day, made even better by Joe as our guide.

Great Tour with Cape Convoy!. This was the first time my wife and I had been to Cape Town and we could not have asked for a better tour or tour guide in Rob. Rob was very knowledgable about Cape Town and South Africa. Rob answered all of our questions! Rob was a great guide that was very accommodating to what we wanted to see and how long we wanted to stay at a particular place. I would recommend Cape Convoy Tours to anyone! Great Trip and tour! Thanks Rob! Hope to see you again soon!

Fun day with new friends!. We visited Cape Town as part of our Honeymoon and had a great day out with Rob! Headed out to the beautiful Cape Point taking in the stunning scenery and beautiful Camps Bay, Hout Bay, Chapmans Peak Drive, Simons Town and Boulders Beach along the way. Rob is full of knowledge, energy and passion throughout the day...and probably has the best job in the world, seeing this everyday! We had a nice small group of 4 only, which was nice as it provided the flexibility of doing whatever we fancied doing without being tied down to being in certain places at set times. Would recommend this for anyone who wants a day full of adult humour, fun and laughter with a bit of history thrown in...if not, just hire a car and do it yourself as it's so simple as you can't really get lost!!

EXCELLENT DAY. Started with great communication with booking. Confirmed on arrival in SA. We were with another couple and a marvelous family. Rob made us all feel comfortable, kept us on track and minded the day to maximize the benefit to all of us. Beautiful sites, fantastic knowledge of local, national and African history. Rob has a true love of S Africa and her people. Cannot recommend enough and feel we had a MAX experience for our day. Rob is so fun with a true servant heart. Thank you Rob!

Great trip with Cape Convey. My family and I (from Virginia, USA) did a tour to the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point with Rob and a private tour to the Wine Lands with Joe. We have very much enjoyed both trips. The trips were well planned, and our needs are well accommodated when possible. Rob is energetic, funny, and very knowledgeable on South Africa’s history (and many other things). I am glad we chose Cape Convoy.

A Guide Who Makes the Difference. My Daughter and Son in Law hired Rob Soloman of Cape Convoy on their trip to South Africa and their raves sent us his way. His trips are wonderful because he is. He doesn't stoop talking, telling wonderful stories and filling us with lots of information and insights about his beautiful country. His vans are comfortable and are perfect if you are traveling with family or even another couple. We highly recommend Cape Convoy tours.

Fantastic!!!. We went on a tour of the peninsula with Rob and I can't say enough good things about the tour! Not only was Rob nice and funny, but he knew a ton about African culture and history and shared it all with us throughout the day. That, plus he has an awesome British accent.Thanks so much for the fabulous memories, Rob!

Fantastic day!. We were three Danish girls at the age of 20 who wanted to see the cape of good hope and Cape Point, and we stumbled across Rob on Google. And we're so happy we did!!! We were visiting Cape Town in low season, which is why we were the only three people on the tour. Rob was phenomenal, we had some great talks (about so much more than just Cape Town, we really got to know each other) and he really made sure we had a great trip, planning according to weather forecasts and only charging us for half a day when it started raining and we didn't get to finish the tour. Our impression was that he went out if his way to plan a great day for us, and it worked. One of the best parts of our trip, and definitely worth the money, even on a tight student-budget. Thank you soMuch Rob! Sofie, Emma and Pernille

Cape Point Tour. Our family of 5 ( 'kids' aged 19, 17 and 11) enjoyed a truly memorable day with Rob touring around Cape Point.Rob was excellent company, enthusiastic, brimming over with information on all aspects of the Cape and South Africa. We opted for a private tour and Rob was spot on in advising us but responding to our preferences.A lot of fun had by all - highly recommended by all of us.

Accommodating in Every Way. I booked Rob/Cape Convoy Tours to take myself, and a team of teenage girls, on a Cape Point Day Tour, on the final full day of our visit to South Africa.Alas, the day turned out to be rainy, windy and miserable. Rob called early in the morning and offered to let us cancel our tour and get a refund. But we said that -- as it was our final day in South Africa, and as the girls had been taking part in a sporting competition all week -- we really wanted to get out of our hotel and see what we could see.So we set off, with a plan to turn back to Cape Town if it looked like we wouldn't be able to see anything at Cape Point. Fortunately, between rain showers, we managed to take in the major attractions: the jackass penguins, climbing to the Cape Point lighthouse, watching some ostriches carouse on the beach and getting our photo taken at Cape of Good Hope sign.During the drive, Rob gave us some interesting perspectives on sport and culture in South Africa. He pointed out to us people whose professions it was to watch out for sharks, and baboons, respectively (who would have thought?) And at each stop Rob let us take as long or as little time as we wished. Then, because we didn't linger very long at any of the sites, and got back to Cape Town early, Rob very generously said that he'd refund a part of what we had paid for the tour since it turned out to be less than a full day.I can't imagine that we would have experienced nearly so much flexibility, and goodwill, from too many other tour operators! Thank you for a memorable day Rob.

Amazing day in cape town. Myself and 4 other colleagues were in cape town for a weekend off of work from jburgh. After a lot of research I reached out to Cape Convoy for the booking, Rob was very responsive throughout the process.We just arrived back from our tour today including cape point, cape of good hope, simons town and penguins wrapping up with a fantastic stop at a winery overlooking the ocean. The entire day was amazing, Rob was filled with great knowledge and facts our group laughed the entire day. We spent the entire day driving around with Rob learned a ton of information about Cape Town and South Africa. Rob's passion for his work, and passion for South Africa made this a truly amazing experience. I can't recommend this tour enough for an outstanding and informative day in Cape Town.

Stunning Scenery with an Energetic Guide. My wife and I spent a terrific day touring the Cape Point with Rob, one of the best tour guides I've had. Rob is friendly and accommodating. He knows a great deal about the history of South Africa as well as the the flora and fauna you'll see on his tour. He brings a great energy and enthusiasm to the tour. Rob responds quickly to email. He also gave us some great ideas for restaurants in Cape Town and sights to see along the Garden Route. You'll see the same sights on any Cape Point tour - the guide makes all the difference.
Superb Cape Point Tour. We had a great full-day tour with Rob. Excellent itinerary - lots of attractions, with lots of variety. We saw so much.And we had fun too. Plenty of laughs!Highly recommended.

Excellent tour with an excellent guide!. My husband and I joined one of Rob's Cape Point day tours. Rob responded very quickly to my email, and he provided all of the information we needed. Despite being an extremely windy day, it was a truly joyful day! Rob is knowledgeable, witty, and clever, and he will regale you with his knowledge of Cape Town, the country's history, and your own country's political climate! We had some fun conversations with Rob! The tour is reasonably and competitively priced, and both the Point and Boulder's Beach are not-to-be-missed stops on your trip. But anyone can drive you to see penguins and the Cape - Rob really is the reason this tour is so special.

Ask my kids: BEST. DAY. EVER.. Thankful to Tripadvisor for helping us find Rob/Cape Convoy. We had the most spectacular day doing the Cape Point tour with Rob. The sights are amazing and Rob couldn't be more fun, entertaining and informative. Many posters in the Cape Town forum suggested renting a car to do the Cape Point day, but I'm SO glad we let Rob do the driving - and it was like having a really smart/informed best friend taking us around. He was wonderful with the kids and kept the pace of the tour just right. Plus his passion, information and history of Cape Town really added to our day. The views, darling little towns and all the animals (penguins!) made this one of our all-time favorite vacation days. We also arranged a private day tour of the wine region with Cape Convoy and Rob chose an amazing guide/driver for us - I'm terrible with names and don't remember, but this was also a wonderful day. The wineries were chosen with the kids in mind and my girls (10 years old) had a fine time too. Couldn't recommend Rob and Cape Convoy more highly.

Awesome tour guide!. My husband and I came to Cape Town as part of our honeymoon and decided to go on a tour with Rob to Cape Point after reading the tripadvisor reviews. We certainly weren't disappointed! Such a lovely and knowledgeable man and there certainly was never a dull moment on the tour! It really felt like Rob was genuinely interested in all of his guests and making sure we all had a good time. Cannot fault his trip at all and worked hard to make sure we got all of the sights in at times which were less busy and when the weather was best. Would recommend his trips to anyone wanting a really good laugh, whilst learning about the local area and seeing some stunning sights! Thanks Rob!

Fun-filled day!. My husband and I went on a day tour to the cape with Rob (the owner), and we had a great time! Rob was top notch- lots of useful information, super friendly, a good driver, and funny as hell. He really makes sure everyone has a great time and gets to see all that the beautiful cape encompasses. I really appreciated that the tours are kept small (I believe there were about 8 of us). The one thing I wish could have been done differently was to have more options for lunch- I understand why we ate where we did (to maximize our time to see lots of great places), but it would have been nice to have a better lunch than a grab-and-go. I would totally do this tour again, and I recommend it without a doubt to anyone looking for a fun and informative trip.

Excellent time!. Robert is a passionate man who loves his job - and it shows in his tours. He picked us up promptly for the tour and showed us an amazing time! He knew all the right stops to get amazing pictures - and knows a ton about the local history. He set us free at Cape Point, giving us directions of where to hike and told us to take our time. We NEVER felt rushed. We asked to stop and watch spear fishers and he of course let us - there was no schedule to keep to - he just wanted us to be happy. And, lucky for us, being low season we were his only guest, so it was essentially a private tour! We had a great time with him. My sister asked about kelp - and the next thing we know he is picking up kelp, stabbing it open with his keys, and showing her the inside. My sister claimed she saw a baboon on an ostrich while we were driving, and he turned around to go investigate. (It wasn't, but we all had a great laugh). Rob is loads of fun. I highly suggest you make this trip with him. You will not regret it!

Awesome Day with Rob. I think Rob planned the weather to be absolutely stunning. Regardless it was made brighter by hanging out with him all day. We booked a private day tour. While we did the main sites it was customized to our speed - never rushed but we squeezed in a trip to kirstenbosch botanical gardens and had ample time to hike around the point. Rob was informative, funny and engaging. My partner and I had a blast and would recommend to all our friends.

Did the Cape Tour with Rob, ended up writing a book..... Our family took a SA tour a few years ago, and the tour of the Cape with Rob was one of the highlights. We even stopped to check out the baboons on the way. Rob was patient and entertaining. My conversation with Rob fed into a book I had thought about writing but never got around to. So it's fair to say, Rob helped make that happen, as I wrote the book soon after we got back- talk about a value-added tour!

Outstanding!!. There are a lot of tour companies that offer one day excursions to the Cape. I would imagine most are good so the basis of choosing this operator was the ratings. There were a lot of 5 star ratings........so much so that one would think the ratings were stacked. NO WAY!Rob is that good........He is entertaining, knowledgeable and, at times to my liking, irreverent. This makes for an enjoyable day if like any of these qualities. The tour is packed with sightseeing including Penguins, the Cape, stops in small seaside towns and spectacular views. He will stop anywhere for a quick photo opportunity, champions the plight of penguins crossing the road and keeps everything light.One quality that doesn't get a lot of attention is trust. I signed up the day before thinking he would not be able to take me. Not only did he "fit me and my wife in" , he asked for no credit card information or any other form of payment. I was thinking he would ask for that prior to starting the tour. No, he did not ask for anything. I had to eventually ask him how to pay at the end of the tour and he said no problem......just give me a credit card number. I can hear the readers now.......shaking in disbelieve that I would do something so stupid.....but trust works both ways. I could give him a false card number; he could charge anything he likes and pass the number over to his buddies. NO.....it was all above board and professional. This is the type of ethics we need and I had to go to South Africa to get it.All I can say is that the total experience was outstanding...Rob, the sights, the knowledge I gained etc, etc,.....By the way, I am an Auditor so trust can be hard to experience!!!!

A Great Way to See The Penninsula. This is a great way to cover a lot of Cape Town in just one day. Rob, the owner and guide, is very knowledgeable and VERY energetic. You'll learn a lot, see a lot, and Rob will keep you awake with his constant jokes. We did the full day Cape Point Tour and, as Rob promised, "had a laugh!" I'd recommend this tour for anyone looking to see the Cape Point in a short amount of time.

Cape of Good Hope!!! Fun all the way down!!. Rob made sure we enjoyed an amazing experience down to Cape of Good Hope. We had our 5-year old daughter also with us, and Rob made sure everyone enjoyed the day, sharing loads of knowledge with us and taking us to all the great spots down the coastline, avoiding traffic and coaches with tourists driving up. This was one of the very best trips we have enjoyed, and I would strongly recommend taking this tour with Rob. You will be guaranteed a fun, relaxed day and get to explore the peninsula. A memorable day, and a definite-must for us again, when we get to Cape Town next time.

A great day out from Cape Town. With only 3 full days in Cape Town, and choosing not to hire a car, we looked for a tour to Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point. We found Cape Convoy and Rob through googling and chose this tour because it offered a full day out, small group tour, great reviews on TripAdvisor, pick up from our hotel (Victoria and Alfred) and included not only our main destination, but also interesting places to stop en route. Rob also responded quickly to my email.Rob has lived locally for some years and has a fund of information about the area. He also made sure everyone on the tour was drawn into the conversation. There were 7 of us in a comfortable vehicle.Thoroughly recommended.

Penguins and the Cape of Good Hope!. Had to take in some of the "obvious" sites, and renting a car was just impossible. Rob to the rescue! We met some amazing fellow travellers, and Rob knew all the best spots to stop for photos. A really top notch experience all around!

Great day exploring the Cape Peninsula with Rob. Thank you Rob for a memorable day exploring the best the Cape Peninsula has to offer on our first trip to South Africa. We enjoyed every minute of the tour. Your positive energy, your passion for South Africa and your abundant knowledge were inspiring. If we ever return to Cape Town, we will most definitely book another trip with you.

Cape Convoy Tours is the Best!. Six of us hired Cape Convoy Tours to visit Stellenbosh Wine Region during our recent trip to South Africa. We made our own itinerary and the driver we hired Ebrahim was fantastic. We set up our tour and itinerary with Rob and he was great to work with! Friendly and responsivie over email - setting up a tour from the US had never been easier. Ebrahim was fantastic. He was prompt, picked us up on time, friendly, a great time keeper, got us where we needed to go and be and made some suggestions on a different winery for the afternoon when we were running out of time. We were with him for the whole day and our trip to 4 different locations worked very well. I would strongly suggest using Cape Convoy Tours and Ebrahim when you visit South Africa. I can't wait to return!!

Fun day out to Cape Point with Cape Convoy Tours. I live in South Africa and on a recent trip to Cape Town, decided to visit Cape Point with Cape Convoy Tours. I loved the fact that I was collected from my private residence and that the group was small. Rob had lots of interesting facts to share with us the whole and was never boring. It was a fun, relaxed tour and I would definitely recommend touring with Rob.

Best way to spend time in Cape Peninsula!. I chose to join Rob/Cape Convoy Tours Cape Peninsula Tour based on the number of very positive reviews on TripAdvisor. It was my first time in Cape Town and I had a very limited time so I needed to make the most of each day!It was such a fantastic tour - Rob knew all the perfect spots for photos. He's more than willing to help you get the perfect picture, and takes you to the less touristy/crowded places so you can enjoy the views without distractions of other tourists! He's well-versed in the history of Cape Town and surrounding area, and makes the history part sounds fun and not boring at all throughout the drive.I never felt rushed and got to enjoy every part of Cape Point with more than enough time and also with knowing the history behind the importance of the various spots we visited. There's never a dull moment during the tour! Rob's outgoing personality helped the group feel more connected, and at the end of the day it felt like you just made 8+ new friends in Cape Town!

Thanks for a special day Rob. We had a short time in Cape Town and wanted a peninsula tour on the day of our 30th wedding anniversary. We chose Rob on the strength of the TripAdvisor feedback and it was a great decision. We had a really enjoyable day which was both great fun and informative. Rob is an entertaining host but he also knows his stuff and made everyone feel at home. He made the absolute most of the time available and was very obliging when it came to the best sightseeing spots and taking photos. He even managed to rustle up some baboons and an ostrich near Cape Point, although the cheetah we suggested next proved to be a bit beyond him! We would recommend him highly to anyone considering a similar tour. Nice to see an Essex boy making good abroad - thanks again Rob

Never a dull moment with Rob!. We owe Rob this terribly belated review and I am glad we are finally down to writing it! We were a couple from Singapore on our honeymoon and did the full day Cape Peninsula Tour with Rob. From the moment he stepped out in his flip flops and berms, you could tell that it was going to be a laid back and relaxing day. I don't think there was a moment of silence ever in the vehicle and Rob could just go on non stop about virtually any topic. It was really enjoyable. Rob's full of energy and spunk and brought us via the best pathways to avoid tourist crowds to see the penguins, and found the best picture spots to avoid "photobombs". He also made sure to stop by various scenic spots and helped us take photos even if it meant he had to climb precarious rocks (by the beach)! And we really appreciated his candour and openness in sharing about his various life experiences and perspectives! We were so entertained throughout I began to suspect that maybe he was on steroids because seriously, how can anyone keep that energy for up for an entire day! Just kidding, Rob :) Go for Cape Convoy! No regrets! :)

An unforgettable day!. We did the full-day Cape Point tour with Rob and it was such a fantastic experience! Rob was so much fun and had all of us laughing the entire trip. The views were absolutely incredible and Rob knew all the best places to pull over for amazing photos. Your really cannot leave Cape Town without doing this tour!!

Feel good, have fun, and learn a lot. We took the all-day Cape Tour. Rob was an awesome guide. Knows all about history, culture, politics, and is not shy to answer questions. He helped our group of 8 fell good, and by coffee break, we all were learning not only about the Cape, but something about each other and respective adventures.

Great day with Rob. We were with Rob in daily Cape Point tour. The places (simon's town, hout bay, cape of good hope...) were awesome and our guide Rob was very friendly, fun and well-informed. I suggest everyone who visits Cape Town to spend 1 day with Cape Convoy & Rob.

Rob is the icing on the cake. We took the full day peninsular tour and it was probably our best day, and there were some great days. Rob called first thing to let us know when he would be arriving, which was a nice touch. I was a little nervous about the lack of an itinerary to begin with, but soon realised that this is how the tour works and means that you get the most from the day. There was virtually no waiting, and we saw everything that we wanted and more than we expected. Rob knows his stuff, his history lessons were brilliant and it was great to feel as though you were learning whilst admiring the scenery.Firstly, we went to Hout Bay along some beautiful roads and met 'Blitz' and his pet seal. As Rob is friendly with Blitz, this was an amazing photo opportunity (and Blitz may let you feed his seal). We visited Simons Town and had a look round and a drink, it's very pretty but there is more to do else where. The penguins are amazing at boulder's beach - we had plenty of time to see lots and take some amazing photos. Cape point was amazing, we had an hour and a half to grab lunch and have a look around. Two Oceans seems a very nice restaurant, but the grab-and-go option is better if you want to see everything. You can still have a beer and drink it as you wait for your fresh pizzas to be cooked. The views were out of this world, and we saw an eland and baboons. We got perfect pictures with The Cape of Good Hope sign, and lots of others - Rob is an amazing photographer and knows exactly where to take them. We popped into the Ostrich farm (another hot topic for Rob). All in all, this was an amazing day, I don't think it would have been as amazing with any other guide. Choose Cape Convoy :)

Outstanding Tour to the Cape with Rob. We had an outstanding tour with Rob from Cape Convoy tours today. We were a group of six in total (2 of us plus another group of 4). Rob's up front communication was perfect. He picked us up on time from our hotel and the mini bus was clean, safe, comfortable and provided great viewing. The tour was absolutely breathtaking! I have traveled the world but today's tour to the Cape provided natural scenery that was unparalleled. Rob had a great way of providing ongoing conversation, jokes and commentary. It was paced very well and really gave a great background on where we were going, the history and current situation. I learned a lot, laughed a lot and the day passed very quickly. Rob has a great knowledge base of Cape Town and the Cape and it really gave everyone a better understanding of South Africa. We always had sufficient time to walk around, shop (only if we wanted) and get a snack. I never felt rushed or even felt like I was on an organized tour. Rob's approach is actually having a local friend of your's show you their country. It worked very well. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone. Great content combined with outstanding natural beauty and a personable and knowledgeable guide. We even had three wild ostriches on the side of the road immediately followed by approximately 20 Baboons on the side of the road on the way back to Cape Town.

Great Cape Convoy Tour. My husband Stuart and I opted to do the full day Peninsula Tour after reading reviews on trip advisor. Rob did not disappoint he was excellent. Rob was knowledgeable about the local area, friendly, flexible, adaptable and extremely personable. He knew how to make the most of the day and we managed to avoid the crowds and tour buses in the process.A great day was had by all. Rob made this one of our favourite days during our stay in Cape Town. Thanks Rob. This is a must do great value for money tour.

Cape Convoy delivers!. We had two days with Cape Convoy. Unfortunately, Rob Salmon, the owner/chief tour guide was ill and he was unable to be with us. However, he had one of his cohorts, Ebrahim, take his place. It worked out just fine. Ebrahim was both knowledgeable and eager to make our two days enjoyable. He is very proud of his country and it showed in his attitude. Our first day was spent working our way around the Cape Peninsula on the Cape Convoy Cape Peninsula Tour. We were just my wife and myself, but we knew that there would be others in the vehicle. Our companions for the day were a group of five young Italian and Nigerian oil geologists and technicians on vacation from Angola. Ebrahim met us on time and we got a good start. We managed to visit all of the places that Rob had originally listed in his packaged itinerary and it was a very full day. The only off-note was that as a twosome together with a fivesome, it became clear early on that we would be outvoted with respect to the rhythm of the tour. Near the end of the day we found that included was a winery tour and tasting that was not on the original agenda and, from our point of view, we could have done without that. We were there to see the culture, not to party. That had also been an issue at lunch which became a two-hour feast/festival – for them. We left some money for our share and left early to walk around the town of Simonstown for a little while. We have had many other tours where we met new people and when it is other couples or threesomes, it is easier for the tour to be a little more democratic in how some issues are resolved. Having said that, however, we do not fault Cape Convoy or Rob or Ebrahim for our slight discomfort. It was what it was and we did not regret taking the tour for one minute.Our second day was a wine tour – the Cape Convey Winelands Tour. We were really hoping to get to some smaller, boutique wineries – based on our past experiences in other wine regions. However, in South Africa it seems that they do things a little differently. The wineries that invite tastings have sunk a lot of money into the grounds and tasting rooms, so they tend to be larger wineries rather than boutiques. Rob had us set up for three wineries – two in the morning and one after lunch. Our companions the second day were a very nice young couple from Brazil and we got along just fine all day.The three wineries were all very nice. Our first stop, at the Ernie Els Winery (yes, that Ernie Els – the golf professional), was the highlight of the day. The other two wineries were just as beautiful, but we much preferred the Els property as the standout. Our second stop was the Waterford Estate Winery. For lunch, Ebrahim had us at a lovely sidewalk café in Franschhoek. After lunch we stopped at the LaMotte Winery.Our bottom line on Cape Convoy is simple – they deliver what they promise. They try to give you a dividend for your tour that you do not expect. Their people are very easy to do business with. We do not hesitate to recommend them.

Best tour company in Cape Town. My husband and I went on the full day peninsula tour of the cape while we were staying in cape town on our honeymoon and it was EXCELLENT! Rob is hysterical and so friendly! We were with 2 other young couples from Englad (one of whom had just gotten engaged) and an older gentleman making it 7 people total on our tour. Rob is so social and outgoing that we truly all became friends throughout the day and had a phenomenal time. My husband and I choose Cape Convoy because we didnt want to be stuck in some huge tour bus with 50 other people and i am SO GLAD we did! Rob brought us around to all the sites, and did it in such a way that we hit virtually no lines the entire day! We would just pull up, hike around, take a bunch of pictures, have a great time and then just as we would be leaving like 20 tour buses would pull up and wait times would double. Rob really knows his way around and makes an effort to have you truly see and experience places instead of waiting in lines or sitting in traffic. He is also incredibly knowledgeable about South Africa, everything from history to plants/animals to current events; you can ask him anything and he will be able to answer it. It was the best day ever and I wouldnt trade it for anything. Honestly I would pay double what his tour costs it was that amazing!!! Thank you Rob!!!

Amazing fun-filled tour with Rob. My wife, daughter and I spent the day with Rob on the peninsula tour. It was an amazing tour with a great guy! Rob is very knowledgeable about the local area and does his absolute best to ensure you see the sights at the best time possible. From Cape Town to Signal Hill to penguins to Simons Town to the Cape of Good Hope, we were well taken care of and entertained the entire way. This is a must-do tour if you are in Cape Town! Thanks Rob!

Great Day at Cape of Good Hope.... Did the peninsula tour to various points down to Cape of Good Hope and back. Rob was a blast to hang out with and did a great job of giving us tips to avoid the busloads of tourists and take some stunning photos. Even better was the history lesson of the area as the various world explorers sailed around the region. As an added bonus, he gave us great advice in visiting Table Mountain - if the conditions are right just go, you can't plan it due to wind and clouds. At the end of our tour, he highly recommended we take the opportunity and dropped us off at the cable lift so that we could cap off our day with some amazing sights. You won't regret hiring Rob.

You'll have a great day with Rob!. I also booked with Rob and reading reviews and watching his very home-made video! All the good things you're read from other reviewers is true - it was a fabulous day. He is very informative and humorous. If you're highly offended by the occasional colorful language, this might not be your tour (we aren't). There were 7 of us and Rob made sure to include everyone in the discussions. He tailored the stops based on the weather so that it would be clear when we got to the Cape of Good Hope and it was stunning! We had a blast - thanks, Rob, for a fabulous day...we're still quoting some of your "Robisms"!

Fun day with Rob!. We had a wonderful tour of the Cape peninsula with Rob in March. We had our 4 year old with us and he made sure to accommodate us well. The group was small, only 7 of us. We learned a lot of the history and area plus we had loads of laughs! Thanks for a great day, I recommend it for sure.

Fun Tour of the Cape. We took a one-day Cape tour with Rob in March. We had a group of 6 in the van. Rob is great and highly entertaining. We had great weather and had a full day of sight-seeing without feeling rushed. This tour is great value for the money. Rob make sure to cater the days activities around when it's best to reach each of the sites to avoid the crowds if possible. I would highly recommend.

Great fun tour. We did a one day Cape peninusula tour with Rob. What a guy! Loved his banter and sense of humour but he's also very good at making sure everyone feels included and part of the experience. The tour was everything we wanted and more- he made sure that we all saw what we were particularly interested in (baboons and leopards for me - don't ask!!!) Don't do a tour with anyone else - Rob knows his stuff and you will have a great time.

Superb. had a wonderful time. Rob was quick to respond from beginning to end. He was very knowledgeable about the sites and made sure we saw everything that we wanted to. Thanks again for a great time.

Awesome tour. We took a tour down to cape point and cape of good hope with Rob and he showed us a lot more. We ended up going driving south thru several suburbs that were beautiful Then the penguin colony On the way back we drove thru Chapmans peak and he stopped for us to take pictures. Rob did an amazing job and we had a great time Thanks Rob!!

Best Tour Ever. If you do nothing else in Cape Town you must take a tour with Rob. You will have a fantastic time at your own pace. He is very knowledgable, flexible and informative, and your sides will hurt from laughing by the end of the day. If I could give him 10 stars I would.GrantCanada

Amazing Garden Route tour 28th Feb 2015. Having read the reviews on trip advisor we were confident that we had made the right decision to book Cape Convoy Tours for our 5 day tour for our party of 4. We had an amazing time with Rob as our tour guide, he did not let us down.Rob made excellent choices of hotels and we would be very happy stay in these hotels on our next trip to South Africa. Rob is not a foodie but did recommend some great places for food although we were disappointed with 34 degrees south in Kynsa. However, this is not Rob's fault. He did say it was best for fish and we ordered meat dishes, so if you go there stick to fish! Would recommend JJ's for food though, we had a great meal there!As per other reviews, Rob is a very friendly tour guide and always has plenty of information at hand. There was hardly a quiet moment on our tour which helped pass the time when traveling for long periods of time.This tour was amazing and Rob will gladly accommodate anything that you wish to see or do. Our trip to South Africa was very special and Rob was part of this. Thanks Rob, you were awesome!

One of the best tours you can go on. One of the best decisions we made in Cape Town. Rob is a fantastic, hilarious, and very well-informed tour guide. He makes everyone in the van feel like they've been friends forever. Not only do you see all the beautiful parts of the Cape and learn a lot about the history but you'll also be doubled up laughing at Rob's stories and personal anecdotes. By far, one of the best tours we've ever been on. Highly recommended.

The easiest and best decision you'll make.... As soon as I saw Rob's videos and read other reviews, I knew it was a no-brainer to book his Cape Peninsula Tour during my recent trip to South Africa. Everything you read about Rob is true. He's hilarious, entertaining, informative...and you immediately feel like you've been buddies for years. He picked up my friend and I around 8:45am for a full-day tour of the Cape Peninsula. As it turned out, there was only one other person on the bus that day, a woman from Canada, so it felt like our own private tour! The three of us got along great so each stop we made, we explored together. We headed toward Muizenberg first and made a clockwise tour of the Cape. There were a handful of stops to take great photos of the coast or explore places like Simon's Town, but of course the majority of time was reserved for Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope. Rob gave us plenty of time to hike all the way out to the lighthouse at Cape Point, and it was great being able to wander off on our own so we didn't feel like we had to ask every time we wanted to stop for ANOTHER selfie ;). We then headed to the Cape of Good Hope (I finally learned that they are in fact two different spots!). We saw some HUGE ostriches and a bunch of baboons along the side of the road, and Rob pulled over so we could get a closer look and take more pics. I got some pretty funny selfies with one ostrich who came RIGHT up to my window! Rob was also an awesome amateur photographer and got some great shots for us at the touristy Cape of Good Hope sign (there is often a long line here but we got pretty lucky on timing and Rob was like a movie director getting people to move along so we got our pics...he could make a living doing that alone!) The last part of the trip was along the stunning Chapman's Peak Drive, past Hout Bay, and just the most beautiful natural scenery I could imagine. Honestly, the scenery throughout the whole trip was breathtaking, and Rob knew so much about the area and the history, so we were able to learn and not just take pictures! The only negative of the day was having to leave when Rob dropped us off. He's definitely the kind of guy that you'll want to have beers with by the end of the day. I feel bad for anyone who isn't able to do this tour with Rob. It's THAT good. I just hope I can get back to South Africa someday so I can look him up and finally grab those beers :)~Katie

Rob's an awesome tour guide! We had a really good time!. Rob is such a nice, funny and engaging tour guide. We spent a whole day with him and we were never bored. It was three of us and we had him all to ourselves - a definite plus since he had so many stories to tell. He never got tired of our questions and was always cheery. He took us everywhere during the day, and probably to places we wouldn't have gone if we didn't have him with us. One of the best tour experiences I've had. He even helped us take an awesome picture at Cape Point ;) Highly recommended.Thanks again Rob!

Excellent Peninsula tour!. Rob is an excellent guide and we all had a really great day! We got to see many lovely places and hear lots of good stories :) I can highly recommend to take this tour from Cape Convoy :)

The Cape at its full. Rob is such and engaging and fun tour guide. We spent a full day with him visiting the Cape and it was fantastic. He was flexible to let us choose our own pace yet so passionate to show us everything. Our kids ages 9 to 13 loved him as he had a very funny and likable way to explain the history and geography of the region. We fully recommend this tour!

Highlight of our trip to South Africa. Taking part in Rob's small-group trip to Cape Point was an absolute treat, and definitely the best thing we did while in South Africa. Rob is a wealth of energy, enthusiasm and knowledge, and his tour took us all over Cape Point, to places I'm sure we would never have found ourselves.Rob was thoroughly entertaining, and has an infectious passion for South Africa. By keeping group numbers low (we had 8 people on our tour) Rob is able to offer a really personalized service - I've been on very few tours where at the end of the day the guide has personally thanked each guest for taking part. As we were in Cape Town for a wedding, Rob even helped out with some jokes for my best man's speech (so now I have someone else to blame for all of those awkward silences!)It was a great tour, which I would thoroughly recommend - thanks Rob.

Fantastic day trip!. Rob is a great tour guide and does an absolutely brilliant tour, taking in the Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, Simon's Town, Boulders beach (with the penguins) and many other sights on the way. This is our second time on the trip and it was just as enjoyable if not better, second time round! Great value for money and a real personal service. Rob has a great personality and shows a real interest in all the people on the tour, making sure everyone has a fantastic time. He has so much knowledge and interesting facts of the area as well as South Africa in general. The tour suits all ages - we had a mixed group on our tour and everyone got on really well, with Rob being very attentive to all and ensuring we were all enjoying ourselves. We didn't feel rushed at all - we could take as much time as we needed in the places we visited and Rob stopped when there were things to see - such as a family of baboons taking over a car by the side of the road! It really is a great trip and I would recommend it to everyone.

a nice day tour with lots of laughters. We have joined the day tour offered by Cape Convoy for two days. Rob has been a good guide for us. He is very responsive and provides much information when I was still planning the tour. It helps a lot for our trip planning.During the day tour, he took care of the group very well, and well catered the needs from us. The tours we joined are Wineland Tour and Cape Point Tour, I will say there are the highlight of our trip, and we know a lot about Cape Town from Rob. Price are very reasonable too. I will recommend Cape Convoy.

high energy guiding. my wife and I (both 60 plus) enjoyed the trip to cape point. Rob is a treat to be with as he is sensitive to the needs of the group but energetic in his leading of the tour. He has a good knowledge of the history of the various places and imparts it in a straightforward informal manner...both clearly and concisely. he goes to some length to make sure the itinerary goes smoothly and avoids crowded times , he is also flexible and adjusts his plans on the hoof to suit the interests of the party. There were 9 of us in his bus from all corners of the world and it was comfortable and well structured to appeal to all.No hesitation in recommending him to others.

Great fun and small group! . Rob is a cool and friendly guy and really cares that his passengers are having a great time. He tries really hard to time his visits to avoid when the major tour companies are visiting the peninsula so it's a nicer experience. I went on the tour on my own but didn't feel uncomfortable at all - I highly recommend it! The other thing is liked is that there are no stops at kirstenbosch or Hout Bay (for seal island boat rides). You can do this with the city sightseeing bus and spend more time on the cape with rob's tour! A+++++++ :)

Rob's tour will take some beating!!. We had a great day out with Rob visiting the Cape of Good Hope, Simon's Town for lunchand taking in some wine (& craft beer) tasting on the way back. There was just me and my partnerAnna on the trip, and Rob went out of his way to make the day even more special (as it was Anna's birthday!) Nothing was hurried, we could have as much or as little time as we wanted at each place and the whole day was individually tailored to our own needs.Rob did a fair bit of talking, we had a great laugh and he knew the Cape area like the back of his hand! It felt like we were being shown around by a mate and not by a tour guide who we had only just met!Thankyou Rob for making Anna's birthday special and hope to see you again when in Cape Town (we will be back!) Keep up the good work!

Fantastic Cape Point Tour. Just returned from our first trip to South Africa, and we were lucky enough to spend our last full on this fantastic day tour of the Cape. Rob is a great tour guide, he's very knowledgable, and his love of the area is infectious. He tailors the tour depending on the weather, and where he thinks it's best to avoid the crowds. We had limited time in the area, and it was just great to see so much in one day. As well as seeing some fantastic sights, you also have a really good laugh - Rob keeps everyone involved, and very soon into the day, everyone was getting along great.In summary, I would thoroughly recommend Cape Convoy and wouldn't hesitate to go on another of Rob's tours when we return to Cape Town. It's a brilliant way to see a fantastic part of the world!

Wine Tasting tour. This was our second trip with Rob and Cape Convoy. Our first was 3 years ago and we were not disappointed this time. Booked via email with Rob, excellent communication all along the way. This trip was for 8 people all friends for a wine tasting tour.We all had a blast, Rob was good company and full of interesting facts along the way.For anyone planning a tour I would highly recommend booking with Rob, you will not be disappointed.

Amazing Day Tour of Cape. Rob is an amazing guide with an impeccable knowledge of the history and fauna of the Cape. His energy (and sense of humor!) were totally infectious, and he was very conscientious of everyone on the tour, offering to snap pictures and making sure everyone was getting what they were looking for. The price can't be beat for what you get, including entrance fees to attractions. The tour group consisted of mostly individuals - we came as strangers and left as friends. Great memories - thanks Rob!

The cape and how!. Rob! What can I say but you did a very good job! Meghann and I were on our honey moon - there were drop outs and therefore we got a private tour! Rob's energy is like a cup of coffee in the morning. he loves what he does and that is apparent in his passion, knowledge and enthusiasm. Rob admits he is verbose - but he is indeed an interesting tour guide! We loved out day and saw the highlights of the cape coast - down to the cape of good hope! Id say kudos to your Rob - thank you for making our day special and memorable! Please do send us pictures that you took though :-)

Awesome Garden Route Tour!. We had the good fortune to do the Garden Route Tour with Rob & a lovely couple from England....3 nights & 4 days...covering a lot of ground and seeing as much as possible! Rob is the most cheerful, funny, enthusiastic guide imaginable....so much positive energy and so well informed! While enroute, we learned much about South Africa...history, politics, current challenges, geography of the Western Cape area we were visiting. We took a township tour in Knysna, visited an ostrich farm, did the Kanga Caves tour, went on a lagoon boat cruise, took a 2 hour safari, had stops for shopping and scenic restaurants, visited Titsikama National Park, saw the bungee bridge & jumpers, and stayed in lovely hotels along the route! Thank you Rob for such fun....this was definitely what we'd hoped for!

A great Bru....am I right??. Well, I first have to give credit to my friend Katie who found Rob and Cape Convoy before our trip to Cape Town. She and Rob exchanged a few emails and we could both tell from that point it was going to be a great time. When Rob picked us up from the hotel we found out there were only going to be 3 of us (4 including Rob) on the tour. Literally a private tour! From the start, Rob was top notch. He had an awesome and engaging personality. Since we chose the full day, he had a route planned that avoided the crowds (where possible) and it allowed us to spend more than enough time at each spot. In addition Rob takes charge when needed. Trust me, you will need it at the Cape of Good Hope. We ran into a bit of an issue with everyone taking pictures in front of the sign and basically Rob gave us the low down and we had out photos within 5 min vs dealing with the chaotic tourists and tour buses. His inside knowledge on what to do and where to go makes the tour a lot more enjoyable and really helps to optimize your time while never feeling rushed. In addition, throughout the tour Rob provides the history of the area. He doesn't just drive you from spot to spot but teaches you the history so you can truly enjoy your time. Plus it never hurts to have a guy that knows exactly the right angle to take the photo to incorporate the whole shot and have an awesome memory.  If you like to just sit, not talk and be a bump on a log.....I would suggest you rent a movie about Cape Town. But if you want to have a fully interactive tour, then Cape Convoy is your answer. You will laugh and cry (from laughing....not the sad crying) and know that you took full advantage of your time in Cape Town. I literally could go on for hours about our tour but that would just spoil it for you! Now go and book it! Awesome job Rob, you have a great business!! We had a blast and the rest of our trip was amazing thanks to a few of your insider tips! Best,Alex (Chicago)

Fantastic birthday hosted by Rob. My wife and I plus our 18 year old daughter were lucky enough to spend my birthday with Rob and his other guests in late December; round the Cape, fish and chips at Simonstown, then a quick dash to Stellenbosch to visit Graf and Waterford. Lots of laughs, and a very enjoyable long day out.Rob's hosting skills are excellent and he makes everyone feel welcome and new friends are made immediately. It's my second time with Cape Convoy Tours and I'm looking forward to next time already...

Rob's yer man. Excellent day out with Rob round the Cape on Sunday 4th. He got us out early knowing that the crowds would be descending on our route and it meant that we could enjoy the sights at our own pace and enjoy his commentary and guidance. Rob sizes up his guests well and plays the day accordingly. We had a great day and we thoroughly recommend seeking out Cape Convoy.By the way if you read this Rob - I got to see the Spurs highlights on the plane home - the Chelsea goalkeeper was as reliable as David Icke.

Amazing way to see the Cape. We started the day laughing and ended it the same way! Rob brought a lot of humour into the tour and did it in a way that learning the history was really fun and interesting. The van was comfortable and we felt safe throughout the tour. We spent all day visiting amazing scenery and were very pleased with the tour overall. Rob had a wealth of knowledge about everything and it was great to have his insight. My only tip: be prepared to walk and be outside a lot. Although we put on a bit of sunscreen in the morning we ended up getting burned as what started out as a 10-20 minute walk turned into being outside for 1.5 hours. We loved it - but not the day after!

Fun, Fun, Fun. I just went on to my home page and realised I've never written a review for Cape Convoy. My bad! I know it's been about a year since I went to Cape Town but I'd have to argue that makes this review so much more pertinent that I've remembered the time I spent with Rob and Cape Convoy after all this time as one of the best trips I've taken in all my travels.So, like anyone on holiday, I'm not fond of guided tours, even if they are personalized ones. And after two days of boring hop-on, hop-off buses, another two days of a guided tour was the last thing I wanted. But my sister had booked this, not least because she'd been told that it wasn't safe for three women to wander around the outskirts of Cape Town alone.Rob took us to see The Cape of Good Hope on one day and wine country including Franschhoek ("French Corner" - one of the oldest towns of the Republic of South Africa situated about 75 kilometres from Cape Town) and Stellenbosch as well as some wine yards the next day.Now, picture, if you will, three bored, irritated women with induvidual copies of Lonely Planet etc in their hands getting into the van. Picture, two hours later, exhilarated folks getting pictures clicked with ostriches in the background as they return from the final point in the African Continent. Rob is an excellent guide. He's a good driver and knowledgable. He's a motor mouth who can keep you entertained constantly. But, far more importantly, he also has the ability to see what the customer wants and find it for them. And he's unobtrusive and low key, even when we're moving behind schedule.

Best way to see and learn about the Cape. Rob was the most knowledgeable guide we've had a long time. Smart, witty, sensitive, and really funny. If there's another guide for this area who who knows more love to meet them. (I doubt it though) He got to the Cape in front of the buses, found a great spot for lunch and could modify the day anyway we needed to. We four so enjoyed our time with him. I'm sure you will be too.

Rob is a master!. We did the tour of the Cape and Simon's Town. Rob is very knowledgeable and he reads his customers well. So you get a tour and commentary that reflect this which makes it very enjoyable. As well as being clever and well-informed, Rob is a lot of fun. So it is a great way to see amazing things and have a stress-free experience. I would certainly do another Rob tour next time.

Laugh a minute. We (a group of 4 adults & 2 children) have just spent 2 great days with Rob. First day exploring the Cape Peninsula..... and you will get to the Cape of Good Hope before the tour buses for that all important photo! The 2nd day we fitted in the Botanical Gardens, a Cheetah encounter and wine tasting, without feeling rushed. Rob has a wealth of knowledge and humour which all add to the day. Thanks Rob for a great time and I'm sure you'll get some mileage out of the "Cheetah" story !!

Great time!. We had a great time to the Cape Peninsula with Rob. He kept us entertained during the entire day. Since it's a small group, there's always wiggle room to do something extra if the day allows. He knows where to spend more time and where we should spend a little less time. If we ever come back to Cape Town, we will definitely get in touch with Rob again!

A great day with the kids. Fantastic way to see the Cape with the ball of energy that is Rob. Within 2 minutes he had won the kids over and they were arguing as to who was going to sit up front with him. Rob was very flexible and adjusted the itinerary based on other things we had already done/had planned. His knowledge was very impressive and we had a lot of fun to boot.

Cape point all day fun. We took the full day tour around the Cape with Rob. The weather was great and the entire tour was wonderful. Rob is so much fun and made our tour very unique and special. I have to say he is very knowledgeable and can chat about anything, so the tour will be as fun as you want, no topics are out of the question We stopped for lunch at Simons town and per Rob's recommendation we ate at the local fish and chips place Salty Dog and it was great. Chapman's Peak was my favorite as the view from the tip is gorgeous! Don't waste your time looking further, many companies do the same tour but there is only one Rob. Cheers!
Fab day!. Brilliant day with rob as part of our honeymoon- it was a fab trip, relaxed, fun and friendly! Highly recommend cape convoy!

Incredible tour made better by Rob!. We visited Cape Town in November and worked with Rob ahead of time via the website. He was responsive and more than helpful. My wife and I booked a full day tour of Cape Point/Cape Of Good Hope. The second Rob came into our hotel to pick us up, we knew we were in great hands. Rob was beyond great. Not only is he highly entertaining, he's incredibly smart and stayed engaged with us throughout our time with him. It's obvious that Rob loves what he does. He knows and loves Cape Town and we're lucky that he shared that passion with us. I highly recommend this tour to anyone that visits Cape Town.

Rob is AMAZING!!!!. We visited Cape Town in November and booked ahead of time with Rob via the inquiry form on the website. He responded very quickly and answered all questions that I had before booking. On the day of the tour, Rob picked us up at our hotel and we had a full day private tour booked with him for Cape Point/ Cape of Good Hope and we could not be happier. Rob was great company, kept us entertained, took us to all the best places, did not cut ANY corners, and gave us an amazing taste of what Cape Town has to offer. It is clear that Rob is super passionate about what he does and that passion is definitely infectious. I highly recommend that anyone who visits Cape Town takes a tour with Cape Convoy- you will see/do so much without feeling rushed. Thanks for everything Rob!! We will be sure to tell our all friends/family in NY/NJ about our amazing time with you. I will also be sure to send you the heart photo we took at the bottom of Cape Point as soon as I upload it!!Hope you visit us in the US soon!!!

High-octane tour of Cape Peninsula. Rob gave our tour group (3 couples) an enormously entertaining day trip to see Cape Peninsula. Rob is non-stop energy - he is the coffee to wake you up in the morning. Pure comedy fun and no topic is off limits. He is knowledgable about the history of the sites, as well as tips and tricks to avoid crowds and maximize the tour time. Highly recommend using Cape Convoy!

Amazing Tour with and Amazing Tour Guide!. His name is Rob, remember that! I was about to catch my flight early morning at 7 am from Nairobi to Cape Town via JoBurg, I had only one free day, the next day, I wrote an email thinking this will never happen, just before taking my flight Rob responds with all the details and we're busy emailing to get the timings and him finding the best possible way to accommodate me, he was brilliant! I still hadn't decided due to my travel dates and mailed him at 11pm the night before the tour, he responds and confirms he has a spot for me, again, he was brilliant! NO BODY DOES THAT THESE DAYS! The next day he picks me from the hotel and we're on our way! The other guys in the group were returning customers, always a good sign! He was very friendly, very informative and FUN! (That's a note to the reviewer who said Rob wasn't funny) He was brilliant with the planning and we saw each and every point of the "Cape Point Tour and Winelands tour all in one day" even if you don't drink he accommodated me and made me feel very comfortable, coz he didn't drink either, but it was very insightful and educational to learn wine making and we both learnt something new :) The penguins tour was amazing, Long Beach is just breathtaking and Camp's Bay as well not forgetting the Cape of Good Hope and we also saw some Ostriches and spotted a few Whales as well! He didn't leave a single stone untouched. I would definitely recommend him to anyone anytime and when I return to CPT would definitely hook up with Rob the man again!Thank you Rob for an amazing tour and company! Say hi to Victor!

Best tour in Cape town!!. Definately the best tour you can make in the cape, Rob is a great guy, he is very kind and funny, and the whole tour is just awesome, we hope we can go back soon and repeat that great experience with cape convoy. Thank you very much Rob!!

Entertaining day out. Rob gave us an entertaining and informative day out. Rob is a great tour guide and makes sure you are having a good time. Me and my wife highly recommend if you are looking for something to do while in Cape Town.

Rob & Cape Convoy made our day in Cape Town. Let me first say this, Rob is literally the best tour guide I have ever had the privilege of being around. Not only is Rob ridiculously fun and hilarious, he knows so much about the history and people of Cape Town. When you book with Cape Convoy you should know a few things. 1. Rob is hilarious and will have you laughing by 8:45 am. The man could moonlight as a standup comedian. He is your cup of coffee that day. 2. Rob will share so much history with you in your time with him. The history of buildings, the rock and mountain formations, the people... he knows so much and he shares it with you in a way that makes it easy to retain. I actually felt like my brain grew on the tour. 3. Rob is just a genuinely good person. The type of guy that makes you happy to be around. The type of guy who makes you question why you get so stressed out back at home with work and the day to day. I think this tour is an absolute must. This is for anyone who really wants to have a fun day, but also a day where you can learn about a different place on this planet and reflect on your place in it. I know I will always remember this tour whenever i catch myself getting stressed and try to get through it half as cool as Rob does. Could not recommend enough. Just book it and thank Rob later!

Amazing. We booked the Cape Pennisula tour with Rob and it was easily one of the highlights of our holiday! Rob is a very passionate and knowledgeable guy. He's funny & easy going and you'll have a smile on your face the entire day! I would recommend doing a tour with him to everyone! You won't want it to end. I'll definitely book a tour with him again next time I'm in Cape Town!

Cape Convoy Tours deliveres!. Rob was our guide and he kept us informed and entertained for an entire day. He knew just were to go, how to get around the bus-full of other tour groups and have an experience worth every penny! Can't wait to return and maybe swim with the penguins next time ;) - just kidding Rob...settle down now. :)

Fantastic Day, Awesome Guide, Unique Experience. We spend a whole day with Rob heading to Cape Point and back to Cape Town. What can I say, I was one of the best guided tours I ever had in my life. Rob showed us so many beautiful places and told us so many interesting stories. You just can't stop listening to him. He is such a funny, likeable and smart guy. I laughed so much. Rob is so full of energy.Thanks again Rob for this fantastic and unforgettable day.I can highly recommend a trip with Cape Convoy. You won't regret it, I promise!PS: I hope Julia is doing good :)

Awesome Cape Point Tour!. I joined with Rob for the Cape Point Tour! What can I say? It was just awesome!!!! I contacted Rob some days before my travel. He quickly responded and all was set. On the day of the tour, he picked early inorder to avoid the big rush of the tour buses. We were 5 people in the tour. Rob kept the tour lively with the jokes and the laughs. Stopped at some of the scenic view points, took pictures, stopped at Simon's town for lunch. He recommended a couple of restaurants according to each person's choice. All in all, had a great day! Loved the tour and Rob's enthusiasm and energy!!!!

Awesome Cape point Tour!!. I joined with Rob for Cape Point tour. What can I say? It was just awesome!!! I contacted Rob some days before my travel. Very prompt response from Rob. On the day of the tour, he picked us early so that we avoid the big rush of tour buses. He kept the tour lively with jokes and laughs. Stopped at some of scenic view points, took pictures. We stopped at Simon's Town for lunch. He recommended a couple of restaurants according to each person's choice.All in all, it was a great day. Loved the tour and Rob's enthusiasm and energy!!!

Rob keeps delivering. Second time using Cape Convoy Tours and lucky enough to have had Rob again as our guide.What can I say? With a couple of days notice, Rob accommodated us to a semi private tour to Cape Point and still managed to fit in a wine tasting on the way back to Cape Town.Cannot understand how can someone give Rob another rating other than EXCELLENT!Rob, you are a friend, a brother, please keep being who you are!I will always speak highly of you and Cape Convoy Tours to anyone that asks me for recommendations of what to do in Cape Town.

Fabulous..... We were together with Rob on the cape point and garden route.The places were awesome and Rob was our guide, he was really interesting and fun and caring...I can guarantee that with your children (even a year old) it is the best enjoyable activity.

highlight for cape town. I did the day tour to Cape point and it was awesome!!!!! Rob was full of energy and information! He picked us up and we headed off for the day! I highly recommend this tour! You see everything popular and get to go to Cape point.Rob is a very funny guy and I don't think I've laughed so much in one day!! I will book all my future tours when I return to Cape Town with this guy 100%!!!

Breathtaking, fun, and insightful. We were lucky enough that Rob was free a few days before we booked him. He's super responsive! Anyway, the Cape Peninsula tour is an absolute MUST DO if you're visiting Cape Town, and Rob made the day fun and entertaining. We managed to avoid, in some spots, the hoard of tourist buses. Rob happily took our photos, gave us lots of tips, and engaged us in very interesting conversations. He gladly (and enthusiastically) answered our questions about South Africa, and he was equally inquisitive about our own culture. We shared quite a few laughs throughout the trip! Which is always a plus when the views are just breathtaking! We loved all the stops. The penguins most especially and Cape Point view.

It was good, but....... I had been planning our trip of a life time to Africa for over a year pouring over options looking to make this the ultimate trip. Based on the fabulous reviews for Cape Convoy, I contacted Rob to book a day tour with him about 2 months prior to our trip. He responded quickly and told me he only had 2 spaces left for the date I had requested, so I booked the tour and received confirmation. Fast forward, two months; we were greeted by our guide for Cape Convoy Tours, but it was not Rob. The guide we had was very good and very knowledgeable and I did enjoy the tour but I am disappointed that I did not get the tour with Rob as I had expected. Because I was told there were only 2 spaces left, I'm left a little bothered thinking, 1) it was a case of bait and switch or 2) we were bumped for some reason. Regardless, it came as quite a surprise and prior notice, at the very least, would have been appreciated. I am not angry and understand that Cape Convoy did supply the service for which it was contracted to do, but I wish it was handled differently and am left wondering about the tour I would have had otherwise...

Fantastic Tour Guide. This was our second time to Cape Town and our parents were with us for their first visit. We were refered to Ebrahim Modack for a fantastic Cape Point Tour by Rob of Cape Convoy Tours. Ebrahim is absolutely the most enjoyable and professional guide we have ever dealt with. His delightful personality, humor charisma, and information made a special day even better for our parents and ourselves. Ebrahim has been a guide for over fifteen years and I would most certainly recommend him for any Cape Town tours. A true Gem!!He can be reached at www.capetown.co.za.

Fabulous tour guide Rob!. We have attendend daily Cape Piont tour and 4 days Garden Route with my wife and one year old baby during October 2014 with Cape Convoy Tours. Our tour guide Rob was so friendly, fun and knowldgable, it was one of our best holiday of all times! I strongly recommend the magnificent Garden Route tour of Cape Convoy to anybody who have visited Cape Town.

Amazing Tour !!. A HUGE thank you to Rob for making the tour so much more fun and informative that the regular one. We spent the day touring the amazing wineyards of Cape Town in October 2014 and Rob was a hang around with! Very compassionate and understanding, Rob went more than the extra mile to ensure that we enjoyed the tour and also provided the insiders-view into Cape Town!! Although, he claims to be just an average guy, I would easily vouch for him to be one of the best human being I have met !! A must-take tour in Cape Town !!

Cape Point with knowledgeable and fun guide. Rob knows a lot of facts and likes to talk so this tour is very informative. He takes you on the route that many tourists go, but somehow is able to avoid crowds and delays.

Outstanding Tour. What a great day with Rob! If you are looking for a fun and informative tour to take to see South Africa Cape Convoy is #1!Thanks Rob for not only showing us the sights but also being a compassionate guy and adjusting your day/trip to meet the needs of your customers. We have made a friend for life! Thanks for everything. We'll be back. Keep a beer on ice for us. Russ and Dyana

Cape Peninsula Tour. We are independent travellers and rarely go on tours. But we are glad we went on the Cape Peninsula tour with Rob at the end of Sept 2014. We awoke to the darkest low hanging clouds ever, it looked like a downpour was imminent. If I was self driving, I would have cancelled our plans and even considered cancelling out of the tour. Rob showed up (on time) and assured us we would have a great time. There was a total of 7 of us. Rob first took us to a seaside town (Muizenberg) with colorful houses on the beach, where we made a coffee stop. By the town we arrived at the picturesque Simon's town, the sun was shining. Next at Boulder's, we spent a good mount of time observing the penguins from both lookout points. Next, at Cape Point, we had lunch, took the funicular up, walked around (saw whales) and hiked down. This was the highlight of our trip and we spend a lot of time her and were not rushed. Then on to the Cape of Good Hope (of course photos @ the sign). We drove along the breath taking Chapman's Peak and the beach towns on ur way home.Rob was the best host ever. He was very engaging, funny, full of information and interacted well with everyone. He knows all of the photo stops (and is a good photographer:-). Rob knew how to dodge the weather and the crowds, there is no way I would have been able to do the same. Forget hiring a car, just go with Rob! You will have a better time and none of the hassles of driving (getting lost, parking, petrol, tolls for Chapman's Peak etc.) Also, all of the entry fees (Penguins, Cape Point) are included (except Cape Point funicular R105). We were back at our hotel by 5:10PM to sunny skies.If you enjoy big bus tours with taped commentary, then this is not the tour for you.

Fantastic tour!. We did a Cape Peninsula Tour with Rob and had a fantastic day! Looked at lots of tours and decided on Rob's tour - we weren't disappointed!Rob clearly knows his stuff and made sure we got to all the right places at the right times missing the crowds/tour buses.Rob took us to some fantastic places and was really knowledgeable about the places we visited and the history of the cape. Rob was really friendly and made sure we were all involved in the whole day. Would highly recommend cape convey tours for a fab fun day!

A Great Day of Fun and Laughter. My family and I recently did the Cape Peninsula tour with Rob and had an amazing day! As Rob phrased it, we were lucky to have our tour on a day with summer weather but winter crowds, so to take advantage of the situation, he took the reverse route and managed to avoid all the tour buses throughout the day. We also stopped at a few truly beautiful hidden gems along the way. On top of giving a great tour, Rob is hilarious. If you're looking for a tour with little engagement and a straight forward (aka boring) guide, then Rob is NOT for you. But if you want to spend your day laughing and having fun with a big personality, Rob is your guy. He also gives great restaurant recommendations (all seafood lovers, head to the Codfather!) and takes the time to get to know everyone on his tour. Thanks to Rob for a memorable day!

Extremely rude and not to be trusted!. After looking up the reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book this tour. I sent Rob a couple of mails and we confirmed the dates of the tour, after Rob let me know the dates on which he would be the guide. A few days after I had confirmed the dates, Rob sends me a mail to inform me that he won't be the guide. After another couple of days, he send me an email saying he's figured it out and he'll be able to do the tour after all.He then sent me a form where I had to fill out all my credit card details. I was a little skeptical about handing over my credit card details just like that so Rob told me I could pay him by cash when he picked me up for the tour.On the day of the tour, Rob calls us up half an hour before the tour to inform us that he won't be taking us on the tour after all and that he'll send someone else. When I told him that he could've informed us earlier about it, he told me he had no time to take everyone on a tour and that if I wasn't happy, I could go with someone else. He then brought up the fact that I hadn't given him my credit card details and that I should be happy he agreed to let me go on the tour!I found Rob to be extremely rude and a person not to be trusted on his word! I would recommend booking with another tour operator as Rob doesn't respect his commitments.

Amazing Tour/Tour Guide. I had gone to extreme measures to ensure that our holiday in Cape Town was one that my wife and I would remember forever. After perusing various sources such as TripAdvisor for suggestions and reviews, I selected Cape Convoy to provide a tour of Cape Point. Rob exceeded every one of my expectations and provided one of the best and most informative tours during our holiday in South Africa. His knowledge of both past & present events, not to mention the Cape Point route, coupled with his sense of humor made this a tour that we will never forget. Thank you again Rob for making this tour a special memory of our holiday in Cape Town. If you are going to be in Cape Town, a tour with Cape Convoy is a must!

A Knowledgeable Friend Beside You. We visited Cape Town this September. Based on the Brilliant reviews about "Cape Convoy", we wanted to book a tour with them. We had a lots of questions and each and every question was answered in a friendly way by Rob. It's like you sense that you have a friend in an unknown city. Let me give you some hints about how Rob helped us to arrange for a tour with us.1) We wanted to do the Cape Point Uncovered Tour on a weekend. It was well informed to us by Rob that this tour was a weekday tour, but as soon as we expressed our desires, he arranged it for us. It's like someone is valuing your wishes. You feel special.2) At the time of booking the tour, we were reluctant to give few details of our card, for which it became a problem to book it. No Problem, Rob booked the tour, believe me, WITHOUT ANY PAYMENT, and asked us to pay at the time of the tour itself. I really don't know, how many of the Tour Operators will take such high risk to arrange a tour for you. Something we really appreciate. We got Joe, as our guide and from the moment we were at his car he became a friend, who knows almost everything about Cape Town and it's surrounding. He took individual care of every guests, making all feel great. He took great pictures, cracked jokes with you, took us to really good vineyards and suggested us really good restaurants for lunch. I can't stop praising this group.P.S To all future travelers to Cape Town " Taking a tour with CAPE CONVOY, is itself an experience of it's own. You need to try it, if you are in the The Mother City"

Best tour guide around Cape Town. We recently took a full day tour of the Cape peninsula with Cape Convoy and the experience couldn’t have been better. Rob’s passion and extensive knowledge of the area made for a perfect day. He was able to navigate the area to avoid the crowds while stopping at some of the most beautiful seascapes anywhere in the world. If you want to see some of the most beautiful spots anywhere in the world while being educated and entertained Rob from Cape Convoy is your man.

Sit Back, Relax and Enjoy the Views!. If you want a fun, relaxed and informative tour of the cape, then book with Rob at Cape Convoy Tours. He is very friendly, approachable and organised. It was nice to sit back and relax as Rob showed us the beautiful coastline. Rob kept us well informed of the plans for the day and coordinated the site seeing to avoid the big crowds of tourists. He had such great tips and tricks up his sleeve to get the most out of each stop on the tour.

Great fun!. After checking out Robs we page and viewing some videos, I knew we had to go with him on a tour of the cape. Rob is a great tour guide, down to earth, honest and a real funny guy. Forgot the big commercial tour bus companies, do yourself a favour and book a tour with Rob!

A Fun Day. Our group of six had a great day with Rob on the Cape. He is very knowledgable and personable and made the day fun. We got to Cape Point before all the tour buses arrived and it was wonderful to enjoy the sights without crowds of people. We also saw the penguins, drove Chapman's Peak Drive and enjoyed a tasting at one of Constantia's beautiful wineries. We were able to relax and enjoy the day as we left the planning and driving to Rob.

Fantastic Full Day at the Cape. We had a great full day exploring the coastal inlets along the Atlantic Coast out to the Cape of Good Hope. I simply can't fault this tour and would recommend it to anyone. Rob is a fun, informal tour guide who is knowledgeable and genuine.While he obviously has some basic itenerary planned on your trip to the Cape of Good Hope, he tailors the tour as required to the crowd and audience. Rob in knowledgeable on a wide range to topics including history and wildlife and will give appropriate commentary as you go along depending on your interests.The tour was informal but intimate and we got to see all we expected and more.Our convoy took us through the suburbs of Cape Town to Simons Town for morning tea with brief stop offs at surfing hot spots to experience the shark warning system and view Table Mountain from the Atlantic Ocean. We took photos at the coloured huts along the beach and enjoyed a lovely pastry and coffee in Simons Town.Next stop was Boulders Beach and the African Penguins. We had a good half an hour to oogle at the cute and curious nature of the penguins on Boulders Beach as they tended to their young and played in the surf.Our tour then snaked along the cliffs of the Atlantic on our way to Cape Point where we stopped on multiple occassions to view Southern Right Whales just a few metres offshore.A postcard photo opportunity and next thing we're at Cape Point. With plenty of time to hike to the most south-western point in South Africa, climb to the lighthouse and enjoy a beautiful lunch at the Two Oceans restaurant and we soon off to tick the box at the Caope of Good Hope sign.On our way we watched two ostrich grazing by the beach.
