Rob then took us to an stop off with less tourists where we took more photos and watched a family of baboons sit on top of a parked car.Finally we're on our way back to Cape Town via Chapmans Pass which is a cliff edge drive with awesome views of Table Mountain and the coastline. A stop at the top to admire the view and sadly our tour is nearly over.We had a great day. It was fun, informal, intimate and we felt we got more than our moneys worth. All entrance fees and parking attendants were including in your tour price. The best full day we had in Cape Town. A must do!!

Awesome. I could not think of a better way to see the cape. Flexible and fun tour that avoided the huge tourist groups. This tour also includes cost of entry into the parks which makes it great value.

A Full Day of Cape activities. We took a combined tour of the Cape of Good Hope and the winelands in one day which is also divided into 2 different days; we wanted one day with our limited time. Rob was easy to contact and we had all of our arrangements settled before we even arrived in South Africa. Rob is very personable, knowledgeable about the history of the area, and passionate about being South African. Since we didn't have a lot of extra time, he kept us on a very aggressive but appropriate schedule to avoid tour buses, long lines, and bad traffic. When we would encounter something of interest (an ostrich wandering free at Cape Point or whales breeching off Simons Town), he was always willing to stop and let us enjoy the moment. Capping the day at Ernie Els' winery was a fitting end to a great day!

This was AWESOME! An absolute must!. If you have limited time in Cape Town and want to hit up the highlights - this is a MUST!My wife Hillary and I spent a wonderful day with Rob. What I liked about this tour is the pace and the size. Because the group size was small, we could move at a pace that kept my interest and didn't rush. It was like spending the day with a group of friends, not a "just another tour group". Rob was amazing! He was funny, knowledgable, and just a pleasure to be around.He chose our activities wisely, and ordered everything in a way to maximize our fun and weather. We did the Cape Point tour, and along the way: Hung out with a bunch of penguins by the beach.Walked next to baboons with cute little baby baby baboons holding on. Spotted some zebras, ostriches, and many whales. Hiked the incredibly beautiful Cape Point. Took a panoramic beach view road home, and took pictures at the best lookouts. Had laughs and made memories the entire way. I can't say enough good things about this activity. If you're in Cape Town - do it.

Great Tour of the Cape Area. Rod did an excellent job in being our host for a day in Cape Town and the surrounding area. He picked us up at our hotel in Cape Town and shared with us some of the places to see while in Cape Town. He took us on our tour along the western side of Cape Town, than on to Cape Point, the Cape of Good Hope, Boulders Beach to see the penguins, and visit to a couple of wineries in Stellenbosch all in one day and not feel rushed. Rod quickly learned where we wanted to spend time and moved us along at the right pace to enable us to have a great tour of the area, while learning about the city, the people and the sights. Whether it was a sighting of a whale, ostrich or baboons, he made time to stop and spend some time.

No time for replies. After doing my research on Tripadvisor, I wrote to Cape Convoy enquiring about its tours 2 weeks before I was due to leave for Cape Town.I only got one email back after about 4 days - with all the rest of my follow-up emails ignored. With no time left to do any more research, I eventually left it all to the concierge at my hotel to organize my day tours and excursions. It was just so much less stressful than trying to organize it on my own when Cape Convoy is incommunicable.

Fabulous full day tour exploring the Cape Peninsula. We had such a fabulous time with Rob and the rest of our group. Rob's local knowledge was fantastic and he was able to take us to all the key sites ( including some thrilling detours to see ostriches and baboons on the beach!) at exactly the right time to avoid the rain and other tour buses. He was very attentive to the needs of the group and his good humour made it feel like you were spending the day with a friend. The day ended perfectly when we spotted whales whilst we made our way back to Cape Town. I would thoroughly recommend this tour.

It's being with Rob that makes the difference!. Rob has such an insane amount of knowledge about Cape Town, and he is so enthusiastic to share them. He is also very fun and hilarious, and his vast experience brought us to the places with the nicest views. He was always very attentive to our needs and made sure we were comfortable and enjoying ourselves at every moment. A few days after my tour with him, I found myself without lodging. I emailed Rob, and he promptly helped and followed up with good suggestions, pro bono! Thanks Rob :))

All three tours we booked were excellent. We did Winelands, Cape Point and Hermanus with Robert and his experience, knowledge, good cheer and flexibility made each of them remarkable. Highly recommended. I checked him out here before and appreciate the reviews I found. Travel well

Way fun! And so informative!. Rob lived up to his reputation as being bright, fun-loving, enthusiastic and knowledgable. He also knew how to avoid hitting the spots as the same time as the big tour buses. We were able to get our picture taken at the Cape of Good Hope sign in a matter of moments (usually there's a big crowd there). He also knows how to set up nice shots along the way and will gladly shoot your group photos for you. We learned so much about South Africa, history and today. Could not have had a more pleasant day. Great driver.

Best guided tour I have ever experienced. Myself and my family could not have asked for a better guide to take us around Cape Town. As a party of 6, we were lucky enough to have a private tour and Rob made sure we got to see everything we wanted and more. Along with scheduled stops at Boulder Beach to see the penguins (easily the best part of the day), Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope, we managed to stumble across a family of baboons and a wild ostrich as well as stopping at some brilliant viewing points along the way. Rob ensures there is never a quiet moment on the tour and his knowledge of Cape Town is ridiculous as his stories are hilarious (particularly enjoyed the Russian basketballer one!). I would take this tour again in a heartbeat and if anything, the day came to an end too quickly. Can't thank you enough, Rob!

Fantastic Guide in Cape Town. It's hard to say more than has already been said by the many others who have had a great experience with Rob, so I'll keep this short: he's a great guide, a naturally energetic and fun-loving guy who cares about his clients getting a great experience and will go out of his way to make the day fun. We took his Cape Peninsula day tour (my parents, sister and I) and really had a blast.He's super knowledgeable and really loves his job. Friendly, funny and engaging the whole time.I'll add one point to illustrate: we were originally scheduled to go for the tour on a Thursday, but the weather report was rain and, indeed, it ended up raining that day. I emailed Rob on Wednesday and asked if we could reschedule the tour for the following day, when the weather was supposed to improve. He was quite busy with bookings over the next few days but accommodated our request and agreed to take us on Saturday. The day was gorgeous and that played a huge part in us having a fun time; it would have been a lot less enjoyable to see the Cape in the pouring rain and wind.Rob will make sure you have fun. Great guy, great guide. Highly recommend him.

Marvelous Guide. Rob was our guide for our stay and his enthusiasm id infectious. He was charming, knowledgeable and sought to please. I could not ask anything more from a tour company. I highly recommend Rob and Cape Convoy Tours,

Its like going on a tour with your best mate!. Rob is so friendly, and with it so funny, that our party and I gelled with him immediately. He tailors the tours to meet what YOU want, even to the point on trying to reorganise when the weather wasn't too good for our tour that morning. Suggesting a cafe stop the weather cleared and we all carried on with the tour. We went on the full day tour to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope, as well as the Boulder Beach Penguins. When we got soaked, Rob took us to Simonstown and we bought new trouser bottoms to keep us dry. We had such a laugh with him, and his knowledge of South Africa is so amazing, and knows how to avoid queues such as at Cape of Good Hope.From booking, acknowledgement, and meeting us on time at the apartments, Rob is well organised and professional, but its like going on a tour with your best mate. Don't hesitate to book with him, you will not regret it! Rob, thanks a million for a great tour and some great memories.

Beautiful Day, Fabulous Cape Tour. We had a private cape tour with Rob in July. He met us promptly, had great suggestions and made some changes in the day based on our preferences. The tour and day were amazing. Our visit was during the Cape Town winter, but the temp was 70 degrees, sunny and almost no wind. Rob was energetic and informative. He gave us history and happily answered any questions. The day flew by. If you are interested in a tour of the Cape (and you should be), book Rob and Cape Convoy Tours.

Great Cape Point Trip!. Our family of six booked a full day Cape Point tour in July. We had a perfect sunny day and had a wonderful trip. Rob was a great tour guide with exciting and funny stories and information about all the places we visited. Thank you Rob for a fantastic day that ended with a beautiful sunset. Hope we get back some day to visit beautiful South Africa!

Rob knows what he's doing!. This is our first visit to Cape Town, and we decided to book a tour with Cape convoy. Initially after the booking/payment was made, Rob had a few issues with personnel and so wasn't sure if he was able to accommodate us. But, he was very clear and open with the problem, communicated well, and offerred solutions (including a full refund). Long story short, he was able to work all his issues out and take us on the fabulous tour. We got lucky with the weather, and with that Rob took us around, gave us a lot of history, stopped for pictures, and didn't really care about the timing as long as we were enjoying. He is a great guy, and very friendly. Rob, you do talk a lot though. Lol. We highly recommend his tours.

1 day Cape Point tour. We booked this tour easily through the website before we travelled in late July and had high expectations having read the reviews. These were well exceeded: Rob was a fantastic guide with incredible knowledge and energy, keeping us entertained and informed all day long- nothing was too much trouble and his enthusiasm was infectious. There was plenty of time to do everything, with detours to watch whales breaching and impromptu stops for family photos. We travelled with 2 kids (ages 13 and 11) and they enjoyed every minute. We learnt a huge amount about the area and although the pace felt very relaxed we couldn't believe how quickly the day flew by. Definitely a tour not to miss. Many thanks Rob and if we're in Cape Town again you'll be seeing us!

Best Tour in Cape Town. We booked the full day Cape Point tour. Rob was an excellent tour guide. He was energetic, fun, and knowledgeable. We had a great time making our way down to the Point with a ton of laughs and talking. Really, one of Rob's greatest attributes is making you feel comfortable in the group from the beginning. I've never had a tour guide that was so interested in being your friend and getting to know you. I walked away with not only an appreciation of South Africa's Cape but also of how fun its people can be. Thanks Rob!

No show, no notice. I booked a tour through Cape Convoy Tours web form a week ahead of the requested tour date and simply got a "Thank You" message when I submitted it. Ok I thought, there will be an e-mail later, and on I went with my day. I kept waiting for a confirmation and, like any traveller, there are lots of other things going on both before and during the trip. Having some difficulty getting a local phone connection left me to the day before the expected trip to finally catch one of Cape Tours people on his mobile.He asked that I send an e-mail with my contact info, and I did that just before leaving our hotel for a different tour AND noted that I would have very limited access to e-mail during the day so PLEASE call me. No call, but a "we're sorry" e-mail that I picked up at lunch. On our wedding anniversary day, BTW.Total cock-up by Cape Convoy Tours.

Cape Town Uncovered. My mother, sister and I were looking for a tour that would encompass a trip to Stellenbosch as well as a trip to Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point. This is a tour that I would do without a doubt. Rob's vast knowledge on everything is incredible. Not only that, but he is the most laid back and easy going person. We weren't on a tight timeline so our group of 5 were able to decide together how long we wanted to stay at each place. I wouldnt even consider taking anyone else -- this is the tour guide for everyone. If I ever make a trip back to Cape Town I would 100% do another tour through him.

Best way to see Cape Point!. Had an amazing day with Rob seeing Cape Point and all it has to offer. Rob is a fantastic guide with lots of energy and very knowledgeable of all the visited sites. He was also very mindful of the weather and made sure we had the best weather when visiting the point and the penguins. Day was cut a little short at the end due to the weather but nothing major and he made the best of it. Overall had a great day and would definitely go on another of his offered tours.

Action packed lol day out with Rob!. Hubby and I just finished an all day Cape Point tour with Rob and had a blast. Rob has a lot of energy and a lot of opinions (some a tad whacky!) but was great fun so bring your sense of humour and be prepared for a brilliant day out! It's akin to spending a day out with a stand up comic - you will lol until your cheeks hurt :-)We went to the Rhodes memorial, then to Simonstown for a walk/coffee stop; then to some scenic lookouts followed by Cape Point where we saw baboons and had lunch and took the funicular up to the lighthouse followed by a rock climb at the Cape of Good Hope where we saw wild ostrich and then to Boulders beach to see the penguins before driving on Chapman peak drive which was stunningly beautiful and at the scenic lookout we saw Southern Right whales breaching in a pod! Fantastic end to a superb day out. Nothing is too much trouble for Rob and his willingness to extend his schedule and drive around in pouring rain until the weather cleared at each location so that we could enjoy it fully was very much appreciated! Rob clearly enjoys his work and meeting people from all walks of life and his passion shines through in this enthusiastic day out! Thanks Rob!

Epic Cape Point Tour!. We simply couldn't have made a better choice! Rob took us around to the best spots while sharing his deep knowledge about the history, wildlife and basically all there is to know about Africa and South Africa! We had a fantastic time and definitely recommend it!

Do Yourself A Favor Book With Rob. If you have limited time and want an excellent overview of Cape Town and surrounding area, do not hesitate to book a tour with Cape Convoy. Our host Rob was incredibly warm, engaging and knowledgeable about so much of the history of So Africa. I really learned a lot which was an added bonus to the amazing and beautiful places he took us. One of my pet peeves with booking private tours is when guides waste your time shuffling you into tourist trap trinket stores or restaurants because they get a kick back. There was none of that with Rob. He recommended a wonderful, local place for lunch - where he takes his own family regularly. And it was delish. How refreshing. Good job Rob. It's so obvious you love what you do. Keep up the good work!

tour in cape town with Rob. We had an excellent day with ROB. He sned us to very nice places where most of tourist tour wouldnt stop. The tour is really adapted to your wishes so that it can only be a great day !

Amazing Day. If you are looking for an amazing full day tour of the Cape Peninsula then Rob at Cape Convoy tours is absolutely the man to hire. Rob is incredibly engaging, well informed and makes a great effort to ensure that the tour is everything that you want. We cannot recommend him highly enough and there were too many highlights to list. One of the best days we have ever had.

Cape Town Uncovered. Multiple people in our group stated that Rob is the "coolest person they have ever met." That being said, he isn't for everyone. He likes to have fun and certainly doesn't mind controversial topics. We found it exciting and appreciated his honesty!Pros:1. Genuinely cares about his guests and always puts your comfort first. For example, when my sister and I were cold, he ran out in the rain to get us hot chocolate. When my brother-in-law forgot his jacket and his shirt got wet, Rob lent him one of his own to wear. 2. The cost is very reasonable, especially for everything you get to see.3. There is no question Rob can't answer whether it's about the history of South Africa, the plant life, or the animals you see.4. Rob is very flexible. If you want the pace to be slow or fast, he will adjust the schedule.5. He only takes you to the best wineries. The two we went to were gorgeous and not crowded at all.Cons:1. NONE!Thank you, Rob!!

Fun!!!!. What a blast! Rob was wonderful, honest, and fun tour guide. We learned a lot, asked a lot of questions, he have us his perspectives on things with absolutely no judgement, and was well rounded with what we chatted about. He showed is great places to take pictures. He took us to 2 wineries. We would recommend this tour to people who want to see a lot in one day! Rob was fantastic!

Cape peninsula tour with cape convoy. We booked this tour due to previous reviews.I was only going to be in Cape Town a limited time and wanted to do as much as possible while there.Thought this tour ticked all the boxes and from my first emails to organise and book the tour it couldn't have been easier.Our guide rob picked us up on time and was great company for the duration of the tour.He was informative about the areas and history of South Africa and came up with little gems of facts about South Africa amongst other things.His relaxed nature made you feel you were out for a drive with friends so that worked great for us.The schedule of the tour is impressive and you are left feeling like you have had a good day out and visited some great places which are included on the tour.Rob will chop and change things while on route to make the most out of time and weather.All parks and entrance fees were included in the cost of the ticket so that was great and no hassle.My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the trip and next time in Cape Town will definitely book a tour with Cape convoy.Well worth the money, informative, comfortable transport, and good company, what more could you want!

Fantastic experience with Cape Convoy. Before we arrived in Cape Town, Rob was very responsive to e-mails about the tour and the booking process was very simple. The day before the tour, Rob contacted us and offered to let us go on a different day because the weather forecast wasn't the best. That alternate day didn't work for us, so we proceeded with the tour as scheduled. Rob's experience leading this tour ensured the day was still a success. With a strategic coffee break during a rain storm, he ensured we arrived at the penguin colony and Cape of Good Hope during a break in the weather. Rob is a "ball of energy" and clearly enjoys leading this tour despite having already been to Cape Peninsula countless times. He is very well informed about South Africa's history and politics resulting in some interesting discussions and a lot learned. I walked away from the tour completely happy with my Cape Peninsula experience. I highly recommend going on a tour with Cape Convoy while visiting Cape Town.

Incredible South Africa, Incredible Tour. My wife and I went to South Africa for the first time and it was our 1st year anniversary.I wanted to do something special and different and looked at many reviews on trip advisor as I am sure you are doing right now :)This tour stuck out like a sore thumb. Now as you all know everyone's experience is different as everyone has different things that make them tick but look at the ratio of good points to bad points here, it says it all really. And my experience was over and above what I thought I would get. Rob Salmon is gem of a human being. Me and my wife did not stop talking about him after our trip and have told all our friends and colleagues about the tour and SA. Going on the cape point tour with Rob is educational / fun and makes you want to never return from your holiday. We learnt a lot of things about SA, saw sights that otherwise weren't of mention in any tour guides, had breathtaking encounters with wildlife and post card pictures and stories to return home with. Rob made everyone on the tour feel welcome and united, our convoy included people from all geographies and we were all catered for and had nothing but smiles and a fantastic experience. Great value for money, great tour of Cape point and many many other sites along the way with stop offs for browsing and food breaks. My wife felt it was the highlight of our trip and I couldn't agree more. We even told people in Mauritius (which was our next destination) to book the tour as they were headed here. Rob, we miss you 'bru' I hope all is well and look forward to seeing you again someday.Btw make sure you take a decent camera because you are about to experience a slice of heaven on earth! If you are thinking of looking at another tour in SA, it's your loss my friend, look at the number of reviews here that make cape convoy tours such a hit, I wish you could have experienced what I did!Fahim & Tam

Swim upstream with Rob Salmon on Capepoint Tour !. Cape Convoy's Rob Salmon was introduced to us by friends in Boulder, CO. If you want to be escorted and entertained by a personality who "goes against the mainstream" of your regular tour operator, then Rob is your man. Our Cape Point tour on May 5, sandwiched between a conference at the Westin Capetown, started amidst a miserable cold and wet morning, and there was Rob, smiling and upbeat and graciously asking us if we wanted to reconsider and arrange another date during our stay. We decided to proceed as it was clear Rob would entertain and educate through the entire tour, rain or shine. When the clouds parted at Boulder's Beach we saw the Penguins and when enjoying coffee and Tea at a local restaurant awaiting for a heavy downpour to end, Rob announced that he had a feeling that there would be an opening in the weather to view and enjoy Cape Point, and that is exactly what happened.Rob was extremely informative and as lively and upbeat a tour operator as you will ever meet- he turned a potentially disastrous day into an adventure to be remembered. We highly recommend Rob's tour to anyone who wants to sit back, enjoy the sights and be educated on the history, local sights and politics of S. Africa - the 7 hour tour went by far too quickly !

Cape Point and Garden Route Tour. My son and I went on two tours with Cape Convoy in early March this year. Firstly the Cape Point day tour with Joe, which was excellent. We parked close to all attractions, we went to the best place for lunch, he stopped when we wanted to stop, he was very keen to show us as much as possible, even took us to the Rhodes memorial which was not on the tour. Joe has a great knowledge of Cape Town and was happy to honestly answer any questions we had. Then we went on the five day Garden Route Tour with Rob, well this was something very special. Rob made everything exciting, from saving a tortoise in the middle of the road, moving the tour around so we had the very best weather at each location, telling us the best place to eat, even making reservations for us. Add to this non stop discussions about everything, not only him talking to us, but us talking, and expressing our opinions, just like a family road trip. We'll never forget our trip to Cape Town and in particular our adventures with Rob. The best thing you can say about Rob and Cape Convoys is " they deliver ", what ever they say you will see, you see. ( except Baboons Joe, I don't think they exist !!! )Still Smiling Ron C

Wine and Cape Point Tour. My husband, daughters and I did a wine tour with Rolph and a Cape Point tour with Rob. We had a wonderful time. Both were very informative and fun! We were only in Cape Town for 5 days and wanted to get in as much as we could in such a short amount of time. Well, needless to say, we got more than what we could have imagined. Rolph took us on a private tour to some great wineries in Paarl and Franshoek. The next day we were picked up by Rob for our tour of Cape Point. Wow! he is very knowledgeable, extremely funny and full of energy. He also allowed us plenty of time to take pictures and walk around all the sites. If you are planning a trip to Cape Town don't miss out on touring with Cape Convoy Tours.

Amazing way to see the Cape Point. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed seeing Cape Point with Rob! It was really a wonderful way to maximize time efficiency and see what every tourist needs to see on the Cape Point. We were debating hiring our own driver, but we are so glad that we did not because then we would have missed out on all of Rob's "hidden gem" knowledge and his funny stories, interesting anecdotes. He also gives you plenty of time at each spot so it didn't matter that it wasn't a private tour. He is extremely personable and makes the entire trip a great time. Highly recommend!

Group with guide for the week. I brought a large group to Cape Town for company visits mixed with cultural events. Joe was with us for the full week--even when we were visiting local businesses. He made sure we got where we were going and the bus was ready when we were done. Patrick was our driver for the week and just great! Joe was knowledgeable and shared details with the group while traveling from place to place. He made local dinner reservation recommendations when faced with a last minute change in our schedule. We worked with Rob in advance to make all arrangements--extremely responsive and professional. They also helped with ground transportation from the airport to our hotel. A great company that I highly recommend!

Cape Town Uncovered - a great day tour with Rob. We a group of 6 friends had a great day with Rob on our Cape Town Uncovered Tour. Started our day early covering beautiful drive - Chapman's Peak Drive to reach Cape of Good Hope ahead of anyone else. It was Rob's idea to explore this beautiful place alone before the crowds and was a unique experience. Rob is full of life and very informative. We feel lucky to have him as our great companion for the day. From Cape of Good Hope we reached Cape Point and after exploring the stunning place enjoyed breakfast at Two Oceans Restaurant. We started our journey ahead to Stellenbosch winelands covering Boulders Beach National Park - visiting the African Jackass Penguins. Visited 'Waterfords chocolate and wine tasting' and after wine tasting enjoyed our lavish lunch there in beautiful outdoor environment. The day was long but we really enjoyed it to yhe fullest.

Great tour of Cape Point with Rob.. After reading fellow trip advisor reviews I booked the Cape Point day trip for my husband and I a few weeks back. I have been to Cape Point a couple of times before - my husband was a newbie - and we both had a great day out with Rob. He showed me things I've missed on prior trips to Cape Town/Cape Point (Cecil Rhodes Memorial & the "2nd" lighthouse at Cape Point) and kept us thoroughly amused and entertained all day long. But to say Rob is just amusing is to undersell his wealth of knowledge about the area, its challenging history and its biodiversity. He is both funny and incredibly bright. And nor can I thank him enough for his lovely lunch recommendation in Simonstown - a 'locals' place for the best fish and chips I can remember. Plus a bottle of wine for USD $8. Plus mushy peas (you can take a girl out of England but…) I'd recommend Rob to anyone looking for a great trip around Cape Point.

Cape Point Adventure with Rob. When you tour with Rob, he's part of the attraction. You'll be hard pressed to find someone as passionate, entertaining, informative, and altogether his own force of nature. I don't know where his store of energy and enthusiasm comes from (or where I can get some) but I'm so glad we found him. He made our day so much more interesting than if we had tried it on our own. Check out his website for video so you can see him in action. What you see is what you get. Want to know about ostrich? He's your guy. Penguins too. Politics? He can help you out. Just don't ask him about Lion's Head.... :)

Garden Route with Rob. Back this year for a second tour with our buddy Rob after a great Cape Point trip last year.5 days on the road and Rob can keep it up all the way - jolly banter, intelligent chat and lots of knowledge - this trip was a lot of fun.Rob really added value - best places to go, stay and eat. We did everything we wanted and a whole lot more - animals, scenery, walks. Highlights included walking with cheetahs and elephants plus ostriches, dolphins and a great game drive. Much more than we could have done ourselves.Rob was brilliant again - really flexible and looked after us all the way - always good travelling with a friend. Great guy.Happy Days

Miss this, go to Cape Town again!. Our family's days in Cape Town, Specifically with Rob on Garden Route tour were extremely wonderful. Rob is really energetic, enthusiastic, he knows how his customers feel and therefore, he can satisfy them, even my little 7-year-old kid. His enthusiasm always keeps us up, inspires us and helps us to truly understand and enjoy the gift that nature has given to South Africa. He is very knowledgeable, he knows all the best so that you can have lots of choices. His flexibiity will make your tour very interesting, no rush, you can enjoy everything! Together, we did the Bungy Jump in Tsitsikamma, and it was brilliant, I didn’t pluck up enough courage to do that but he had succeeded in persuading me to do that, and we did it, as a team! And, I have to say that it was the most joyful tour we have ever had!

Cape Point tour, a must do. We did a full day tour of Cape Point with Rob and it was the best day we had in South Africa. Rob is so knowledgeable and enthusiastic that we not only learnt all about the area but also a lot of South African History and lifestyle, so interesting. Rob was flexible and so we were not rushed. If we wanted to stop for photos, it was no trouble. The scenery, beaches, cliffs, penguins, ostriches, elands, Chapman's Peak, and more.. all amazing and Rob knows all the best places. Take plenty of sunscreen and water if it is hot and good walking shoes as there are some short walks at Cape Point and you might scramble over some rocks at some beaches, but only if you want to. This tour is certainly a must if you are in Cape Town.

Great Job, Cape Convoy!. Had an absolutley brillant experience with CC. Our driver Joe, was super personable and very knowledgeable of the sights, the history and the general state of affairs in Cape Town and SA as a whole. His observations and conversation made the tour very, very enjoyable and educational.We booked through Rob and found him easy to work with and punctual in his follow-up communications. Pricing was very reasonable and we booked a whole day private tour - but basically followed the standard tour route, which covered 99% of what we wanted to see anyway.We give two hearty thumbs-up to Cape Convoy and highly recommend that you use this service should you wish to see the sights of Cape Town and its surrounds!

Perfect introduction to ZA.. Really couldn't have asked for a better introduction to our first time in the Cape. Rob was an absolutely fantastic guide (with a great sense of humour), who went out of his way to make sure that each and every guest had a memorable day. Our Cape Point day tour went very quickly, despite a very early start, but I couldn't believe how much we got to see and do by the end of the day. This was no doubt due to Rob's expertise, and careful planning of the tour itinerary. Lots of fantastic photo opportunities, with Rob obliging as a dab-hand photographer. If you're looking to tour the Cape Peninsula, look no further than Cape Convoy Tours.

Great day out. Just arrived back home after a wonderful three weeks in South Africa. One of the main highlights was our day trip down to Cape Point. Rob was not available (toothache). However, our stand-in guide/driver Joe was brilliant. Joe's knowledge of the Cape (and of South Africa in general) was outstanding and his obvious love of his country was infectious. He took us to every place of interest and allowed us as much time as we wanted - to make the most of each stop. He was so friendly and considerate towards us that he felt like a friend by the end of the day.Thanks Joe.

Cape Point tour. It was a really good day and we were lucky with the weather. Rob is an experienced guide who knew the best times to visit the different places, avoiding the queues. We saw great places, had fun watching various animals, especially the baboons. The restaurant recommended for lunch was great - good food & wine, great location. Highly recommended!

Spectacular Rockin' Day Not to be Missed!!. From start to finish Cape Convoy Tours (via Rob's infectious enthusiasm) had us on an unforgettable trip. Can't recommend this tour more highly to anyone who wants a unique, fun, personal experience of some of the most breathtaking places on the planet. The real joy is that you know from the first moment (like randomly picking up some fellow travellers in the colourful Bo-Kaap) you're not just on some jaded formulaic scripted sightseeing tour. Rob's whole approach is to take the road less travelled (literally and metaphorically) so you wind up at all the superb highlights from Cape Point to Chapman's Peak to even an unexpected spin up to the Rhodes Memorial without another tour bus or queue in sight. Add in some winning Essex charm, fascinating historical ad-libbing, socio-politically incorrect insights (This is South Africa!), a picture postcard lunch location, docile penguins, rude boy baboons, a few feral ostriches and some of the best photo opportunities in the world and you're in for something very special indeed. Looking forward to our next trip already,Cheers Rob, 1 LOVE from Dave and Mallory ("diamonds are forever") in Dublin.

Fantastic. Cape Convoy was a perfect way to see Cape Point. Rob is a fantastic guide, in terms of personality, and also having an intimate knowledge of the Cape that benefited us, the clueless tourist. We enjoyed the scenic vistas, experienced a pack of baboons, and got to Cape Point before the crowds and clouds rolled in. His knowledge was especially handy at Boulder's Beach with the penguins. We arrived shortly after a large tour group. Rob directed us to a spot to observe the penguins that was free of crowds and offered an un-rushed view of the penguins. Make him tell you the prawn joke.

Wow!. What a great day we had on the Cape Peninsula tour with Rob. Our tour group was only 5 people and very compatible. (Luck of the draw) We had perfect weather, got to Cape Point before the clouds and crowds rolled in. Saw baboons where Dias landed. Was fun watching them try to open the van doors. Took the funicular up to the Lighthouse and enjoyed the spectacular views. Next was Cape of Good Hope where we saw wild ostriches along the road as well as the fantastic waves hitting the rocks. Could have spent hours there. Stopped at Simon's Town, a quaint village, for lunch and a great local beer and malva pudding. On our way back to Cape Town, we took Chapman's Peak road. Views of the Atlantic were beautiful. If you take only one tour in Cape Town, this is the one to do. Rob is absolutely great!

You must try it.... One of the best tours and tour guide we ever experienced. Rob is 5 stars, knowledgeable, fun and full of contagious energy. We did the full Monty in one single day with all the important Cape attractions seen plus 3 wine tasting visits and still got back to Cape Town in time for an early supper. Great memories for the whole family, Thank you Rob!

Excellent tour guide. Rob was a great tour guide. He was knowledgeable, interesting and fun. We left early in the morning from our hotel in Cape Town on a coach with my husband's work colleagues and families. His company had organized the tour with Rob. Our early start paid off. Rob got us to see the penguins and the Cape of Good Hope before the crowds. We had the places to ourselves. I appreciated his concern that we had the best day ever, and we did!

Fabulously fun day. I cannot stress how great of job Rob Salmon does from start to finish. He is funny, energetic and extremely accommodating. Most importantly, we took the full day Cape Tour on January 1--one of the BUSIEST days of the year. Rob made sure we left early and re-routed the itinerary so that we beat the crowds to every stop on our agenda. We did the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point with no wait times and no crowds, he phoned ahead to the delicious Bertha's in Simons Town and made a reservation for us outside at a waterside table and when we visited the penguins, he advised us to go to the right. ALL THE CROWDS WERE TO THE LEFT and we did not have to fight for viewing space and great photo ops!! Very knowledgeable about Cape history, too. And excellent at answering emails in a prompt fashion. Wish we could take Rob to countries all over the world with us!!!

Must do!. We did the Cape Point tour with Rob in November. We were picked up early to beat the tour buses to Cape Point however, we never felt rushed at all. We stopped off at many attractions along the way and Rob told us about the fascinating history of South Africa in a very entertaining way. We made it down to Cape Point first and we had the area and the sign to ourselves for 15 mins before the tour buses started turning up. The early start had become completely worth it as about a hundred tourists poured off the buses.Rob goes to every length to insure that everyone is included and feels comfortable and no one is ever felt left out. you learn and see so much on this tour while also enjoying plenty of laughter and banter along the way.The penguins are also amazing and Chapmans peak is stunning. This tour with Rob is an absolute must if you are visiting Cape Town.

Best Tour Guide EVER!. We booked a day around the Cape Town Peninsula with ROB and even though we were feeling so terrible from being sick we pressed on with the tour and VERY happy we did. Rob is so fun and energetic and it's almost impossible to not smile when on his tour. If you want to feel the energy and excitement around such a beautiful part of the world then by all means don't hesitate to contact him and book a tour. He takes you to all the places that are picture perfect and takes the time to show you a few hidden gems with great explanations along the way. In that one day alone we saw Penguins up close (and lots of them), baboons (on the van), and a family of ostriches. I've done many tours in my travels and Rob is the best guide I've had yet!!Thanks Rob and I'll see you on FB

The one to go for. We went round the Cape Peninsula with Rob in early November. He picked us up on the dot and the six of us that day had a wonderful ride. Rob laid on some great weather ( it is in his power!) and kept us entertained and informed all day. He has an excellent touch in ensuring that everyone participates and is taken care of.Great value.

Absolutely Fabulous Scenery, Wildlife and Guide (Rob) - THE BEST!!!. We joined Rob for his Cape Peninsula Tour in November.During many years of travelling, we've never taken a guided tour. I suppose we thought it would be boring, a rip-off and ultimately a waste of time and money.We decided to join Rob on his Cape Peninsula tour - based on the fabulous reviews he was getting on Trip Advisor. It was genuinely awesome in every way and fantastic value for money. He says from the outset that he'll do anything he can to fit the day around you and what you'd like to do - and he means it. Just a few of many examples - he'll drop you right outside an attraction where he can't park. Go park the car and run back like an idiot, just so you don't have to walk too far, or wait too long. Rob kept telling us that he'd get us to the Cape of Good Hope before it got busy, so we could take our pictures by the sign before it went mad (he guessed about 10 -15 mins after we got there). Rob kept his word, we got great pictures and 10 minutes later hoards of coaches and cars arrived and the only pictures people could get of the sign, were those with crowds of strangers in. Rob's happy to take pictures of you and will also show you some of the best places to take the photo's from.It would take too long to individually list everything that was good about the day but here's a summary.Picked up from accommodation as promised - bang on time.Rob is one of the most knowledgable, engaging, funny people you will ever meet. You end the day feeling as though he's one of your best mates.Fantastic tour that fits so much in to one day - astonishing balance between relaxing and fast paced.We saw some of the most beautiful scenery possible, had to stop for an Ostrich, watched baboons on the Cape, pulled over on a beautiful beach drive to see a huge number of wild dolphins swimming near the shore (maybe 20 or more), watched penguins at the fabulous Boulders Beach, had a lovely lunch in Simon's Town - and so it goes on!If you're considering a tour - you must go with Rob. Like us, you can then join his many fans on this page who have had an amazing experience and loved every minute. Thanks again Rob!

The Peninsula Tour. We had a brilliant day with Joe! He was there to pick us up even before he promised to be, he was very interesting and knowledgeable guide, and we got to see so much. Joe was very helpful and friendly all day long, and we especially appreciated how he made us feel that we are on that trip together - instead of just talking to us only when there's some sight to see, like some guides do. So all in all, a great tour, with which we were very happy!

Absolutely the best. If you're looking for cape peninsular and/or garden route tour then you're in luck! you've found the best man for it at Cape Convoy - ROB! Rob is very knowledgeable about his beloved CT and SA and is a wealth of all sorts of information. He will do everything possible to make your trip special and fabulous and you needn't worry about a thing - just tell him what you want and he will try his best to help or will be very honest with you. Rob genuinely wants you to have the best time.Uncharacteristically for me, I didn't ask him beforehand about the accommodations on the garden route tour, and I needn't have worried - they were all first class accommodations. Rob re-jigged our plans to ensure weren't stuck doing an activity in the rain and suggested fantastic activities we could pick up during the days and arranged one very last minute for us.It felt like we were doing the tour with an old friend, and Rob will ensure you have the greatest time.

A real Cape Town character! Great guy, awesome tour.. We booked a private tour with Rob for the Cape Town leg of our honeymoon in September. Although the weather wasn't great, we barely noticed as Rob kept us entertained the whole way to Cape Point and back again.In fact, Rob's colourful and detailed knowledge of South African history meant we kept forgetting to look out of the minibus whilst driving along! In addition to having a great knowledge of the area, Rob is one of the most interesting (and at times outrageous!) people we have met in a while, He is a great guy and made our Cape Town trip truly memorable for all the right reasons.Definitely book with Rob if you want to hear the unabridged history of South Africa - and if you are up for a laugh and a bit of banter along with great views and beautiful scenery.

A perfect day for our Cape Point Tour. From the moment Rob picked us up from our hotel, we knew we were in for a great day. We were very lucky with the weather...the best day in a while. There were many sights along the way and Rob never rushed us. He is an excellent guide, very knowledgeable, and has a great sense of humour, which always makes a great day even better! There were many amazing photo opportunities. I would definitely recommend Cape Convoy Tours to anyone visiting Capetown.

Cape Tour - great way to see so much in just a day. We had an amazing day with Rob even though he was recovering from flu and was still feeling a bit rough. He was so friendly with my children and made sure we saw all the sights around the cape. We reckon it would have taken us three days to have covered the same ground on our own. Great value for money!

An amazing, fun and witty experience. This is the first time I have opted to take an "organized" tour anywhere. I typically prefer to just travel on my own. However, this time with driving being on the opposite side and time constraints, I opted for a tour of the cape. I discovered Rob through the trip advisor website. He was quick to answer e-mail, and setting up the tour was easy. The tour was not what I expected, but in a great sort of way. Rob is an energetic, intelligent, funny, witty guide. Riding in him with the car, I just wished the day would never end. The day was full of interesting information, of personal stories, geography, history - simply the right mix of everything. Then we get to the cape, and we were a small group, so he let us wander on our own!If you are looking for an interesting, funny and different kind of tour to the cape, look no further. Rob is the guy for you. This was an experience to cherish, and one I will always be smiling when thinking of.

A Brilliant day with Rob on the beautiful Cape Peninsula. We weren't especially lucky with the weather that day, but Rob's local knowledge and flexibility meant we got to see all the highlights at the best moments. He's a great character with lots of stories and jokes which kept us all entertained, as well as a wealth of information about the history and geography he shares with everyone. The area is beautiful and is worth seeing with or without a guide, but if you want fun and light-hearted way to see the Cape with some local knowledge thrown in too, we can't recommend Cape Convoy highly enough.

Rob is the best!!! Totally different!. I'm so glad we got rob instead of any other tour! His tour was personal and much more fun! He tried to avoid the crowds also! You must book him if you're going to do a cape point tour! Worth it!!!! Such a great guy too

Highlight of our Cape Town visit!. Rob took my friends and I - a group of 8 girls - on a tour of the Cape Peninsula on a perfect day in Cape Town. I don't think we stopped laughing and learning the entire tour! Rob is incredibly energetic, knowledgeable, and funny - a super tour guide! He always told us the route of our tour and stopped along the way when he saw a great photo opportunity. He definitely knows the in's and out's of touring the peninsula and made sure we were most efficient with our tour route.We asked in advance if we could visit the seal island in Hout Bay and he was kind enough to arrange our tour itinerary to squeeze in our request. Also, on the morning of our tour, we mentioned to Rob that we hadn't been able to visit Table Mountain yet due to the fog and the next day we were leaving to go to Stellenbosch. Rob told us we most definitely couldn't leave Cape Town without going to Table Mountain. Since we had such a beautiful day, after we finished our awesome tour with Rob (including seal island, Boulders Beach, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope), he drove us back to Table Mountain in time for us to take in the evening views. The traffic was really terrible leaving the mountain but he insisted on driving us all the way to the top to drop us off at the entrance. It was incredibly nice of him. We squeezed in a lot in one day but Rob never made us feel rushed. We all really loved our day with him and think I can say for all of us, his tour was the highlight of our visit to Cape Town!

Amazing, A Must Do!!. The last full day my friend and I were in Cape Town we went on the Cape Convoy tour. I am more than grateful for being able to see all of the area including Cape Point in the best way possible! Rob is the most enthusiastic tour guide I have ever had and I would recommend him to everyone! He kept everyone entertained while also finding the best spots for the most amazing pictures I have from the trip. He made you feel like you have known him for years and was so full of information that there was never a dull moment on the trip. This tour is a must do for everyone visiting the area! It was definitely my favorite day on my trip!

The one to choose for the Cape. Rob is not only a great guy, he will take you to the best spots along the way and do everything possible to make it an unforgettable experience. And it is. On our way to the Cape we saw whales and penguins and baboons, and he took the time so we all could get our shots. And on the very tip of Africa he took care of both those who wanted to enjoy the view from a comfortable spot as well as he made time for those who wanted to do a little hike. I'm sure everyone had a great time. And who can forget the fisk & chips in Simons Town and the beautiful scenic route along Chapmans Peak on our way back. Thanks Rob, I really had a fantastic day!

A Guide with the Right Attitude. Rob is an amazing & enthusiastic tour guide. We spent 2 days touring the wine country & Cape Point. He did everything in his power to see that we had the best experience possible. We would never hesitate to call him if we head back to Cape Town.

Do not leave Cape Town without a day with Rob. My wife, daughter and I booked the Cape Peninsula tour with Cape Convoy tours after reading the stellar reviews on TripAdvisor. We can honestly say that is was the most enjoyable tour we have ever been on. Rob picked us up promptly at our hotel and then we picked up 2 other couples to join us on our adventure. He immediately set the tone for the day and put everyone at ease with his spirit and enthusiasm. Rob laid out our plan for the day to hit all of the highlights of the beautiful Cape Peninsula. We were fortunate to also have an absolutely perfect day for our touring. He knew to beat the large tour operators by going straight to the Cape of Good Hope before the crowds arrived. Throughout the day he kept us involved and interested in what we were seeing with his extremely vast knowledge of everything we saw. The pace was never rushed and offered ample opportunity for exploring and photo ops. When we stopped in Simons Town for lunch he had many recommendations for different restaurants so everyone could chose something to their liking. We could not believe his knowledge, enthusiasm, and constant humor; we felt as if we were seeing all of this beauty with a long time personal South Africa friend instead of just another monotone tour operator. Highly, highly recommend

We love Rob!!. My husband and I have just come home after a long but extremely fun day doing a tour of the Cape with Rob from Cape Convoys. He is an Essex lad who has been in South Africa for a whole bunch of years and is the best of both worlds. He has bags of personality and a story for every situation. Like all the best tour guides, he knows all the facts and the best spots. He picked us up at about 8:50am and we did not get back until about 5pm. He took us to a great place for lunch, we saw the penguins and a whole load of other stuff as well. A great day.

Great Experience Cape Point Tour. We had a blast with Rob. He was so knowledgeable about the history of the area and is hilarious to say the least. I was leading a group of 13 students from the USA and we were well taken care of. He was very flexible and really calmed our fears traveling with many students in a new country. Well done Rob!

Fun & informative Cape Point Tour!. My boyfriend and I went for the Cape Point Tour with Rob in late September. He is an amazing and friendly guide who has lots of knowledge on the sights and history of the city! He makes the whole experience really fun with his jokes and witty remarks. We also really liked how he tailored the itinerary of the tour so that we would avoid the tourist crowds. Both of us enjoyed our day trip and would recommend all of you to go on his Cape Convoy tours.

Excellent Garden Route tour!. Being a solo traveller I searched for Garden Route Tour for quite a while more than 3 month in advance. Some tour operators did not respond at all, some recommend contacting them couple day in advance while I am in Cape Town. Not acceptable for me. Rob was different. He offered 3 days Garden Route Tour, instead of 4 I originally was looking for, but with all places I would like to visit. When he arrive to pick me up at the hotel it appears that couple who supposed to be in the tour with me cancelled their booking. So it turned to be private tour. I was really impressed that Rob kept his commitment to me. Travelling with him is a lot of fun. His knowledge of the country, area we travelled is complete. Hotels he booked were excellent and restaurants he recommended worth a visit. We stopped at interesting points of Route 62, visited Ostrich Farm and Kango Caves in Oudtshoorn area, Tstitsikama, Knysna, Mossel Bay. His flexibility is also worth mentioning. Depends on weather conditions and his customer’s interests he can add something different to the tour. Results: I saw more than I planned to see during the tour and made lots of pictures from one of the most beautiful places in the World. In short Garden Route Tour with Cape Convoy exceeded my expectation and I would recommend it to anybody. When I will be back in Cape one day, Cape Convoy would be my first choice for tours. Thanks Rob!

An Amazing Adventure (Garden Route & Cape Peninsula Tour). There are no words to describe how awesome Rob is. But I'll try to explain my mother & I spent 6days with him. We did both the Garden Route Tour & the Cape Peninsula Tour. You'll always find him smiling. He's is amazing, heck in the end he became family. Plus he has the funniest stories you've ever heard! He made me fall in love with road trips. On the garden route I got the chance to ride an ostrich, enter the coolest cave, zip line from tree to tree, & I got to watch some people bungee jump & dive with sharks. So give the garden route a try. Its safe fun for the whole family. And it was one of the best experiences of my life. Thank You So Much Rob We'll never forget you :)

Like touring South Africa with your best friend.. That is the sentiment my girlfriend and I had after taking the Garden Route tour with Rob. He is awesome, in that his tour really inspires awe. Rob tailored our tour to our specific interests and always had us engaged in the most entertaining, educational, and scenic activities. We hit on all of the major spots along the Garden Route; Knysna, Tstitsikama, Plettenberg Bay; and even added in an afternoon of walking with elephants at a sanctuary after Rob learned of my girlfriend's obsession with them. Rob booked us into wonderful accommodations along the way and went above and beyond to ensure that everything was to our liking. He truly cares about the well being of his guests and always had informative stories and humorous jokes to keep the conversation going on the scenic drives from location to location. By the end of our journey we felt more like good friends than tourists and guide. If you want the perfect mix of fun, humor, and local knowledge then book a tour with Rob and Cape Convoy.

Wow, what a fun, awesome day we had to Cape of Good Hope. Having searched Trip Advisor for sometime to locate a good day tour to the Cape of Good Hope I happened across "Cape Convoy". I have to say we were not disappointed in any way at all !!!. From the moment we "plonked" ourselves in his van to the time we arrived back at our accommodation we laughed, we were informed, we were educated and there was never a dull moment throughout the whole day. Rob knows his stuff, is interesting and funny and he never rushed us at anytime during the days tour - Rob even became the photographer at some points of interest. The only thing to watch out for are the ostriches... they run at you while being photographed. Now that set Rob going !!We had the first fine, warm day for some 3 weeks so we were blessed from that moment. Rob should I ever get back to Cape Town I will booked on one of your tours for sure.... thank you for an awesome day.

Look no further :). If you want a day that’s fun and informative then look no further! Rob truly is an amazing tour guide, my only regret now is not booking more tours with Cape Convoy as we had a wonderful day in the Cape Peninsula and are still talking about it :). This was definitely the highlight of our stay in Cape Town. Rob is extremely knowledgeable and very interesting to listen too, he really does know his stuff and most importantly the tour was great fun. Rob also kindly give us lots of invaluable advice regarding our trip along the garden route, which I now wished we had booked through Cape Convoy rather than doing ourselves. Rob also likes to keep his tour group’s small which is nice as this made the tour feel more personalised, we were also able to see and learn so much in one day. Rob is also flexible and timed each attraction perfectly so we missed all the crowds, especially when we visited Boulder's beach which was very impressive. This allowed us to enjoy and appreciate each attraction so much more. We also saw the most amazing scenery during our tour.I cannot recommend Cape Convoy highly enough! I am planning on a RTW trip with a friend next year and after falling in love with South Africa I am now intent on re-visiting and will definitely be availing of Cape Convoy's services again. Thanks for a great day Rob :)

I love me some Rob!!!. What can I say about Rob other than that he is AWESOME !!! He's knowledgable, flexible and above all fun - Never a dull moment or awkward silence. Rob took a group of 8 out for a tour on a cold, bleak rainy day and from the get go he was high spirited and funny. He was filled with stories and jokes and we all enjoyed ourselves immensly. Due to weather conditions and a road block we werent able to complete the entire tour that we orginially booked with Rob but he was happy to drive us around town, show us the hotspots and he even refunded us for the portion of the tour that we didnt do. Our only regret was that we didnt book Rob for any other of our tours. I highly, highly , highly recommend Rob - you wont forget it.

A great tour with a wonderful guide. We spent a wonderful day out with Rob, exploring the peninsula. It goes without saying that the scenery is stunning, so having someone who can get you to each spot at the quietest point means each of those places is that bit more special. Rob is a lovely, lovely bloke: very informative and great fun - he certainly knows his stuff, but just as interesting were his thoughts on life in South Africa. If we'd just spent the day in the pub discussing contemporary South Africa, it would still have been money well spent.We had five others along for the tour - all great company, and I think everyone had a great day. A wonderful tour with a top man.

Party Bus - tour of Cape Point. Rob is a one-man entertainment - he talked his way from Cape Town to the Point and back again. He is funny, entertaining and well-informed - although he does tell terrible jokes :). He adapted the tour to ensure we reached the point for the best weather in a difficult weather day, whilst ensuring that we still saw as much as was possible. Book with Rob and you won't have a boring trip that's for sure!

Great Tour! Rob knows what he is doing very well!. Rob is a fun person to do the tour with; he is very knowledgeable and tells jokes and other stories nonstop. He picks you up at your hotel with his minivan and makes sure to stop at several interesting points and reserve enough time for you to explore. Our tour consisted of him, my wife and me and 4 others.We stopped at Boulder Beach to see the penguins. Rob told us how to best avoid the crowds and he was right, we saw everything and were almost by ourselves and the big crowd of people was always somewhere else. Then we stopped at Simontown for a restroom, lunch and shopping break. There were street vendors who had the best souvenir prices that I have seen in Cape Town…if you bargained hard. At Cape Point, we had approx. 1 1/2h to spend at the lighthouse and hike. Then we drove to the cap of good hope and, again, Rob managed to get us to the sign and our photos taken in record time. Thank you Rob!We then spent another half hour or so at this breathtaking spot before we left. Rob took the scenic road, that all other tours take in the morning and not in the afternoon, so we had several gorgeous spots where we stopped all for ourselves.Long story short: Rob loves what he is doing and you feel it and he is very good at it. I definitely recommend doing the tour with him.

Rob is the man!!!. I stumbled across Cape Convoy from a Cape Town tour book and booked the peninsula tour. I thought it sounded like it would be a good introduction to the city, but had little expectation beyond that. It turned out to not only be a great introduction to the city, but also a day full of laughs and great fun. Rob is by far the best tour guide I have had in any city I have visited. Our group consisted of people of different age groups from across the entire world, but Rob's personality and energy made sure everybody had a great time. We spent 6 days in and around Cape Town and this was the most memorable of them all.If you are visiting Cape Town for the first time, doing a day tour with Rob should be a requirement.If you have visited Cape Town in the past, but have not had the pleasure of spending a day with Rob, even you will have a great time and learn something new about the area.If you are trying to decide whether or not to visit Cape Town, the opportunity to do a tour with Rob at cape convoy should help give Cape Town a leg up.

Wonderful day out with Rob. My wife and I took the Cape Peninsula tour with Rob. We were the only two that day so we had our own private tour. Rob is very fun with an energetic personality which made the day exceptionally fun and entertaining. Rob gave us as much or little time at the stops as we wanted and was a great tour guide. Don't think twice, just book the tour with Rob and you won't regret it.

Yes, book this tour!. We had a fantastic day out with Rob, and it wasn't a sure bet that it would have been fun at all with any other guide. The day was rainy and cool, and out at Cape Point it was also pretty windy. I think some tours could have been poor in that weather, but Rob made it fun and totally do-able.We were at Boulders visiting the penguins when it started to rain. Rob sprinted back to get the van and drove it as close as he could to pick us all up. You can't prevent bad weather, but Rob came close.We saw and did absolutely everything we wanted to do that day, rainy weather notwithstanding. Big fun, very informative, and I would do it again. If you're debating, stop and book this tour!

Seeking the best Cape Town tour? Look no further bru!. I have nothing but great things to say about Rob and his amazing tours! The experience from booking to touring was exemplary. Our group of 6 initially wanted to do the Cape Town Uncovered tour on a Sunday (August 18, 2013). However, this tour is only available during the weekdays (due to the business hours of the wineries). "No worries bru!" said Rob. He accommodated our needs by designing a private customized tour to include Groot Constantia. Talk about service. And it didn't end there... A tour is a tour is a tour, right? Wrong! Rob is the quintessential perfect tour guide. Not only does he know everything this is to know about Cape Town, but he also has the winning personality to boot. Rob kept us laughing from start to finish. I have never felt my abs burn like they did on that tour. If Rob made a perfect abs video, he’d be a millionaire! My only regret is that we couldn’t stay in Cape Town longer. Otherwise, I wouldn’t hesitate to book another tour with Rob. If you’re contemplating what Cape Town tour company will best meet your needs, then look no further bru!

AMAZING!. Whenever I travel I like to do a little research online to avoid the overpacked, highly commercial tourist attractions. I went with Cape Convoy Tours because of its stellar rating on TripAdvisor as a flexible, laid back tour with very small groups, which is exactly what it was. Including my friend and I, there was a total of 4 people on our full day tour- no pushing and shoving to get to the best photo spot or be the first out of the van. If someone expressed interest in seeing a little more of an area, Rob made it happen. Everyone always says eat where the locals eat; this tour takes you to see the best areas of the Cape with the inside knowledge of a local. No crowds, nothing sketchy, just amazing views!

Would book again and again.... We booked the Cape Pennisula day tour with Rob, and had an amazing experience! He was punctual, and as soon as we got in the van, he laid out the plans for our very full day. He wasn't kidding. We were exhausted (in a very good way) when we got back to our hotel.Rob's energy, knowledge, and obvious enjoyment in being a guide, made this an amazing experience. Aside from me and my husband, there were 3 others on the tour, with 2 people who spoke very little English. Rob made sure to include them in the conversation, and checked in with them to make sure they understood what he was saying. I was impressed that he did this, as you don't see all guides doing that.Rob made sure that we had enough time at all of the stops, but made sure to keep the tour going. I just wish we knew to book more tours with him during our 2 week stay!

Excellent Tour. Now I know why is this tour rated so highly. And I'm glad I followed the advices of all the kind reviewers here. I booked a full day tour on 5 August 2013. Rob picked us up from our hotel and the journey of lots of laughter and fun began. Rob was very knowledgeable (and by that I don't only mean the places we visited). He can talk about any topic under the sun.I can see the effort in him trying to bring us to as many places as possible. We were blessed to have a good weather and good guide.Prior to the tour, we already agreed that he'd drop us at a restaurant which I had made reservation. I had no idea that it was out of the way and the traffic happened to be extremely bad on that fateful evening. He was rushing to go meet his mechanic but he still patiently drove us to our agreed destination. He's really one of the nicest, sweetest and funniest tour guides whom I have ever met. Keep up the good work, Rob!

Simply Amazing. Rob is the best tour guide I have ever had. His outgoing can do attitude makes for a wonderful experience. We booked a Cape Point tour and I am so glad we did. We got to spend as much time as we wanted in any location and was left to our own leisure. None of this be back at the bus for 2 which is fantastic. Rob is a very informative funny guy who bends over backwards to make his guests happy. We were so impressed with Rob we asked him to join us for lunch at the beautiful Salty Sea Dog in Simons Town where we had the best fish and chips to be found in South Africa. We stopped off at every point for photos and browsing round shops and curio stalls. Rob provided us with very informative information regarding to the destinations of the tour and the value for money is outstanding. I highly recommend Cape Convoy to anyone wishing to see the best of Cape Town with the Best of guides. Many thanks from Aberdeen, Scotland.

Never a Dull Moment. Bad weather and vehicle problems could have ruined our time in Cape Town. With only a 2.5 day stopover before our next departure, Rob with Cape Convoy Tours did everything he could to modify schedules and make our stay memorable. Rob was only our guide for about 6 hours, but was engaged and available anytime we needed him to optimize our stay. The Cape Point tour was beautiful, fun and very informative. Due to unforeseen circumstances a partial refund was owed after we left Cape Town and Rob worked through all the Visa obstacles to get every penny returned plus some. I mention that only to display the integrity of Cape Convoy. If I ever make it back to Cape Town I will definitely use Cape Convoy again! Thanks Rob for the fun day.

A Must When You Visit Cape Town. Rob, our Guide, was the perfect Guide. Punctual, welcoming, full of information but not spouting it like he swallowed the Internet, thoughtful towards our needs, a careful and confident driver, and, most of all, took us to all the most perfect places in and around Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope. Rob was also lots of fun and but at the same time able to discuss the broader facts of the history, the economy and political situations in many parts of the world. Stimulating, entertaining, knowledgeable.....like I said, the perfect Guide.

Incredible and entertaining tour that was the highlight of our trip!. My family and I did a tour of the Cape of Good Hope and Winelands with Rob last month and it was absolutely one of the highlights of our trip! Rob is the best tour guide you could ask for. He is extremely knowledgeable about everything he shows you, and I guarantee you will be laughing the entire day as he shares funny stories and anecdotes with the group. Our tour group was fairly small (a total of 8 people), which was the perfect size. I was a little worried about squeezing tours of the Cape of Good Hope and Winelands in one day, but Rob made it happen and we never felt rushed. We were able to fully experience and enjoy every stop along the way. It's a day we'll never forget!

Perfect day visiting the Cape!. We joined Rob on a private Cape Point Tour (family of 4 with 2 teens) on a perfect winter day. Rob is very energetic and knows the area well. We were able to explore at our own pace, stopping for photos of ostriches and baboons along the way. We could take as long as we liked at Cape Point. He recommended a great fish and chips place for lunch in Simon's Town. The penguins were definitely a highlight (and again Rob suggested a path - or boardwalk - less traveled to avoid the crowds). He was also our photographer for the day, taking some great family photos. The time en route passed quickly as we had some interesting conversations. All in all a perfect day! Thanks Rob!

Professional, Upbeat and Energetic Tour. Husband and I spent a lovely day on the Cape Point Tour with Rob. Rob was a very outgoing, energetic guy. He kept us engaged in conversation and regaled with information about Cape Town and its history as he drove us from point to point. On the way to pick us up, his vehicle broke down and Rob was very good in communicating this to us. He called our hotel to let us know what had happened and went to retrieve another vehicle. We really appreciated that he made the effort to make our trip happen even though it was just the two of us that day. Rob took us to Simonstown, Boulders Beach, Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope. At each stop, he gave us all the important information about the stop (what we could see, what we could do, etc.) and then we had free time to explore. We had enough time at each stop and didn't feel rushed. We also had brief stops at various scenic viewpoints to enjoy the scenery and stop for a photo opportunity.

Rob the Great!!. I found Rob on trip advisor and couldn't have been more satisfied. Rob told us if we have faith in him we would have an excellent tour. We left it all in his trustworthy hands and he took us around Cape Town and made sure we had the best time...resulting in tons of memorable pictures. Rob was extremely knowledgeable about Cape Town and gave us an interesting perspective on past and present events in Cape Town. He was energetic, organized, professional, and genuinely wanted you to have a great time. I recommend Rob to anyone who is looking for a tour in S. Africa.
No Baboons!. .... but despite that minor disappointment this was a really great way to spend a day. Rob's infectious enthusiasm, local knowledge and flexibility made this a day to remember. Book it!

The highlight of 2 weeks in South Africa. I booked the tour down to the Cape at the last minute and Rob was great at gettin back and telling me what was available.There were only 3 of us plus Rob on the trip and we had a blast!Rob is hugely knowledgeable about SA and the Cape ; and got the balance just right between hiding out hands and giving us enough time to explore on our own.I can't recommend highly enough - book it now you won't be disappointed!
Amazing day out!. Rob is super knowledgeable about the history of South Africa! He is fun, excited about everything and friendly! Wouldn't recommend anyone but Rob!Chris & Anne from Canada

Best Cape Point Tour guide. Dont need to look beyond Cape Convoy as Rob brings with him lots of information, life, humour, knowlegde of amazing points to capture pics. The tour is very conducted in a very professional yet friendly and warm manner, always punctual, yet easy going. Do it for the fun, high energy levels and to get to see unexplored points.

Had a blast. I had such a wonderful time in my day tour with Rob! I was a single traveller in Cape Town and it was nice to travel with a small group (5 people) for the day. Rob was a wonderful guide, picked me up on time and gave lots of good information about Cape Town. Rob also helped everyone get some terrific photos, told wonderful stories, drove safely and just made it a wonderful day. I had a lovely time in Cape Town and this day tour was really a highlight for me!!

Great fun!. Booked this tour after reading great reviews. Rob is an excellent guide...very friendly and lots of fun. He accomodated my friend and i although the tour was full. He usually takes only 6 people but that day we were 8. Due to his open and friendly nature, all the guests on the tour got along very well with one another. The weather looked a bit unpredictable so, Rob made sure we visited Cape Point whilst the sun was still shining! On the whole, we had a great day, sight seeing the prettiest places i have ever been to. Totally worth it.

Fun and busy. This was a fast but fun day. every stop had something special about it and the weather was great which made everything more enjoyable. Rob had me laughing because to me he sounded like the late Steve Irwin with the same type of enthusiasm as well. He was laid back and not overly controlling or formal about where we went or what we did. He even changed the game plan in a second when the group decided to go and take a boat out to the fur seals and their islands. He gave recommendations when he could and was honest about it when he couldn't. it was a day of laughs, observations and fresh air.

Maximum fun!. If you want to have a great day, take the peninsula tour with Rob! He has so much energy and passion for what he does, by the end of the day you will think that he has been a friend for life. Don't miss it!!!

Cape Convoy - 5 days Garden Route tours with Rob. My wife and I recently joined a 5 days Garden Route tour with Cape Convoy andRob, our guide, is enthusiastic, knowledgeable and interesting. He’s very flexible and tried to cater the tour to the best of our interests. Moreover, his programs are well screened and the lodgings are excellent. On the top of all that, as to provide additional entertainment, he kept singing in the car.All in all, it’s been a wonderful experience and we definitely want Rob to be our guideon any return trip. Highly recommended.

Brilliant Day. Really fun day, pretty packed in but didn't feel rushed and we even got in a few extra stops based on requests. Rob is so enthusiastic and knowledgable that he was a pleasure to spend a day with. You will learn and see a lot in an action packed day, our tip is to eat lunch quickly in Simonstown and not at Cape Point (over priced with bad service! But the savannahs were cold!).
Awesome!. This tour would not have been so good, if we did not have Rob as our guide! He made it fun and was always open to making changes / customisation, per our need.Rob, you're the best!

Highly Recommended!!. We spent a whole day with Rob (April 2013) and visited Cape Point/Cape Hope, Simon’s town, wineries/vineyards. We had such a wonderful time and learned a lot about S.A through Rob. He was very dedicated, professional and very passionate, which made our journey very pleasant and unforgettable. He even took the time and offered to take our photos at every opportunity; it’s nice to have a few photos with ourselves in it. Fantastic!!

Who's Your Penguin Daddy. My wife and I took the Cape tour on our first day in Cape Town this past February and must say it was the best choice we could have made. First of all, Rob - he was unbelievable in terms of his local knowledge, positive attitude, and his overall willingness to do whatever it took to make our experience as memorable as possible! The itinerary and views matched the weather - simply magical! If you are looking to take a tour of the Cape be sure to book with Cape Convoy as the prices are fairly reasonable and you will be sure to make some great memories while you get acquainted with the area.Do it early in your trip and hope for a good clear day! Rob, thank you so much!

Cape Point. What a brilliant tour. The tour came recommended and we were not disappointed. Rob was an excellent guide, went out of his way to please, and was adaptable and flexible. He is so knowledgeable about the region and history and this comes through in his enthusiasm. Highly recommend.

Winelands Tour. Rob was extremely knowledgable about the local area and the history of Cape Town. He was very flexible and tailored the day completely around our requirements. I have already recommended him to people who are thinking of visiting S. Africa and I will definitely be booking Rob again on any return trip. Once again thanks for a great day Rob!!

Hey Rob we miss you !!!! we miss your tour!!. It is a privilege to know rob, be with rob and spend time with this amazing person. he is friendly,knowledgable, humourous, kind. Just cant stop saying about him.It was a first experience for us to get a local person in South Africa for our first visit to this beautiful country to show us around this vast nation.
