I started to communicate with Rob from home and booked with Cape Convoy for a day tour of Cape Peninsula. A few days later i happen to look at his website and he offered 4ngts/5ngts packages for Garden route tour too. I too was planning to self drive on the route for about 7 ngts till Port Elizabeth. I quickly put forward a proposal to Rob if he could join us for 7ngts on the tour that i had customised myself and not for 4 ngts.He could drive us in his car from CT till PE for 7 days and be our guide.thats it. We had a quite a few email exchanges before Rob and I freezed our deal. And i was happy we both agreed. And my wife too as she did not want me to drive for long in a country not known to us.that too for 7 days with a 3 year old with us.As she and I would not be able to spend quality time as i would be exhausted. Probably i could not have seen this country more leisurly,casually if i was driving.where to stop,what to see,drive rules, safety issues etc etc use to bog our mind.So here comes Rob Our messiah!!!. He is such an amazing honesh kind hearted guy. We just finished our cape point tour. it was a detailed day tour with amazing views of cape town and peninsula. The best tour ever with Rob. And next day we were again off for 7 days on our garden route tour with the best guide in the world. My family including our lovely 3 yr old daughter too developed a good rapport with Rob. As soon as he drops us at every accomodation and he leaves us alone we start to miss him again. He was talkative, joyous and we missed his company. His toyota van was awesome. too big for a 3 people. it can accomodate 10 on a tour. Imagine we were only 3 and rob in this big van. it was fun.My daughter could literally sleep and run around at the back.All along the way from Cape town till 7 days to PE we stayed at all places, Rob guided us along the way,from cape town we stopped at Montagu(my wife shopped for nuts etc),Ladismith etc. Rob totally did not mind and he was cool and we got a know a lot about south africa,its history etc on the way.we started with Oudtshoorn(Cango and Ostrich farm),Knysna,Mosselbay(for shark diving),Storms river(Tree Canopy and Suspension bridge)Did you know, he walked the suspension bridge with us. its a 600 mt steep climb,He didnt have too but he did.He is not a commercial guide,he justs wants to get involved with his clients,be a part of the fun. At storms river he dropped my family at the rest camp and then we went to Tree Canopy tours in Tsitsikamma village. I finished the tour and he was right outside waiting to pick me up and drop me at rest camp. Then it was Addo and then rob drove us to PE with a stop over at Cheetah farm.It was really sad for all of us to part ways from PE as we were flying to Kruger. Rob is so enthusiatic,would take initiative,stop for photos etc. He helped us get discounts for us. its just truly amazing. I mean who would do that.??? He is that kind.he says he doesnt want to earn extra rather he would give his clients discounts.He wants to show his country in the best possible way he could. He surely met our expectations. Exceeded our expectations.ROB YOU ARE FAMILY!!!! WILL COME BACK!!!!Visited August 2012

Simply fantastic - one of the best tours we have had. Used Rob and Cape Convoy for a full day Cape of Good Hope/Cape Point tour after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and weren't disappointed. From start to finish Rob was excellent. Friendly, knowledgeable and completely flexible - he was there for us rather than the other way around experienced so often with other tour operators. No real structure to the day - he adapted things to suit the weather and traffic conditions, but with the promise that we would see everything, no matter how long it took him, and we did, and more. A great fun day and we simply wouldn't use anyone else in Cape Town if we go back again.

Garden tour. I recently completed a 5 day garden tour with Rob the owner of cape convoy and it was excellent.There were only 2 of us & our ages were 30 years apart, Rob was flexible & catered for all our needs. He has endless energy & is very enthusiastic. The accommodation he selected was very comfortable & friendly. One of the best tours ever.

The ONLY way is Essex!. We booked 2 tours with Rob-Winelands and Cape Point. Unfortunately for us he had to transfer us to another company for the Winelands. However, he took care of everything and even paid the difference. The Cape Point tour was with Rob-what an amazing, awesome day. If you like your tours unstructured and you're prepared to trust Rob then book with him. His knowledge and passion shines through. There were quite a few adhoc stops but well worth the time. We look forward to coming back as many customers do.

best tour ever!!. Rob is probably the best tour guide we have ever had! it is like you are taking a tour with a long lost friend! he was incredibly funny and is incredibly knowledgeable about cape town and south africa. beyond that, he is an honest guy. our tour was originally scheduled for a monday but the weather was no good so he called us and rearranged his schedule so we could go another day. most tour guides would have apologized for the weather, taken us on the tour and that would have been it. but not rob, he was willing to change his schedule so people he'd never met could have a memorable experience. and let me tell you, he makes it memorable! when i go back to south africa, i will definitely book with rob again

Jim & Caroline, Florida USA. The tour with Rob was FANTASTIC!!!!!! He is very knowledgeable, personable, and made the day one of the most outstanding during our visit to South Africa and Cape Town. We did the western cape tour and visited with the penguins, went to the extreme south end of South Africa (Cape Hope) and all of the other great sites. Even saw a group of baboons during the day which was quite unusual. All in all, Rob provides the best tours in the area.

Cape Town's best. I can't say enough great things about Rob. He gave us a quality tour of Cape Point and provided additional information from a local's perspective. During our drive along the cape the weather turned super rainy and windy. Rob offered to take us down to Cape Point on his day off so we'd get to see the view in the sunshine.i recommend Rob to all planning trips to Cape Town!

Cape Point & Winelands. Brilliant trip with the very entertaining Rob - really genuine bloke who puts heart and soul into his tours. Thoroughly recommend The Cape Point and Winelands Tour - early start was worth it to beat the crowds and then relax in beautiful vineyards with a couple of tastings.Cape Point was great - well worth the walk to the second lighthouse.We joined with two other parties to make a group of 5 and had a great time.Very memorable day.

Amazing time!. My husband and I had a few days in Cape Town and we booked Rob after reading the good reviews on Trip Advisor. SO GLAD we did! It was a fantastic time, seeing the beautiful ocean coast line, lots of wildlife - we were fortunate to see a Cape Zebra and an Eland on the side of the road! Also the amazing penguins and the cool ostriches. But what made it all really great is Rob's energy & enthusiasm for his job and his country. He is chock-full of knowledge and loves to share his information with everyone. He brought us to some amazing locations that we would have never seen taking a big bus tour- I have always liked smaller group tours better and this is that. I'm a photographer and got some amazing shots- I did a whole blog post about it here: http://www.capturedbybrooke.com/blog/?p=281. My husband and I have traveled the world over- 26 countries so far and taken lots and lots of tours and this is the one that has stuck with us the most. We loved Rob and can't wait to come back and go on a tour with him again!

Fantastic experience!. Rob showed us the unusual places and the usual ones in an unusual way. And he always had a story to tell about whatever he was showing us. He is a very funny and entertaining guy, always full of energy and ready to make friends!
Kurt

Rob is AMAZING. Rob took us on tours to see the Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, and the winelands. These tours were awesome from start to finish!!!! Rob has so much energy and is VERY fun!!!! He is extremely knowledgeable about the entire Cape Town area! He has a true passion for what he does and takes great pride in making all of his customers happy! He is very prompt at responding to emails, and we found it very easy to correspond with him from the U.S. before our trip to arrange our tours. Rob went above and beyond to make us feel at home and helped us see everything we desired! We loved Cape Town so much that we will definitely return, and without a doubt we will contact Rob to show us around again!

The best 2 days of our trip to Cape Town. I spent 9 days in Cape Town with my family to celebrate my 50th birthday last month. We spent 2 days with Rob visiting the Winelands and also Muizenberg and the amazing Cape coastline. They were the best 2 days our our trip. This is our second time with Rob. We spent 3 days with him on our last family visit to Cape Town 2 years ago. We all enjoyed it so much that we couldn't visit again without spending more time with Rob. You could say we re booked by popular request. The kids (who are 22, 18 and 11) love him and he combines an amazing knowledge of the area with a unique sense of humour. Rob is "one of a kind" and no trip to Cape Town is complete without a Cape Convoy tour. Looking forward to seeing you next time- Rob!

A perfect day. I was traveling alone in Cape Town and booked a day tour of Cape Point, Simon's Town, Boulders Beach with Rob during a day off. Cape Point was beautiful and visiting the penguins at Boulders Beach was unforgettable.It was a great day! Rob did such a good job of bringing together a group of strangers - it was entertaining and fun, not too structured or rigid. He was so good at listening to the interests of the group and organizing our day to put together the best overall experience.I would highly recommend for groups of any size!!

3rd year running. 3rd Year running and it just gets better and better. Rob is not only highly informative, professional and really flexible to individual needs, he is also very funny which makes the trip so enjoyable. The Cape Point trip and the Winelands trip are not to be missed

We love Rob!. We did a tour with Rob two years ago and when we booked to come to Cape Town for the second time we knew that no trip would be the same without booking with him again. His boundless energy and sense of fun makes the trips totally unique and he is so knowledgeable about the local area which makes the tours really interesting-ask him anything and Rob will probably know the answer! Rob totally tailored our trips around what we wanted to do, giving advice on where he thought would suit our family but allowing us to make the decisions and not putting any pressure on us. Our holiday to Cape Town would not have been the same without him and we can't praise the tours highly enough. Book with Rob!

There is such a thing as fun for the whole family!. What a blast we had touring Cape Point, South Africa, as well as Simon's Town, Boulders Beach and fiinishing with the awesome Chapman's Peak Drive. Truly a great little road trip. Rob was an engaging and fun companion who regailed us with lot's of interesting history and funny stories all while showing us all the best spots and getting us on our way efficiently.

Rob is the best!. We had the pleasure of spending two full days with Rob roaming around and those days were major highlights of our trip! He is so knowledgeable about the area, endlessly fun/hilarious, and just a general pleasure to spend time with. He is completely focused on making a great experience for his guests and you can trust him to make very special times. Thanks, Rob, will always remember you for helping us to have a great trip to Capetown!

Just Book It. We took the 5 day Garden Route and the one day Cape Point tour with Rob. We can't recommend Rob and these tours enough to do them justice. We had the best vacation of our lives. Rob is the ultimate host. He is energetic, knowledgeable, interesting as heck to listen to and watch, and he excels at what he does because he sees things from his customers perspective. His super charged brain is always thinking, "How can I make this better for my guests? What can we do better to enhance the experience for them? What do they need now?" It's all about YOU. We have never experienced a tour guide like Rob. He is the ultimate. It's enough to make you feel positively spoiled! If you are looking for a boring and laid back experience then Rob is not your guy.

Fantastic Days. We hired Rob for 2 days of sightseeing in the Capetown area. On the first day we toured The Cape of Good Hope and the Cape Peninsula. Rob got us up early to avoid the large crowds. We were able to see the splended scenery without huge masses of people. In addition he became a good friend. We felt that we were seeing the sights with a friend. On our second excursion we went to the Capetown Wine country and did some local city sightseeing. We had a glorious day. Rob made us feel so welcome. He was also very accomodating. On our first tour he picked us up at our hotel, while on our seond tour he picked us up at our cruise ship at the the V and A waterfront. Our trip to Capetown was the highlight of our cruise. I will always miss Capetown

Quite simple, Rob is sensational!. There are not enough kind, wonderful words that I can use to describe Rob. He is the most enthusiastic, knowledgeable and fun tour guide you could ever hope to meet. I have noticed that a very few number of people on TripAdvisor have rated this tour as average… I think there must be something wrong with them if they cannot appreciate such fantastic day. Even before you meet Rob, you feel like you know him. His e-mails are so friendly and welcoming. You feed off of his energy and love for such a beautiful country.As soon as you meet Rob, the day is immediately exciting. He is honest and interesting in his approach and there is not a moment of the day where you are not completely enthralled in what he is telling you and what you are looking at. He is so knowledgeable and passionate about South Africa that I believe even the most miserable of people can be inspired by him. You feel like the tour is tailor made for your needs. He completely caters to what you want to see and do. Nothing is too much trouble for him and you are thoroughly entertained for the whole day. The penguins were my favourite part but after extensive talk and joking about the infamous honey badger, Rob went out of his to take us to see one. It was the best day of our trip and I cannot recommend the tour and Rob as a tour guide enough. We have stayed in touch with Rob and are so looking forward to visiting South Africa again to spend another day with him. This is a MUST if you are visiting South Africa. Cape Point is quite simply the most beautiful place on earth and to see it with Rob is all the more special. You will have a sensational day and make an even more sensational friend!

We Saw it All. We had a very short time to see all that Cape Town has to offer. As I e-mailed around to different tour companies, I was beginning to wonder if we could manage to see what we wanted during our quick visit. Then I e-mailed Rob at Cape Convoy. He was the perfect guy to make sure we saw everything we wanted - and not just that, we saw what we wanted and we saw it how we wanted to see it. We did a Cape Point tour with a bit of Cape Town thrown in. We saw Rhodes Memorial, The Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, Table Mountain, Signal Hill, the penguins, Hout Bay and Chapman's Peak Drive. To do all that in a day, you need a flexible, high energy guide, and Rob fit the bill perfectly! many thanks Rob.

Highly recommended!. We enjoyed 5-6 hours of Rob (the owner) taking us all around Cape Town & the time flew by. He is extremely enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the history and culture of the city. For those who know Cape Town will know the weather can be a bit of a lottery at times, but Rob has a knack (mainly due to how long he’s lived there) of knowing which area to go to when the weather would be at it’s best. When we went to Boulders Beach to see the penguins he immediately took us along a path opposite to where everyone else was going. We ended up on one side of a small bay by ourselves when all the other tourists were huddled on the other trying get to the front to take photos. Nothing is too much trouble and he doesn’t mind stopping at anytime so you can take that sudden landscape photo!Thanks once again Rob.

A great tour! Rob is a legend!. We first came across cape convoy, from reading other people’s trip advisor reviews we knew Cape Convoy sounded like a great tour so we booked the cape point tour. Before we even departed Essex, Rob was very enthusiastic about welcoming us on his tour before we even got on the bus. And I have to say from start to finish, this was one of the best tours I have ever been on. For this tour, it is an early start as Cape Point is a 4-hour drive away from central Cape Town. 24 hours before the trip commences, Rob will either ring or email to confirm your booking and also arrange a pick up time. On our tour we had a small van, and we travelled with two other parties. I find a smaller group better, because there is more interaction and is easier to talk to the tour guide. On our way to our first stop, Rob explained the tour and then started to talk about the history of Cape Point. I found this very interesting and learnt quite a lot about South Africa in one day because Rob interacted with the group instead other tour guides just giving you a leaflet with all the information inside it. As Cape point is a very long drive away, Rob has a stop over in the morning. Firstly, you stop at Hout Bay to see the seals. As you pay all the fees beforehand, Rob will sort out the excursion for you. The boat journey is around 45 minutes long. But when get to the seals, it is just amazing and is great chance to get your first photographs of the day. Also you get to see some beautiful landscapes whilst on the boat ride. This is also a good chance to go to the toilet, get a beverage and a chance to purchase your first souvenir of the day, as there is a market. When you depart Hout Bay you travel along a mountain road where you get stunning views of the ocean and also Simonstown (which is the next stop of the tour). Another perk travelling with a personal tour company such as cape convoy is unlike big operators who take massive buses; you can't stop to take photos unlike what we did. Rob knew the exact spot where to take a photo and we got a great view of the town and the ocean. It was breathtaking. When you get to the town, you have a short break to stretch your legs and take in the stunning views. Then you then go to a penguin colony. At the penguin colony you get a chance to see African penguins. Once again I thought this was a nice extra touch to the trip, as you learn about the wildlife that South Africa has to offer and the views once again were amazing! Rob is always on hand to take photos when needed so that you can show your friends and family when you get home! Then you go the main attraction of the day, the Point itself. However, again Rob who is brilliant in finding terrific photograph spots, found this spot to take a photo which is still my facebook photograph! In the distance, you have the beautiful blue sea alongside the last piece of land of Africa. It was great! Then you drive down and you enter Cape Point. Rob lets you go round the area on your own, but is always on hand to help answer your queries, if you have any problems. You spend around 2.5 hours in the point and when we went it was quite misty, but nevertheless I got some photographs, which I will keep forever! You have to climb a lot of stairs to the top and but the views you get are just brilliant. You see the last bit of land, before miles and miles of ocean awaits. You also get see how many miles other cities are from the point including London and Rio de janiero. Truly remarkable. It is also quite windy up there as it is up a high altitude. In addition, you can also get food and use the other amenities. When you leave the Point, you make your way back home! But before you leave, Rob again takes you to another great photograph spot! On this occasion, you get a chance to have a photo with the cape point sign. Another great photo! On the way back, and another perk travelling with Rob, you get a chance to travel down another mountain road. This time, as it was nearing sunset, Rob stopped the van again, and took us to a beautiful beach. The sand was so soft and was very cool as well because it was a hot day. We even saw a whale as well, which was making this trip so good! And finally, you then stop at the table mountain natural park, where you get great views of the mountains and even a view of lion's peak. It was great way to end a great trip and one I will have great memories in years to come. Rob then drops you off at your hotels or apartments. Overall the trip was just brilliant and I believe the tour was reasonably priced. And Rob is one of the most funniest and informative people I have ever met, so if you want a tour which is value for money, get to know south Africa a bit more, go with Cape Convoy. You will not be disappointed!

Excellent tour guide, amazing tour. Rob is a top-notch guide. (Seriously, you won't find anyone better or more entertaining!) He's knowledgeable and friendly... and we didn't have to wait in a single line! You will NOT regret booking him. The whole tour was phenomenal!

Cape Convoy tour. Rob is absolutely amazing. He was really energetic, down to earth, and very informative. He made this trip an absolute success. My friend and I would have gone on another tour with him but he was completely booked. He did however give us advice about what we should do and who he would recommend. I would without a doubt recommend that you should book with him. He knows Cape town and surrounding areas really well and knows his history. He is funny and is so entertaining. Thank you for a wonderful time. We will be booking with him in the future when we visit again. FYi, my parents might be visiting and I would book them with him and only him.

Rob is a legend, he is the best tour guide ever.. I booked two tours with Rob before I left the UK, Cape Peninsula and the Shark Dive. I felt like we were friends even before my family and i had left the country. He is one of the most genuine people I have ever met and all he is concerned about is his clients and ensuring that they have the best and most memorable time ever. Rob is absolutely passionate about what he does. His knowledge is endless and he tells you everything in such a fun and interesting way. We laughed so much on our Cape Peninsula tour. I had a problem with my leg which meant I didn't feel fit enough to do some of the walking but he drove me up to the top of the walk and never once made me feel he was being put out or that I was holding everyone up. He was thoughtful enough also to know that when you are travelling as a family , you rarely get a family photo and he always offered to take our pictures. He knew all the best places to get the perfect shots. This is just a snippet of the things he did to go the extra mile. We did the trip on the 2nd Jan a national holiday so extremely busy. Rob thought all this through ensuring our pick up times were early enough to miss the hundreds of people all going out and the long traffic jams. He is meticulous in his planning and has great attention to detail. The trip it's self is a must do. The penguins at Boulders Beach blew me away. My husband and children saw baboons on their walk at Cape point. We also saw tortoises and zebra to name but a few of the animals we came across. Due to the high winds we did not manage to go on the shark dive. Rob tried his best to get us revised dates so that we did not miss the experience but I didn't want to do it on my last day . Rob was very understanding about this and true to his word we got every penny refunded to us. He said even if the Shark company didn't refund he would pay us back out of his own pocket. That says it all. He is genuine, honest and completely sincere. I hope we go back to South Africa one day and meet up with Rob again.

Excellent. Rob was the perfect person to take us on a tour of the Peninsula! He was knowledgeable, friendly, funny, and knew how to beat the crowds. You won't regret taking a tour with him! He's amazing!

Cape Point, Boulder Beach. I toured all over South Africa for three weeks and Rob's tour was definitely the best part of my whole trip! He took us to Cape Point and to Boulder Beach to see the penguins. Rob is full of energy and he will have you laughing the entire trip. He is also very knowledgeable and has a real passion for Cape Town. If you could only do one thing in South Africa, I would recommend the Cape Peninsula tour with Rob!

Cape Peninsula tour. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Cape Town! Rob is a friendly and knowledgeable guy, who went out of his way to ensure we had a great time. He even allowed us to move from the day we initially booked to ensure we had perfect weather conditions!We saw some amazing sites, which I will never forget!!

Fantastic Cape Point Tour. Highly recommended! Our family had an amazing day tour organized by Rob. He is the best tour guide I've ever met. If you want to keep the best memories about your visit to Cape Town, you should definitely book a tour with Rob.

Winelands and Cape Point Tour. Hi Rob, sorry this review is long overdue! We were on Honeymoon in August 2010 in South Africa and during our time in Cape Town we spent 2 days touring with Cape Convoy, one day on the Winelands tour with Julius and another day with Rob on the Cape Point trip. These were 2 of the best days of our honeymoon. Rob and Julius were brilliant and have such great energy, they do their utmost to make sure that you see as much and gain as much information on your trip as possible. There are small numbers on the tours which is great and the guys were so friendly and knowledgable. We had great fun on both trips. Their tours are such great value for money. You'd be mad not to book your trips with Cape Convoy.We would highly recommend their tours.Thanks for such great memories guys.Deirdre & Conor

Best Tourguide/Tours Ever!! DO NOT MISS. Rob is the best tour guide I have ever met. From the moment we met him we knew we have picked the right guide. He is the most knowledgable and passionate tour guide ever (and my husband and I have been to over 30 countries). We were in Cape Town for three days and my husband planned three days with Rob, as the budget conscious one in our relationship I thought we did not need to have a tour guide everyday, but I am so happy we did because it was the best decision we made for the trip. At the end of the three days we knew more about South Africa and it's rich history than you could imagine. We tell all our friends that a trip to Cape town is not complete without tours with Cape Convoy. Rob really made our time in Cape Town unforgettable. He is extremely thoughtful and we still speak of him often. He quickly becomes a friend you just have not seen in a while. We even have pictures of him in our South Africa photo book. We are always talking about our next trip to South Africa and cannot wait to see Rob again.

One of the most beautiful days in South Africa!. Rob is one of the most enthusiastic tour guides I've had in my travels (and I've been to 20 countries in the past 2 years!) He picked us up at our B&B after breakfast which made the day start out on a positive note. Easy mornings are a plus :) We spent the day with just one other family seeing all the highlights of Cape Town. Each stop was more beautiful than the next and Rob knows all the best photo spots & will very happily take your photo. He is also extremely knowledgable and can answer any questions you have. My husband and I really enjoyed his humor and felt he was passionate about taking people around Cape Town. Overall, amazing tour! Rob's tour is a must-do when visiting Cape Town!

Amazing Cape Peninsula Tour!. My husband and I did Cape Peninsula tour with Rob on January 2 and it was fabulous! First of all, January 2 is apparently one of the busiest days of the year for Peninsula tours, but Rob made sure to get us there early enough to beat all the crowds and enjoy the beautiful scenery to ourselves. His tours are kept small (no more than 9 people) and Rob is extremely knowledgeable about South African history, culture and wildlife. But most importantly, he's hilarious and fun! Also, I was a little concerned about certain parts of the tour because I was 13 weeks pregnant at the time, however, Rob was very conscious of my condition and provided some alternatives to some of the long hiking trails during the tour. I would definitely recommend Rob and his company to anyone looking for a great time in Cape Town. And his prices are hard to beat!

TheCormier's 2012. We took the cape convoy tour this December during the busiest time of the year, but somehow Rob found a way to get us ahead of all the groups and get to really enjoy what we came to see. Rob is one of the funniest guys you'll ever meet, its like having a comedian with you all day. Besides his witty word play and sarcastic sense of humor, he's a great photographer, if your looking for a great way to see what the cape peninsula has to offer, you'd be crazy to go with anyone else.

Cape Point Tour was perfect for us!. We had only 2 days in Cape Town and wanted to see and experience as much as possible. Cape Convoy's Full Day Cape Point Tour was perfect for us! Rob picked the 3 of us up at our hotel in the morning and we toured all day. From the penguins on the beach to the baboons climbing on his car to the rain and fog lifting just in time for us to see Cape Point. It was a highlight of our South Africa adventure! Rob was super entertaining, full of fun and facts, and knows what he is doing! He seemed to know how to squeeze everything in that we wanted to see without feeling rushed. Thanks for a great day!

Great!!. What a great guy is Rob and how knowledge and enthousiastic this man is.. Me and a friend did two tours with them last november and we didn't regreat that.I can recommend him any time. You will have a lot of fun with him. Also he is very knowledge and experience. He know's where he is talking about. It was above our expactations. Thanks Rob we will never forget the great time we had with you.

Best way to see the Cape. This review is long overdue (sorry, Rob!), but we toured with Cape Convoy on our Honeymoon in November, 2012. This is one of our favorite memories from our trip. Rob was great- so funny, warm and welcoming, and so knowledgeable about the history of the Cape. In just a few hours we saw all the famous landmarks, beautiful beaches, including Boulder's (with the penguins) and of course, the Cape of Good Hope. The drive is really treacherous, especially for those not used to driving on the left. Some portions are pretty sheer cliffs, and once we saw the road we were relieved we did not venture out in a rental car. It is a gorgeous drive though, and since Rob was behind the wheel, we were able to truly enjoy it. We would absolutely recommend this trip- Rob also knows some great off-the-beaten-path places too, and it makes it so much more fun. This was a definitely a highlight of our trip to Cape Town.

Rob, you rock man! What a wonderful day!. We booked Cape Town tour with Cape Convoy Tours and we ended up getting a private tour with Rob! Rob is incredible. He picked us up by 8 o'clock in the morning. Rob began as our tour guide and became our friend. He is absolutly a great guide. We learned so much from him. He has a big knowledge and passion for what he does. Every minute of the tour was full of energy and fun. We were really lucky to go on the tour with Rob, just loved every minute of it. He made sure we were happy with everything. And we could not ask for more. He exactly knew where and when to take us to avoid the crowds. He is simply the best guide ever. Rob thank you so much for making our time so special. You rock!We highly recommend Rob and Cape Convoy Tours

Such a fun tour of Cape Point!. We absolutely loved our tour with Rob Salmon of Cape Convoy Tours. Our friends had highly recommended him. Know I understand why. When I reached out to Rob about booking a Cape Point day tour, he was very quick to respond and his follow through was exceptional. He was right on time to pick us up and from the beginning until the end of the tour, he kept us thoroughly entertained. We saw many beautiful places along the way. Rob was so energetic, fun and informative. He kept my 9 and 12 year old boys fascinated with stories, facts and history about the region. He is an all around great guy who loves life and loves what he does. That made our tour around the Cape such a great, personable and memorable experience. Thanks Rob!!!

Most amazing tour you will do in Cape Town!. If there is a for company you pick in Capetown, than this is the one. Especially if Rob (the owner) is taking one of the tours. Rob is so knowledgeable, informative and hilarious. His aim is to make sure you leave Capetown having seen every inch of it and have the most memorable experience. I've travelled all over the globe and I can honestly say this is one of the most memorable tours I've ever done. Thanks Rob!

FANTASTIC!!!. Young or old, adventurous or not, Cape Convoy tours did it all for our group of 8-5 of which were family members. We did the Garden Route tour and what a ride it was. Rob was awesome! Enough energy to keep up with our 7 year old, jokes to amuse the 12 year olds and lots of stories and sites to keep the rest of us busy. We have been on many trips and tours but this was one of the best we have ever done. My friend found Rob and Cape Convoy on Trip Advisor and proceeded to initiate dialogue from there. We shared what we were looking for to get the most out of our trip to South Africa and the recommended Garden Route far surpassed our expectations. Want to do something a bit extra-bungee jumping or sky diving-no problem-Rob could find a place along the route. Shark Diving-again no problem-again along the route. Feeling like an ostrich ride or maybe some safari time-no problem. Your vacation, the Garden Route, your way. Sites galore, sunsets to remember and some of the most beautiful scenery to be seen. Thanks Rob!

Great tour, even better tour guide. A can't miss on the Cape!. For those that travel a bit, you know that a tour can be made or ruined by the tour guide. Well this did not disappoint one bit. Rob picked us up early in the AM and drove us around the entire day providing just enough historical facts mixed in with a lot of good stories and jokes. He knew the entire area like the back of his hand and took us to the right places at the right times. If I had to go again I would probably book the tour for the first day or two since he covers so much and explains what else you should or shouldn't see (around the whole country)
Fantastic Trip!!. Very well organised, Rob is a walking book of knowledge and a lot of fun! We enjoyed every minute :)

The Tour of a lifetime. From the moment we met Rob we new this tour was going to be special. It was not like any tour I have been on, it was just like going out with your mate.We did a full day tour of Cape Point and another tour a few day later, of the Winelands. I walk with a limp and Rob went out of his way to assist me whilst at the same time was not obtrusive. On the first trip to Cape piont, as we drove past Table Mountian, Rob suggested that it would be a good idea on a lovely day to go up to see it immediately. He extended the tour to enable us to fit it in. How luckly we where as on the following days it was shrowded in cloud and we would have missed the views completely! Rob was a great guide and very informative and made the day he talked to us as friends and filled the drive with interesting coments and experiences that we will never forget. His knowlege of the history geography and other facts about South Africa was second to none. The winelands tour was equally memerable we also popped in to come face to face with a cheater, fantastic Rob made the trips so enjoyable! and we had a fantastic time with him.We will be returning with our 4 children, to see Rob who made the trip so memorable . Would definitely recommend this tour!

Our South Africa Trip Highlight!!!!. This was our first trip to South Africa and my husband and I knew very little about the county, what to see/ do, etc. so we decided it was best to book a tour for the beginning of our trip. Coming from California we wanted to get the most out of our S.A. stay and Cape Convoy Tours gave us everything we hoped for and more! We booked the Garden Rout tour and Rob was an amazing tour guide and so much fun! My husband and I had a blast and felt so comfortable with him the whole time. We could tell instantly we were in good hands! Every day was an amazing adventure that gave us unforgettable memories. We stayed in wonderful bed and breakfasts, enjoyed delicious meals, and lovely company. And on top of it all, Rob knew everything there was to know about the history of the country. We never wanted the tour to end! Cape Convoy Tours is a definite MUST and a real South African gem. Our trip would not have been nearly as wonderful had it not been for Rob. If and when we go back to South Africa, there's no question that we will be booking another tour with Rob! Anyone traveling to S.A. should absolutely book Cape Convoy Tours to get the most out of this amazing country! Thank you Rob!!!!!

Fun Tour of Cape Point. We did a full day tour of Cape Point. Rob was very responsive to e-mails and was early to pick us up. Rob knows the route and the weather very well - The weather was disagreeable in the morning, so Rob took us to the Rhodes Memorial and extended our drive so that we would arrive at Cape Point once the sun popped out again. He is fun, energetic, and knowledgeable, a good combination for a long day tour. He fills the drive with his crazy experiences, history and interesting facts about South Africa. We also saw interesting wild life on the way – baboons, penguins, giant deer things, and ostrich, We went to Rhodes memorial, smithtown, boulder’s beach, cape point, cape of good hope, an ostrich farm, and did chapman’s peak drive all in one day. Would definitely recommend this tour!

A great way to see the sites!. I wasn't sure what to expect of this tour, but I am SO glad I did it! Tour Guide Rob was awesome! We met early in the morning and went out first thing to the Cape of Good Hope. The drive on the way was wonderful and informative, with Rob filling in lots of historical and cultural background. [Fair warning: Rob is a bit of a talker, so even if you are introverted there will be a conversation going!] The early start was brilliant, as we beat the crowds of busses and had the whole place to ourselves. I recommend this, and if you are visiting from the west you'll be up early because of jet lag anyway.Rob was flexible and accomodating of what the group wanted to see, and how long we wanted to spend at each place. We hit so many highlights and had a beautiful day. He knew of just the right places to stop for a perfect view and photos, and which walks to take to get the best experience. He really knows the area well, and works hard to make sure his guests get the most out of the trip. I thought it was great, and am so glad we had this day! Thanks Rob!

Excellent trips!. Me and my friend booked 2 trips with Robert which I can really recommend. We did the Cape Point trip which was great. We visited all nice sights of Cape Point and surroundings. Boulder Beach, Hout Bay, Cape of good Hope etc. Robert is a very enthusiastic person with lots of stories, humour and attention. He is very helpful and personal. We had lots of fun with Robert.The wine tour to Stellenbosch was also good fun. Robert took us to 4 wineries, not the big ones but the beautiful ones. We tasted wines in combination with chocalate, which was very good. And also his high energy level made this a great day. If you consider some day trips than I recommend Robert, because he has the knowledge, experience, he knows the best places and is very helpful and funny!

Exciting, fun tour of Cape Town, excellent for all ages - A definite must!. Our family of 5 - 2 adults and 3 children- booked a two-day tour with Rob. From the first time we saw Rob- excited and enthusiastic- we knew we were going to have a wonderful time. Rob made everything so interesting and so much fun, from learning about penguins to the history of Cape Town. He was very flexible, making sure that we saw all the sights despite the extremely unpredictable weather.He is one of the most passionate, entertaining, and genuine tour guides we've ever had, and he really went all out to make sure we had the best time we could have in Cape Town. We all love Rob to bits and we highly recommend him to anyone and everyone who wishes to have a whole lot of fun while seeing and learning about the sights of Cape Town. He is a definite must- without him, our time in Cape Town definitely would not have been as spectacular and memorable. Thank you Rob!:) - Alyssa Ling, Singapore

Never a dull moment!. So Rob is AMAZING. He kindly added me to his Cape Point Tour the evening before of the day trip. Participating in this tour was probably my favorite thing I did in Cape Town -- Rob is absolutely knowledgeable of his lovely city and region to which he also passionately added history, ethusiasm, and reliability to every stop we made. I was so happy to see penguins, dassies, ostriches, and ... BABOONS! Thanks, Rob for a lovely experience!

Cape Convoy Tours was awesome!. Two friends and I booked Rob and Cape Convoy Tours for a day of sightseeing in and around Cape Town and I don't believe we could have found a better guide. Rob was extremely accommodating, very knowledgable and thoroughly entertaining. If you are looking for someone reliable, honest, open, flexible and extremely concerned that you are happy - book a tour with him. I live in Los Angeles and have high standards - Rob exceeded all of them!Lori L.

Wonderful tour of Cape Town with Rob!. Rob is a fabulous tour guide. He is genuine, passionate, knowledgeable AND flexible. My two girlfriends are American and had never been to the African continent before. I am a native Southern African who has visited Cape Town on multiple occasions. All 3 of us thoroughly enjoyed the tour. We are all early birds so he took us out before all the tourist buses hit the popular areas like Cape of Good Hope and the penguins. He is full of interesting information and aims to please.So if you're looking for an excellent tour that you can customize to suit your needs AND be guided by a super-friendly and informative guide, Rob is your guy!

Simply a MUST!. Do you want a tour with an energetic guide that knows Capetown inside and out? Then don't hesitate in the least to book with Rob. We were only in Capetown for 5 days and Rob's tour was day 3. We did the shark drive, the table mountain abseil, and wanted to see Capetown on day 3. After reading the reviews i felt confident Rob was our guy and i wasn't disappointed. Many thanks for a great day!

Fantastic way to see the Cape with a great guide. Just finished a day tour of the Cape peninsula with Rob. It was excellent from start to finish. Rob is a great guide - fun, energetic and knowledgeable. On his advice we started early and that was key to help us miss the Boxing Day crowds. Rob tailors the tour to get the maximum for his guests, and the informal approach was perfect for us. Our kids (aged 9 and 11) said it was the most fun they'd had on a tour, and we have to agree with them! Totally recommended as a great way to see the key sights (Cape Point, Boulders, Simonstown, Chapman's Peak etc etc). Thanks, Rob.

Excellent Cape Point Tour. This was really an amazing tour! Everyone who wants to have a good tour with an excellent, fun, smart, friendly and just amazing tour guide must book this day tour! We have seen so much from the Cape and so many nice views and fun experience! I can just recommend this tour to anyone who is in Cape Town or around, be on this tour! :-)

Great Cape Convoy Tour. This is one of the best tours I have been to. Rob was friendly, energetic and experienced. We started early and managed to visit almost all the highlights of the peninsula without the stress of competing with the crowd. Such relaxing and enjoyable experience is very important for someone like me who is visiting Cape Town for the first time only for a weekend. The tour is a small group (4 of us) but people in the tour are also very friendly and helpful. I strongly recommend any one who would like to visit Cape Town to join Rob's tour!

A must in Cape Town. We loved the two tours we took with Rob. The Winelands and the Cape Tou. It was a great experience. Rob is a very caring and passioned about his job. We visites several interesting and beautiful places. The best of it is that Rob was always alert in making each and every experience unique. We definitely recommend these tours with Rob.

Enjoyable tour. We (partner and I) did the tours earlier this year but never got the time to write a review. I really enjoyed both the tours we did with Rob - the Cape point day tour and the Stellenbosch Wine tasting tour.Throughout the Cape point tour, Rob was very informative and he always made sure that we were happy with the activities throughout the day. He gave us enough time to climb to the Cape point and to grab a sandwich. We went to most of the beautiful and picturesque places on the day. Most of the time was spent at the locations as opposed to just sitting in the van which was the best part. The rest of the group consisted of one single lady and another family of 3(mum dad and an 8 yr old boy) so we didn't end up being thrown into a large tour bus. The only flaw I experienced was that Rob also spent a lot of time discussing country-specific politics with the gentleman which wasn't too interesting for us. I'm not saying he didn't include us in his topics but we felt a bit out of place during those 'off-track' discussions. Moreover, their 8 yr old son was hyper and that annoyed us for a fair bit as well (not Rob's fault at all). The wine tasting tour was perfect as we met an older British couple and we all gelled well together and had a great time. One tip for those opting for this tour - definitely visit the 'aviary/zoo' at Spier wine estate. It has owl and eagle encounters for an extra price and is too good. The trained baby owl called glory just made my day. There's also a cheetah encounter option for approx. £11 but really isn't worth as the cheetah is sleeping most of the time and there are like 50 rules about stroking it and even taking pictures!! All in all, Rob is a wonderful guy with in-depth knowledge on South Africa and the tours are certainly worth booking. Just in case you want to avoid some annoying kids - I feel it's best to ask Rob about the rest of the group beforehand!!

Best day of the holiday. We've just spent 3 weeks in South Africa and this was easily the best day of the trip. Rob collected us from our apartment at 8.15 and we spent the whole day exploring the Cape Peninsula before being dropped off at c17.00. He took us to fantastic places, some of which we would never have found on our own and nothing was too much trouble. There were 4 other guests in the minbus and he was very good at tuning in to what each person was interested in. We never felt rushed and he seemed really committed to making sure that all of us had a fantastic time. He really knows the Cape inside out and is delighted to share it with you.I would recommend him without any hesitation.

Entertainment From Start to Finish. We booked the Cape Point Tour with Rob after reading the reviews are were glad we did as we had a fantastic and full day out visiting Cape Point & the Peninsula. Rob keeps his tours small and therefore friendly, he takes the time to find out about his guests for the day and as a great people person he binds everyone together throughout the day. Rob is really knowledgeable about the area and its history and this is all delivered in a really fun way with stories which makes you want to listen to more. Whilst there is a route that Rob follows we had time to stop for the Baboons we spotted and also the Ostriches and you do not feel that you are being rushed along. Having spent some of his years in Essex, England we were able to have some good banter with him, and ha made sure he engaged with everyone throughout the day. This was a long day out but it flew by and we saw absolutley loads. A good tip is to rememeber any dates that Rob throws at you it can be very rewarding!!!!!

Excellent organizations!. Thank you Cape convoy and Rob who gave us excellent time in Western Cape. Our tour (with 16 people) was part of big trip from Zanzibar to Cape Town. And Cape convoy made everything on time. We were ordered like day trip to Cape Point, what included short trip to Four seals island, wonderful Chapmen's peak drive, Cape point and Cape of good hope! Attention! If you want to take a table in Two ocean restaurant - it will be better if you get a reservation before you start walking to Cape Point! After capes we were visited the Boulders penguins beach! Also Cape Convoy arranged for us all transfers and trip to Cape L'Agulhas. Thank you!)

Cape Town Tour. I've been on many tours, but this was by far the best I've ever had! Our tour guide Rob Salmon showing us around the beautiful Cape was amazing. He was full of information on the history of the Cape and full of fun facts. He truly loves history all around. I learned more from him than any history teacher that I've ever had had. If you are looking for a great tour guide in Cape Town. Look no farther, Cape Convoy Tours and make sure you ask for Rob Salmon. You will have an amazing time with him!

Great Day Out With Rob. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our two full days with Rob, firstly visiting Cape Peninsula and then another full day at the wineries at Stellenboch. The tour groups are small and very personal. A wonderful experience, you feel as though you a travelling with great friends. Rob is a lovely guy, a real character, he had me in fits of laughter even before we had left Cape Town.A very informative and very enjoyable two days with Rob. I would thoroughly recommend him as a Tour Guide.

Fun, educational and personal tour- Cape Towns best!!. My and my husband went on Rob's tour in aug 2011. It was definatly one of the best days of our holiday. This is something you cannot afford to miss if you're visiting Cape Town. We're planning to go on one of Rob's tour on our next visit. He's great and alot of fun!

Memorable, Excellent Guide and FUN! Wine Tour & Peninsula Tours recommended. We booked to do the Cape Peninsula Tour and the Wine Tour with Rob last week. If you're unsure whether to book, I can highly recommend you do! Rob is an all round excellent guide - well informed, friendly and very accommodating. It's a very personal tour - not at all like being on a coach / tour bus. He was really flexible for us - making recommendations and tailoring his usual schedule to suit what we really wanted to do.We went on the Wine Tour, which was wonderful. Rob knew loads of great places to go which were beautfiul, not too touristy and had excellent wines. We visited 4 or 5 vineyards and sampled wines from all sorts of price brackets - including some pretty exclusive bottles. If you think you might want to visit Stellenbosch, I really recommend going on a tour with Rob as it means you can enjoy all the wines without one of you having to be a designated driver.We also went on Rob's Cape Peninsula Tour which is definitely a must-do! Rob took us early to Cape of Good Hope, which was such a good move as we got there before the coaches started arriving - so we had it all to ourselves. It's such a beautiful country and the Cape is especially stunning - the tour was spectacular all round. Cape Point was definitely the highlight for all of us. Though you can do this drive yourself (it's quite a long one), you'd miss out on all the fun and knowledge you get from travelling with Rob. When you arrive at attractions, he was good and giving us time to explore ourselves and setting off again when we were ready.Travelling with Rob was the most fun we had on our holiday - I can thoroughly recommend Cape Convoy Tours.

Fun on the Cape. We had a fantastic day out with Rob on the Cape. He was gregarious, fun and full of tales and history about his homeland which gives you a real insight into the country. He was extremely knowledgeable and easy to get along with and made sure everyone on the trip had a good time and felt at ease with each other. Would definitely recommend.

Cape Peninsula tour highly recommended. I echo the many other positive reviews. The Cape Peninsula tour itinerary is spectacular. We saw penguins, ostriches, baboons plus dramatic scenery, crashing surf, you name it. As our tour-guide, Rob was informative, personable and entertaining. Also, the tour benefits from being a small group in a van (rather than a large bus) since there is more flexibility on where to drive and stop, and ability to answer individuals' questions. I highly recommend this tour.

Cape Convoy rocks !!! You are family Rob!!. It is a privilege to know rob, be with rob and spend time with this amazing person. he is friendly,knowledgable, humourous, kind. Just cant stop saying about him.It was a first experience for us to get a local person in South Africa for our first visit to this beautiful country to show us around this vast nation. I started to communicate with Rob from home and booked with Cape Convoy for a day tour of Cape Peninsula. A few days later i happen to look at his website and he offered 4ngts/5ngts packages for Garden route tour too. I too was planning to self drive on the route for about 7 ngts till Port Elizabeth. I quickly put forward a proposal to Rob if he could join us for 7ngts on the tour that i had customised myself and not for 4 ngts.He could drive us in his car from CT till PE for 7 days and be our guide.thats it. We had a quite a few email exchanges before Rob and I freezed our deal. And i was happy we both agreed. And my wife too as she did not want me to drive for long in a country not known to us.that too for 7 days with a 3 year old with us.As she and I would not be able to spend quality time as i would be exhausted. Probably i could not have seen this country more leisurly,casually if i was driving.where to stop,what to see,drive rules, safety issues etc etc use to bog our mind.So here comes Rob Our messiah!!!. He is such an amazing honesh kind hearted guy. We just finished our cape point tour. it was a detailed day tour with amazing views of cape town and peninsula. The best tour ever with Rob. And next day we were again off for 7 days on our garden route tour with the best guide in the world. My family including our lovely 3 yr old daughter too developed a good rapport with Rob. As soon as he drops us at every accomodation and he leaves us alone we start to miss him again. He was talkative, joyous and we missed his company. His toyota van was awesome. too big for a 3 people. it can accomodate 10 on a tour. Imagine we were only 3 and rob in this big van. it was fun.My daughter could literally sleep and run around at the back. All along the way from Cape town till 7 days to PE we stayed at all places, Rob guided us along the way,from cape town we stopped at Montagu(my wife shopped for nuts etc),Ladismith etc. Rob totally did not mind and he was cool and we got a know a lot about south africa,its history etc on the way.we started with Oudtshoorn(Cango and Ostrich farm),Knysna,Mosselbay(for shark diving),Storms river(Tree Canopy and Suspension bridge)Did you know, he walked the suspension bridge with us. its a 600 mt steep climb,He didnt have too but he did.He is not a commercial guide,he justs wants to get involved with his clients,be a part of the fun. At storms river he dropped my family at the rest camp and then we went to Tree Canopy tours in Tsitsikamma village. I finished the tour and he was right outside waiting to pick me up and drop me at rest camp. Then it was Addo and then rob drove us to PE with a stop over at Cheetah farm.It was really sad for all of us to part ways from PE as we were flying to Kruger. Rob is so enthusiatic,would take initiative,stop for photos etc. He helped us get discounts for us. its just truly amazing. I mean who would do that.??? He is that kind.he says he doesnt want to earn extra rather he would give his clients discounts.He wants to show his country in the best possible way he could. He surely met our expectations. Exceeded our expectations.ROB YOU ARE FAMILY!!!! WILL COME BACK!!!!

Great trip with an excellent guide!. We did the Cape Point tour with Rob who is hugely enthusiastic and energetic. I suspect each trip is subtlety different due to Robs style and desire to make the trip as memorable as possible. We experienced everything that was promised and more! The funniest thing we saw was the sight of baboons being chased down the road by guys with paintball guns but we also got close to Ostriches and other wild animals.Great fun with a very accommodating guide and real value for money!

Rob & Cape Point. Researching some trips to take for our 3 day stay in Cape Town, we asked through our travel agent and they suggested Thompson but after reading reviews on here, Cape Convoy was the choice. Rob picked us up right on time at the 12 Apostles Hotel and the trip was incredible. He takes you to see everything you could possibly imagine on a full day tour. Cape of Good Hope was unforgettable. It was a really clear day and Rob kept reminding us of how lucky we were to see across False Bay and that fog and clouds had disappeared. Besides the sites and landscape, the best part of the trip is Rob. The man genuinely is interested in what you have to say and loves to talk. The man does not stop talking (in a good way!). He will make you laugh the second you meet him. He is extremely knowledgable and knows the ins and outs of making the best experience you can make in 1 day. We were considering a shark dive the next day and he said it was a must. He went out of his way to arrainge for us to be picked up the next morning to go to Gansabaai for the dive the next morning. In talking with him, it was clear how hard working and how much he truly enjoys his job. I would recommend him to any person traveling to Cape Town. His tours are memorable and will be a highlight your trip.

Amazing!!. We recently did the full day Cape Point tour and could not have asked for anything better! Rob was really knowledgable about every destinaton that he took us to as well as Cape Town in general. Not only did he take us to great places and hit all the highlights of Cape Town, he makes the tour even more enjoyable with his awesome personality-- he had us laughing the entire day and he is just so entertaining you could not ask for a better tour guide to spend the whole day with!! Would highly recommend to anyone!!!!!

garden route. Did the garden route with Rob.. Enjoyed it very much. He went out of the way to take us to monkey land which was not part of the itinerary. We were with another tour group and table mountain was part of the package. Unfortunately due to bad weather we could not visit table mountain. At the end of the garden route he dropped us at table mountain which was very considerate.Very affable and flexible guy.

Cape Convoy - Cape Penninsula Tour. Outstanding Cape Tour - Like many people before me I found Cape Convoy on TripAdvisors and based on other traveller's recommendations I booked a tour with them. In late September I spent a full day touring the Cape Penninsula with Rob and a couple of other tourists. I was on a very tight timeline in Cape Town and only had one day to see the Cape and Rob went out of his way to ensure that my experience was a great one. Rob is a very down to earth guy with an amazing sense of humour and one of those truly remarkable people who truly love what they do. Rob went above and beyond to ensure everyone on the tour was not only able to see everything they wanted to see, but also ensured that we all had an enriching experience. I left the tour with a deeper understanding of the area, of the amazing sights and challenges found within South Africa. The tour was excellent value and time very well invested. I would highly recommend Rob to my own friends in a heart beat (and actually already have) - 3 of which have already taken a similiar trip with Rob and all of which have thanked me for my recommendation. Book with Rob and Cape Convoy and you wont regret it.

Excellent. We've just returned from a trip to Cape Town and one of the highlights was the tour to Cape Point with Rob.Nothing was too much trouble and his one focus was to make sure that we saw everything we wanted and enjoy the day.A very friendly guy with excellent local knowledge who went out of his way to ensure you had a great experience.No problem in recommending this guy you can't fail to enjoy his company.

Cape Town tour. Me and 2 of my friends done a day tour of cape town with Rob Salmon , This was one of the best days I/We spent of the 3 week holiday we had , Rob is a very funny guy and a great guide , Well worth the money . 10 out of 10 A Kennedy

Rob is one of a kind!. My husband booked a Cape Point tour with Rob during our 5 day stay in Cape Town for our honeymoon in July. The tour was literally the highlight of our time in CT and we wish that we had booked more time with Rob. He goes above and beyond to make sure you have the best experience possible. The weather was very dodgy in the morning and instead of going along with the tour as scheduled he changed the itinerary around so that we could get the best possible time at the point when the weather was perfect. He is funny knowledgeable and personable - I've traveled all over the world and Rob is by far One of the best tour guides I've ever encountered! He really cares about his people and his passion for what he does shines thru. Bravo Rob, best of luck to you - hope all is well thanks for Making our time in Cape Town so memorable- Carolyn and Scott - New Jersey

Cape point tour. Outstanding day of Capetown. Rob Salmon is a great guide and is very passionate about his work. Great value as well. If you are more than 4, ask for the rate for a private tour as it might work out the same or less.

Very laid back personal fun informative tour!!. Well where do we start, we have done a couple of tours that usually start slow but not with Rob this is energy from the start not sure where he gets it from as he doesn't drink coffee :0)The tours are small groups where he will guide or change it around the weather to give you the best views, stops and beat as many of the busy coaches as possible!There is a nice balance between being informative and also time to do your own thing and nothing is a problem!Rob is a highly energetic, fun guy with a lot of knowledge and if back in cape town any time would do the tour again.We were on honeymoon and he brought us a little present which was very kind and his easy going nature and fun is infectiousThanks again RobSam and Adrian

Well worth every Rand!. Booked a tour with Rob on the recommendation of a friend who had done the trip with him and wasn't disappointed. We had excellent weather for our Cape Point trip and Rob made sure that we reached the point and all of the other stops ahead of the coach trips which was excellent timing. He has an almost encyclopedic knowledge of the area and was so enthusiastic and friendly that he made the whole day extremely enjoyable. He was very flexible with timings and nobody on our trip felt rushed and we felt like we were getting a truly personal service. Book a trip with him and you will have a great time!!

Cape Point. Based on reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked a Cape Point tour with Rob. He was funny, flexible and made sure we avoided the large crowds at all the interesting points. He was very knowledgeable and told us a fair bit about S Africa's past as well as the present. We truly enjoyed our trip and wished we had more time. At the lighthouse, he even advised us to pick up some great pizzas that were value for money. Those of you who are not on a guided tour would find Rob to be an excellent guide.!!!Arthur & Priscilla,Singapore

Excellent Garden Route Tour!!. Booked a 4 day garden route tour with Cape Convoy based on its ratings in tripadvisor and some videos I watched and can say that it exceded my expectations,I had a Great time,and found a new friend. Rob is a very energetic and friendly guy.He was a wonderful guide who is very flexible & would do anything in order to make you happy and accomodate to your needs, rythm and tastes (even a 5 day tour in 4 days!!) . I would certainly recomend Cape Convoy to anyone interested in doing this trip because aftter you've done it, you would see the difference between someone who guides tours for the love of his profession (Rob) and someone who does it mainly for purely commercial reasons (Rob was not interested in selling me anything, or in stoping at any factory or shop, etc),... the difference is HUGHE! Plus you would have a new friend in South Africa! ,....What else would you like?

Fantastic 2days with Rob. Booked 2 tours with Rob while on our honeymoon, Cape Point and wine lands. Fantastic trips, had a great group and great weather for our Cape point tour. Saw lots of baboons and learnt something about them that I don't think anyone in our group will ever repeat! Rob even bought us a little honeymoon present on this trip. Next day and our winelands tour was just us and rob so it turned into a day with district 6, wineries, table Mountain and lions head! Rob changed the tour to suit us and the weather and we had an amazing day . Rob feels like a friend and not a tour guide. Great way to start what ended up to be a fantastic honeymoon. Thanks Rob.

Top rate tour. We booked with Rob based on his Tripadvisor reviews and he exceeded every expectation. He arrived at our guest house promptly and expresses his concerns with impending rain and revised the plan to be sure we saw cape point. He was animated, very lively and filled with knowledgeable information. He was very flexible and never rushed us. Making a sudden stop and u turn for us to see a family of baboons by the road and again to take pictures of 2 ostriches by the road. He pointed out many things along the way and lots of facts about life in South Africa.We had great fun as he pointed out the penguins and their habitats.On the return he dropped us at the waterfront and walked us to a favorite restaurant where again his recommendation was on the mark.We had a great day and enjoyed Rob very muc. Easily 5 star service

Awesome 5 days Garden Route tour with Rob!!. We wanted flexible itinerary with Hermanus, Oudtshoon and Knysna. Rob quoted rate on day basis without entrance fees, as this what we wanted and his quote was very cheap. We booked him and trusted him based on TA reviews. He was very friendly and tried to fit in all the things we wanted to do. He tried to keep all of us happy, which is a very tough task. He also got us discount on various entrance fees. It was an amazing time spent with him. If you want amazing time you should definitely book tour with him.

Excellent Cape Point Tour!!. I booked the Cape Point Tour for our group based on the Tripadvisor reviews and we had such a good time on this trip. Rob is an excellent tour guide. He provided us with a lot of history but at the same time had us dying laughing the entire time. The part I enjoyed most was how laid back and flexible the tour was. We had a full day of sightseeing that included the Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point Lighthouse, beautiful coastlines, penguins, ostriches, turtles, and whales. If it is your first time visiting Cape Town, then the Cape Point Tour with Rob is a must! Some of my favorite pictures from my trip to South Africa were from this tour. Next time I visit Cape Town, I hope to book another one of Rob's tours.

Great trip. Rob was knowledgeable , entertaining and really knew the history and significance of various sites. We took a one day tour of the Cape peninsula and saw penguins, whales, baboons and ostrich along with amazing scenery and spectacular views. If you have only a short time in Capetwn, spend it with Rob and Cape Convoy. You will not be disappointed.

It's simple... One of the best tours I've ever been on!. The reviews for Cape Convoy and specifically Rob are not exaggerated, he's an amazing tour guide. First of all, Rob appreciates his clients and it shows! He really goes above and beyond to ensure your time with him is magical! Before we even met Rob was easy to contact and very flexible. My wife and I were celebrating our honeymoon in South Africa and we had seen the amazing reviews for Cape Convoy on TripAdvisor. We both excitedly booked the full day tour of the Cape Pt. area. Rob was flexible which was great considering the erratic Cape Town weather making our original tour date impossible. The trip itself is amazing. The entire Cape Point region is just oozing with charm. The Cape of Good Hope, Simon's Town, and Chapman's Peak were visually stunning. Rob knew the ins and outs of each location and was able to get us to places ahead of the crowds! He was extremely knowledgeable on wildlife, South African politics, culture and seemingly anything else you might want to know. He's also hilarious! Really, this tour is a gem and both my wife and I highly recommend booking at least one tour with Cape Convoy. Our only regret is that we took our tour on the last day of our stay in Cape Town. If we had more time, I assure you we would have done another tour with Rob. Don't mess around, book it!

Fantastic Tours!!!. Had two days of fun with Rob on the Wine Tour and Cape Point Tour. Very knowledgeable guy who had smart insights on not just the content of the tour themselves but South Africa in general. He made us feel welcomed and comfortable from the get go. This guy just has an awesome personality and he knows how to deal and speak with each individual in the group. The two days we were with him were just wonderful. Gracious in every way and truly passionate with his job.Will miss the time we had with you, Bro. Cheers!!

The highlight of our trip. Small group, almost made to measure tour. Rob is knowledgeable and funny, making us comfortable from the start. Whether you are a family with small children, a couple or a group of friends, Cape Convoy will suit the trip according to your need. This is not one of those 'on your left you will see...' or 'coming up on your right you will see...'. tour. Rob engages everyone in the trip, our family of three was in the tour with a young couple and none of us felt left out. Highly recommended.

Fabulous Cape Point Day Tour. I Highly recommend booking at least one tour with Rob during your visit to South Africa!I started off my visit to Cape Town by joining Rob on a day long Cape Point tour. Rob takes care of his tour group. He promptly answers all emails, keeps the groups small, charges a fair price and is super passionate and informed about all the sites. The real differentiator for this tour is Rob. He's super high energy and gives you that insider's view of Cape Town. You can tell he's passionate all things South Africa and loves what he does. His enthusiasm is infectious and was great for our little group of 6.I will definitely book a tour with Cape Convoy again.

Fun, funny and flexible!!. Rob, is wonderful and we learned so much on our day trip with him. He is funny, fun and full of information and very proud of Cape Town. Not only did we have a fabulous day with him, but he also organized a shark diving trip and wine tour for us and de facto became our one point of contact for everything you need to do while In Cape Town. HIre rob!!!

The only way to see South Africa is with Cape Convoy.... IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR THE BEST HOLIDAY IN SOUTH AFRICA LOOK NO FURTHER....JUST GO WITH CAPE CONVOY......Just came back from the best trip of my life from South Africa (I have been to several countries before this).ROB SALMON IS THE MAN..... my family and my friends family spent 7 unforgettable days with Rob seeing best of Garden route and Cape town. He started of as a guide and ended up being a part of our family. Never seen anyone with so much passion for his job. He is a live wire and his energy is contagious. Have seen many guides in my life and i always looked at them with speculation as we believe that they are just trying to find short cuts. But with Rob whatever he did he did it in the best interest of the group. Never said no to any requests, tried his best to make sure we had a great time. We were a mixed group with kids, teenagers and old parents but he ensured that all of us were entertained and enjoyed equally.The thing with Rob is that he might seem very unconventional and not the run of the mill guides who hands you with a time schedule and push to make sure we stick to it. He is flexible and will change the schedule depending on the convenience and weather but he will ensure that we do and see the best things at the best times. With Rob just forget your schedule trust him 100% and he will make your trip memorable.He is so passionate about his job that on the 6th Day he was really very sick we offered him to take rest, but he said "this is probably the only time you will be here and I have to make sure you see the best" and there he was with a dose of antibiotic making sure we still see what he had planned for us. Really appreciate your commitment Rob.Thanks again Rob for such a wonderful holiday... We will always remember you....

Cape Town Day Tour. We had an amazing day with Rob. He shared so many great stories and jokes about the people, places, and animals of South Africa. He also showed us some of the most beautiful places in Cape Town. Rob even found me a wild ostrich, which was the last animal I needed to see before I left South Africa. He always catered to our needs and gave us one of the most memorable days during our trip. I highly recommend you book a tour with him. You will be very happy and go home knowing all about Cape Town and South Africa! :)

Great Cape Peninsula tour. My wife and I did a full day Cape Peninsula tour with Cape Convoy Tours the first week of August. What a great day!! Our guide was Rob Salmon, a really friendly, enthusiastic, energetic, good humoured, knowledgeable guy. You'll never meet someone more into their job than Rob. He's really up on his history and knows just where to get that perfect holiday photo. Would definitely recommend Cape Convoy Tours to anyone!! Thanks Rob,Andy and Jackie

Trip of a lifetime. My mom had found Cape Convoy through Trip Advisor when we found out that we where going to South Africa. While looking through the reviews we saw nothing but positive and since being back from this trip I as well have nothing to say but positive reviews. If you are looking for the BEST tour company probably in the world BOOK WITH THESE GUYS (ask for Rob he's the best tour guide I've ever met). Rob is very professional, knowledgable, & energetic (We had 3 young kids with our group and he kept them entertained). He will go out of his way to do any thing that you want to do, with our tour we modified many things we wanted to skydive, bungee jump,an elephant observatory and go on a safari and Rob made sure that it all got done by the time we said goodbye. The places that he took us to were top of the line. The perfect spot for that picture the best time to do something and even the best places to eat, all food was amazing and was inexpensive. When my family's 5 day tour was over my brother & I had said that we was going to cry because we felt like Rob was now apart of our family. Since being back in Canada I tell EVERYONE about my experience with these guys, and try to make as many South African references as possible. If you're looking for a life changing trip go to South Africa and book a tour with them, whether it be a day tour or a 5 day tour I can promise you it won't be a decision you regret.Amanda,Ontario, Canada

Cape Convoy and Tour Guide Excellent!!!. Spent 4 days with Rob - awesome and lots of laughs. Went out of his way to ensure we (3 of us) had the best possible experience while visiting South Africa. Would highly recommend and hope that Rob will one day do the "jump" - this was an experience of a life tiime for our daughter. Thanks again - enjoy your KFC Rob.

The Perfect Tour Guide. We were three adults who had never visited Cape Town before and we did not really have enough days to do justice to everything in Cape Town. We booked Cape Convoy from the UK and that turned out to be a great thing to do. Rob is knowledgeable, energetic, good humoured and most of all passionate about making sure every minute is put to good use. As well as the Cape Peninsula and Winelands tours, we found a couple of hours for the Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens (before the wine tasting) and that is really worth a visit. Rob knows all that's worth knowing about the Cape Town area. Sorry if this is another boring 5 star review, but Cape Convoy is a great way to get up to speed quickly. JamesW

cape convoy don't do it. I planned short travel to Cape Town, I would like go to one day safari or one day Cape tour. One week before I asked Cape Convoy to arrange it. Done. One day befor my arrival to Africa they told me that the travel is not possible on saturday, so I asked what about Monday. Done they agreed for the arrangement the tour. We decided to chage our plans (we were in Cape Town only 4 days!) and the Monday came. I waited over 40 min for Cape Convoy - nothing. I phoned to their office what is going on. They told the convoy will be shortly. The man came after next half an hour and... told he could not take us because other group is bigger than they booked, there were two children - they were very noisy (the man from the convoy said that) and he recommended not to com, but tomorrow he could take us. IT is very unprofessional and lack of seoriso thinking about clients. Primary we decided to change the plans third time, but later we found new agency and left the information at conseirge desk not to participate in Cape Convoy tour. It is a pity that deals are not respected by Cape convoy and MR Salmon. greeting from Poland. The thing was from te last monday, today I'm already in Poland with thinking about responsibility and respecting some rules. ewa

Perfect Tour!!!!!. Rob is such a fun loving, knowledgeable person we felt lucky to be on one of his tours. I highly recommend anyone that would like the best tour guide in all of Cape Town to choose Rob. He is willing to go out of his way to personalize your tour and to give you the best experience possible.
Patti V.
