Cape Convoy was brilliant. Cape Convoy was brilliant, Rob knew everything about all the sites we visited! He was filled with passion and information and plenty of jokes!, giving a great tour! The price was worth every penny, we always felt safe. With only 2 days in Cape Town we saw all the main attractions!

Fantastic tours with a great guide.. My wife, daughter and I spent 2 fabulous days with Rob touring the Cape and Winelands. Despite the threat of rainy winter weather, we ended up with the nicest day as we took the cape penisula tour. We spent the day seeing all the promised sites while we laughed and played all day. The next day was supposed to be the Wine tour but the rain washed us out so Rob rescheduled us for our last day. He insisted we could see the winerys and then he would take us directly to the airport. Well, we visited 3 wineries in Stellenbosch and were at the airport with plenty of time to spare. We are so glad we found Rob and Convoy Tours and highly recommend his company.

Thanks for the Great Time!. My friend and I took the Cape Tour with Rob. We rescheduled our tour because of the bad weather - Rob actually contacted us and said, the weather is horrible and you will not be able to see a thing - so we booked it for the time before our flight as that was our only available time. Rob picked us up at the airport after we dropped off our car, drove us to Cape Point and the penguins, and back to the airport. It was an impromptu sort of thing, but he worked with our schedule and the weather held up. Rob is extremely friendly and knowledgeable, which made the tour that much better. He also did not charge us for the full day as we were not on a full day tour as originally planned, which was extremely nice of him. If you are looking for good views, conversations, and experiences, look no further than the Cape Convoy! Thanks again Rob for the great time!

Best tour guide in Cape Town. My wife and I went with Rob for the shark diving, winelands and cape peninsula tours early June and they were absolutely fantastic! Rob's flexible and positive attitude even with the bad weather clouding most of our days in Cape Town made us felt like we made the most out of our trip. His enthusiasm for his work and passion for providing an excellent experience for everyone on board made him a truly special and outstanding guide. Bravo and thanks to Rob for making our trip to Cape Town such a lifetime experience!

Garden Route, Cape Point, Shark Dive. I was in SA for 1 week and I left it up to Cape Convoy to do all the planning. I did the Garden Route, Cape Point, Shark Dive, and Wine Tour. It was a packed trip but I left feeling like I didn't miss out on anything. Rob knew all the great local spots and we were able to get in on a few extras at low cost. One for example was bottle feeding baby lion cubs for less than $8 USD. I did the wine tour with H. Ross group and I thought that wasn't good at all. The places we stopped for the wine were probably the spots that have Hylton Ross the best deal rather than the best wine/ experience for the customers. I'm positive if it had been Rob and I said I wanted upscale/ downscale he would have made it happen, because that's what we did the entire time. He gauged out interest and energy level for the day and planned it all out.Garden Route: fabulous dinner recommendations, caves, ostrich farm, wine, bed and breakfast to very nice hotels, zip line, hikes, safari, township tour...Cape Point: very cool to see the entire cape and the history. If you only had one day for a tour, this is the one.Shark Dive: hit or miss if you see one, luckly i was on one of the boats that did!

All about customer service. I see that there are over 250 positive reviews about the great service "Cape Convoy Tours" provide.I can confirm that those 250 reviews are spot on.What I can also confirm, based on my own experience, is that Rob is a guide who cares about his customers.We were scheduled to visit Robben Island on 25th of June.Tickets were booked and on 25th the weather was great.However, for no apparent reason, Robben Island canceled all tours on 25th!We were given the option to visit on our last day in Cape Town, on 27th of June.We said OK, because on 26th we had booked a "Cape Point Tour" with Rob, so our last day was free anyway.Unfortunately, storm like conditions and heavy rains meant that on 26th we couldn't leave our hotel room, let alone do a "Cape Point Tour".And here is where Rob impressed us.On the night of 25th, he warned us that weather conditions will be horrible the next day.He suggested we do the "Cape Point Tour" on our last day in Cape Town, on 27th of June.When I told him, we have already bought tickets to visit Robben Island that day, he gave us two options.1- To go ahead despite bad weather and do the Cape Point Tour on 26th (He warned us this would not be a wise choice).2- To reschedule and do the Cape Point Tour on 27th.We took the 2nd option and decided to do the "Cape Point Tour" with Rob.Of course, this meant we'd lose over 400 rands (40 euros), because we had already paid for our Robben Island tickets.When I told Rob that we'll give up on Robben Island to go to Cape Point, he gave us a 200 rand discount, cutting our loss by almost 50%.The Cape Point tour itself was very nice.We saw everything we were promised to see and even more.We saw Ostriches, baboons and even a whale in a beautiful day. One final note:Make sure NOT to do the "Cape Point tour" on a rainy day!

Most fun and exciting tour of cape peninsula --Cape Convoy (dont bother choose another tour company). We are family of four from Indonesia and we did the tour with Rob in June 2012. It was a private tour in a minibus seater 9..(there were only 4of us).The day we were picked up by Rob, we knew that we were going to have a great time.. Rob was very entertaining from start until the end. He told us everything about South Africa and all the interesting (not the boring side) histories and my kids love him so much .. You know how Cape Town weather changed so quickly in winter and he made us to choose the right decision to avoud the rains and the crowds by a different routes to Cape Point ( smart Rob!!). Rob also showed us ostrichs and baboons at Cape Point and we basically beat the crowds and bad weather at every points ... he knew all the good spot to take postcard pictures..At any point during the tour, we never felt the rush we were so relaxed with him .. The drive to chapmans peak was spectacular as well...As an Asian family, we felt amazingly safe and comfortable with him all the time and we simply clicked instantly..Thank you Rob for such a wonderful time in Cape Town and we definitely would ask our friends and families to share another tour with Cape Convoy ..

Wonderful Customer Service. Let me begin by saying I never actually went on a tour with Cape Convoy. We had booked a tour out to Cape Point and had confirmed the tour before leaving for South Africa from the States. Unfortunately, the morning of the tour, we got a phone call at our bed and breakfast. Rob had a serious family emergency and would be unable to give us our tour that day. He offered us a choice: he could reschedule the tour for the next day or he could arrange for another company to take us out to Cape Point. Because we already had tickets bought for both Robben Island and Table Mountain for the next day, we chose to have Rob arrange for another tour company to take us out to Cape Point.Within minutes, Rob had us booked for another company's tour (which was a great tour, as well). In addition, he checked in with us that evening to make sure our tour went well. Furthermore, we didn't pay any more for the tour with the new company, and Rob even refunded one of our tickets. So, two of us got a tour out to Cape Point for the price of one. Even more amazingly, he was so apologetic he's given us a standing offer that should we ever be in Cape Town again, we can take his tour as guests. Rob was wonderful, clearly values his customers, and wanted to ensure we still had a great experience. We did. So, thank you for your wonderful service, Rob! If we're ever in Cape Town again (one can only hope!), we'll happily meet with you!

What a great day..... This was a brilliant day out, where we got to see all the amazing sights the Cape Town area had to offer. The tour was relaxed, informal and flexible. I would recommend to anyone short on time but wants to see all the main sites. Thanks for a great day Rob!

Best Tour and Guide Ever. We booked Rob because of recommendations from family and friends and let me just say thanks for giving us this guy. It was fun, exciting, entertaining, informative and extensive. Rob's knowledge and experience are matched with his passion and enthusiasm for his work. He loves talking about the history and the stories behind every inch of his tour. He delivers it in an entertaining and fun way that will have you hanging on his every word. Rob is not your typical tour guide, he is fun and energetic and gives you the tour you’ve only dreamed about. You need only spend a day with Rob to realise why he gets such great recommendations and has so many customers befriending him on Facebook. We loved our day with Rob on the Tour of the Cape and if and when we go back to Cape Town again we will certainly be going on another tour with Rob and Cape Convoy ToursThanks Rob for a fantastic time and a wonderful experience.

Amazing Honeymoon!. We booked Rob's Garden Route tour, Winelands tour, and Cape Point tour based on all of the positive reviews on tripadvisor. We couldn't agree more. We loved all of our tours. We had the most amazing trip to Cape Town thanks to Rob.I had a good feeling about Rob even before my wife and I made it to Cape Town. We bombarded Rob with tons of emails, and changed our itinerary nearly daily. Rob responded promptly to all of our questions and worked with us to make this trip happen exactly as we wanted it to. Rob picked us up promptly at our hotel on day one (of six total days we spent together), and we embarked on the Garden Route tour. The weather happened to be amazing that day, so Rob flexed the itinerary and took us to Table Mountain so that we didn't miss it later in the trip (due to the high potential for bad weather on the mountain). This was the first of many times that Rob went out of his way to tailor our itinerary so that we got the most out of our visit. It was evident immediately that Rob is passionate about his work. He was energetic and enthusiastic every day (even early in the morning and throughout long days), which was an inspiration to even the most jet-lagged tourist. We had great conversations with Rob, and really feel like he became a friend by the end of our time together. He made our honeymoon extremely special. Thanks Rob!

It couldn't have been any better! Best day in Cape Town by a mile. We booked this tour following recommendations from friends and family. Particularly, everyone spoke so highly of Rob, the tour guide. Not only were we not disappointed but Rob made our tour by far the most wonderful day for us in Cape Town and the best day of our holiday. Even the process of booking the tour with Rob was a positive experience. He was friendly and accommodating and easy going. He answered all of our questions and by the time the tour came, it felt like we were already friends. It was just the two of us and Rob on the tour the day we booked and the whole day was fantastic. Rob was so knowledgable, not only about Cape Town and South Africa's history, but about everything we spoke about that day. He took us to the most stunning places and educated us about the significance of each destination. Rob has such a passion for South Africa and its history that you really feel like you are apart of the story as you drive through the breath-taking scenery. Rob was so accommodating. He tailored every part of the day so we could maximise our enjoyment and experience at every single place. The day just got better and better. The penguins were my favourite part but the views from Cape Point are indescribable. We laughed all day and had so much fun. Rob did everything in his power to ensure we loved every moment of the day. We got to experience all the best parts of Cape Town in a way I'm certain no other tour guide could provide. By the time we finished the tour and were saying goodbye to Rob, it felt like we were saying goodbye to an old friend. Would do the tour everyday if I could and cannot recommend it enough. A MUST!Thanks Rob :)

No Other Way to See the Garden Route. My family and my friend's family recently travelled to South Africa on vacation. I had researched trip advisor to try and find a tour company that would be able to handle 8 people. The plan was to see as much as we could of the highlights that South Africa had to offer. Cape Convoy Tours stood out as a great choice given the reviews that I read. I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED. All the positive reviews were right and then some. Rob organized every detail of the trip for us and we didn't have to do a thing. I knew from the beginning that the trip was going to be wonderful because Rob emailed me with all details and kept me up to date with all the updates, hotel accomodations etc. Once we met Rob at our hotel, he became an instant part of our family (my son was upset when the trip was over) He had so much knowledge about the area and kept us occupied on the entire trip with his stories and memories of the area. Rob bent over backwards to ensure that we were happy. We changed the plans a couple of times and Rob didn't bat an eye to change them. (always with a smile on his face) Hotel accomodations for the Garden Route were first rate, meals included with them were fantastic. All the activities during the Garden Route were well planned and very fun and educational. Rob swapped out activities when the weather didn't seem to cooperate also because he thought the kids with us wouldn't find some items fun. He was Right! Trust him because he knows what he is doing. Rob knew all the special areas to visit (we got closer to the penguins than anyone else did!) the restaurants to eat at and the places to avoid. Rob was affordable and we got more than our money's worth. Thanks Rob for a great time and memories that will last a life time.

Great for seeing CapeTown and the Western coast!. My husband and I did 2 tours with Cape Convoy. The owner, Rob did the tours himself and he loves to share history and info about the Cape Town area. He'll answer any of your questions and is happy to chat and explain things to you. He does his best to make everyone happy and made sure to hit all of the stops we wanted. He's flexible and open to suggestions and is very personable. He makes sure you get the most of your tour. The tours are small so it's a very personal experience. They also pick you up and drop you off at your hotel. I definitely recommend using this company if you're looking to tour the CapeTown area.

Don't miss the Garden Route Tour!. If you have the time, go on the Garden Route Tour with Rob and discover the sheer beauty of the Western Cape. We had a nice and enjoyable holiday. There was no rush, no stress. Rob is very flexible and did his best to fulfil our wishes. He's also very friendly and we felt comfortable and secure in his company.Thanks Rob for this wonderful souvenir of the Garden Route Tour!

Best way to see cape town..... I was wondering where to go and what to do in cape town for my 4 day trip to cape town with my wife and then i read about cape convoy on trip advisor and thought so many people are recommending Rob for a day tour there must be some truth in it. Just feel very lucky to have found such a lively guide, who has now become a nice friend...Thanks a ton ROB.....U ROCK BRO!!!!

A fun Day with Rob!!. My wife and I toured the Cape peninsula with Rob on our last day in Africa. It was great fun, Rob is a special treat, his humor and knowledge of the area are outstanding. We saw all the major sights, had some great laughs, and were with some interesting people. Thanks Rob!

Don't miss it!. Our 3 day custom tour up the Garden Route with Rob was the highlight of our 2 week stay in South Africa. Rob was flexible and invested in our experience. Taking this day tour with Rob of Capetown will be a highlight of your trip!. I highly recommend booking with Cape Convoy Tours! Best money spent on any your guide I took on my two week trip!

Fantastic Tour. If you want to have a great time, lots of fun and see loads this is the tour for you. Iwould recommend this tour to everyone. We did the Cape Point Tour but wish we haddone more with Rob.

Best tour guide in South Africa. My partner and I made a 5 day garden route trip with Rob in March 2012 and had an absolutely brilliant time with him and he definately made it a holiday to remember. Rob definately goes above and beyond the call of duty of his job. Rob also has a great outlook on life and he is an inspiration to others. You should definately look no further than Cape Convoy Tours if you are heading on holiday to South Africa as they are like Tina Turner sang "SIMPLY THE BEST".Thanks again Rob for giving us a holiday of a lifetime:-)Orla & Kieran

Thanks, Rob!. Hi Rob,Thanks so much for taking my brothers and nephews visiting from the US on the Cape Point Tour. I knew after taking it myself that they would enjoy it, but really they all said it was the highlight of their whole stay in South Africa, and the teenage boys kept talking about you--they were thoroughly entertained!Best,Jenny

Two Great Days. My fiancée and I booked with Cape Convoy for a Winery tour and a Cape Point tour and got so much more. A few people didn't show each day so we actually got private tours. Rob was awesome, funny, and knowledgeable about everything we encountered. A tour guide can make or break a tour and he definitely made our days much more enjoyable. We even had some time after the wineries and he took us over to Table Mountain which was one of the more incredible parts of our time in Cape Town. The whole thing was very relaxed and honestly we felt like we were just riding around with a friend all day.This is not a stuffy, quiet, stare-out-the-window type of tour. It's involved and you'll be chatting about what you are seeing and learning new things all day. I laughed a lot, which isn't something that you think about doing on a tour, but it is definitely the sign of a good day.

Rob is someone you will never forget!. When we stepped out the door of the hotel, Rob was off very cheerful man, nothing negative to say! The tour wasn't rushed, and took it at our own pace we had an input to the tour. He knew many facts for the historic meaning of everything which was really interesting he gave it in bite size chunks, as my parents said they liked a lot of history whereas myself and the other couple were so so. We did a different route to minimise traffic as our tour was on Easter Monday! DO NOT BOOK WITH ANYONE ELSE AS YOU WILL REGRET MISSING THIS EXCELLENT MAN AND HIS BUS!

A very relaxing tour. I do not know where to start... this was probably one of the best holidays i had..and all thanks to our wonderful guide Robert. I support the statements of a lot of people here, Robert is fun to be with, talkative, knowledgeable, and very flexible person. I booked him after reviewing the tripadvisor website and spent a wonderful 3 nights 4 days in his company with my husband on the garden route... Outdshoorn, Mossel Bay and Knysna.. he even took us to a wolf sanctuary that i absoluted adored.. i never thought i would ever encounter wolves in SA... the hotels we were booked in were very comfy and breakfasts were always great.. the sights differed every day and something very key for us too was the relaxed mode of our tour and our security..Thank you Rob and do not forget to visit us in Mauritius soon...

Must be the best cape point tour available, Rob's a legend!. We booked with cape convoy tours to explore Cape Point and surrounding areas based on the numerous positive comments on Trip advisor. From the moment we were picked up from our hotel we knew that we had made a great choice. Rob is the most approachable friendly and fun guide we could have hoped for, on top of this he knows a huge amount about south african history and culture...he's a bit of an oracle! All in all I can't imagine there being a better Cape Point tour available and I would certainly recommend Rob's tours for someone looking for an enthusiastic, passionate and fun loving guide who will go the extra mile to ensure that you have a fantastic day. There are many tour guides who go through the motions of showing you the sights, but it is very clear that Rob genuinely cares about giving a professional, informative and fun day out. Top marks from us!!

The funniest days in Cape Town!!!. I was in Cape Town for a few days of work and decided to extend my stay for the weekend, looking for a guide through Trip Advisor.What to say? Thanks to Trip Advisor for letting people know how Robert is the most clever, friendly and talkative person you could find in the entire South Africa.If you want to have a trip that is not just a "going around the Cape" but you also want to learn every bit of the places you are visiting, then you could not find better guide than Rob, who will make you discover every hidden secret of the Cape.All culture and fun!!Thank you Robert, I hope to be back to the Cape one day just to travel again with you!!!!

Top Geezer!. Rob's tour was amazing. His enthusiasm was second only to his knowledge of the history and culture of the sites we viewed. He tailored his tour perfectly catering for all the needs of the group (there were 25 people) in a very relaxed and funny manner. Would thoroughly recommend using Rob and look forward to catching up over some beers in the future. Thank you Rob!!

Best tour in Cape Town!!!. From the moment that I first inquired about the tour, Rob was absolutely wonderful! The tour was amazing, as Cape of good Hope, Chapman's Peak, Boulder's Beach, etc are absolutely stunning sights! But what makes this tour special is Rob. He has so much enthusiasm, and his commentary about the history of the region, politics and culture is very insightful. I highly recommend this tour, it was definitely one of our favorite experiences in Cape Town!!!

Perfect day with Rob. Although we only had three days in Cape Town due to my husbands work commitments. My husband had booked our last day with Rob, and what a day we had, a day we will never forget. From the moment you picked us up at our hotel to the moment you dropped us back in the early evening, you made us feel as if nothing was to much trouble. We where in a party of 6 which you helped gel to become more of a small family.The day was full of information, the sights where unbelievably beautiful, stopping at places of interest, stopping to enable the party to take photo's of Baboons and Ostrich on the side of the roads. Being the eldest of the party I was never made to feel as if I couldn't do things that the younger members could do, which I thank Rob for. I would recommend Rob (Convoy Tours ) for a perfect day ,a day you will never forget. Thank you Rob..

perfect day with Rob. We had full day Cape Point Tour. Robert is taking good care of all group and taking you to picturesque places that you would probably not discover yourself when you are first time in Cape Town. We visited Clifton, Bantry Bay, Camp's Bay, Kalk Bay,Fishhoek, Boulders Beach National Park, Simon’s Town and the Historic Mile, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope and last not least had most tasty seafood together...
Wonderfull day with Cape Convoy and Robert Salmons nice personallity. Very well planned tour, nice storys from Rob and beautiful places
Cape Point Tour. Repeat experience with Rob from last year. Fantastic trip. Rob is not only very informative and attentive to needs but eally makes the trip so much fun

Awesome trip!. I had planned a special trip to S. Africa for my husband's 50th birthday. We had 4 days in Cape Town of which 2 were with Rob. We did his very popular Cape Point Tour the 1st day and a private Winelands tour the following day as we wanted to see some other vineyards of our choice. The tours were fantastic and we saw it all. Rob is very knowledgeable (and more....), there's not a question he's not able to answer. He's humorous and makes it all very interesting. My 8 yr old son, Shane, enjoyed Rob's company thoroughly and couldn't stop talking about him to his classmates and friends when he got home. Rob feels like a family friend after our 2 days with him. He is definitely the only guide (and friend) to go with if you ever consider visiting Cape Town and taking in all the beautiful sights!! Thanks Rob...

You will not be disappointed...passionate about the Cape & it's history!. Rob was fabulous! Rob is an individual that loves what he does & wants to share that passion of the Cape with others! A huge history lesson---packed full of factoids & funtoids! Awesome recommendations for viewing the sights, restaurants, pictures, etc. I would absolutely book another tour with Rob & highly recommend! We had an amazing day!

Amazeballs. Words cannot do justice the amazing day I spent with Rob touring Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope - on Valentine's Day no less! Rob is funny, friendly, charming and impressive in his knowledge and enthusiasm for the history of the Cape. He also really listens to what his clients are looking to get out of their day. My tour was a group of 5 women and by the end of the day - largely due to Rob - I think we all felt that we were a part of something special. Rob let us explore at our own pace and we never felt rushed. At the end of the day, we had a lovely bite to eat at a great little surf town - Kommetjie. It was the perfect end to an honestly perfect day. If you are going to Cape Town, you must do a Cape Point tour, and the very best tour you can book is with Rob and Cape Convoy. I am not typically a fan of group tours but Cape Convoy's tour is the exception.
Cape Tour with Rob. This tour was great! Plenty of attention was paid to making the sights interesting and Rob ensured that we knew the history behind the cape. We would definitely book this again!

Great tour, great guide. If you're looking for a fun, boisterous guide with a wealth of S. African knowledge, go tour the Cape with Rob. Not only did he keep the energy high but Rob is also brimming with interesting facts about the history and geography of SA, the Cape, and its flora and fauna. It's also clear that Rob loves his job and, even more so, his customers. If you're exploring Cape Town a Cape tour is a must - and we're so glad we chose to share the day with Rob!

cape convoy with rob is fan bloody tastic. Our band of 6,three couples travelled with Rob, January 2012,we cannot sing his praises high enough,nothing was too much trouble,his knowledge extensive and his sense of humour infectious,we had a great time for 6 days seeing the best of the Cape and the Garden Route,Bottleskiep Game reserve was the highlight though stay for two nights if you can,thanks Rob

Rob is the BEST! Informative and hilarious!. We spent two full days with Rob Salmon of Cape Convoy tours and we didn't regret a single minute! Rob took us on a full day tour to Cape Point and a full day tour of the Stellenbosh wine region. He also organized our shark diving trip with a very reputable shark diving company. On both days with Rob, he took small groups and obviously had put thought into organizing the groups. The Cape Point tour was amazing. The sights were incredible and Rob kept us interested and laughing all day long. On our wine country tour, Rob took us to three wineries. Each was stunning and had amazing wine. Both of our days with Rob were incredible. We HIGHLY recommend booking a tour with Rob!

You book a tour , you end up with a friend in town. Robs tours are a must for any visitor. It's like getting a friend to show you round town. The tour is unscripted, informative, entertaining and his enthusiasm on all subjects is infectious. He's a super guy who added so much to our experience in the Cape. He will always go the extra mile to make sure you get everything you want from the tour

AWESOME!!! Look no further.. We were a large family group looking for a fun and informative tour to the peninsula. He is full of facts about the surrounding area. We made lots of stops and he really focused on the areas we were interested in most. It's a fun filled day and rob is full of energy. Incredible Cape Point Tour!. This is a must book tour while in Cape Town. The tour is breath taking and Rob is a phenomenal host and guide. Amazing tour experience with rob. One of the best tour experiences ive ever been on (dec 2011). Rob is a brilliant host. So entertaining, engaging and intelligent. Anyone visiting capetown should go on the tour with rob. Ziad, dubai.

Fantastic Day out!!!!. Best tour guide in cape town!. My family and I booked the full day cape peninsular tour with rob and it was absolutely amazing! Its a no brainer - Convoy Tours is a MUST in Cape Town. Absolutely amazing . You get to see the main attractions in CT in one day. Rob is an awesome person with great energy which really adds to the whole experience. He knows the city extremely well which helps you save time and avoid traffic. You not only get to see the city but you make a friend. Got nothing but the best things to say.

Amazing tour! Amazing guy!!!. My girlfriend and I -- both rather well-travelled and cosmopolitan in outeach -- had a wonderful day with Cape Convoy Tours. The excellent, laid-back but very well-structured tour from Cape Town to the Cape of Good Hope and back was a most amazing experience. We returned to our hotel with life-long memories and gorgeous photos, truly inspired (and very tired). In a nutshell: We would want to rate this tour with six stars but Tripadvisor regrettably contemplates only five. The greatness of our experience was almost entirely due to the remarkable performance -- and man, he did perform! -- of the most august of tour guides I've seen in my life -- Rob Salmon. A provocative blend of South African and English roots, this dyed-in-the-wool entertainer-plus-guide not just introduced us to the unmatched beauty of the Cape, its most scenic environment and the locals but provided in-depth insight in what is going on in the heads and hearts of Capetonians, their local culture, politics and gossip. Rob's discursive, non-stereotypical way of explaining things sets precedent. Perfect for people able and willing to think out-of-the box about this marvelous country. Rob, if you read this, you're awesome. You checked all the boxes. Also the unusual and astonishing ones. Chapeau!

Great one day trip. This is our second time to use Cape Convoy, the first being a couple of years ago. Rob is a very energetic guide and loves his work. He has a great knowledge of the area and full of historical facts. He makes the trip entertaining and fun. Definitely recommend his services.

BRILLIANT EXPERIENCE!!!. I and a group of 8 shipmates were coming off a 30 day cruise and spending a few days in Cape Town before heading home. Occasionally, you "hit the jackpot" with a tour and take away fond memories from the experience. Rob, owner/operator of Cape Convoy Tours, with his winning personality, quick wit and vast knowledge of the history and culture of South Africa, is a sure bet.From my initial contact months prior to our visit, Rob was quick to respond to my inquiries in a complete and professional manner. I booked the "Full Day Cape Point Tour" followed the next day with the "Winelands Tour & Tasting".There were 4 hotels involved with our pick-up. Rob met me first in a clean, well maintained mini-van. I immediately got wrapped up in Rob's energy and enthusiasm about how our day would play out. It was obvious he had a keen sense of humor.There was a marathon that day but Rob knew about it so adjusted our route to avoid any traffic tie-ups. On our way to the "Point", Rob used the amazing scenery and our "must see list" as a framework to paint a picture of the history and culture of the area. He is obviously a history buff with a gift for storytelling that's not even close to being boring.The list of places we visited is too long to post here but the beaches and surrounding vistas are magnificant. Where else can you see baboons and ostrich meandering along the roadside? And the penguins at Boulder Beach are amazing. At the finish of our day, we came to appreciate the beauty, people and culture of this land to an extent greater then we could have imagined. Bravo Rob and thank you!I'll post a review of the Winelands Tour separately.

A tour with character. Rob gave us a great day, from pickup to dropoff. He took us to great places, both the big sights and a few things off the beaten track, and gave us a great insight into the Cape and its history. I heartily recommend him!

Worth the 5 stars!. I was looking for something to do on my trip to Cape Town and found this tour on tripadvisor. What caught my eye was that the guide had over 200 reviews but still maintains a 5 star rating. Quite impressive! I booked the tour and Robert was everything the reviews said he is. He is knowledgeable, friendly, kind and really really savvy. He knows an awful lot about the history of Cape Town and Southern Africa, and he always has something interesting to talk about. I and my girlfriend covered a lot of ground with Robert within one day and we kinda wished we planned our entire vacation through cape convoy tours. Absolutely 5 stars!!!

He's not just a guide, he' become our friend :). Rob has made our trip to South Africa one of the greatest we've been to. The places he brought us along Garden Route and the adventures we've had together were amazing. With him, we never had a dull moment. We laughed all the way from Capetown to Glentana. He didn't force us to do things we didn't want to do but recommended all the wonderful things he saw fit. Thanks Rob for a once in a lifetime experience!

Fantastic tours with a great guide!. After finding Cape Convoy in the Rough Guide and reading reviews on Tripadvisor, I booked 2 tours with Rob - the Cape Point day tour and the Garden Route 5 day tour.I'm so glad I did!Just a short time after you meet Rob it is like you have known him for years - he becomes one of your friends! We had a small group and at the end of both trips it was so strange to think that we had known each other for less than a week!He is friendly, funny, enthusiastic and so easy to chat to. He is so passionate about Cape Town and South Africa and has a vast knowledge about its history and trivia.The Cape Point day tour was the first one I did and took us down the coast via the picturesque Chapmans Peak drive. We saw all the sights down the peninsula including Hout Bay and Seal Island, Boulders Beach and the penguins, Simon's Town and various bays and beaches along the way. It was a great day, despite the changeable weather and the highlight was of course Cape Point and its lighthouse. Seeing a lady being mugged of her lunch by a baboon was pretty funny too! (Its ok - she was laughing too).After this daytrip, I couldn't wait for my Garden Route tour. I wasn't disappointed!The amount of stuff I did is too much to list here but includes: riding an ostrich (yes really!) at Oudtshoorn, stroking cheetahs at Cango, exploring at the Featherbed Nature Reserve in Knysna, zip-lining through the forest canopy at Tsitsikaama, a day-safari at the Botlierskop game Reserve, the highest bungy jump in the world at Bloukrans Bridge (which was AWESOME!) and generally exploring and appreciating the beauty of the Garden Route and its coastline.Rob cares a lot about his guests and just wants them to have the best trip possible so the itinerary for the trip is not totally rigid. He is flexible and is always suggesting extra activities to do if you feel like doing them. If the weather is worse one day than the next, he might suggest doing this today and leaving that for tomorrow. In the evenings, he is always around if you want him, but doesn't impose if you want time to yourselves.The accommodation included on the tour was fantastic - lovely hotels and guesthouses.Overall, this tour was without doubt the highlight of my holiday in South Africa. I had so much fun from beginning to end and was quite sad when we all said goodbye at the end of our trip. I would highly recommend Cape Convoy - Rob is everything a tour guide should be and you would be a fool to go with anyone else! Thanks so much Rob - I will treasure the memories for ever!

Astounding. We arrived in Cape Town on Long Street our first night. We were feeling totally overwhelmed: massive jetlag, culture shock, driving on the left side of the road, and various minor things that were really making us feel a bit down. We brought two travel books with us, but fortunately my wife was smart enough to have the foresight to book with Rob Salmon of Cape Convoy for the Garden Route tour. We slept through our first night with great anticipation for the next day when our tour would begin. Rob picked us up at 9AM and we hit the road to Oudtshoorn. Immediately I felt that book with Rob was a truly great thing! While driving us out of the Central Business District we were given a history lesson with all sides of each issue presented. Cape Town has an amazing history that mirrors the birth of the United States and is representative of colonial history in general; Rob is an EXPERT in South African history. It's not rote recitation of memorized dates and trivia; Rob is passionate and inspired when he speaks. Beyond that, the sites he took us to visit were great! We never would have found Zoe and Huw's charming little guesthouse in Oudtshoorn, stopped to see camels (why are there camels in South Africa?), ridden, yes ridden, on the back of an ostrich, or known the best lunch spots. Staying in Knysna at the waterfront with a beautiful sunset on the docks; enjoying the B&B of a former South African Rugby player with vast untouched beaches on the Indian Ocean, driving through a huge game reserve, it goes on and on; each day was packed with sights to see and filled with Rob's passion for South Africa.Other things about Rob: He is flexible, funny, and an easy conversation partner and friend. When we stepped into his van he informed us of the ground rules: None! We were given option upon option each day that catered to our various interests. Do you want to zip-line through the trees? Take a township tour? See monkeys? Whatever you want, Rob knows!Other plusses include learning the rules of the road (people drive quite a bit differently here than in the US), local customs with regard to tipping, just seeing in general how warm and inviting South Africans are. This tour was an excellent intro to South Africa and I HIGHLY recommend it. Thanks Rob!

Amazing tour and tour guide. According to TripAdvisor reviews, Cape Convoy Tours was number 3 of over 170 tourist attractions but it is wholly mistaken in that assessment as it should easily be number one!!! Rob Salmon started his business some years ago and is the most enthusiastic and knowledgable tour guide I have ever met or traveled with. I booked two tours, the garden route tour (3 nights) and the day Cape tour. My situation was very different to other tourists as I was traveling with my partner who surprisingly was given permission to travel as she between her once every three weeks chemotherapy sessions.The doctor felt that after one year of such treatment with another 6 months to go, she deserved a uplifting holiday. Rob ensured that both of our trips would be just that. The tours were private ones, that is, no other passengers. He catered to our specific needs to the letter. The garden tour was an original as my partner's illness precluded us from doing much of what others would have done and instead we toured attractions that she favoured and yet Rob with his amazingly upbeat disposition happily took us everywhere....even driving way off the beaten track to get some medication. Nothing was too much for him. He was entirely flexible and even dropped us off at Port Elizabeth where we stayed with friends and he drove back the 800 kilometres to Cape Town on his lonesome. Two days later he fetched us from our Cape Twon accommodation for the Cape tour and that was the most brilliant tour ever. Again, it did not have the number of stops that other tourists would take with Rob but, nevertheless, it was awesome. One stop took us to Simon Town and while doing some shopping for souvenirs, a shopkeeper saw me speaking with Rob and took me aside after Rob left and told me that he sees all the tour groups coming by but that Rob is by far the best guide of them all and I couldn't agree more.Rob does these tours because he loves his work and he loves people. He is the most personable fella you can beat and his enthusiasm is contagious. For the outstanding service he provides, his prices are extraordinarily reasonable. Rob is also an honest and very caring individual whose knowledge of the area would be second to none. I cannot recommend Cape Convoy Tours highly enough as superlatives lack the depth of the service provided.

You will not regret using Cape Convoy. Cape Convoy was our choice to book two tours - the wine tour and the general SA tour. They were amazing. Julius was so flexible on our wine tour and detoured to take us to a wine and cheese festival. He went out of his way to make sure we and the other couple had a great time. This company was so great that once we made friends with the other couple they were willing to change our tours so we could continue hanging out with each other. Robbie was so knowledgable and passionate about the history of SA. We walked away with a deeper understanding and respect for SA. I can't stress enough, you will not be disappointed with Cape Convoy - they set the bar on tours. I wish all the tours I chose were like these ones!

!!Go with Cape Convoy if you want the most of South Africa!!. I found Cape Convoy on the internet before my trip to Cape Town, and from the reviews on Trip Advisor it seemed like the obvious choice for my tours during my stay. I wanted a tour of the breathtaking scenery and to know more about the area and its history on my trip. As a 24 year old woman travelling alone, another factor I looked for in a tour company was friendliness and fun. - I chose both a tour of the cape peninsula and a trip to the winelands with Cape Convoy, as I wanted to soak up as much as South Africa had to offer during my short stay (I had only 5 days to explore before my stint volunteering in a township close by).  When I got to Cape Town I contacted Rob, and he spoke to me like he’d known me for years. He had me chuckling in moments and we were only arranging the days for my trips. The morning I was due to join Rob on a tour, he called to ask whether I could do the tour another day during my stay instead.... The day of the arranged tour was a grisly, horrible morning, thick with cloud. He explained he doesn’t like to take people on a tour unless they will have a good time, and on such cloudy days you just cannot see the beautiful scenery, it’s literally not worth it. I am totally grateful of his decision to change the day, as I witnessed the density of the cloud around the Cape mountains! So the next day I went on tour with him down the peninsula, with two other couples. It was a day of sunny intervals, but we literally chased the sunshine in the van. Rob knew which areas to go to at certain times for the best weather, and because of his timing we stayed with beautiful visibility all day. We saw all the wonders the coastline has to offer. Rob is extremely friendly and passionate about his country, which makes for a fantastic guide and a great insight into South African life and history. He is so eager to show his country to his passengers and chats to you about the sights and history like a friend, not like a boring tour guide! But still manages to tell you a lifetime of fascinating information! In contrast to the brilliant tour I enjoyed with Cape Convoy, I went on a pre-organised tour with the Baz Bus a week later with my volunteering company. It followed a similar tour route on the peninsula, but it was awful weather and we paid alot to pretty much see nothing of the scenery. It angered alot of the volunteers that they paid for a tour that had literally shown them nothing of the scenery through terenchal rain. More importantly to me, the guide had the usual, very boring monotone spiel, merely pointing out the places we passed and not connecting with any of the passengers. I felt like I was on a tedious tour bus on a school trip, one in which you end up nodding off on through boredom! With Cape Convoy however, you feel like you are a group of friends (even though you've just met) on a road trip, chatting about different subjects of South Africa and learning about the history from a real South African. Rob is very genuine, and you can see his passion for his tours, in the way he presents the country to you personally and in the best way possible. Rob also has the insights of the areas, where to go on the tour at certain times of the day for the best experience, and where to eat, not to eat etc., and will make sure you get your photo with the ‘Cape of Good Hope’ sign pronto on the peninsula tour! To also mention the Winelands tour, I went with tourguide Rob on a last minute arrangement due to my time restraints. He is honest and expains that his company partner is the expert on the wines, and is the person to go with if you are interested in serious wine conversations. But that wasn't what I was looking for so was happy to go with Rob. I wanted to see the sights of the winelands and of the wine estates and to experience them with fun. Again, I had a fantastic day, saw beautiful places, stroked a cheetah and got back to my hostel happy. The friends I had made at the hostel and had pursuaded to join me on the tour agreed they didn't expect such fun, and such a fun and friendly tourguide. They were happy I talked them into coming along!Cape Convoy portray the nature of South Africa, unpretentious, fun and a friend to everyone. I wouldn’t have chosen anyone else to see the beauty SA has to offer, and you shouldn’t either. If you are looking for a guide to make you smile and to show you the beauty of SA with fire in his belly, go with Cape Convoy!Any age, any gender, any amount of people, Cape Convoy is the tour company to go with. They have fun with everyone and anyone, make sure you have the best time possible, and I promise you will smile more than any other tour! Feel connected to South Africa, go Cape Convoy!!!!

Amazing time and best tour guide ever!. Me and 3 of my friends traveled to South Africa in November, our first stop was Cape Town and our first full day was a tour of the cape with Rob. This was the best way to start off our amazing vacation! Our day long tour of the sites around the cape was truly amazing. Our tour included only the 4 of us which which is exactly what we wanted. Rob has great energy, amazing knowledge of the area and history of the world. Rob got us all excited and kept us going all day long. He has an amazing sense of humor and became our friend, not just tour guide, while we toured and saw the sites. We saw everything, never felt rushed, learned a ton and when the day was over I was not sure where it all went. Rob answered every question, is not afraid to discuss sensitive/taboo subjects and filled our day with education and laughter. I would highly recommend Cape Convoy Tours to anyone who is looking for a fun energetic tour of one of the most beautiful places in the world! It really is the most fun I have ever had on a tour!

The best day you could spend in Africa!!!!. I have then pleasure of calling Rob a friend having joined him on the peninsula tour for the past 2 years and joining him on a tour of the winelands this year!The peninsula tour is superb, without a doubt the best 8 hours I have spent in my life(twice!)The winelands tour is superb with both Rob and Julius. I cannot wait to take some friends in February 2012 to enjoy both days.

Fantastic, fun and informative tour. We had an excellent day on the Cape Peninsulal tour with Rob. His understanding of the geography, history and politics of the region was astounding and we couldn't have enjoyed the day more. We took in a lot of different sights for one day but did not feel rushed at any point, and could enjoy everything in a relaxed manner. Wish the day could have been longer!

Cape Convoy's Personal Service Made our Trip to Cape Town!. I have read trip advisor for many years for cautious guidance on our travel plans and have never posted a review. After our day with Rob at Cape Convoy, I was so impressed that I felt it was important to share our experience since i used it to select this tour. As you can see from the other reviews on trip advisor Rob is very knowledgeable about South Africa and takes a lot of pride in educating his visitors on really interesting facts of the area, so i won't go into detail on the actual tour. But the most important reason that I would highly recommend this tour is the personal care that Rob gives to each and every person on the tour. Even before, we arrived, we e-mailed back and forth confirming a day and time to pick us up for a tour. I called Rob when we arrived in SA about adding a day to our tour and he called me right back. He called us again to confirm our time so we wouldn't have to wait for pick up. He let us bring our bags on the tour bus as we were changing hotels, saving us the expense of cab and storage fees. The weather in Cape Town seems to change every few minutes and really can make our break some of the tours and not affect others. Rob was very flexible working with us and others who we met on the tour in scheduling the right tour for the right day based on the likely forecast. In the end, I left my jacket on the bus and he had another US couple bring it back to the States for me. My wife and I travel extensively, with her being in the meeting and incentive business, and are reluctant to go on tours as we don't like pretencious generic tours. But our time with Rob and Cape Convoy was the most fun and most personalized tour that either of us had ever been on with a really good group of people who were as fun as Rob. I would be happy to respond to e-mails if anybody needs additional detail, but if you are going to tour the Cape Town area, I would highly recommend Cape Convoy.

Carjacked by a Baboon!!. We spent a very enjoyable and UNFORGETTABLE day with Rob. With one eye on the weather, Rob suggested we head straight for Cape Point and do the tour in reverse. This we did which resulted in perfect weather (& pictures) wherever we went. This also meant we avoided the crowds. We felt very smug leaving a fast filling car park at Cape Point as the crowds (& clouds) rolled in. Rob is a great tour guide and his enthusiasm is infectious. We loved all we saw and have dined out (many times) on having been hijacked by a baboon at Cape Point....I will never forget the 3 of us peering through the windows (from outside the van) watching the baboon rifle through our bags & the glove box, looking for food....and I don't have one photo of this unforgettable experience.

Amazing 2 days with Rob - Wine tour & Cape Point. Rob is a fantastic guide. Most importantly he is a great guy, very outgoing and energetic and it feels like he genuinely wants his guest to have a great time and goes out of his way to make it happen.We had a very fun and friendly atmosphere almost immediately, and I am sure the other guests on the tours felt the same way.Rob is also very knowledgeable, and able to answer almost all of our questions on a lot of different topics and knows a lot about the exciting history of SA and the society now.We have travelled a lot, and we both feel that Rob is one of the best, if not the best, guide we ever had. We would def. choose him again.Cape Convoy is fantastic...195 reviews atm with almost perfect score says it all. :)

Wonderful Day with tons of information & beautiful sights!!. My mom & I recently went on the Cape Convoy Tour around Cape Town. Rob had so much information & You could really see how much passion he has for his job & South Africa. If was a small group, which made it easy to get in & out of places, so we could see more of Cape Town. Rob was so accomodating to let us stop where we wanted & answered all of our questions. I would definitely recommend the tour to anyone & would have liked to go on another tour too, but didn't have time! I also liked that we saw different places than what the hop-on hop-off bus (red line) did so nothing was very repeatitive.
Marvelous time. Fantastic day with Rob. Felt like we saw it all and avoided a couple long queues. Would highly recommend Cape Convoy.

Rob from Cape Convoy is the best tour guide in Cape Town!. My friends (3 of us 30-something ladies) took two 1-day tours with Rob and Cape Convoy. The first day was a tour of the Cape. It was absolutely beautiful and Rob is a wealth of knowledge on South African history...and anything else you'd like to chat about! We left the Waterfront at about 9am and returned at about 6:30pm. Rob took us to see everything from the penguins at Boulder Bay, to the ostrich mama, papa, and babies at the Cape of Good Hope beach. We went to Table Mountain National Park at Cape Point and were able to sit down and have a delicious lunch and enjoy a glass of wine overlooking the most southern point in South Africa. Wonderful! We then walked to the top of the point for a photo shoot! :) Along the way we stopped and saw baboons, sea kayakers, and even fed a seal!Our second day tour was a tour of four South African wineries. Again we met at the waterfront at 9am. Returning around 6pm. Our first stop was Ernie Els vineyard...my personal favorite. From there we went to Waterford where Rob has set up a tour of the cellar. At this winery they paired wine and chocolate...what more can a girl ask for?! Third stop was the Spier winery and cheetah enclosure. We were able to pet the big cats for a small fee and then sample wines. The last stop was Asara winery. Again Rob had set up a tasting of six wines for us. This day was my absolute favorite day of our week long vacation in Cape Town. Without a doubt Rob completed our South African vacation. He was able to safely navigate us around the Cape all complete with an extensive history lesson and a wonderful sense of humor. For the day tours all you need to bring is some decent walking shoes, your camera, your sunglasses, and a sweater as the cape gets pretty windy!Thanks again Rob!

Unbelievably fantastic!!!!!!!!!. Just returned from a two week tour of South Africa. Our time in Cape Town was fantastic and mostly due to Rob. We took all three tours with Cape Convoy (winelands, Cape Tour, and shark diving tour). Rob went out of his way to adjust our itinerary due to the weather which resulted in perfect conditions each trip. His friendly personality and the ability to make everyone feel comfortable and involved in the tour was matched by his love for his country and extreme knowledge of the history of the area. He always said if you doubt me GOOGLE IT! He was always correct.Rob is one of those people you meet that you consider a friend from the time you meet him. He even has offered to meet my daughter who will be moving there next year to show her around and be a local source of info and help if needed. He is welcome to stay with us in Texas anytime!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Rob is like having a friend show you around!. I cannot sing Rob's praises enough! Cape Convoy was everything we could ever ask for in a tour company! From the moment I first emailed and spoke with Rob, he was excited, energetic, and had us excited! He loves South Africa so much and it comes through in everything he says and does. He honestly wants you to see the best of everything in his country, and he makes the history come alive! We loved that on the wine tours, you end up at places that the big tours don't take you, because they're too expensive. We practically had the places to ourselves!! I loved that it's only small groups and everything is super relaxed and enjoyable. Riding around with Rob was like going to Cape Town, meeting up with a friend, and having him show you around. He knew all the right times to go to places, and what would make for the most enjoyable experiences and pictures! I will be recommending him to everyone I know...in fact I just sent a recommendation to a friend tonight! Thanks Rob, for an amazing trip!!

Best Tour Guide Ever. We travelled to South Africa for our honeymoon, and as part of our trip we wanted to visit the Cape Point and Winelands around Stellenbosch. We chose Cape Convoy Tours on account of its outstanding TripAdvisor rating and reviews, so our expectations were already high. Our two tours easily surpassed them and were the highlight of our Honeymoon.Rob is simply the best tour guide that I have ever had. He is extremely knowledgeable both about the tour destinations and about the history of South Africa. He is also extremely friendly and entertaining and made the entire tour an utter pleasure. He was also very accommodating and was happy to rearrange one of our tours to a different day on account of me acquiring a 'tummy bug'.

Fantastic Trip!!!!!!!!. We had planned to do both the Cape Point & The Winelands tour with Rob. Both tours were exceptional & Rob's local knowledge is comprehensive. His enthusiasm when speaking about the regions history is infectious. Rob seems to do everything possible to ensure his customers have the best possible experience. We were coming towards the end of our holiday in Cape Town and a combination of high winds / cloud meant that we hadn't made it up Table Mountain. We mentioned this to Rob whilst we were on his winelands tour.Rob assured us that we would make it up table mountain,he mentioned that we would still have time to go up the mountain that day. He phoned a friend who confirmed the cable car was in operation & that the mountain was cloud free. As soon as we'd finished the winelands tour Rob whisked us off to table mountain. Myself and my husband made it up Table Mountain which was pretty much due to Rob pulling out all stops and going above and beyond the call of duty at the last minute to get us up table mountain.

Cape Town is my favorite city in the world now because of Cape Convoy and Rob the best tour guide ever!. I have traveled all around the world but my two tours that I took with Cape Convoy (one to the winelands and another down the Cape) were my favorite experiences from a three week vacation in South Africa. I still rate Cape Convoy's tour down the coast as one of my most favorite experiences of my life thus far. I usually hate going on tours... I think they are "too touristy" or cheesey. But Cape Convoy does it right. The tours are small enough that you get to become friends with others on the trip. The tour guides could answer all the questions I threw at them and managed to come up with places to visit that other similar tour companies didn't spend time at. My sister and I hadn't gotten the chance to walk on a Cape Town beach... so Rob pulled the van over so we got to climb down the slope and walk on the beaches of South Africa. So accomodating and fantastic... a must if your visiting!

Great tour with Rob. We had a great tour of the cape with Rob. He was very energetic and knowledgeable. He was flexible on drop off and pick up points. He even bought me a birthday present. Highly recommended.

Best Tour of Cape Town...Hands Down. Do you like to visit your best friend? in his home town? Then you will love Rob & Cape Convoy Tours.Rob knows “his” Cape inside & out and loves to share it. His energy abounds and he makes everyone he comes across feel like they are his family. He has an encyclopedic knowledge of the Cape and everything in it. In one breath, he can talk to you about the Cape Ostrich, Baboons, Tortoises, Penguins or any other wildlife you might find. The next breath might be a discussion on Cape History including the indigenous people, Portuguese discoverers, Dutch & English settlers, Charles Darwin and even apartheid. Just for fun, he will throw 15 jokes in between just to keep you on your toes. Rob would give the tours even if he didn’t do it for a living.Bottom line, you cannot find a better Guide or Cape Tour.

FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. We did a full day trip to Cape Point etc with Rob last year (sorry for delay in review) and it was a highlight of our amazing time in South Africa. Rob was great and gave us probably the best tour we have ever had on any holiday. He is the friendliest, best natured and energetic person we have had the pleasure to meet. If you choose any company to do any tour in South Africa then don't go past this one. Our only regret is that we had not the time to do another tour with Rob but would certainly do so if we are lucky enough to visit S.A. again in the future.

Fanastic Tours with a new friend. We booked with Rob from Cape Convoy Tours after finding him on tripadvisor. The reviews were very good and we decided to give it a go. We were not to be disappointed in any way. Rob is a very personable, energetic and intelligent individual. He is deeply passionate about South Africa and will give you a running commentary as you drive along but he is also very willing and able to answer any questions you may have no matter how difficult or awkward they may be. From our first e mail to getting off the mini bus at the end of the tour you are entertained, informed and extremely well looked after. We chose a 2 day package of the Winelands Tour followed by the Cape Point Tour. We did the Winelands Tour with a wonderful older American couple and had a thoroughly relaxing, informative and enjoyable day, (I think the wine played a part too). After collecting us from our guest house we visited 4 very different vineyards which gave us the opportunity to experience excellent wines in very different surroundings, the cost of the tastings is included in the tour which was a pleasant surprise. Throughout the Tour Rob will entertain you with great stories and funny anecdotes but he is also very well-informed regarding the vineyards and the history of wine making in the Cape area. Rob catered for the specific needs of everyone and his primary aim is to ensure that everyone on the bus has a great day. We were then dropped off back at our guest house.We did the Cape Tour the following day with an American couple and a Malaysian couple, Rob will only take a maximum of 6 people to ensure that the experience is personal and to ensure he can give everyone his full attention. We all got on very well and much of this was due to Rob who engaged everyone in the conversations and was genuinely interested to hear our stories and experiences. By the end of the Tour we were all chatting like old friends. The Tour itself was brilliant and the views were breathtaking and the wildlife amazing. To see Baboons, an Eland, Ostriches and seals in their natural environments was wonderful and all the time Rob was educating us on everything from the climate, the wildlife, the history and the hopes for the future in South Africa. Rob also gives you time on your own to wander and enjoy the experience. At no time were we bored listening to Rob, his enthusiasm is infectious and his conversation is engaging, educational & entertaining, (even the corny jokes).In summary we can recommend Rob & Cape Convoy Tours without reservation, the Tours are great, good value for money and Rob will tailor the Tour to meet your needs. He is a pleasure to be with and we definitely feel we have made a great new friend.

Probably the best tour you can do in Cape Town!. Where do I even begin?? If you're looking for an awesome adventure around cape peninsula coupled with a walking wikipedia and looking for a pal to show you around and give you the background to almost anything/everything you'd like to know about Cape Town/South Africa, then Rob Salmon is your guy!! He's an energiser bunny on steroids! You won't regret signing up for his signature cape peninsula tour.

Fantastic, informative and brilliant day at Cape Peninsular. We booked with Cape Convoy on the Cape Peninsular Tour based on Trip Advisor reviews. The day exceeded our expectations, It was a real highlight to the start of our trip to Africa. Rob was amazing, his knowledge was incredible. Nothing was too much trouble. His goal was to make sure we enjoyed the day and his enthusiasm and pride in Cape Town and Africa was infectious. We saw whales, ostriches and their chicks, penguins and baboons and learnt so much history in our day tour. Thanks Rob. Your Pals Pat and Mike!

The only to see the Cape. We arranged our Cape Point trip with Rob based on the Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed... The trip was amazing and this is the only way to see the Cape..From the start Rob was full of energy and immediately made us and everyone on the tour feel at home. Rob's style was great...... he is informal, engaging, unique but more importantly incredibly knowlagable about South Africa and in this case the Cape... Rob was very flexible with the tour and we visited everything we wanted to see and more.. including Simon's Town, Boulders Bay, Chapmans Peak, Cape Point....even having the delight of seeing baby ostriches and zebra at the cape... which was amazingThis is not just a typical tourist tour trip.... Rob's passion is addictive and he provides a really good overview of the Cape and South African social history to boot...you will definitely not be bored that is for sure

A wonderful day out. Rob was a magnificent host - driving us from Capetown to Cape Point and providing a wealth of knowledge delivered with amusing anecdotes and great stories. Rob never tired of answering our questions - we had a wonderful day out and it was just the best introduction to South Africa we could have hoped for. We would recommend Cape Convoy to anyone who would like to see all the sights - with that littel bit of extra service.Thanks Rob we will never forget you ..............Deb and Jylee

2 terrific days out. We have just returned from SA where we spent 2 days with Rob. Day 1 was the Winelands tour and day 2 the Cape Peninsula tour. We had 2 terrific days out. It's all been said before but Rob is funny, high energy and great company. Rob knows his stuff and is prepared to be very flexible to accommodate his client's needs. Having been on many many organised tours in the past, in was very refreshing not be be taken to overpriced and poor qualty shops and restaurants that seem to be the priority of the tour guide rather than the tour itself to get his or her commission . We had Rob to ourselves on the Winelands tour and on day 2 enjoyed the company of a very charming lady from the USA, some 20 years younger than us. We all got on really well and it is to Rob's credit that he can 'manage' such groups of strangers and age differences with such skill to ensure that everyone's needs are catered for. it was a great day with a lot of laughter . Rob is very knowledgeable and very passionate about his Country. He felt like an old friend by the end of the 2 days and it was sad to say goodbye! SA is a very very beautiful country and we certainly learnt a lot in our 2 days with Rob . One other point to make is that on the Winelands Tour all the tastings etc were included. The only extra was lunch, which we chose the venue and time for. On the Cape Point tour all entrance fees were also included, again except lunch. I believe that there are some optional 'add ons' to the Cape tour ie boat trip to Seal island but these are clearly stated on Rob's website www.cape convoy.com

Brilliant - this is what a tour experience should be like!. We arranged a very last minute Winelands tour with Rob for our last day in Cape Town, and from the very first moment he responded to my email until he dropped us off at the end of our tour, we knew we had experienced something very special and unique.Rob was amazing and is so accommodating; he goes out of his way to make you feel at ease at all times. We were lucky to have another brilliant couple join us on the tour, and we had such good fun. You do not need to be a wine expert to enjoy the wine tasting tour, and we made to feel so welcomed at all the stops of the tour, partly due to Rob's great reputation amongst the Estates. He even managed to get us a private wine tour around one of the Estates, which was unexpected and just a great example of how he will go out of his way to give you an excellent experience. His knowledge of the area is vast and will keep you entertained with amusing stories and information as you drive from one place to the other. I promise you will not have a boring bus ride to your destination!We will be telling everyone we know who goes to Cape Town to book a tour with Rob, as we guarantee that it will be a highlight of their holiday. He doesn't try to the best, his natural way with people and his dedication in making sure everyone has a great time just means that he has ended up the best, and he rightly deserves it!

It's like having your buddy bringing you around. Rob was everything amazing. My husband and I lucked out as the other people who were supposed to be on the tour with us got their dates mixed up, so we ended up having a private tour with Rob. It was like having our buddy take us around town. We learned so much about the history and culture of SA from Rob and oh my, he is good with historical dates and timelines. We visited Hout Bay, drove along Chapman's Peak Drive, went to Simon Town, Boulder's Beach and of course the highlight was Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. Rob let us have time by ourselves as well which was a great plus and he was every so helpful to help us take pictures. He knew which spots exactly that would make picturesque shots. My husband and I are so glad to experience the beautiful Western Cape with Rob.

Go with Rob of Cape Convoy!. My wife and I were in Cape Town end August 2011. We didn't rent a car to get around so we booked a day tour to the Cape Peninsular with Cape Convoy. Rob was fantastic and hyper! Never a dull moment but at the same time he let's you have your own private time as well. Book with Rob and you will have a whale of a time for sure!

Rob is smart, interesting and puts his heart into his work.. We scheduled with Cape Convoy to visit Cape Point. It rained the day we were scheduled. Two others were booked on the same day and couldn't change their plans. Rob took them on the scheduled day and gave us our own tour the next day when the whether was perfect. He really enjoys his work, knows geography, history and culture. We have no reservations about giving him the highest recommendation.

Rob is your mate about 30 seconds after you met him. Fantastic trip around the wine areas plus and unscheduled stop to stroke a cheetah!Rob made the trip with his live wire chat and enthusiastic personality, he was eager to please and make sure we got the day we wanted.Highly recommended for a great day out on any itinerary

Like an old friend showing you his city. I and 2 other gals took a tour to Cape Point with Rob and it was fantastic! The weather was a bit yucky--gray and rainy--so we took our time going down to the Point, stopping at the Bird & Wildlife Sanctuary as well as some other places. By the time we got to the Point, the skies turned blue and it turned into a beautiful day. Rob was incredibly knowledgeable about the history and geology of the area, but was also funny and personable. Doing a tour with him was like visiting a friend who was showing you around his city. I strongly recommend.

A must in South Africa!. My wife and I just returned from an incredible vacation to Cape Town, South Africa. Due to its number 1 rating for tours in Trip Advisor,we booked 3 tours with Cape Convoy: Cape Point, Winelands and The 3 Day Garden Route Tour. We were so lucky to have had Rob as our tour guide. Everything that has been written in the reviews about Rob is true and more. Rob is bright, energetic, and funny. He is passionate about his country and its history. His passion is infectious. We had great fun and learned so much about South Africa. Each tour had its highlights. In particular, the Garden Route with visits to an ostrich farm, Cango Caves, Cango Wildlife Ranch ( a breeding facility for endangered cheetahs), Featherbed Nature Preserve and the Botlierskop Game Reserve brought many unique activities and experiences.The route had spectacular scenery and the accommodations were superb. Rob tailored the Point Tour to avoid the rain, the raced the clouds to see penguins, a wild ostrich family on the beach and whales. The tours were active and exciting though we did skip the shark cages ( on purpose ). We give Cape Convoy and Rob our highest recommendation. You can't go wrong with this company!

Best day of our visit. This was an amazing tour and Rob had so much energy that we were entertained all day, as well as being given lots of useful information and local knowledge. We met another lovely couple on the trip so felt as if we could share the wonderful experience with great new friends. It made our honeymoon so very special.

Awesome, informative and entertaining. My husband and I went on the Cape Point tour with Rob. The other 4 individuals who were supposed to go with us canceled, so we had a private tour. It was awesome. We went in search of baboons, stopped at scenic lookouts and heard all about Cape Town's history. We couldn't recommend this tour more!

Wonderful day out- learnt all about the colorful history & scenery of SA. Did my own trip with my Irish girlfriends in a hired car 11y ago. Barely remebered a thing! Rob the tour guide with Cape Convoy is so passionate about his country and his job that you are guaranteed a memorable day out. He makes it his mission to ensure you have a fun day out seeing all the sights that the Cape has to offer and boy did he deliver for my boyfriend & I. Highly recommend this trip for value for money and you'll finish the day with a greater appreciation of SA, it's history, it's people and it's beauty!

Delightful!. By the end of our day touring the Cape with Rob, the four of us felt as if we had made a new friend. He was so relaxed, funny, and engaging, and yet he was so knowledgeable about Cape Town, the Cape area, and South African history. He talked non-stop, and we learned a tremendous amount about the area. It was very obvious that he has a passion for what he does and where he lives, and he wants to share it all with his clients. He does seem a bit loosey-goosey at times, but that's part of his charm. We would definitely recommend him to anyone who is visiting the Cape Town area!

Cape Convoy - priceless!. We had a fabulous day touring the Cape with Rob and another couple from Ireland. Rob kept us all engaged from the moment he picked us up. The weather kept changing, but Rob was extremely adaptable and just kept switching the order we did things in, so we could see each of the sites in the best possible weather. He went above and beyond to make sure that we all had a positive experience.My teenagers thought Rob was "awesome, freakin' hilarious, and would do the tour again and again, nine times in a row!" Rob was extremely knowledgeable about the area and South African history. We learned more from him in one day than we did on the rest of our entire trip. Our only regret is not staying longer in Cape Town so that we could have enjoyed the other tours offered by Cape Convoy. Oh well, maybe that's an excuse to go back...............................

Our best day in Cape Town!. Our family just returned from a 5 day visit to Cape Town. The highlight of our stay was the peninsula tour with Rob. He was so knowledgeable but at the same time so much fun! We learned so much while laughing the whole time! He clearly loves his job and couldn't do enough for us...making our stay special was so important to him. If you could choose to do only one tour during your stay this is the one to pick.

Calling Rob a "Tour Guide" would be an insult.... ....he is a historian, a comedian, a political and social commentator, and a honey badger (Rob's favorite animal).... and frankly just a great guy to spend a day with. I think our day with Rob will be one that I will remember my whole life. If I go back to Cape Town I am going on Cape Convoy again!

Wonderful!. Rob's tour was fantastic! I spent my childhood in South Africa and both my parents lived there until their 30's. We all had an amazing time on the tour! We saw so many beautiful things and learned more than we thought we would. But most importantly, the day was so much fun for all of us, including my 9 and 17 year old daughters. I recommend this tour to anyone and everyone!

Fantastic...... My husband and I have just returned from a week in Cape Town with our teenage sons (16 and 18). I had booked the Cape Convoy Peninsula tour after all the postive reviews on here and we were not disappointed, in fact even better than could have imagined! Rob arrived to pick us up at the hotel as agreed and from the word go enterained us with interesting snippets of history, information and jokes! We were the only people on the tour but Rob did say his maximum group size was 6.We went to Hout Bay and did the seal island boat trip, then on Chapmans Peak drive with a couple of amazing photo stops and then on to Simonstown. When we arrrived here it was quite misty and cloudy - we left Rob to go for a coffee and after about 15 mins he came to find us to suggest that we go to Boulders Bay to see the penguins and then head back to Cape Town for the day. He'd pick us up the next day and take us to Cape Point to see if the weather / visibility was any better!! Wow never had service like that on a tour! Rob dropped us back at V&A about 230pm and then collected us at 8am then next day to take us to Cape Point. We were the first people to arrive and the mist cleared as we drove up - fantastic. Would certainly recommend Rob - most friendly and likeable guide you will ever meet!

Loads of fun. Recently returned from Cape Town and 2 great days with Rob doing the Cape Peninsula tour and Winelands tour. Rob was not only very informative, but also extremely amusing and entertaining. He was flexible and modified our tours appropriately to our interests and desires. (He even allowed me lots of extra shopping time assuring that it did not interfere with our scheduled plans.) One of the funniest times was when Rob cajoled the ostrich to bite at his arms and hands.Our days with Rob were very special. He is a warm, very energetic and entertaining guide who kept us learning and laughing the whole time. He exceeded our expectations.

Great customized tour at group rate. My husband and I were the only ones on the tour due to rainy weather so Rob customized for us. He rearranged the itinerary in order to get us to Cape Point before the rain hit there. Weather was good at Cape Point, we saw baboons, ostriches, and an eland at the Cape of Good Hope and the penguins on the way back. Rob offered to drive us to the cable car for Table Mountain when we returned to Cape Town, but the clouds had moved in again and we ended up not going.
