He was a very informative and entertaining guide (lots of history, which we enjoyed hearing), and we appreciated his attitude about the changes that have taken place in South Africa and will probably continue to take place.

A Blast!. We had a small group of 8 on this tour and it was a blast. Our guide (owner) Rob was interesting, very funny and the sights he showed us were spectacular. I can' recommend him highly enough.
Fabulous!. Did the Cape tour with Rob and had a great time - Highly recommended!! Rob is knowledgeable, funny and engaging. One of the highlights of our two week visit to South Africa.

Brilliant!. We did the Cape Peninsula Tour and the Winelands Tour with Rob. He was the most excellent, knowledgable and most of all fun guide we could have asked for. He was enthusiastic and really made our trip to Cape Town better than we could have expected. Nothing was too much trouble and the itinerary remained flexible to make the most of the weather, to avoid crowds etc etc. A master of his trade.
Highly recommended. Rob is a very nice and funny guide. Expect not just to see the amazing views of the cape peninsula, but also to have real fun and to know better about this part of the world.

Fantastic time, an experience never forgotten and hard to rival.. If you want a great time, one hard to surpass, one that will excite, educate and inspire, then make sure you contact Rob at Cape Convoy Tours. From the moment we was picked up at our hotel to the moment we was dropped off, Rob never stopped giving us an education on the history, the politics and the beauty of Cape Town, all with a relaxed and fun atmosphere. Great guy, cheers mate.

No better way to see the Cape peninsula!. After reading the numerous positive reviews on this site, we decided to book a cape peninsula tour with Rob at Cape Convoy. We were so happy that we did. Rob has such vast knowledge of the area, wildlife, and history of South Africa. He had tons of entertaining stories to tell along the tour & you can tell he's just really passionate about what he does. I feel like I learned so much in one day. We were a group of 4 total, and he customized the tour to what the group was interested in. He's personable and keeps everyone engaged for the day. When my parents go visit Capetown, I'll be sending them to see Rob because I know they'll be in good hands. Thanks for a great time!!!

Absolutely FANTASTIC!. We did the 4 day 3 night Garden Route tour which was the highlight of our holiday thanks to Rob's limitless enthusiasm, massive amounts of knowledge and clear love of South Africa. Every hotel/ guest house we stayed in was immaculate and very accommodating. After the Garden Route tour we also signed up for the one day Cape Point tour. Again, Rob's enthusiasm was infectious and we had an incredible last day before heading back to the UK.We've recommended Cape Convoy Tours to everyone we've spoken to about our amazing trip to SA.

Fun filled day around Cape Point--well worth it. I took this tour with 2 other family members, and we all had a great time. Rob is very dynamic and he really packed a lot in to the day. We saw so much, and Rob was great at managing the sequence and timing of the site visits so we missed the crowds. The group was 8 tourists, and Rob facilitated a very friendly atmosphere so although we did not know each other we all felt very comfortable together. Rob has a degree in history, and beyond pointing out the sites, he shared a lot of information about the history and social dynamics in South Africa that we would never have otherwise been exposed to.

Great fun, wonderful trip. Recently did the Cape Convoy full day Cape Point tour with my family, we had a fantastic time with Rob who is very knowledgable about the history, geography and culture of the western cape but is also very relaxed and great fun, we laughed all day and saw some memorable things, from seals, ostriches, penguins and baboons to beautiful beaches and landscapes, including the spectacular Cape Point. Highly recommended.

Cape Convoy was excellent. Rob was an excellent guide - I loved our day trip around the Cape and it was so great that we got to see so many animals. As a single traveler Rob made sure that I was never left out - he walked me up to the lighthouse and beyond and took lots of photos for me. Rob was hilarious and made our tour of Cape Town very memorable.

Best Tour Company in Africa!!!!!. We visited Cape town end of February into beging of March 2011.We booked the garden route tour(5 day western/eastern cape), safari, cape point, andthe wine tour. Our tour guide(and now good friend) was Rob Salmon.Coming such a distance you are apprehensive of the tour company you have choosen,Rob put us at ease the first 5 minutes on meeting him. Personal touch ,honesty and justdown right great guy who provided over the top tours, extensive knowledge base of SouthAfrica, and a great sense of humor. Our Safety was first, and @ no time did we feel threatened, secure comfortable van. Nothing was out of the way or too much trouble.Accomodations outstanding with the nicest people you could meet! Took us to some great restraunts too! A-one for Rob and Cape convoy tours! Garry, Roberto from St Catharines, Ontario, Canada! P.S. we found this tour company on trip adviser.

Best tour EVER!!!. I could go into details, but it has obviously been said dozens of times before. Rob's tour is simply one of the best tours that you will take in your life. A great start to an awesome African vacation!!! Thank you SOOO MUCH BRU!!!

Amazing, interesting, knowledgeable and great fun!. We booked the Cape Peninsular tour after reading several reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. Rob provides a wonderful day in his own inimitable way..his passion for the history and geography of the area is second to none.

One Of The Best Tours My Wife Have Ever Take. I went on line and was very fortunate to have found Cape Convoy Tours, you never know what your going to get. Rob our tour guide and owner of Cape Conoy Tours did not stop speaking during the length of our tours to Cape Point and the surrounding areas. He was very informative and knew the history and the areas well. My wife and myself have taken many tours in our lifetime, this has to be one of the best tours we have ever taken. If we ever come back to Cape Town I would certainly call Rob to book some additional tours.Jerome GreenfieldWest Palm Beach, Florida

Spoiled Us for Other Tours. Rob took us on the Cape Point Day Tour. We had a wonderful time and saw everything possible in that area. It spoiled us for future tours we took. Rob is professional, fun, educational, and can't say enough good things about him. As you can see from other reviews, everyone agrees. Thank you, Rob, for a wonderful day, tour and experience!!!

Fabulous Cape Point tour & Wine tour. After reading all the great reviews on Trip Advisor, Megan & I decided this was the tour for us. And the Cape Point tour was just like all the reviews, fun, informative, at our group's pace. Rob was funny but so knowledgeable and informative. The day was over before we knew it. We also took the Wine tour but Julius was sick on that day so we got Rob again. Rob was not as knowledgeable about wine as he is on history, culture & people of South Africa but we had a great day!

SIMPLY THE BEST - What a tour Rob your a star - Just do it, it's simply the best.. Friday 4th Feb 2011. Like most people we use trip advisor to review tours and this particular tour was rated No. 1 in Cape Town. We now know why, it was magic, Rob, what a tour guide, his knowledge and history of not just Cape Town but of South Africa as well was excellent. He greats you with a smile and gets straight into it, he really made the trip a great success. The trip went at our pace not his pace, there was not time limit on any of the locations he took us too. He knew where to go and what time of day to take you there as the clouds can drift In at anytime and spoil the views of the Cape. Bring a camera, a good one, as there is some magnificent scenery our there so see. Have a peek at some of the photos.

Totally entertaining. We don't know if we can add anymore to all the previous rave reviews of Rob and his tours. He and his tours are the best. We did tours on 2 days with him and loved every second with him. You must book your Cape Town tours with Cape Convoy if you want the best!!

Amazing Tour and Tour Guide!. We selected Cape Convoy Tours after reading about them on-line. After making contact via email there was a mix up on our tour date. They are normally closed on Sunday's and that was the only day we could complete our tour. After explaining the misunderstanding Rob agreed to still take us on a full day Cape Point Tour! Our travel group consisted of my parents, husband and 2 children ages 8 and 5. Rob was able to keep ALL of us completely entertained for the entire 8+ hours! If it is history that you crave this is your guy! If it is just an entertaining informational tour this is your guy! This tour was everything you could ask for and more! I just hope that he made it home in time for dinner at his mom's! :o)Our next trip to the Cape will include another tour with Rob and the wine country! We can't wait!

Informative, interesting and most importantly fun!. Not as if Rob needs anymore reviews, but this is an excellent tour of the Cape. The history of South Africa; the flora and fauna; where to get the best shots; fast track at the boat trip, delivered with passion and a lot of humour. Expect a 'test' at the end. We got all the right dates, but the wrong sequence. Not that we were'nt listening there's just so much.I will go to Cape Town again - it's a truly beautiful city - and will take more of Rob's tours.Pat & Ruth

Don't Book Your Peninsula Tour with anyone else..... Cape Convoy may not be a familiar name amongst the 'usual tour operator suspects'... but then again, I suspect most travellers don't do much research and thus don't know about Cape Convoy.... their loss.... Our Peninsula day trip with Rob was absolutely phenominal... he's funny, passionate, educational, passionate, dedicated, passionate, and very knowledgeable... oh, and did I mention passionate? !!! Rob picked us up at our B&B at 8 and off we went... we joined 4 others (6 people in all)... and we all had a blast... highlights were too many to list... but one of the benefits of travelling with Rob was busloads of tourists were 'hogging' time at the Cape of Good Hope sign (where you want your photo taken - alone!) ... it was obvious Rob had seen this before - he simply walked over like he owned the place and within a couple of minutes had cleared the area, took our pictures, and then we moved on... Be ready for a full day... you won't get back until around 6pm... and you'll have memories and pictures/videos to last a lifetime...

Fantastic Tour. What a wonderful tour to Cape point/Cape of good Hope as well as the rest of the Cape Peninsula- Rob is such a lovely guy and makes the day so much fun - as well as giving you a comprehensive history lesson about S Africa and its roots. Rob is so passionate about Cape Town and area and I can see why it is a stunning place and he took us around virtually all of the Cape - not a stone left unturnned!My husband who also likes history got on well with him like a house on fire - and it was only at the end of the tour we realized they had the same birthdate - only about 25yrs between!! If this is your first trip to Cape Town Like another reviewer suggested I would do the Red bus Tour around Cape Town to get a feel of the city then I would recommend Cape Convoy (Robs Tour) another day - you will not be disappointed

The best way to see Cape Town. From the first 2 minutes my gang met Rob you knew it was going to be a fun day! We had booked Rob for a number of tours and his energy, passion and love of the area really shone through and helped us understand a lot about the history and beauty of the area. Thats not to say its all facts and figures, it is genuine fun delivered in Rob's unique style which may not appeal to those who want a quiet tour by numbers experience. His tips on the nightlife we're bloody great too. Next time myself and the lads from Dublin are back, we'll be booking Rob again!

Trust the reviews. It's all been said before and many times. Rob and Cape Convoy Tours are great.Rob makes the tour fun, interesting and the best laugh you will have in a long time. If only my school history lessons had been that much fun. Can't recommend highly enough - you will NOT be disappointed.

I would go back to Cape Town just to do this tour again.. I've traveled to quite a few places and been on many tours, and I can honestly say that I've never been on one that comes close to being as good as Cape Convoy's Cape Point tour. You can tell that Rob, the tour Guide, is really passionate about what he does. He mixes humour with his great knowledge of southern African history to make it a really enjoyable trip. Through his company Cape Convoy, he can organise many different trips for you, but I highly recommend the Cape Point tour because you get to spend the full day in his (sometimes chaotic) company.

Every moment is an adventure on the Cape Convoy!. If you're looking for an itinerary that runs perfectly to a schedule that has been written in stone, and an endless stream of cold hard facts and figures, then Cape Convoy is not for you. If, on the other hand, you're looking for an unpredictable adventure, led by a very knowledgeable, outgoing and somewhat hyper guide who brings Cape Town and its history to life, then make your booking with Cape Convoy Tours now! You won't regret it, and you'll come out of your trip with a ridiculous number of crazy stories, wonderful memories and a love of Cape Town and its characters. My group booked three tours in a week and we couldn't wait for the next one. If fact, I'd happily go back and book another tour just for the sheer fun of it!Leave your watch and preconceptions at home and hop on Rob's Cape Convoy!
Great Day out -Gave us a real feel of Cape Town. Fab day out - covered everything, saw everything that the guide books said we should see. Couldnt fault it - fun, informative etc

Like an old friend showing you around town.... The two times I've visited Cape Town, I've met up with Rob.The first time I met him was when I took his Cape Town tour in 2009 and the next was when I took my partner over the Cape Town.Each time I've taken the Tour, Rob has been informative and full of energy to make it the best day possible. He took us to all the main sites and the second time around tried to included a couple of places he hadn't taken me last time around - legend!!My recommendation would be to take a tour around on the red bus, one day, stop off at Kirstenbosh Gardens and then take Rob's tour the next day. The main reason is that he'll fill in all the gaps and questions you'll have from the previous days red bus.He'll show you the pengiuns, the seals and make sure you get the important pictures to take home.Every friend, who visits Cape Town, gets told to look up Rob... and no he's not paying me commission to say this.... he's one of lifes genuine guys.

This is how you do Cape Town > Cape Convoy!. Just finished an incredible Cape Point tour with Rob at Cape Convoy. As a tour operator his service was professional throughout our entire experience. He would regularly text us with updates for pick up times. And he warmly greeted us at the front of our accommodation. Rob took us to every place on the Cape that was worth going to. Throughout the trip Rob impressed us on his knowledge of the Cape's history, the people that have influenced its present culture, and the wildlife that inhabit its shores. Robs insight was a comprehensive and hugely entertaining way to experience the Cape. We got to see wild Ostrich's feeding at the Cape of Good Hope, baboons walking along the road, hundreds of seals at Seal island, and the amazing penguins of Boulder. Even at Cape Point, Rob told us of a track that few tourists follow but which gets the most incredible views of the upper lighthouse and where the two oceans meet. During the trip, before we got to our next destination, Rob would explain the history and any entertaining stories that help us to connect with the landmark on more than just a tourist level. He was flexible and gracious enough to go with whatever the group felt like doing. All in all, we couldn't fault Cape 'Convoy on anything. Even my 10yr old daughter was laughing the entire day. Rob revealed to us that his goal is to convince everyone that Cape Town and the surrounding districts is the best place in the world. After our experience today, Cape Town is definitely up their with the best. And Cape Convoy is definitely the way to do it!

The most fun tour ever!. All the reviews about this tour tells the truth. We took the Cape Point tour and this was better tour than we could ever expect and we warmly recommend this to anyone who has even some sense of humour and wants to experience a fun tour with a great guide who knows and tells you more details than you can ever remember, but it is so exciting that there is no fear of getting bored, but this tour you will definatelly remember all your life.Wonderful views, cute penguins, funny seals, exciting stories, sun, great guide and really nice fellow tour-mates was what our tour was made of.After this tour you go to sleep smiling and promise yourself to vome back to Cape Town one day!

The best thing to do in Cape Town!. The three days our family spent with Rob and Julian were the highlight of our trip to South Africa. Both were extremely enthusiastic, knowledgeable guides, who provided valuable insights in an entertaining atmosphere. We learned a lot about the history of South Africa, had a ball, and laughed until our sides hurt. I would recommend Cape Convoy to anyone traveling in the Cape Town area!

Best Tour Guide Ever!. We went on the tour of The Cape of Good Hope etc with Rob from Cape Convoy.Rob was both funny and knowledgeable. Don't be fooled by what seems like a cockney accent, Rob is a proud South African and boy, does he know his stuff. Rob makes the history part of the tour so much fun and memorable. He pitches this part of the tour according to his audience. If you don’t want to hear too much about the history of apartheid etc he will happily oblige, but if you do, Rob’s wealth of knowledge is phenomenal.I would thoroughly recommend this tour company– We can’t wait to return to Cape Town and to our next Cape Convoy tour!!

Cape Convoy will blow you away. BEST tour in the world... one day and you'll see and know almost all of Cape Town!. We saw Cape Convoy on Trip Advisor and what glowing reviews they got and being we didn't have a lot of time in Cape Town we thought this was the best way to go. Although, not usually a fan of organized tours, we decided to book our tour...we were not disappointed and all the reviews are true. Rob, our tour guide, first off, is AMAZING and secondly, the tour package is perfect, it covers so much ground and is worth every penny and thirdly, the experience was unforgettable. Rob knew so much history and he's absolutely entertaining. Forget about a stuffy tour bus with a droning tour guide, this guy is HOT and on fire and full of energy and gets you PUMPED about everything you are hearing and seeing, plus he drives you around in a smaller minibus, so it's more intimate and you really bond with your bus mates. Cape Town is gorgeous as it is, but you get to see so many wonderful sights and hear perspectives from a local who clearly LOVES his city and his country and is very proud of where its come from and where it is going. You want to learn a little about where you are vacationing, this tour is for you. We'd have done all their tours had we more time.Right from the start Cape Convoy, the company, was professional and prompt with arrangements and payment. Then, you get a personal pick up from Rob, right at your hotel door...smiling and happy and like I said, full of energy, it's just how you want to start any day! Before you even see the beauty of Cape Town you are feeling good and ready to go because of Rob's jovial nature.With so much ground to cover you think you might get overwhelmed or tired, but not with Rob and not with the itinerary they have planned for you, you can tell a lot of smart & thoughtful planning go into their tours. You just want more and more and until the very end - and our end climaxed with a GORGEOUS soon to be setting sun at Chapman's Peak. We were almost sad to say goodbye to Rob and the people we'd shared our tour with. I have a feeling too that Rob somewhat conducts his tours based on his passengers and their dynamic, which is brilliant. He is a great judge of his surroundings and instinctively knows what his clients want.When we go back, which I know we will...we'll take a different tour from Cape Convoy again. And if it's not with Rob, as there are other tour guides, we'll also try to arrange having a few beers to catch up with him. He's that kind of guy who leaves an impression! Their whole business did. It's a day in me and my husband's life that we hold close to our hearts, because it - was - truly - special.Thank you Rob and thank you Cape Convoy!

Going to Cape Town? This is the only way to see it!. I wanted a fun and informative tour of Cape Town and after having read the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor I went with Cape Convoy and I’m so happy I did! You’d need a pretty special guide in order to keep my attention for a full day of site seeing and Rob was just the man! He has an abundance of energy (not overbearing), enthusiasm and outstanding knowledge of this beautiful country. He made sure that everyone was looked after, entertained and well informed. He really went above and beyond for a guide and it made all the difference. It was a fantastic day – not once was I bored!! On my next trip to CT I will be sure to book another tour with Cape Convoy! Thank you Rob

Superb Cape Peninsular Tour - Rob made the difference!. My wife and I did a Cape Peninsular Tour with Cape Convoy having read the reviews on Tripadvisor. Considering that they were the number 1 attraction for Cape Town tours, we naturally had very high expectations for it - and our expectations were exceeded! I must say Rob truly made the difference for the tour. We had been on other tours around Africa before coming to Cape Town, our last stop of our travels and I must say that Rob's exuberance, energy and wealth of knowledge was astounding. He kept the group engaged througout the full day trip with stories, information and wonderful insights and opinions. A guide with real heart and soul who takes into consideration every kind of traveller in his entourage. Even the family with a child travelling with us had all her questions answered. What also impressed us was his persona that makes us so comfortable right from the start. Even for an Asian like me, coming from a relatively conservative society, you can't help to feel connected to a tour guide like Rob. His service is impeccable and can be seen in his ability to keep the itinerary flexible and attending to the small things like ensuring we don't get stuck in traffic, making sure we get good pics along the way, picking up nuances in the group like an interest in ostriches and the subsequent unplanned quick stop for ostrich feeding, recommending a lunch point that will not burn a hole in the pocket. His passion just overflows and it is infectious!

Tip Top Tour. My Wife and I went on the Cape Peninsula day tour and it was absolutely fantastic. Rob is a real character and made the day fun and interesting from beginning to end. Fantastic scenary etc is a given on these types of tours but what makes them stand out is the tour guides and they don't come much better than Rob! He is not only good fun and enthusiastic but extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the wonderful country of South Africa. If you are looking to do a tour of the Cape Peninula, you shouldn't even consider going with anyone else.

Whatever you do, do it with Cape Convoy!. I felt that I must write my first review after our recent trip to Cape Town because Rob and Julius with their differing but equally brilliant styles completely made our holiday! We did 4 trips with them, each one a wonderful experience for the whole family (not always easy to achieve!). Julius took us to the winelands and also shark cage diving. He is unassuming and amusing with a laid back attitude yet with great knowledge of the area (and its wines.....). He tailored the days to suit our interests and could not have been more obliging or accommodating. Rob, who took us to Cape Point, Chapmans Peak, Boulders Bay penguin beach and introduced us to the amazing honey badger is the polar opposite - a bundle of energy who made our time with him unforgettable. He has a wealth of knowledge that he is bursting to share in his inimitable way. He had us laughing all day but we learnt an amazing amount and came away feeling like old friends. The weather played havoc with the plans we had in place on arrival but Rob made sure that we got to do as much as was possible. We will definitely be back to do more with Cape Convoy again - our advice would be to look no further, these guys are the best!

If you miss this tour, than you have not seen Cape Town and surrounds! This tour is a must do!. What an amazing tour!!! If you go to Cape Town and you do not do this tour, than you have definitely not seen Cape Town and its surrounds, and this is definite. Truly one of the best tours I have done! Not only that, Rob was an absolute barrel of laughs , and so informative, I could not believe how much Rob knew about Cape Town and South Africa. It was amazing! He is a walking, talking ecnycolpedia and history book, without being boring at all, it was great! The way he delivered all the information was so interesting and enjoyable, and not boring at all. Rob took us absolutely everywhere. No stone was left unturned. I could not believe how much we saw in one day and for the amount we paid , it was soooo cheap! Rob genuinely cared about making this day an unforgetable one for us and went out of his way to take us everywhere and anywhere and to please us. I would 100% recommend this tour to anyone and if you miss this tour, it is a great loss! Thank you so much Rob :)

No better tour than Cape Convoy. We had a personal family tour of the peninsular with Rob. Many many thanks to the reviewers who helped me select Cape Convoy and Rob. We had the most fantastic time - we were in awe, moved, challenged, by the beauty, the sites, the landscape that Rob exposed us to. And he had us laughing hysterically all day with his great sense of humor. If you are visiting Cape Town, this is the company you want to reach out to. If you get Rob too, then you've certainly won the lottery.

The Coolest Day in Cape Town wit the best guide. Boy howdy what at day. Rob met us at 8:30 am and we were off and running. He is Mr. History and we learned more in one day about Cape Town than I learned in High School or forgot in High School. When I travel to a city I always take a private tour and only with somone who has grown up in the area and knows and loves their city. Rob is your quy, and Cape Convoy Tours is the company.This is the way you should keep your memories.ThanksCandy

Amazing day along the Cape Peninsula with Cape Convoy's Rob!. My wife and I booked Cape Convoy's Cape Peninsula Tour - An amazing day in Cape Town. We pretty much covered everything the Cape Peninsula has to offer in a fun filled day packed with loads of information. Rob is an amazing tour guide. His love and passion for what he does makes the day an unforgettable experience. Cape Town is amazing place - Cape Convoy will make it Rock!

Cape Convoy Tours - Garden Route October 2010. We found our initial contact with Cape Convoy Tours (CCT) exceptional, every question we emailed to Rob and his lovely wife Liza prior to leaving home was often answered within hours. Any concerns we may have had booking this tour ourselves were quickly diminished by Liza and Rob's reassuring and responsive emails. We started off from Port Elizabeth with CCT picking us up from a private residence and was met by Julius (Jules) who I might add has a great passion for his guide work and South Africa. Jules was extremely informative throughout our entire trip and could not do enough for us.From Port Elizabeth we went to Tsitskamma where we joined the Tsitskamma Canopy Tours swinging our way through the treetops on a flying fox, what a hoot!!! A visit to the Tsitskamma National Park is a must, and the accommodation at the Tsitskamma Lodge was terrific, you would think you were in the Swiss Alps.Day two was Knysna and a guided walk in the Featherbed Nature Reserve. Great view, great meal, a great place to visit.Day 3 we arrived in Oudtshoorn, where we first stopped and visited the Cango Caves, very spectacular. But I must say the highlight for us was a visit to an ostrich farm where Renea managed to have a massage by the local habitants (check the photo). The B&B we stayed at in Oudtshoorn '88 Baron Van Reede Guesthouse' was fantastic and our hosts Zoe & Shaun certainly looked after us.Day 4 we left Oudtshoorn and traversed the country side to make our way to the windy city Cape Town, and boy did the wind blow!!! But what a great place; we stayed the Fire & Ice Hotel in Cape Town, and if its funky you want from your accommodation this is the place.We arranged for a visit two days later with CCT and Jules our faithful tour guide arrived to take us around some of the wineries in Stellenbosch. Jules's love for South Africa is only second to his love for the wine country. Some friendly banter was had about who's country produced the better Cab Sav but we have to admit Jules almost won his argurment. LOL. We will endeavour to get some wine over to you Jules so you can see what you are missing out on. Seriously though, great wine and food to be had in this area. If you get a chance visit Spiers Winery, combine their wines with their treetop dining, patting chetahs, and local music you will be certainly in for a great day.From us to CCT, thankyou so much Liz and Rob for organising a great tour with plenty to see, and to you Jules thank you for making it such a memorable trip. We will be back.Kind RegardsGreg and Renea

Take the Tours. We did both the Cape Peninsula and Wine Region Tours with Cape Convoy and thoroughly enjoyed them both.The Cape Peninsula Tour was run by the irrepressable Rob whose high energy, high octane style whizzes you through the day. He imparts his considerable knowledge of the culture, history and geography of the area in a very interesting manner.We visited Hout Bay - Seal Island, Simons Town and learned about the legendary naval dog Just Nuisance, the penguins at Boulders Beach and finally the nature reserve of Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope where we encountered baboons, elands and ostriches within touching distance along the roadside. The journey both ways included travelling along Chapman's Peak Drive with it's stunning scenery and photo opportunites.It was excellent value for money especially as unlike some other tours all the entrance fees were included in the cost of the tour.The Winelands Tour was equally enjoyable with the more relaxed style of Julius being more suited to the nature of the tour. Julius was a teriific guide with an indepth knowledge of the wines. He tailored the day to suit our tastes, with a nice touch in starting the tour with a champagne/sparkling wine tasting and ending with a wine and chocolate pairing. The 'normal' tastings in between were no less special!We were given options for lunch and chose to spend a couple of hours in Stellenbosch which was ideal and a chance to sober up!As with the Cape Peninsula Tour, all the costs of the tasting were included in the price of the tour.We would thoroughly recommend either/both of these tours. A tip would be to do the Winelands Tour early in your stay so you can take advantage of the very reasonably priced wines to drink back in your hotel.

A Must-Do for every visitor to Cape town - Rob makes the breathtaking peninsula even more amazing!. As a travel agent, I am very careful when booking my own travel products, and like everything else, I shopped around for my tour of the peninsula. First off, Cape Town is an amazing city on it's own; but to miss out on the peninsula and the most south-westernly point of the African continent would be sacrilege. Cape Convoy's Cape peninsula tour provides an in-depth look at so much more than the beautiful scenery, but allows you to really appreciate it on a different level. The rich history and fun facts that Rob includes just keeps your mind racing throughout the tour. Rob's incredible energy and passion is contagious and allows you to feel what he feels... I strongly urge any visitor to Cape town to book the tour of their life, which is Cape Convoy's Cape Peninsula tour... Oh, and if you are an adrenaline junkie, they also offer the very popular Shark Cage Dive; and if you arn't, then they also offer Winelands tours! I learnt so much about South Africa on December 2nd, and I would love to share Rob's knowledge with all. Again, I can't elaborate to which extent i fully enjoyed this tour. Thank you, Rob!

Cape Convoy and Rob. Where to start...I really cannot praise Rob enough. I was a single female lone traveller and my first trip with Rob was with 3 couples...I could have been left out on a limb but Rob included me within an instant and made me feel part of the group.The tour itself was fantastic, the scenary amazing and the adhoc info from Rob was welcome and fun.Rob's enthusiam for his country is contageous.Whole heartedly would recommend.

Great wine with a breathtaking backdrop. We went on two tours with this company, the Winelands tour and the Cape Peninsular tour. Both are very different with very different approach, so I will write about them separately.The Winelands tour was the first tour we went on. The scenery was amazing and the host Julius was informative, friendly and kept us entertained all the while. Although he was always on hand, he wasn’t hovering over your shoulder every two minutes, allowing everyone to enjoy it at their own pace in a laidback atmosphere. During the day we went to several different vineyards, each different, each with its own character and wine style and each of them worthwhile. We were lucky, it was a glorious sunny day, we met and shared the tour with some lovely people (hello Harry and Margery) and everyone came away happy (and slightly drunk!). If you’re over 18, enjoy a good glass of wine, while overlooking rolling mountains, lush farmland and pretty courtyards, then, in my opinion, this is a tour well worth doing.

The Best Tour Guide in the World!. My partner and I visited Cape Town in December and scheduled a Cape Peninsula tour. The reviews rated Cape Convoy Tours the number one tour company in Cape Town and we came with very high expectations. To have our expectations exceeded by this incredible tour is truly mind boggling! We have been around the world, but have never had a tour guide like Rob. He was the most articulate, passionate and informative guide we have ever had the pleasure of meeting. His knowledge of history and politics was extremely impressive, but it was his unceasing energy and enthusiasm that truly set him apart from all others. Unfortunately, Rob has raised the bar so high that we may never ever be pleased again!

Great Tour - Thanks Rob!. As part of our father's 70th birthday celebrations, my sister put together an itinearary which included 4 days on the garden route and 2 days in Cape Town with Cape Convoy.Rob's high energy, full-on enthusiasm may not be up everybody's street, but his passion and knowledge was endearing and we all had a thoroughly enjoyable time with him. Driving for hours on end on a tour is painful at the best of times, but Rob made the hours melt away with interesting stories, facts and good conversation.If you want a holiday that's quiet, tranquil and unexciting, don't book with Cape Convoy, but if you want to understand the history, culture and tradition of the Western Cape, then Rob's your man. I highly recommend Cape Convoy - top bloke, honest and genuine.Alvin

Spectacular, informative, and extraordinarily friendly. Rob led us on a one day Cape Point tour, filled with extensive history and incredible scenery. We saw a zillion seals on seal island and a plethora of penguins along the way. There is a photo of our group posing with a few locals on the capeconvoy.com home page. Rob is extraordinarily knowledgable and full of energy (he kinda bounces off walls), and he customizes the tour to the interests of the people in the group. All in all it was a terrific day of sightseeing!

so much energy,well versed with cape town history. we visited cape town from 11th to 16th nov,2010.We took the cape point/cape peninsula tour with Rob.I was amazed to see the amount of energy rob has!!he is really wonderful.He explained in detail about the history of cape town on our journey to cape penisual tour.It was really wonderful to know the history of cape town.His indepth knowledge and energy makes the trip really pleasurable.I would surely recommend cape convoy for tours in cape town.cape town is such a beautiful city and Rob it's worthy guide.I wish him and lIza all the best and good luck.yysandeep/anita

Loved the trip, loved Rob, learnt a lot!. We booked Cape Convoy after seeing the company top the tour companies on Trip Advisor. We did the Cape Peninsular group tour on Nov 29 2010 (there were only 4 of us on the tour that day). As I had watched the video on their web site I knew what to expect from tour guide Rob but my husband wondered what had hit him.Rob is an Essex boy, talks a mile-a-minute and is so enthusiastic about South Africa and history that you are soon sucked into his world! He puts his extensive knowledge over in easy to digest chunks without talking down to his audience (or sending them to sleep!).We had a great, full day out - loved everything we did - and didn't feel rushed. We learnt more about the real South Africa and its history in one day than you would think possible!His style is not for everybody - if you want a sedate, quiet day this is not for you. For us, it was perfect!

AMAZING. My husband and I booked the Cape Point Tour and the shark diving. The first day was the shark diving. It was incredible, we were able to see several sharks, and one was almost 4 m in length! I almost could not make myself go into the cage, but the crew was so nice they were able to make me feel comfortable enough to brave the sharks. I am so glad I did, and I know I will never forget it. Second, was the Cape Point Tour. On the day it was scheduled it was raining; Rob came to our hotel to pick us up, but instead of trying to make the best of a rainy day, Rob was nice enough to re-arrange his schedule so that he could take us the following day. We ended up getting a private tour and it was definitely worth the wait! We felt like we were riding around Cape Town with a friend. He was extremely knowledgeable and you could tell he did everything he could to make this an unforgettable experience. I don't even know what other good things to say to describe Rob that have not already been said! They are all true and I don't know why anyone would book a Tour with anyone else!

Best tour guide ever !!!. You've read the reviews and it is all true. After travelling the world and going on many, many tours Rob is simply the best . His knowledge, passion and overall enthusiasm for the subject is simply amazing. In addition to this the scenery is spectacular with amazing views wherever you look. If you are travelling to Cape Town make sure you book a full day trip with Cape Convoy. After doing this we also had a fantastic day out with Julian on the wine tour.

The highlight of our three-week African honeymoon!. Rob's Cape Point tour was amazing! I've never encountered someone so passionate about his job and his (adopted) country's history as Rob was during our full day tour. Every minute of the tour was insightful and fun. Words really cannot express how much my wife and I enjoyed the day with Rob. All of the positive reviews on tripadvisor were what led us to Cape Convoy and I can safely say now that they are well deserved. In fact, they do not even do Rob's tour justice. I wish everyone in the tourism industry had the passion and knowledge of Rob.Book your tour now!

Great All-Day Tour!. We were only in Cape Town for one day. We contacted Cape Convoy Tours & were lucky to get Rob as our guide. He picked us up at our hotel at 9:30am & proceeded to give us an entertaining, educational tour of the entire area. There were 6 of us, 2 being ages 8 & 5 and we all enjoyed being with Rob the entire time. He first took us down to a harbor where we took a boat out to see the seals. We then drove down to Cape Point where we rode up to the lighthouse on a cable car...beautiful view! Next we went to Cape of Good Hope where we saw the penguins and on the way back we met up with a large group of baboons with babies....very entertaining! Our last stop was Table Mountain & we went to the top on another cable car & were there for sunset.. I highly recommend Cape Convoy Tours and Rob!!!

A Fantastic day out.. OK....Where to start with this one. 9 hours in a mini bus with complete strangers didn't sound too appealing, but I thought it was an economical way to see the Cape.........BUT HOW WRONG I WAS! 9 hours felt like 9 minutes by the end of the day, and value for money was fantastic The trip was entertaining, educational and informative. The passengers ages ranged from 10 to 60 and everyone ended the day with a smile on their face. This can not be recommended highly enough. I did the Cape Peninsula tour which included the Simon's Town penguins , A boat trip to Seal Island in Hout Bay, and A leisurely visit to Cape Point amongst it's highlights. All the information was put over in an entertaining manner and not just a fact after fact approach. Definately a highlight of my trip , even when up against such places as Table Mountain & Stellenbosch. Book with Cape Convoy and you won't be disappointed.

Passion & Energy - It was a lot of fun,don't miss out. We booked the Cape Point and Winelands tours with Cape Convoy due to the reviews we had read on Trip Advisor and have to say that it was all I expected it to be and more. Rob who runs the Cape Point tour is on another planet. He really knows his stuff and has so much energy that sometimes its hard to keep up. His sheer passion and knowledge is quite incredible and how he manages to talk like he does for 8 hours is anyone’s guess. I do understand how some may find him a little bit too much and quieter types who prefer a more formal operation may struggle a bit but for us and the others on the tour he was perfect. The Winelands tour with Julius was also fantastic, perhaps the polar opposite of Rob, Julius is calm cool and collected and the perfect match for a day in the Winelands. I learnt so much and had so much fun that I would recommend Cape Convoy to anyone visiting Cape Town. Rob, if you read this I joined the Facebook group!

Cape Convoy sets the bar for quality and professionalism - Julius, Liza, and especially Rob, are the best.. I traveled with a group of 7 friends for the World Cup. We scheduled five days in Cape Town, and Cape Convoy was one of the main reasons we loved our time in Cape Town. We arranged a wine tour and a cape point tour for consecutive days. The wine tour, led by Julius and Liza, was amazing. Julius picked us up at our guesthouse on-time and we hopped in very nice and comfortable Cape Convoy van. We visited three wineries in the Stellenbosch region they had picked out for us to enjoy. There was never any rush at the tastings and we were permitted to enjoy ourselves at every stop. The ride between wineries was very enjoyable and Julius was very helpful in describing the complex history of South Africa and the region we were exploring. The highlight of the day was the visit to Waterford Estate. We got a personalized tour and explanation of the wine making and bottling process. The estate itself was gorgeous and offers the possibility for great photos. Besides their great wine, their specialty chocolate cannot be missed. I cannot say enough about Julius and Liza's professionalism, patience, knowledge, and friendliness throughout the day.The cape point tour got off to a problematic start due to the weather. However, Rob was there to save the day. As we eagerly waited Rob's arrival (due to his stellar reviews and demeanor on the phone) we suddenly saw a man in a blue jacket running towards our guesthouse from a few blocks away. He began to wave and shout. It was Rob. He immediately said that the weather would ruin our trip and suggested we reschedule to another day. It wasn't that he didn't want to take us, but rather, the cape point tour is so visually stunning that there is zero chance of enjoyment in such poor weather. He got on the phone and immediately began making moves to get us on the tour the following day (our last day full day in Cape Town) or else offered to give us full refunds. Rob then offered to drive us into town and drop us off so that we could at least enjoy the day sightseeing. The following day, Rob picked us up and led what was very likely the best tour I will ever be on. There is nobody quite like Rob. His enthusiasm and love for South Africa is contagious. His energy sets the tone for the full-day adventure. Rob makes sure that those on his tour leave with at least a very basic understading of key events and moments that have shaped South Africa. This is not simply a sighseeing tour, but a journey in understaing history that the average South African tourist would not be exposed to. It is not all just serious stuff. If you have any sense of humor, your face will hurt from laughing so much at Rob's jokes and stories. Although Rob's voice is plenty loud, try to sit towards the front of the van so that you do not miss a word. Be sure to ask Rob how he feels about Baboons near his van. The tour itself makes stops for a ferry ride to Seal Island, the picturesque Simon's Town, the penguins at Boulder's Beach, before eventually getting to the Cape Point national park. Make sure you go as close as possible to the tip of Cape Point to enjoy the incredible view. Also, be sure to make it down to the shore and listen to Rob's lesson about Pangea and the rocks. On the way back, Rob will take you to Chapman's Peak (with unbelievable timing) for a great sunset over the ocean to cap off the best tour ever.Rob, Liza, and Julius are running the best operation in town. You will not be dissapointed.I will definitely be back to Cape Town and will book a tour with Cape Convoy without hesitation.

Treasure memories from beautiful part of the world with Cape Convoy. We, group of five people, had a great full day tour of Cape peninsula with Rob form Cape Convoy at the end of October. Rob is really amazing guide and everybody from our group was excited and impressed by breathtaking views, complete historical information and friendly atmosphere during the trip. I like wild animals very much and I was happy to see many of them during the tour – seals, penguins, ostriches, baboons. Rob wanted to be sure that each of us feels well and has a great time. I would recommend Cape Convoy full day Cape point tour for everybody who wants to spend one wonderful day in this beautiful part of the world. Thank you Rob!

Only way to do the Cape Peninsula & enroute sights!!!!. Rob is the coolest - South African born, but spent a lot of his childhood in Essex - the Essex/South African accent is worth the trip alone ;) - no offfence Rob it's a cool accent! We has the best day - saw some breathtaking stuff and Rob fills you in on a lot of South Africa's history on the way in a v impartial way - he really inspired me - we are on honeymoon & came to Mauritius after Cape Town & he inspired me so much so I now have a copy of Mandela's autobiography & The Rise & FAll of Apartheid to read on the beach!!!!!History/politics aside the day is soooo much fun & Rob just wanted us to have the best time & see/do as much as possible. Don't try to do all the sights like Boulders' Bay, cape Point, etc yourself - the tour is well worth it - takes the thinking out of it, you meet loads of new people & make lots of new friends..Thanks for a great day Rob

Wow!! What a fantastic tour. So much fun, definitely a highlight of our trip!. Cape Convoy tour was absoloutely fantastic. My husband and I went to Cape Town as part of our honeymoon and were limited with time here (only 3 full days) - but booked the Cape Point tour with Rob and also booked shark diving for another day. I cannot speak more highly of our Cape Point tour, I am so glad we booked it. We saw so much of Cape Town in that tour, however never felt rushed at all. Rob was so enthusiastic (not at all your typical boring tour guide!). He was very informative and alot of fun, very easy to get along with. He is very comical and a good laugh! Definitely very passionate about Cape Town and its history and you can really tell he loves his job.At the end of the day he also asked us if there were any other places we would like him to take us to, nothing was too much to ask. I would definitely recommend this tour if you are going to Cape Town, you have nothing to pay for on the day (all entry fees to places are included), except for lunch.

Cape Convoy is above the rest!. I booked our tour because of the numerous outstanding reviews I read hereon Tripadvisor. I have no regrets and do believe our day with Rob will be the highlight of our time here in Cape Town.Warning: If you want dull, boring, monotone guide....... then this tour is not for you. Rob is full of energy which helps keep the tour fun and interesting. His love of his country and love of history is amazing as he shares tidbits of Cape Town, South Africa and its culture. He ensured that everyone was comfortable throughout the day and that we got to see the highlights of the Cape Peninsula. I look forward to a return trip to Cape Town and am positive I will be booking another tour with Cape Convoy. Thanks ROB!

The perfect tour company!. Myself and my wife did the full day Cape Point Tour with Rob from Cape Convoy on 10th Nov.Rob has put together a fantastic tour mixing the most breathtaking scenery with a genuinely engaging introduction to the history of South Africa. It's not like a standard tour, where you are stuck in a coach with a droning guide. Instead you are given an understanding of how South Africa got where it is today, through Rob's enthusiastic explanation. This was all broken up with a boat trip to seal island, penguin viewing at boulders beach, ostriches, dassies, a stunning walk at cape point, and a great photo of my wife running away from a baboon!!Can't recommend Cape Convoy enough!

Brilliant - what a tour!!. Did the Cape Point tour and had an amazing time. Rob was fantasic, what a guy. He has such passion and knowledge - couldn't ask for a better guide. If you are thinking about doing a tour, then go CAPE CONVOY - you won't regret it

Just Briiliant!. I am not sure what else i can add that has not been said about these guys! Julius who took us to the Winelands and along with the other 4 people in our group, really knows his stuff and we had a top class day in some of the most amazing country I have ever experienced. The Cape Point Tour with Rob was so much fun I dont know where to start. It was all i hoped it would be and more. TIP- It helps if you like history as you learn a lot. Thanks guys!!

Cape Convoy and Rob - SUPERB! EXCELLENT! You can find NO ONE better than them!!!. I have been a great fans to Trip Advisor but I literally have never left any comment, but Cape Convoy really prompted me to write this very first one cos Rob is just FANTASTIC! Rob is superb and I truly dont think there will be any tour guide that is better than him. He is super passionate and eager, and our group of 10 were all excited by him since the very first minute we met! I have been joining various local tour operator in various countries and Rob is really by far the BEST BEST BEST BEST BEST one. We had so much fun with him and we all just diddnt want the day to end. I found Rob on Trip Advisor too. There are Trip Advisor No 1 hotels and tour operators I joined but some of them just not deserve the ranking, but I have to say if anyone missed Cape Convoy when they are at Western Cape, they are going to be sorry! Super highly strongly recommended without reserve!!

FANTASTIC, ENJOYABLE COUPLE OF DAYS!. 2 Day Tour, Cape Peninsula with Rob and Winelands Tour with Julius.Wow, what can we say, enthusiastic, informative and great fun.I know more about South Africa than my own Country. We picked up another family with 3 children aged 11 to 17 on the Peninsula Tour, Rob full of information with a wonderfull sense of humour kept everyone informed and entertained all day.  Julius a little more conservative with the chat but just as informative and enthusiastic.A great 2 days, Rob and Julius are happy to be flexible in making sure everyone gets what they want from the tour. There was no rush to get us home we finished when we wanted. Would definately book with them again, and already recommended them to friends.

The best 2 tours we have ever been on.. Two totally different guides, with one common denominator- incredible passion for their subject area! We went on two tours with Cape Convoy: the Cape Point and the Winelands. Cape Point was with Rob, who is incredibly passionate about South African history. We learnt more in one day than we had in history at school. The Winelands was with Julius, who while quieter than Rob, is just as passionate, but about wine! We were incredibly lucky in that it was just the 2 of us with Julius, so the trip was our own, but people in our hotel had a similar experience with a bigger group, asking wine preferences before setting off. There is no set itinerary on either tours, and they are so flexible. This is NOT a boring faceless tour on a coach.The best things about Cape Convoy Tours are that you learn, they're flexibile, they tailor the tours to you, they only take small groups, they are fun and they are incredibly knowledgable in their subject areas.We would recommend them to anyone visiting Cape Town- in fact its a necessity!

Cape Convoy made my trip to Cape Town complete!. Cape Convoy was exceptional. I booked the Cape Point and Winelands Tour with them. I did the Cape Point tour on a Saturday and Rob picked me up right on the dot. The entire day was filled with breathtaking views, plenty of wildlife (penguins, whales within 10 feet away, ostriches, and baboons). Rob is very passionate about South African history, and by the end of the day we had such a greater knowledge about the beautiful country we were visiting. If you have ever driven through Big Sur in California, the views driving through the coast reminded me a lot of it, but it seemed like everything was even bigger and grander (and you would think I would be bias considering I am from California). Rob really wanted to make sure I saw everything and even woke me up from my little cat nap so that I wouldn't miss the views. I appreciate him doing that since the views were worth staying up for. You can also get a sense that even the locals love Rob, and that he is just not another tour guide. On Monday I had a winelands tour with Julius, and he also picked me up right on time. We had a small group of four (including Julius). Julius genuinely cares about his tours, and is always seeking ways to make his tours better. I have gone to many wine tours around the world (on 5 different continents), and this by far, hands down was the best wine tour I have EVER done. Julius sat with us at every tasting, and even had lunch with us. No wine guide has ever done that before. He had a great knowledge of wine, and made sure we all had a relaxing and pleasant experience. Not only that, he really caters his tours to the wants of the group. It's not a set itinerary like most wine tours, he even gave us an option of where to go for lunch. We got such a variety of tastings, sparkling wine, delicious reds (and I'm not typically a fan of reds), chocolate tastings, old wineries with lots of history, upcoming new wineries, and we even visited a cheetah outreach program to make the trip even more unique. I will recommend Cape Convoy to friends traveling to Cape Town, and I wish Rob and Julius the best of luck with everything!

What a blast!. We chose Cape Convoy because their full-day cape tour did not include Kirstenbosh Gardens. (Other tours included a brief stop there, but we wanted more time both on the peninsula and at the gardens - where we spent 2.5 hours on our own another day.) Rob, the owner and guide, was super-friendly, engaging and energetic, and we soon felt like part of the family. We were lucky: there were only 3 people in the tour and the weather was perfect. Rob was responsive to our needs and interests, giving us options about how to organize the trip. He gave us tons of history on South Africa, thoughtfully reminding us now and then that he would stop if we weren't interested. The trip included fabulous views, a boat ride and various animals (baboons, a whale, ostriches, seals, penguins). There was nothing at all that we didn't like. Rob's goal was to give his guests a great day and he succeeded 100%.

All you need to get the most out of your stay in Cape Town. We spent just over a week in this beautiful part of the world and the trip was enhanced by the fantastic experience we had using Cape Convoy.We had booked 3 trips with them, unfortunately the weather prevented us from visiting Robbin Island & Table Mountain, but thanks to Rob's advice & guidance we were able to do these on our own. We also enjoyed a trip on Safari.The trip I enjoyed the most was the Winelands tour with Julius. Not only was Julius very knowledgeable about the area and wine, but I found him to be insightful and interesting when talking about South Africa in general. The drive to and around Stellenbosch was absolutely stunning and Julius' recommendation for lunch was delicious.I would recommend Cape Convoy to anyone visiting Cape Town as the service you receive is exceptional and made our trip so much easier. It is also a privilege to spend time with Rob & Julius - they are very good at what they do!

Amazing ! Like your best mate taking you on tour !. I had 2 tours booked with Cape Convoy, the cape point/cape of good hope tour and the shark diving.Both were amazing, the first day we did the Cape point/good hope tour Rob picked me up at the hotel and took us on a great tour and explained the history of the cape and south africa along the way - all very interesting and like I said on the title was like a good mate throughout the trip which really made it better.We even went up to signal point on the way back and this was not advertised - so this was a real bargain! As for the shark diving well we saw 7 great whites and was probably the biggest buzz of my life ! what more can i say !!I cannot recommend this enough !! 10/10!!

Cape Convoy - a great way to view the Cape Town Area. We booked to go on both the Wine Lands and the Cape Tour. Julius was our guide for the Wine Lands tour - the tour was instantly organised to meet our wine preference. Julius was very friendly, knowledgeable and flexible. A splendid day. On the Cape Tour we had Rob as our guide, in no time at all he had the party at ease - we felt we had been friends for years. Rob's enthusiasm and passion for passing on local history and information soon became apparent - it didn't stop all day and we did not tire from it. During the day nothing was too difficult we even did a detour on the way back to see Signal Hill at Rob's insistence. An excellent day. I would use Cape Convoy again and would certainly recommend them to others. Thanks to Julius, Rob and Liza (who took our bookings).

Cape Convoy really made our holiday. I can't begin to describe how great Cape Convoy are. We did the the Cape and Winelands tour and can honestly say they were the two best day trips I've ever done on holiday. Rob and Julius are excellent guides, friendly and knowledgeable, our holiday to Cape Town wouldn't have the great memories if it weren't for them and we wouldn't have seen most of the places we visited if it weren't for them.I don't usually write reviews but I haven't been able to stop gushing to everyone I know that if they ever go to Cape Town they must use Cape Convoy, they are the best, I promise you you won't be disappointed, thanks Guys :D

A fantastic & memorable trip!!!. My husband booked this trip based on the other reviews he had read and we weren't dissapointed! Rob is an amazing tour guide with a huge wealth of knowledge not only on Cape Town but the history, something of which he is very passionate. We took my son who is 10 years old so I was apprehensive that a full day might be boring for him. He enjoyed every minute! He must of taken in all of Rob's historical information as he did a talk to his his class at school all about the history he had learnt from Rob. We particularly enjoyed the boat trip to see the seals and the penguins at Boulders Beach. However, be careful when eating up at Cape Point, my son lost his pizza to a baboon!!! Eat inside the cafe!Thanks Rob for a truly memorable day.

Recommend the Cape Point Tour. A Cape Point Tour with Rob is a great way to kick off a visit to Cape Town. Rob ranks off the charts in energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge of history. He provided a great deal of information on the people and events that shaped the history of South Africa. Fascinating to listen to, he works hard to ensure you enjoy your tour and get your moneys worth. We had to cut out the boat trip to Seal Island because of the weather, but he added an extra stop to compensate. A fun, informative day!

Cape peninsula tour - fantastic trip. We had a great day out with Rob on the Cape Peninsula tour on the 27th September. Rob was knowledgable, very interesting and great fun too! Rob went out of his way to ensure we had a fantastic experience. We would highly recommend this tour. Diane & John

A great day and a great history lesson - thank you Rob!. Fantastic day - the trip to Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope etc was wonderful. Three of us were lucky enough to have Rob to ourselves for the day which made our trip with him all the more personal and therefore memorable. We really appreciated Rob's knowledge of the areas we visited and the country as a whole, as well as his passion and willingness to share any information with us.Because we were such a small group, Rob very much went out of his way to make sure each of us saw the sights we wanted to see and enjoyed the day as much as possible. Rob is very enthusiastic, and really wanted to make sure we got value for money. Definitely recommend this particular Cape Convoy tour.

Absolutely Fabulous!. My daughter and I were in Capetown the week of Oct 9 and booked a Cape Point Tour with Rob of Cape Convoy Tours. He was outstanding as a tour guide, kept us on our toes with his history, made us laugh out loud with his self deprecating humour and filled us in on social issues affecting S. Africa today. It was the second last day of our trip and definitely the high light of it. There is no way you should miss out on this tour company...it is worth every penny. Thanks Rob and Liza for helping to make this a memorable holiday.

Good day at Aquila Safari, but Cape Convoy is overrated!. My husband and I had booked a safari day with Cape Convoy on October 8th. Aquila is 90 minutes from Cape Town and once you get there, you are taken in charge by the guides from Aquila. The role of Cape Convoy is to book your reservation, to pick you up at your hotel and to drive you back. At the booking, we received two conflicting emails: One saying we would be picked up at 8:30-9:00, and one saying at 6:00. When I emailed to check the right time, I was told 6:00, and they would confirm the day before. They never confirmed and the driver showed up at 5:20. At that time in the morning, 40 minutes earlier than agreed makes a big difference. Later in the day, a woman joined us: They had forgotten to pick her up in the morning. Since transportation is the main role of Cape Convoy on that tour, they haven't really succeeded. Aquila was nice and according to our expectations. It is not wild Africa, but you see animals in their natural environment and spend a nice day.

Cape Convoy Tours made Cape Town Peninsula the Highlight of the Trip!. My sister and I traveled through South Africa May 2010, just before the World Cup. Cape Town is amazing! But after four days, we were looking for something more...along came Rob and Cape Convoy Tours! We were lucky, we managed to get into a tour at the last minute, and joined Rob and his group that day for the most entertaining, surprisingly educational, breathtaking tours on this trip. Rob is very passionate about his country, and just as importantly, a very nice individual who is living a life authentic to his passion. I highly recommend his Cape Peninsula Tour.

Excellent and Informative. We did the Cape Peninsula tour with Rob. He is very informative, interesting and his enthusiasm in sharing the history is enthralling. He is most energetic and goes out of his way to ensure that the group enjoys the tour and gets value for the money spent. The tour was awesome and amazing and would have no hesitations in recommending Cape Convey Tours

'Excellent' only just starts to cover the Cape Convoy experience. I hardly know where to begin, there's just so much that is praiseworthy about Cape Convoy Tours and our intrepid guide, Rob. Here's a few superlatives for you: awesome, fantastic, amazing, hilarious, fabulous. Also, informative, friendly, fun.My friend and I were lucky enough to have Rob to ourselves for our Cape Point day tour which made our trip with him incredibly personal and enabled us to set our own agenda and timetable. His knowledge is second to none and the enthusiasm with which he imparts it is infectious. We both learned so much and in such a fun way. We didn't get just the history but also issues affecting the area and country today, the background to current problems and some philosophy too! It was like being given a guided tour by a friend, Rob is in a league of his own.Rob, both of us had an awesome visit with you, you're one in a million. You deserve all sorts of awards.Trip Advisor researchers; you really, really can't do any better than book a tour with Cape Convoy. Any visit to Cape Town would be incomplete and the poorer without one.

Didn't get to go :(. This is a bit of a weird review as we didn't actually get to go on the Pennisula tour with Cape Convoy!We read such great reviews about Rob and this tour on trip advisor that we booked to go with them 4 weeks before we set off for SA, the only free date they had was for our last day in Cape Town. On the morning we were due to be collected we received a phonecall from Cape Convoy to say that there had been a mistake and that they had over booked - we were gutted, I was really looking forward to this. I'm not sure what happened but i'm thinking as we were in Camps Bay (last pick up point) they didn't realise they had over booked until that morning when they realised they had another 2 people to collect.Despite this, Cape Convoy really went out of their way and made up for their mistake with the arrangements they made for us; because this was our last day in Cape Town we couldn't go the next day but they arranged for another tour company to pick us up (they were there within 10 minutes) and we did the Pennisula tour with them. Cape convoy also refunded us what we paid, so the tour was on them by way of apology. Not only that but we received lots of apologies via text from Liza during the day, which we really appreciated - afterall, we know that mistakes happen and Liza was really sincere in her apology.The tour is brilliant, all the places that we visited was great - Cape Point, Hout Bay, Chapmans Peak drive - it really is a great day out and we got lovely weather.I hope to return to SA again some day and I will book with Cape Convoy (and confirm my booking nearer the time lol). Thanks again Liza for everything you did for us!

Most informed and energetic tourist guides ever. My wife and I visited Cape Town from August 28 to July 2, 2010. We took three trips with Cape Convoy - the winelands tour, Table Mountain/Robben Island, and the Cape Peninsula tour.Table Mountain/Robben Island: I think they have discontinued this tour - it's pretty much a drop off / pick up kind of tour. What made it good for us is that Rob kept a watch on the weather, and got us the tour exactly when it was the best time for it. This is not a small deal in winter, when Cape Town weather is very unpredictable.Winelands: We did this with Julius, who is the perfect fit for this tour - he knows a lot and has some interesting viewpoints about the current events as well. He took us to 5 wineries, as well as downtown Stellenbosch. The wineries were among the best I've seen - I've been to Napa, Sonoma, Anderson Valley, as well as Maipu Valley and Casablanca Valley in Chile.Cape Peninsula: We did this tour with Rob, who's also the perfect fit for this tour. He is literally bursting with historical information that he will impart to you with an enthusiasm that is remarkable, considering that he must be doing this tour quite a few times a week. He was also kind enough to incorporate a diversion so that I could take a photo of some colourful huts I had seen in some magazines and brochures, in Muizenberg. I wish I had the energy he has ...I should also mention Liza, who I unfortunately never met. Because of changing weather, bookings, etc, we had to change our plans several times, and she coordinated everything together with Rob. Eventually, we were able to do everything we wanted with the perfect weather matched to it. Can't ask for more ...

Highly recommendable. I can highly recommend Cape Convoy.I was travelling alone as part of business trip, so only had a week-end in Cape Town. I contacted Cape Convoy and booked a wine tour and the Cape Peninsula before I arrived.They didn't have enough people for the wine tour, but kept me updated and offered to get me a seat on African Eagle's wine tour - this worked fine and Cape Convoy took care of it all - and I enjoyed the wine tour.However, the Cape Peninsula tour with Rob was the hightlight of my trip - a great, fun and informative day out - what a beautiful part of the world - and Rob was extremely dedicated, made sure everyone had fun and he shared his vast knowledge of South African history etc. We saw Seals, Whales, Penguins and Baboons.

Simply the best !!. We booked two tours (Cape Point and Winelands) with Cape Convoy & can only back up the great reviews already given. Rob was one of the funniest but knowledgeable people we had ever met . His enthusiam rubs off onto you as you listen. The scenery along the way was amazing & not to be missed & Julius certainly knows his wines & was equally as good. Many thanks for 2 wonderful day tours.Wendy & Linda (Cornwall, England)

We love Rob and Cape Convoy Tours". We went on two tours with Rob and Cape Convoy in July 2010. All I can say is amazing! We loved every minute of our time with Rob at Cape Point and the second day of Cape Town/Table Mountain. We had a diverse group on our Cape Point tour, ages 11 to 70, and wow! Rob had us all enjoying learning about history, apartheid, colonialism. He is just a terrific guide with an enthusiasm about people, his country, learning. We cannot praise him and the experience he provides enough.

Excellent. Based on Tripadvisor reviews, we scheduled 4 days with Cape Convoy: Cape Point Day Tour, Big 5 Safari, Shark Diving, and Table Mountain/Robben Island. Because of the weather, we had to move things around so that the 4 planned days turned into 5, but they made it happen and we saw everything. I could not be more impressed. Read all the previous reviews, but I can confirm that the entire experience was excellent. Rob, Liza, and Julius are wonderful people who made us feel like family. When visiting Cape Town, definitely go with Cape Convoy.

Best experience you could hope for. Rob is probably the most fun/informative/crazy tour guide ever. Seeing cape town with him is a must. We did the cape point tour with him and it was unforgettable. Rob's commentary really added to the beautiful sights we saw. His explanation of the complicated history of South Africa's past was enlightening and engaging. Don't be hesitant to book with this company, you won't be disappointed. Even though our family is usually very quiet we didn't have any trouble fitting in. I love tripadvisor for helping me find people like Rob and experience such amazing things as we did on our trip to South Africa.

Wonderful!! Only disappointment was we did not take more tours with them!. My wife and I were in Cape Town for the World Cup, and booked the Cape Peninsula tour with Cape Convoy. We had individual tours through another company for the vineyards and Hermanus, but wanted to get the comraderie of a group tour and picked Cape Convoy based on the glowing TripAdvisor reviews.We could not have been happier with Rob, as our tour guide, and this excursion. While the beauty and history of the country supplied the material, Rob worked magic like a great school teacher weaving the story and bringing the trip to life while we took in breathtaking scenery, in addition to baboons, ostriches, penguins and other friends. Also, the day started out rather wet, and the very low visibility could have easily dampered the trip to Cape Point. Rob's enthusiasm and optimism shined brightly, hoping it would clear up, and it did. Meanwhile he patiently took us around to other sites and admitted he would willingly cut the tour short and offer large refunds, rather than take us to view sites which we would not be able to see if the weather persisted. I was immensely impressed at how earnestly he cared about our total experience.This was easily the best tour I remember ever being on, and as mentioned in the title, my only disappointment was that we had not planned ahead to take other trips (such as shark cage diving, winelands, or safari) through them. As it was near the end of our trip, we did not have time to fit another in. When we go back to Cape Town, this will definitely be a priority.

Experience Of A Lifetime. What more can be said about Cape Convoy Tours than has not already been written in other reviews.Rob Liza and Julius provided me with two tours,Cape Peninsula and the Winelands,and I experienced the best tours I've ever had anywhere where I have travelled.Liza painstakingly not only provided me with fantastic advice and support in relation to my two tours but also rpovided me with advice in relation to my stay at Johannesburg.Nothing was too much trouble for her and her personal interest in dealing with my requests was highly professional and very efficient.Rob is just a human dynamo!It would not have been possible for me to enjoy the exhilirating experiences of the Cape Peninsula tour without his infectious enrhusiasm,incredible local knowledge and obvious passion for the area and his country in general.He successfully made everyone of the group feel inclusive and an acvtive participant.Julius,with his quieter demeanour but wonderful personality guided us through the beautiful Winelands on a magnicent day.Again his knowledge,personality and obvious love of what he does contributed very significantly to an exceptional daylong experience where everyone in the group felt relaxed,happy and enjoying the companionship of their fellow tour member.I may not get back to South Africa but I will never forget the experience of a lifetime that Liza,Rob and Julius kindly created for me,Absolutely a five star operation!!

Excellent - but.... I booked two tours (Cape Point and Winelands) with Cape Convoy after reading the reviews here and had a great time. The only problem was that I *almost* missed the Winelands one... cutting a long story short, I texted the office about 20-25 mins after the pick up time and found out I had been left behind by mistake. However, it was swiftly dealt with and I was soon whisked away to Stellenbosch by the lovely Liza and didn't miss any of the tastings. I considered giving Cape Convoy 4 stars instead of 5 because of it but the matter was solved quickly and the tours were great, so 5 stars it is. Just be sure to text them if something similar happens to you! As other have stated, the Cape Point tour with Rob is a must. I understand he might be "too much" for some people but it's hard not to enjoy the sheer enthusiasm he's got for Cape Town and South Africa. Cape Point is one of the most beautiful places I've ever been to (if not THE most beautiful) and Rob gives all the background to enjoy the experience in its entirety. The Winelands tour was also very good - just a shame that it was Monday and the Rust en Vrede restaurant (one of the 100 best of the world in 2010) was closed but Julius took us to a very nice restaurant right in the middle of Stellenbosch instead and it was a good chance to see more of the beautiful town.It was quite interesting to be able to compare yang (the force of nature that is Rob Salmon) and yin (cool, calm, collected - and quite gorgeous - Julius).

Not to be missed..... Like many of the reviewers, we were in ZA for World Cup and booked the Cape Point tour based on the reviews here. We were definitely not disappointed--this is by far the best tour I have ever taken and I have traveled a lot and taken a lot of tours. We had our 4 children with us and Rob was adaptable and enthusiastic. His knowledge and enthusiasm for his country is amazing as are all the sights he showed us. We saw wild baboons, ostriches, penguins, and some fabulous views. Do not miss this tour if you go to Cape Town--it is a true gem.

A+ for Rob!. Rob was an amazing tour guide. I think I learned more during his tour than in a whole history book about South Africa. He made everything fun and exciting. This is the BEST tour of the Cape and a much do!

Probably the best tour company in the world.... Folowing the great reviews we found on trip advisor, we decided to use Cape Convoy when we holidayed in Cape Town during the World Cup. What a great decision!!!!We booked four tours with the company as listed below1. Safari. We were taken by the friendly Des to Aquilla game reserve, two hours from Cape Town. Des was very friendly from the moment we meet her until she had us back to our accomodation.On safri, we were taken out in a jeep and saw close up so many animals, Lions, Elephants, Buffalo, Rhino, Hippos and so many more. The jeep driver made sure we stopped in great positions and was very informative whilst getting us great view/photo points.Once back at the HQ we were able to tuck into a great buffet with something for everyone and beautiful malva pudding and custard.... here started my love affair with the dessert!2. Rob introduces us to the Cape Point Peninsula - day tour. I think Rob must be the most enthusiastic tour guide you will ever meet.
