He has a great balance of humour with fact and you cannot help but leave the tour wiser with the history of Cape Town, I dont want to spoil it if you havent been but for those who have the phrase '1488, everything is great' will bring the memories flooding back.We saw Baboons, Seals, Penguins not to mention the breathtaking view from Chapmans Peak (a brilliant sunset) and Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope.Do this tour or you will really miss out!3.Shark Diving - as brilliant as it sounds and our first meeting with Julius another friendly tour guide - no exception.We were a little late in going out but that did not matter, they juyst simply brought us back in a little later, making sure we had enough time with the sharks. You get so close to the sharks you could touch them (but dont). They equip you in 7mm wetsuits and diving experience is not needed, you wear a mask and the cage isnt fully submerged. I went in the cage twice and although the cold got the better of me in the end, I had numerous encounters with in excess of five sharks, the biggest of which must have been 4 metres long!The sunset on the trip back was amazing and the only regret I have was not buying the DVD as the photos we took did not do the experience justice.4. Winelands tour.Juilus picked us up to embark on a day of great wine tasting. I am a lover of cheese and so at my request Julius took us to Fairview where we got to sample 8 cheeses and 8 wines. This was a nice start to the day and was good having something to break up the drinking of wine (they also brought out oils and bread). There was a fantastic shop selling oils and cheeses to and a great selection of jams and breads for sale outside - I recommend the chilli jam.We went on to Warwick for another selection of wines before stopping for lunch in Stellenbosch, the name of the place escapes me but the food as always during our time in South Africa was superb value for money.We on to the Cheetah Reserve - nice in itself but not sure if the close encounter is worth the money as you spend no more than five minutes in with it (we were a group of four that paid 100rand each to do this).Our final stop was Waterford which was a selection of 8 great wines, the last 3 served with specially made chocolate and followed by a tour behind the scenes.We tasted several great wines during the day and saw some spectacular views. Even if you are not a big wine drinker the tour is interesting and the views stunning.As you can tell I loved all four tours and the guides really enhnaced the experiences. Use this great company and you wont be disappointed!

Fantastic tour - unbeatable!!!!!. We were in Cape Town for the World Cup and decided to try and see some of the surrounding area while we were there. We picked Cape Convoy due to the reviews on here and we weren't disappointed.Rob was amazing on the Cape Point tour, gave us lots of interesting facts about the history of the Cape (and kept testing us to see what we could remember) We've never enjoyed a tour so much!Julius's Wine Tasting Tour was also very good, he knew so much about the wines we were tasting and explained it all to us.Thanks for making our holiday even more memorable!

#1 for Good Reason - The absolute BEST in Cape Town!. Cape Convoy is the best there is when it comes to tours. Rob is amazing and you cannot miss his Cape Point tour. LIza is amazing and does so much to help plan the perfect tour package for you. They are so accommodating and even called us to rearrange a few tours to make sure we had the best weather for everything that we did. Dez, on our way home from the safari, even stopped to help us find a camera shop, so we could buy an underwater camera for our shark dive. You cannot go wrong with any tour that you book with them. Choosing Cape Convoy was the best decision we made about our trip to Cape Town. We loved the Cape Point tour, the safari, Robben Island/Table Mountain, and the Shark Dive. We also heard amazing things about the Wineland tours, but never actually did it ourselves. If you are wanting to learn a lot about the area and have a lot of fun while you do it, do not pass up Cape Convoy. You will not be disappointed!

Interesting Exciting Amusing Informative Delightful. Simon Schama meets Del Boy.. I chose this tour because of trip advisor. Like many other reviewers I am an independent traveller who does not generally like tour parties or escorted groups. I can agree with all the positive comments about this tour. Rob is so enthusiastic about South African history. By the end of the tour I had a real understanding of the whys and wherefores of SAs past. I also heard great jokes saw blagging at its best and had tremendous fun. I really believe I could have had a great time just sat in the minibus listening to Rob without even traveling anywhere. As it happens I was shown some of the most stunning scenery and sights imaginable. I cannot reccomend this highly enough...disorganised at times but thats part of the charm.

An absolute GEM in Cape Town - a tour with Rob is a MUST!!. My husband and I usually avoid tours because they tend to be boring, inflexible, tiresome at most times with tight little schedules that everyone needs to keep to and being hustled in a hurry from place to place. But with Rob and Cape Convoy, it is a totally different experience..one that we totally relish and love! Rob is simply amazing and passionate about all things Cape Town and South Africa. His extensive knowledge and love for the country just blew us away. He doesn't mind the time too much and leaves a lot of flexiblity of the day's tour to go with the flow of how things turn out as we went along. Fantastic narrative stories and history of the places that we visited kept us entertained as well as broadened our knowledge of Africa. Without the life stories, beautiful sceneries after awhile becomes just beautiful landscapes with no meaning and with Rob, we really felt a connection to the places. Rob's enthusiam and spontaneity is very infectious and we had a great time laughing with everyone on our tour and only 6 of us in all - equally amazing people that made it all more fun. His genuine sincerity in sharing and showing us how stunningly beautiful Cape Town is, is very refreshing and made us feel special - as if he was showing these places for the very first time especially for us, although he must have been there at least a thousand times. We loved that he's always looking out for us and treats us just like his mates and not customers and making sure we were comfortable and having lots of fun at the same time. Cape Point is so stunningly beautiful that it took our breath away and nothing else capped our wonderful tour better than an almost perfectly timed sunset at the most gorgeous place. What a wonderful end to our perfectly amazing day! Thank you again Rob for leaving us with such beautiful and warm memories to last a lifetime. We will always remember that perfect day...Jonathan & Adelle

Wine-land Tour. We did two tours with Cape Convoy. I have written about the Tour of the Cape with Rob. The tour of Vineyards with Julius as the guide was a delightful experience as well. The journey in a comfortable mini-bus was deeply relaxing as we drove through beautiful country side. We visited the vineyards of Ernie Ells, Ruste en Vrede and Waterford, each located in a picturesque location. The weather was perfect - light rain playing with sunlight and the air crisp. Ideal weather to enjoy some fine wine. Julius understands and loves wine. His descriptions of the wines helped enhance our experience. He also understands the history of South Africa very well and it was a pleasure to be in his company imbibing great wine as well some lessons in history.

Probably the best guided tour I have ever been on - anywhere!. Hands down, a simply amazing time on the Cape Town Uncovered Tour. Rob is a fantastic guy who really loves Cape Town and South Africa. He gives you a real glimpse of the Cape Peninsula and covers more ground in 8 hours than you would ever be able to cover yourself. He is extremely knowledgeable about the history and culture that surrounds the whole area and gives it to you from a real, unbiased perspective. His first priority is to make sure you have a great time and he treats all of his guests like family. After our tour on Saturday, he offered to arrange Robben Island and Table Mountain tickets to us for us and to bring us to the mountain the next morning at no charge. His tours are well planned, but also very flexible. He has the ability to adapt the itinerary based on how the group is feeling that day and where everyone wants to spend time the most. For example, even through we had already spent 8 enjoyable hours with him, someone said that they heard Signal Hill was an amazing place to watch the Cape sunset and he immediately headed over that way to provide a memorable end to the day. He's not a clock watcher and doesn't spend his day figuring out which hotels or sites are going to pay him the best commissions. He just wants his guests to have a great time and he accomplishes this well.We shared our tour with 4 other people (strangers) and we had such a good time together that all of us booked their wine trail tour with Julius the following Monday, which was also a great time. Julius is also very knowledgeable about the Cape Town wine region and focuses on bringing his guests to the places that provide the best tasting experience - not which places are going to give him the biggest kickback. On our day out, he basically played the entire itinerary by ear, according to what the group was feeling like on that day. It was a truly enjoyable time.These guys are a not-to-be-missed part of Cape Town, so please make sure you take a day out to spend with them...

Great tours and willing to help. Rob and his crew went out of there way to make our trip a good one. We had some not sure what they want to do until the day of the tours but that didnt slow Rob down. He let us make changes and worked with us every step of the way.

Look no further for an awesome, friendly and personalised tour. I went to Cape Town in January 2010 (sorry this review is a long time coming, but I did promise Rob that I would write it!!!) for work, with a few spare days to look around. It was my first trip to Cape Town, and as a single female I was a bit apprehensive about traveling around on my own. Cape Convoy were very responsive and helpful with some early email queries I had (even kind enough to call me when it came to booking with my credit card).I chose the two day Cape Town Uncovered Tour, and it was a absolute blast! The tours are very personalised and you travel around in a small group- not like those massive tour groups where there is a leader up the front waving a flag! Rob picked me up from my hotel, along with two other people for the day and went to Robben Island for the ferry and tour. This tour you can book yourself through the website, but it was really nice to have transport there and to hear a bit about what to expect! Following this, we got picked up again and went to Table Mountain- the views of the city are magnificent, and I highly recommend it. The following day was the Cape Point Day tour... and you get a LOT covered in that one day. Beautiful scenery, lovely towns and the trip to Cape of Good Hope was very memorable. One slight dampener though was the trip on the boat to Seal Island- it was rather rough that day and someone got a little seasick (then to sit on a bus for a few hours is a bit uncomfortable)....so if you're susceptible to motion sickness take some tablets! Despite this, we all had a fabulous day and took some very happy memories home. The enthusiasm and energy that Rob shows is remarkable, and it's truly great to have a tour guide who is so obviously passionate about what he does.

fabulous day out with Rob and Cape Convoy. We booked this trip as we only had a short time in Cape Town and wanted to get to see as much as possible in a short time. We saw every thing we had expected and so much more. We had an amazing day - really got a feel for the place and the history and culture - Rob really made it entertaining and as we were a small group of 6 felt that it was personal to us and very much tailored to what we wanted to do. Thanks Rob

This is THE tour company to go with in Cape Town!. Cannot say enough good things about this tour! We did the "cape Town in a day" and Rob was our guide - we were blessed with perfect weather but even if we hadn't, it would have been fantastic! Rob is SO knowledgable about the history of SA and he tells it in such a very entertaining style, I remembered it! He take you around the ENTIRE Cape and its truly incredible scenery and still gets you back in time for the sunset - SO much fun and a Great value!! Definitely the tour company to go with if you are visiting the area - go with these guys, you will not be dissapointed!

Simply the Best. I have traveled all over the world and have seen canned tour guides. Cape Convoy and Rob absolutely break the mold and are highly entertaining, friendly and very knowledgeable to the history and current dynamics in Cape Town and South Africa. If you are going to Cape Town, the wineries and Great White Cage Diving use Cape Convoy!!

Best guided tour.....ever! Rob is enthusiastic and genuine!!. What a way to explore Cape Town. Rob made the guided tour fun, even for our 10 year old daughter. He truly loves South Africa, has a wealth of knowledge and his energy is infectious! We would not hesitate to recommend Cape Convoy Tours.

Tour operator. If you are looking for a tour company in Cape Town you wont do better than Cape Convot.ROB WAS AMAZING.His knowledge was first class and is enthusiasm in passing on his knowledge of South African history was inspiring.PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE use this service, you will not be dissappointed.ROB, Thank you very much for the tours, you are an amazing man. As and when I return to Cape Town I will use your services again.

The best day ever!. We booked the Cape Point Day - what a day!We were picked up from our hotel at 08.30 by a very enthusiastic Rob. He said we were going to have a great day and he certainly did not disappoint.Robs knowledge and passion for his country & its history is amazing and he made it such fun. Nothing was too much trouble he went out of his way to ensure we all got the best out of the day. Cape Point was spectacular, stopping to photograph baboons, the view from Chapmans Peak etcWe were very lucky to meet the lovely Lisa & Jason from Texas and Barrie & Jo from Bristol. Well Rob a huge Thank You you made a huge impression on our holiday. Would love to have booked more trips with you (time permiting)..... next time. Highly recommended! Five Star!All the very best Rob and Thank You.

Unmissable. We would never have considered having a guide were it not that Tripadvisor showed Cape Convoy Tours as number one CapeTown attraction. So we decided to give it a try and we all four agreed that it was the best two days out of what was a fantasic two week holiday. The Mountain and Robben Island were great outings to get us started on day 1, but it was the Cape Point tour on day 2 that had us drooling. The day raced by as Rob took us to all the corners of the Peninsula. Wouldn't want to spoil all the surprises in store for you, but the combination of views, animals, people, towns and history was unmissable. If we had done this ourselves we would have only covered half the ground, and would have missed most of the surprises.Great value too, as Rob pays all the entry fees and tips for you, and knows how to prevent all that nasty queuing too!Don't miss it!

Indeed, very good!. first time in South Africa, last minute trip... checked for several alternatives online but was not familiar at all w/ tourism agencies or anything. As always, read the reviews here as guidance (it's great that we have this community, always very helpful!) and decided to book the peninsula tour. Called Rob the night before and asked whether there was an space available (just one person). Rob was very nice and confirmed the tour. I think it was the best decision I've made! I've really enjoyed the day, Rob is very enthusiastic (I wonder how he does to speak the whole day!!! :) I've learned so much about the country that you cannot imagine, we had a great outdoor day. I highly recommend to use Cape Convoy!!. Rob also helped me to get a last minute ticket to Robben Island for the day after. I am back in Cape Town and will contact them for other tour :)

highly recommended. wife and I did 2 day cape uncovered tour with Rob, we both enjoyed it, Rob is very enthusiastic and informative guide, I would definately recommend his tour to anyone visiting cape town

Incredible day out. We had booked a tour with Rob but our flight to Cape Town was delayed 24 hours so couldn't make it. All it took was a quick text with the reply ' no worries mate will pick you up same time tomorrow' . We joined 3 others on an excellent full day trip taking in all the attractions around cape point and this set the scene for our fantastic 3 weeks in South Africa. Rob even offered to pick us up the following morning as he had two spaces free on the trip up table mountain - sadly the cape doctor ( strong winds ) prevented that. We learnt a lot from Rob, his knowledge and enthusiasm shine through as the day progresses.

A must do!!. If you do just one thing whilst in the Cape Town area then take a day trip with Rob from Cape Convoy. We did the one day Cape Peninsula tour with him and from start to finish we could not have spent the day with a more informative, friendly and passionate about his country and its history guy - he was just brilliant. If you want an over and above experience in a small group then Rob and Cape Convoy are for you.

Your holiday will not be as good if you don't go on one of their tours!!. I stuggle to put into words just how good these guys are! I am so glad we booked with them as I really don't think our holiday would have been nearly as good if we hadn't! We first of all went on the Cape Point day tour with Rob.. it was AWESOME! Rob is such an enthusiastic & knowledgable guide, and the group is small so you really get the personal touch. We drove past a few coaches and I just thought we were so lucky to be in such a small, intimate, tour group. We had a lot of fun and by the end of the day I just felt like I was out with a friend (who happened to know a LOT about Cape Town)!! We also went on the wine tour with Julius who, again, was fantastic! We had a brilliant day and yet again at the end of it we had forgotten we were on a tour at all, we were just having a great time! I would definitely recommend both these tours to anyone in a heartbeat!! Both Rob and Julius were so fantastic I really doubt there is anyone better! I wouldn't bother shopping about for prices either as the value for money is amazing!!We also went on the Aquila safari day trip which again we organised through Rob. This was a great day yet again (although the 2 hour bus jouney at 6am was a struggle - don't go hungover!!).I hope we will return to Cape Town again soon and when we do we will definitely go on some more tours with Cape Convoy!

We hit the jackpot !. We had a brilliant weekend with Rob from Cape Convoy on 27/28th Feb 2010. Rob made sure that we made the most of our time whilst ensuring that our 7 year old daughter was not bored. We converted our Winelands tour into a mixture of Table Mountain, Cheetah experience, and still managed to taste enought wine to keep us very happy, all courttesy of Rob's imagination and desire to ensure that we had a great trip.I would reccommend him to anyone looking for an informal tailor made tour without having to worry about clock watching and keeping up with large parties. Hope to see Rob again soon.

Customer serive superb. Had a great three days touring with Rob and Julius. Groups are small and the conversation is exciting! I would recommend them!. Loved to the tour to the vineyards! We were taken in completely by Capetown and hope to return.

Great Introduction to South Africa and Cape Town. We booked the 2 day tour 'Cape Town Uncovered' for the first 2 days of our holiday, it was a great introduction to both the city and the country. Rob was a great tour guide and made us feel very comfortable in the city. We would throughly recommend this tour, don't hesistate to book it!

CAPE CONVOY - AMAZING!!! All the way from Brazil!!!!. My friend Isabella and I were in South Africa last October, 2009 and we had the best 4 days trip in Capetown with Rob - owner-operater. He is gentle, really knows about his business and fun!! Rob introduced us not only the beautiful South African Sightseeing, but also gave us a great insight perspective into history and life in South Africa.We had the best time in Capetown and neigborhood. Our tours included the winelands (which was for sure one of the most remarkable day in my life), safari, and the city itself of Capetown and its natural sightseeings.I totally recomend Cape Convoy Tours to anyone who is coming from Brazil or anyother part of the world!!

look no further than Rob and Cape Convoy for your Capetown tours. In January my sister-in-law and I did 3 tours with Cape Convoy. I've never learned so much on a day trip as I did on the Cape Point tour! Rob inspires his tour guests with his knowledge and enthusiasm. I must also mention the Township tour organised by Rob, with an African guide. It was a morning to remember, highly recommended.

Fun, friendly and factual all in one trip!. Cape Convoy tours came very highly recommended so we did not hesitate to book the Cape Point tour. After reading so many positive reviews of this trip (well, of tour guide Rob really!) we had very very high expectations. I can honesly say that it surpassed our expectations in every way! Our only fear would be if he was fully booked, (which fortunately he wasn't.) The trip was from start to finish a great fun time, Rob makes you feel like part of a team , he made all of us feel at ease with one another and by the time the trip was over I was already sorry to say goodbye to fellow co-passengers and especially to Rob. We felt that we had seen the best of the sights, learnt the facts the fun way, and been more than just a passing tourist. Truly cannot wait to return to Cape Town and can't wait to book another tour with Cape Convoy! Thanks Rob, keep up the great work!!

Talking scenic & historic tour!. My wife and I were under the capable hands of Rob from Cape Convoy end of January 2010 and enjoyed 2 days touring the Peninsular Cape, Robben Island (skip if you are not interested in the history of South African independence struggle) and Table Mountains ( a must do if you want to have a panoramic view of Cape Town, food at restaurant also good!). Rob is very knowledgeable about the historic links between the various colonial powers and how they resulted into today's South Africa and Cape Town. He loves talking but for those who love history, it can be fascinating for the listening tourists . Our group of 12 mixed nationalities had a great time seeing the nature's side of the Seal Island and the Penguin colony and the picturesque tour of the various scenic spots/National Reserve Park and Rob seems to keep us amused all the way with historic quiz, social comments, cultural & political insights of the South Africans. All in all, we find Cape Convoy services personable and value for money and we would recommend Rob for any first time visitors to Cape Town.

Awesome !!. We had been recommended to book trips with Cape Convoy and were not disappointed !Rob the owner, is enthusiastic and committed to Sth Africa and making sure you have a great day ! He is very informative and you will have a fun day, believe me !We booked 3 trips with him, the day to Cape Point could not have been better, just a small group of 6 (perfect) and we spent 10hours visiting all the beautiful places in this area. He has useful tips e.g. the best side of the bus to sit when visiting Robben Island.The Wine Trip is wonderful visiting five beautiful Wineries and a fabulous lunch at Spier, where we had contact with the cheetahs !Rob is a great host/guide for the day....... you cannot go wrong, such fun - and he really cares that you have wonderful time. Can highly recommend !! No worries..........

Cape Convoy-BRILLIANT -don't go with anyone else !. Booked for 3days - Stellenbosch, Cape Point and Robben Island/Table Mountain.Right from the booking stage everything was efficient .Great being picked up from our accomodation and very punctual !Day 1 with Julius - what a nice guy - knowledgable and very accomodating .It was like spending a day with friends !Everywhere he took us was great , but was completely flexible if anyone had other suggestions . Thanks Julius for a great start to our stay in Cape Town!!Day 2 & 3 with Rob - and another nice guy !!We learnt so much and had so much fun .His enthusiasm was immense -such a positive approach to his work and a superb guide. Doubt you could find any other tour operator with such personality and drive as well as being very professional .Very memorable 3 days - many thanks to both of you !

That was an amazing weekend!. In the space of one weekend in December, Cape Convoy made sure we went up Table mountain in the best conditions possible, get across to Robben Island and do the Cape Point tour despite a ferocious wind that seemed to daunt other operators.Rob was about as good a guide as you can get, dealing with everyone on a pleasant and personal basis whilst ensuring he explained anything and everything about what we were seeing.The prices were good, the company excellent and the whole experience outstanding. If you go to Cape town and do not use Cape Convoy, you are missing out!

Simply the Best Tour in Cape Town. Monday 25th January 2010 was when my wife and I met Rob of Cape Convoy. Booking a tour in an unknown City is always a worry! This is one tour you seriously do not have to worry about. Rob proved to be an excellent host and when you meet him, I can promise you that you will enjoy his company. Rob is passionate about Cape Town and it was a fantastic experience. When we come back we will be looking up Rob for an update. Thank you Cape Colony

How To Make A Great Holiday Even Better. I owe Rob Salmon of Cape Convoys a debt of gratitude.Rob turned a great holiday into an unforgettable experience, bringing the region’s history to life and unveiling the beauty of the landscape.Passionate about his love of the country, members of his tour can't help but fall for the Cape as well.I intend to return to Cape Town and a second Cape Convoy experience will be at the top of my to-do list.

Cape Convoy Tours delivers just what they promise and more!. I had spent many hours researching who we would choose to go with for touring the Cape Town area. And finally choose Cape Convoy, we booked the Full day Cape Point Tour and Robben Island/Table Mountain tour. I definately made the correct choice - Rob is your man and he is excellent!!! He is very passionate and knowledgeable about the history of Cape Town/South Africa and has lots of interesting things to tell you as he takes you along the beautiful coastline. I am not going to tell you every place he took us because he took us everywhere you want to see when visiting this beautiful area.Rob picked us up from our hotel and returned us back afterwards, and makes the day very enjoyable. Cape Convoy were very helpful, I can justify this because we were scheduled to visit Table Mountain on the Thursday of our holiday, but sadly the mountain was closed due to high winds, so Rob arranged to meet us the next day to try again…..sadly the winds were still too strong and we could not go. Luckily on the morning of our last day there the sun was out the mountain was clear and the wind had dropped, so he rang us at 8:30 to say ‘get up the mountain it’s open’. Sadly, he was already pre-booked elsewhere which was understandable (he’s very popular) but he did refund us that part of our payment to go up Table Mountain, which was really nice of them. I can’t recommend Cape Convoy enough, I was so worried about booking a tour before getting there so please if you have any concerns DON’T they are great! And we look forward to seeing him again when we go back next year.

Cape Convoy = AWESOME. Had a day trip with Rob, Owner-Operator (which means he has a passion for what he does) and had a blast. Explored the cape, had a run-in with a Baboon (good experience, remind Rob to lock his van) and learned some great local history and tidbits from Rob. Promptly picked up in the morning, we were running a little late at the end of the day because the group lingered, but Rob did not mind. Thoroughly entertained the entire day, got some great sights, pictures, laughs and recommendations. I was going to go with Rob again on the Table Mountain and Robben Island on day 2, but Rob talked me into the Shark Diving Trip (I thought it would not be a good time of year) and I am grateful that he did.Two great days in Cape Town, glad I got to spend at least one day with Cape Convoy and would DEFINITELY do it again.Thanks for the great time Rob!!!!!

The best guided tour in Cape Town. We booked onto Rob's 2 day tour. Day 1: visiting the the tourist sites around Cape Town. Day 2: Robben Island and Table Mountain. Unfortunately, the cable car up the mountain was closed due to high winds.Rob picks you up and drops you back to your hotel, and I think has a maximum of 8 guests which is a great group size. He is very friendly and relaxed, knowledgeble about the area, especially the history and you are never rushed.100% should be awarded for his enthusiasm!

Unforgettable tour run by unforgettable Rob. We went to Cape Town the first week of December and had an amazing time. We booked the Table Mountain tour and the City tour. We wanted to book the wine tour as well but we had a schedule conflict. All tours were absolutely awesome. Rob is British and a total laugh. He was also so accomodative and responsive, we were really impressed. Even my husband, who usually does not like tours, totally opened up and had great laughs with Rob. The Table Mountain tour is excellent. Rob picks you up at around 8:30AM, and we picked up 4 other passengers. We got to Table Mountain and Rob let us roam and hike around on our own. Then he took us to vistas where tourists do no go and gave us a history lesson on South Africa. It was great because he offered different perspectives with lovely British humor. We also hired him to give us a personalized City Tour which was really special and great. Rob loves his work and it shows. His enthusiasm was consistent through all our tours. It was so enjoyable and I would highly recommend him to everyone. All the positive reviews are absolutely accurate. In a city where you don't really know what you are going to get, Rob made us feel very safe and free to enjoy the beauty around us.

Fantastic. Rob was fantastic! This is a very family friendly tour as well. We went out with 2 young kids and one of ours fell ill and he was very understanding and accommodating. We got to see so much, but didn't feel rushed at all. Rob treats you like it's a private tour, without the price tag. Going out with Rob if more like going out with a family member than with a tour guide. You will miss out if you don't do this tour while your in Cape Town!

The Best Tour in Cape Town - Read for Details. My sister and I had 3 days in Cape Town and a million and one things we wanted to see. After searching for tour groups on TripAdvisor, I selected Cape Convoy and hoped for the best. Here is our experience:We booked the Wine tour, the Robben Island and Table Mountain tour and the Cape Point tour.A day or two before the trip we received an email from Rob with a tentative schedule. The schedule honestly depends on the weather, and things may get shifted around a bit. For example, it was rainy and windy several of the days we were in Cape Town. This resulted in moving the Wine Tour to a later day.Our first excursion was the Cape Point tour. This tour in particular is given by Rob himself and I highly recommend it. My understanding is that several of the tours are giving by different people working for Cape Convoy. The Wine tour was given by someone else (more on that later). We were picked up from our hotel at around 8.45am by Rob with a full van / mini-bus of people. I think we ended up with at least 8 people from around the world. Rob mentioned that about 70% of the tourists end up being Americans. Our first stop was Hout Bay with about 20 minutes to shop the local vendors and then off on a 30 to 45 minute boat ride to view seal island up close. This was great! We visited Boulders beach which was fun (though I am told Winter is a better season to see the penguins, as most had gone out to forage for food). The majority of our time was spent at Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope. There is a restaurant, however my sister and I purchased some chips and drink from a local vendor and instead used our time to hike out the light keepers trail to the furthest point and then take a second hike out to Cape of Good hope. Each hike is no more than 1 to 2 miles, though given the time you may need to jog portions of it. Rob peppered the trip with interesting history and facts about South Africa, Cape Town and the various locations we were visiting. This trip alone was well worth the money.Our second day was the Wine Tour. The tour is given by another guy (forgot his name) that runs his own tour company. Rob mentioned that he doesn't do the Wine Tours himself. I have seen a few people complain about this tour, and can sort of see where they are coming from.  We had a great time on this trip. I attribute this to the fact that we more direct with our guide as to where we wanted to visit, and what we wanted to do. There are some 100+ estates in the Cape Region, and I guarantee you that everyone will have different tastes.  For example: We first visited Durbanville Estates which was alright. From this point on, we asked our guide to take us to Estates with a little more character, featuring sweeter wines and possible side attractions. And because of this, we had a great day! We asked our guide tons of questions and non were left unanswered. To be honest, after about 4 estates, each serving 8 glasses; we had each had our fill for a while. Our favorites were Solms Delta, with their fusion wines and Vrede en Lust for the spectacular views (and great wines!). We also spent about and hour and a half in Stellenbosch having lunch and shopping at Oom Samie se Winkel; the oldest store in Stellenbosch. Its definitely worth a short visit! We purchased about 4 bottles, with the top vintages going for around $10!!!!!!!!! You can purchase a bottle and pay an uncorking fee of around $5 to $7 at local restaurants to serve with your meal. To finish the day we wanted to see some animals. There are two estates right next to each other that offer such a treat. The one that we visited had the cheetah's. It cost R5 to enter and about R95 I think to pet them. I was content with taking photo's through the cage and walking around. The estate next door had white lions. Sadly the last tour of the lions is at 5pm, and we missed it by about 10 minutes; so instead we sampled 4 of their wines to conclude our day. If interested in the white lion tour (which runs around $10), be there by no later than 4.45pm.To be honest, if you didn't have a good time on the Wine Tour; I think its your own fault. My recommendation is to let the guide know up front what types of estates and wines you are interested in, ask lots of questions, and enjoy the day.Sadly we were unable to enjoy our third day on Robben Island or Table Mountain. Rain and windy weather forced the cable car to shut down and the island ferry to close as well. We did not plan for bad weather and thus did not have any additional days with which to be flexible. My advice for future travelers is to book about 3 or 4 extra days in case of bad weather. This will allow any tour groups to reschedule for better weather. There is plenty to see and do on your off days though. We spent at least a day or two shopping at the waterfront, visiting museums and various landmarks.Rob did refund us for the day we were unable to take. I will definitely look up Cape Convoy when next travelling to Cape Town and highly recommend them as a tour group. If unsure about anything, email Rob and i'm sure he'll be more than happy to help you out.

Go see Cape Town with Cape Convoy - you will have such fun!. My friend and I spent two wonderful days with Rob in November last. I had booked Cape Convoy as a result of reports on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. Having spent the previous few days on an organsised trip of the Garden Route with a different company (whose guide treated us like school children) it was wonderful to meet such a friendly, obliging and fun tour guide as Rob. The first day we went to Robben Island and Table Mountain with a lovely young English couple. Everyone was so relaxed and friendly and we ended up meeting them for a drink that evening. The second day we did the trip to Cape Point/Cape of Good Hope/Boulder Beach etc. in a group of seven. Rob is so relaxed that he helps everyone to get to know each other and that makes the trip so much more enjoyable. The day was magical - from the boat trip to see the seals off Hoet Bay to beautiful Boulder Beach and the adorable penguins to Cape Point. Rob is very obliging and willing to go with the group's wishes, i.e. if someone wants to stop for a photo all you have to do is ask and it is no problem.. He was flexible with the time and you never felt as if you were being rushed along - we had as much time as we wanted at each stop. My friend spent a third day with Cape Convoy on the shark diving trip (I was too much of a coward to try that but, having seen the video of her day, was rather sorry I had missed another fantastic trip). Rob's love of Cape Town and South Africa in general shines through on his trips. He is informative and very entertaining - a really nice guy and, at the end of the two days, was like an old friend. We had a most wonderful holiday in South Africa and my one regret is that we had not done the Garden Route tour with Cape Convoy instead of the other operator.I hope to return to Cape Town in the next few years and, when I do, I will certainly be booking more trips with Rob.

BAD-what a waste of money.. I think this company is hiring other drivers in order to keep up with a growing demand. Our tour guide was nothing more than a driver. He didn't offer any information to include where we were going or what we were seeing. No history at all....thank goodness I purchased a book on Cape Town. He was truly unimpressed with Cape Town and needs to find another job. He actually said "there isn't much to see here"......are you kidding???? He was not kidding. Our entire group was grumbling throughout the day about how we got ripped off.We booked this company based on the glowing reviews, but didn't have "Rob" as the others did. I was under the impression this was a small company that gave much attention to detail and wanted to separate itself from the countless other companies giving tours of the area (and there are many, we saw guides everywhere, wearing headsets, giving insight and pointing out things to their groups) Unless you have it in writing that you will have Rob as your guide, stay away....far away.

Completely unuseful!!!!!. We have booked this tour following the positive comments on Trip Advisor, but unfortunely for us it was not the same. The first day in Cape Point the guide didn't explain us anything on the town, on the travel, he was only a driver....it was better to rent a car and to manage the time as you prefer.The second day, it was ridicolous. First the guide arrived at the appointement 1 hour before what written in the booking, fortunately we were ready. Then, he did the function of driver to bring to the port to take the boat for Robben Island and at the return there was the best surprise: the driver gived us some cash to take a taxi to go to the Table Mountain because he was too busy.....no comments

Cape Convoy - Winetour. When demand calls for it Cape Convoy would call in tour guides to help with demand from other operators. This is perfectly fine but I personaly felt that the guide was not too interested in providing the best possible experience and we would have prefered to be advised about this prior to the commenment of the tour.The shuttle was of a high standard and the guide picked us up on time.There are over 200 wineries in the region so the three to four on the tour are a good spread between traditional and modern. We stopped at Spier for lunch at Moyo and to see the cheatahs. We weren't told about the cost of lunch and had to wait 45 minutes for the bill. I feel our guide could have done more on this occasion to ensure we get value for money on the tour. After settling the bill we needed to wait another 10 minutes while the guide spoke to some friends.We were then taken to a club in Camps Bay which was a nice surprise but again had to wait for the guide to finish socialising. I personally would recommend a self drive day tour around the region to fit more into your day.

Cape Convoy is the Best, don't bother with the rest!. We went to South Africa at the end Nov/ early Dec. starting in Pretoria, staying at the Sheraton Hotel, taking the Blue Train to Cape Town, staying at the Table Bay and using Cape Convoy (tour guide) to show us around Cape Town. See separate reviews for these. The trip was arranged by Natalie with Best at Travel in London, who did a fantastic job arranging the tailored trip for us and at a price we were happy with – I would really recommend Natalie, she gave us some really good advice. We spent 4 days with Rob at Cape Convoy doing Cape Point, Robben Island, Wine Tour and Big 5 safari. Rob by far was the best tour guide we have ever had, and we’ve experience quite a few in our time. I would describe Rob as an expert Tour Guide, historian, philosopher, geologist, comedian, match maker, business man and the list would on and on, but most importantly a friend. I was a little sceptical about all the review I read but if you are thinking about any of the tours Rob offers then don’t even bother looking elsewhere – Cape Convoy is the best. We learnt so much about Cape Town in such a fun way. On all 4 of the tours we met some interesting people, but more importantly Rob has this gift of bringing everyone together and by the end of the day all become good friends. Some advice: Take something warm and waterproof for the Cape Point tour, and the sun can burn so use sun block. Don’t bother driving to the Wine Lands – we bumped into a few people who took the car and the driver could not drink, and if he/ she if part of your group it really does not make it a party atmosphere, again with Rob, we all became good friends and the help of some wine it all happened at the first Vineyard!. You can book the Robben Island and Table Mountain trip yourself and you’ll save yourself a few pounds, but don’t bother because Rob gives you some good advice on both tours which you won’t get going on your own and it’s worth it. Great work Rob - if I can give you more the 5 on Tripadvisor I would, you certainly deserve it!

If You Want To See And Fully Understand The Cape, Then Look No Further. I can only endorse the many plaudits already wriiiten about Rob and Cape Convoy. My wife and I had the most fantastic five days in Cape recently and our experience was all the better for meeting with Rob. As with outer reviewers, Rob showed an incredible amount of flexibiity in ensuring that we saw all the sights. We only booked the Cape Peninsula and Robben Island/Table Mountain day tours but such was Rob's determination to ensure we received value for money by seeing all that we had paid for, we actually saw him on four different days. Despite the unpredictable weather we managed to visit Roben Island and Table Mountain, albeit not on the planned days. Our fortune in doing this was emphasised when we met other couples in the hotel who, using other operators, had failed to visit these sights because of unfavourable weather with no alternative being offered. Rob's tours are relatively informal but that doesn't stop you feeling a VIP as he directs all of his attention and enthusiasm into ensuring you fully understand the culture, history and beauty of his country. We are well-travelled and we have never been provided with such a comprehensive and willing tour package. We would strongly recommend Rob to any Cape Town visitors.

Personal, friendly, and fun small group tours. We went on the Wine tour and Cape Point tour with Rob and the Robben Island experience and Township tour.First of all, these tours are really good value, particularly the 2-day explore capetown package.The Winelands tour centred on Stellenbosch and included stops at some amazing vineyards (apparently not all frequented by the larger tour operators). The Ernie Els vineyard was a particular highlight; other than our party (4 people) there was nobody else there and we had the opulent surroundings to ourselves! We also got the chance to visit a cheetah sanctuary and paid a small supplement there to stroke the cheetah.The Robben Island tour was largely operated by the Robben Island people but we were picked up by Rob on the day.The Township tour was interesting and we visited a 'witchdoctor' and local kindergarten funded by tour operators. There was also a visit to the district six museum on this tour. This does obviously bring you up close with the poorer areas and deprivation in Cape Town and perhaps isn't for everyone as a result.The Cape point tour was brilliant. It was a day packed with so much - a boat trip, numerous historic sites, penguins, the Cape of Good Hope, Hout Bay. Fantastic. Rob is a great guide - great knowledge but also able to weave a really good historical picture and above all willing to go the extra mile for guests. The tour is in a minivan and there were never more than six of us in total on any of the tours.Thanks for a great time and memories to keep for a long time

great trips and a professional friendly approach. rob salmon is a legend. delivers excellent trips, adds small detours to see new stuff if time allows, reschedules trips when the weather demands it, knows his stuff. cant believe the review from the guy from LA, sounds like a pro moaner. we took 2 trips. the cape tour is excellent and the robben island tour highly recommended. highly recommended.Gareth and Wendy. uk.

Great Tour. We just returned from spending three days in Cape Town and used Cape Convoy for several trips. Rob was extremely flexible, lively and committed to ensuring that we had a good trip. He rescheduled tour days for us, due to weather, to ensure that we saw everything that we wanted. Very enthusiastic and knowledgeable guide and I would recommend him to anyone.

CONVOY OF ENTERTAINMENT AND ENJOYMENT. My Wife and I spent three days last September in and around Cape Town with Rob and Cape Convoy as our hosts. Rob was in good form, full of life, and made sure that all his guests felt at ease with himslf and each other on each of tour days. He changed tour days around for us, (his suggestion) to suit the change in weather. He certainly had a mind full of information on any information with relation to the tour you were on that particular day. He was a breath of fresh air as far tour guides go, and i would definitely recommend Cape Convoy to a friend.

Fantastic Guy and tours. If you want to see the sights of the Cape these guys are great. Rob is so accomadating he tries to make sure you see the sights you want to see. In the 5 days there in winter managed to get to Cape Point and all the sights along the way. Table Mountain, Robben Island, Signal Hill and a tour of the Winelands. I have got the bug now so going back to d othe garden route and whale watching. What a place and Rob makes sure you get the best out of it.

Educational, entertaining and enthusiastic. We arrived in Cape Town on the morning of the 7th for a 5 day stay. On the 8th, I called and e-mailed Rob about using his services, and he rang back and advised that although Monday the 10th was a National Holiday, he would be glad to take my wife and 2 adult children on his tour that day. He picked us up at the agreed time, but the weather was not immediately accomodating. He then altered the schedule and we went to those sights that would be good assuming the weather cleared up. Along the way, he pointed out the important sights, engaged us in enthusiastic and interesting conversation and informed us of great inside information about the entire area. He didn't push us to hurry, or suggest that we might not want to spend time in a particular area. Because the early morning weather was not good, he reduced his normal price because he didn't take us to what he usually does. All 4 of us thoroughly enjoyed his tour and company and we would readily recommend him to others.

Excellent Bloke and great Tour!. We were in Cape Town for 4 days as a stop over to finish off our Honeymoon. When we got there we realised we should have planned our time there a bit better. However after contacting Rob who had been recommend to us while we were in the Kruger, he arranged for us to join his Cape Point tour which he was running the next day. It was brilliant. Cape Convoy is a very personal and friendly outfit. There was 6 of us on the trip and the tours seem to range from about 2 to 6 people (8 max) as normal. Rob is very enthusiastic and great fun. He is full of interesting info about Cape Town and South Africa. He also offered plenty of advice on a wineland tour which we did on our own as Rob obviously had other things booked up for the rest of our time in Cape Town. He also did his best to try and arrange a Shark diving trip for us with no incentive for him but just cos he's a great bloke.He comes highly recommended and is great value for money.

Stay away from this tour!. My wife and I recently took this tour, finding the driver unable to answer many of our questions. The driver became indignant when we asked who might know something else about the particular area. There is too much competition in Cape Town for this type of poor group tour service.

One of the best tours we've ever been on!!. Cape Convoy was brilliant, Rob knew everything about all the sites we visited! He was filled with passion and information and plenty of jokes!, giving a great tour! The price was worth every penny, we always felt safe. With only 2 days in Cape Town we saw all the main attractions! except Table Mountain which was closed due to the weather even though Rob did everything he could to change the tickets and get us up there the weather was against us. We couldn't have had a better time and if you want to be in the best possible hands, have a fantasic time and see all there is, Go with ROB!! Cape Convoy was just Fantastic. Thanks Rob

The BEST Tour Guide and Company on the planet!. My family had the distinct pleasure and good fortune to find Cape Convoy before our Cape Town trip. Rob (the owner, driver, entertainer, and now friend) bent over backwards for our family to ensure our seven days with him would be memorable and amazing -- and boy did he deliver! Rob devised a unique tour that set his tour company apart from the rest in that he catered his tour to meet the satisfaction of us, his customers. If a tour is closed due to weather or if the customers are just not so interested in the place - he changes the tour right on the spot to accommodate his customers and ensure their happiness, even if he loses money in the process, Cape Convoy will move mountains to make sure you - the valued customer - is happy. Regardless the reason or cost. It was just amazing to be treated like royalty and like such a valued and important part of Cape Convoy's day. We had an INCREDIBLE and memorable time while in Cape Town and it was all because of Cape Convoy. Thank you Cape Convoy and thank you Rob for everything! We miss you and appreciate all you did for us during our time there. We would not hesitate for a second to recommend this great tour company to anyone else and have already done so numerous times. Just amazing! You will leave Cape Town with a great background knowledge of Rob's beloved city as well as with a new family friend. We are happy to supply photos and/or more information on request. Thanks again Cape Convoy - we had THE time of our lives!!

Great time with Cape Convoy!!!. We found Cape Convoy here in trip advisor and it was very well recommended. We booked 4 days with them. Them, I mean Rob, that is the owner, guide, driver... An excelent person to spend a day with and very commited to deliver the best. He makes everything possible for you to get the most amazing experience in Cape town. He was aware of the weather forecast, changed the days for the tours because of that, tried to understand what we want to do. It is not a big tourist company, so don´t expect large buses... but do expect a great time in CT. We had a great time!

Refreshing !. Being a 1st timer to Cape Town, tedious research were carried out in order to have the ultimate enjoyment in Cape Town and boy we got so many choices of tour agencies to choose from. Only after stumbling upon Cape Convoy, plus it's overwhelming reviews we decided to put our safety to them. We took the Cape Point tour (2 days visiting major attractions) at a reasonable price as compared to other agencies. It was winter and on our 1st day, only 2 couples (including ourselves) were in the group. The other couple was this lovely husband & wife from England. The whole journey was a thoroughly enjoyable experience with wonderful attractions visited, extremely breathtaking views, enriching conversations shared and whole lot of jokes and laughter throughout the journey !!On our 2nd day, we were supposed to visit Robben Island and Table Mountain but we only managed to visit Robben Island due to weather conditions. However it was well taken care of by the good company of Cape Convoy :)All in all, we love South Africa & Cape Town and we truly apprecaite the experiences shared by Rob of Cape Convoy ! It was truly memorable ! This visit to the country has totally changed our mindset about South Africa as we found out that the people are warm, very hospitable, down to earth and safety was not an issue for us. From us in Singapore ... thank you Rob !!Imran & Fizah

CAPE CONVOY - Rob Salmon "The Legend". I'm South African and been living in the UK for the last five years. I decided to return to SA to have my wedding in Durban, and also planned a surprise honeymoon for my bride to be in cape town for a few days as well. My only problem was.... that i couldn't find an extensive tour of the fair cape within a reasonable budget within the short time frame i was going to be there. Thank god for Cape Convoy and more so to you Mr Rob Salmon. Of all of my trips in Europe, i have never come across a tour guide who has such a personalised and positive approach to his work. He was extremely accommodating and has such a wonderful energy about him that made this guided experience anything but some of the boring, scripted tours that i've been on in other countries. Besides the guided tour, on our first day we enquired about any seafood restarurants he'd recommend, to which he off his planned route and dropped us off at no extra charge at Ocean View in Camps Bay. My wife and I had the perfect start to our honeymoon watching the sunset whilst dining on the best seafood in the cape. Needless to say we had a fantastic honeymoon, and on our next trip to South Africa will definitely be returning to the Cape to try out the Shark Cage diving that Rob mentioned. All of the best to you Rob and may your business go from strength to strength!! Your friends, Prean & Anneline (12th May 2009)

Cape Convoy Rocks. I must admit that when my wife said..."we are going on some arranged tours when we return to SA"...I groaned.....the thought of sitting on a bus with some monotone guide droning on didn't fill me with unbounded glee........but guess what.....we got Rob Salmon and we had a ball.....this guy is seriously cool in every way. To begin with he is just a really nice, positive guy...full of jokes....add to that an encyclopaedic knowledge of the cape and environs.....top this off with a well executed itinerary, excellent organisation and a built in radar for the best places to go....in total you have one of the best (and reasonably priced) tour experiences you could imagine....can't recommend CC enough....top man...thanks Rob....cya next time ace.

Convoy Tours is as awesome as South Africa !. I have spent a lovely trip with them covering all the attractions Cape Town has to offer. The trip plan and schedule was exactly adjusted to our needs and met fully our expactations. I am one of these travellers that is not easy to be satisfied and these guys made me more than happy with the day spent togetner. They make you feel not as if you was just one more tourist but a friend to whom they want to show their city. We have seen everything including Cape Hope, Cape Point, Seals Island, Pinguins, Table Mountain and many many more... and all that in very friendly, like home atmosphere! Thank you very much for your effort Rob! It was fantastic!

Best tour during our world cruise. We had a fantastic tour, Robert Salmon looked after our every need, the tour was taylor-made to our requirements, and Robert added extra to the normal tours. With only two and a half days in Cape Town we were able to visit Seal Island, Penguins at Boulder, Cape Point and beyond to the new Light House, Cape of Good Hope, Robben Island, and Kirstenbosch Gardens in two days leaving time for shopping before we sailed away. We saw Baboons, Ostrich, Seals, Penguins, Whales including the rare "Island Whale" and many birds. The tour was great value for money, and enhanced by Roberts attentiveness, and sense of humour.

The Best Tour I have ever been on!. I wanted to share my Cape Town experience with everyone. Anyone who has not make the journey to Cape Town yet should def make the effort, you will find it very hard to meet someone who has been here who will not tell you it's one of the most stunning places on earth!I am from London but am based in joberg for a few years and my wife and I took a holiday to Cape Town and stayed in the fantastic Fire & Ice Hotel, 3 star and only R500 per night.I was recommended a tour company by some friends of mine from New Mexico that run their tours in open top Land Rovers. They are called Cape Convoy and the day tours done in safari style and have 360 degree views so you can really get a feel for the Cape.Our day tour took us to Seal Island, Boulders Beach witch is the home of the African Jackass Penguin, Kirstenbosh Gardens, Cape Point (where the 2 Oceans meet) The Cape of Good Hope, and the Ostrich farm. All in one day! We also were given a good few hours at Cape Point, we were informed that with a lot of companies, 45 mins is the norm but that’s not enough. Those of us who felt up to it walked all the way to the end of the point, the edge of Africa!It was simply the most fun we have ever had on a day tour, our driver Roger was a star and what a character! We learnt a lot, made new friends and had a blast. I have never seen a company that do the Day Tours this way, the Land Rovers were converted to seat 7-8 people and the views from the back were incredible. It beats a mini bus hands down!Another aspect of Cape Town we really enjoyed was Robben Island. The tour lasted 4 hours and was hosted by an ex –political prisoner. We also found and amazing sea food restaurant in Camps Bay called Ocean View, eating wonderful food, watching the sun go down with a cocktail. It’s as good as it gets!

Fantastic tour; James is brilliant guide!. Highly recommend this tour - we visited four wine estates with about six tastings at each, with a bit of brandy thrown in and a full glass of wine over lunch..! (Bring water and have a good breakfast...)The wine estates were fantastic - great quality wine in exceptionally beautiful settings - you'll go to all the region's famous wine areas. We even threw in a quick stop at a strawberry farm shop. The tour was recommended to me by a local Capetonian as she'd been on it herself - so I do think this is the very best wine tour you can do! It was both fun and informative. We were very lucky to have James as our guide as he was great fun, interesting and very knowledgeable. 5/5 - the only thing I can think of to improve it and make it even more awesome, for the awkward ones of us, is to forewarn the restaurant/wine estates if you have someone with dietary requirements. I had emailed before that I was vegan and reassured that that would be accommodated but this hadn't been communicated to my guide/the restaurants etc. Couldn't eat the cheese and chocolate (these could be easily supplemented) during the day and didn't know if the wines were vegan. But had a very merry day indeed - thanks so much!

Great day. I researched companies to do the 1 day wine tour with and was so happy we picked African Story. We had Willem showing us round who was a young, energetic, superb guide. There was just the 4 of us so it was flexible and he asked us what types of wine we liked/didn't like to tailor the tour around us. We went to 4 places and each was very impressive with lots of very good wines to try. No pressure anywhere to buy but we picked up a few bottles as it's so cheap. We went to a fantastic place for lunch which I think is the usual place. Big hearty dishes (needed after drinking from 10am!) and a good range of options (inc veg and a local dish - the meal was as good as anything we had in top restaurants in town and inc in the price). Good commentary from Willem through the day and a thoroughly enjoyable day out at good value in my opinion. Would highly recommend.

A++.. be sure to request BRUCE as your guide!. We were so very blessed to have Bruce lead our tour.. We were also so very blessed to have two wonderful couples join us for the journey.. Bruce is as savvy on wine as he is personable. Truly a kind-hearted man with a plethora of knowledge & life experience.. We've been on several wine tours globally & are firm believers that a tour is only as good as it's guide! Be sure to request our new friend, Bruce, & come with an appetite! Between visiting four vineyards, we had stopped at a delicious restaurant for lunch & even a chocolate factory! Wine, chocolate & good company- what more can a person ask for in life? John & Kim C

One of the best days out you will ever have!. We had the best time with Bruce, he's a lovely, funny, interesting and knowledgeable guy. He really knows wine and the best wineries to take you. He is in no way stuffy or pretentious, he just wants to share his love of wine with you and for you to have a good time doing so. We were so fortunate to have two lovely honeymoon couples on our tour, we all hit it off despite us being older and on our 30th wedding anniversary! We all enjoyed ourselves. Bruce took us to 4 different wineries and a chocolate tasting at the Fairview wine estate. We also sampled port, brandy and dessert wines at Backsberg- wonderful! We ate at a fabulous restaurant for lunch, really delicious, again, Bruce knows the best places! We loved this tour and can't recommend it enough. We will never forget our lovely day in the Stellenbosh wine region. Thanks Bruce!
Awesome tour. We had great fun with james. He was very informative and knows his wines. I would really recommend this tour.

Great day out!. We had a great day out with Bruce - 4 wineries, lunch, plus a stop for fresh strawberries and biltong. We had a diverse group of 10 people and Bruce made sure everyone was enjoying themselves. He could answer any questions we had about wine, or would also leave us alone to just enjoy the wine and cheese.I'd definitely recommend booking them!

Cape Town Wonderful Wine Tour . Unforgettable wine tour through 4 wine estates based in Stellenbosch / Paarl / Franshoek, with James who was helpful, always available & full of interesting facts & anecdotes on South Africa. More than 20 wines tastings throughout the day, from white to red, including sparkling wine.Will definitely recommend this to my Family & Friends! Thank you so much for this day, James!

Wonderful rainy day. It was a rainy day in Cape Town, so we decided to take a wine tour. Glad we did. We spent a wonderfully entertaining and informative day with James, visited 4 wineries and must have sampled 20 different wines. I'd highly recommend the tour and James especially.

''Making wine is great''. went for one day wine industry the place is one of the oldest in the area. some of the old vessel used for making wine. place has history of its own. the guide takes you around and show the history of wine making, the place is old now run by nth generation. has wine tasting area and how it is matured and stored in casks and served. it has small restaurant with fire in one corner and leather sofa, Heat in the winter is just enough to make you cold and the fire makes you warm .lovely crockery and cutlery in the fine dinning restaurant. little expensive but one can enjoy everything in the area.

A great day. Went on this tour knowing next to nothing about wine and came out feeling like I knew what I was talking about. Extremely friendly guide who ensured that all members of the group are catered for and he also found the correct balance between friendliness and professionalism - lunch was also delicious

James is the best. . Have to say that James was an excellent tour guide. Beyond excellent. He really knew how to be educational without being over the top or pretentious. He was also great if you wanted to know other things like life for a South African. Lastly, he didn't make us stick around with the group. He let us roam but gave us suggestions. He's an awesome guy who just wants you to enjoy yourself.I will tell anyone and everyone about this tour and how cool he was. The entire day was so good. Very happy drunk by the end of this tour. Learned a lot and had a great time. Thanks James!

Wonderful Experience with New Friends!. Our van was full (7 + driver) of interesting people from all over the world. We were all ages, all sizes, and all colors and got along marvelously: 2 from US, 2 from Durban, S. Africa, 1 from Japan, 1 from Canada and 1 from Australia. We shared our 'stories' along the way--non-stop chatter--and Nick joined in with the local flavor. Marvelous winery sites; very accommodating. Wine with chocolate: yum! Wine before and after lemon: interesting! Lunch was included!Would definitely recommend Bruce Storey's tour!

Personal attention with the perfect itinerary. We were fortunate to have Nick of African Story Wine Tours to guide us around. He is an amazingly affable, down-to-earth and light-hearted man. His passion for wine and friendships gave us a tour that was full of joy, relaxation and knowledge-building. Already, the rate of ZAR 700 was value for money given the extensive itinerary and lunch. His personal hospitality, the itinerary's fine selection of vineyards gave us so much more value for our experience.We went home with not just brilliant wines, one of our best lunches in South Africa but also joyful happy memories to long for.Looking forward to sign up for African Story Wine Tours again when we are back in Cape Town. Thanks for adding yet another perfect day to our amazing Cape Town holiday.

Wonderful winelands. Our winelands tour was fantastic. Bruce our host was very knowledgable & organized the day to perfection. This is an awesome tour for locals & overseas visitors alike. We loved the Master Wine & cheese tasting at Fairview. From there we had a wonderful lunch in a perfect setting at La Petite Ferme in Franschoek- a breathtaking setting for a delicious lunch. This was such a lovely way to see the countryside of Stellenbosch, Paarl & Franschoek in one day. Highly recommended!

The tour consisted of visiting 4 vineyard and restaurant for lunch.. The first vineyard we stopped at was Fairview which is also a diary farm. The wine and cheeses very excellent. My favorite of the four. I was not impressed by the lunch we had a Le Pommier. I ordered the grilled fish which was overcooked. Our tour guide Nicholas was very nice.
Great day. What a great day... Bruce did a great job, nice tastings, good lunch, flexibility ....Thanks Bruce, will do it again when we are back in town.

Fantastic Day with a fantastic host. What a fantastic tour. Our guide Bruce was a perfect host, He was very knowledgeable and made sure we had a great day. Would definitely recommend this day out, had a lovely lunch and great wine tasting. Hopefully one day will be back to sample a few more wines! Keep up the good work Bruce.
A nice day in a beautiful area. My daughter and I did a tour last week. Our guide was James. He was very knowledgeable and made sure we were on track and had enough time to visit in each place.

Fantastic day out!. We enjoyed a fabulous tour of four wineries. Our guide, Fern, was amazing. So friendly and helpful. The day was relaxed (no long trips in the bus) and varied. We had a lovely lunch, with more wine! I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to experience the wine region, but in a relaxed, non-stuffy way.
Wine lands tour. Had a fabulous tour to four wineries. Richard was a wonderful guide, who made sure the whole group had a fun time. Would definitely recommend this.

Great day with an amazing guide. We had an awesome tour with Bruce who is a wonderful tour guide. He was very knowledgeable about the different types of wine, pairings and just had a love of wine which was infectious. He was very friendly and encouraged the group to mix together which made the day more enjoyable. Also, it was my birthday and Bruce was kind enough to surprise me with a bottle of wine! It was totally unexpected.Overall it was a great day, learnt a lot about different types of wine and just had a fun day out.

Great day out!. I had a really good experience with African Story, the whole process from booking through to the end of the tour was excellent, very well organised and superb value for money. Our Guide (Jimmy) was friendly, informal and relaxed, he knew his wines very well but was pretentious in the slightest, although I'm still not sure about the Banana flavour Pinotage!! :) The wineries we visited (4 on the day) were all different from the last, each had something to crow about and with lunch included I am a very satisfied customer. Good job!

Wonderful. A truly brilliant experience. When booking we thought that the price and itinerary were too good to be true. But bruce delivered on everything. He is a fantastic guy and a great guide. He really knows his stuff about wine and wine pairing. He has his own opinions but does not push them onto you. He informs and educates. Bruce wants everyone to feel comfortable with him and others on the tour. The wineries we went to were all fantastic (exceptional wine) and not too busy. He had designed the route so there was no long queues or waiting. Lunch was lovely. I could go on for ages saying how good this tour is. I would strongly strongly recommend to anyone who likes wine, cheese, food and the company of other like minded people.

Amazing !. This tour was really incredible !! Our tour guide, Bruce was really fun, knowledgeable and full of jokes. He made us laugh from the time we stepped onto the tour bus until we returned to our hotel. Bruce is very knowledgeable and answered any questions we had. I have celiac disease and Bruce made sure that my lunch didn't have traces of gluten which I thought was exceptionally caring. This is a great tour for anyone wanting a relaxing day out as well as a educational wine tour. Thank you Bruce for the amazing tour. !!

A fun, relaxed day out. Our day out in the Cape Winelands was fantastic. Jimmy, our guide, was very well-informed, yet never too serious or pedantic - so our small group had a great time moving from one estate to the other, learning a thing or two along the way about the history of viticulture in the Cape region as well as some basic techniques of tasting and appreciating the wine. We visited estates in Stellenbosch, Franschhoek and Paarl, driving through some amazing landscapes and stopping for a lovely lunch break at Le Pommier in Stellenbocsh. We were quite wobbly on the walk back to our hotel room at the end of the day, but that was a welcome side-effect of a most enjoyable day. Would highly recommend an African Story tour to anyone discovering the Cape Winelands for the first time.

Great Day Out. Want a day out tasting wine, experiencing the wine lands and without the pressure of driving; you won't go wrong with travelling with African Storys.. I cannot speak for the other guide leaders, but what I can say is that Bruce, our guide, was brillant! He knew his stuff, looked after us well and gave everyone time. For sure this little excursion into the wine lands worked out well because of Bruce's interaction with his clients. He even laughs at his own jokes, which is a bonus because no one else did.. (only joking Bruce).Looking to do the wine tour with a smile, an insight and some personal service? Grab Bruce's trip

Wonderful Wine Tour. A fantastic day out, made even more special by Richard the tour guide, and the other members of the tour, who were from the UK, Gran Canaria and a village close to the Kruger National park. Thank you all so much for making our day so wonderful.

Great Day Out. We went on the full tour on New years eve 2015.there were five of us in our group and 13 overall.What a great day everyone had , Bruce has a wealth of Knowledge and puts everyone at ease .The places we visit are superb and the wine tasting excellent .There is no pressure to purchase any wines sampled ( we sampled well over 20 )I recommend this tour as a great day out to taste wine and see a magnificent part of the world .

Convenient & Very Fun Tour!. I went on this tour with five other friends, and we had a great experience. Our guide, Jamie, really took care of us and accommodated everyone's wishes. We had a great time at each of the tastings, learned a lot about the wine-making process and several South African wines, and ate a wonderful lunch. Our tour not only included wine tastings, but we also had a cheese tasting as well as a brandy and chocolate tasting. Getting picked up and dropped off at our hotel was extremely convenient too. Overall, this was an excellent way to spend a day outside of Cape Town, enjoying the fantastic wines and views of the region.

OK tour, nothing special though. We visited 3 different vineyards, tasted several wines but didn't really get to see or hear anything about wine making procedure. It felt a bit too touristy and you could see groups of tourists coming and going to the same vineyards, as if there was a schedule. Would be better to do this kind of trip by your car with your own planing and pick vineyards you want to visit. Also, one of us wasn't drinking wine at all, but the price was still the same as for everyone else.

Great way to spend a day!. We did this tour today with James and had a fantastic time. When looking for a tour, we wanted one with a small group so it was a more personal and relaxed experience. This fit the bill perfectly: 11 people total from ~6 countries. We appreciated how well James paced the day, with the cellar tour up front when we were most attentive, and then the most casual winery (with delicious cheeses!) at the end. The lunch was excellent and we never felt rushed during the day. We enjoyed James' sense of humor and professionalism, and would (will!) highly recommend him and this tour company to anyone visiting Cape Town. Thank you!

Definitely Add This to Your Cape Town To-Do. Our group was hosted by Richard. He's an absolute pro, knew his stuff, had plenty of banter and made it a very laid back and unpretentious day. I'd highlight the word 'unpretentious' as I reckon that's what most people (or at least I) feel is important in a wine tour.Everyone in our tour was mid-twenties to early thirties, but anyone older would enjoy it too.We also booked very last minute on the phone, which was no problem.A very fun day.

Great way to spend a rainy Cape Town day!!. Thanks to Bruce for a terrific time. The morning started with a downpour, but Bruce quickly got us in his van and off to a wonderful winery – then it just kept getting better. He’s got a great sense of humor, an extensive knowledge of wines and the perfect personality for creating a relaxing and fun day.

Wife,sister in law and niece . Many thanks to Bruce for a great days wine tasting,visiting 4 winery's.A good lunch plus a stop at a really good biltong shop and strawberry stall.Bruce picks you up from your hotel,he plainly loves his work.He gets everyone at ease with each other and his love of wine and foodand the relationship between the two is obvious.Have taken wine tours in a number of places around the worldAnd would throughly recommend African Story Thanks Bruce.

The best wine tour ever. My fianceè and I decided to go on a wine tour and it was the best ever. Bruce was our guide, he is so friendly and knows so much about wines. His wine tips are amazing and we learnt so much. It was a group tour so we got to meet people from different countries. Truly awesome, anyone that wants to do a wine tour I recommend African Story Wine Tours. You won't regret it

Would do this tour again and again if we could!. With only a week to spare in Cape Town, we wanted to head into the Winelands without hiring a car - after all, we wanted to be able to drink the wine!Charlene led our tour. We were with four other people on the tour, and it was a great group to go around with - we got on really well and this added to the day. We were taken to four wonderful wine estates, showcasing the range of wines and places that this incredible area has to offer. Charlene was very knowledgeable and good company too. We just could not have done this type of tour ourselves - it was completely worth going on this organised trip. The fact that it included a really nice lunch and a cheese tasting was better still - these made it a really good value tour.We took a few tours whilst in Cape Town. If we could do any again, this would be the one. In fact, we would happily do it many more times to try many more great wines and see many more beautiful wine estates. Completely excellent.

Amazing, fun trip with legendary Bruce the guide and made so many friends!. The BEST way to explore the wine lands. Met lots of new people, facilitated perfectly by Bruce the tour guide, who is one of the nicest people ever - he is genuinely happy when his guests are happy and mingling. Will go out of his way for you as well - for example, I need gluten-free and dairy- free food due to medical condition. I informed the agent at time of bookings who said t would be fine. But then on the day the lunch organisers didn't know what I could eat so Bruce called them during a winery visit and spoke to the Manager and the result was a delicious, large filling meal for me at lunch!!
