Thank you Bruce!Absolutely recommend. When it was time for us to get off the bus at the end of a long day we genuinely did not want to get off - we were all singing to the radio and chatting! 10/10

Fun, informative and delicious lunch!. This was a wonderful activity for a rainy day in Cape Town. There were six in our group and another couple from the U.K. Bruce, our guide, was enthusiastic, fun and knowledgeable. It was interesting going to the four different wineries and comparing/contrasting not only the wines, but the atmosphere and service. (A few had cheese tastings as well!) The lunch was delicious! We really enjoyed ourselves! I would highly African Story Wine Tours!

Great tour!! Super friendly tour guide and wineries. I was in Cape Town on business and had some time for personal site seeing. My bf and I opted to do this wine tour instead of driving ourselves around to the different wineries. I'm sooo glad we did. We had a small group of 9 people plus the guide. It was a neat mixture of people and all were friendly. They picked us up at our hotel. We went to 3 different regions and 4 different stops...all of which were a reasonable short drive from Cape Town and each other. The guide was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. The wineries were all very friendly. Even the one stop where we didn't have a group wine tasting did a free tasting for me and my bf when we asked. You can buy at the different stops. The guide had to foresight to provide a cooler for those that purchased cheese at the first stop. My bf and I love to buy wine and they were very accommodating to help us fit it back on the van. LOL The included lunch was delicious, included wine :), and was plenty of food. You have to pay for the tour in cash, so be prepared.
Stellenbosch wine tour from cape town . Awesome!. Beautiful wines, spectacular views. Our guide Fern made it even better with her bubbly, infectious personality! One million stars!

Fantastic tour. We had a brilliant day with Richard. He was very knowledgeable with lots of info about the different wineries and surrounding area and very easy to get along with. We were shocked at the sheer volume of wine we got to taste and all the little extras like the olive oil, chocolate and cheese tastings were fab. Would highly recommend!

What a great day!. Just a quick review - a fantastic day, great tour and all the other guests were awesome. Fearne, our guide was great fun and knowledgable. Lots of wine and great things to see.Highly recommended.

Fantastic. Richard was our tour guide and what a great job he did! We have a very cohesive group. It was very informative. He picked 4 great wineries, with a great selection of wines and attractions. Lunch was very good! A great day, and we were feeling more than a little happy by our drop off!
Great wine tour. We booked with African Story Tours for a wine tour. Had a fabulous time. The wine was great and the food (for lunch) was superb. I would highly recommend this tour company.

Fantastic wine tasting with Bruce. Fantastic wine tasting tour. My tour guide Bruce was very friendly and had lots of knowledge about the different wines, and foods to pair them with, he also had a lot of did you know facts about the city as we drove to the different wineries it was nice to be given all the history of the different places.Not only did we have wine, we got to have brandy too, see beautiful scenic routes and wild animals. Our wines where paired with great cheese varieties, chocolate, crackers and our lunch was at a little restaurant in Franshoek which was amazing, I had the mushroom risotto ( because I am vegetarian) if you are vegetarian there was other options too such as veg lasagna and a few more options but I forget.I really recommend this tour to everyone, Bruce was the best you can ask him anything about wine and he will know the answer 5/5.

Superb!. My boyfriend and I were recommended this company by a friend and couldn't be happier. Definitely recommended booking with them! We have done numerous wine tours in other regions and this is definitely a winner!We booked a group tour however were lucky in there only being the two of us so ended up with the equivalent of a personalised private tour! The guide Bruce was extremely knowledgable, expanding our taste buds, educating us with food matches and taking us to wineries he knew we would enjoy (he managed to expertly pick our favourite wines after only one winery!). The lunch was lovely, we had the opportunity to see some wild flowers and animals in addition to tasting some absolutely beautiful wines.At no stage did we feel rushed and Bruce encouraged us to experience the South African wine regions to the fullest. He also assisted with duty free allowance and assistance with international shipping options (above and beyond!)Highly recommended+++

Great scenery, great people, great wines, great day!. Great tour, and what a bargain! Tour picks you up at your hotel. Erika was our tour guide for the day and she was very knowledgable and very friendly. We went to 4 different wineries, all very unique and different in their own way. Two of our wine tastings were outside which was lovely. 24 wines tasted! Lunch, olives at one tasting, chocolate at one, and, my favorite, cheese tasting at our last winery! The scenery was spectacular, and hit the three best wine regions in the area, Stellenbosch, Paarl, and Franschoeck. You do not get to spend time in the towns, which I knew upfront, but if you are expecting to walk around Stellenbosch, etc, then you will need another trip. Overall, great day! Loved getting to spend time with people from all over the world on this tour and get everyones input.

A Great Day with Bruce. My husband and I booked this wine tour based on the TA reviews. We recommend it highly. Though it was a rainy day, we had a wonderful time. The 4 wineries visited were lovely and all the wine thoroughly enjoyed. There were 8 on our tour, and we were good friends by the end of the day! The tour includes a cheese tasting, lunch and lots of wine education.

Brilliant Day Time Trip. A very well run day tour, picks you up and drops you off at the hostel/hotel, 4 wineries visited (4+ wines sampled at each venue) plus an excellent lunch. The tour guide Richard was brilliant, very friendly and full of local knowledge. Caters to all type of people and excellent value for money. Would 100% recommend.
Cape Town Wine Tour. Quite simply one of the best days of my life. Extremely good value for money, great education on the South African history, wines and general culture. A fantastic day out.
Friendly and enthusiastic. A fun tour with Bruce, who is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the wineries and the area. Highly recommended!

The best wine tour operator.. We opted for a special tour since we were a group of 12. We had a flight to catch at the end of the tour. However our luggage could not be fitted into the bus. Bruce was most helpful and arranged for a another vehicle to take our luggage to the airport.I have make a special mention about our charming guideJamie. She is very knowledgeable about wines which we are not and explained in detail about wine selection and tasting.On our request she gave us a tour of the quaint little French town of Franshoek.Incidentally the are working on Sundays.Overall a very memorable experience. Highly recommended by me.

A fun, delicious and informative day!. Our guide for the day, Ferne, picked us up on time and with a sincere smile that never left her face. She safely ferried us from vineyard to vineyard and to a delicious lunch. With a local upbringing, several years of industry experience and a passion for great food and wine she shared insider insights and provided a comprehensive overview of the region's history, vineyards, topography, animals and weather patterns. All inclusive of transportation, wine tastings and lunch, we found this tour a great value and would recommend it to friends. This tour is focused on tasting quality wines in elegant settings and is not a land based "booze cruise."

Long day filled with fun. We visited 4 winefarms in the surroundings of Stellenbosch & Franschenhoek. There was a good kind of balance between information, tasting, a good lunch and between the different locations, wines and farms. The guide was nice and funny, but took at the same time his responsibility for not drinking because of driving.

Loved it!. Professional and easy going tour leader Richard...lovely vibe from the start! Even in wintertime lots to see still...scenery, lunch and cheese tasting all excellent. Really memorable and would do it again! Small things like having everyone buckle up in the vehicle and a few safety briefings along the way could be incorporated in a fun way for that extra point! The staff at the wine farms themselves seem hassled and hurried, even mechanical at times .(we visited Anura, Tokara, Vrede & Lus, Fairview)..this probably is not totally within African Story's control....emphasis on service has a long way to go at most wine farms where you feel a bit like a number really. The awesome scenery, food and the tour group vibe makes up for it all in all.

Great day out - if you do one wine tour this is the one. Really good day out, well planned and structured day.It allowed a non expert to gain an appreciation of the areas wine industry and also to sample some of the great wines.The four farms (don't think small smelly farm yards) were of different standards and the same could be said for the wines, very much bout personal taste, we were not disappointed in any way.The inclusive lunch was of a good standard too with a reasonable choice in the restaurant selected by Richard the guide.Richard did a great job in gelling the group together who had come from three different continents, that said he didn't need to work too hard as they were really chatty friendly group who as the day progressed had even more laughs. I would thank my fellow guests for their company and Richard for his informative commentary I will definitely recommend.Darryl and Louise

Book this tour, you wont regret it! Amazing experience and great value!. I had heard Cape Town had a fabulous wine region, so this was a must do on our trip! I was a bit nervous as I had to reach out and get confirmation the day before the tour to make sure it was still on and confirm where we were to be picked up, but after they responded it was perfect! Nothing to worry about.Our guide, Paul was right on time (even a bit early), and was such a nice guy. He was so knowledgeable about Cape Town and all of the wine regions we visited. The drive was about 35 minutes to the first winery - not bad at all! The tour lasts all day long, but is so worth it. We went to 4 WINERIES overall! Each had about 6 tastings at each- all which were delicious. Lunch was even included (which was really lovely!) For the price, this was an absolute steal. Great wine + great food + great people + great guide = GREAT EXPERIENCE. My husband and I were extremely pleased. Just book it, you won't regret it! Thanks African Story!

excellent and value for money too.. Before leaving for South Africa, we searched on the net and amongst a raft of tours, found this tour company.I was a bit worried because it was nearly half the price of the company which we had previously used and even lunch was included.Booking was a simple matter and Bruce, the owner, driver and guide arrived exactly at the time promised.We picked up an American couple and 5 young ladies from Canada. Together with the 4 of us, it made a party of 11. Everyone seemed relaxed and we all got on well together which added to the pleasantness of the day.Bruce proved a perfect host, very knowlegeable, relaxed and friendly.We started at Fairview estate, then on to Backsberg before calling at Le Pomier for an excellent lunch.The afternoon saw us visiting another 2 estates before heading back to Camps Bay.There was a fantastic range of white and red wines as well as sparkling and a rose. The tour also included cheese tasting at Fairview, something not included by other tour companies.The whole day was exceptional and we cannot praise and thank Bruce enough.Oh, and before I forget, as it was my wife's birthday, there was a bottle of wine for her from Bruce. A nice touch.If you have any doubt about who to use for your wine tour, I can highly recommend this company.

Just book it!. We were in Cape Town for the first time, late on a Saturday evening wishing to go on a wine tour on Sunday which seemed unlikely. Bruce however accommodated our late booking with no problems and promptly turned up the next morning! We had a great group (Hi to Ali and Marissa from the U.S student cruise!), Bruce was great and a genuinely very nice person. Started sampling wines at Fairviews at 10am! And by 5pm, we had gone to 4-5 wine farms and had sampled more than 25 wines (with a lovely lunch of bobotie in between!)! All the wine farms chosen were different with stunning settings, and we even got to sample cheese, port, chocolate and olive oil on the side. No pressure to buy anything either, but it was so good, did end up bringing 4 bottles safely to the UK ;) It was one of the highlights of our SA trip and would love to do it again. Totally worth the price too!

My second time on this tour. I did this tour with my brother a couple of years ago, and when I visited Cape Town again earlier this month, I knew I had to take my wife on this. We had Ferne with us again, and she was as cheerful and knowledgeable as ever. We visited the same estates, but I had no problem with that whatsoever. In fact, I was happy to go back.

Great day out. Had an amazing time in the Winelands. Ferne is a brilliant guide, such a lovely person - warm, friendly and professional throughout, and it was a long, 12 hour day. Having done the Wine Flies tour, I would say that they are both equally good but with a slightly different vibe. Ferne is extremely knowledgeable and really engages you in learning about the wine.

Great day out . Went to four different places and sampled between 4-6 wines at each with cheese at the final stop. Relaxed friendly atmosphere created by the guide and pitched at the right level. Ferne was an all round great guide and went the extra mile by recommending and helping us organise further trips a field in the Western Cape, which proved to be really good advice! Would recommend this company.

Wine Tour. Just been on the African Story Wine tour. Absolutely fabulous. A real fun day out. Fern was our tour guide. She was both knowledgeable and a great guide to the wine growing area. Would have no hesitations in recomending it. All inclusive meant all inclusive. Wine tasting and a great lunch

fabulous!. We did our wine tour with Fern and she was superb! So friendly and knowledgeable, we had a great group and got to experience lots of different wines and cheese. I would definitely recommend this company!

Even on Sundays. We chose this company because they were available on Sundays whilst most others were not. As it tuned out we were very glad we did. Paul was our guide and he was excellent! He imparted a vast amount of knowledge upon us. This coupled with fine locations and great wine made for an excellent day. Lunch was also fantastic. If you are considering a Cape Wine Tour, this is the one!

The most prefect day.. Can't wait to do it again!. The wine tour was one of our biggest highlights of our month in South Africa! Bruce has amazing knowledge and is great fun. (We even met him for a beer the following night) We went to beautiful vine yards, the wine tasting was amazing. One of the vineyards had cheese tasting as well.. Wine and cheese perfect! We stopped at a lovely restaurant for lunch with different choices and again great! Bruce has the tour worked out perfectly! We can't fault it! Just looking forward to going back to South Africa and doing it again!

A beautiful fun day in the winelands. spent the day with Erica, tasting and checking out the wineries in Stellenbosch and Franchook. Could not have asked for a better day to go wine tasting. Erickas knowledge helped make the tour worthwhile. Lunch stop was nice sat outside and enjoyed the nature with some bobotie and more wine.Great job Ericka!!

A Great Day in the Cape Winelands. A friend in DC recommended African Story Tours when I mentioned I was interested in doing a winelands tour when I was in Cape Town, and I'm really glad I followed up on his suggestion. Our charming and knowledgeable guide, Richard, took our merry little group (me from the States, and some folks from Switzerland, Germany, and Finland) to four wine estates over the course of the day, several of which dated from the mid-1600s: Fairview and Spice Route estates in Paarl, Anura in Klapmuts (near Stellenbosch), and Solms-Delta in Franschhoek. The stops included wine tastings, informative presentations, and winemaking tours with the vintners at each estate; cheese tastings; a great lunch; chocolate; and awesome scenery, from the vineyards themselves, to the wild ostriches and springboks on the farms, to the backdrop of the Groot Drakenstein mountains. Kudos to Bruce, the owner of the company, who even came to our rescue at the end of the day when a couple of us went out to dinner after the tour and one of our group had forgotten his cell phone in the tour vehicle: Bruce not only delivered the phone to its owner, but he also gave me a ride back to my hotel, even though it was late in the evening and well after our tour had ended.African Story Tours is highly recommended!

Fun Day. We spent a fun day with Bruce touring wine country. The variety of wines was very fun to try and Bruce throws in some sweets here and there. Lunch was delicious! We visited 4 wineries and drive through the town if Stellenbosch. Bruce is very knowledgeable about wines and loves to share tips. One point of note - this is not a private tour. My husband and I were part of a larger group of 11. While a bit unexpected, I would not say this was a bad thing as we got to chat with people from all over the world.

Great day in Cape Town. Was in Cape Town for the Mining Indaba so booked a trip to Stellenbosch for the day. Had Fern as our guide - very informative and lots of fun. Was a good group of people - Aussies, Germans, Brits (from Qatar), Spanish and an Italian. The wineries were all very good and the wines ridiculously cheap. Favourite was the Africana from Solms Delta. Great value day out in Cape Town.

Fab Family Wine Tour with Bruce!. Having looked at a few companies for a wine tour, and it's hard as you know who to go with when you are 6000 miles away looking through the internet etc, however ,we eventually settled on African Story, and we were delighted that we did! We communicated with Bruce who was very happy to answer the many questions we posed, and we decided that we would actually like to do a Private tour . We are a family of 5 , with 20 something 'kids' and with Bruce's help we tailored our own route. Bruce had even thought to bring along a cool box in case we made any purchases or had water with us on a hot and sunny day, small things that we hadn't thought of! He was extremely knowledgeable, made the transitions in and out if the wineries very smooth and was good fun along the way! We even got to see the grapes at Villieria going through the wine making process courtesy of Bruce! I could go on, but just try African Story yourself, you won't be disappointed and we would highly recommend to any one contemplating like ourselves!

Great day out. There were 8 of us on the trip from Canada, Germany, South Africa, Italy and the UK.Our driver and guide, Jamie, was excellent. She got us to introduce ourselves and from then on we got on like a house on fire. We visited 4 winneries sampling 24 different wines and champagnes as well as cheeses. The more we tasted the happier we became. Lunch was included and of course a glass of wine [or beer or soft drink].It was great to see the countryside around Stellenbosch.The scenery was lovely and Jamie was very knowledgeable, All this for only 650 rand [approx £37] Highly recommended. Booked online and was picked up from my hotel.Excellent in every respect.

Charlene's knowledgeable tour and explanation. Fantastic day out with very informative & enjoyable trip. Great lunch stop. Highly recommended.All day trip with champagne brunch & cheese & wine swansong !

Great way to see the wine regions. I had a great experience with African Story Wine Tours. The group was interesting and diverse. There was a nice mix of large wineries and smaller, boutique wineries. The lunch served outdoors was delicious. I booked last minute as a single (a lot of Cape Town tour companies have a two person minimum) and Bruce was very accommodating. I would highly recommend this tour.

Bruce and Fern Rock!. I usually head out with Bruce on this tour but I had Fern for the first time a few weeks ago. Both Bruce and Fern are awesome. The trip is great, the wine farms are great and lunch is good. Great bang for the buck and a great way to spend a day in the cape. Do it!

Wine Tour. I found Bruce online and after reading reviews knew this was the tour for us. He was very quick to respond and answered all questions in a timely manner. Charlene picked us up at our hotel and we toured 4 wineries. She is very knowledgeable about wine and also gave us commentary about the sights as she was driving. Very good wines and a lovely lunch. Last winery included a cheese tasting. Would definitely recommend.

A good fun day. We had a really fun day in November. There was a good group of people all aged about 25-35 from various European countries. We visited four wineries, tasted at least 25 to 30 wines and had a really good lunch and learnt a bit about the area around the Western Cape.

Fun and relaxed wine tour. The 5 of us knew we wanted to do a wine tour and we found African Story tours offering a packed day out, with lunch and cheese testing at a great price. Bruce was quick to get back and answer all our queries so we booked the tour. There were 11 of us altogether and with Bruce's enthusiasm and cheery nature we all got to know each other. Four wine farms, plenty of cheese tasting and a great lunch made for a fantastic day. The scenery is stunning also. At the end of the day Bruce supplied a final drink and chocolate, which was a lovely touch. Bruce, we can't recommend you or your company highly enough! Slainte!

Day Wine Tour. Bruce gave us a great day out. It was fun and Bruce's knowledge of wine and the region and the easy way he communicated the same was appreciated. This was excellent value for money.Thanks Bruce until the next time!

Fun, easy, mind blowing. Bruce is the man. Was solo in Cape Town for a few days and felt I had to tour wine country while there. While my hotel offered a stuffy high end tour, Bruce made it fun. Group of about 10 of us incl a few solo's...Bruce got everyone to know each other a bit on the van ride and made everything chill and fun. He knows which vineyards to hit up, knows the people that work everywhere and really just made it an awesome day out, could not recommend more. Thx Bruce!

Great day!. We had a great day with Ferne! She picked us up at our hotel in Cape Town and then we efficiently collected the rest of the group. The day was specifically planned to minimize time in the van, which was much appreciated.We visited 4 different wineries in Stellenbosch, Franschoek, and Paarl. We loved all of them and each had something slightly different to offer. We also stopped for a delicious lunch at a restaurant on a wine farm. All along the way, Ferne shared fun stories and information about the region and wineries.Overall, it was a relaxed and enjoyable day for a great all-inclusive price. The booking process was also easy and Bruce quickly responded to my inquiries via email. I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Cape Town!

Great day. it was a last minute decision (late the night before) to book a wine tour so i emailed a few operators and Bruce immediately returned my email and confirmed space available the next morning. He is very friendly guy and knowledgeable. We had some oenophiles from France and he could talk to them as well as people just out for the day with no interest in wine. The four vineyards he selected were different and provided a nice contrast. Nice lunch and lots of wine.highly recommended.

Great day!. I just got back from Cape Town and went to a day wine tour. It was amazing. Bruce will pick you up already in a great mood and will make sure that you feel as part of a team with the rest of the group! Will tell some funny jokes and others not that funny but at the end of the day what matters is that you have a great laugh and interact with the other people so the tour is not only about the wine but the entire experience. He has great knowledge about what he does and you try so many wines that you ended up quite drunk. Bruce got strawberries on the way and I thought cure that he shared with the group! At the end we had a a game and the winner got a bottle of wine. The winner nicely chose to share with the rest of us ( by that you see how friendly the group was) and seeing that Bruce gave another bottle to the winner! Who again shared on our way back! Such a cool day! Recommend!!! Food was great and well served in a nice place! Really a good value for money!

Fun and relaxed. Had a great time with Jamie, our guide, and the others on our tour of the wine lands. We went to four or five wineries plus a lovely lunch. The Malay chicken was great. The wineries were a nice mix of large and small with different specialties. Jamie had a knack at keeping things light and fun. Great day!
Excellent Day. Great wineries with good community involvement. Yummy cheeses. Knowledgable guide. Beautiful lunch. Comfortable transport - with local music!

Outstanding Experience. My girlfriend and I had an extremely enjoyable experience taking the wine tour with African Story tours. Our guides name was Charlene and she was very friendly and seemed fresh and excited to share knowledge with the group all through the day. I say 'day' as this is exactly what you get for the excellent price of R650. It is a full day consisting of many different wine farm tasting sessions as well as some cheese (Buy the cranberry cheese at Fairview - you will not regret it) and brandy for good measure. You really do learn a lot on this tour and after coming home we both feel very equipped and worthy of commenting on or suggesting the wine choice to accompany any dinner! Who knew you could have red with fish - contrary to western myths! Highly recommended. Will certainly be in Cape Town again and this will be the first line on the to do list. Thanks for a very friendly and professional tour guys. Cheers.

Wonderful scenery, wine and company. My wife and I booked this trip before we left the UK and we're so glad we did.We visited four lovely wineries, all in stunning settings, and enjoyed sampling at least four wine at each visit – including reds, whites, roses, sparkling and even a sparkling red. Lunch was equally enjoyable – I had a first-class Malay curry, but for the less adventurous there's a wide choice, including a burger – and our fellow tasters were delightful.Bruce who led the expedition was knowledgeable and charming and made the day one of our stand-out memories of our holiday in the Cape.As promised I've uploaded the "team photo" from the day.

A great day in the wine region. We had an enjoyable fun day tasting wines at 4 wineries. The wineries were very different, offering their own red and white wine specialties. The lunch menu offered a good selection of items from which to chose and lunch was superb and in a charming setting.Charlene, our tour guide, was informative, helpful and engaging. We not only learned the wine-making process but also learned more of the charming countryside and towns of the area. Prior to booking, Bruce promptly answered and explained timing and details of African Story Wine Tour. Thanks for a wonderful and memorable day, Charlene.

A fantastic day out!. We've just happily returned home after a day with Terry, who was a thoroughly enlightening and humorous guide. He went out of his way to impart his passion for wine through 4 wine tastings in four unique vine yards, and a delicious lunch was included as well. We learnt so much about wine and cheese, I felt like I should be taking notes! Fantastic day out, thoroughly recommended!

Brilliant day out for all ages. My brother and I were one of the youngest in our tour group (early twenties) but our guide, Bruce, brought the group together with his great personality and in-depth knowledge of the subject.The day was very relaxed and all the vineyards we visited were beautiful. The lunch was excellent and as for the wine - brilliant selection! We left with much more than we had planned.Fabulous day out in all - very much recommended!

Delicious, fun filled, winery hopping day. Bruce was the ideal guide; easy going, funny, highly informative and punctual. We were picked up on time and visited four beautiful wineries, each one unique in location and wines. Bruce added expert detail and we learnt more about wine (and food and cheese!) in one day than I have in my time drinking wine! Lunch was delicious (we're vegetarian) and the company of the other travellers excellent. We had a range of ages and nationalities and it made for a fun day of story swapping. A highly recommended day trip for anyone visiting Cape Town.

Fantastic wine tour. We had a fantastic day with Charlene, our guide, exploring 4 superb vineyards. Charlene was incredibly knowledgeable and personable and terrific company. I would thoroughly recommend this tour for people who genuinely want to learn about the process of making wine especially sparking wine (MCC). It is also a super way to taste 27 plus wines . Thanks Charlene for making such a great and memorable day!

THE BEST WINE TOUR WE'VE BEEN ON!!. Bruce was funny, full of knowledge and just an absolute legend!! The wine tour was one of the highlights of our honeymoon and we would highly recommend African Story Wine Tours. We met great people and the wine was terrific (and so reasonably priced! woohoo!). The standard was world-class. If you're considering it-DO IT!!!Colin & Natalie van Zyl (Australia)

As good as reviewed. Bruce was a phenomenal guide. After having read many of the reviews I was tentative as to whether he could live up to the pedigree of his reviews however he did so with ease... We had an amazing time and ended up sending 4 other people on his tour - all of whom also loved it.A very, very helpful and knowledgeable individual with amazing personal skills.

Absolutely Amazing Day. Our tour guide (Fern) was a delight! It was always a fear that we would be led around by a 50 something wine snob but this was simply not the case. The day involved no less than 27 wines and 5 champagnes as well as a brandy! My fav day out ever!!!!

Ton of fun...and wine!. I had a great day with Fern as my guide and a nice small group of seven. The mix of wineries was excellent and all had great atmosphere and wine. Fern was a brilliant guide full of information and just great fun. Would highly recommend!

Awesome Day in the Winelands. We had a fabulous day in Stellenbosch thanks to Bruce! After doing research on TripAdvisor, we settled on African Story for our wine tour because it felt a little more balanced between fun and maturity than some tours out there. Interestingly the group the day of our tour ended up being really young (we were the oldest, I think, at 31 and 30!) but not at all wild, and we had a great time exploring four different wineries with our fellow travelers under Bruce's wing.Bruce knows a lot about the region and wine, but didn't explain too too much about either, instead choosing to give us lots of time at the four vineyards we visited for tasting and exploring. We spent ample time at each and were able to get to every spot on his list — with a side trip to a yummy biltong spot! — without ever feeling rushed. The lunch spot he brought us to was delicious, too. I'd definitely recommend this tour to people who are looking for a fun day (maybe not so much if you're looking to learn every detail of winemaking) — we really enjoyed ourselves.

Excellent trip. Bruce was an excellent and very knowledgeable guide. Great to spend the day with him learning about wines and hearing his great stories! Sampled lots of delicious wines and ordered a lot to be sent home for us. Highly recommended!

Fantastic experience. I went On a wine tour with African story wine tours on Sunday the 3rd of August 2014 and what a fabulous experience.My tour guide Terry was fantastic he explained and told a story with every landmark and he knew exactly what he was talking about.When we got to the wine Farms he knew exactly what each wine was and all the information regarding each farm and wine.I recommend The African Story wine tour and I give Terry and Bruce 10/10.Justin heath

Greatest Wine Tour There Is!. I just went on this tour yesterday with three friends and it was by far one of my favorite things I have done over the month I have been in South Africa! Our guide was Bruce and he was AMAZING. His amount of wine knowledge was incredible and he was extremely kind. He also had a great sense of humor. To top that off we went to four different wineries and each one is very distinct. The wine was spectacular as was the cheese, chocolate, and brandy! The lunch included was also awesome. If you are looking for great value and a wonderful time, then look no further than African Story Wine Tours and request Bruce! In California wine country we have nothing close to this great of value.

Perfect day, wonderful wine. Fern you were fabulous and saw farms I'd never been to before. Great wine and bubbles, fab cheese and olives a scrummy lunch and perfect "winter" weather. Thanks for a lovely, happy day. We'll definitely recommend it to our friends. Thanks a mil.

Wine Tour. An absolutely fabulous day trip with Bruce covering Paarl, Stellenbosch, Fransxhhoek area - tour included cheese tasting, a great lunch, zebras and music. Bruce is extremely personable, and paid attention to our intersts -- he took the time to take us on a trail walk and drove us through Stellenbosch so we could see the university, etc. All in all a memorable day.

Highly recommended!. We did a one day tour of the winelands with the African Story Wine Tours, and booked through tripadvisor. The tour was led by Ferne and she was fantastic! She was a fantastic (I repeat myselft with good reason here) tour guide, driver and a representative of the people of Cape Town. We loved the tour too :). There were only 5 people on this tour, me and my spouse and 3 older (very fit) Australians. I think this made for a better experience than if there had been more people.Ferne came to pick us up at our hotel at the designated time, and we were off to the East to Stellenbosch, Paarl and Franschhoek. We visited 4 wineries in total , and had a lot of delicious wine with olives and cheese. I unreservedly recommend this group for touring the winelands of the Western Cape.

Fantastic day out. The wine tour lived up to everything we wanted, we visited 4 different vinyards accompanied by the very knowledgeable Charlene who told us everything about wine making. We had a great lunch which was included in the price. An absolutely fabulous day trip and would highly recommend African Story who communicated very well with me when making the booking.

Lots of Wine - Lots of Laugh - A simply marvelous day!. The owner and my guide for this full-day wine tour Bruce Storey, gave me a perspective on wine and cheese I hadn't had before. We visited four outstanding wine farms during the 10-hour trip with generous tastings at each, and were highly entertained by Bruce's description of the surrounding countryside, wine and life in general. I highly recommend anyone to spend a day with this outstanding tour company, especially if you're a wine lover and even if you're not - you will see the most spectacular scenery South Africa has to offer, and it's very reasonably priced. When Bruce realized I had no idea what Biltong was, he made a detour to a local hole-in-the-wall which in his opinion, had the best around. He even introduced me to Ginger Beer....he's a character and so much fun to spend a day with.....highly, highly recommended.

Just a Perfect Day. We had a great time on this wine tour, our guide was brilliant and the wine farms we went to we're spectacular, the scenery is magic! The memories made on this day will make your holiday!

A superb day out in wine country. The great reviews here are well deserved. This was a fantastic day from start to finish - our guide, Fern, was enthusiastic, engaging and informative. The tour takes you through some beautiful countryside and gives you a great introduction to wine and winemaking with the addition of cheese, chocolate and olives! You definitely will not be hungry/thirsty by the end of the day and the approachable style of the tour makes it accessible for everyone! No previous wine education required! Go on this tour!

Perfect day. The tour guide knew everything there was to know about the process of winemaking and made for interesting discussion beyond the cellars. While on the tour, we also got a bit of history on the towns that we visited such as Stellenbosch (a beautiful town, might I add - I had never been there before). Reasonably priced for door-to-door shuttle pick up and drop off, tastings at four different wine farms and lunch that was fit for a king's belly.Thank you so much African Story.

Amazing wine tour!. We are so glad we went on this tour. We got to see the sights of the beautiful Cape and visit some superb vineyards. Such a great day! High recommended! Especially the cheeses!Will & Lauren

A fab and fun day!. We booked our day trip to the Cape Town winelands with African Story after seeing all the great reviews and they did not disappoint! We were picked up promptly and Erica, our host was really lovely and a fun guide for the day! The tour was one of our funnest days of our trip and we visited a good range of wineries with not only wine tastings but some olive oil, olives and cheese! We had a great group so had such a laugh and the day seemed to be very tailored to our group! Would definately recommend to anyone wanting to see some of the winelands scenery surrounding Cape Town as well as try some amazing local wines! Thanks for a great day!

Wine tasting in style for cheap!. In terms of value for money - this one is a winner! Get to visit at least 4 wine estates...and good ones at that! We also got to taste cheese, olives, chocolate, MCC (SA's version of Champagne but better!) and also obviously copious amounts of wine. Bruce and his team work hard to make sure that each and every one of their guests have a good time. When in Cape Town...do it!

Enjoyable day for a non wine drinker!. Spent a very enjoyable day, with a great group of people, visiting the stunning winelands. Bruce was informative and attentive, taking great care to find me an easy introduction into wine drinking which by the end of day had me tasting and enjoying a few reds! My husband is now worried he might have to share his purchases with me. A highly recommended tour.

A Must Do Wine Tour! Cape Towns Finest. Having spent roughly 5 weeks in total in Cape Town I can truly say this is an experience not to be missed. During my 9 months of travels I can say this is one of my most enjoyable days yet. In total I enjoyed Bruce's wine tours on 3 occasions. There are 4 wine lands to experience throughout the day with a fantastic lunchtime stop which offers great foods and more wine. Each wine land is very different: cheese tasting, olives, Brandy's, chocolates and of course wide selections of wines. The drive throughout the day is stunning also. Do not miss the opportunity to purchase some great foods and wines at Fairview- very good value.Thanks again for 3 very enjoyable days Bruce! I will be back.Phil London, UK

A great day with Nadya.... The full day tour was cheaper than others and included a lunch, four different farms with wine tasting, cheese and chocolate :) tasting. Pick up from the hotel was included.

fun day of wining. My husband and i recently booked a last minute wine tour and had a great day touring four different vineyards with Nadya. The upside - we were the only people on the tour, so we had an entire vehicle to ourselves! What a treat, we felt like the whole day was a private affair customized for us. We tasted a delicious variety of whites, reds and MCCs and brought home the maximum allotted in our luggage (two each). The downside - we were really looking forward to the unconventional addition of the brandy tasting, which was not included into our itinerary, and were told we would tour a barrel cellar which we did not get to do. I would have also loved to have driven through the beautiful town of Franschhoek, although I'm not sure if that was possible given the tight schedule of the day. Overall, a great experience!

A perfect birthday trip. I was recommended African Story tours by a friend who had used them previously.  We were a larger group of 7 and so opted for the private tour to celebrate my 30th Birthday. The tour was of an exceptionally high standard, and the knowledge of our guide Bruce was excellent. this was a full day trip and we visited a number of different vin yards, beauty spots and had a lovely meal included. When doing the standard tour all tastings and meal are included however this is not the case with the private tour. I was advised in advance to collect a kitty of 200 rand pp (apx £10pp) I wasn't sure this would be enough for everything we did, and was shocked when we ended up with money left over.  The wine was was beautiful, the scenery spectacular and the tour superb.  Whatever you do.... DO NOT MISS THIS TOUR!!Ps. Thanks for the birthday champagne Bruce

Wonderful day in the winelands. We spent around 10 days in Cape Town and wanted to do a wine tour. We booked a day tour through the hostel next to our accomodation. The tour included pick up at your accomodation, visit and wine tasting of 4 different wineries and a lunch. The group was about 12 people in total. We had a wonderful time especially because our guide, Fern, was so lovely and made everybody feel at ease. The atmosphere was really relaxed; we never felt pressured by time or to buy anything. We tasted lots of different wines and champagnes but also olives, cheese and chocolate. We don't know much about wine but Fern was giving lots of explanations. We also visited a cellar. The landscapes were really amazing. I really liked the fact that we visited two sustainable farms. We would highly recommend this tour (unless you want very technical explanations about the wines).

Wonderful wine tour and a fantastic guide,an experience not to be missed!. Our Company booked a full day wine tour with Bruce Storey and his team of African Story Wine Tours on the 7th February this year.From start to finish,our tour was made fun and informative- Bruce our guide was unpretentious and graciously shared his extensive knowledge on wines with us. He is truly phenomenal, a consummate guide as well as host- a perfect blend of humor, education as well relaxed hospitality all throughout the day.We visited gorgeous premier wine farms,we tasted different wines and cheeses and luxuriated in the magnificent surroundings in what is known as one the most beautiful regions in the world!It is a day we will always remember, and we all now cherish a deeper appreciation of our world-class South African wines as well as those who produce them!Thank you once again to African Storey Wine Tours and our wonderful guide Bruce Storey!Warm regards,Candice Roberts and the CallForce Team

Best wine tour you can have, great guide, great fun. My partner and I booked with Bruce back in December for a full day wine tour in the Cape Winelands and had the best day. Bruce is great fun and takes you on an educational but fun and relaxing tour of different wine farms in 3 different regions. We tasted so many different wines, champagnes, brandy even chocolate and a tasty lunch was included in the price. It was a great day and I met some really great people. I would recommend this tour to anyone and would definitely book with Bruce again if I return to Cape Town. If you're considering who to book a wine tour with look no further than African Story you really will have the best experience. Thanks again Bruce - Becs and Chris from the UK :-)

Highly Recommended Wine Tour. We were very lucky to have Erica as our guide and driver for the wine tour. She made the day even more enjoyable and gave us lots of useful information, not just about the Winelands but told us plenty of information that we didn't know about South Africa and Cape Town, during the journey.We stopped off on route at a service station where we were able to get a coffee and light breakfast before the wine tour. We visited 4 beautiful vineyards in Paarl, Franschhoek and Stellenbosch. We had a cellar tour at the first winery and at the last one, as well as wine tasting, we were also able to do cheese tasting. The day was very well organised and a nice lunch was also provided. The weather was fantastic, blue skies and hot sunshine. The group size of 12 in a minibus was just about right and the pick ups / drop offs to the hotels didn't take long. Other wine tours have larger groups in coaches. Fantastic tour and great value for money. Would highly recommend this tour.

Relaxed wine tour. Bruce let our tour of Paarl, Franschhoek and Stellenbosch. It was a relaxed and enjoyable day and we visited 4 vineyards, a wine cellar and tasted over 30 wines (make sure you pace yourself!). Lunch was good and the whole day well-organised. Highly recommended.
Awesome Wine Tour. I really enjoyed the tour. Erica was a great tour guide and I met awesome new people. Were really lots of fun!!!

Fabulous Wine Tour!. Great tour of 4 beautiful wineries in Paarl, Franschhoek and Stellenbosch. Lovely cheese tasting included in the first winery, some chocolate in the third and some nougat with our sparkling wine at the fourth. The guides were really friendly and knowledgeable and helped ensure everyone had a good day. Lunch was also provided at a nice restaurant, good choice of meals including vegetarian choices.Highly recommend!Jamie and Sarah

excellent day out. we had a great wine tour with paul who was very knowledgeable and gave us loads of hints and tips.we went to 4 different vineyards and had a great lunch came back slightly sozzled after tasting 24 wines but we both slept well that nightgreat day out

Great time, great wines. From the start all went well. Charline is a great driver and tour guide. She is charming, helpful and most knowledgable about all aspects of wines. Whad a marvellous day and enjoyed good wines and company. Highly recommended!

Excelent Wine Tasting tour. I did the day long winery tour with AfricanStory and had a great time. The tour guide 'Fern' was outstanding, very funny, knowledgeable, and a lovely person. We went on 4 different wineries, and got to taste up to 6 different wines in each place. Our lunch was also very nice and there was cheese and chocolate tasting as well. I highly recommend this company!

Best wine tour!. We were visiting Cape Town and had heard wine country was a must. All 7 of us loved this tour! Charlene was fun and informative. I learned much more about wine than on any tour in a fun setting. I highly recommend taking this tour to explore wine country-this one include lunch unlike the others. If I'm ever back in Cape Town I will book again!

Wonderful time in the wine country with Charlene.. Excellent trip through four wine farms with Charlene. Her advise on wine purchases was superb. Each farm was different but a gem. Would happily do again.

Fun and inexpensive. Best way to see the Winelands. Guide was great. Fairview was my fave farm, couldn't get enough of the cheese. Recommend the chocolate and brandy tasting at one of the farms as well.

Great Day out in Cape Town. This is a fantastic tour of the Cape Winelands...at a fraction of the price you would pay to do a wine tour pretty much anywhere else around the world. Bruce and his guides keep you entertained while explaining the intricacies of wine. Wine tasting can sometimes be a bit of a pretentious activity at the best of times...but these guys make it a really fun day out. It includes an informative cellar tour, some cheese and chocolate pairing with wines and about 4 different wine estates. All in all...great day out and worth every cent! :)

Made me feel like family. My friend recommended this tour to me. She was raving about it and decided to book it. I emailed Bruce to book it and he was very accommodating. On the day of the tour I went to the wrong pick up location. When I called him he said, no problem we'll find you :-) Then it started to rain a bit (it does this in capetown...one never knows when it will downpour!) but i was ok since i had an umbrella. Bruce worried about me being out in the rain and came to get me and stayed with me in the van until the whole group arrived to pick me up! That was so sweet. Then he handed me over to Fern (the loveliest person!) and the tour was on the way. We visited 5 different wineries had an amazing lunch in franschoek and had the best time. Thank you Bruce and Fern for a wonderful experience. I highly recommend this tour!

Wonderful experience and would highly recommend!. My friend and I visited Cape Town at the end of May. We decided to do a day trip of the winelands through African Story Tours and we were not disappointed! Fern was a delight and so passionate about sharing everything she knew about wine tasting with our group. We visited four vineyards and drank a lot of delicious wine and ate some cheese, too! If I ever visit again I will definitely go back, but probably during the summer this time.

Great day with great people. Learned some great tips on how to taste wine from our guide Charlene, very knowledgeable knew the area and vineyards quite well. The vineyards we visited were also all eco friendly and/or socially responsible in sone sense which was a nice surprise. We also had lunch which was more substantial than we expected, and quite delicious. With a range of food options we ordered ahead of time and did not have to wait very long. Overall a great experience, great service with pick up and drop off at our hotel. Would recommend to anyone looking for a casual learning experience through the beautiful wine country of cape town.

A fun way to explore the wine lands and try some great wines. This day-long tour takes you to 3 different wine-producing regions near Cape Town, and Bruce tailored the tour to what we were interested in doing. We were a group of 6, and we went to 2 wineries before stopping for a delicious lunch (with wine, of course). Then we went to 2 more wineries before he dropped us off at our hotels (we were also picked up at our hotels at the start of the tour, which made it very convenient!). We got to determine the pace of the tour, and Bruce added in some spontaneous stops whenever we had some extra time, like a walk to a little pond and a stroll through the town of Stellenbosch. The van we drove in was very comfortable, and the people working at the wineries we stopped at were all very nice and knew Bruce; the winery with the cheese tasting was a favorite, as was another where we tasted chocolate as well as brandy (not together). An excellent way to spend a day in the Cape Town area.

Bruce made my day!. Not being a wine buff, I didn't want to be bogged down with too much wine talk, Bruce tailored the day trip to the attitude of the group, I learnt some wine knowledge but didn't feel it was pressed upon me, tasted some lovely wines, experienced some amazing scenery and thoroughly enjoyed the day. Bruce is a top bloke and met us for a drink and to watch some rugby the following day.

I'll toast to African Story Wine Tours!. My husband, mom-and-law and I were in the Cape Town area last week. We took a day-long wine tour through African Story Wine Tours and it was a trip highlight! We enjoyed it not just b/c of the fabulous tasting room choices but also because of our guide, Fern, who is full of energy and an absolute blast. This is a really special place and we got to experience it under the guide of a special person. You will love this tour; get Fern if you can!

Plenty of wine, cheese, and excellent views!. This tour was epic. We went to several wineries throughout the area and enjoyed some of South Africa's finest champagnes, rieslings, and pinotages. You cannot help, but leave this tour with a bottle or two and that happy wine drunk feeling! I would highly recommend booking a tour.

A real treat. I was able to book African Story at short notice and what a treat. A lovely, small group and a tour guide extraordinaire. Fern was a real delight - incredibly knowledgeable, extremely engaging and responsive and a whole heap of fun. Her commentary and communication with the group made this a trip well beyond the ordinary. The selection of wineries and the order in which we visited them was simply superb. Champagne to start and the heavier wines to end the day. Olives just when we needed a snack, lunch perfectly timed and cheese late in the day to both complement and soak up the wines. This really is a trip above and beyond and a great way to see Stellenbosch as well. Thank you Bruce and Fern. You're doing an excellent job.Thanks to my travelling buddies as well. Lovely to spend the day with you.

A Great Day with A Great Guide. I was very lucky to be referred by another company to African Story. Turns out it was just me and the guide/owner, Bruce. He showed up on time at my hotel, warned me I was the only client and off we went for a very memorable day of visiting 4 wineries and a fine restaurant. Bruce is very knowledgeable in a subtle way giving a lot of information without making one feel naive. My best day of a 5 day visit to the Cape.

Fun day of wine drinking!. Such a fun wine touring experience! The wine farms that we went to were all very picturesque and the wine was great! Really nice lunch as well. Overall we had a lot of fun and thought that price was well worth it.

Ferne was an exceptional tour guide!!!! Go on this tour!. This wine tour was so much fun. We had a great group of people, went to great vineyards and Ferne, our tour guide was lively, knowledgeable and a real pleasure to be around.IF you are planning on visiting Stellenbosch, Franshoek and Paarl wine regions and only have a day to do it, African Story is your best bet FOR SURE

The best wine tour. It was everything we hoped for and much more. Our guide, Bruce was a delight. He KNOWS wine! He took us to four different wine farms; each with its own unique feel. The wines we tasted were varied and really showed the level of winemaking in South Africa. Bruce displayed an amazing knowledge of his home nation. We learned history, sociology and politics.It was a special 50th anniversary trip for us. Bruce made it more special (including a gift bottle of sauvignon Bland from Villiera winery).The price of the full day tour was very reasonable - better than other tour companies we checked out. Lunch was great too!If you want a great day in the Cape Town region, this is the one.

Best value wine tour available when in Cape Town. I had a fantastic time taking this tour yesterday. Bruce was not available, but his substitute was excellent. Not only did I learn about SA wine, but was also exposed to the culture and history of this great nation. Our guide was well versed and passionate - a great combination. The wineries themselves were very interesting, but the experience went beyond this. One of the ladies in our group was celebrating a birthday and he arranged to have a cake brought out during our lunch (the food here was fantastic - more than I expected for the price we paid). In addition he let one of the wineries know and they gave her a birthday bottle as a free gift. I booked the trip through another group (wine desk), but would certainly book direct on my next trip. If you want to learn more about wine in an informal atmosphere at a very reasonable rate, then this is the way to do it.

Cape Town HIGHLIGHT. I am not one to normally write reviews but Bruce was sooooo awesome and made this tour a highlight of Cape Town, he deserves a stella review. BRUCE ROCKS! The wine was amaze balls (and I live in the swan valley wine region of Western Australia), the company were great, the lunch was fantastic. There is not a single complaint about the this tour.

But the cheese Maria, the cheese!!!. I really enjoyed this tour. In it (although you need to always confirm with them company) you get to taste olives, olive oil ( I promise you it's gooood) cheese, drink one (no one ever spits) and have a wonderful healthy, but very filling lunch in a beautiful setting. I cannot say enough about it. My guide knew quite a lot about the history of the area as well, which was not boring at all. between all the tidbits he was giving us and the scenery and the wine and the good company. Plus, if you did wonder, it is absolutely not a drunk ride. You generally do go with people who want the experience and are therefore not interested in blacking it all out.

Amazing day! Met some fantastic people. Such a fantastic day..... Great service, great food, great people, and of course great wine.A must do for all visitors in Cape Town, Bruce the guide did an amazing job!Thank you

Memorable, fantastic, great value!. This company was recommended to me by a couple I met on a safari tour, so I looked them up online and found them to be quickly responsive and very informative. I booked with them without any problems. They were right on time to pick me up (unlike one of the other local tour companies). The tour was a mix of young and middle-aged tourists of a wide variety of nationalities, some in couples, some solo travellers like myself and some pairs of friends. They give you a nice view of the Cape dutch architecture of Stellenbosch and then went to 4 different wineries over the course of the full-day tour, which also included lunch. I never felt rushed. The price was more competitive than the larger tour companies and it included more wineries as well as lunch. The lunch had quite a few options and was delicious and included another choice of wine with it. The wineries varied between small and large across Stellenbosch, Franshoek and Paarl, and even included a cheese tasting at one of them. And since I had spoken to the other couple about their tour, I realized that they change the wineries they go to between tours as well--you could probably go more than once and get 8 different winery experiences. The guide was very knowledgable and friendly. One of the tourists in the group unfortunately had her ATM card taken by a machine in a scam, and he spent a lot of his free time on the tour trying to help her correct the situation. For service and price, this was easily the best tour experience I had in South Africa. The only downside is that they don't have credit card services.

Memorable & Brilliant Day. My fiancee and I had such an amazing time exploring the wineries in Stellenbosch. Our guide was Erica and she was just amazing with her knowledge and passion about the wine and the background of the Estates. Stellenbosch holds so much beauty and he wines are just absolute amazing. We were drinking champagne before 11 - what more can you ask for a holiday!! Our lunch was absolutely DELICIOUS. Overall we had a amazing time, our guide Erica was amazing and I highly recommend this Tour to anyone who would like to experience a great wine tour :)

'What a brilliant day'. This is a must for any visitor to Cape Town. Fern our guide for the day was fabulous. Loads of information relating to the wine areas and vineyards that we were visiting. We were drinknig champagne before 11am in the morning - what more could you ask for on holiday. The tour itself was fantastic but what really topped it off was the guide Fern. We were quite a mixed group and she spent time getting to know everyone and their plans for their stay in South Africa. She gave us lots of hints and tips to enjoy the best parts of Cape Town and the surrounding areas - all of this on top of the wine tour.I would definately recommend this wine tour - Make sure you ask for Fern....she will ensure that you are not on 'just another stuffy tour'

Great tour. Great guide.. We really enjoyed our wine tour with Bruce. He was informative, but not pretentious about the wine, and went out of his way to show us everything, including a quick side trip for gourmet biltong. We had booked this trip after reading reviews about how well he handled the need for a gluten-free experience and the raves were born out. He was very careful, and made sure there were no issues. That made the tour so much more relaxing for us. Plus, his selection of South African music to drive by was impressive!

So much fun. Such a really nice trip to the wine areas. It's a beautiful place you must see when in Cape Town and this was a great tour. We tasted so many South African wines and the guide was really making sure we were all having a good time.

Awesome scenery and vineyards. One of our friends told us to visit the Stellanbosch wine areas near Capetown. We booked Bruce based on others' recommendations on Trip Advisor.  We had a full day exploring the wine areas outside of Cape town. We can't say enough about the scenery and the vineyards. We had three non drinkers with our group of 12 and Bruce bought  soda for them.  Some of the vineyards has nonalcoholic alternatives.  The four wineries we stopped at were all good and different enough to provide a good mix of environmental practices, history, settings, and taste. The only flaw for us was that we live so far away we could not purchase all we would have if we lived nearby. The included lunch stop was tasty and full of atmosphere. The van was comfortable and our guide was sincere and shared his knowledge and enthusiasm for wine and the area.

Bruce is a Legend. My wife & I did a full day wine tour to Stellenbosch with Bruce on New Year's Eve 2012, which also happened to be my birthday.From the moment he picked us up right on time in his mini-bus from our hotel, he made us feel at home with him & the other guests on the bus. He launched straight into stories about Cape Town, rugby & of course his love of the winelands. He loves playing the tunes straight away to get the mood going & loves telling jokes, all of which kicked the day of very well.We went to 4 vineyards all up (plus a brandy farm as I said I liked brandy), with each of them diverse & excellent. Bruce has an amazing knowledge of everything drinkable, but has the knack of explaining it very simply to punters like us so we know what we are drinking, how to enjoy it more, what foods to eat with etc. He does it all with great humour & stories from his own past & stories he has heard from other places. Once the wine started flowing, the full group of 16 started to get very merry & it was only 10.30am.Lunch was excellent & Bruce took it upon himself to spoil me by organising my own sticky date pudding complete with candles & an Irish coffee. He also bought me a couple of bottles of sparkling to enjoy that evening: all off his own account & not organised by my wife.The day was absolutely brilliant & Bruce is the best wine tour guide we have ever had. Great bloke who loves wines, good times & good rugby banter with an Aussie. It was sad to get off the bus at 5.30pm, as we met some great people on the bus & Bruce ensured the fun never stopped.All up this guy is THE man: don't bother going anywhere else, Bruce is on the mark & his prices are very reasonable also.See you next time we are in Stellenbosch Brucey.
Wine tour superior. Had a great tour with an amazing lunch! We stopped at 4 farms, and even had some cheese tastings at one of the farms. What a fantastic day, thanks again Bruce!! We will be back!!!

Highly recommended and great value for money!. I don't drink wine, and therefore went on this tour because of my wife. Even so, I had a great time. Once I introduced myself to Bruce as being 'the guy who doesn't drink', he made sure I was always catered for with a juice, coke or water. He also took me to the cheese tasting while the rest of the group was with the wines and we had a really nice conversation (the cheeses from Fairview were excellent, btw). Bruce definitely knows a lot about wines but he also loves them and it shows. During the day we went to 4 vineyards and the wife was very happy with the quality of the wines. Lunch was great and the fact that it is included in the price of the tour is a real bargain. If you want to go on a wine tour in Cape Town, this should be your choice.

A great day with Bruce's stories. We had a great day with Bruce on the wine tour. He's a fantastic guide who knows a lot - not only about wine...The wine farms that we visited offered good wine, fine cheese, sweet chocolate, and a beautiful scenery. The whole trip is worth every single cent. We had a blast!Thanks Bruce!

I would HIGHLY recommend this tour.. I have recently returned from a study abroad program called Semester at Sea where we traveled to 14 different countries in 4 months and I have to say that this day on the wine tour in Cape Town was the best day of my entire trip. Every aspect of the trip was flawless, from the vineyards, to the lunch, to the wine itself, and of course, to our wonderful tour guide, Bruce! I would highly recommend this company. The tour was professional, well organized, a great value, and fun! We had a blast with Bruce and he really tailors the tour based on the desires of the group. You should not leave South Africa without doing an African Story Wine Tour.
BEST TIME IN CAPE TOWN. This is the best wine tour u ever want to be on..Guide Bruce is five star all the way..the tour of all selected winery was great..luch was excelent ....

Great Day of Wine Tasting. Had an amazing day out with Bruce (the owner) the other day. We visited four wineries, plus an extra stop for a delicious lunch. Bruce is quite the character, and is very knowledgeable about wine (and many other things--ask him about his very eclectic life).

Best tour, great value...Bruce is awesome. My cousin and I went on a wine tour with Bruce. Bruce is the owner and operator and he takes great pride in his business. He had great music on the bus (can someone say Chumbawumba after too much wine)...most of all he anticipated our needs. He had cups on the bus for wine, took us to a strawberry farm (it was delicious) and even added another stop for Brandy. Most of all, we felt safe, and felt Bruce was very genuine. This tour went so well that Bruce even came to dinner with us after recommending Arnolds (that's another review). He did not try to gouge us by recommending the most expensive restaurant in CT. He also managed to get us a few bottles of wine for free at the restaurant. I wholeheartedly recommend African Story Wine tours.

Best tour, unbelievable value!. For less than 600 Rand they did a fantastic all day tour of wineries in Western Cape: we did the wine route covering 3 regions (starting at Paar, then Franschoek and ending with Stellebosch). We visited 4 or 5 wineries, sampled over 30 wines, and our guide even made a detour so that we stopped to sample brandy and chocolate. Beyond enjoying the sampling, the tour was also very educational as we got excellent tours and lessons watching how the wine is made. The service was excellent as well... Bruce picked me up at the hostel and even after we had driven to other locations he turned back as I had forgotten my wallet. I did this as a solo traveler and thought it was excellent! If it's always sunny when you are in Cape, I'm sure it will be beautiful I decided to do the tour on a rainy day and it was perfect nonetheless!

just right!. This is a real Goldilocks experience: neither impersonal nor overbearing, but very friendly; neither regimented nor chaotic, but very well organized; neither ignorant nor arrogant, but with just the right amount of information for the interested amateur. Bruce (and, presumably, his team) have got the balance just right!I had a 'free' day in Cape Town by myself in the middle of a work trip, and after looking at tripadvisor reviews decided to book a day trip to the winelands with African Story. The winelands are beautiful, the wine farms scenic, and the tastings varied and interesting. And this was a really great way to see it in a day. The rest of the tour group (we were 13 in total) were nice as well, and it was good to be able to chat in a friendly way without feeling too pressured.Highly recommended!

A job well done. Bruce Story, the owner, did a bang-up job of taking us through a one-day tour of four wineries outside of Cape Town. As you might think, a full day of tasting the stunning range of pinto grigio, pinotage, merlot, shiraz, chenin blanc, desert wines and bubbly turned our group of ten into a jovial troop. Bruce showed his passion of wine, South Africa, and the art of pleasing people throughout the day. I don't want to spoil your fun by giving away the day's events, but the tour is well worth it.

Best day out EVER!. I literally had the time of my life. The group is a decent size and Bruce is a lovely friendly guy. There was a laugh a minute and there's something for everybody.I usually only drink white wine, but after trying heaps of different wines on the tour, I have been converted to a red wine drinker! It was great to try so may different wines without having to buy an expensive full bottle. The day got even better when Bruce took us to a winery that offer a selection cheeses to try with your wine.All of the staff are very friendly and the lunch which is included is out of this world! I would DEFINITELY reccommend this tour to anyone, even non wine drinkers as I think it will convert you ;)

An awesome day. We learned more about wine & wine tasting in one day than over years of merely drinking it! Bruce is a great guide and amazingly knowledgeable about all things wine-related. We visited several wineries, one of which also made incredible cheeses, and one where we also tried some fantastic brandy. Bruce was more than accommodating for people who wanted their morning coffee, vegetarian lunch, or afternoon pie. All in all, had a wonderful day -- thanks Bruce! :)

A fantastic tour into Cape town wine region ! A fantastic guide!. A fantastic tour into the wine region of Paarl, Franschoek and Stellenbosch. Bruce is an excellent guide, giving you detailed and interesting explanations about wine making and wine tasting. He takes you to four vineyards, all very different, from community based to eco friendly or luxurious multi-millionaire owned ones, all with their very interesting stories. You get to taste fabulous reds, whites, bubbles and even brandy, but also various cheeses, olive oils... Plus lunch is excellent, you can choose from several dishes (also suitable for vegetarians), giving you a good insight of the diverse South African cuisine. But what realy makes this tour an unforgettable memory is Bruce who is really passionate about what he is doing, really proud of South African history and culture, never rushing you, always with a smile, a nice story and plenty of jokes. He succeeds in creating a relaxed and joyful ambiance in the group, making people feel so comfortable! We loved this tour and highly recommend it as a must do in Capetown!

Great Winelands Tour. Did a one-day Winelands Tour with Miranda recently and had a fantastic time! Miranda was an energetic and enthusiastic host, who even made last minute changes to our itinerary to suit the group. Tour was informative, but fun and relaxed. Attracts a lot of small groups and solo travelers from all over, which also adds to the experience. Winelands Tour includes a great lunch, transport and many tastings - a great value for your money!

Amazing. Went on this trip with a few friends last Saturday, what a day! All travel and tastings included plus a great lunch at one of the vineyards. Bruce was friendly chap and just into enjoying great wine. Recomend to everyone!

The perfect winelands tour. If you are looking for an unpretentious relaxed wine tour that enables you to sample the capes wines without having to purchase the whole bottle to find out if you like it or not this is definitely the trip for you.Even before we booked this wine tour we knew we had found a tour company who were genuine jewels in a rare crown!During the initial enquiry and booking Bruce made us feel like nothing was to much trouble even when my phone was switched off he found a way to contact us with the pick up times and details.With a family of four ( Uni student and a much younger teenager) we did not hold out much hope that a wine tour would appeal to all of us. However, us adults, although not huge wine lovers, felt we could not come to SA without sampling the regions delights.As soon as we met our guide Ferne, we knew we were all going to have a fabulous day, within minutes of her warm enthusiastic welcome she made us realise that you do not have to be an expert to taste wine and even if you do not manage taste something you like,  you would have still had a lovely day out viewing the beautiful wineland scenery.We visited four very different estates during the day. From the first estate our youngest at 13 is now an aspiring MCC expert and has fallen in love with Merlot, the estate dog not the wine! The second estate had a more modern boutique feeling with a large welcoming open fire. where we purchase some very fine olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Our third estate was where we stopped for a wonderful relaxing lunch and in my opinion tasted and then brought the most exquisite sparking red wine. The food and service was superb and according to our eldest it was a steak well worth waiting for. Our youngest had her own private tour of the estates 'Narnia' with our guide while we enjoyed tasting even more of the sparking red and some of their experimental wines. Our last estate gave us the opportunity to try a variety cheeses along with our wines and for me a badly needed coffee! Also thanks  to our guides excellent choice of 'road tunes'. I am now a firm Goldfish fan with my own CD and t shirt!!From our last minute booking to the help of booking a trip to see the penguins with another tour company, African Tours gave the whole family a day to remember with so much more than the first class service they deliver.

I had the time of my life :). I have booked wine tour's with African Story Wine Tours numerous times now and still it is my favourite day out in the Western Cape. My most recent wine tour was with my parents, my brother, his wife and my partner and it was an absolutely stunning day! Our guide Bruce was both knowledgable and friendly and did everything in his power to ensure everyone on tour experienced the best. The wines we tasted were gorgeous and the food was a much needed (after all that wine) gourmet feast! The scenery along the route is beautiful and the tour really has something to offer everyone. You don't need to be a wine connoisseur to enjoy this tour. It really does have something to offer everyone. Wine, gourmet food and good company.... what more could you need!! Book this tour and you won't be disappointed. This tour is a hobbie of mine which I highly recommend to anyone!

A day out touring the wine-lands of Stellenbosch. The day started with a group of us being collected by the remarkable 'Fern' from African Story Wine Tours. What a wonderful host Fern was through-out the whole day, her whit and enthusiasm made the whole day a memorable experience. The whole day was informative, fun and above all, with sufficient wine to "taste" to ensure we were all merry and happy. The lunch was superb. The group I was with were all very pleased with the whole experience. I would take such a trip again. Well done African Wine Tours.

great way to tour the winelands. Lucked out with a small group (six vs >10 for some other operators we stumbled across during our trek). James was great in providing all kinds of information about the winelands, wines themselves and regional history. Great lunch out on the patio of one of the vineyards (though the steak is v tender, I'd suggest taking the fish/lighter option so you don't clonk out immediately post lunch). Of the four vineyards we visited, especially enjoyed Villeria, Tokara + Fairview.

Incredible day. African Story Wine Tour in Cape Town was without doubt one our best days in South Africa. Our guide, Miranda, was amazing, the four wineries were brilliant and felt like we learnt loads about wine, while totally enjoying ourselves and trying dozens of new flavours. Also learnt how to drink brandy without it burning your mouth :) I didn't know anything about wine before going on the tour (you don't have to) and if you do have some knowledge this day tour will enhance it. If you're looking for a fun, unforgettable and brilliant day out in Cape Town - this is it! A wine tour wasn't part of our original 'list of things to do in Cape Town' but this was so worth doing and was worth every precious rand. Don't miss out!

So. Much. Fun.. Absolutely brilliant day tour form Cape Town to the Winelands! Just the right amount of info to drink ratio. The area is amazing, the wine is plentiful and really good and I also really enjoyed the cheese tasting and the delicious lunch.Highly recommend!

Excellent for a reason!!!. This tour was absolutely amazing!!!I contacted the owner Bruce the day before our tour and in no time he got back to us and arranged pickup from Camps Bay and booking details. He also confirmed that this wasn't a "smelling and spitting" tour but more of a "drink and drink" some more tour :-)The next day (my Birthday) Bruce arrived on time with a birthday badge in hand and we collected fellow tourers on the way with him doing the introductions so everybody got on well right from the start. At Cape Town we met our excellence guide James before spending our time at 4 great vineyards tasting a lot of wine and great cheese at the end. Included was the best lunch and pick the steak if u like meat, u won't be disappointed!!! James was really casual allowing you to learn as little or as much as you want and giving the local grown knowledge of the areas we visited. This tour is cheeper than its competition and is exactly the trip to go on during you holiday!!! Thank you Bruce and James for the best of memorys on my Birthday.
Fabulous Day. Visits to four wonderful wineries, lunch at a lovely restaurant, lots of learning about wine and the wine making process. Ferne was grand. Highly recommend this door to door tour!

Best wine tour in Cape Town!. I first went on the African Story Wine tour in January 2011 and had an amazing time. Four different wineries, cheese tasting and an amazing lunch are all included for less than other wine tours in the area! They pick you up and drop you off right at the door of wherever you are staying, have good music on the ride, and great explanations along the way. A great deal!
