Since then I have sent all of my friends and family who have come to visit me in CT on this tour and every single one of them RAVE about it as well. I also went back for a second time in Dec 2011 and it was as fun as the first time! Among myself, my friends, and family we have had a few different guides and everyone is great. Definitely not to be missed while in Cape Town!

This is the wine tour to get on!. So after reading a mind boggling amount of time reading up on review's of wine tours and the difference between prices and such, I decided to give this one a try, and let me tell you. I enjoyed every minute of it. They pick you up at the plce you are staying in cape town. The guide actually knows what she was talking about and had a great sence of humour at the same time. The wine estates we visited were really good ones and everything was well taken care off. Oh and the lunch was very good at a very nice restaurant in the wine region. Don't let the reasonable price scare you off, this company charges less for the same tours other company's offer.

Excellent - great value for money and lots of fun!. Really great! The tour guide we had - Fern was excellent, really knew her wines and the production process. Lunch was top restaurant standard - some of the best steak i've ever tasted and the range of vineyards could not be topped!! Would highly recommend!

Amazing. Miranda made this day out awesome she was full of local knowledge and had a wicked sense of humour . The winerys visited were beautiful and the wines sampled just as stunning. Excellent value no pressured sales as you sometimes find on theses tours. Lunch was to die for in a lovely setting the best meal we had all the time we were in south Africa. Thank you Miranda and the 7 swedes for making my birthday 1 to remember

Not for stuffy wine drinkers!!!. We had a fantastic fun filled day on our wine tour. We visited four vineyards and tasted some fantastic wine, champagne(sorry sparkling wine) and cheese. A lovely steak was also included for lunch. Ferne was fantastic as our guide, she was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend this tour as the best value for money in Cape Town.

Fantastic Value for Money. We've done quite a few wine trips in Cape Town but this one is by far the best. We went to quite a few wine farms, tried sparking wine and had a well cooked lunch - all in the price. Fairview has got to be one of the best Wine farms around but the other farms were equally as good. This full day trip is by far the best value and we booked it via the Wine Desk.

Great guide, great company, great tour and good wine.. We had a great day last week on the wine tour. Our guide Marinda was great fun and knowledgable making for a great day out. The tour was in a minibus with a good mix of 11 people from UK, Belgium, USA & Greece and of course our guide. We visited 4 vineyards with approx 1 hour drive to the first one, then approx 15 mins drive between each off the stops and then an hour back to Cape Town. We'd all had such a great time together we decided to go for a drink together in the evening and our guide was more than happy to drop us off at a different location from the morning pick up points.I would certainly recommend an African Story wine tour to any friends visiting Cape Town.

Brilliant. The route was beautiful, the choice of wines and vineyards was very good, the lunch was delicious, and the pace of the tour was just right. Ferne was an excellent guide - warm, friendly, and a lot of fun. It was certainly one of the highlights of our trip to South Africa.

Best Boxing Day of My Life. I think generally you should call ahead for these things as booking fills up, but we generally travel on a whim. I phoned Bruce on his mobile around 630am the day we wanted to get on the tour. He pretty much told me there was no way but I managed to convince him we could get dropped off at the first stop-Fairview Winery in Paarl. It was unbelievable we had a great crew of South Africans and an older couple from Australia. Bruce told stories all day about apartheid, his days as a clown and general knowledge of South African culture. At the second stop Solms Delta, where we had lunch, the head sommelier Leon, a Xhosan dude told cool stories about the history associated with the name of each wine. Bruce even took a small detour at the end of the day to drop us at the Drostdy in Stellenbosch. I was a bit tanked by the the end of the day but it was a fantastic tour and likely the best of 20 days in SA. Even better than the golf or the lions. First Rate.

Great tour guide, Great wine and Great Scenery. My friend booked us on this day tour when we were recently on holiday in Capetown. What a wonderful experience. We had a fun group of 11 people from various countries. This number of people was just perfect and we made lots of good connections. The tour guide Bruce was simply fantastic! He was extremely entertaining yet still informative. The wine farms were wonderful and the wines and cheeses. The wine farms were carefully selected, each providing something different - from interesting histories, to winefarm specific wine types. The sceneries are also just breath-taking. It was definitely money well-spent!

Best wine tour in Cape Town!. We really enjoyed this tour and Bruce was a fantastic tour guide, giving us so much information on the way about wine and cape town generally. He has so many different hints and interesting facts and we really enjoyed chatting with the other people in our small group. The wine farms were well chosen and the lunch was fantastic. Will be recommending!

Best tour ever!. My friend and I recently traveled to South Africa and definitely wanted to take a tour of the winery region. So many of the tours were large groups and/or only a half day, which I didn't think would be long enough to cover such a large area. I decided on African Story Tours and truly couldn't have had a better experience. Marinda, the guide, was so much fun! We saw so much, sampled a huge amount of wine, and the included lunch was fabulous. Our group was about 8 people and they added a lot to the experience, as well. I couldn't more highly recommend this tour for a really fun experience!

Excellent Service!!!. What a brilliant choice for our full day tour of the best winelands of the Cape! Picked up on schedule by Miranda, our guide, who was not only professional , knowledgeable and informative but also has great energy making you feel welcomed from the very beginning.The tour was well structured with ample time to enjoy at each of the excellent vineyards selected by the Company without feeling rushed. Lunch was delicious and gratefully served. A cheese and wine tasting concluded our day. African Story guarantees and delivers an unforgetable experience.
Wine Tour. Tour was on time, well organised and the wines were excellent. Our tour guide/driver was very professional and the safe and I would highly recommend this tour and company

Great experience. I did the 8-day Garden Route + Wow Tour with Hotspots2C in August. Our tour guides (Isaac and Maudi) were really great, especially Maudi always made us laugh and told us lots of interesting stories about the country - even though we were probably not the "easiest" group, being just girls and 13 (!) of them. The landscape was great and there were lots of really great activities (zip-lining, hiking in Tsitsikamma NP, canoeing, whale watching and my personal highlights, the sunrise game drive in Addo NP and surfing in Jeffreys Bay!). Even if it was somtimes a bit rushed, our guides managed to make basically every activity possible. Most of the backpackers we stayed in were amazing, too! The only downside of the tour for me was the group of travellers - they were nice, but on my tour we were only girls, most of them German and except for one all of them really young (I know it's always a bit of luck and due to advertising and stuff there are always many young travellers that come from different volunteering projects, but as I did another tour right after this one, I just really felt the difference). Nonetheless I would definitely recommend the tour and Hotspots2C if you don't mind this.

Cape tours. Two great tours of the east and west coasts of Cape town for people who don't want to drive.In addition to all the must see places the guest houses selected were outstanding.The 4 different guides we had were not only knowledgeable of the sites but were always kind ,helpful and considerate.Special mention of Issac who called us his VIP guests.Will recommend Hotspots to any age group.
Garden Route and Addo. Great experience with the best tourguide ever. (isaak)We had an excellent description of everything, perfect accomodation etc.
Perfect Journey. More than I expected. Total fun on 5-days-Addo tour with guide Isaac. Top sea views in excellent 4-star-hotels. Highlight: Elephant meetings.

Great Cape Point Tour. We booked the Cape point tour which was excellent. It was just the two of us on the day we went as it was out of season but we had a great guide who was very knowledgable. A good Itinerary which was well spaced through the day and as we went in the car rather than van we could stop in places the large buses couldn't. This also helped when getting into the Cape point park as well as our guide smartly beat the queues. The guide was flexible to what we wanted as well so we stayed a little longer at the penguins for example and he was generally helpful with both the tour and letting us know more about Cape Town generally and advising of things to do, places to eat etc. Having researched which company to go on this tour with extensively I was very happy and impressed so would highly recommend.

Trip with hotspots2c. I enjoyed my trip in Cape Town with hotspots2c I took two trips the first : 2 days wild life safari with Uriel best tour guid and 1 day trip Cape peninsula with jeje the most I like about them is they provide pickup and drop to ur hotel wherever is ur hotel also their tour guides are kind and explains very well to all your questions. I will most definitely take my next Addo trip again with them.
Went on 3 tours. All three were great, excellent guides, fun tours, met great people who we took other tours with, it was an experience of a lifetime.

Quiet tour guide. Our guide was Andrew Jackson. He is always punctual and a very friendly person with excellent driving skills. We felt very safe along the journey with him. However he seemed to be relatively quiet as compared to the reviews we saw here and sometime we wish he'd have more to say about the background/history of South Africa.
Cool!. Your Tour was really good and enjoyable! Our Tour Guide Mordi was very funny and always in a good mood :)

Best tour ever. Together with our hilarious tour guide and a very nice geoup of people from all over the world we had such a great time that we would do it all over again :) the choice of activities was perfect and you could enjoy South Africa

2 days wildlife + safari. Me and my friends where picked up to The trip and first day me went to a safari. We spend The Night in beautiful Buffelsdrift. Next day w had amazing elephant Bush walk. And then we Visit ostrich farm and Cango Wildlife ranch, where we had a chance to see and Touch cheetah. Amazing trip with excellent, fun and nice guide Damon.

Garden Route Tour. This tour was an easy way to see part of the Garden Route and to do some of the main highlights along the way. We did spend more time in the car than I was anticipating so come prepared for 4-7 hours in the car a day. As a solo traveler I was disappointed that there was little effort made to connect the group members. Our group was rather quiet and it would have been nice if the guide tried to encourage us to get to know each other more or to switch up our seating in the van like I have seen other guides do throughout my time in South Africa. Overall, I am glad I did the tour I just wish I had a better idea of what to expect before I went.

Great 3 day tour. I had a fantastic time with Zaahid. The tour was well organized, there were lots of activities packed in a short time without feeling like it was rushed. He was a brilliant tour guide, full of positive energy, fun to hang out with and talk to. I recommend this tour and Zaahid wholeheartedly*

Too short. First off, shoutout to Simone because she was an incredible guide. Hands down, perfect. The tour itself was awesome and of course the best part was the elephants. For me though, the trip was far too short (2 days). This is of course my own fault in lack of availability. However, as my friends and I were only able to get two days off of work, it would have been nice to see at least one other Garden Route option including elephants from which to choose from.

Recommended Garden Route tour!. I went on an A-M-A-Z-I-N-G Garden Route tour with our guide Mordy. The itinerary itself was fabulous with one incredible experience topping another...bungy jumping, entering the cheetah's enclosure, walking with elephants, then shark cage diving!  Also impressive, Mordy had an eye for detail: He was very organised so we never had to rush, he commanded us when we were entering the caves to not wear jumpers as it is boiling underground (very good choice) and he even went to the effort of making sure the windows were spotless so we could have a great view of the landscape driving. I feel incredibly humble to have these memories and thank my tour guide for an entertaining trip and especially for encouraging us all to get involved in the activities: most memorable, convincing us to bungy jump and trying a home-cooked meal at the backpackers called potjie!!!- SO GOOD.

Superb trip of the Garden Route. Joined a private tour of the Garden Route; excellent setup, good balance between activities and time off. Good choice of places to visit, and excellent choices of places to stay! Good guide and safe driver, and a comfortable car! Can highly recommend these guys!

We had the absolute best time!. My husband and I booked onto the 3 day Garden Route + Safari tour, and it was an absolutely awesome trip! Our guide Zaahid was knowledgable, very friendly and loads of fun. Thanks so much for making our trip amazing Zaahid!The trip itself does include a lot of driving, but it's through beautiful landscapes with plenty of photo opportunities. We loved every activity included on the tour, with the elephant walk and game drive being a highlight for us both. I even conquered my fear and did the Bloukrans Bridge bungee!My only feedback (besides all the positive stuff) would be to include on the website that the Cango Caves tour option is the "Adventurous" one which does include some very small spaces. Being extremely claustrophobic, I would have preferred to do the Classic tour. No matter though, as I was able to just stop when I couldn't go any further. Thanks Hotspots2c and Zaahid! ☺️

Great tour company. I booked the 3-day Garden Route tour via Viator with this company. Our tour guide Isaac was amazing... super friendly, knowledgeable, and a very safe driver. We visited the sites along the Garden Route that are popular with many of the tour companies, and I was able to do a very last minute booking with this company. Even though it rained most of the weekend, it was still a very enjoyable one.If you do this tour, keep in mind that you will be doing a lot of driving. I would love to see one or two more activities on the itinerary to break the drive up, but I would still recommend it to anyone short on time or who wants a long weekend outside of Cape Town.

Cape Point Experience. I was travelling solo so security and convenience were my top priorities! I am so thankful that I booked my trip to Cape Point in this company. Aside from the convenience of being picked right at the doorstep of my hotel, the tour guide was awesome! He was very pleasant, very courteous, and very sensitive to the clients' needs. I would have loved to book more trips had I not been scheduled to fly out the next day. I hope you get ANDREW as your tour guide when you book here! Fantastic Cape Town experience, I must say! Thank you very much, Andrew and Hotspots2c Travel and Tours!Professor Shirley N. DitaManila, the Philippines

3-day penguins, whales and Southern tip. It was a great opportunity to know other places around Cape Town with a very clear explanation of the guide. Wonderful places, wonderful days, so many emotions!

Had the best time. When we took this tour it was only me and my wife who were in it. Turns out eventhough if only one person took the tour they will still go, it became somewhat a private tour which was perfect for us. Our guide Gerhard was very helpful and knowlegeable of the vast history of South Africa. The route that we took was beautiful and the places we stayed for the night was perfect. We took the 4 days garden route + caves adventures.. at the end we didn't just have a great time but we got a friend as well.. thx Gerhard and Hotspots2c

Excellent!. I booked the 8 day tour which was a great intro to this part of South Africa. Note that it's actually a seperate 3 day and 5 tour back to back. Ulrich, my tour guide, was an absolute star! I'd recommend hotspots wholeheartedly.

Garden Route (5 days) Experience of a life time. I would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to visit South Africa and the garden route. It was a fabulous five day tour of the garden route, a tour that had no bad features whatsoever. Suzanne and I loved the range of activities we did every day, from exploring Addo National Park, to ziplining through waterfalls, to cave crawling, to hiking alongside fantastic viewpoints, this tour was one of the best holidays I have ever been on. Our tour guide, Isaac, was incredible. Incredibly knowledgeable, incredibly caring and thoughtful for everyone on the tour, and helped make the trip the unbelievable experience it was. If you ever want to see the Garden Route, Cape Town and do a wide range of activities in South Africa, I would throughly recommend this tour. You will have the opportunity to try new foods, go wine tasting, play with varying South African Animals from cheetahs to elephants to ostriches, and overall have a fascinating and engaging exploration of life in South Africa. If you want to tour South Africa, whether you are a couple or a group of friends or of any age, this is the tour for you to do.

If you are contemplating this tour- DO IT!!! Garden Route & Winelands (7 days). First, let me just say this is the best trip I've ever done, and I have traveled quite a bit. Isaac is the most charismatic, wonderful tour guide, and we had the pleasure of also traveling with Maudi, who was driving a separate group. They are so knowledgeable, organized, thorough, and fun. These two are so genuine and made everything amazing. In addition, my husband and I decided to backpack for our honeymoon, and we both agree it was the best thing we could have done. Isaac made sure that he pampered us where he could, which was so unnecessary, but so so appreciated. He was professional but also genuinely cared about each of us. The vans were new and always clean, with a/c and heat. Our tour had about 14 people in it, but they split it up into two vans so that there was plenty of room and personalization. I didn't feel like I was on a tour group, but instead with a group of travelers from around the world and different age groups, who soon became fast friends. I haven't done a formal multi day tour before, so I wasn't sure about it when booking, but I can't say enough about the quality of the vendors and events. My past experience with day tours was often to places where the tours had a relationship with the vendor, no matter how cheap the quality, and I felt forced to buy/ take part in what they were selling. This was NOTHING like that. Isaac and Maudi clearly have good relationships with each accommodation and experience because the vendors are professional and these two guides are fantastic people. Isaac still always had our opinions and best interests in mind, and even went into a restaurant he loved and frequently visits, and calmly explained to a waiter when he thought the waiter had screwed up and over charged us at one point. Our only regret is that we didn't see there was an 8 day tour that also did Cape of Good Hope, but Isaac helped hook us up with an additional tour to get there, even though it was a competitor's, because they could fit into our schedule and budget before we flew out. He went above and beyond for us, all the time.Every day we were in awe- it just kept getting better.We also chose to stay in a private room in the hostels, and I honestly think that while the 4 stars looked nice when we dropped off others on our tours, we had the best location for every place, often right on the beach (with the exception of Stellenbosch, I'd maybe try to upgrade on that location if they would let you for location's sake)... If you are ever going to contemplate shark diving, bungee jumping, walking with elephants, climbing through crevices in a cave... I can go on... I hadn't before, but this trip (kindly) pushed me to my limits, and we couldn't be happier we did it all. We were heartbroken when it ended. It is so hard to pick out a favorite part, and looking back, I can't believe how much we accomplished in 7 days! It went by so quickly because we were always doing something. I will be highly recommending this tour, and especially with Isaac and Maudi, to everyone I know interested in South Africa. I can't remember the last time I laughed and smiled so much! We talked it over, and there isn't anything we would change. We started out with amazing tour guides and ended with friends. Thank you! - 1 and a Half Hours from ChicagoPS: If you end up touring with Isaac, make sure you have a lot of Madonna on your Itunes. He loves Madonna. :)

Garden Route + Winelands. Tour was amazing, and our guide Isaac was completely awesome! Haven't had this much fun in a long time. For sure going to plan another trip with hotspots. And hopefully get Isaac again. Much love! -Texas

Garden Route. Wonderful tour with a group of great students as we finished our summer abroad. This tour took us to many amazing places and took care of everything in a fantastic manner - things were typically on a good schedule, we had nice places to stay each night, breakfast and dinner each day, a WONDERFUL bus driver (Kevin & Lizzie rock!!!), etc etc. I couldn't be happier with it!!

Most Excellent Tour!. Our guide was awesome! He made the trip even more spectacular! This was a great way to have a great time while learning about the people and culture of South Africa! What a great experience! Even better than we anticipated!!!
Kevin vester. Really great time, our tour guide Kevin was a great guide. We all learned a lot about South Africa from him and he made sure we had time to see everything

1 day Cape Peninsula Tour. Our tour guide Andrew was great! He was very helpful and attentive, making this 1 day tour awesome. This was our second time with Hotspots and we will continue to recommend it to others.

Garden route with Addo Elephant Sanctuary. Great value tour. I was fortunate to have Gerherd as my guide with 3 trainees joining us. They were all experienced guides. Gerherd has extensive knowledge on S. Africa, they were good fun, and an easy rapport quickly developed with the group. Nothing was too much trouble for them and the tour was well paced. I cannot recommend Hot Spots highly enough as a tour company and would definitely travel with them again.

Western Cape Wow. Great guide, had an answer to all our questions. Very helpful and caring when I was unexpectedly unwell! Kept the tour flexible to our needs and ensured we saw all the highlights and weren't to rushed! Incredible weekend trip- great to see outside of Cape Town. Great way to get to Shark Cage dive too, great to made a whole trip of it instead of just a long drive there and back! Thanks :)
Isaac was amazing!. Our tour guide Isaac was amazing, friendly, and knowledgeable! Our tour was surprisingly intimate and jam packed with sights.

Garden Route Drive (South Africa). Both of the hotels were quite nice. In addition, the staff at hotels and drivers were very friendly. I had an excellent time canoeing and going through the caves. I might advise to consider doing something other than the hot springs. It was nice, but it was more so a pool with the water from a spring pumped in. Either way, the trip overall was fantastic.
Best Tour ever!. The elephant walk was amazing! And our tour guide was fantastic! Thank you so much for this experience!

Great tour. Enjoyed 2-Day Western Cape Safari from Cape Town: Big Five Game Drive and Cango Wildlife Ranch with the team. Great customer service, nice hotels, good food, really enjoyed the two game reserves and zoo (got my 'big 5' photos for the bucket list). Interesting and fun way to spend two days and see more of South Africa than Cape Town. Recommend!
REALLY GOOD. The safari and the elephant walk were really good. And the hostel was a nice place. But the ostrich farm was a little boring. The Zoo was okay.

Isaac is my hero!. I am 18 years old and I was travelling on my own and decided to choose hotspots to take me on some of my journey around the garden route. My guides were Isaac and Maudi, and they are some of the most amazing people I have ever met. They really do care about everyone who they guide the tours for - extra special care and attention to detail is why I enjoyed the whole tour so much. I wish I had spent more time with Maudi, because you could see how much he loved making people happy and it really stuck out for me when he got champagne and cake and gave another person on my tour the most southern birthday party in Africa! I spent more time with Isaac which I am very grateful for. Isaac does it all without asking for thanks or credit which is why I almost didn't notice how much extra care he was putting in. But I'm glad I did notice because I realised how inspirational he is and he has given me a boost of confidence which I can't thank him enough for. He made me feel the most comfortable and myself that I have ever felt. Shame he couldn't beat me at pool though! But I'll be back soon, so maybe he can give it another go then. Hotspots2C are a great company and I would definitely do another tour with them if I am back in South Africa. What sets Hotspots apart from other tour companies is they really are giving the best possible service they can, whilst juggling time schedules around and organising everything for you so you can sit back and relax knowing everything is sorted for you. Sit back or jump off the worlds tallest bungee bridge - I'll take the second every day! They do all their hard work with warm and friendly smiles on there faces - I miss you guys! Keep up the good work! Peace out. Jimmy

Great Garden Route Experience. Joined this tour at the last minute based on solid reviews here, a very transparent website with clear pricing, and quick follow up on the part of Belinda who handles bookings. I was traveling solo, female, early 40's. The tour included a mix of younger and older travelers with most of the older opting the 3* guesthouses. Good choice for me since the hostels were definitely more of a party scene. Our guide Ulrich was an absolute pleasure to travel with, very easygoing, happy to answer lots of questions, a great driver, and really well liked by every place we stopped. They greeted him like a dear friend at every stop, including the elephants! The 4-day, 3-night option was perfect for my schedule but 5 days would have made more sense considering the amount of driving. Choose that if you have the time, but the shorter one was also really great. Nothing but good things to say about HotSpots2c. I'm really happy that I took the leap in booking with them!

Andrea's garden route. This was seriously the best weekend of my life. Big G, the driver, was amazing and definitely deserves recognition. He was super friendly and helpful. The bus was comfortable and the hostels nice to stay in. The adventures planned were perfect for your bucket list and the adrenaline seeker in me. I loved every moment of it and am very pleased I chose hotspots2c.

Awesome Garden Route Trip. The garden route trip is very nice, a lot of driving but the route is worth it. The activities included were great with the hike to the suspension bridge in Wilderness Park and canoeing. The game drive in Addo Park was excellent and our guide drove us to the watering hole where we saw over 50 elephants, spectacular site.

Always a Pleasure!. I did 2 trips with hotspots2c: the Cape Peninsula one-day trip and the 5 day Garden Route + Addo tour. I loved them both! The groups have a reasonable size and the guides are not only very friendly but are also walking encyclopedias. Learned a lot and had heapes of fun, even when the weather was not on our side. I will certainly join some more of their tours when I'm back in the country. =)

great experience. I took the one-day peninsular tour and went to Hout bay for seals, cape of hope national reserve and boulders beach for penguins. Views were gorgeous especially in the reserve! Isac is a great guide that he gave us a lot information. He is also very friendly and ready to help!

Winelands Tour - Cape Town. Our driver picked s up at the exact time specified. He spoke well,had excellent subject matter knowledge and was pleasant. He was able to excellently read his tour members and I fond us relating to and conversing on a number of topics. The venues we visited were amazing, especially the gardens at Babylonstoren, the views at Ernie Else and the wine and ice-cream pairing was superb. Overall, I can't really find fault with the tour, the company nor the guide. will definitely go again

Really great trip!. Thank you very much for a really amazing trip. The guides made it extra special with their attentiveness to detail and ensuring that everyone was enjoying themselves, Uli and Big G (thank you very much it was great meeting you). I really enjoyed everything that was on the schedule and how it was planned was excellent. Great sites, great food and great company! I would recommend Hotspots Travel and Tours any time.

Amazing Experience. I couldn't think of a better way to end my trip to Cape Town. I booked the 3-Day Western Cape Highlights Trip from Cape Town. The tour had a variety of options and sight seeing opportunities within a 3-day timeline, which was great. I enjoyed each day of the tour and everything we experienced. Our tour guide, Zaahid, was AMAZING!! He was very professional, knowledgable, and fun! He was very accommodating and flexible and wanted to make sure that each of us on the trip got as much out of the experience as possible. I truly appreciated having a guide like Zaahid who was able to make the experience that much better with his adventuresome and great personality, and who has a passion for being a tour guide and helping people have amazing experiences in beautiful South Africa. I will definitely make sure to book at least one or more tours with HotSpots when I return to South Africa next year as long as I can have Zaahid as my guide again :). Thank you for such a great and fun experience that I will never forget!

awsome experience. did enjoy every day, was very happy with our guide maudi, who organized so well and carefully everything and was beside so entertaining and friendly. only minus was the accomodation in j'bay...dirty and stinking although impressing situated on the wonderfull beach. big praise!
Garden Route . Very interessting and exciting trips, especially for young people. Our guide maudi was the best!You get lot for your money.

Solo trip to Cape Town. I travelled to Cape Town on my own but knew what I wanted to see. I booked a couple of trips (Cape Point and Boulders Beach as well as a 2 day safari and wildlife trip) with Hotspots2c and they were both great. Both tour guides were helpful and friendly, arrived on time and I enjoyed each trip thoroughly.

Good choice!. Me and my wife took the 8 day tour. When it says on the website they combine the 3 day and 5 day tour together, that's actually what it means. It's literally 2 different tours, 2 different drivers, and 2 groups of people. I would have preferred for that to be made more clear, as I was under the impression it was one 8 day tour. On the positive, responsive company, good prices, good destinations, good accommodation choices. Be prepared, there will be a lot of driving involved.

Exceeding High Expectations. I highly recommend the tour. Activities throughout the garden route tour create lifetime experiences. RSA is insanely beautiful. Maudi is the best nicest most likeable tour guide ever!!!

Best of South Africa. Hotspots2c is the best tour company operator. We have the best tour guide "Maudi is the Man!" He makes us feel comfortable, safe driver and with sense of humor. The itinerary is always on time and lots of activities. Make sure you bring your best camera to take the precious moments and of course your wallet to buy amazing give aways!

Excellent Garden Route Adventure tour!. Highly recommend tour! Ask for Gerhard or Big G as we affectionately called him!Took care of us for our 5 day your!Loads of fun for young and old ( we had ages 20- 55 in our group of 9 who just met on the morning of the trip but became fast friends)!Big G went out of his way to make this even more special with little kindhearted gestures ... Like a special Coctail for us on the beach and hot chocolate after an cold rainy early morning game drive!Never rushed us and was so informative!The tour itself had so much variety and fun things!The 4 star guest houses were all amazing... Especially the last night when we went glamping.. Wow! Claw foot bathtub over looking a watering hole with hippos!Thanks hotspots2c for a wonderful experience!

Outstanding overview of Garden Route. Absolutely great... Would highly recommend to all wanting to see as much of the Garden Route in only a few days. Our tour guide "Big G" made the entire group feel as if we were his guests, rather than tourists on holiday.

Best way to spend a day or two in the Cape. We selected 2 separate tours from this operator. The first day was the Cape Point tour followed by the Stellenbosch Wine tasting tour. Andrew was our guide both days. Very knowledgeable about the history of the area and entertaining as well. We seemed to be ahead of the crowds at each area he took us to see. Comfortable ride and excellent choices for lunch each day. If you don't have a lot of time in Cape Town but would like to see a lot of the area, take the tour. You will not be disappointed.

Garden Route + Addo National Park = 5 wonderful days. Perfect organization of a very enjoyable trip. A group of nice people and the skill of a knowledgeable and helpful guide, thanks Maudi ! The full program was rich of exciting experiences; before starting I was worry it would be too rushed for our old age (68) but we could keep pace without special difficulty. Excellent accommodation at every location, a special note to the guest house in Sedgefield.

Private Tour: Cape Point and Constantia Valley Wine Region from Cape Town. Our guide was professional and knowledgeable and I enjoyed having a private tour that allowed us to enjoy the sights and activities a little more at our own pace (with the cost not being much more than similar group tours). The sights were beautiful and there were stops for photo opportunities along the road. The wine tour and tasting was lovely although I would recommend giving the option to pay a little extra on the day for 'wine and chocolate tasting' as the package in the tour was wine only and we didn't realise there was a chocolate option until we got to the tasting room. Overall a great day out that I would recommend.

Garden Route + Addo. I joined the 5 days tour that covers ( Wilderness Canoe, Knysna Heads, Cango Caves, Cango Wild life Ranch, Tsitsikamma hike, Bloukrans bridge Bungy, Zipline, Ostrich farms and J Bay).We were 11 on the tour with age ranges from 19 to 35 and a couple in their 50s. The tour is balancing between activities and free time to do what you want.. we have a daily things to do from 8 am till 5 pm then you we were free after 5 to have our own time to do whatever we want.I would recommend this tour if you are a Solo traveller and have a tight time as it is very organized. If you are not on your own and can share a car i think it would be better.

Garden Route & Winelands - what a great tour!!. For five days Isaac guided the Garden Route and then the two day weekend was guided by Andrew. Two fabulous, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful guides!The combo seven day tour was fabulous, it gave a great overview of the amazing nature and scenery that South Africa has to offer. I got to enjoy activities in nature such as ziplining, canoeing, shark cage diving and visiting a game park. The wine tasting was a great way to finish off the week!

2 tours, both great. Having just done both the 'wine & whale' (2 day) & Cape Point (1 day) trips I have been very pleased with the efficient organisation, communication, punctuality & format of both tours. The particular highlight for me was the shark dive near Hermanus (@ extra cost, but a unforgettable experience). The guide, Andrew, made both trips enjoyable with his commentary & friendly and considerate manner.

Garden Route Trip. I had a wonderful experience I took two trips for 8 days total and both of my tour guys Andrew (rugby player) and I can't spell the others name but he was really funny and was always telling jokes. Both made the experience worth every penny and were so helpful and willing to go the extra mile for anything anyone needed. I highly suggest the Garden Route tour and definitely do the shark dive!
amazing. The tour was really great. We have seen a lot and the driver was really great .I would want to repeat it .

Satisfied. I went to 3 days garden route + safari and 1 day cape peninsula trips. In the 3 day trip, i we covered cango caves, elephant walk, canoing, bungee jump, myoli beach, big 5 game drive. Among these cango caves and bungee were good. The other stuffs i enjoyed on the trip are scenic routes and towns. Some good restaurants as well.Being from India, where i can easily walk with elephants, i didn't like elephant walk. I missed enjoying in the beach. Having done safari in Kruger National Park, didn't like the big 5 game drive. From big 5, was able to see only lion, elephant calf from distance and rhino. Lion is confined to small area. But the guide, Marco, for that game drive was very good. He added lot of character into all the animals we saw and lot other interesting information on animals.1 day Cape peninsula tour was good. Covered many places in one day. Duiker island cruise, Ostich Farm, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, chapman's peak, Boulder's beach.Guides cum Driver were nice and good. No complaints.

Top notch outfit. A very reliable and professional company who really has what it takes in the field. You get your money's worth and more! I would not hesitate to recommend Hotspots2c to my friends and family

Winelands tour. What an awesome trip ! Our guide was so friendly, fun and knowledgeable not just about the wines but about the history and culture of South Africa. Highly recommend using this company.

Excellent Experience. I did two tours with Hotspots2C, one three day WoW and one five day Garden Tour with two different guides (Isaac and Kevin). This is my first time in S. Africa and I am traveling by myself. It is a great way to see the country for the first time and covers a lot "cannot miss" or "must see" spots. From the get go the staff was very prompt and helpful in answering my questions and supporting me making payments. Both tour guides are very friendly and fun to be around with. My impression is that they are quite knowledgeable. Isaac was my tour guide for the three day tour and he also led the 5 day tour in parallel with mine. Issac helped to break the ice with such a wonderful sense of humor. On the 5 day tour I sat next to Kevin in the front and asked millions questions and he was always happy to answer my questions and have a conversation just about anything. For those who enjoy more outdoor activities Kevin is THE guide to have. The relationships that they try to establish with the travelers felt genuine and personal (vs just business). I personally felt like that I left the tours with two friends in Cape Town and would hope to see them again at some point. I am also happy with the accommodation options they provided to me. Normally I would have liked to do my own research and pick the place but given this is a tour structure and I was not able to. The owners at the B&B places (I picked 3 star option) are very friendly and accommodating. Their hospitality made my stay very enjoyable and pleasant. I have been on tours in other countries and what I particularly appreciate about them and these tours is that there were opportunities set up to help the fellow travelers to bond and to know each other. I had a great time interacting with fellow travelers from all over the world. The only reason that I did not give 5 star rating is that there is not much flexibility in picking and choosing the destination and activities. For those who have done safaris in national parks in Kenya and/or Tanzania you might be disappointed with what you might not get to see in Addo. With that said it is always luck of draw on what you get to see. I also understand that it is a standard tour. For those who wish to have a more tailored experience the agency also offers private tours. After the 8 day tour If I were to come back to S. Africa I would do a private and tailored tour.

Best Tour ever. Thanks to our gide Andrew, best man! It was a great journey , we saw a lot of wild animals, beautiful beaches, had a lot of adventures and fun, ate in good Restaurants and slept in cute guest houses with friendly owners... Thanks for all!!

The perfect choice!. We met Hotspots2c at Trip Advisor and we loved the experience. We got three days of tours, also outside the town and our guide Simone made our trip a very luck one. Ask for her if you want someone discreet, but also spontaneous, efficient and more important: always with a safe drive, even in long distances. We loved everything!

7 day wine and garden route. We went on the 7 day tour, which in reality is really a 2 day tour of vineyards and the 5 day garden route. We ended up having two guides, Izaac for the vineyards and Maudi for the garden route. Both were great and made sure we were properly settled in and happy with our accommodations.There is a good amount of time spent traveling on the road, but there's no other way to really see everything. Most activities were included and there was no real push for the ones that weren't. We were free to participate or not. The only downside of the trip is there is not much free time to explore the locations and most nights, we are just dropped off at the B&B for sleep and not much else. Overall, a great experience as we saw a lot of South Africa for very little, just wish that they offered a longer tour, so we could have a bit more free time to explore some of the wonderful locations.
Wine country your. Our tour guide was great , very helpful & knew his stuff Great lunch organised Overall wouldn't hesitate to recommend

Exploring the Garden Route. I'm closer to 60 than 50 and wanted an active trip to explore the garden route. The guide and the trip more than met my expectations and although I was the oldest on the trip by about 30 years had great fun with the other travellers. The upgraded accommodation was the best option for me and all guest houses were lovely. I'd recommend it to anyone wanting to travel alone.Sally

Cape Town Wine Tour. It was a great day out with a good variety of different wine estates. I liked the fact that it was private (just my family) and the guide was able to tailor the experience to our special requests. Wonderful scenery, wines and cheeses. Our guide was very friendly and flexible.

5 days trip to Garden Route. My 5 days trip to Garden Route was very excellent trip. Tour Guide was very excellent, knowledgeable & helpful person. Rooms provided as per my choice & expectation. Overall it's very excellent trip with Hotspot.

JUST AMAZING!. We traveled with hotspots2c and explored the garden road which was really amazing!Guides are very knowledgable and great people, so had a great time on the road with them!4* Guests houses where we stayed were very nice, just wish our trip was longer!Highly recommended Tour Operator in SA! A++
A great day of Cape Town peninsula tour. Even it was a raining, cold day, but we had good time to see many places in a day! The tour bus picked up us at our hotel, and returned back too.
Pennisula tour. It was a great day out to finish off the week. Visiting all the different sites of the peninsula was a lot of fun. Cape point was fantastic. Boulders beach was fun.

Great 5 days garden route tour. It was a great experience and I can definitely recommend that trip. Lots of fun with great people! Only day two would be better if more time would be available for the Tsitsikamma national park. Great value for money. Xenny was a great guide, always in good mood and in for fun actions! I had a single room at backpackers which was also great! Can also recommend the guesthouses (if some money left, I'd go for that option).
7 days garden route tour with wine tasting. I had a beautiful week with backpackers from all over the world. A lot of new experience with funny people and nice tour guides. Thank you so much!
Garden Route tour. Our guide Kevin was excellent! He clearly knew the route very well and took us to the best backpackers along the way

7 Day Garden Route + Wine. Even as South Africans we found the trip most enjoyable. Great value for money and excellent accommodation at all the B & B's we stayed at. Gave a new insight to our wonderful country. Our guide Izaac (Easy) was a star and went out of his way to pamper us. A lot to do and see and you cannot always fit it all in. Loved walking with the elephants. Mixing with the backpackers was an enjoyable experience. Would definitely recommend Hotspots2c to friends.

Awesome!. We had a great time on our wine tour! The guide, Andrew (I think), was very knowledgeable, helpful, and an all-around cool guy. The wineries on the tour were amazing and certainly well-chosen.

Excellent!. Originally booked Cape Town highlights day tour - but as we'd already been down to the V&A Waterfront and Table Mountain was in cloud we asked for it to be amended. Our tour guide Andrew (and the company) were very helpful with this and we ended up going down to Cape Point and a great trip around the coast. Andrew was knowledgable about the local history and made sure we a very enjoyable day - recommended !

7 day Garden Route + Wine. A very enjoyable trip with a great bunch of people from around the world. There were lots of exciting expeiences, excellent accommodation (we opted for B&B) and a lovely driver cum guide. My only complaint is that some days were too rushed. In order to fit in the optional activities for some of the group we were rushed around the things which were fixed for everyone.However, Overall it was great and I would use this company again if I came back to South Africa.

Seen the hotspots of South Africa in just 5 days with awesome tourguide Xenny! :). First of all thanks to Xenny for making this trip so special and nice! He's a really cool guy and I was very glad to have him as our tourguide! :)I really enjoyed the whole tour and all the spots that we've went to. My top 5 Activities I did on this 5 day tour were: 1. Bungee jumping the highest bungee bridge in the world2. laying at the beach and stargazing at the milky way above us3. seeing 2 fully grown male lions & over 50 elephants walking super close next to our 4x4 vehicle in Addo National Park4. bush walking with an elephant, riding and feeding it and touching it everywhere I want5. Cuddle with 2 grown-up cheetahs at the cango wildlife ranch! :)Thanks for everything Xenny, may we see again! :)
2 days safari. The driver and the accommodation were good. The attractions were also very good and well organized. The transport was on time and was comfortable.
Amazing and well organized tour. Highly recommending Hotspot2c specially if you will be alone. well organized tour. has a good value for money.

Great overview of the Western Cape. I did the 3day Western Cape Wow Tour with some friends and we all really enjoyed it because you get to see lots of different places along the Western Cape which are all very beautiful. I had more than enough possibilities to pictures, but unfortunately we spent a lot of time in the car and did not have enough time to explore the places we stopped either. The guide was really nice and tried to answer all the questions we had concerning the trip. Aditionally he spoiled us with some sweets and ice cream during the trip. The backpackers that were chosen for the nights were cool, especially the one in Cape Agulhas because it is very close to the sea so that we could go for a quick swim in the Indian Ocean. All in all I would really recommend this tour for everyone who does not have lots of time or wants to get a quick overview of the region.

Fabulous 2-week tour of southern South Africa with teenagers. Greetings from back in the USA! We had such a wonderful trip to Cape Town and surrounds! Your itinerary was fantastic. We did almost everything suggested on it. We were exhausted :) We had absolutely no problems with logistics and really liked everything you planned. We also loved the freedom of exploring in our rented car, and the adventure of driving ourselves around. Highlights were the Cango Caves, ostrich riding, surfing, bungy jumping and game drives!

Safari and Garden Route Tour (3 days). The tour was really a lot of fun: nice activities and great tour guide. We didn't see a lot of the Garden Route, but we saw some of the big five on the safari in a private game reserve, we cuddled with elephants, felt the arenaline in our body after the world's highest bungee jump and enjoyed a beautiful sunset at the beach.

Fun but more like a promotional trip. Lovely places and amazing landscapes but no time for stops to enjoy it. It was more important to to get to the next event where we could do some extra bookings. Our guide exaggerated to sell more additional events. It was good, but much to much of a promotional trip.

Great action-packed week on the Garden Route. I did the 5 day Garden Route + Addo tour and it was great. I did the single room backpacker option and my rooms were lovely in every place we stayed. My favourite place was the hostel in Jeffrey's Bay where my room opened out onto the beach and the ocean.The activities included (and optional) were good value for money and I enjoyed each one of them. Our tour guide, Isaac, was very friendly and loved to joke around with us. There was high tension as we had a very difficult individual in our tour who wanted all of the activities catered to his every whim (wanted Isaac to be his personal chauffeur, complained that he wasn't allowed to ride the elephants or ostriches, even though it's well-known that these activities are cruel to the animals, to give a few examples) and Isaac made sure this person had a minimal negative impact on the rest of us. Overall a great five days with (mostly) awesome people in an absolutely beautiful part of South Africa - I would highly recommend!

Fantastic 4 day garden route tour. My boyfriend and I took the four day garden route tour, visiting oudtshoorn, wilderniss, knysna, sedgefield and Jeffrey's bay- and covering a wide range of activities. We cannot even begin to articulate how wonderful this tour was. Accommodation and activities were both fantastic, but most importantly we had the best guide we could possibly hope for. Gerhard made our experience so much better, offering us advice and recommendations.My boyfriend fell ill on the second day of the tour and Gerhard's support was invaluable to us. A truly lovely man with an excellent knowledge of South Africa!

BEST TRIP EVER!! . I went on the 5 day garden route tour with Maudi at the end of January and it was amazing. Everything about the trip was perfect. It couldn't have gone any better. I came alone and we all left friends despite all our different ages. We stuck togethet as a.group the whole time and had so much fun together. The driving is split up nicely and activities are distributed good throughout the trip. The hostels were amazing. I loved them all. The first three nights were ON the beach. Absolutely gorgeous. The atmosphere at all the hostels was amazing and super chill. Every meal we had whether it at the hostel, where we were doing an activity, or somewhere maudi took us was always delicious. My highlight of the trip was the elephant walk. It was great. Just make sure you budget extra money for the activities that aren't included. It was the best week ever and I was so sad to leave! Would do it over again a million times and recommend to everyone!!

4 day Garden Route. We did this 4 day Garden Route Tour with Hotspots2c on our honeymoon and it was amazing! It is full of adventure, fun, amazing places. Zahid, our guide was very well prepared amd nice. He paid attention for each of us, both separately and together.The B&Bs (in 3* option) were really great, much more better than we expected.We liked especially the 3rd one where we had view to the ocean.:)The variety of the programs was great, we had so much things to do on each day. Some of the programs are not included in the price and it is ok if you don't want to participate on it. But I have to say that all of them worth it and are on a good priceWe tried all of the additional programs (bungee jumping, feeding elephants, adventurous cave tour, safari, etc). The whole service provided (hotspots2c, at the B&Bs, other guides and programs during the trip) was excellent! It was a lifetime experience! I can highly recommend it to everyone!

3 night, 4 day Garden Route tour. Myself and three friends did a 3 day, 4 night garden route tour from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth and we had a great time. All the accomodation we stayed in was great (3* option) and we had a wide variety of activities to do and things to see.Our tour guide Gerhard was fantastic - he was very knowledgable and helpful. We are very glad we picked this option for exploring the west coast of SA.
3 Day Garden Route + Safari. Good Vibes all around! The tour guides are very nice. The attractions are fun and you will not be disappointed.

4 day garden route tour, memories worth having forever. One trip that make you really appreciate life and the loved ones. The garden route is full of adventure, fun, creates new relationships with other tourists on board. Zee, the guide added more flesh with the knowledge he shared of all places and made it interesting with his personality, humour and tact of making sure everyone is on the same page in terms of understanding, participation and having fun. Elephants and ostriches in Outshoorn, Wilderness, Tsitsikama and being very close to the beach at night in Jephreys Bay, thesound of waves even in the morning,,, outstanding.

Brilliant and totally worth it!. An adventurous and fun filed tour with a great group. My fiance and I were so pleased with the range of activities, diverse group of travellers and wonderful guide - Isaac. We especially loved the elephant encounter at Addo, an unreal experience to remember for a lifetime!

Always on the move!. 4 day garden route town with Hotspots.Every day we got up early to do different events each day.There was 10 of us in a minibus with a lot of travelling with a laid back guide.There was only one event each day that was not included in the price but whatever you did was optional.Everyone got on well.From walking with and feeding elephants and game drive to canoeing,speed boat,hiking over suspension bridge and even the world highest bungy jump if you were up for it.Choice of accommodation comfortable 3 star or backpackers.Evening meal barbecues at backpackers one of which was on beach.

HotSpots2c SAVED our trip to Cape Town. When I arranged a city tour, I have to say, I was sort of ambivalent about whether I really needed it. We could get around on our own, take taxis etc. What I did not appreciate is how INDISPENSABLE it would be. To explain, the first day, we went to Table Mountain. Our (excellent) guide, Maudy, drove us there, accompanied us up to the top, and then set us loose for an hour and a half. So I'm thinking, "did we really need a guide?" But when it was time to leave, I realized when he left us, he went and started holding our place in line for the descent. He waited an hour and a half in line for us . . . so we did not have to. People were jealous to see us skip the whole line, but hey, have you ever heard of the concept of "business class"? Not having to wait in line for an hour and a half was worth every penny. The next day, we had Divan as our guide, and again, just having someone there to facilitate everything for you, drop you off right at the spot while they go search for a parking place, pick you up front and center when you're ready to go . . . having this service really saved our whole trip.

So worth it. My friend and I were only in town for 7 days, so we did the 2 Day Western Cape Safari tour. Steph, our awesome and knowledgeable tour guide, drove us and about 8 other people up to the private reserve and was super cool about telling us all about South Africa on the way. (The running joke for the rest of the trip for my friend and me was that everything we knew about SA we had learned on safari).We saw all of the animals we could ever hope to see on the private reserve, we took a million pictures, and we really felt we had gotten our money's worth. She took us all to have ostrich braai for dinner, which was definitely an experience (other food options were available too) and the next day we went to the Canga Wildlife Ranch, an elephant walk, and a tour of an ostrich farm. Each part was unbelievably fun and interactive and worth every penny. Elephant walk was by far one of our favorite parts, but the wildlife ranch was awesome because we got to play with lemurs and baby cheetahs (the really interactive parts you had to pay for, but because the US dollar is so strong right now it wasn't a big deal for us at all to shell out an extra 20 bucks here and there to actually play with some African animals). Overall, my friend and I agree this was by far the BEST 2 days of our entire trip and we would totally use hotspots2c again for other tours. This was super fun, informative, active and exciting, and I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking to get a taste of Africa in a short amount of time.

See All the SIghst. I went on 2 separate HotSpots tours while in South Africa. One was a day tour of the winelands and the other was a 7 day Garden Route tour. I was very impressed with the friendliness and professionalism of this tour operator and would highly recommend booking. The guides were knowledgeable and accommodated the group's needs. I was also impressed with the backpacker accommodations which were clean and offered a fun atmosphere for dinner and socializing with the other travelers. Overall, the tours were well organized and allowed me to see and do a variety of sights in a short amount of time. I had an amazing time in South Africa thanks to HotSpots2c! Thank you!

Super Tour and Guide. Gerard was an excellent guide for a 7 member family 2 day Safari tour over the holidays. Every aspect of the trip exceeded our expectations. We learned SA history, geography and lore. Our visit to Buffeldrift, Garden Route Game Reserve and the Cango Ostrich Farm were super. Garden Route guide Wessel acquainted us with game life and principles and brought us as close as we ever dreamed to animals. Wessel's love of his job and animals was apparent throughout the 2 hour drive. Cheers and thanks to Hotspots.

great experience. Did the 8 day Western Cape Wow + Garden Route tour. Was fortunate to have excellent tour partners and Isaac, Andrew and Kevin were outstanding guides. Be forewarned there is a LOT of driving and downtime in the bus, but that's to be expected considering the distances travelled. However, the activities are great, I've made some amazing friends, and the company is very professionally run. Don't hesitate to book them.

Loved everything about it.. The most outstanding aspect of this tour was our guide Gerald. He made the trip really special and gave it a personal touch. He adapted the tour perfectly to the needs of everyone in the group, for the adventurous and less adventurous. We learned a lot as he mixed informative stories with humour.

Cape Town area Tour. After having two days of pre-cruise tours in and around Cape Town, I was pleased that Hotspots2c were willing to work out a tour for my wife and I on the last day our ship was back in port that would let us cover the spots that the cruise tours had not covered. Our private full day tour of Table Top Mountain and then down the coastal road to the Cape of Good Hope was wonderful. We were able to book a half day tour the next day as we disembarked the ship and then to our flight, seeing the aquarium and botanical gardens on the way.It was our good luck to have Ulrich Damon assigned as our guide. What a wonderful, friendly, informative,an warm young man. Best of luck to him in his dream of Olympic competition.J Kuehnle USA

South Africa Garden Route. This tour exceeded our expectations. It was fabulous, informative and fun. We learned so much about South Africa visiting the places and being guided through by Isaac,our fantastic guide and driver. His knowledge and history are amazing and he really is excellent at his job doing his best at all times to make sure all on his tour are having a most enjoyable holiday. A really interesting insight into Africa and their people. There are a lot of sites visited on this tour including the Ostriches, Mountain Forest, Pristine Beaches & Cango Caves. We have had such a memorable holiday

A wow trip!. We were a family of three traveling to Cape Town for the first town. Our guide, Isaac, treated us with utmost care, put us in the most wonderful lodges and gave us detailed description of the places we were visiting. Although we met with an accident, Isaac was very patiently trying to calm us down while intensely solving each problem. Thanks to his thoughtfulness, our trip was very productive and a great learning experience.

3 days garden route. We had a wonderful and well organized tour with our excellent guide Gerhard who gave us many pieces of interesting information throughout the tour, and was considerate and helpful. Gerhard helped to create a beautiful atmosphere amongst the group members. We visited the wild life ranch in Cango with Cheetah cubs encounter, walked with elephants and fed them, took canoe adventure in wilderness, walked in Tsitsikamma forrest to see the big yellow tree and had a safari with close encounters with lions, zebras and a lot more. The accomodation guesthouses were excellent.

Garden Route tour was AWESOME!. Maudi our guide was great! He was accommodating in every way and was knowledgable about all aspects of South Africa's culture and history. Thank you Maudi for all the awesome memories you helped us create. My wife and I will be recommending you to all of our friends in the USA! ;)

Excellent 4-day Garden Route Tour. I would highly recommend the 4 day garden route tour with Hotspots2c for persons who wish to travel along the Garden Route. It's certainly a well organized package that has a diverse array of activities. I was quite pleased with the guest houses that we stayed at as they were in close proximity (i.e. one could walk or take a taxi) to local restaurants. My group consisted of only four persons and thus our tour was more personalized. Xenni (our local guide) was absolutely fantastic as an ambassador for his country. He certainly made every effort to ensure that his clients were well taken care of. South Africa is a beautiful country and if I were to return, I'd definitely contact Hotspots2c!

5 Day Garden Route Tour. One of the best tours I've ever been on! Amazing variety of activities, great hostels, beautiful scenery, and lots of opportunities to customize the tours. Highlights included the bungee jumping (go for it), the elephant bush walk, the Addo safari drive, and the beautiful beaches of Jeffrey's Bay. It wasn't on the optional list of activities, but crocodile cage diving at the conservation park ranch was also fantastic, as was getting the opportunity to see and pet a cheetah up close.Our guide Kevin was a legend - he always went out of his way to make sure everyone had a great time. We were lucky to have him join us for dinner and post-dinner drinks every evening where he shared lots of great stories and history. We all agreed he was one the best tour guides we've ever had. The hostels were all excellent, great food, locations, and evening socializing. I went for the single rooms which were great. We had a pretty special group indeed...after 5 days in a van together we arrived back in Cape Town and all went out for dinner followed by Karaoke. We definitely have the amazing tour and our guide to thank for making it such a special week.
No.1 tour. Guide awesome! Itinerary awesome! Beautfiul south africa! Stay arrangements were awesome! Bungee jumping to top it all
Wine in paradise. Loved the day with excellent guide, good wine and fabulous countryside.Visit to Ernie Els vineyard was a special treat. Thanks Lisle.

Wine Tour of Note. This was such a fantastic day that I want to do it at least once a week. The wine farms visited was excellent and Hotspots bus was the only way to get there. Great day excellent wines great operator with lots of knowledge regarding the surroundings and wines. All in all I will do it again anytime!!!!
Capetown Wine Tour. Cape Heritage Hotel handled our reservation to our complete satisfaction, what a fine tour and day we had, highly recommend this vendor.

Fantastic Weekend Trip. Overall the trip was a very enjoyable one. Had the friendliest driver on Earth and he really knew his stuff. Although there were a few extras that had to be paid for to participate in, the whole thing, in my opinion, was great value and definitely worth it.

Great trip!. I did the 8 day cape wow & garden route combo 2 weeks ago and had a wonderful time! Ulrich was an excellent guide - I will say that it was nice we had the same guide for the whole time, he mentioned usually the 3 day and 5 day tours have different guides. If you are trying to choose between the 3 or 4 star guesthouses - CHOOSE THE 4 STAR!! The guesthouses were great - and most were oceanview/oceanfront! (just be warned you may be the only one at the 4 star but I was fine with that - Ulrich would pick me up for dinner so you aren't alone all night - and even was nice enough to make a separate trip for me the night I wanted to stay out later w the others at the hostel!The 3 day cape part was spent seeing lots of the famous sights and the garden route combined lots of activities (zip lining, "adventure cave tours", safari, canoeing, etc) with amazing views. Be warned the garden route is quite a bit of driving but thanks to frequent stops it wasn't unbearable. The people definitely helped make this trip great but even if you don't hit it off with people it is still one of the most beautiful places I've ever been!I usually don't do tours but for cape town and the southern cape this was perfect! I'd highly recommend Hotspots!

2 Day Safari from CapeTown. Our tour guide Maudi couldn't not be beat, he was pleasant, helpful and full of fun. Highly recommend this tour to anyone on a quick stay in Cape Town and who wants to see the animals. The feeding of the elephants, as recommended by Maudi, was the absolute best thing I have done on vacation in a long time.

Great Tour. I did the 3 Day Western Cape Wow for my birthday and it was a weekend very well spent. The entire tour was sublime and went very smoothly. The sights were incredible and our tour guide was great. To top it off, our guide and my fellow travellers surprised me with a cake, birthday card and some bubbly. All this from people I had just met a few hours before! It was much too kind of them all. Cape Town is a a beautiful place to visit and is probably better with the right tour company.

excellent tour, would do again. We had a blast. Our tour guide Maudi was TOP notch, and had great information and was so helpful throughout the trip. Long car ride, which is no one's fault, but just be aware and bring a book or something. That said, the vistas were so beautiful you could just look out the windows the whole time and not be bored. lots of "single" travelers that became quick friends. do the elephant walk, it is worth every penny.

Excellent tour guide. Our guide Andrew was amazing, he really shared a lot of informations about the country, wines, etc. His personality was also nice, we really enjoyed the day with him. Not to forget his english was also excellent, just like his photo skills! If you want to have great pictures, you should go with Andrew. Thanks again.

Tons of great memories. I am going to be very honest. What made this tour absolutely amazing was the bunch of people and an excellent tour guide (Ulrich). Everything just clicked, nobody tried to be difficult or adaptive and the time spent together was simply awesome - a lot of fun and those "awkward" moments that make you laugh and tell stories later on. The tour itself offers a little bit of everything and I really liked the mixture of activities. You will see beautiful sunsets, landscapes, ocean views, you will walk through stunning nature, meet animals, visit farms, have some beach and shopping time, have some adventure time when you actually have to get on your knees and dirty or "fly" and evenings are either yours or social - you choose. The walk with elephants along a lake was the highlight of the trip for me. You also have a variety of accommodation to choose from - which makes it affordable for almost anyone. I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Wine, cheese and chocolate + staggering views = a great time. This was such a pleasant trip! Our guide Lissel (please excuse if I spelled your name incorrectly) was very knowledgeable about the area and took us to four different vineyards. The van was clean and air-conditioned. Lissel took every opportunity to ensure we had a great experience - including providing us with sample of the local delicacies. Of course the star of the show was the amazing scenery. The vistas are stunning. We had wonderful day.

Private Four-Day Garden Route Tour of South Africa. This was an outstanding experience thanks to Hotspots2C. We got to see all the beautiful scenery and sites without having to drive or navigate thanks to our very own driver. The Elephant Walk was my favorite because we got to walk alongside three orphaned "teenage" elephants and feed them inside a sanctuary. In return, they hugged us with their trunks! I would highly recommend this trip for anyone who is not comfortable driving on the left side of the road. With this pre-arranged trip, we did not waste any time hunting for hotels, good restaurants, places to see, or things to do. It was a great combination of site seeing and activities such as hiking, canoeing, and visiting places like the Cango Caves and an ostrich farm to name a few of the ones we selected from a list given to us prior to the tour.Everything was perfect!

5 Days Garden Route + Addo. The trip was very well organised and thought out. Hostels were clean, comfortable and had beautiful scenery. Maudi was a great guide and we had a lot of fun with him. He is very knowledgeable. Would definitely book again with Hotspots.

6 Day Personalised Garden Route. The tour was a trip of a lifetime. I worked closely with Nicollette to plan the trip and she offered awesome suggestions as she understood my requirements. The trip itself with guide Andrew Jackson was amazing. Andrew is a fantastic guide and was knowledgeable, thoughtful and very entertaining. We had long discussions on the history and culture of South Africa and this made the drive between destinations a breeze. He also planned for us very thoughtful reservations for dinner, allowing us to also sample the wonderful cuisine along the Garden Route. He very quickly understood our likes and dislikes and planned added activities that were simply amazing. I would highly recommend this trip, hotspots2C and Andrew Jackson.

8 Day Garden Route + Wow....more than perfect!. The best thing you can do! I booked the 8 Day Garden Route + Wow Tour. Big G, our guide for the first three days, made the trip very enjoyable and told us all interesting facts about the Western Cape and was always willing to answer our questions. We, a full bus of young German girls and one English/Dutch guy, visited Cape Point, Hout Bay, we watched wales in Hermanus and took pictures at the most southern tip of Africa. A wine tasting in the amazing wine area as well as a walking tour through the township were also excellent experiences. The stop at the penguin resort is a must. The hostels and the places to eat were always very good. Thank you Big G for this perfect start. Two of us spent the last night of this first part in a lovely hostel in Cape Town city where Zaahid, our tour guide for the next five days, picked us up. We were a very nice small group of five people. In the following days we walked with lions, canoed in the Wilderness, watched a huge herd of elephants in the Addo Park and visited an ostrich farm and the Cango Caves. These are just a few of our fantastic stops. All the hostels were perfect and we spent there very enjoyable evenings. Zaahid is a real gentleman, open-minded, has a great sense of humor, is a good story teller and became a really good friend. From the first moment he integrated every single person into the group and took care that everyone is happy at any time. He always stopped for some pictures at a nice viewpoint and explained a lot about SA and the culture. Thank you so much Zaahid for this unforgettable time….I think without your help I would have never gone over the bungy bridge and would have missed this amazing experience.I can only complain about one thing – eight days were too little ;-)I will never forget these days. A big THANK YOU to the best guides (and drivers)!

Lovely Wine + Whale Coast Trip. I booked the 2 day 1 night Wine and Whale Coast trip so that I would get to see something else than just Cape Town after a business trip. The tour was very well organised and our tour guide Ulrich was amazing. He was very knowledgeable and also added some nice surprises to the tour (some more stops along the way). Everything went very smoothly and the guesthouse I stayed at in Struisbaai/Cape Agulhas was very nice and the dinner at the hostel was very good, too. The group was a good mixture of age groups and of solo/friends travellers. I had exchanged some emails with the Hotspots2c office before my trip and the replies came through very quickly.I can really recommend the tour for everybody, especially for those who don't have a lot of time but still would like to see some nice places outside of Cape Town.

4 Days Garden Route. I did the 4 days Garden Route with Hotspot 2c. We were a groupe of 6 people and the atmosphere within the group was very nice and funny! Our guide Ullrich was very nice but also he gave us all the interessting informations. We booked the 3 Star guesthouse and our accomodantions were absolutely lovely! I would recommend the trip.

excellent tour with a great driver. I booked the 5 days Addo and Garden Route tour and had a great experience including the Lions Walk, bungee jumping, the Addo Elephant Park, hiking in national parks and a lot more great experiences. My driver (Isaac) did a great job, he was so caring and well informed, all of us (a group of 10 people who did never meet before) had 5 absolutely funny days and in the end, it was hard to say good bye. If you're not sure whether to book a tour or not, here's my advice: DO IT!

4 Day Garden route escape. What a blast!! A great way to spend the weekend exploring the South African coastline. The guide knew all about the different areas of the route and was always willing to answer all the questions that were asked. My tour highlight was Addo Elephant National Park as well as the Bloukraans bungee jump. I really enjoyed the way that the tour was run. I'm going to recommend the tour to everyone as I had an experience of a lifetime on it.

Really nice 5-day tour along the Garden Route. We are a group of 8 students and had little time to see the Garden Route. We found this opportunity on the internet and booked the 5 day tour on backpacker budget. We stayed 4 nights in 3 amazing hostels (Sedgefield, Jeffrey's Bay, Oudtshoorn) and had a really good guide, Isaac. He drove us around and we stopped at several places for activities or look out points, such as Bloukrans Bridge (for the bungee jump), Cangoo Caves, Tsitsikamma region, Cango Wildlife Park, Ostrich Farm etc. All in all, we really enjoyed our trip and we would definitely recommend it!
4Day Gardenrout. overall good but a bit to much pressed in .You spend the most time in the bus.But is all written in the Prospect (1500Km in 4 Days so thats what you got)

Hotspots2c 3-days Garden Route and Safari. I really loved the hostels they had for overnightstay. Cozy and fun! Good group of people travelling together. The Bungy jump and the elephantriding/feeding were my favourites! Do not hecitate to do the bungy, you will for sure regret if you don't! I was terrified, but I did it, and I am SO glad I did! If I was to say something that could be better I would say that the safari was a little bit long. This was because we were driving a long time and we did not see animals all the way. I would have liked it more if it was a smaller area with more animals walking with each other. But all in all, a great experience with Hotspots2c! :)

Garden tour to addo and wine tour. Amazing! Great activities, great tour guide great value! Juanita is an amazing tour guide, so sweet. The tour is full of once in a lifetime activities. It was my first time staying in hostels, which turned out to be a much better experience than I expected. Very well planned and very friendly.

Garden Route 5 days. Enjoyable trip from Cape Town east along the coast for 5 days in a van. Very attentive and helpful guide. Half the international group was in their 20s and intent on thrills (bunji jumping eg). I was more interested in natural history and there was ample opportunity for seeing birds, etc. Big 5 animals were accessible too--we sat out for a day on the beach while the tour went to Addo and saw big mammals. We had nice accomodations at guest houses while the youngsters stayed at hostels (we wished for better wifi at a couiple of them because some work had to come along.)
4 day 3 night Garden route. This was a great tour! Our guide Maudi was very social, fun, and knowledgeable. Overall this was a great trip!
