It is ideal for people travelling alone and wanting to meet new people, but it is suitable for both young and older couples with an open mind as well. The only thing I could request a bit more of is better structure, as it seemed like we were always in a hurry to go to the next place.

Garden Route 4 Day Tour. The best weekend of my 3 months in South Africa!! What an adventure!! Maudi is one of the best tour guides I've ever had. He was fun to hang out with and very professional, a perfect combination. He really wanted the whole tour group to have a great time, and that really makes a difference. Each day was filled with adventure. I walked with elephants, explored caves, rode an ostrich, canoed in paradise, met local children on a beach, bungie jumped the worlds highest bungy bridge, and got to see my favourite African animals on a game drive!! It's the Cheetah by the way :) Hotspots offers many different tours, so you can choose what you'd like to do/see and how long you'd like your trip to be. I'm Canadian, and the other members of the tour group were Swiss, Russian and German, ranging in age from 19 to 55. It was an excellent way to meet other travellers and learn about the countries they come from. I would definitely recommend Hotspots2c!
Perfect weekend!. There is not a lot more to add to the title! Well organised, great people, very friendly tour guide, well chosen places..... I had a really good time, thanks everyone!

Great hotspots. I was on the Three days garden route and safari tour. The tour was great and very interesting. Xenni is a great guide, being always in a good mood and spreading his positivity among the group. Xenni has also explaind many things while driving during the tour. All hotspots have been excellent. I just can recommend the tour. Thanks to all .. Miriam

Garden Route Trip. Thank you for the amazing places that you recommend for us. we love adventure and you offered us different types of adventure that we really enjoyed it. Guest Houses that you offered us were amazing!!!!!We missed South Africa after this Trip. everyday, me and my husband say "Good morning beautiful world!!!" Thank you "Zeny Yasbek" you make the trip really brilliant!!!

Western Cape and Garden Route. I had the absolute best time on both of these trips, the 3-day Western Cape and the 4-day garden route tours! Isaac(3-day) and Xenny (4-day) were incredibly FANTASTIC guides and became great friends! As well as teaching us so much they were so fun as well! This is why i did two tours with Hotspots, because the guides really did all they could to make it great, by being flexible and chilled taking time to stop off and spend longer time at certain points on the tour we enjoyed, asking us if everything was okay and would let us do any extra activities we would like along the way! I went with the budget option, which meant i stayed in dorm rooms in hostels, and this was definitely a great option, as not only did you make friends on your own tour, but also could make friends with other travelers in the hostels. All the hostels were very well chosen, as they allowed the tour to flow seamlessly without any long trips to get there, and they were clean and comfortable!I'm so so glad I went on these fantastic tours, and despite originally thinking I would never do a bungy jump, I did the world's highest! And it was phenomenal! These tours I will always remember, I saw some of the most beautiful sites of South Africa, had lots of fun, and made really great friends. All round, exactly what you want!

big 5 safari game. I travelled from Cape Town to make a safari game.Our guide Paul did a great job.But, it wasn't a comfortable bus, I think.It was a long way to get there, the bus was crowded and had a tiny space into.About the safari, I think it should have more animals, because most of then were hidden in the bush or were far away.But it was good anyway.
Garden Route. Awesome trip! Had an amazing time. Xenny our guide did a wonderful job and was friendly, informative and fun!

The best way to see the beautiful country of south africa. I recently took the 3 day western cape tour and the 4 day garden route tour. Both trips were impeccably well organised and ran smoothly. The busses are comfortable and the guides are flexible with stop-offs and are even happy to alter the itinerary if needed. Our guides marlyon (western cape) and Issac (garden route) were friendly, knowledgable and easy going and in both cases really made the trip! Issac even bought us all an ice cream! The tours are very reasonably priced considering how much is on offer and include all accommodation. We opted for the budget accommodation and stayed in dorms in hostels. All the hostels were clean and comfortable although sometimes a little busy! I would probably opt for the pricier option of private rooms in future. We saw so much of the beautiful countryside and never felt rushed or "herded" around. The guides let you enjoy every stop and never hurry you on. We met wonderful people on the trips...some who I will keep up with forever! Hotspots tours would be ideal for first time travellers, students or those travelling alone x

One Day Wine Trip. This was an AMAZING trip! Our guide was SPECTACULAR. We got to see all the major sights along the route as well as some extra stops that just made our adventure complete. Morrie, our guide, really added to the enjoyment of our tour. Cape Point, seals, penguins, wine, what else can you ask for? The trip was memorable! :) :)

Fabulous weekend!!. I went on the 2 day safari trip while on a recent trip to south africa. It was definitely my most memorable weekend packed full of exciting things. We did a game drive on the first day before spending the night in a fab hostel where we had the tastiest braii (big BBQ) and played pool in the hostel bar all evening where we mad plenty of friends. The following day was crammed full of unforgettable experiences. We got to spend the morning with 3 elephants where we hand fed them and got to have photos while sitting on their knees or backs. It was incredible to get up so close to these majestic animals. From there we went to an ostrich farm which is definitely an experience you won't forget as you see people ride them and attempt to kiss them. Finally we stopped at cango animal ranch where you ge to see lots of different animals in a zoo like setting but get taken round by a guide which is very informative. Here we were abl to pay a little extra to get up close with some of the animals including white tiger cubs, lemurs, snakes or cheetahs. I spent time cuddling the cheetahs which was unbelievable they were so tame and purred away while you stroked them. Fabulous company to do a safari with as you get to do so many more things with them.

2 DAYS WILD SAFARI. During the month of October 2011 I went on a 2 day wild safari trip together with some students that were in Cape Town to study English.We had an amazing time .We had Isaac as our driver and he was so friendly but professional because he always answered our questions.I'll be in CT again in July and have already arranged a 7 day Garden Route Trip with 12 students from Italy.

An incredible experience!. I'm brazilian and i've been on a 4 days garden route tour by the time i was studying english in cape town, and it was simply amazing, the vehicle is very comfortable, our guide, xenny is one of the nicest person i've ever met, he gave us a lot of tips about best places to visit, to eat, and shared with us a lot of histories of south africa, the most beautiful place i've seen. I also made some good friends on this tour, people from another countries that i hope to keep in touch. IT WAS AWESOME!

Amazing 3 day tour with Isaac. I recently went on the 3 day tour of the western cape and had an amazing time on this tour. We had Isaac as our driver and he was first class - he added some comedy to the trip, was able to advise us on how to get the best value for our money and was always at hand to answer any questions. The door-to-door pick up is a nice touch as there is no hassle in getting to a meeting point for a specific time! Highlights of the trip would have to be the cage diving with the great white sharks - a must do for any adrenaline junkies out there - and just generally traveling around the coast taking in the amazing scenery of south africa. Definitely recommend this tour and this company and plan on taking another safari tour with them in the near future.

Nice people and excellent service. I booked with them a 2 DAY WILDLIFE SAFARI tour and a Shark Cage diving and they were all the time friendly and nice, each question I had they nicely answered, and I just can be thankfull to them as I really had a good time during those 2 tours.I would highly recommend them!!

AMAZING GARDEN ROUTE WITH HOTSPOTS2C. Hi everyone! I did a Garden Route tour (4days) by hotspots2c from Cape Town! It was an absolutely unforgetable experience! I have enjoyed it very much!!!We visited so many wonderful places and main attaractions of the Route (Cape Town-Mossel Bay- Wilderness-Knysna-Tsitsikama National Park-Natures Valey-Pletentberg Bay-Oudtshoorn) in 4 days! We did canoe on a river, visited elephant park (fed them and walked with them), ostrich farm, jumbed from the highest bridge (260 m)- bungy jumpinig, got some tan on the beach, intered the Camgo Cave! Every day was an adventure! Organization and accomodation (backpackers) were perfect! Our guide, Johan, was very knowledgeable and flexible. He tried to do everything in the best way and comfortable for the people! Highly recommend to do this tour to everyone who comes to South Africa!I think that this is the best way to visit Garden Route if you do not have a car or can not drive. Cost of a trip was absolutely affordable. Thank you very much for this trip! Karina, 24 years, Russia

We'have had a wonderful time with a nice groupe, age 17 - 56!. The trip was well organised. Our tour guide Rochelle did very well and was not only well informed about the places itself, we visited, but as well about the economical, political and cultural background connected to these sides. Everything was almost perfect. My partner Siegfried and me decided to take the backpackers en suite option, not to spare the money for the guesthouse (the price difference wasn't that big, by the way) but because we had learned from other trip advisor comments that the backpackers would be at the nicer places. Infact all backpackers were very well situated. The standard of the rooms were a little bit different. By any standards the best accommodation was near Addo national park. We stayed at a farm side in the so called "castle" which was more like a guesthouse room than a backpackers double room. The food we'd got was at all places memorable. Rochelle was one o the best tour guides I've ever had! The activities were the pure fun. We did the early morning tour through Addo National park where we saw not only lots of the 600 - 700 elephants they have there, but one of the only 10 Lions who live there in a space almost as big as Belgium (!). Besides that we saw Kudus, Zebras and a lot more ... Fun was also the Canopytour, the tour with canoes, the adventure in the cave adventure an last but not least the skydiving. Can't tell everything. I would travel with Earthstompers again!

Great trip.. What an amazing host was Cindy. We had a great time on this tour and it's a great way to see a lot in a short amount of time. The Cape area is beautiful and although there is a lot of travel the scenery is great. The accommodation was really good ranging from back packers to hostels and some right on the beach. Well done Cindy and Earthstompers and thanks for a great tour.

Addo and Garden coast adventure!. A brilliant trip and introduction to the Cape area. Skillfully and professional organised and with lots of options for the adventurous (although ive seen the appeal of throwing myself of a bridge attached to a rubber band..). 3 spectacular national parks seen, amazing traditional food consumed, backpackers hostels which are more hotel and hostel, and lots of wildlife including elephants - but i still dont get the reference to Poomba and Timon?! And all with an excellent sound track - thanks very much Steph!!

Perfectly organized tour. We (2 families with 7 people total) had a great tour from Cape Town up the Garden route with this company. Our guide was great (Stephanie Harris) and drove use safely all the many kilometres up to the Addo Park. The organization was really good, as were the accommodations and restaurants. Adults and children alike loved it.

A brilliant tour!. Despite the fast pace of the tour - the garden route in 5 days means there is a lot of travel, but the scenery is worth it - it is relaxed, friendly and wonderful. We had 10 on our tour in a very new minibus; four couples and two travelling alone. The tour is perfect for those who are willing to meet like minded folk from around the world. An absolute gem of a tour (with a brilliant tour guide), it had been recommended to me and by golly I will recommend it to who ever will listen!

Amazing way to see the garden route. Earthstompers Adventures offers you a lot of fun activities for the 6 day trip. Bungee jumping , sky diving , canoeing , hiking , whale watching , shark cage diving are some of the activities you can do on this trip. If you are prone to sea sickness take medication when you go for the whale watching , the water can get quite choppy out there . My husband and I chose the guesthouse accommodation and the places we stayed in were really nice .Day usually starts by 8 am and we are on the road till 5-6 pm everyday. Dinner was at the backpacker's and it was mostly braai .Charlene ,our guide, was amazing and she definitely kept the group up beat .

Great fun way to see the Garden Route. This 6 day tour was an amazing way to see the Garden Route, my wife and I had a fantastic time, it caters for everyone with a sense of adventure no matter what their age, it includes bungy jumping, skydiving, shark diving and zip wiring for the more adventurous, beautiful scenery, history and wildlife (Safari & Whale watching) for all. Our guide Charlene was awesome, has a superb knowledge of her country and a great sense of fun that enhanced the whole experience. Her safari game drive in our opinion was better than the early morning ranger drive! We took the guest house accommodation option but ate as a group at the backpackers, usually a braai or the house speciality and were not disappointed with either. This trip really enhanced our holiday experience and we would thoroughly recommend it.

Garden Tour with Steph was amazing. Garden Route tour with Earthstompers was a great experience.Steph was so knowledgable about her country and wanted us all to enjoy every day.We had ages from 20 to 60 and we all had a fun time. Backpackers and guest houses were excellent and lots of stops for sight seeing and adventure seeking.Would recommend this to everyone.Thanks so much Steph.

Exploring your own country in style.... Aimed at foreigners from other parts of the world but perfect for the South African wanting to explore their own country but specifically the Garden Route. So much fun for all ages...young and old. Guesthouses amazing. As a Vegetarian I was very spoilt...my guide went out of her way to make sure that I got something veggie for every meal. Did not feel judged for not been a non-drinker. As with food I was also catered for with mocktails. Transport amazing. Everything on this tour was perfect. Thank you Earthstompers for the most incredible experience and for creating the most amazing memories.

Life Time Experience. This tour is absolutely amazing. I enjoyed the trip every singe day. Every penny we paid and every effort we made is worthwhile, highly recommend for this trip. however, it is a shame that we couldnt stay at the little lovely town - barrydale, a bit longer.The guide, Charlene, is undoubtedly second to none, lovely , cool and taking good care of her group.

Perfect in every way!. This was an incredible trip! Ferne, our guide, was fun, friendly and fabulous in every way! Everything was so well organised, we stopped at beautiful, interesting places, and had the chance to be as energetic or relaxed as we wanted! All the optional activities are worth doing - I personally went for the skydiving which was awesome, and my daughter loved the bungee jump! Guest house accommodation was wonderful throughout the trip, food was great, we really couldn't fault the trip in any way! Thank you, Earthstompers!
Food Tour. Enjoyed places and beverages that started off our trip with information about the area that we wouldn't have otherwise had knowledge to visit.

Unforgettable experience. The six day trip along the South African coast was an amazing experience. We enjoyed the garden route a lot and would definitely book it again. The people were nice and our tour guide Charlene was great! We had a lot if fun and learned many new things about South Africa. Thanks!

Amazing trip!. What an amazing trip was this! The group which I travelled with, was great. Also Ferne, my guide, was a great person to meet. She had so much positive energy, what I really, really liked! I've seen and done so much crazy, beautiful, amazing things durig the tour that all those things made this a tour I'll never forget!

Memories I will never forget!. Me and my boyfriend (20 and 21 years old) booked our trip to South Africa at the beginning of the year, and was recommended the Earthstompers Garden Route Adventure 6 Day Tour. I myself cannot express how impressed and happy I am with the trip and all that we was able to do in as little as six days and clock up so many miles in that time frame!Cindy and Ferne's enthusiasm made the trip that extra bit special and didn't go unnoticed along with their knowledge on the history of the Garden Route made it that little bit more special. From our very first to our last day we were looked after, fed well and also placed in nice Backpack suites which gave us a social vibe throughout the evening round numerous camp and beach fires.I myself feel that this tour made me overcome boundaries and obstacles I would never have overcome before, and also allowed me to meet people from all over the world. Please please please book this tour!! On the first day of us being off the tour, myself and my boyfriend felt completely lost and had no idea what to do with ourselves, yes the tour is time scheduled and action packed but that's what made it so exciting! This tour is arranged and time-tabled to a T, and I did not expect to see and do as much as I did and what was listed in the tour guide itself. Thank you Earthstompers, Cindy and Ferne!!!!

Amazing 6 day tour!!. This was such a fantastic tour, I would do it again tomorrow! There were 11 of us on the tour and we got on really well, those that could met up afterwards in Cape Town!The tour guide, Rochelle, was amazing. She was super organised and always made sure that everyone was happy and knew what they were doing. Even though she was working long hours and driving everywhere, she was always cheerful and chatty - you could really tell that she loves her job and South Africa! We stayed in the guest houses and they were all really nice and comfortable with a great breakfast. I took part in the whale watching, zip lining and sky diving. The activities were well planned and definitely worth the extra cost! I definitely recommend this trip to anyone wanted to explore the garden route.

No other way to see the Garden Route. A big thank you to Earth stompers, Cindy and Ferne, who exceeded expectations. Me and my girlfriend joined the 6 day Garden Route and Addo adventure tour, a tour which was organised and executed perfectly from start to finish. The food, accommodation and social aspect was great and we always arrived to a warm welcome each night. I can honestly not fault a second of my trip. I was amazed at how much the tour allowed me to see of the garden route in just six days, and I hope to do this tour one day in the future again.

The greatest tour ever!. I had a blast! It was such an amazing experience, that it's even hard to describe! Apart from visiting the beautiful spots of the Garden Route, we had lots of adventure, such as experiencing a shark cage diving, crawling and sliding inside a cave, canoeing and having a picnic in front of a waterfall, trying a bunch of ziplines, going on a game drive at Addo Elephant Park and even trying the highest bungee jump in the world! The guide was amazing, full of stories to tell and a really great person. The hostels where we spent the night were all super cool as well. All in all, I couldn't have had a greater time!

Earthstompers Adventures: 6 day Garden Route and Addo Adventure. Great trip. Our guide, Ferne , was excellent. She really went the extra mile to make sure everyone had an awesome time. She worked very hard. Hope I have the opportunity to travel with her again.

Great trip!!. This tour was fantastic! Interesting and active activities everyday, beautiful driving routes with a comfortable van. Friendly and warm tour guide and brilliant accommodation each night ranging from trendy and cool to homely and scenic. Stayed on a beach one night!! great food each night too. Highly recommend

Garden Route. excellent tour. Surpassed expectations. Our guide Ferne was very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and good fun. The backpackers accommodation and food was at a much higher standard than we had expected. The tour was perfect for 2 50 year olds with a 20 and 18 year old. Just enough different things going on to suit all. Made our South African trip.

Garden tour - Very nice!. My girlfriend and I did the 6 days garden tour with this company in July 2016. I recommend! THe tour was very well organised and we saw beautiful places. The big plus is the backpacks they have picked, we sincerely enjoyed all of them! two of them are right in front of the ocean and it was ery nice to stay there! The activities are nice and it is a very convenient way to discover the south of south africa. Also, our guide Rochelle created a very good atmospher and enthusiasm!On the last day, the group was split because some wanted to do the shark diving. But they did everything to put the group together after the sharks and it was very much appreciated. To do so, Rochelle had to wake up at 4am to drive us and then come back to pick the group. She drove a lot and Earths. didnt charge anything, we thank you for that!The only activity we did not really enjoy was the addo elephant park... not such a great experience.I sincerely recommend the tour and the company because you will do great activities and the company is well managed!

Amazing garden route experience with Earthstompers . Fantastic week, great variety of activities. Our guide Stephanie was brilliant, so knowledgeable and accommodating. My hubbie and I joined a group of 16 in 2 buses and we had great fun and have some new friends after the week. Food in SA is awesome and the guest houses we stayed in were beautifully located and some amazing accommodation. Highly recommend this company and this trip. Well planned and nothing was any bother. Sarah

Great exploration of the Garden Route. Rochelle was a friendly and knowledgeable guide who took us expertly from place to place, ensuring everyone's questions were answered and we were all enjoying ourselves. The range of activities was great and we would highly recommend Earthstompers! We opted to stay in guest houses, which were extremely good places to stay.

Yes, you can!. I'm usually the leader of group trips rather than a participant, but I'm really glad I joined the Earthstompers 6-day Garden Tour for my first visit to Africa (let alone South Africa). Maybe we were lucky that the 8 of us were all so easy going and enthusiastic, but I also think our guide Rochelle contributed a lot to the upbeat energy we shared, despite being a diverse group (early 20's to mid 50's, German, American, Canadian and both French and German Swiss). Nothing was too much trouble for Rochelle, who always went the extra mile to make our trip informative, comfortable and enjoyable. While I didn't try shark diving, bungee jumping or parachuting, most of us tried and had fun on the adventure cave, the zip-lining canopy and the whale watching tours. (The shark divers among us were much enthused about that tour). The canoeing and walking in Wilderness, and the viewpoints and beaches at various spots along the coast were sublime. Lots of wildlife: in addition to whales, the penguins were delightful and the Ellies at Addo fantastic. The food was delicious (many meals included), and almost all my guesthouse rooms were very special. Buy wine at the wine tasting estate to enjoy later at dinner! My only reservation was the optional safari game ride at Addo, early in the morning. To some extent, we just weren't lucky (saw more animals later in the day with Rochelle driving through the park), but I thought the Addo driver was lack luster, reciting information in a monotone about the animals we did see. Having stayed in a private game reserve near Kruger where we had a driver and a spotter in a smaller vehicle and where we could go off road onto smaller tracks or even in the bush, I didn't think this optional activity was worthwhile. To be fair, though, if we'd seen more wildlife (the lions were elusive and the elephants were hiding out until it warmed up later), I might feel differently.But this was just one small reservation: otherwise, this was a perfect trip - despite that I nearly got stuck in the Devil's Chimney at the Cango Cave.. I would recommend coming at a warmer time of year when perhaps longer days might allow for a more leisurely pace - or at least more time on the beach at the end of the day. But truly, it's an amazing tour at anytime, and Rochelle is an absolute gem.

Wish I could do it again!. A whole week packed with such a range of activities (whale watching, shopping, caving, bungees, hiking, canoeing, safari and more!) this tour is the best value for money that I have ever done, do NOT miss out!Our guide Ferne created such a fun atmosphere, always thinking about how we could have the best experience possible, providing interesting information on the long drives and always motivated and enthusiastic. For me travelling to Cape Town alone it was so great to be able to be part of a group of people from all over the world.Everything was so well planned and thought out, which meant the whole trip ran so smoothly. The bus was clean and air conditioned and the places we stayed at were all in beautiful locations. Of course I would have liked to stay longer in places but the tour never dragged or felt rushed. The only thing I would say is I never realised Africa could be so cold, so anyone travelling in SA winter come prepared for the chilly mornings and early morning game drive with hats and gloves and warm jumpers!!

Great 6 Days in South Africa!. I am so glad I followed the recommendation of a friend to book with earthstompers! It was the highlight of my two-week visit to South Africa.A friend and I booked a 6-day backapakers tour wherein we slept at five different lodges/inns for five consecutive nights. The package gives visitors the option to choose from different types of accommodations. We chose the one with a private toilet and bath.Rochelle, our guide, was terrific from the first minute she picked us up from our guest house in Capetown. It helped that our group of seven people meeting for the first time hit if off soon after. We were from Denmark, England, Scotland and the Philippines.Driving a distance of around 2,500km for five days, Rochelle gave us the history and bits of information about the various places we visited and passed by. Lunch was paid by us but nearly all dinners and breakfasts were part of the package. I particularly enjoyed the dinners. The tour price was just right!I would recommend for visitors to bring shampoo and soap as these are not provided by the places where we slept. Also, make sure to clarify the approximate time you would be picked up and returned to your starting point so you can book your hotel or onward flight.We had to change our flight to Johannesburg as we will miss our original schedule. Rochelle was so helpful looking for alternate flights and finding us a ride to the airport so we can catch a our new flight.Do keep an open mind and make new friends, and try out the bungee jump and tandem skydive! These were optional and we are glad we chose to do them. My videos on Youtube will be seen and enjoyed in the coming years.Thank you Rochell and Earthstompers! Arnel (Philippines)

My first Amazing Garden route trip!!. I did this trip in Dec 2015 with my mom & I must say as locals it was good value for money, We stayed in backpackers that were quiet cosy & food was always home-made, healthy & filling. We shared the travels with other tourists who were amazing even though we were different age groups. I did various activities, we did so many fun stuff in one day & it was busy,busy. Rochelle our guide was awesome taking our suitcases & seeing to us, getting us on time & coordinating, making us comfortable. The tour itinerary was well written, we did exactly as it said. The last night the backpackers was full they put us in a B&B which was lovely accommodation. Their fish dinner was awesome & so were their breakfast it was a nice way to end the holiday. The Germany couple with us even got married on Sedgefield beach. Thank you for a great organized trip, I know my review is late but I often think of this trip.
Excellent trip. Rochelle and Ferne as our tour guide were really professional and passion !!! We are enjoy the trip and all have fund.

6 day garden route tour. great trip - good company , Charlene an excellent guide/host. Accomodation was excellent . there was only one disappointment - no guided early morning safari into Addo. However , our own drive through the park was great .

An Amazing Way to See A Lot in a Short Time. Booked a trip last minute and it was the best decision. We had Charlene who was amazing and an all girl group all from different countries. It's a lot of driving but very worth it. Addo was amazing and the bungee jump was unreal. The Cango Caves were also worth the hour spent. There were some minor hiccups but none were the fault of the guide or agency. Definitely make time for this trip in your schedule.

Unforgettable week!!!. The 6 day Garden Route tour with Earthstompers has been amazing! I saw many beautiful places, did plenty of activities (hikes, canoeing, swimming, sandboarding, game drive...), stayed in lovely accommodations (did not matter if Backpackers or Guesthouses, they all were very nice and had an individual atmosphere) and had the best tour guide ever!!! Many thanks to Cindy for making this trip unforgettable!! We were a group of 7, all very nice people and we all got along very well. I would definitely recommend this tour to others, it was an experience I did not want to have missed. Thanks again to Earthstompers Adventures for everything :))
An amazing week, perfect and Cindy the guide was simply marvellous.. Everything good, smart chosen, beautiful, nice, friendly, tasty, splendid, original. Nothing else to say more : get on the bus!

6-day Garden adventure route tour. Very well organised! Our tourguide Rochelle was very good, she could answer all our questions, and she made sure you feel at ease at all times. She made sure there was a good vibe in the group, she had a great sence of humour. Off course you have to be lucky with the people in the group as well, everyone in our group was enthusiastic and active. I am 33 years old and I was single traveler for that week. Earthstompers have chosen very nice accomodation and restaurants as well. For me the right combination of doing an active tour and chill in the evening. I would definitely book again with Earthstompers!

Great time!. Took the 5-day trip and it was great fun. I stayed in the guest houses and enjoyed the chance to see a range of properties. Even better, we had dinner at the Backpackers (hostels) three of the nights with the people in our group who were staying in those. It gave me a chance to see both options. And, the dinners were delicious. Daytime activities were varied, fun and interesting - a good amount of outside activity to offset the long car rides between places.Our guide, Charlene, was knowledgeable and easy-going. Everything together made for a wonderful Garden Route tour. Thanks!
Amazing trip. This 6-day-trip at the Garden Route was absolutely amazing. I can highly recommend that tour! Most of the hostels are very cosy and right next to the beach as well the BnB's are.

Adventures!!. Had an absolute blast with Stephanie rolling through the Hills of South Africa! All accommodations and hosts were wonderful. The itinerary is a great mix of beauty and adventure. And meeting people from all around the world was an added bonus. You won't regret it.
Earthstompers 6 day Garden Route. Excellent , value added trip across the garden route with good attention, variety, great accommodation and a very good knowledge from our guide.

Wonderful. We took the 6 days adventure tour and it was just amazing. The activities were great and our guide, Stephanie, was great. She gave us a lot of information about everything we were crossing by and her country in general. We really appreciated. In addition she was so helpful with the booking and the logistics of our different optional activities. The different backpackers we stayed in were very nice, the food was delicious, the activities were so diferent and nice (there is not so many country where you can bungee jump, do a safari, a shark cage diving, enjoy the beach... in a so short period of time). South Africa is a very beautiful country and visiting it with a small group is definitly a good option. It has been a great week for us and we totally recommend the tour with Earthstompers.

Amazing tour . We booked the 5 day Garden Route and Addo Adventure with the Safari Extension. Our Guide Charlene was great. She gave us a lot of information about the landscape, animals, food, wine, culture... She knows everything about her home country and that was a big enrichment for us :) Due to we had nearly every age on our group, different nationalities, single travellers, friends and couples we had a lot of interesting conversations while we travelled through the beautiful Garden Route.It was an adventurous trip with great activities which everyone enjoyed a lot.The accomodations (we booked backpacker style in a twin room) were nice, clean and especially with it's own special character.After the amazing Addo we had a meeting point for our Safari Extension and had to say goodbye to our group.We are really happy that we decided to do the tour with Earthstompers. So we can totally recommend the tour and the Safari Extension.

An absolute must - just incredible. What an amazing experience. Our guide Rochelle was the best guide I have ever had and I'm a pretty seasoned traveller. She was organised, fun and clearly passionate about her beautiful country. The tour was busy and fun, I stayed in the bed and breakfast and the rooms were beautiful, we had dinner at the backpackers every evening and these were equally good, so either option would be great. You see and do so much: canoeing, caving, hiking, zip wiring, sky diving. The food is fantastic too.

Amazing Garden Route experience. I attended the 6 days Garden Route trip of Earthstopers recently and I was amazed how perfect they organised the program for the small group. Everything was perfect, professional, including our guide. The Garden Route is one of the most beautiful in South Africa.

Recommendable tour, good vibe, great guide. I had a really good experience with Earthstompers Adventures. The organisation of the tour was good and everything worked out well. Our guide was laid-back, well informed and a lot of fun. Our age range was between 25 and 65! The hikes were not too difficult and the extra activities were a lot of fun (for those who did them...). I would really recommend Earthstompers Adventures! Thank you very much!

Do not hesitate to book!. Awesome.This 5-day tour was exceptional value for money.The activities have been chosen to be both great fun, challenging and show-off the best that this area has to offer. The accommodation was first rate. I chose the guest house accommodation and most of my nights were truly beautiful (especially Dover-on-Sea at Sedgefield) but the hostel accommodation (where you eat at night) was cool, funky and very very clean. I would happily have stayed there. The meals which are included are delicious and very much appealed to the foodies in our group - also authentically SA.I would recommend all of the activities especially the canoeing/hiking (included) and our group did a mixture of the extra activities. All were superb.Our guide (Rochelle) went above and beyond. She was knowledgable, cheerful, caring and very very hardworking. She made sure everyone in the group was happy and well informed throughout. She really turned a wonderful trip into an unforgettable holiday of a lifetime. She has an expert knowledge of her country and the Garden Route and is proud to be an ambassador to visitors.I cannot recommend this trip more highly.

This trip exceeded all expectations!. I was thoroughly impressed from beginning to end with Earthstompers. Wild Wings Safari was our "travel agency" in South Africa that put me in touch with Earthstompers. Booking the trip was easy and painless. The trip itself was exceptional. Rochelle was our guide and she was extremely knowledgeable (I did ask her a ton of questions). We were a group of 8 girls whom all connected well. We would spend all day together so it was fun getting to know other people from different parts of the world. My girlfriends and I stayed at the most adorable guest houses and the rest of the girls stayed at the backpackers option. For dinner we would all eat together at the different backpackers facility which was great!!! Either sleeping accommodation is great. Everyone we interacted with was so incredibly nice and helpful. I only wish South Africa was closer to the US so I could return sooner! I highly recommend this trip if it's your first time in South Africa and beginning your trip in Cape Town. You will see and do a lot and meet great people. I also recommend for someone traveling alone too.

Great Tour!. It was a great tour! Daily activities was so fun and active. Tour guide was so knowledgeable and friendly. Love the food and accommodations. I just love everything about it.We made the right decision in choosing EarthStompers!

THE BEST TRIP EVER ++. Thank you Earthstompers for a truly amazing trip - and thank you Charlene for putting up with all of us and explaining to us about everything en-route - you made it a trip of a lifetime for me.

Had a great trip - 6-day Garden Route tour. We had a great trip. Our guide was great, and it was a real nice group. The tour is a little bit adventurous, which we liked. All the accomodations were great too. Totally recommended!

Amazing. Loved every minute of this trip. Adventure in the caves, tree canopy, amazing beaches, penguins, skydive & so much more in the 6 day tour. Would recomend the guest house upgrade as they were beautiful & worth the extra money. Everyone always included. Went with partner & friends so good to do with both.

AMAZING trip!. We absolutely loved our trip with Earthstompers and have recommended it to a lot of people since we got back. It had been recommended to us by one of my closest friends, so we had high expectations, but they were still exceeded. The trip is extremely well organised, Rochelle, our guide, was lovely. The places we stayed at were great (backpackers en-suite), very realxed, clean, good food! The activities were fun and exciting. The beaches were absolutely stunning, and we didn't even have the best weather. Definitely do the sandboarding and the adventure tour at the caves! And choose the backpacker option, the guesthouses were often too far away to walk, so the guys staying there missed out on some of the evening drinks... I strongly recommend this trip to everybody looking for an active, fun and relaxed holiday.

Best decision ever!. Going on this tour made my South African experience a million times more interesting and fun. Met new friends and learned so much about culture, nature and history. I strongly recommend experiencing a diversity of everything throughout the Garden Route when visiting Cape Town. And Earthstompers is the best way to go! Lucky to have the energetic and highly informative guide Cindy in our tour. Strongly recommended.

Best experience ever!. This was a completely fantastic tour hosted by friendly guides. You are constantly outstanded by the natural beauty of the country and meet some fantasic people along the way. The personal approcah the guide takes towards your trip makes it feel even more soecial. It is a once in a lifetime adventure that should be done!

such a wonderful trip !. I loved this trip very much for many reasons. First, the group was rather small ( 12) what makes easier to know each other very quickly. Our guide, Steph was very cool and always ready to give us any informations we asked for and gave us enough time to enjoy every spot where we stopped. Then, the landscapes, attractions and accomodations were very diversified and nice. I loved eating at a restaurant, feet on the sand ! Meals were very good and varied. We saw lots of animals in different lanscapes : penguins, cassies on the rocks, the game drive of course, ostriches, birds. The group was very friendly and it was a very nice travel. I recommand this trip strongly !
Hands down- the best trip ever!. Such an amazing experience! Well planned out and perfectly met our needs! Will visit them again in SA!

Great Tour. We did the Gardenroute 6 day trip and it was great. The places are well picked and also the activities were a lot of fun. Cindy was an amazing tour guide. She is so proud of her country and wants to show it to us foreigners. I loved listening to her stories that she knew about every mountain or plant. We learnt a lot and we could also ask her any questions. As we were only 7 people, we also had some flexibility and we felt like travelling with friends. I would recommend everybody to travel with Earthstompers!

Greay Tour!. I had a blast, the people were great and the Tour guide Pieter was outstanding.The places we stayed at were very nice and generally the food was good everywhere.I highly recommend this tour for people that like extreme sports and adrenaline junkies, sky diving, bungee, cave exploration, waterfalls, sand boarding, etc. I had a great time. People that do not do much sport should book a different tour, it might not be as good for you as it was for me.Great for solo travelling or with friends.

So good I didn't want to leave. I did the 5 day Garden Route and Addo with Charlene who was so knowledgeable, there were 12 people, fantastic group, we went to some amazing places, the guest houses were pretty basic but still more than comfortable, it was hard to leave.

Wonderful trip with a wonderful guide. We booked a personal 5-day tour of the Garden Route. Our guide, Stephanie, was extraordinary. While the trip would have been good without her, it was made special by her kindness, knowledge, and assistance. She seemed to have contacts everywhere and was able to get us to where we wanted to be easily. My partner is extremely interested in birding, and Stephanie is quite knowledge and was able to point out birds by the side of the road -- how she saw them while we were driving was something I never was able to understand.

Fun and activities. We had a great time. Guesthouse accomodation was very good. The food was excellent and kept to the African theme. Always on the move and plenty of things to do and see on the trip. You can choose to do all the optional activities or just go with the standard programme. Whatever suits your pace and activity level. Would recomend this to anyone. Well spent 6 days and well looked after.

6 day Garden Route and Addo. We were 11 people on the tour which I thought was a good size. Mostly between age 21-37, so definately for the young generation.I have to say the tour was a lot about 'rush rush' and not having a lot of free time. Yes we traveled 2000km in those 6 days but could not enjoy a few moments by ourselves.It was a lot about waiting for other people, people forgetting things, people wanting extra things which went on the costs of others. Also do not under estimate the time being spent driving on the road as it as A LOT - every day.We saw a lot and had fun times that's for sure. Enjoyed the ostrich farm, ziplining, sandboarding, Addo Park etc You could also go bungy jumping or skydiving.. I stayed in the single en-ensuite Hostels and was positively surprised about the rather high standard. Dinner was always delicious too (just note that for guesthouse people dinner is always being served in the hostels).I made some good friends too on this trip :-)

6 garden route adventure tours , excellent + 5 star. I book this tour on the Internet, a group of 12 people and the guide Stéphanie, she is very nice. for the photography you will loved the beauty of the area of cap townOn the first day to the last day excellent nothing bad to say , the proposed activities are for any ages, from 18 years to 55 years. About the stops we have a lot of time to drink or eat. Smile i am from france . Recommended for people likes, Natur, the adventure, the photography, the wine is a good meal .5 nights 6 day route Garden. Le tour starts from pick me up at my hotel, cape Agulhas, Oudtshoorn, Sedgefield, Mossel bay, wilderness, port Elisabeth, national park Addo end to my hotel in cap town .The guest house excellent , and amazing customer service , breadfast with champagne ( sud african ) I paye for this trip 560 euro for one personn.. to cheap for the qualities of this trip . Service : 10 Guest house :10 Guide stephanie :10 + 5 star food :10 Activie : 10 Recommandation oh yes . Thanks alot , i keep alot memory

Had an awesome experience. I very much enjoyed my trip with Stephanie.She is a fabulous tour guide and a wonderful person to get to know!!!! I did the backpackers and everyone was great except for the afrovibe. My roomie and I both found it very dirty and unsafe. But mostly dirty our bathroom smelled soo bad you had to hold your breath when entering. And if you kept the the door open the mildew smell would permeate the whole living quarters. They needed a scrub bucket and some bleach and get in that shower which is where it was the nastiest and scrub that place down. As for the unsafe there were no locks on the doors and no lockers for your stuff so i didnt like that much. But other than that 1 night the whole experience was fabulous and i would do it again in a flash. It was the best part of my african adventure!!!

very good experience. I would recommend this to anyone with a lot of energy that loves the outdoors and wants to meet new people. We covered a lot of distance, stopped at loads of locations and did quite a few activities. Pieter our tour guide was very friendly and accommodating, I really appreciate that he would go out of his way to make sure everyone was happy. The only thing that was a bit of a bummer was that we didnt have enough time at some of the locations, but I guess it is a good sign that we would want to do the garden route again. Thanks

The Perfect Garden Route Tour!. I traveled with my friend this past January to South Africa. We are both females, age 27, and wanted a tour that was both safe and adventurous. This tour exceeded our expectations. We did everything we wanted to do and more. It was full of adventure, great food, and beautiful views. We got to go wine tasting, canoeing, zip lining, shark cage diving and sand boarding. We had lunch at a waterfall, went on a safari, and explored the Cango Caves. Our tour guide Cindy was very fun, knowledgeable, and was certainly a contributing factor to our fantastic experience. My friends are all telling me they want to travel to South Africa now after seeing and hearing about my trip. I don't normally bother writing reviews but Earthstompers gets my highest recommendation. Baie Dankie Earthstompers!

Garden Route Addo Tour Eastern Cape South Africa. Our trip with EarthStompers along the Garden Route and Addo Elephant Park were both exciting and enjoyable. Our guide/driver was well informed, very personable and caring. Our group consisted of 8 individuals, plus the guide/driver, which was the perfect number for a group travelling on this type of adventure. Our accommodation and food were excellent. I would recommend EarthStompers as an excellent choice to use while visiting South Africa.

Such a fun trip with an amazing guide! Highly recommend. I was a solo traveller as part of the Addo - Garden Route tour. We had a really easy going group which made it so enjoyable. Our guide, Steph, was also amazing and extremely knowledgeable about the local ecology and general history of the areas we passed through. If you are a thrill seeker or just want to see something different in South Africa, I would highly recommend this tour with Earthstompers! Amazing. Thanks guys :)

Loved it !!. The excursions were amazing. Loved the shark diving and the safari the most. We packed so much into the 6 days without feeling rushed at all. Our guide Pieter was brilliant- So organised, friendly and always made the effort to keep everyone in the group happy. We stayed in the backpackers accommodation which we were really happy with, each place was a lot nicer than we had expected- really clean with lovely staff. Even had a sea view on a couple of the nights! I was worried when I booked it about feeling ill as I get travel sick, don't let this put you off as you have regular stops and the roads are usually long and straight so I didn't feel ill once. Definitely worth booking!
Steph is the best!. Overall great tour. Well organized and executed. Food and accommodation were on point and our guide Steph did a fantastic job.

Best part of my South African adventure!!. Everything from the excursions, the accommodation, the food and especially our guide Cindy was incredible. I would recommend Earthstompers to everyone. You see so much in such a short amount of time, and for the price I paid I couldn't believe the quality of everything we got. Thanks again to the whole Earthstompers team, you made my trip to SA truly memorable and now I can't wait to get back!!!

Perfect tour. We were incredibly impressed with this tour, our first of this kind. It was timed well so we didn't feel bored or rushed. And all the stops were so fun. We stayed at bed and breakfasts that I would definitely return to. Great choices. Our tour guide was knowledgable and fun.

Absolutely great!. This tour far outweighed my expectations. Our tour guide Peter couldn't have been any more welcoming and professional throughout the trip. We were able to do so many great excursions and i had a life changing experience. Doing the bungee jump was by far my favourite day and i would highly recommend. As a single traveller i stayed in the backpackers accommodation. Everywhere we stayed was very clean and the evening meals were exceptional. I think it was much more fun staying at the backpackers as you get involved with everything. Peter went out of his way to make sure everyone got to do the excursions we wanted and you were provided with lots of options each day. The bus journey was good and always had appropriate rest stops along the way. The beginning of the Garden Route tour is absolute breathtaking and has spectacular views. 100% if you get offered the change of Shark Diving DO THIS! Its amazing to see these animals. Thanks very much for a great time :) Rachel
Still Thinking About It. This trip was the best adventure! Each day packed with interesting new things to do and see! Accommodations beyond expectations. Highly recommend!

Amazing garden route tour. Booked this from the UK, easy and lots of communication. I selected guest house accommodation which all were lovely. Our guide Charlene was very patient, informative, friendly and really helpful. There were 2 minibuses, so 2 guides and Cindy other guide was equally helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. The itinerary was a great way to see the garden route and the added bonus Addo elephant park. A good mix between trying different food, wine tasting, buying the best gin in the world, some walking, canoeing & swimming. Definitely recommend. They also do optional activities but don't push them if you don't want to do them. Thank you so much we have had a great insight to South Africa & look forward to the food & wine tours.

An outstanding way to see the Garden Route!. I spent the week over Christmas with Earthstomper's fabulous guide, Rochelle, and 5 others. From the moment we were picked up, Rochelle went above and beyond her role to look after us, get to know us, share her passion and love for the country, and make our Christmas unforgettable! Each day had a well thought out and planned itinerary which allowed us to see and experience as much of the beautiful country on the route as possible. It was certainly an active tour and I particularly enjoyed the gentle canoe followed by a tranquil le walk to a waterfall for lunch in Wilderness; it was easy to understand why Rochelle loves her job so much with all the stunning places to see!The transport was very comfortable, modern and ideal for a road trip. The accommodation always had a great atmosphere and the dinners and breakfasts were all superb! Waking up early Christmas Day and heading out to see lions, elephants, buffalo, zebra, warthogs, ostriches... in Addo was a real highlight as was the magnificent accommodation on Christmas Eve; a little slice of paradise.This was a truly unforgettable trip and I would definitely go on it again! Thank you, Earthstompers, especially Rochelle who made our Christmas so wonderful!

Very well organized and wonderful tour. I wasn't sure about booking this tour as I didn't know what to expect. I'm glad I decided to do it. We has a blast. Our guide Rochelle is one of the best guides I've ever met. I am not sure if the trip would have been the same without her. She is so friendly, knowledgeable, accommodating, considering to everyone's character and personality. We were a nice mix of 6 people from 5 different nationalities and we all enjoyed it to the max. The activities were nice and varied and the choice of accommodation was very good. Book this tour and ask for Rochelle to be your guide!

Exellent Tour. The Earthstompers Tour was fantastic, exceeded my expectations. Excellent tour guide Cindy, very knowledgeable and personable yet professional. Every day was face paced, there was loads to do but no obligation to pay for extra activities if you didn't want to. Excellent route and trying all the traditional foods was a really nice touch. Would definitely recommend this tour and have already done so!

6 day Garden Route South Afrika. Very well organized 6 day trip. Very enthusiastic tour guide. Safe driver. Very good accommodations and good food. Places we visited were carefully selected. The facultative activities were also very wel organized and professional. A real recommendation!The group was mixed in age: 32 -71. Couples and singles.

Unforgettable Experience. We had to reschedule our trip 3 times due to some personal unintended issues.A very big heartfelt 'Thank you' to Earthstompers for your kind understanding!Nothing can be better than what Charlene (our most caring and energetic guide) had arranged for us. We took 6 days Garden Route. Excellent Guest Houses, variety of food, lots of activities, pristine beaches, beautiful wild life & never tiring smiley Charlene have stolen our heart. We recommend Earthstompers wholeheartedly.

Garden Route Experience. Very well organized, overnight stops located in marvelous places , especially Sedgefield, one near citrus plantation and Agulhas Cape- we took upgrade backpackers package. Variety of great meals during whole trip. Tour guide (Stephanie) knowledgeable, helpful, caring and a very good driver! Fantastic people from all over the world in our group, great atmosphere everyday. Many activities to choose during tour, bungee, sky diving, ostrich farm etc. Is not coach type of tour, flexibility is an advantage just be on time on bus.

Very good tour! Perfectly organzied, good accomondations, nice guide and a lot to see and fun. We had the 6 day garden route tour with earthstompers. They are interessted to show people as lot as possible about the beautiful country. In my opinion they take care very much about their guests and the country. All accomondations very nice. Even if we had to drive long distances, it was never the Feeling of "loosing time in the car" ... The guide always told us interesting Storys, we made stops inbetween to visit nice places and had also some time to relax or shop a little bit. We can recommend earthstompers 100%

A perfect trip in Southafrica 🐘. The tour with all the places we visited with our favourite stop the Addo Elephant Park was just fabulous. You have to have a little bit of patiece in the park, but in the end we have seen a whole Elephant Family and a lot of other beautiful african creatures out there. Beside our personal highlight the tour was totally organized. Every night a great new guesthouse or hostel and yummie dinner. We just can say thank you to Cindy, our guide. She explaint everything to us and took care about everyone and you can see that she just loves her job and southafrica. So just perfect. Thank you for six beautiful days.

Great tour. My husband and I did the 6 day Garden Route tour + Addo, and very much enjoyed it. Our guide, Rochelle, was excellent, and we enjoyed the company of the other tour members too. Although we were easily the oldest on the tour, we felt very much part of the group and took part in many/most of the activities .

Highly reccomendable tour. The Garden Route with Earthstompers was amazing. All arranged in detail and with freedom to do activities as you like. In 6 days you get a great impression of this part in South Africa and with Cindy as a tour guide you cannot be in better hands! Food was good and hostels of quality as expected.
Garden Route of S. Africa with Charlene. This was a great tour. Nice mix of activities. Really enjoyed the Wilderness kayak/hike to the waterfall. Charlene was great. Baie dankie!

Fantastic tour - amazing week. What a fantastic week - amazing sights, delicious food and drinks, unbelievable adventure experiences and awesome places to stay. Huge thank you to Charlene, our guide for the week, who from day one was going out of her way to make each day super cool for everyone. Thank you so much. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to see a little more of South Africa than just Cape Town. You won't be disappointed.

Amazing tour and brilliant guide!. We did the Garden Route 6 day tour and it was incredible! We saw amazing views, wildlife, had unbelievable experiences and an overall wonderful time. The tour guide, Charlene, was just brilliant, extremely knowledgable about all the stops, the nature, the wildlife (birds in particular!) and couldn't have made us more welcome or been more helpful. Really great route, you get to see everything you could want, everything was well planned and there are some great optional extra activities too - definitely do the early morning game safari! Would recommend this tour to anyone. Thanks!
great experience. The trips was an excellent combination of amazing places, great food and very nice company. I highly recomend it

Amazing!. Fantastic 6 day trip with Cindy as our guide. Her passion for the country is truly inspiring. Stayed in the backpackers dorm accommodation and all was great! Loved the whole trip. Very well organised and fantastic optional activities.

Earthstompers garden Route Tour. I had a really fantastic experience with Earthstompers doing their garden route tour. The tour was well planned and our tour guide Rochelle was absolutely amazing throughout and really made she trip. Rochelle was enthusiastic about everything, super knowledgeable, fun and so helpful driving everyone to their optional activities. As a company Earthstompers are ethical and encourage sustainable and responsible travel, which I loved. Last but not least, all the accommodation was great, well chosen and the food was beautiful. I'd highly recommend to anyone.

Amazing experience!. We had the best time on this trip. Our guide Cindy was so wonderful and made everyday fun and exciting! We had never stayed in backpacker accomodation before but absolutely loved every place we stayed at. Would highly recommend this to anyone!

Amazing trip and beautiful part of the world. I had a really amazing time on the Earthstompers Garden Route tour 19-24 October. I would do the trip again – it is such a beautiful part of the world. For us this was a better option than hiring a car and self-driving the garden route because you pack a lot in and get to see so much more. Plus our guide Rochelle was fantastic – really informative and passionate about South Africa. When the rain almost prevented us from canoeing in Wilderness, Rochelle even had a number of alternative options for us, meaning we got a bonus visit to an amazing cave. And thankfully the rain stopped and we did get to do the canoeing as well, which was definitely one of the highlights of the trip for me.We stayed in the guest houses and the accommodation was a very high standard. We ate at the hostels each night with the group and they had a really nice vibe to them as well. The food was really lovely and they provide great vegetarian options.I can thoroughly recommend Earthstompers – not only was the trip itself really great, but the office staff are really helpful. Thank you so much!

Exceeded my expectations. I had such an amazing time on the 6 day Garden Route tour. Hendrik and Rochelle are both great guides with an inherent passion for what they do. We were on the go every day, so never any opportunity to get bored and the activities were lot's of fun too. The canoeing in Wilderness and the game drive in Addo were my two highlights - but each day was special ion its own way. A lot of care and attention is taken in the accommodation selection - each backpackers and guesthouse was a little bit off the beaten track and had it's own character. Big ups to the Earthstompers team. I'll definitely be back with entourage in tow.

Incredible. We had such a ball during our tour with Earthstompers Adventurers. We had such an active and fun week of adventure. A big thank you to our tour guide, Steph, she was super fun and very informative.

Amazing Trip!. Staff are very friendly, helpful and gives informtive facts, they are very warm and caring (rochelle, stephanie and cindy), the trip was simply awesome and we would certainly recommend you to our friends. Eric and Kent
Brilliant trip. Can't fault anything about this trip. Our guide Charlene was absolutely amazing.. The places we stayed were fab!!! Can't wait to get back to South Africa!

Great 5 Day Garden Route Trip. Fantastic trip from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth. Never too long in the van, but do be prepared to buy a few lunches and snacks along the way. The hostels were quite good, and had great food, especially the Thursday night at Avoca. The activities are well chosen, as are the options - a lot of thought has gone into these. Steph was a great guide, who clearly loves what she does.This is part of a 6 day trip, but I cannot recommend enough to skip the trip back and do the safari extension at PE. The two days at Amakhala were the most amazing ones of my month in Africa.

Fantastic 6 day Garden Route tour!. Absolutely great 6 day tour! Charlene, our guide, was so welcoming, knowledgeable and friendly throughout. The days were well planned out and the backpackers lodges were all of fantastic quality. Thank you!

6 Day Garden Route and Addo Tour. Superb holiday with many highlights such as the Addo Elephant National Park and amazing landscapes, The long days of travel were split up with plenty of stops. Our guide was fantastic (Rochelle) and arranged alternatives when an event was cancelled due to bad weather. Definitely recommended,

6 day Garden Route Tour. We booked our Garden Route tour in the UK through an agent so we had no idea who we were doing the tour with until a few days before the tour when I received an email from Hendrick. Having already spent a week being spoilt on a safari lodge I was less than looking forward to staying in "hostels" but boy was I wrong. The accommodation on this tour is actually of quite a high standard and would recommend to anyone to pick this option over the guesthouse, the hostels are very homely and nothing what I expected so was pleasantly surprised, all the food was fresh and home cooked, the atmosphere was brilliant and the hosts did everything they could to accommodate you. The garden route is stunning and we were lucky enough to have nice weather throughout our trip and even luckier to have such an amazing guide in Charlene, she was very knowledgable and even went out of her way to retrieve my partner's IPad when he left it at hostel. There is a wide choice of optional activities to do and Always something to keep you busy. All in all it was a great second half of our holiday to South Africa and we met some great people from all over the world.

A fantastic tour with a fantastic guide. We had such a great week with Charlene as our guide. She is so passionate about South Africa and it was so interesting to chat to her and grill her with questions. She knows all about the flora and fauna and so the trip was so informative. The trip was very well organised, enabled us to see the main sights of the garden route, whilst also being taken off the beaten track to stay in really wonderful locations. The guest room option was definitely worth it as the guest houses were amazing. A really super company to travel with. Thank you!

Absolutely brilliant . I honestly do not have a single bad thing to say about EarthStompers. I did the 5 day tour + safari extension. Hendrik and Chrissy were great at keeping in touch pre-departure and thoroughly answered all my questions and made useful suggestions. Our guide, Charlene, was wonderful. She made the trip extra special and knew so much about everything we encountered. Even with the extra activities, the itinerary was excellent value for money without comprising in quality. The backpackers we stayed in were all of a high standard and made some incredible food. Be warned though, the trip is intense with activities and does have some long driving - unavoidable unfortunately but the journey is beautiful and you get to see all the best bits of the garden route as a result. The safari extension, although expensive (most safaris are) was worth the money. It was a unique experience staying in Amakhala in a tent and definitely a highlight. I wish EarthStompers would cover the rest of this beautiful country - 200% recommended!

Absolutely fantastic!. Really enjoyed the 6 day garden route tour and would definitely recommend Earthstompers to everyone. The things you see and do on the tour are incredible- from the herd of elephants we saw in Addo to zip lining through the trees in Tsitsikamma. Our guide was absolutely fantastic and looked after us very well (thank you so much Charlene :D )

6 Day Garden Route Adventure 6-11 July 2015.. "But you're not a backpacking type ..." thought a friend. Think again!To be honest I'd already blown my budget with an upcoming Peregrine Kenya/Tanzania tour but wanted to see the Garden Route too. With guide Rochelle I immediately knew I'd made the right choice and our disparate group of four from 18 to never mind had such fun and will remain a highlight of my African trip. I'd upgraded to en suite rooms which were well worth it. Don't expect hairdryers, great lighting or good powerpoints but be amazed at how liberating a new attitude to travel and adventure can be. The tour exceeded all my expectations and thank you again to Rochelle who helped make it possible for me to accept a job offer back home which made my holiday. It sounds easy but not at the Southernmost tip of a different continent! TIA ('This Is Africa!') doesn't keep her from getting the job done - with a smile. You'll be in good hands with Rochelle and Earthstompers.

MUST DO WHEN IN CAPE TOWN!. This was truly an amazing week, spent with the best tour guide Rochelle. We got to see the true cultural side of the western cape while enjoying some of the best adventurous activities followed by breathtaking scenic drives. Definitely recommend for people of all ages. This is an awesome company who really go out of their way to make sure you have a wicked time. And the backpackers accommodation is some of the coolest places we have stayed in. Awesome!

Garden Route Tour. As a middle-aged woman who looks much younger, I highly recommend this tour! Steph was the excellent tour guide for our motley yet wonderful group. I should first start off by stating that Earthstompers was excellent at accommodating a health condition that I had and made tremendous efforts to make sure that I was comfortable on this trip! Next, Steph was funny, warm, and very informative -I learned a lot about the flora and fauna of South Africa. The adventure part of my trip was doing the 90 minute Cango Cave adventure route which involves going through very claustrophobic spaces! (I hope the embarassing picture of me sliding out of a narrow space does not surface). South Africa is beautiful! Do the tour and enjoy!

Great Tour. This is a great tour to take if you're traveling SA. I'm about 2 months late for this review, but my experiences stuck with me. The guide, Rochelle, had a great spirit and though we had some rough weather, she was able to keep our morale high and made sure we continually had things to look forward to. It was a fickle group with fickle weather and yet our guide managed to make the most of it. Hope I can return one day and stomp SA with Earthstompers once again under more favorable skies. Cheers! -n.m.

6 day Garden Route. I can only praise this company with my whole heart. I was with a small group together with my friend and we had Charlene as tour guide. She is absolutely a wonderful person and I'm so happy I got the chance to do the tour with her. She knows a lot about the area and did her best to give everyone the best experience as possible. We have done some amazing things (bungee jumping) and we always stayed in very nice and cozy backpackers. The diners were absolutely mind blowingly jummie and most of the time really typical South African, which I really liked (we ate for example ostrich meat, did a nice braai and ate potje). Unfortunately my dorm was broken into and me, my friend and a girl from the group were robbed from our camera's and money. We lost all of our pictures and this was of course a very sad experience. Everyone (the company, the owners of the farm where we stayed and Charlene) were very shocked, because it has never happened before on a tour. Even though I had the feeling my entire holiday was ruined, Charlene managed to make me smile and enjoy myself again (and I'm very thankful for that). Earthstompers sent us a heartwarming email and we were taken to diner to a very nice restaurant, where we had an amazing night. We can't get our pictures back, but my memories will always remain and I will definitely remember how well I was taken care of in the sad circumstances. Thank you for the amazing trip Charlene and Earthstompers!

6 Day Garden Route Tour (South Africa). I had a great tour with an affordable price and packed with great activities including hiking, canoeing, wine tasting, a safari in Addo, and scenic views every day. Our tour guide really made the trip even better than it already was, and was also very knowledgeable about anything that we had to ask. One thing to note about this tour is that some activities that are really worth doing are not included in the price, such as shark cage diving, bungee jumping, an extra early morning game drive, sand boarding, skydiving, zip-lining, etc.

6-day tour garden route. Had an lovely experience with an even better guide. It was really well organized, slept in really good places. Good value for your money. I can recommend this to anyone of any (adult) age

garden route and addo. well organized and very good quality tour, beautiful places, nice food, very good backpackers and an excellent tour guide!! I recommend Earthstompers Adventures to everyone!Eleonora, 30/06/2015

Fantastic Garden Route Journey. We travelled as a couple in a small mixed group (7) of all ages and had a fantastic holiday that ticked so many boxes in just one week. First of all I should say that this tour offers unbelievable value for money but can be easily adapted to suit your budget and preferences. We choose to stay at backpackers but upgraded to private en-suite and were really impressed at what we got. The tour is really well thought out and followed the itinerary but our guide (Pieter) was really happy to adapt things to suit peoples wishes. The food provided is of a very good standard and you get to try many local dishes. Food and drink in South Africa are of a very good quality and along the route there is plenty of opportunity to sample so much! The activities built into the tour gave an excellent flavour of everything we wanted to do along the Garden Route and for us the tour took away the hassle of organising things ourselves. If you are looking for a great value Garden Route tour that wont break the bank but still exceeds expectations - this is the one for you.

Family Trip on the Garden Route. Our family of four (2 parents / 2 tweens) very much enjoyed the venues and services provided by Earthstompers on the Garden Route. Our guides Rochelle and Charlene were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We opted for the Backpackers' accommodations and felt much more a part of the evening fun, as the dinners take place at the backpackers' lodges, not the more luxurious accommodations (which are often a bit further away). We strongly advise signing up for as many optional programs as possible: it's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to do the "special" cave tour, sky-dive or bungee-jump! The company is well managed and the itineraries well planned.

Great time on Garden Route. We had a fantastic time on the Garden Route 6 day tour. It was a great mix of nature, relaxation, and adrenaline. On a few days we ran into some weather (we took the tour in the winter) but our guide was tireless and creative in finding alternatives that better fit the weather conditions.

This was not just a trip; it was the journey of a lifetime!. This was my second time bringing college students to South Africa. I had taught a class about the culture and history of South Africa. Earthstompers accommodated all the museums and historical spots I wanted to include, besides making this journey beautiful and an emotional journey through history. We saw wildlife galore, gorgeous coast, mountains, caves, had spectacular food, a drumming circle on the beach, and got to visit Townships where we met real people, real teachers, and saw real life as well as all the tourist must-see spots. We feel as if we lived South Africa instead of just sight-seeing. Every student wants to return. The variety of accommodations were all comfortable and what we hoped for. Earthstompers did all this within the budget I gave them. They are AMAZING! I'd recommend them to the end of the earth. They only hire knowledgeable, wonderful guides. I'll use them again, absolutely!

Garden Route!. We had a great time on this trip! My sister and I had previously been to South Africa and heard wonderful stories about the Garden Route and Southern Coast. We vowed that we would come back and see all those beautiful places- and we are so glad we did! The Earthstompers 6 Day Garden Route & Addo Tour was great! See got to see all the highlights along the way and Rochelle was a amazing guide. Getting the opportunity to meet other travelers and not have to worry with trip details was exactly what we wanted with picking a tour company! I would definitely recommend Earthstompers and the Garden Route tour.

Amazing tour!. This tour was awesome. The events, food, people and accommodation were all amazing and fun. The Earth Stompers staff are also really friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our tour guide, Rochelle, was awesome. Highly recommended!

Garden route Marissa and Maggie. We really loved this trip!! It included everything we had expected and more! First of all, we had a really cool and chill guide (charlene) who could tell us everything about the surroundings, culture, people, and birds ofcourse :) Also, the accomodation was amazing: I really think we had the best hostels in town everytimy, and the food was both healthy and really good every night. We would definitely recommend this trip!

Amazing Time on the 6 Day Garden Route & Addo Tour. I had an incredible time on the Earthstompers 6 Day Garden Route & Addo Tour and I would recommend it to anyone. Our group had people of all ages and nationalities as well as solos, friends, couples and family and by the end of the tour, everyone felt more like friends than strangers. The dinners were delicious in each of the places we stayed and the accommodations were great and tailored to individual budgets. Full credit goes to our stellar guide Charlene for being such an incredible host, logistics coordinator, driver and keen eyed animal spotter. Her love and enthusiasm for South Africa and its people was easily conveyed and she did an amazing job keeping us all informed, entertained and on schedule. Thanks again Charlene for everything and for making the trip so memorable for everyone. You've no doubt inspired many return visits to South Africa!

Perfect to get a taste of the Garden Route. I had a great time on the trip. Everything was very well organized and our guide Charlene did a awesome job. This trip was perfect to get a feeling of the area. After this experience I'm coming back for sure. I'll definitely recommend this tour to my friends and colleagues.

Chief Rochelle is awesome. Rochelle is the best tour guide ever. She is hilarious and keeps us entertaining the whole trip. She is a trained professional and knows what she's doing. If she doesn't know the answer, she will do her research until you are satisifed. The whole tour is extremely fun, very organized, and had a lot of great braai.
Garden Route Tour. This tour was fantastic. It was well organised and it was so much fun with our amazing tour guide Rochelle. I would recommend it to everyone who wants to book a Garden Route Tour.

Enjoyed every minute!. Although older than the average backpacker, I had a great time! The guide was brilliant, full of interesting information. The hostels were in amazing locations and had a wonderful atmosphere. The food was to die for. Excellent value for money.
Enjoyed it from first to last second!. Great value for that money. Fantastic driver and guide. Have seen a lot of awesome things, have slept in very nice backpackers. Very good atmosphere!
