Meet the amazing Anine!!. We were in SA just some weeks ago and whilst in Cape Town wanted to catch the grapevine! We contacted Cape Fusion not expecting to fuse and get amused by the amazing Anine. Not only was she good at her job. She was a fantastic guide, great company, very humorous and knew exactly how to make our day memorable and happy. She entertained our 4 year old whilst we toasted at the Winelands. Cant wait to go back and meet Anine again. Anine please don't say - OH MY HATTT not them again. Salome Sean and Alize'

Awesome Anine. Anine was everything one would want in a tour guide, and then some. I was eager to tour a winery, but it had to fit into my schedule--and I had other ideas about what I wanted to see and do in my too-brief time in Cape Town. Too much to do in too little time, and a woman traveling alone to boot. She was very helpful from the beginning in helping me sort out the possibilities, giving me lists of restaurants, galleries, shops, and other places to see on my own. She picked me up and drove me to Constantia, but worked in many of the other sights, as well, making it a wonderful day. Her advice on where I could comfortably go alone was a valuable extra. Contact her if you're going to Cape Town--you won't be disappointed.

Amazing Day in the Winelands. So glad we found Pam to do our tour of the winelands. From the first communication she was responsive and easy to work with and planned an amazing day for us based on our interests of wine and art. She also was quick to adapt and suggest ideas throughout the day to ensure we got to see and do everything we wanted to. I'm in awe at how much we covered and got to do - and never felt rushed. She did a great job recommending a range of vineyards as well as key shops in the towns that were worth stopping in to that gave us an ideal overview of the region. We had a spectacular lunch at Delairre Graff and ended the day with a wonderful walk through the galleries at Grand Provence and the gardens of Babylonstoren.

Memorable and fun!. Pam is energetic, passionate and extremely knowledgable about the history of South Africa, the cape, the winelands and all the amazing gourmets experiences that can be found in and around Cape Town. With very little time to explore, we were so lucky to have Pam as our guide!! She is a fountain of knowledge, very easy going and loads of fun to spend time with too.

A Foodie's Nirvana. Pam took us on a delightful tour of the Paarl and Stellenbosch regions, all the while filling us with informative and entertaining anecdotes about the area and its characters. History was never so interesting. The wine & cheese (Goats do Roam) and chocolate tastings were superb - as was the exquisite tasting menu and wine samplings at Jordan wines and resto. Pam flexed her plans and timing to meet our evolving interests and needs, including a delivery to the airport. If you are not a fan of wine tours, I can guarantee that Pam will convert you - she was the highlight of my visit to Cape Town and I would recommend her service as a "must" to anyone visiting the area. Thanks, Pam!

Wine tour with energy and enthusiasm!. Pam took us on a fantastic wine tour during our honeymoon - she is fantastic fun, very knowledgeable about her wines, good food, the region, and South Africa more generally, and also really professional. Would book with her again to visit some more vineyards if we had had the time! Thanks Pam!

Amazing three days of tours!. Pam was highly recommended to us, so I booked her way ahead of time for the full three days we were to be in Cape Town. It was the best decision ever! Pam was very communicative and asked for our input about what we were interested in seeing, doing, and eating, and she planned us three wonderful days. First day was the Cape of Good Hope, Boulders Beach Penguins, a lovely Mothers Day Lunch at Harbour House and all sorts of other little goodies tucked in between. That day we had Anine as our driver and associate guide and really enjoyed her as well. Next day was the winelands. Along the way we had tastings of beer, chocolate, cheese and wine and saw the beautiful wineland countryside. A lovely late lunch at La Petite Ferme followed, then an interesting visit to a car museum. Day 3 was a walking and tasting tour of Cape Town, starting in Bo-Kapp and ending at the Mount Nelson Hotel. We tasted all sorts of delicious traditional foods like samosas and bunny chow, stopped at a new winery tasting room, and also visited several Interesting crafty shops such as Monkeybiz and Streetwires. We were also treated to a visit with David, who makes the most delicious stew with Pap and Samp, and sells it from a kiosk at the Transit Station!Pam was very communicative, prompt, friendly, fun and outgoing. She adapted to our interests and was flexible if we happened upon something that we found interesting. She was an absolute font of information about Cape Town past and present, as well as South African history. Pam has both the knowledge and the contacts to custom tailor her tours. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of all three days....Thank You so much Pam and Anine!

Pam provides a wine country tour full of enthusiastic spirit. Pam McOnie is an ebullient sparkplug of a personality and the ideal guide to take my partner and me through the Cape Winelands. About a month prior to flying to Cape Town for vacation, I contacted her company, Cape Fusion Tours, about booking a Cape Peninsula tour for which she was not available. She immediately referred me to Lesley Cox of Amber Tours, who did a spectacular job. Pam made a smart, customer-first business move because when Lesley turned out to be unavailable for the Cape Winelands tour, she referred me back to Pam without hesitation. I think this clever networking all turned out for the best because Pam certainly knows her local wines and describes the area with great enthusiasm throughout the tour. A full day cost the two of us cost us R 2500 (approximately $240), and this consisted primarily of traversing between the two key towns in the region, Stellenbosch and Franschhoek, presumably the Napa and Sonoma of South Africa.We made stops at three wineries plus the Delaire Graff Estate to enjoy the eclectic art amid elegant surroundings as well as lunch at La Petite Ferme, a popular, rustic-elegant restaurant with a lovely hilltop view of the vineyards and the Berg River Valley. Our first winery stop was at the Waterford Estate, an exquisite chateau-like setting in the Blaauwklippen Valley, where we were served a satisfying wine and chocolate pairing in their courtyard followed by a brief tour. Next was the Stark-Condé winery in the Jonkershoek Valley, where we were taken to a charming small island in the middle of a lake where they conducted their tastings. Last was the family-owned Fairview winery famous for their cheeses and where in fact, we were served eight cheese bites to go with all the wine samplings. Pam certainly demonstrated a great deal of stamina in not trying any of the wines since she was driving. I would definitely recommend her services without question since she placed focus on our interests first.

Perfect!. Pam was amazing! She was so knowledgeable, flexible with our schedule and always punctual. We truly got a feel for Cape Town and its different personalities - it was the perfect introductory trip. We are looking forward to bringing our families back in a few years. Thank you Pam!!

Pam is the BEST!. Pam always goes out of her way to make sure every trip is perfect. We go back to the area every year now, and she's always the one we contact first. She's incredibly knowledgeable and has the contacts to take us places we'd never thought of. So nice!

A First Class Tour from someone who knows the Area so well. Pam tailored our two days with her to suit our preferences so well. She is a fount of knowledge for the area and was always informative but delivered in a fun way. She clearly loves the area and her enthusiasm is infectious. Nothing seems to be too much trouible for her. She sparkles like the wine she showed us.

I can't imagine a better Winelands experience!. We booked Pam through our travel agent and were very pleased. We were in South Africa for our honeymoon and wanted a 2-day tour of the Winelands. Pam had been given some basic info about our preferences so she had planned a few places to take us, but she was also flexible and receptive to changes as we went. She was very thoughtful, going as far as calling our hotel to ensure we had a car to take us to dinner after she dropped us off, and she was clearly focused on providing us with the experience we wanted. Also, I've been looking through our photos and Pam took several candid shots of us during the tour that are some of my favorite pictures from the whole trip. That part is definitely not in her job description but is much appreciated!I really can't recommend her enough! There's no reason to book anyone else for tours in the Western Cape!

Tour Guide DayTrips from Cape Town. We received a recommendation from friends to engage Cape Fusion Tours for our holiday in Cape Town. It turned out to be an excellent choice with four fantastic daytrips that were customised to our interests that were built around site seeing with an emphases on restaurant and wine which was clearly of mutual interest. The day was brilliantly structured to cover all of the ground we could have ever wished for with great care and attention to detail. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and clearly new many of the managers of the restaurants and vineyards and their staff such that we enjoyed a lot of personal attention even down to where we were seated that really contributed to the overall experience. Our guide was always happy to explain historic and points of interest and shared her knowledge which covered a wide range of expertise on locations and places that most tourists would never find. We had a great time and shared many amusing events with an endless variety of things to see and do from traditional to trendy, quirky to the totally unexpected which all contributed to a memorable experience. Above all the service was really relaxed from being picked up at our hotel in the morning and being returned in the evening with whatever time we wanted to spend at each location. This is a highly recommended experience for all age groups as the tour guide takes a lot of care before you travel to tailor the trips to your interests and goes out of her way to provide interesting and amusing content that is very customer focused.

A unique and unforgettable experience!. We had a private tour and cooking class with Pam (and a lovely new tour guide she was training) and this was a definite highlight of our trip to South Africa. Pam is knowledgeable, warm, entertaining and insightful. She doesn't just rhyme off historical facts - she brings the past to life with her intelligent commentary. She also loves her city and it shows, which means her tours are full of energy and colour. As part of our day, we did a cooking class in Langa township with the delightful Mama Lindy and we were so impressed with the entire experience. The food was delicious and gave us a real chance to eat what the African people traditionally eat. The cooking school, which gives young people the chance to find meaningful employment, is inspirational and we felt honoured to be a part of that, even for just a day. An amazing experience, and one we will surely not forget.

100 percent customer focused. We hired Pam for a day tour of Cape Town followed by some wine tasting in Constantia. In all cases she exceeded expectations, taking the time to learn what we would be interested in experiencing, and even taking the time to modify our itinerary on the fly as she got to know us. Ask her for her unique take on African cuisine and meeting chef David. Our first introduction to African food, and she made it educational and fun.

a unique culinary experience hunting the best and most unusual food and wine on the cape. Pam organised a private tour for some friends and I this January and joined us with another group she thought we might enjoy - different we were but for love of food and wine.In a city famous for both its dinning and wine, Pam selected an experience which allowed us in a short time to sample the best the Cape had to offer from five star dinning with paired wines with its unique influences from Malaysia and Indonesia to the strong African meat influences and spiced relishes.All told by locals chefs from Indian kitchens to African food vans to five star degustation restaurants Absolutely amazing!!

Incomparable guiding experience!. Pam's information and involvement with her city,country and its many diverse attractions is truly encyclopedic.Each walk,drive and experience is brilliantly thought out and effortlessly tailored to the clients needs and desire.She is also fun and warm and our new pal in Capetown.

A Must-Do for Foodies and Wine Lovers!. Pam came highly recommended by a friend of a friend who had visited Cape Town several years back, so I made arrangements to spend a day visiting wineries in Franschhoek and Stellenbosch with her on my recent trip. Pam was a fantastic tour guide (it felt more like talking with an old friend than with a guide) and her tour exceeded my expectations in every way. She is a wealth of knowledge about South African history and politics as well as the ins and outs of Cape Town, especially as it pertains to food and wine. As a passionate foodie and wine lover, she takes her research seriously and is constantly keeping up to date with the restaurant and winery scene. Her tour is extremely comprehensive and flexible and she works hard to cater the tour to her clients' interests and requests. Additionally, Pam was quick to respond via email when booking the tour and followed up afterwards with a list of the restaurants she had mentioned throughout the day as well as others to check out. If you are looking for a fun, comprehensive tour with a professional guide who is very in the know about what's happening in Cape Town, definitely reach out to Pam.

Pam’s the man! (OK, give me some artistic license here guys!). I came across Pam’s details – like all good finds – though a recommendation, a ‘friend of a friend’ thing. I wanted to get as much out of my trip to Cape Town as possible and get all the ‘must see’ things done as well as picking up some ‘insider’ tips too. I emailed Pam from the UK and she was quick to respond. I managed to get a walking/foodie tour lined up and set a date. On the day, Pam turned up bang on time, big smiles and lots of laughs. I knew that it was going to be a good day and – usefully – Pam had warned us (against the threat of death) not to have breakfast!We headed off in Pam’s (new and A/Cd) van and were quickly parked up in the wonderfully coloured streets and ready to get walking. Our first stop saw as getting stuck in to a tasty Samosa, a sweet doughnut-y (sorry Pam, forgotten all the names!) and a fruity, milky drink to wash it all down with. Lovely tastes and something very different. The tour got better and better. We ‘snacked as we went’ and Pam – clearly passionate about her great city – gave us the very best tips that we’d go on to use throughout the remainder of our trip. Every corner provided a nugget of history or a shop to re-visit. The tour is quite a lengthy one but Pam knows exactly how far you can go without a pit-stop. These were well-measured and at the right pace for us. The fact that nibbly bits/food are included in the tour cost means no raking round for change and showing everybody that you ‘might’ be a daft tourist!All in all, a great experience and certainly one that I’d recommend. We’ll see what else Pam has to offer next time we’re in Cape Town.Top marks.Gordon & Jorge

More than a foodie tour !. We had a great time on all three days of our stay in Cape Town with Pam. We enjoyed walking through the little streets of Cape Town on her gourmet walking tour and discovered the wine country through her expertise of the area.Her knowledge of the South African history and culture added to all the flavours she introduced while bringing us into the everyday life of Cape Town. Everything we ate and drank was interesting and delicious. We had such a memorable, fantastic, scrumptious, enjoyable experience that words can't describe it! We highly recommend this very authentic way to experience Cape Town and its cuisine.

Highly Recommended!. I traveled to Cape Town recently and one of the highlights of my trip was a customized one day tour of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek with Pam. She was flexible and worked closely with me to create an itinerary that touched upon my interests (art, design, food). It was a really wonderful day and I only wish that I had more time with her! She is very personable and full of great information! Also a fellow foodie :) She even gave me some valuable tips for the rest of my holiday!

Great "Foodie" Walking Tour of Cape Town. We recently spent a day with Pamela on a walking "foodie tour" of Cape Town. Pamela was extremely knowledgeable on the history and culture of South Africa. Her sense of humor and easy going personality made it a great day. She picked us up at our hotel and we spent most of the day walking around the major sites of downtown Cape Town. During our tour we had an opportunity to explore a variety of local foods ... the highlight was a small food stall with local African dishes. One recommendation ... eat a very small breakfast before the tour !

Great tour!. I spent two days with Pam and both were spectacular and unique. I really wanted to explore the art scene and Pam provided the perfect day of cruising around galleries, shops, and studios where local people were creating beautiful art right in front of me. We even managed to fit in Table Mountain, the Cape of Good Hope, the penguins, the historical section of Capetown and some great restaurants. Pam's vast knowledge of South African history is also very impressive. She is awesome at tailoring the tours to exactly what the client wants. A tour with Pam is not to be missed!!!

Fabulous Fusion!!!!. Amazing lady and incredibly knowledgeable on everything about Cape Town. We had a wonderful day with her in the Stellenbosch area. Her knowledge is incredible. She knows just the right places to visit and is highly respected everywhere she visits. Believe all of these fabulous reviews!!

Wonderful Day of Food Exploration with Pam. I was in South Africa with my 15 year old daughter this past June. While we had been there before, we wanted to have a tour with a more "local " flavor. We also wanted to see the wine lands. Pam was wonderful. She showed us around Cape Town popping in & out of little local food & coffee shops. We explored the food markets & tasting authentic and interesting treats along the way. While I wanted to see the wine lands, I did not it to be a typical wine tasting experience seeing that I was with my 15 year old. Pam suggested we mix in a little chocolate tasting in addition to the wines and it turned out to be a perfect day. Pam has an amazing knowledge of the South African culture and our time spent with her is a treat. I will definitely call Pam the next time we return to South Africa.

Champagne Tour with Pam was a Highlight of our Trip!. My friend and I booked the MCC (South Africa's version of champagne) tour during our visit in May. Spending time with Pam was such a joy. She was completely engaging from pick up to drop off and the conversation was easy and fun. She was full of interesting facts and we ate great food and enjoyed fabulous MCC tasting. In addition to our great tour experience, she was an integral part of our trip planning months in advance of our visit. Because of her knowledgable recommendations, we dined at some of the best restaurants in the country and had a fabulous stay at a beautiful bed and breakfast in Cape Town. We highly recommend Pam for a wineland visit. I only wish we had had the time to book a visit with her to the local cooking class. It sounds like it would have been a blast.

Highly recommend !. Pam was fabulous! We booked her for two days and it was the highlight of our trip to Cape Town. I can't imagine having seen the city without her. She is so fun, super knowledgeable and I can imagine she would get along with pretty much anyone!

Passionate Pam in the winelands. Seeing Stellenbosch for the first time with Pam was brilliant. She is passionate about everything in the region and helped us to fall in love with her country. It's just so inspiring to travel around with someone who is so positive about the possibilities South Africa has, despite understanding all of its problems . . . . oh, and great wine and food too.

Cape Malay Cooking and so much more.... We spend half a day with Pam walking the Bo Kaap and the Gardens, learned a lot about the history of Cape Town, the local food, nice restaurants and coffee shops and where to buy what. After the walk we experienced such a very warm welcome at Gamidah's house in Bo Kaap, where we prepared a delicious Cape Malay meal together. Relaxing and interesting afternoon. Pam and Gamidah, thank you both!

The best way to see Cape Town. Because we only had three days in Cape Town, we wanted to make the most of it by having expert guidance, so Pam took us out on all three days for wine and food tasting and general sightseeing. It was amazing! I expected Pam to be knowledgeable on the food and wine aspects, but wasn't expecting to be able to get so much extra information on all aspects of Cape Town life. We got to see and know about a thousand times more than we would have on our own. Pam's enthusiasm for Cape Town is thoroughly infectious and we can't wait to return. Not to mention that she is excellent company! I can't imagine having a better guide.

Traditional Cape Malay Cooking. My girlfriend and I spent half a day with Pam on a cape malay cooking tour.We were collected from our hotel by Pam at 9am and we started the day in one of cape towns lovely coffee houses (which roasted it's own beans). Over coffee Pam explained all about the history of Capetown to explain the roots of Malay cooking in South Africa. We then moved onto District 6 where we explored the wonderful District 6 Museum. Then it was off to the Malay area - Bo Kaap. We did some spice shopping then we were off to do some cooking.We arrived at Gamidah’s house in Bo-Kaap where she taught us some of her family recipes. We made a Malay chicken curry, samosas, chilli bites, rotis and finished our feast with some of Ghamidah's home made koesisters. It was great fun getting our hands dirty, rolling out rotis and folding samosas.The whole day was great and one of the best experiences we had in Capetown. Pam was very good at explaining the history of the country. While Gamidah was so good at teaching us her traditional family recipes. Both of our hosts during this tour were really fun and outgoing and really made our day.I'm sure I'll now be cooking a lot more Malay food!

Wonderful Day. My husband and I spent the day with Pam on a wine tasting tour in the Stellenbosch region. It was an amazingly relaxing day. My husband had communicated with Pam before the trip on what type of wine,food and atmospheres we enjoy and left it up to her to pick the wineries. She did a fantastic job. She selected the Spice Route(where we also did our first chocolate tasting-so fun), Tokara, Stark-Conde, Ernie Ells, and lunch at Overture. She was a great guide giving us history of the cities and wineries along the way. Sometimes it can feel awkward to spend your entire day with a guide you do not know but right from the start when she picked us up, Pam felt like a friend. We had great conversation all day. I would absolutely recommend her! This day was one of my favorites of the entire vacation.

You are in for a treat. My wife and I spent two days with Pam exploring the amazing geography, wineries, restaurants and shops outside of Cape Town. Some of our favorite stops included Jordan, Overture, and La Motte. Thank you Pam for helping make our trip spectacularly memorable!

Best Guide in Cape Town!. We had Pam as our guide for 3 days and she was absolutely amazing. She was extremely informative and planned our days according to the weather and what we were up to doing. She was so lovely and flexible with our schedule - we can't wait to see her again soon. She made us feel right at home in such a fabulous city!

The Best Way to Experience Cape Town. We only had 3 days in Cape Town and this was THE way to make the most of it. Pam packed in a ton of information, sights, and experiences in 2 days. We did the city tour and the penninsula tour. Both were awesome, and included great stops for food (coffee, bunnychow, & spicy treats)! She also gave us great suggestions for dining and things to do in the evenings. I would highly recommend hiring Pam!

Above my expectations. I met Pam during my recent trip to South Africa. I was referred to her by a friend. We did a wine tour highlighting a chocolate factory, a brewery and 3 wineries with a fabulous lunch on route. Pam's history, politics and general knowledge added immensely to the conversation and the experience. The day was one of the top days of my trip.

Best introduction to the Cape. Our first visit to South Africa-indeed our first day-and Pam was the perfect guide. She was astonishingly knowledgable about the history, politics, fauna and flora and we enjoyed the most fascinating day around the Cape. She was a terrific companion too. Don't explore the Cape without her!

Wonderful and informative tour. I have done a number of private tours over the years, but the day we spent with Pam on our Cape Fusion Tour was beyond expectation. The information that we were provided along the way was relevant, well researched and interesting. The different chocolate, beer and wine tastings locations were well planned to ensure a thorough appreciation for what the wine lands has to offer. We had a special request for a particular wine farm, and this was included seamlessly as if it was part of the schedule.Lunch was superb, as was the whole day

Great Cape of Good Hope Visit. Loved the experience... Pam is very knowledgable in history, politics and current situation of SA. Great tour guide for Cape of Good Hope visit. She is an audio book of information. Amazing sites. A must in Siuth Africa !

Wined and Dined on Valentine's Day. Cape Fusion Tours was an extremely fun and informative way to learn about Cape Town and surrounding areas. Although this was my second trip to South Africa, Pam still managed to teach me new things about Cape Town, Stellenbosch, and Franschoek. Pam was also excellent at picking out vineyards for my family of five to visit, with varying types of wines and specialties. The best part of our day was the fabulous lunch at La Petite Ferme Winery, with a slow-roasted lamb shank that I shall not soon forget!I definitely recommend Pam to anyone - whether it be a first-time traveller or a South African Native - looking to learn all the hidden secrets of the Cape.

Wonderful tour for some Canadian wine lovers. We had a great day with Pam travelling about in the different wine regions around Cape Town. She was very knowledgeable about the area and what to expect from different producers. She took us to some top notch vineyards that we probably would have missed. The highlight was the location she suggested for lunch in Franschoek; it was a wonderful restaurant with an amazing view. If you're interested in wine and looking to discover a new favorite, go on a tour with Pam.

Valentines Day tour of Wine Country. We had found Cape Fusion Tours on tripadvisor. After reading many very positive reviews we decided to see if she could accomodate our family of 5 for a day long tour of wine country during our recent holiday to South Africa. By the second email Pam had developed an itinerary for us that proved to be perfect. It included a wonderful lunch at La Petite Ferme Winery in Franschhoek. That was one of our favorite meals for the entire 3 week trip.We were all impressed with and enjoyed Pam's passion in the sharing of knowledge not only of Cape Town and the surrounding area wineries and restaurants but also the history of the areas we visited and her country in general. Pam was very accomodating and patient with our group when we would spend that little bit of extra time looking or exploring at some of our stops. Pam was not only interested in telling us about herself and her country but she was also interested in finding about our family. We will definitely look her up the next time we go to Cape Town and arrange another tour. If you want to have an enjoyable and interesting tour to some of the many wineries and restaurants in the Cape Town area from a very knowledgeable person with a passion for what she does, I would highly recommend Cape Fusion Tours.

Pam is the Greatest. We planned two days for our our trip to Cape Town to be shown around by a guide.Firstly the Southern Peninsula of Cape Town and secondly wine tasting with a relaxing lunch.Pam was recommended to us and it was a great recommendation.Her knowledge of the area is amazing along with her passion for wine and food.She showed us areas that we could never find by ourselves and introduced us to all the history of South Africa.She also had a great way of making us feel relaxed totally catering for what we wanted to do and achieve in the day.We will be coming back and for sure will meet her not only as a guide but as a friend.

Fun Times with Pam. My husband and I set up a cooking class in Langa Township with Pam. We couldn't have choosen a better tour guide. Pam knows everything about Cape Town and I mean everything. From where to eat, shop, and explore. The cooking tour to Langa Township was the highlight of our trip. Being able to cook authentic African Cuisine with locals was an absolute treat. Mama Lindy was such a joy to be around. She taught tus he importance of the African dishes to their culture. If you are going to Cape Town contact Pam.... You won't be disappointed.

Very best wine tour. This is our fourth wine tour with Pam on our visit to Cape Town and quite frankly we wouldn't go with anyone else. He knowledge of wine and the areas you visit is excellent, yet she's never 'stuffy' about our limited knowledge. The day has been an absolute delight. As we have been before, she knows what we like and customs the tour around us completely, booking our favourite restaurant and changing the itinerary to suit us.We are going again before we leave and will be looking forward to it. I highly recommend anything Pam has to offer, just let her have an idea of what wines you like. Price wise, well worth it.

Fantastic time with Pam-. We beyond loved our time with Pam- the whole tour was easy to organise, completely relaxed and enjoyable, and Pam dead-on understood our taste in wine. We tried some absolutely fabulous wine and great food, and have seen some of the most beautiful landscapes in the Cape area- we can't wait to return!

Excellent Green Wine Tour. I booked the Going Green Wine tour for me and my sister. She's a foodie and into organic. She insisted on doing a tour of an organic vineyard. Pam has a Going Green Wine Tour. The tour was excellent. We had a fabulous time with her. I contacted her 4 months in advance and she was able to get us a booking for lunch at an excellent restaurant. We visited a farm that uses biodynamic farming techniques. The wines at that vineyard were the best! Pam also took us to some scenic spots for photography, Stellenbosch, and Franschhoek.I would highly recommend this tour. Pam is warm, friendly, and full of energy. She is accommodating and will take into account your interest to carve out the perfect day trip.

An absolute MUST for all foodies visiting Cape Town. I have been using Cape Fusion Tours for the past nine years on my annual vacations in the Cape. I have come to know the area very well and regard it as a home from home. You might be wondering why then am I still using a local guide each year?The answer is really simple. Pamela McOnie is not just a local guide, but she must be the best connected guide, and the most enthusiastic foodie in South Africa. A wine day with her tends to involve not just tastings, but drives through some of the most picturesque scenery on earth, cellars tours and sometimes even meeting wine-makers. Pam is exceptionally knowledgeable about South African food and wines.Cape Town is not one of those places that you can turn up at the last minute and expect to dine anywhere, as we found on our first trip there - we ended up eating in our hotel most nights, as everywhere worth dining was enormously booked up. Now Pam books restaurants for us, and they will often be top flight, not-what-you-know-but-whom-you-know hard to get in to places, and on top of that she generally books us the table with the best view. If every destination had a Pam, the world would be a more enjoyable place.

Fab Pam and our tour Dec 2012. I first tracked Pam down by visiting this website and seeing the rave reviews on there. Having arrived just the day before Pam very promptly organised us a full day tour of Cape Town and then a full peninsula tour. What a lady - bubbly and so easy going, knows the very best off the tourist track spots and is keen to share her vast knowledge of the area whether this be history, conservation, the best bars and restaurants - you name it and she has it. Unfortunately her popularity meant we could not secure her services for the wine tours we wanted to do but here again she sorted us out with another small independent (and I think over time these two have become good friends) who was simply great too - another fantastic day tour.I cannot recommend Pam highly enough. Thanks Pam!

The best way to REALLY get to know Cape Town. Although it's easy and safe to rent a car and drive yourself in Cape Town, I can highly recommend making use of a private guide to REALLY get to know this beautiful city. Pam McOnie's local knowledge and bubbly personality makes all the difference between a reasonable stay and an exceptional one. She took us to some amazing little boutique vineyards in Stellenbosch and Franschhoek, which we would never have found on our own. That she knows the winemakers personally made it an even more unique experience. Learning about the fascinating history of our country whilst being driven through some of the most beautiful scenery was a highlight. I am definitely booking a day with Pam soon again; I need to thirst my quench both for knowledge and Sauvignon Blanc!

Fantastic - again!. We had Pam as our guide for a wine tour in February 2010 to the Stellenbosch area. Not only did she bring us to some phenomenal places to explore for wine and food, she was also extremely knowledgeable about the area which added to the experience.Last month we were back in Cape Town and Pam took us to the Biscuit Mill! Wow, what a wonderful event and way to experience a taste of Cape Town. A recommended must if you're visiting on a Saturday. Our next stop was Eziko for a cooking class on preparing the local cuisine. Mama Lindy was such a treat as the teacher as well as Victor who started the school.Pam creates a unique experience and is a pleasure to spend the day with and learn more about the Cape. Thank you for a wonderful time, again!

Cape Fusion Tours were a perfect way to spend our limited time!. Pam was engaging, knowledgeable and fun to spend the day with.Well worth it especially since our time was limited. I'd love to go back and would spend more time with Pam in a heartbeat! Highly recommended.

The Eziko Cooking and Catering School. We spent a most wonderful last day of our trip in South Africa with Pam McOnie cooking at the Eziko Cooking School and Restaurant located in the heart of Langa Township. What a great opportunity to learn about, cook, and eat a traditional meal of samp and beans, under the tutelage of the remarkable Mama Lindy. I highly recommend this activity to all travelers who want to experience the lore and tastes of the local hearth.

Highly recommended. Pam is fantastic. She knows all of the best food, wine, and shopping places, but also has a deep knowledge of the history and culture that she will enthusiastically share at the drop of a hat. Her energy is seemingly boundless. Going out with her for a day (or more if you're lucky!) is like going out with a friend who so loves her hometown that she is nearly bursting at the seams to share. As one who has traveled the world, I can confidently say that Pam is a real find. Don't miss the chance to see the Cape through her eyes. Thanks Pam!

Cape Fusion Tours - The BEST. We were fortunate to spend the day with Pam and had a wonderful time! We will be returning again and again! Pam was able to make the very most of the limited time we had available. If you are looking for a very personalized experience, look no further!

Cape Fusion Day Tour. I enjoyed a packed one day tour with Pam McOnie of Cape Fusion Tours. I was speaking at a conference and a one day tour was a wonderful gift from the organisers. Pam is incredibly knowledgeable about the history and politics of South Africa and the Cape Region. Her explanations illustrated by her experiences of student life in the 1990s provided an insight into the dramatic changes that have happened in this beautiful country over the last 20 years. Cape Town does not advertise its changeable weather but the rain and wind at Hermanus did not dampen my enthusiasm for the views of the Southern Right Whales lolling around in the bay a few metres from the shore. Pam seems happiest when discussing food and wine as we toured the estates - her real passion. If you are a foodie or have an interest in wine then I cannot imagine a better guide to the region.

Trip of a lifetime. My mom, sister and I traveled to South Africa in August and were lucky enough to have Pam McOnie of Cape Fushion tours as our guide in Cape Town. She was very knowledgable with all aspects of the penisula areas, city, attractions (i.e. Table Mountain, Lion's Head, Signal Hill) and of course the winelands!! She was extremely flexible and accomodated all three of our interests. My mom and sister didn't want to join in on wine tasting but wanted to see the winelands. Pam arranged a chocolate tasting for us followed by a wine tasting. While I was enjoying the wine, my mom and sister were able to view glass blowing!!! Pam also was more than happy to find Kodak moments for us and insisted on taking pictures with us in them!!! She was very personable and funny and made all of the history of Cape Town come to life. If ever in Cape Town, Cape Fusion Tours are a must!!!

Cape Fusion Tours - The Best!. My husband and another cupel just spent a TERRIFIC time in South Africa with Pam McOnie & Cape Fusion Tours. Pam was just FABULOUS and as great a host and guide as we could have wished for - very knowledgeable, flexible, and wonderful company. While she is extremely passionate about and a master on food and wine, we quickly learned how she knows so so much about the whole country, its history and current issues and status. This really was the trip of a lifetime for us and she helped make that happen - so much so that my husband is already talking about returning some day. If you are planning on South Africa - no matter what the duration & Itinerary you should talk with Pam 1st!!!!!Linda KPam Mc OnieCape Fusion ToursLandline: +27 21 461 2437Mobile: +27 83 235 9777www.capefusiontours.com – offering a taste of the CapeFacebook: www.facebook.com/CapeFusionToursTwitter: pammycapefoodie

I'm first in line!). I accidentally found the Cape Fusion Tour in the network three years ago ... and now, when in Cape Town, we are always with her ​​.. I highly advise you to pay attention to the specialized agencies .. They are masters in the food and wine !!! .. Fancy restaurants, special wine lunch with the family winemaker, exclusive tasting ... Pam finds amazing things! If you are traveling by yourself, then you will spend more money and do not learn anything new .... If you have time, then two or three days a week, you have to spend with Pam!

Professional, Knowledgeable and Fun!. My wife and I are from NYC. We honeymooned in South Africa this past May. We were introduced to Pam and Cape Fusion Tours by our hosts at the Welgelegen Hotel in Cape Town. My wife and I truly enjoy traveling the US and the world to find small boutique vineyards. Pam picked us up for a full day tour of Stellenbosch and took us to Meerlust, Starke-Conde, Ernie Ells and Delaire Graff. Lunch was at the exquisite Overture restaurant at the Hidden Valley Winery. Each wine estate was wonderful and we were able to sit outside at all but Meerlust to take in the view and enjoy the wine sampling. We’ve included some pictures and though we are shy about putting ourselves on TripAdvisor, just imagine us sitting at a comfortable table, our glasses full of delicious reds and whites, and looking out at the scenery that you can see in these photos. But truth be told, wine was only part of the Cape Fusion experience. Pam McOnie has an encyclopedic knowledge of South African history and geography and combined with her always positive personality was the perfect tour guide. For the better and the worse she gave us candid explanations into Cape Town history and answered all of our questions. And she shared with us recommendations for the rest of our time in Cape Town that made the honeymoon even more memorable. Lunch at La Colombe. A visit to Harbour House in Kalk Bay. The cheetah rescue experience at the Spier Wine Farm, just to name a few. And for the Johannesburg leg of our trip she introduced us to a local tour guide there named Kenny Letshesa Takalo. I could write a whole rave review about that experience alone but this story is about Pam and Cape Fusion. I would simply say we so enjoyed learning Johannesburg history from Kenny that we extended our honeymoon a day in order to spend not one, but two days in nearby Soweto. Think about that for a moment… But like I said before, the Cape Fusion experience was more than just getting out to great wine estates and enjoying the vineyards. It was the genuine desire of Pam McOnie to help you learn what makes South Africa and Cape Town such a unique and beautiful place and to help you make the most of your visit there…while enjoying a great lunch and a bottle or two…or three…or four. :)

Pam is incredible!. My husband and I spent a whirlwind 2 days in Cape Town. Since our time was limited, we chose to have Pam gives us a guided tour. It was one of the best decisions we made. Pam is a fountain of knowledge about South Africa, in general, and Cape Town and its vicinities, in particular. We toured the coastline, tasted wines, cheeses and chocolates. We went on a mini shopping spree and got a rundown on the architecture of the area. Pam was entertaining the entire time. She is a truly happy, cheerful, enthusiastic person. It is evident that she loves Cape Town and she wanted very much to share that love with us. I have already recommended her guide services to friends here in the states. I know my husband and I will be returning to Cape Town and we will have Pam show us all the great places we missed!

We love Pam!!. We abesolutely had the best time with Pam!  We are travelers who don't have to have a personal tour guide on every trip ...it's rare that we book one but we are SO pleased that we did!  Pam was an incredible guide and I was sad to say goodbye.  We spent a half day with her seeing the penguins, lunch at the harbor house and driving around the cape Peaks!  We did a second day with her in the wine country where she took us to 3 wine tastings and lunch in the valley!  It was so incredible and it made our trip!   She lives in the area and knows it very well!  She is very knowledgeable about the history of the area as well so everything you drove past she can inform you on! I wish I could have a guide like Pam on every trip!

The Best Day. My daughter and I spent a day with Pam in early May and it was truly a fabulous time with her seeing the vineyards and towns. We agreed it was a highlight of our visit to Cape Town, both really informative but also fun and flexible. One of my better decisions to book this tour! I will not hesitate to recommend to anyone coming to Cape Town. Pam has a wealth of knowledge and is very willing to tailor the day around whatever you want to do but also has great suggestions of where to go and what to see. Cannot recommend enough! Great to do as a couple, with friends or on your own..

Fantastic Cape Peninsula trip. We booked this trip as part of a short stay in Cape Town. It was excellent and we have to support all the other great reviews posted here. An excellent and informative guide that gave us a lot of information of the history of sites as well as the South African history. After being traveling here for 10 years; I learned more this day than the previous 10 years of the S-A culture and history.If you ever need (and you might think you don´t) an excellent day of Cape Town - call them!We watched the seals from the boat at Hout Bay, we visited the Cape Point, we saw the penguins at Boulders beach and we finished off with wine tasting in Constantia...

Awesome trip in SA. Thank you so much African Blue tours and congratulations to David, Valentine , Duncan and Matthew !A few day trips with this team made me addict to SA.With Matthew we spent a fabulous day exploring the West Coast National Park and the Cape Peninsula. Thanks to him we discovered the beautiful landscapes of SA.And then with Duncan who was so patient, caring, passionate , we discovered the Tsitsikamma region, had a fun day kayaking , walking on the suspension bridge at Storms River Mouth and then on the garden route where he showed us such a beautiful route.And at last but not least thanks to David and Valentine for their impecable organization of our stay in SA !

family holiday. We can't rate African Blue Tours highly enough!!! David, the owner of the company, was our extremely knowledgable, amiable and passionate tour guide. He took our family of 5 on two private day trips, Cape Peninsula and District Six/Langa Township.He managed to combine his vast knowledge of the area as a local with an easy ambience and attention to detail making our tours tailored to our wishes and seamless in management. But we had fun too!! And learnt so much. The Cape Tour was fabulous, with personal touches such as providing cold water bottles, showing us where he surfed as a teenager, taking us to the non-tourist side of boulders beach, reserving us a great view lunch table at Cape Point restaurant, giving us a choice of wine estates, even keeping us calm as a wayward baboon came to check us for food whilst watching the ostriches!! All the while giving us snippets of local info, historical references and current political news. The tour to District Six and Langa though was something else. He introduced us to a whole subject matter that we had very limited knowledge of previously, and it opened our eyes to the huge traumatic politics of apartheid in this area of SA.David took us to the museum which was fascinating, and then a car tour of the area including the now very desolate district six and showed us with very precise knowledge where the old tracks and houses were, where the remaining churches and mosques fitted in.David has a very good friend and working colleague, Odwa, a wonderful and clever 26yr old man who was brought up in Langa Township, and still lives there. Odwa took us on a walking tour of the township, he reassured us of our safety and of our being very welcome, and that the local people would be very pleased to open up their homes and show us how they live. It blew our minds away seeing all the housing/shelters and what the township means to the people who dwell there. We visited the orphanage and saw the children's beautiful and fabulous welcoming dance. It was truly humbling. Would thoroughly recommend taking your children there and meeting Odwa and hearing the story of Langa.

Fantastic Cape Peninsula trip. I booked a day with Matt to explore the Cape Peninsula and would highly recommend it. A great day seeing the sights but Matt made the day fantastic as I learnt so much. He is incredibly knowledgeable, wanted to share his history and wealth of information and was happy to answer a constant stream of questions. We had sufficient time in each location and he was happy to deviate the trip to accommodate some of our personal requests.

Excellent Great Cape Peninsula Tour. We booked a full day Cape Peninsula tour with African Blue having read the very positive reviews from other travellers. Karen our guide picked us up from our hotel on time and immediately put us at ease with her friendly approach and informative chat about Cape Town. The drive down to the Cape was really interesting and alongside the scenery we saw a huge variety of birds, animals and flora, with Karen able to give us a great commentary on what we were seeing. Excellent lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant with great views. The afternoon saw us taking in the Boulders Beach peguins and then the Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens which really are a "must see". Overall an excellent tour and well worth the money.

Outstanding tour and fun too. We took a full day tour to the Cape of Good Hope with Matt who proved to be not only knowledgeable but friendly and fun. We were a small group of 6 which sure beat going on a huge tour bus. This company offers many tours of Cape Town and I would highly recommend them.

Great tours!. African Blue took care of me for three days while I was in Cape Town. The good service started with a clear, easy to navigate website. There was also friendly and timely response to my email inquiries, and easy and secure payment methods. The tours were top notch. Great experience overall!

Great Cape Peninsula tour. Had a great day with Matthew on an African Blue day tour of the Cape Peninsula. Matthew had very interesting information about Cape Town, and it was really great hearing about the area from someone who grew up there. The van was very comfortable with only 6 of us for the day. We hit all the big stops and had plenty of time to hike up to the Cape Point lighthouse, take pictures, hang out at the beach with penguins and even got to spend an hour at Kirstenboch. Wonderful views and beautiful weather all day. Had a great time and I have already recommended this tour to another couple who was traveling to Cape Town.

Great service and tour. David always answered to all my emails and questions very quickly. He provided great service and I also ended up really enjoying the tour that I booked through him to Kruger Park (3-day tour plus Blyde River Canyon). There are many tour operators in South Africa and it was hard for me to compare and choose one – if you are in the same position, look no further and book through African Blue Tours, you won’t regret it.

Shipwreck / Cape Agulhas Day Tour. A wonderful and well-priced full day experience. I selected the shipwreck tour, but my guide Duncan left the actual details and agenda totally up to me. An outstanding guide and very accommodating. Exceptional historical and local knowledge. Great selection of the lunch spot. The entire day was informative and leisurely, not a hint of being rushed. I would highly recommend this tour over the more common cape Peninsula tour. I suspect all of African Blue’s offered tours are equally magnificent.10 of 10!

Amazing Tour around Cape Town. We booked 3 days personalized trips around Cape Town with African Blue Tours. Our guide, Duncan, made the trip simply marvelous. Our original 3 day itinerary was changed a little bit to suit the weather conditions which worked completely to our favour. Duncan was very knowledgeable, readily answered all our questions and enriched us with his valuable insights of the neighbourhood. He ensured we were comfortable and planned the trip to our pace and likes. He also put in some extra effort to ensure we experienced the most beautiful sunset along False Bay. Highly recommended by us !

Cape Peninsula Day Tour. We recently did the Cape Peninsula Day Tour with Matt and I can't recommend it highly enough! The pace was perfect with plenty of time for all stops, photos, refreshments, etc. The scenery was amazing and we were really blessed with the warm weather. Matt was a fantastic guide and gave us lots of interesting history and and information...he was also a great photographer! Matt also recommended a restaurant for lunch which was really fabulous. This should be on everyone's to-do list when in Cape Town!

Fab cape point day trip. My husband and I went on the full day cape point your in March. Matt was our guide and he was brilliant. Very knowledgeable, easy going and chatty and really made the day for us. Got to see lots of lovely sights on the day and went for a lovely lunch. Note you need to take cash for some entrance fees and for lunch. A must do if on holiday in Cape Town

Personalised day trip around the Cape. I first made an enquiry about a day trip having checked what was available in Cape Town online. David was very quick to reply and in no time we had agreed for pick-up at the apartments I was staying at, along with an outline itinerary for a private tour. We are a family of 5. We have 3 sons, one disabled and two other 'adults'.The day before the tour, David contacted me as the weather forecast wasn't good for the day of the trip, and offered to reschedule for a day or so later, when the weather may be better. Whilst appreciated, we had other arrangements and needed to keep with the original date.We were picked up by our driver and guide, Karen, and we again agreed loosely what we wanted to do and where we wanted to go. Of course, no-one controls the weather, and it was pretty awful from 11ish onwards. So, as we were driving, Karen made suggestions of other things which we could do, which were really good. For example, we visited an ostrich farm and had a moment feeding them. We managed to prevent the big birds from eating our hands!We made it to Cape Colony and the lighthouse in the dry and agreed with Karen that we would walk from the lighthouse to the Cape of Good Hope where she would pick us up. When at the top of the hill at the lighthouse, the heavens really opened. We travelled back down on the funicular wondering what we would do about the walk and the rain, but then saw that Karen had waited as she thought the weather looked a lot like rain. What a relief!We went on and had lunch in a really nice restaurant on the sea front and then wanted to go on to see the penguins at Boulders Beach. It was still raining really hard, so Karen drove us as close as she could to the entrance - probably closer than she should have! - so we wouldn't get too wet. Fortunately, the weather eased up enough for us to see the penguins.We next agreed to change a visit to the gardens to a visit to a vineyard, which I was very happy about, and Karen obviously knew the staff there and arranged for us to have a special extra treat which was otherwise not available as a tasting.It also has to be said that Karen was good at informing us about where we were going, what we were looking at, some of the history of the areas we visited, and was very friendly and approachable regarding questions we had.So a great day. Did the weather spoil it? Well, it tried but when you travel somewhere in their winter/wet season, you have to be prepared. Did the tour deliver? Yes, absolutely. Karen went above and beyond to make sure it did.And the key question - would we use African Blue Tours again? Absolutely right we would!

3 wonderful days . We spent 3 wonderful days with Matt. He was an exceptional tour guide with lots of local knowledge. We liked that he involved us in deciding where to go each day. You have basic itineraries for each tour but he made sure we saw everything we wanted to see. One of our tours was of the Langa Township which I would encourage everyone to take. It's great to see the beautiful scenery of the Cape but you must experience all sides of the culture. Our guide was a local gentleman that showed us the positive and uplifting parts of the townships well as their challenges. We paid a bit extra to have the private tour. It's well worth it! The van you travel in is very comfortable and has large windows. We saw other tour groups with tons of people in them and we were so glad we had a guide all to ourselves! The owner is very conscientious and wants to make sure all your needs are met. I'm looking forward to using them again the next time I'm in Cape Town

Cape Peninsula Tour. I went on the Cape Peninsula tour with Duncan, there were only 2 of us on the tour and he really tailored the tour to what we wanted to do and how long we wanted.Duncan was willing to answer any of our questions and helped to make it a really memorable day. I booked the tour last minute and was very grateful that David was able to accommodate us.Through African Blue, I also booked a 6 day garden route and a 4 day Kruger trip, these were with other companies but were both well organized and professional. David responded to my emails quickly and really helped me plan and have an unforgettable holiday in South Africa!

What a day!!. We were only in Cape Town for a couple of days so decided to do a Peninsular Tour with African Blue Tours. Duncan was our guide for the day and really made sure we got to see everything from The Cape of Good Hope, to penguins on Boulder Beach. He even ensured we had a reservation for lunch which was really good. One of the highlights was the trip to the seal Island as the water was beautiful and as the weather was good we had stunning views back to the mainland.Duncan went out of his way to avoid arriving at places which would be busy where possible but made sure we saw everything and we never felt rushed. He is extremely knowledgeable about the local area as well as the history and we had some very interesting discussions!!We even managed to see the elusive Cape Zebra which was a real bonus. A great day and I was really pleased to have booked with them.

Fantastic day. Fantastic day!!We did a Cape Peninsula tour with Duncan. This was an absolutely wonderful tour.The tour was well organized allowing enough time to visit all the hot spots along the coast without feeling rushed.Duncan our guide was Excellent, very knowledgeable, friendly and professional. He made sure we all had a good time and looked after us very well.Thank You Duncan and African Blue for a fantastic tour. Highly recommend!!!

Cape Peninsula Tour with African Blue. We booked a day long Cape Peninsula Tour as part of our honeymoon in August 2016. From the very start, we knew we were onto a winner as the owner, David, took one look at my misguided clothing choices and promptly lent me his African Blue jacket for the tour to prevent me freezing throughout the day! Our guide, Duncan, was friendly and clearly knew Cape Town really well. He was constantly advising us of the key historic points relating to each of the city's attractions and was always volunteering to take photos of us for our scrapbook. Highlights of the tour had to be Boulders Beach for the penguins, Hout Bay for the seal colony boat trip, complete with eccentric locals feeding the seals at the dock, through to the climb to the lighthouse at the top of Cape Point. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend African Blue Day Tours to anyone visiting the city, and want to thank Duncan and David for their hospitality, knowledge and friendliness. Well done boys!
Peninsula Tour. I did the Peninsula tour with Duncan. Duncan is a great guide and the Peninsula is fantastic. Don't miss the penquins and the Cape itself. Recommend

Peninsula Tour and Langa Township Tour. Peninsula Tour: My 3 children (ages 6, 8 and 10) took the full day Peninsula tour with Matthew. It was a fabulous trip! It is difficult to keep this age happy and occupied but they had a ton of fun! We learned a lot of history of the area, saw and learned about many of the communities right outside of Capetown, had lunch at the Cape and saw the penguins. Everything was well planned and executed. I would recommend this tour to families for sure!Langa Township Tour: This was the highlight of our trip to Capetown!!! David was our tour guide and picked us up from the hotel (myself and my 3 kids ages 6, 8 and 10). We visited the District 6 museum and learned a bit of the history of the area. Then we met up with a resident of the Langa Township who took us on a walking tour. This was incredible, eye opening, fabulous...once in a lifetime. My kids are still talking about it. Absolutely a MUST for everyone. I was a little concerned before we went about safety but as I quickly learned the township is incredibly safe, the people are very warm and inviting and our guide made us feel right at home, even teaching us some words in the local language so we could better greet the people. We visited several different types of houses there and is was incredibly impactful. I think this is a MUST do for a trip to Capetown.

Girls Weekend in Cape Town. The tour was amazing... We went to some amazing wine farms...tasted some gorgeous wine and brandy...The tour guide was engaging and very knowledgeable.Lunch at Rocca was absolutely gorgeous...stunning views...stunning tour...a must do when you visit Cape Town...

Amazig experience!. We had booked Cape Winelands and Cape Point Tour with African Blue Tours. The tours turned out to be an amazing experience, with the tour leader Smith (if I correctly remember his name) giving us minute details about every single location (historical background, local specialities). We thoroughly enjoyed these two days...Best wishes to African Blue Tours! :) :)

Fantastic day tours, yet again!. Having previously used African Blue for a couple of private, guided day tours with a group of friends a few years ago, we again booked the Cape Peninsular and Winelands full day tours when revisiting with some friends earlier this year. Our guide for both these trips was Matthew and as with the previous guides, he was excellent. Very knowledgeable and attentive without being over-imposing. He also tailored both trips during the day, based on our discussions and requests and I would have no hesitation recommending both him and the other African Blue tour guides as a great way to explore CT, the Western Cape and beyond in comfort (modern, comfortable and air conditioned fleet of vehicles) and flexibility, designed to each groups individual requests. Coupled with excellent communication and arrangements from David and the office team, the African Blue tours represent great value for money, providing fun-filled, informative and exciting full day tours.

Excellent guided tour. Duncan was extremely knowledgeable about the natural and cultural history of the area, and we very much enjoyed our private tour of the Cape Peninsula. He was able to incorporate our particular interests and advised us on the best way to plan our day to maximise our enjoyment. Highly recommend.

"A Great Day". A last minute decision to book the Cape Peninsular tour and what a good decision it turned out to be! Duncan made our day with his knowledgeable commentary and his willingness to accommodate us. We had originally planned to go by train to Simons Town but now realise how much we would have missed out on. We are looking forward to African Blue looking after us for the next part of our holiday on the Garden Route.

Brilliant , highly recommended! . We booked this before we left on holiday and I would highly recommend it.We were two families of four adults and two 15yr old girls.We are hiring a car tomorrow to travel down the garden route but for out time in Capetown we chose to get a tour. Matt our guide was very prompt and collected ua as arranged at 08.30.The day was misty so he suggested changing the tour a bit so the mist wouldn't affect our viewing.He was very courteous at all times and had the ability to move us on when needed without us ever feeling rushed.His knowledge of the history and geography was unbelievable. He was very sensitive to all the communities we passed through.We had wine tasting , loved Simon Sig and had to buy some wine and bubbles! We went to Boulder to see penguins! Simonstown, Muizenburgh, Cape point for lunch,Hout Bay. It was amazing so much to see and do. Matt was brilliant and I would recommend this company to anyone planning a trip here.We also managed to see Baboons and a very large elk!

Great day!. We did a Cape Peninsula tour with Duncan. We had an elderly man in the group (4 of us, private) and Duncan was extremely accommodating to his needs. We had a great time and would highly recommend the company and Duncan!

Amazing Tour with Matthew! . Matthew took us on 2 private tours, a Wineland and a Cape Peninsula tour. Both days were exciting and full of sights, but at our own pace, which we greatly appreciated. Our guide Matthew anticipated our every need, provided a comfortable and clean van, and made great suggestions on additional sights like the Motor Museum. He reserved great tables at restaurants that provided stunning views. He was extremely knowledgeable in everything from politics to the flora and fauna of South Africa. He showed us the best of South Africa and always made us feel safe. Thank you African Blue and Matthew for the best vacation ever!
Private tour of Sterkfontein and Lesidi. Johan and Bianca were excellent guides. The show at Lesedi was fantastic. Try to book this as a group tour or at least with more than 1 person.

Cape Town - Langa township and Robben Island. We took a half day tour with Duncan to the Langa township and District Six Museum, followed by a trip to Robben Island. We really enjoyed the day and would definitely recommend African Blue Day Tours. The email communication with David was clear and quick. The day was perfectly organized and we learned a lot about the history of apartheid from Duncan and life in the township from our local guide Odwa who introduced us to local people in a natural and non-intrusive way. Afterwards, Duncan took us to the ferry to Robben Island. Thanks guys, for a perfect day! Julie and Michal

very informative and professional done. My wife and i used African Blue to tour Cape Town South Africa, cape of good hope, and the wine country. They did a very nice job of coordinating the picking up from our hotel and showing us the sigjts. Our first schedule day to see cape town was cloudy so we had to reschedule and African Blue was very accomodating. Good choice of wineries. Best of all was the history of South Aftrica our guide Matthew gave us. He was very knowledgeable and that really added to the tour.

Honeymoon in Cape town. Hi, Had a fab tour yesterday with Matt. As nobody else booked we ended up having a private tour of the peninsula of Cape Town. Matt was a great tour guide- really nice and very knowledgeable about the area. He also returned my fleece when I forgot it on the bus. This tour is excellent we seen the African an penguins and had a boat ride to see the seals. Matt also organised a great sea view table for us at two oceans restaurant were the seafood was to die for. All in all a fab day. Thanks Matt. Would highly recommend. Laura and Gavin from Northern Ireland.

Amazing 12 days in South Africa. We have just returned after a 12 day trip to South Africa. Our entire trip- 3day Kruger Safari and Blyde River Canyon tour, Cape Town and 5 day garden route tour was entirely managed by David Smith and how well he managed it. Our tour guide for 7 days was Duncan Petre an excellent gentleman, professional, friendly and very flexible. His knowledge shows his passion for his profession. Travelling extensively with 2 kids is never easy but Duncan made it so and I must mention, David was himself present at the airport to pick us and he himself drove us back to the airport at 5.30 am in the morning for our return journey. I have never come across an owner who does this personally for his clients. Kudos to African Blue.....stay blessed and go miles guys....

Amazing 2 days with David Smith. We did a private tour with David for a group of 4 people. Excellent experience overall and David is very professional, prompt, flexible and very responsive to emails/calls. On day 1, we went to the Cape Peninsula, saw cape penguins on Boulders Beach, and went to Seal Island. Day 2 we went to the shark cage diving adventure. David is very knowledgeable and great tour guide. Pricing is very reasonable for a private tour.

Enjoyable. I have to commend this company for their flexibility and professionalism.Duncan was our guide and he was most knowledgeable (facts and figures on the ready); friendly and quite frankly saved us a lot of time and hassle. We were booked to go to Table Mountain the next day and if it weren't for Duncan we would never have gone, as the weather changed the next day and the mountain cable way closed. He was kind enough to double check for us and organised for us to go that very day... I would recommend this company to anyone going to Cape Town as they will give you the full experience of the city and its sights but with none of the hassle. We where picked up and dropped off on time as well.
Amazing day at the Cape. Just simply put its amazing and well worth the trip. you will not be disappointed. Very informative guide and really great lunch too!! what are you waiting for! Book it now!

Day Tour of Jo'burg. I booked a day tour of Jo'burg for my husband and 18 year old daughter with African Blue Tours. They had one day to see the city and wanted to have a lot of flexibility with the itinerary and length of time at each stop. Henry was their tour guide and both my husband and daughter raved about the day they spent together. Henry was very informative about the history of the city and S.A. The highlights of the day were stops in Soweto, the Apartheid Museum and Constitution Hill. My husband told me that they could never have seen so much of the city on their own. Many thanks to David for arranging the tour and his quick responses via email as we decided what to do in Jo'burg. I highly recommend this tour company.

Fantastic Time at Cape Peninsula. I did a small group tour of the cape peninsula on my last day in capetown. Duncan our tour guide arrived at my hotel on time and was very friendly. He gave us a brief description of our itinerary which included Seal island cruise. Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. This was an absolutely wonderful tour and a great value too. Duncan made sure we all had a good time and was a true professional. He was well prepared for the tour polite and friendly despite us making extra little stops to shop or have some ice cream along the way. We had lunch at Two Oceans, great seafood. I enjoyed seeing the Penguins and the drive along Hout Bay. This tour was one of the highlights of my trip to South Africa. Thank You Ducan and African Blue for a fantastic tour.

Excellent Tour. We booked a private tour to the Aquila safari and Duncan is our tour guide and driver. He's very friendly and careful driver. Throughout the trip we are very satisfied and would definitely choose this tour again for the next visit.

Wonderful Peninsula and Garden Route Tour. I had the pleasure of traveling with African Blue in April 2016 for 5 days- 1 day Peninsula Tour and 4 day Garden Route Tour.All my email queries were dutifully and promptly answered by David giving me peace of mind whilst planning the trip. During the trip, Duncan (our guide) impressed us with his attention to detail, willingness to go the extra mile, his knowledge, and his eagerness to pick up new knowledge and experiences. He even soldiered on through a bout of gastroenteritis which we both picked up from a restaurant. We really appreciated Duncan's careful driving, given the long distances we covered during this trip. All in, a great experience with African Blue. Highly Recommended!

Excelent 2 days with Duncan. Perfect way to enjoy Cape Town and outstanding customer service. We booked a private Cape Peninsula tour and private transport to the Aquila safari. Based on the weather David switched the tours so we would have the best possible weather on the Cape tour - turned out perfectly. Duncan was an excellent guide - friendly and informative yet didn't feel the need to talk the whole time which I appreciated. He offered suggestions along the way that we could decide what to do: extra wine tour stop on the way back from the Safari, making lunch reservations for us at Cape Point. Highly recommend this company!

The best way to see the Cape!. We loved our private all day Cape Peninsula tour with Matthew. He added a few personal favorite stops and routes that we wouldn't have gotten to see with another tour. The stop at Llandudno Beach was especially enjoyable. Matthew even helped move along the chaotic photo line at the Cape of Good Hope. He also told good stories about the history of the South Africa and the current state of affairs. African Blue also offers wine tours. Matthew would have been a great host for that too, but we'd already put a deposit down with another company by the time we found this out. Perhaps next time!

Two excellent trips. I booked a half day peninsula tour and a one day wine tasting tour with African Blue whilst recently in Cape Town with my wife. I had no problems with arranging and paying for the trips through email and all correspondence was promptly dealt with. The tours, both with Matthew were excellent and he took the time to find out which wines we liked and so tailored our wine trip to include Simonsig known for its sparkly wines which was greatly appreciated. Matthew was punctual,friendly and informative - more like travelling with a friend!

Fantastic experience - very prompt service. I used African Blue to book Shark Cage Diving at Gansbaai, Cape Peninsula tour and Cape Town city tour in the last week of Feb 2016. My wife and I really had an amazing experience of all the activities. Reasons - 1) Competitive pricing. 2) Safe. 3) Very prompt responses over phone and e-mail. I always felt that I got the response I needed at my level of urgency whenever I specified this in my e-mail / phone call. 4) Very courteous and knowledgeable staff - always going the extra mile to provide information and flexibility. I strongly recommend using African Blue for travel needs in Cape Town area :)

Cape Peninsula Tour with Duncan. We had amazing Cape Peninsula Tour with African Blue Day Tours, we would recommend them to anyone. It was only a small group which was fantastic and really got to see another side of Cape Town and its surrounding towns. Its a must when visiting Cape Town. We loved it.

Blue Tours in the Winelands. My wife and I toured a full day in the Winelands with Duncan as our guide. It was a beautiful day tasting the various wines, cheeses and olive oil. Duncan showed an excellent knowledge of the region and provided inside stories which made the trip fun and interesting. He knew staff at the various locations which helped make the stops smooth and timely. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Excellent and professional services = Good memories. First of all I must thank David for always swift response to any request/questions with positive and good input and solutions. Also and not least to Matt taking us around the Peninsula tour , the wine tour and to Aquila private game/safari.His local knowledge and friendly/calm attitude was really a good experience matching us perfect.So whoever is asking me how to plan, to do, to contact for a stay in CT I give them the same answer NO PROBLEM call David and African Blue Tour.

Perfect Choice. My friend and I had only a few days in South Africa and the choice of African Blue Tours was perfect! Our driver, Duncan, was a delight - so knowledgeable, friendly, easy going and informative. He stopped off wherever we asked and was always offering up interesting facts, cultural insights and answered all of our questions. Most importantly, he was very patient with our frequent requests to stop and take pictures! Our world needs more Duncans and he will forever be our personal ambassador to South Africa. Thank You!

Professional, informative and super friendly!. I highly recommend the Cape Peninsula Day Tour with African Blue Day Tours. They were prompt in responding to my emails from the outset. The tour was well organised allowing enough time to visit all the hot spots along the coast without feeling rushed along the way. The guide Mathew was very knowledgeable, friendly and professional. I would highly recommend African Blue and their tours.

Cape Peninsula Tour with Matt from Africa Blue Tours - superb!. This is the second tour which we booked through Africa Blue having already enjoyed a trip out to the winelands around Stellenbosch and Franchhook. It was really easy to book, David the manager is prompt to get in touch and very helpful and the trips are great value for money. Having already spent a week in Cape Town and enjoyed many of the sights, this Peninsula tour was the icing on the cake. The landscape and views were stunning, lunch at the Two Oceans restaurant was delicious and our guide, Matt Bloomberg was fantastic. He was friendly, knowledgeable and it was a pleasure to spend the day with him. A great end to our holiday. Thank you!

Wonderful Tour with Professional Guide. Went on the full day Cape Point tour, our guide Duncan was professional and knowledgeable as well as very helpful and friendly, going above and beyond expectations. We saw all the major sights, Duncan provided lots of helpful information about the history and the natural beauty of the cape area. The small bus was in very good condition. Highly recommend African Blue!

Cape Peninsula Tour with Matt - excellent!. Great day out on the Cape Peninsula! Easy to book, quick responses to email. Matt was an excellent guide, very knowledgeable and great sense of humour. Very accommodating with scheduling, we were picked up at our hotel in the morning, then dropped at the airport for our evening flight home.

Cape Point Peninsula Tour. Awesome experience with tour guide Matt!Very patient even when some of us wondered of to do some curios shopping...Excellent driving and quite knowledgeable of all our stops :-)
Cape Peninsula Tour. Wonderful day out visiting Hout Bay, Simons Town, Chapmans Peak and Cape Point. Duncan our tour guide was both very informative and kind.

Day tour to the Cape Peninsula and Cape Point.. We booked an all day tour to Cape Point. Our driver/ tour guide Duncan arrived early. He was very polite, very professional and always willing to answer our questions. He knew the history of the places we went through. We drove passed the CBD, the Castle of Good Hope, the Waterfront. On the way to Cape Point, we made several stops to take pictures of the beaches and the mountains, the penguins the seals and the ostriches. We'll definitely be using African Blue Tour on our next tour.Stafford.

Great Service and Top Local Knowledge.
