I booked the day tour to Cape of Good Hope on a scheduled day (Sunday) everything worked like clockwork - pre contact to confirm my pick up - patience with all my to and fro-ing about the date (I had other shifting appointments) and a great value tour full of history, local tips and excellent guide Matthew.Our small bunch Euro(4) / US (1) Aust (1)could all contribute to decisions along the way and comfortable mini coach gave us all room to stretch out and relax.The pace, information and opportunity to stretch our legs were perfect - I'll be back and tell all my friends to go with and trust African Blue Tours, top rate company and personable professional people.

Must do tour of cape coast . We booked a day tour from Cape Town of the Cape coast to Cape Point. Our tour guide Duncan was excellent, v knowledgeable, laid back and looked after us very well. The tour takes in lots of stops including seal watching off Hout Bay, penguins at Bolders, delicious lunch, Cape Point and Good Hope then a final stop at Kirstenbosch Gardens. Duncan planned the route so we missed any large queues for pictures etc by arriving ahead of large bus tours at Cape Point. Lovely group, only 6 of us in the mini bus. Brilliant day, thoroughly recommend.

Simply amazing. We travelled as a mixed age group of 12 family and friends, pre booking airport transfers, shark diving, cape duet tour and a transfer to our next accommodation via David at African Blue Tours in Cape Town. From the planning stages to our stay in Cape Town the service could not be faulted, even helping us do a shopping trip when we first arrived! We were met by David and Matt at the airport in Cape Town and were lucky enough to have Matt for the rest of our tours and travel. His knowledge and passion for the area and South Africa was amazing and he was so keen we see everything possible in our short time in Cape Town. They thought of absolutely everything, even bringing a car to the airport purely for our luggage!The Shark Diving was such an incredible experience, seeing a total of 5-6 different sharks. I would advise to definitely take sea sickness tablets, even if not normally seasick! Although you definitely feel better when in the cage...with your mind on other things!The Cape Duet Tour was also incredible, although obviously a lot to do in a day we fitted everything in, including a lovely lunch in Simons Town.I would recommend African Blue Tours to everyone and will definitely use them again when we return!

Cape Town Peninsula and Winelands Tours. I had a great experience with this travel company on the two excursions I took with them. Everything ran on time and was well planned. Duncan was very knowledgeable and very patient. We were also given options to serve our interests and there was a very relaxed feel to the day despite packing a lot of things in. The van was comfortable and his driving was safe. I highly recommend this tour company.

Cape Point and Stellenbosch day tour. We had a tight schedule whilst we were in Cape Town and looked for a company that would pack Cape Point and Stellenbosch in the one day. And African Blue provided this. We had Duncan as our guide for the day and he was great. His knowledge was exceptional - from the history, to the animals and fauna in the areas we visited. And he was a nice guy - easy to converse with and accommodating to our requests/needs, etc. We would have no hesitation in recommending this company again!

The top tour company in cape Town. We used African Blue Tours for our whole stay in Cape Town. We cant praise them enough. They were brilliant from start to finish. From picking us up from the airport and even taking us over to George at the end of our Cape Town stay. Our tour guide Matt was brilliant, very friendly, helpful and a top guy. He looked after us on all our day tours through out the week, shark cage diving which he picked us up at 3am! our cape point, chapman's peak and wine route trip, where we saw sea lions, penguins at boulder beach, the cape of good hope, cape point and wine tasting in the many vineyards. Matt was very informative and talked about all the history of place we drove through, stopped for photos at the best spots and showed us all the hidden gems Cape Town has to offer. We were very pleased with the service offered by African Blue.

Cape Town Pennisular I day Tour. Booked this tour a few days before we arrived in Cape Town and it was excellent with our knowledgeable guide, Duncan suggesting a negotiable itinerary with approximate timings. We saw seals, penguins, baboons, antelope, dassies, Cape Hope, much flora with scenic stops to suit and a huge range of questions answered. Duncan drove well in a comfortable mini-van and collected from hotel promptly.David Green..Gloucestershire ,UK

The best tours in Cape Town. I'm so glad that we chose David and his team to help us see the best that the Cape has to offer. We booked three tours through David and all were faultless. The starting point for any Cape Town adventure is a tour of the Peninsula. Matthew was our guide, a really friendly knowledgeable guy who was clearly very experienced and knew how best to avoid the crowds on the busiest day of the year. We then followed this up with a day trip to one of the safari reserves, which David transferred us to and from himself - an unforgettable experience and a great introduction for anyone wondering if they would like a safari or not... this will definitely make your mind up for you. It was great to chat to David on the drive there and back and find out lots about the culture and history of the region and the future of tourism in the region. Finally, David arranged a shark dive experience for us which was something I will never forget. This is arranged through an external company that David deals with, but the day was perfect. All three experiences were magical and I couldn't recommend David and his team enough. Even if you are not sure what you would like to do in Cape Town (or other parts of the country) i'd recommend getting in touch. David clearly knows both the country and the tourism industry inside out and i'd trust him to plan the vacation for you.

Cape Peninsula Tour. The Cape Peninsula tour was scenic, picturesque and simply beautiful. We were a small of group of five, and set off in a comfortable passenger van with AC. Stops included Hout Bay (for seal watching), Chapman's Peak, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, Boulder'S Beach (for penguin watching). We had a superb time with our guide/driver, Duncan, who is by far the friendliest guides I have met in all my travels so far. I would recommend this tour to anyone who has a day to spend taking in the breathtaking vistas of the Cape Peninsula. Right from booking to execution of our tour, we were pleased with the service offered by African Blue.

Arranged Sanbona Wildlife Reserve. I found African Blue Tours on the internet while searching for safaris out of Cape Town. David Smith recommended Sanbona Wildlife Reserve, which we enjoy very much. He took us there in person and arranged to have us picked up and take on a short tour of the area south of Table Mountain. I cannot recommend him too highly for personal service and advice.

A great partner to any South African holiday. Being limited to ten days' vacation, we had a short time to visit as much as possible in South Africa. We consulted a number of TripAdvisor's recommended guides to gather information and benchmark prices. African Blue stood out for two reasons: first, because of the affable David Smith, whose email responses to our initial queries were prompt and helpful; and second, because the company is able to offer airport pickups and tours in both Joburg and Cape Town (enabling us to cover all of our needs with one provider).Having booked African Blue, we were assigned Duncan as our guide. Duncan was extremely knowledgeable, a safe driver, and an energetic guide. He was flexible in his plans and great with our young kids. He was a great representative of the company and I am pleased to recommend him.

Perfect Tour of the Cape. We travelled with Cheryse in December whilst in Cape Town. We were collected from our Hotel on time and we collected a few more guests on the way. We headed off to the Cape Point and missed all the other tourist traffic due to our knowledgeable hostess. The tour was very comprehensive and fun and we saw lots of wildlife and got some great photos. We had a lovely lunch overlooking the bay. We were a small group and had the choice of direction/ending of the tour. The days was long enough and felt we had covered a lot of ground without being too rushed. Cheryse gave us a lot of background information on South Africa and its people, flora and fauna. She was very proud of her country and rightly so. It's beautiful.

Cape Peninsula and Constantia Wine Tour. Our time in Cape Town was limited so we booked a tour with African Blue so that we could make the most of our time. The service was very good and our guide was very informational. As we were there in the middle of summer, he planned the tour such that we would minimize the wait time. We visited the cape, stopping for pictures along the way, and then visited the penguins as well as a couple of wineries. Lunch and wine tastings were great.Since we are a family of five and wanted to have control of what we did and the pace, we booked the private tour. I highly recommend it. We were able to spend longer where we wanted to, while still being able to see our top attractions.

Cape Peninsula Tour. We used Africa Blue Day Tours in our recent trip to Cape Town. We were booked on a cruise that included a 3 day pre-cruise tour. However this pre cruise tour did not give us the opportunity to visit the beautiful Cape Peninsula. I contacted Blue Day Tours ( David) to book a day tour to the Cape. . David was extremely helpful in helping us plan our time to include the sites of Cape Town that our pre-cruise tour did not include.Duncan our guide arrived punctually at our hotel and a group of 6 of us boarded one of the best tour vans I have been in. There was enough space for all our luggage and lots of leg room for all of us. It was clean and water was provided. Duncan was very knowledgeable, pleasant and handled our itinerary well. He got us to the main sites just before many of the large buses and even pointed out to us a better viewing platform to view the penguins. At the end of the day he took us and our luggage to our ship. As our boat was docked in port for the night the following day with detailed instructions from David we walked, bought our tickets and boarded our ferry to visit Robben Island. Thank you David and Duncan, your tour and help allowed us to maximize our time in Cape Town. I would recommend and suggest to any one who may be on one of the cruise pre-cruise tours to contact Africa Blue. Our experience was first rate.

Great Tour Guide. My recent trip to Cape Town was wonderful and Mathew our tour guide was very helpful in making our experience pleasant. He took us to all the places we wanted to see and even went out his way to show us some other places that he thought we would be interested in just by talking and listening to our personal interest. Thanks African Blue!

Table Mountain w/ Highlights of Cape Town (city tour + table mountain). This is the tour to see the jaw dropping landscapes of Cape Town!! Matt was our guide, and he went above and beyond to make the tour a smashing success. When there were technical issues with the Table Mountain cable car, Matt adopted the tour and took us to other highlights, then brought us back for the stunning sunset atop Table Mountain once the cable car was fixed. If you do just one tour, do this one as it gives you a taste of what the city has to offer in one day.

Cape Peninsula Tour. Really good day tour, plenty of good view points for those crucial photos to be taken. The tour guide Matthew was brillant, adding some useful information and able to answer questions. Highlights were Cape Point and Cape of good hope.

Great Cape Point tour with sociable, knowledgeable guide Matthew. We had a wonderful day driving from Cape Town to Cape Point with our guide Matthew Bloomberg. He really added to the whole tour with his knowledge of the places we went, the history, and even gave us tips on a few of his hidden local gems you won't find in any of the guide books/sites (like going to Llandudno beach instead of some of the other tourist traps). He picked us up at 930a (we're late risers) and we headed down. He was willing to stop along the way for us to take pictures and knew when to push us along when we were spending too much time in one place. We need that some times.Warning - if traveling to Cape Town in general, but specifically Cape Point during the summer seasons, it WILL be windy. We're from the U.S. so we think Chicago is "the windy city" but Cape Town brings it to a whole new level. My wife and I agree we've never in our lives experienced anything like it. So be prepared, and don't wear lose fitting sunglasses or hats because they'll be gone before you know it. We stopped at the old and new lighthouses at Cape of Good Hope (previously "Cape of Storms" which is more accurate given the wind) and be sure to walk up the hill instead of the cable car because there are additional spots along the way to take pictures you won't get via the cable car. And exercise never hurt anybody :)We saw a fire along the way which have been happening at higher rates because of the drought so our drive went on a bit of a detour but we were fine with it. We stopped to visit the penguins (one of the windiest spots so wear long sleeves even if it's hot if you want to avoid getting pelted by the sand). The R65 per Adult admission was a bit high for a few minutes of looking at penguins, you basically pay that much to get good close up pictures. And on the way back, stopping at Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens is an absolute must! We could've spent all day there. Amazing foliage and views of the mountainside one way, and the city and beaches the other. All in all, a wonderful day. Thanks Matthew!

Fine, a few improvements perhaps required. Had an enjoyable trip with Ian around the Cape Peninsula. Highlights were the penguins at Boulders Bay, relaxed lunch at Simon's Town, and Cape Point.Although the trip was enjoyable, there were a few things that could have been improved: the vehicle's suspension was poor and air con unit's generator pumped out warm air, rendering it useless. We opened a window so no big deal, but I'd have preferred air con to wind blowing in my face. Also, instructions to other members of our group were seemingly either unclear or not adhered to, so we ended up having lunch after 3pm. Again no big deal for us but you expect things on such a packed trip to run like clockwork and have lunch earlier than 3pm.A good trip and hopefully the few negatives can be improved for others in future.

Day Cape peninsula tour. Had a fantastic day tour round the cape peninsula with Matt. He was a very knowledgeable guide,not only on the local sights, but gave us tips on all the places to visit up and down the coasts, that foreign tourists aren't aware of. It was well organised and extremely friendly, definitely book with this company.

Superb full day tour of Cape Point. I did this tour at the end of November 2015. It was quite outstanding. The tour guide Duncan was among my best guides, extremely knowledgeable and also managed the day very well. We saw everything including the seal colony, the penguin colony, ate at an outstanding restaurant, saw the magnificent scenery of the Cape Point itself, and ended the day with a full tour of the very beautiful Kirstenbosch Gardens. The vehicle we traveled in was extremely comfortable and high quality. Also very reasonable cost. I highly recommend this tour.

Peninsula Tour. We had a fantastic day out with our guide - Redaa. I think that if he is the standard of Davids guides then ABT will be the tour of choice as he was excellent - the vehicle clean and plenty of water - the choice of restaurant was fantastic and he was so flexible - no set agenda just a damn good guide....We were relaxed at the end of the day and had so many great pictures that a very inquisitive 9 year old took full advantage of the knowledge on display!Thanks also to Hazel at ToEscapeTo for arranging!

A great South African experience. We did 4 private tours with African Blue Tours organized by David Smith and his team:1) City tour of Cape Town and Table Mountain2) Wineland Tour3) Addo Elephant Park (to/from Port Elizabeth)4) Johannesburg, including Apartheid MuseumAll tours and guides were excellent. David was very responsive and knowledgable when we planned the tours beforehand. We had a wonderful experience and we do appreciate the excellent job David`s Team did. Well done & Thank you.

Cape Peninsula Tour 1st Jan 2016. First compliment must to Matt, our tour guide. Very knowledgeable, friendly and extremely interesting. Fantastic trip to Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, penguin colony in Simons Town, stop for lunch at Bertha in Simons Town, overlooking the harbour. Then onto the seal colony in Hout Bay and fabulous scenery with many stops to capture the stunning surroundings. I don't think our day could have been any better. Thanks Matt - would definitely recommend this tour and tour guide.

Matthew was brilliant.. I booked the pensinsual tour, visiting Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope and the heart-warming penguins on Boulders Beach. For our guide, Matthew, this is more than a job. He is a tour guide with a passion, who fulfills every guest's wish. He told us the most wonderful and interesting stories about every place we visited. I can really recommend this tour, you won't be disappointed. Penguins!

Amazing Cape Peninsula Tour! . David is super efficient with the tours and is very helpful in answering questions. Our guide Duncan showed us many sights through the cape peninsula and is really accommodating to our family of 6 with two elderly folks!Thanks African Blue team for a wonderful day trip :)

fascinating experience. the whole day cape peninsula tour from African Blue Tours was very good and our guide David was friendly and knowledgeable. the entire sightseeing tour from camps bay to cape point and along the way boat ride to see cape fur seals and then visit to boulders beach to see penguins was incredible to say the least. we enjoyed every bit of the tour including having lunch at 'two ocean restaurant' in cape point. no doubt the restaurant is little expensive but given the option to choose by David, we felt it is worth paying and eating fresh seafood at this place which indeed was good.

Great tours.. Booked two tours with David. Cape Town and Table Mountain, Cape Penisular.Our tour guide was Matt. Nice chap, very knowledgeable. Good vehicle. There was only the Two of us on the first tour, and four on the second, so loads of room and very unhurried. We were given choices on where to eat and time to enjoy ourselves.Would not hesitate to recommend them.Very punctual. Full of information for our onwards journey.

Fantastic Full Day Cape Peninsula Tour. Excellent tour in every way. David was wonderful in being able to accommodate me when I emailed him to make a last minute booking. He was very professional and organized. Matthew was my tour guide and he was the best guide I have ever had. He was knowledgeable about a diverse array of subjects and there was a constant narrative throughout the day. I really like how he personalized the tour for the people in the van that day, even making an extra stop when we wanted to see the ostriches up close. It was a day that I will never forget!

Grea privat tour. We booked a privat tour to cape point for the day. I have been there so many times and for me its kind of boring. But WOW! Not with Matt, he knew so much and it was so interessting! He toldus loads of old stories and it was a great day for me. Not again a boring trip to cape point... I would go and bookthe straight away again!!!

Matthew was a star. Booked for two excersions - one to Langa Township. African Blue have a relationship with one of the local residents who took is around on foot. Fascinating and a must when visiting Cape Town. Matthew also took us to District Six and Museum to explain the history.Second day was a trip to the wineries of Frankchuch and Stellenbosch - the most amazing day. Matt was brilliant, chatty, knowledgeable - felt like he was a friend he was very easy to talk to and spend the day with! Thank you Matt for one of our holiday highlights.

Great day out. We booked a full day excursion to the Cape of Good Hope and were picked up on time from our hotel by our guide, Duncan. After skilfully negotiating his way through the Cape Town traffic he then drove us on a fascinating and most enjoyable tour all the way down to Cape Point, stopping along the way to take a boat trip out to see the seals on Seal Island, Simon's Town and the African Penguins on Boulders Beach. Lunch had been booked for us at a great restaurant and after spending some time at the bottom of the world, we were taken to stroll around the beautiful botanical gardens at Kirstenbosch. Duncan's knowledge of the history, politics, geography and nature of the Cape is extensive and we certainly learned a lot about South Africa in general and the Cape area in particular. It was a wonderful day and I would thoroughly recommend African Blue.
Visited Craddle of Mankind and Lesedi. Was picked up by David, your was great he was on time for pickup and helped us through the two sites which were stunning, well worth the money spent.

Who needs GPS when there's Matthew!. To set the scene...our GPS was down and we were lost in Camps Bay, trying to find our guest house. Having spotted an African Blue tours mini bus we asked if the driver had heard of the street name and if he could help us.Matthew was super friendly, he quickly checked Waze for us and not only did he give us directions he then went on to offer to drive to the street we were looking for, and we followed him!Thanks again Matthew!Jonny & Tash

Wonderful Cape Peninsula Tour with Matthew!!. My husband and I reserved this tour online and their communication was on point. Matthew, our tour guide picked us up at 8.30pm just like they mentioned in the email. He made us feel comfortable right from the get go and was very knowledgeable of Cape Town and its history and we learnt a lot about the city!! He never once sounded rehearsed although I can imagine how many times he must have repeated the same lines to countless tourists. He was very accommodating and never made us feel rushed. Matthew also pre-booked our lunch at a very nice restaurant (Bertha's) in Simon's Town. We felt like a friend was showing us around rather than a typical tour guide. I would strongly recommend this tour company and especially Matthew to anyone looking to have a fun and relaxed day as well as learning a lot about Cape Town and Cape Peninsula region. This was truly a highlight of our vacation!!

Private Tour. We were treated to a private peninsula tour with our guide Duncan, he was an amazing guide and very accommodating. The whole day was alot of fun and Duncan provided us with many photo opportunities while also giving us intresting insight on south african history.

Aquila Day Safari and Wine Farms: A Full and Fun Day!. My husband and I spent a very full day with Matthew as our guide. He picked us up at the guest house where we were staying at 7 a.m. and drove us to Aquila. We had a nice breakfast there and then boarded our safari truck with about ten other people. Had a super time and were able to see lions, rhinos, zebras, elephants, springboks up close! Our three hour safari was perfect for us as we did not want to do an overnight or multiple night safari. After lunch at Aquila, Matthew drove us to two wine farms, Warwick and Muratie, each very nice, and very different from each other. We did tastings at both and enjoyed the drive through the Stellenbosch area. Saw several baboons sitting on the guard rail of the road, watching us pass by! Matthew is a very fun guy, a safe driver and incredibly knowledgeable. Throughout the ride he pointed out sites of interest and enlightened us with his knowledge of South Africa, its history, culture and current events. Thank you, Matthew, for a terrific day! And thank you, David, for suggesting we combine the two tours! It was great!

Cape peninsula group tour!. Contacted the company in July, expressing my interest and asking for ideas whilst I was in cape town.-David was prompt with his responses-Informative, with good advice and suggestions.The tour itself was amazing, had Duncan for the day, what a gentle soul. Every photograph has a story because the depth of knowledge he holds, is phenomenal. I was very impressed.Enjoy

Wine tasting tour in Stellenbosch and Franschhoek. Took the wine tasting tour the day after the trip to Township. Big contrast, with many questions regarding South African history and the situation today on our minds. But our guide Matthew not only provided us with an relaxing tour in exact right tempo and duration, but also helped us get some answers to those questions. Balanced, knowledgeable and and with reflections we could follow and that answered many of our questions.Not to much, not to little! It felt just right and very pleasant to invite our guide to join us for lunch. Would recommend him for anyone who wants to take the same tour. Trude & Asgeir

Two days with Matt. My wife and I decided to take a couple of day tours, one to the wine area and the other to Cape of Good Hope. We were extremely fortunate to end up being the only people on tour so it was like having our own private tour and time was efficiently utilized. Matt was very informative and new a lot about the Capetown area. I was able to book online and the owner responded very quickly suggested we change the tours around because of the weather forecast. Excellent company

"Best experience of my life". Great job to tour guides! They really took a good care of us. My wife and I really had a good time in Hluhluwe Imfolozi game reserve. And Cape Town tour was a breath taking. Thank you very much Dave Smith! For getting eventhing lineup us

First class all the way. From the start African Blue were simply first class. The liaison, correspondence prior to arrival from David spot on and always prompt. Our guide Duncan was superb, knowledgable, professional , courteous, helpful, caouldnt ask for more. We spent 4 days touring . Trips were all individual and made to measure. We saw everything from whales, ostrich, penguins to baboons . Amazing views. Superb horse riding on Noordhoek beach. Cape point stunning. Would love to come back with the whole family and children. So much to see . Recommend African Blue for your trips , you won't get any better . Thanks David and Duncan

An Amazing tour. We had an amazing time in South Africa. All was greatly planned and booked (including the weather :-)). We really enjoyed the time with Matthew he was balancing very well his guidance with providing us family time as well, and he also managed to catch quickly on the thing we enjoyed doing and adapt the plan accordingly. We enjoyed his companion and pleasant personality. It was a great trip

Cape Peninsula full day tour. Superb full day tour with Matthew as our guide. I was picked up directly from my hotel in Cape Town. This was really memorable day with a highly knowledgeable local who really brought the area to life. A beautiful drive down one side of the peninsula with lots of opportunities to take photographs. There was a stop to take a boat trip to Seal Island which was a great experience. The highlight was the trip to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope (learned these are different). A bit of a climb to the lighthouse, but well worthwhile. Lovely trip back with lunch near to the Penguin Colony at Boulders. Great guide, great company and a great day out.

100 Percent Perfect Wineland tour. We booked this tour online about a week and a half ago with no problems. That may be partly due to this not being the height of the tourist season. Our guide (Mathew) always had a smile and a nice comment. He was able to walk two novice wine tasters through the day without fail. Also, being that he provides many different tours, he was able to answer all of our wide-ranging questions. Mathew took us to many wonderful places including several vineyards of varying types, a beautiful lunch overlooking a valley of vineyards, and a couple of small towns where we could buy gifts for back home. While there was so much to see and do, Mathew never had us in a rush and we always seem to have more time. While I'm sure a group setting would be pretty fun, our private tour was catered perfectly for us (and we had no clue what we wanted to do when we set out in the morning).

Look no further. Our group of 4 engaged African Blue for two separate day tours when in Cape Town last week. The tours were pre-arranged via email with David. Payment was easily settled online via credit card. It was our first trip to Cape Town (except for one) and we were very much impressed with the general service standards in the city’s tourism industry. This is very much so in the case of African Blue and the lodge we stayed (that’s another story). We opted for the scheduled full day Cape Peninsula on Day 1 and a private Table mountain /City/ Kirstenbosch private tour on Day 2. Duncan, our guide for both days, was excellent. He was patient, professional and very knowledgeable in the areas of history, geography and nature. Places we visited offered both magnificent views & enriching experiences. Thanks again, Duncan, for the well conducted tours, the exciting ride up to Signal Hill to catch the noon gun and the beautiful sunset captured during the scenic ride back to Cape Town Central from Kirstenbosch. Kudos to David, who, having checked the weather forecasts, took the initiative and efforts (by mail & phone) to contact us to swap the date for our private tour from Wed to Tue to avoid missing the Table Mountain given the rainy forecast for Wed. Proven to be a wise decision and we were blessed with beautiful sunshine. If you are searching for a tour operator in Cape Town, look no further! On a side note, I would recommend to devote a full day to enjoy the sights and sounds of Table Mountain.

Amazing. Greatest service and gratest people. I booked the Cape duet private tour, pick up service and cape town city private tour afternoon with Duncan. Cape Point and the tast in stellenbosch there was fantastic, the african blue tour staff was avaible anytime for any ours request.The last day we known David Smith, the boss .We are very happy for the choice and if we will comeback to sudafrica we will comeback to african blue tours.Thank you
Cape Peninusular Tour. Had a great day touring the cape peninsular, Matthew our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. Full day tour was great value.

Private Cape Winelands Tour. My wife and I signed up for a private tour of the Winelands. Our tour guide, Duncan, was extremely knowledgeable and thoroughly professional, in addition to being very pleasant and personable. He took us to three wineries that we enjoyed very much--the surroundings as much as the lovely wine. This tour was one of the highlights of a very pleasant trip to South Africa. We definitely plan to come back to South Africa, and hope to do another tour with Duncan and African Blue.

Cape Peninsula Drive. Our tour guide Duncan was on point arriving shortly before the scheduled start time. The drive along the coast was brilliant with mountains on one side and an expanse ocean on the other. My wife and I were the only tourists but Duncan acted professionally and exhaustively in terms of information provided for the entire journey. Visit to seal island was splendid and I particularly enjoyed the cozy lunch in Simons Town during our stopover to see the penguins. Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope were tremendous giving you that feeling you are at the worlds edge!!! Then to piece all together, botanic Kirstenbosch with its lush green. Awesome trip and surely will return to Cape Town.

Amazing tour!. We had a very short time in Cape Town and African Blue Tours made sure to accommodate everything we wanted to do for a morning tour. Matt our guide was extremely knowledgeable about South African History and was such a friendly guy. I would request him as a guide any day of the week.
Cape peninsula tour. We had a perfect tour thanks to Duncan. We surely would mind another tour with him. Thanks again Duncan

Great people.. These people rescued us from the side of the road when we had terrible taxi problems. Great people who went out if their way to help us for no reason. Would always use them when in Cape Town.

Wonderful Man. My friends and I had an unhappy experience last week in Cape Town in an illegal taxi. We were so lucky to be helped by David and his wife. They stopped on the busy road leading up to table mountain and helped us away from the taxi driver and then took us up to the lower cable car station. They were our good Samaritans that day and I will always be truly grateful for their help. If they are that good to 5 random English tourists then anyone who books tours with them will be very lucky. Thanks David, you are a star!

Thoroughly worthwhile and enjoyable tour of the Cape Peninsula. We enjoyed a half day tour of the Cape Peninsula with Duncan (organised with David) and we were very impressed with the service provided and the tour.Our tour was originally scheduled to be a full day tour, but due to bad weather the day before a trip that we had arranged to Robben Island was cancelled. We contacted David who was able to change our arrangements at short notice so that we could do a half day tour and still do our trip to Robben Island.We were met from the boat after the Robben Island trip and taken in a very comfortable vehicle around the Cape Peninsula. We opted for a private tour and this was worth the extra cost to make it a truly personal experience. Our guide Duncan was very friendly and knowledgeable and had organised a fabulous lunch for us to get the tour underway. From there we saw all of the sights we hoped to see in the Peninsula and plenty of wildlife too. Duncan answered all of our questions and provided lots of other useful info as well as being on hand to take pictures for us at these wonderful locations. We found this a great way to see the Peninsula and would happily recommend.

Cape Peninsula Tour - unbelievable. We did this tour, and right from pick up I knew we were in for a good tour. Duncan was our guide and he amazing with all his knowledge, and he clearly enjoys what he does with nothing being too much trouble, at no time were we rushed so we able to spend as little or as much time as we wanted at each stop, he went far beyond what we expected stopping for us to get out and take pictures of the wildlife. Thank you Duncan for a truly wonderful experience.

Cape peninsula tour - Excellent experience. We did the full day cape peninsula tour. Our guide Matthew picked us up from our hotel. In total we were 3 people on the tour. Matthew explained us a lot about the area, the people, and the history. We also had very interesting conversations on the time before and after end of apartheit in south africa. It was a great day and we got a lot of impressions and information, We can highly recommend this tour and of course our guide Matthew.

Cape tour and township tour. Both tours were excellent. I had an enthusiastic and welcoming guide for the township tour. He was informative and very open too and appeared to be very honest with his answers to questions about his community that he could have avoided or been evasive with. Being a local resident of the Langa township for me at least, gave it an authenticity that may otherwise have been missing. The Cape tour was also a great day made better by having the very friendly and accommodating Matt as our guide. The trip was diverse from penguins to wildflowers and from the cape and its beaches to historical monuments. Matt could answer all the questions asked and did it with great humour and an obvious love of his country and interest in his guests having a great time.

Tours in/around Cape Town. We are so pleased with our tours with African Blue, and we had EXCELLENT experiences over three different days. We were able to see many sights and attractions with Duncan as our guide. He was professional, knowledgable, and very flexible to assist us in our tours! Thanks David and Duncan for making our stay in Cape Town so memorable!

Cape peninsula tour. It was an overcast day and the wind was blowing a gale but our tour guide Matt made this a great day! His enthusiastic conversations on flora, fauna, geography, history, politics and surfing kept us informed throughout the 8 hour trip around the cape peninsula. Highlights included the penguin colony, a very windy cape national park, and Chapman's peak. We didn't waste time on lunch and had plenty of time to explore the wonderful Kirstenbosch botanical gardens where Mandela's strelitzias were in full glory. Scones and jam at the park were a nice way to finish off a terrific day.

Hluhluwe-Imfolozi game reserve. We had a full-day (12 hour) tour. It was very convenient in that we were picked up from our Umhlanga hotel. Barry was extremely informative, not only about the wildlife, but about many various aspects of South African culture and history. The safari itself was exciting and fun. The day was the highlight of our trip.

District Six and Langa Township Tour. David was always very prompt and concise when responding to my dad’s pre booking emails. He helped arrange how it would be best for us to spend that particular day in Cape Town. About 2 weeks before our arrival in Cape Town, another tour guide of ours had a schedule conflict. David was more than happy to move our originally scheduled Wednesday tour to Monday to help us and the other tour guide out.We were picked up on time by Matthew, bright and early. We first headed off to the remains of District 6. Along the way, he explained the history of the area. Our visit to the District 6 museum afterwards really brought our experience at the actual site there to life and gave us a clearer perspective.When we arrived in Langa, we had a brief tour of the visitor center. Once our guide Odwa arrived, we started a walking tour. Odwa would walk and explain certain areas to us. Then we would hop in the van and head off to different areas of Langa for more sights and information. Odwa was fantastic! We were not apprehensive about visiting a township, but Odwa made it so welcoming and safe. At the end of our day with African Blue, Matthew dropped us off at the Waterfront to catch our ferry to Robben Island. He gave us great directions where to board the ferry, and after he parked, he met us there to make certain we made it there okay. Matthew was not as engaging as some of our other tour guides, but he did a very good job and we saw everything we were promised. Odwa made our day very memorable too. All in all, a great morning of enlightenment!

Nice Big 5 Safari and Cape Town City Tour. We booked a Aquilla Big 5 Safari Tour which was a great experience, we saw all of the Big Five. Although the reserve cannot be compared with a 'real' safari - the reserve was fenced, and also the lions were separated from the other animals - it was nice to see all the animals such close. We also booked a City Tour, which was a little shorter than normal because we were the only two who had the trip at that day. Nevertheless, Matthew told us a lot about Cape Town and gave us a good view of the life over there. Unfortunately, the Cableway up to the Table Mountain was closed, but we drove up to the hill which still gave us a nice view over the city,

Cape Peninsula and Winelands tours. I had two great tours with African Blue. Duncan took us to the Winelands and Matthew to the Peninsula. Both were very professional, knowledgeable, friendly and included everyone in the day regardless of wether they were a solo traveller or in a couple. It was also really interesting to hear their own personal insights and experience of South Africa's recent history. Two very different but really fantastic days out enjoying the beautiful South African scenery and countryside outside Cape Town.

Cape Peninsula Tour. Duncan was awesome. He made us feel like we were getting shown around by our good friend instead of some snobby tour guide. His breath of knowledge stretched way beyond the content of the tour and was much appreciated. We saw the entire cape peninsula in the 9 hours we were together but left feeling it was just the right amount of things to do and see. Both the optional seal and penguin excursions are totally worth it so take advantage of them. Overall a wonderful day of sightseeing that generated many lasting memories.

Great tour. I booked a 5 day private tour with my family.It was a great experience.Our guides were outstanding and very professional (cheers to David and Michael).The hotels we stayed in were very good and the activities and sightseeing were great. African Blue taylored a personalized tour after we contacted them a couple of weeks before our trip.Of course, it was not cheap, but it worth every rand.

Amazing Private Tour of the Winelands!. We had planned to drive ourselves through the Winelands, but after randomly meeting David and his wife, Michelle, we had a new plan. Two days later we found ourselves on a private tour of the Cape Town Winelands with David and Michelle along for the fun! Duncan had the honor of being our driver. At one winery we met the winemaker and stopped in on his crew as they were busy labeling and boxing the bottles. Definitely not something we would have been able to do without David and his network. Many thanks to David and Michelle for a wonderful time!!

Cape Peninsula Tour. We booked online the Cape Peninsula Tour, Duncan was our guide, showing up perfectly on time at our hotel, sharply at 8.30 am.We were seven people on the ride. All the places we visited were perfectly introduced and shown by Dunca, that definitely knows his stuff.We were at Hout Bay, Seal island, Penguin Island, Cape of Good Hope among the others.Really nice choice and worth the money.

Fantastic Private Tour. I booked the Cape Peninsular tour from the UK on the internet but decided to take David's offer of a private tour upgrade at a reasonable price.Our guide Duncan was absolutely brilliant. Very knowledgeable on South African history, local landmarks, the wildlife and plants etc. We asked LOTS of questions but Duncan was great at answering and made us feel comfortable all day long.The beauty of the private tour was we could adapt and spend more time at attractions we liked such as Boulders Beach and Cape Point rather than be slowed down by the group. The vehicle was still the spacious big mini bus.Highly recommend.

Cape Peninsula Tour. Duncan our tour guide was on time to pick me up from the hotel. There was seven of us and never at one time did I feel out of place, all the places we visited were an eye opener, Hout Bay, Seal island, Penguin Island, Cape of Good Hope - the walk up to the Diaz lighthouse was something else - tiring but worth it. On our way back drove past Parliament and Pollsmoor Prison. Duncan knows his stuff and it was great to have him as our guide Thanks Dave and Duncan! Will surely recommend to other people.

Cape Peninsula Tour. We did a tour of the Cape Town Peninsula with Matthew. The site seeing speaks for itself - Cape Town is gorgeous and there is so much to see. But what made this really special was our guide Matthew. He is from Cape Town so he really made this an authentic experience. He was so knowledgeable about literally everything, from the history of the area down to how many different plants are in the park. There wasn't one question we asked that he didn't know the answer to. He also took some great pictures of us. This tour is an absolute must for anyone visiting Cape Town and I would highly recommend requesting Matthew.

Cape Peninsula Tour. I just wanted to say a big thank you to Duncan for the lovely tour he took us on, on the Cape Peninsula. He never tired of our questions (or at least he didn’t show it, lol!). He gave us such wonderful insight on South African and Cape town history, a mini lesson in Afrikaans and showed us the most amazing views of Cape town.  Thank you for being part of creating such wonderful memories for us.  Next time we are in Cape town we shall do the Wine tour and we shall definitely do it with African Blue! Baie dankie!
Cape Peninsula Tour. Excellent day out with Duncan. Well pace tour with an informative guide. I'd recommend the specific tour and the company for amazing views and attention to detail throughout.

Duncan was the best tour guide ever!!!. My friends and I visited Cape Town for the first time and it was such a pleasure to have Duncan! He is very knowledgeable about the attractions, caters to your particular group and is such a sweet and kind person genuinely. He was one of our best tour guides during our stay. I'll be sure to request and recommend him for all future tours.

Awesome Cape Day Penisular Tour. I was picked up promptly by Leslie our tour Guide at 8am who from the off was extremely engaging and knowledgable, The day was a tour of the cape with stops at Hout Bay, Cape point, Kirstenbosch Gardens ,Chapmans Peak and Boulders Island (Penguin colony) with Lunch at Cape Point (not included) I enjoyed the tour and our guide Leslie was very considerate even supplying, the cold water during the day which as an brilliant and welcome touch, his insight into SA and Cape Town is what made this for me my best tour and money very well spent. Thanks again to Leslie and to David who was able to reschedule my tour. I truly look forward to my next visit and will definitely do another tour with African Blue.The day was an incredible tour and I was glad I was recommended to your tour agency.I look forward to my next trip and will definitely be taking one of your trips next year when I return for Two Oceans Ultra.rry for the delay since the trip but I wanted to send a note of thanks for the tour and especially to you driver Leslie your driver, he was very considerate, the cold water supplied during the day was an brilliant and welcome touch, along with his insight into SA and Cape Town, this was the best tour have been on and I hope you will pass my thanks again onto Leslie.The day was an incredible tour and I was glad I was recommended to your tour agency.I look forward to my next trip and will definitely be taking one of your trips next year when I return for Two Oceans Ultra.

Fabulous day!. Matthew picked me up from my B&B and collected just one other person. He was very knowledgeable, interesting and took us on a fantastic tour of the peninsular. A very full day, great lunch at the Cape. Highly recommended

Outstanding Cape of Good Hope private day tour. We worked with David to put together a private all day tour to the Cape of Good Hope. David worked out a great itinerary that touched all of the typical Cape attractions. We decided to go with the private tour becasue of the flexibility it offered for a relatively small premium in price. Our driver, Duncan, was great. He got us everywhere we wanted to go and stayed late with us so we could see the botanical gardens. David contacted us a few days before the tour and we agreed to switch the dates because the weather on our original date was questionable. We had great weather as a result and David's commitment to service should be noted. I recommend both African Blue and our driver Duncan.

Fabulous day on the Cape Peninsula Tour. Our tour guide Matthew was our fab host on a relaxed, informative and varied tour of the peninsula - seals, penguins, two oceans and spectacular views! There was even an ice cream stop! Would recommend it you plan to this day trip!

Une journée sensationnelle au Cap. We had a great day with our private tour guide Matthew that explained everything to us! Now cape town and surroundings have no secrets . I highly recommend this amazing tour !

Brilliant!. We did the full day Peninsula tour with Matthew,a fun and knowledgeable guy. His obvious love for the area came across especially in his distress at the devastating forest fires that were raging at the time of our stay...our lunch at the two oceans restaurant was interrupted by a member of staff saying that we wouldn't be able to have dessert as the place was being evacuated due to the smoke nearby !! The whole day was full of highlights,spotting a whale from our boat in Houts Bay on the way to the seal colony,the penguins at Boulders,the delightful gardens at Kirstenbosch...all in all a great day.

Capetown in South Africa. We spent two and a half days with Duncan from the African Blue Day Tours. My husband and I felt we know Capetown very well after spending time with Duncan. We went almost everywhere and even the scenic ride in the mountains and the back roads. Duncan was punctual, polite, courteous, attentive, always asked if we needed to use the bathroom and at each stops he always let us know where the bathrooms were. Duncan was very knowledgeable and he gave us the history and details of the places we were visiting and we had some very good conversations with Duncan. We felt very comfortable with Duncan. Duncan was an excellent tour guide and we could not have asked for more. We will definitely recommend African Blue Day Tours to anyone we know who is going to Capetown and have Duncan as their tour guide.

A perfect guide. We had the chance to experience David's guidance and flexibility when he tooks our group of journalists from Switzerland around Cape Town. We experienced a wonderful day, compact and inspiring. Thanks to David who always knew where to stop, where to optimize our time and gave us a perfect chance to experience as much as possible in our limited time. We very much loved his humour and his way to explain the South African way of life. We will come back - for sure!

Fantastic day!. We took the Cape Peninsula tour with Matthew, and it was a wonderful experience. Since it was a Saturday, there was a bit of traffic and the sites were busy. We were worried we wouldn't make it to Kirstenbosch at the end due to this, but Matthew made sure to get us there by the end of the day, and we really appreciated it as we were leaving that day and had not had a chance to go to see the gardens yet. He also dropped us directly at the airport after the tour for an extra 350 ZAR, which was very convenient as well. It was a great day! :) Thanks, David, Matthew, and African Blue!

What a service. This was the best and easiest trip I've ever booked. I've been dying to go to Aquila and with just one call it was all organised just like that. David is a legend and made it super easy. He emailed straight away with all the details we needed and a really easy link to make a safe payment. Just super! Thanks Dave x

Excellent!. From booking, to airport transfers to tours, service was excellent! David really took care of us, and everything was customization to our needs for such a short stopover. I would recommend Africa Blue to anyone!

Great Cape Tour. We had a lovely tour of the Cape. Our guide personalized the day, stopping where we wanted and suggesting a great spot for lunch. We saw many animals and got a lot of history of the area that was very interesting. We will definitely use this company again!!!

Cape of good hope day tour. We had a fantastic day With the guide called Matthew. He took time to show us around, and give detailed information in anything we wanted to know. He was friendly and efficient. When most of the day had gone, we still had some time left and he took us on a Scenic roadtrip. It was just amazing the Whole day from morning to afternoon, and I really recommend this Company. They are serious and honest.

Penninsula Tour. Booked this tour some weeks before we came to Cape Town. It was easy to book and Davis was helpful and answered all my question. The day with guide Duncan was excellent. Well planned and he is a great guide in all ways.

Fantastic Day Trips. We booked two private day trips with African Blue - we have teenage daughters. It was our first time in Africa and we didn't quite know what to expect! The first day we went around the Cape Peninsula, Boulders Beach, Simons Town, a boat trip to Seal Island etc. The second day we went to Hermanus- a boat trip is a must- we went in August and although they don't promise anything, I think you are pretty much guaranteed to get close to the whales. On the way back we asked if we could squeeze in a stop at Betty's Bay penguin colony. We preferred it to Boulders Beach- it was much more low-key, natural and cheaper! I can't recommend Blue Africa Tours enough. They were punctual, accommodated the schedule we wanted and our guide Marcus was knowledgeable and really friendly.

Great Tour. We booked the Wineland Tour to taste some of South Africa's finest wines and to see the country side. Mathew picked us up at the hotel at the agreed upon time. We had a great day with the two other guest and our knowledgeable guide. After 3 wine tastings we stopped him having a fourth one and asked for an alternative which he easily could porpose. (Visited a small museum along the road.) Excellent guide, excellent tour.

Great day trip . We booked a Cape peninsula tour with African blue and received excellent service. From the moment I emailed David he was prompt and helpful. On the day of the tour the weather wasn't great so our guide Duncan talked us through the day and gave a suggestion to do the tour backwards to escape the cloud. This was a brilliant suggestion as instead of being in cloud the whole way round we were in beautiful weather. Duncan is a great guide, knowledgeable and very helpful giving us recommendations and advice. The day was excellent and well organised. We had a fantastic time and would recommend!

Cape Peninsula Tour. I booked this tour after seeing good reviews on T.A. We were staying in Camps Bay and David arranged for our guide Duncan to collect us from there which was great. Duncan was an excellent guide, he is very knowledgeable and friendly. This tour is a must for anyone staying in Cape Town as you get to see so much more than you would on your own. We stopped for lunch and the food in the restaurant was excellent. We had plenty of time in each place to look around and explore. We would use African Blue Tours again if we were to return to Cape Town.

Private Cap Peninsula tour with African Blue Tours. Dear David!For 10 years ago we discovered your travel agency “African blue tours” and we decided to take your excursion when we shall visit South Africa.In December 2014 the time arrived and we book a private trip with you to Cap Peninsula.. I must say that everything was fantastisc, you was a perfect guide, showed to us wonderfull places, and stayed there how long time we wanted!!!We can never forgott this day and this remain to us one of most amazing excursion that we ever did.You agreed to drive the way we have prefered.We were safe in your Mercedes car, and you drived carefully and stoped on the way when we wanted to see something special.We must say that just from beggining we feel that we are thinking on the same way. You are an open person, who knows a lot of things and wanted to share with us! Thank you David, thank you African Blue tour! The only thing that we regret is that South Africa, you, and your travel agency, is toooo long away from Sweden!!

Well organzed. I signed up for the full day Winelands Tour which was outsourced to Hylton Ross (www.hyltonross.ca.za). On Dec. 20, I was met at my hotel by Wayne. I was the first pickup and got an amazing tour of Cape Town as we picked up the other passengers. There were 7 total. I was able to ride in the front seat since I was solo. Our first stop was the Anura Winery and we sampled wines with a selection of jams and cheeses. This was a great start to the day. From there we drove to Franschhoek and were given ~ 2 hours to shop and have lunch. This was too long for me. There was a wonderful Arts & Crafts faire with some vendors selling food. I had a good lunch and shared a picnic table with a local family. The next winery was Eikehof Winery where we tasted wines outside under ancient oak trees. The owner poured the wines! We then drove to the historic & university town of Stellenbosch where we had 40 minutes to explore and shop. Unfortunately it was Saturday afternoon and many of the stores had closed. We didn't make it to the 3rd winery before they closed (Vergenoegd) but we were able to walk the grounds. This was a lovely day, good weather and I had another private city tour since I was the last to be dropped off.

Private Cape Peninsula tour with African Blue Day Tours. We had an amazing private Cape Peninsula tour during our stay in Cape Town. Our guide Duncan was very knowledgeable and was great company for me and my family. We felt we had enough time and managed to see all the highlights.

Cape Peninsula Tour. The day trip was led by Matthew who was really friendly and gave us enough time to take pictures and enjoy the spectacular views of Cape Town. The trip was well organized by David Smith, who was always prompt in responding to emails and giving us as much information possible prior to the trip. I am South African, and African Blue Day Tours have made it possible for me to explore and experience the beauty of our coastline. Well done to you all, I surely recommend African Blue Day Tours to anyone who wants to see the true beauty of the South Africa coastline in a one day trip :)

Cape Peninsular Tour. Absolutely fantastic tour with an amazing tour guide- Duncan. Duncan made the tour feel like a road trip with close friends. Comfortable rides. Beautiful scenery. Factual history by the tour guide. A must do tour when in Capetown, and the African Blue Day Tours values your time and money. Not a single regret!

Well-organized, very enjoyable tours. Even though my African Blue tours were outsourced to Hylton Ross and another company for the shark cage tour, everything went off without a hitch and I had a great time. For African Blue tours part, I must say that David Smith did an excellent job of communicating to me clearly all the details that I needed to know prior to departure, and he was very quick to respond to all my questions via email and texting; his competence, as well as his professional and friendly demeanor were greatly appreciated...especially since I was a bit stressed out due to my procrastinating till the last minute to make tour arrangements for Capetown...totally my fault but he worked with it (which may explain why the tours were outsourced)! Anyhow, kudos to African Blue and David Smith...hope I am lucky enough to return to South Africa someday to try some more of the tours- they all look so fantastic! :)

Amazing Cape Peninsula Tour. My wife and I had an amazing Cape Peninsula Tour back in November 2014 with African Blue Tours. Our guide was Duncan who was very friendly and professional and made our day a memorable one. We initially booked a group tour but ended up having a private tour at no additional cost. Duncan is very knowledgeable about Cape Town area and made us feel relaxed, no rushing, we enjoyed every stop, took loads of pictures and we had a great meal next to Boulders Beach. We will definitely book tours with this company next time we are in Cape Town.

Peninsula Tour . Great tour! Well managed and fun. Not too rushed and we enjoyed all the key points. Our guide Duncan was awesome -:) Really knowledgable and he gave many great insights into plants, animals and histories. Very friendly and professional - one of the best guides I've had. Would love to tour with this company again.

Excellent African Blue Tours. Me and my friend just got back from taking a private tour of Cape Town Peninsula and it was absolutely amazing. We were originally going to do the group tour but decided to upgrade to the private tour. We were so glad we did this. Our guide who was named Duncan was very good. He was very knowledgable on the Cape Town area as well as South Africa. He was polite, friendly and made the trip well worth the cost.This tour has been by far the best tour we have taken here in Cape Town. They picked us up where we were staying all the way out in Hout Bay and dropped us off at the end of the day. We got to see areas of Cape Town we would not have other wise gotten too. This trip is a little expensive but well worth the cost. I would recommend it to anyone who is visiting Cape Town. Over all excellent tour!!!!!

African Blue Tours - the best tours at there!. We have just returned from our first South African holiday. We were based in Cape own for four days of which we booked 2 days of tours with this tour company. Our driver/guide was called Duncan. He was a very charming, polite and knowledgeable guy. He had a wealth of information to share and was great with our rather 'active' kids! While booking the trips I corresponded with David Smith, another helpful man who guided me when booking the day trips and catering for my familys' needs. I would definately use and recommend this company again.

Excellent tours.. My wife and I went on three tours whilst in Cape Town, a full day Cape tour, a half day wine route tour and a half day Township tour. We thoroughly enjoyed all three and would recommend the tours themselves and also African Blue who delivered in every aspect of the process. Bookings and confirmations were efficiently processed, tours began on time and met our expectations, the tour guides were excellent, enabling flexibility within the structure of the visits and really bringing the places alive. Our appreciation and understanding of this wonderful country was enhanced immeasurably and African Blue have helped to provide us with some of the best memories of our holiday.

Day trip to townships and Robben Island. My husband and I and two friends spent an interesting and thoughtful day visiting District Six, the township of Langa, and Robben Island. Our guide was Thabiso, who was friendly and knowledgeable, and answered all of our questions. He started our tour by driving to the heart of District Six, where he stopped and gave us an overview of what happened there before taking us to the museum. After visiting District Six and Langa in the morning, Thabiso dropped us off at the harbor, and showed us where to catch the ferry for Robben Island and where to have lunch. We had a marvelous day despite the depressing aspects of the different sites, which are very much worth experiencing and provide unique perspectives on some of the darker moments in South Africa's history.

Excellent Cape Peninsula Tour. My friend and I took the full-day tour led by Duncan, our driver who previously had been a ranger at a game reserve. He was very friendly and informed. He wanted to maximize our experience and took us to Kristenbosch even though we were running late and it was out of the way. He also drove to Cape of Good Hope beyond the planned Cape Pointe. I highly recommend this group.

Excellent Cape Peninsula Tour!. From the initial email conversations with David, I had such a great experience as David ensured to answer all of my numerous questions about the various tours of Cape Town. I was a solo traveler from the States with limited travel days, so I ended up going with the Cape Peninsula tour. It was fantastic and I had such a wonderful time. Matthew was the tour operator/driver that day. He was very knowledgeable and very friendly and ensured that we had a great tour experience. I got to see everything on this tour: from the penguins at Boulders Beach, to the lighthouse, to taking pictures at Cape Point, it was such a wonderful and unforgettable experience! I plan to visit Cape Town again next year, and when I do, I will definitely be reaching out to African Blue Tours again. Thank you so much David and Matthew!

Amazing & fun Cape Peninsula tour. We had such a fun day exploring the Cape Peninsula with our guide, Duncan! It was our fist time to Cape Town, and we were celebrating our honeymoon—so we ended up going with a full-day private tour and loved the more personalized experience. Duncan was super knowledgable about everything, and had a particularly good eye for spotting wildlife. And he was really fun to spend the day with, too! He knew lots of little side stories and anecdotes about each place we went, and was really nice about stopping for pictures and taking photos of my husband and I in each place. Since we did the private tour we were able to spend a little extra time in the areas that most interested us—like swimming with the penguins at Boulder beach! Definitely a highlight of the day! Duncan shared a lot of fun local facts and recommendations that we used the rest of our time in Cape Town, too. Would absolutely recommend African Blue for a really thorough and fun way to see ALOT of the Cape in just one day! It was awesome!

Cape Pennisula Tour. We took the Cape Pennisula Tour with African Blue Day Tours and I would highly recommend this tour to any first timer to Cape Town. Ian, our driver, was very professional and knowledgeable about the local information and the wildlife. His low-key approach was very refreshing as it was a small group with many questions. Ian was at our B&B at the prescribed time and dropped us off timely as well. Highly recommended.

Excellent Tour Operator. David Smith was a pleasure to deal with on arranging our 3 tours. We did the Township Tour - an absolute must, Robben Island and a half day in the wine country. It was comforting to know that we had arranged all this with David before we left home.Our guide for the Township Tour was a native of Langa Township. His name was Ludumo Dwaha and he was just fantastic! He gave us such and insight and you could tell how easily he was connecting with the people who invited us into their homes and kindergarten, He also gave us great demos of the click sounds in the Xhosa language. Ludumo came to our hotel in a timely fashion and we had a great morning. If there is one tour that one must book in Capetown, this is the one! Ludumo also had our Robben Island tickets for the afternoon and showed us where to get the boat. Robben Island was very interesting but if you have a weak stomach, avoid the boat.It is still very important to see if you can get there.The next day we did a half day tour of Stellenbosch and the wine country with none other than David himself and his lovely wife, Michelle, who went to the university in Stellenbosch.The town was quaint and Michelle filled us in on the university.We are not wine drinkers at all but it was worth it to see the beautiful vineyards and landscapes. We did appreciate that David took us to a very unique and beautiful winery calledMuratie and if you love wine, you must go there.I highly recommend African Blue Tours for your next trip to Capetown.
Cape peninsula tour. It was a very good tour. We learned a lot of interesting things and saw amazing landscapes. Our guide was nice.

Township Tour. Our group of seven had a fantastic day visiting the Langa township and Robben island. From the moment I first inquired about the excursion, David was great to work with. He was quick to respond to any of my questions which made me very comfortable about booking with him. The tour itself was eye-opening and inspiring. David and Matthew picked us up at our accommodation (they ran a few minutes late due to a traffic stop). David was a great guide and very informative as we drove to the township. He was able to give us insight into what it was like to grow up 'privileged' during the Apartheid era before we got to the township. David then left us in the very good and capable hands of Odwa, a resident of Langa. Odwa was a fantastic guide and gave us a great tour of the township. It's difficult to put into words all that was seen and experienced, so suffice it to say, i would highly recommend this tour.After the township tour ended, David picked us up and brought us to the waterfront to catch the ferry to Robben Island. There was a bit of a hassle getting onto the ferry, but there is nothing David could have done about it. We had tickets for the 1pm crossing, but due to overselling and the lateness of the returning ferry, the 1pm ferry was full so we didn't board the next ferry until almost 2. Something to keep in mind if you have time constraints.The Robben Island tour itself was remarkable. The bus ride around the island for an orientation was pleasant. The bus guide did a good job of explaining what life was like around the island. However, it wasn't until we got to the prison and met Derek that the visit came to life. Derek was a political prisoner on the island in the late 80s until his release when all political prisoners were let go. His first-hand account of the treatment and conditions really brought the tour alive.David did an outstanding job putting together this tour for us so i can highly recommend his company as one to book with.

1 Day Inverdoon Sarfari. I took the 1 day safari to Inverdoon from Cape Town in October. I have been to Kruger and ADDO Elephant Reserve so was aware the one day safari to this private reserve could not be compared. Our driver Olaf was excellent and very knowledgable. I would like to comment however that he was very tired on the return drive and we were a little concerned.I felt overall the tour was good but think the price is very out of proportion to what was received.

Excellent Cape Peninsula Tour!. My first trip to Cape Town, and I wanted a day trip that would be memorable. So glad to have chosen this one! Matthew was our tour guide, and as we were a very small group we had excellent access to him all day. He grew up in Cape Town and has a very thorough knowledge of the area. He is also knowledgeable about local history, geography, plants and wildlife. There was so much information that I ended up taking notes on my phone to be sure and remember it. We were lucky with animal sightings (ostrich, baboon, and of course the wonderful penguins!) I recommend the Peninsula Tour very highly, and would definitely take another tour with African Blue if I had more time here. Also - the fee was very reasonable for a full day's excursion. Overall really excellent!

Hermanus Whale Route tour Amazing. We had a great time on the Hermanus Whale Route tour 10th October with David as our tour guide. David was a brilliant guide with insightful commentary on historical buildings and Whales backround only a true local would know. We saw the Whales. We won't hesitate to recommend African Blue tours to anyone.

Excellent Peninsula Tour. We had a great time on the Peninsula tour with Mathew as our tour guide. He has extensive knowledge of Cape Town and I won't hesitate to recommend African Blue tours to anymore.

Fantastic tour . If you want to take a marvellous, informative and relaxed tour of the Cape, go with African Blue. Matthew was a brilliant guide with insightful commentary only a true local would know. We knocked off all the greatest hits and even saw whales, thanks to Matthew's eagle eyes! When we return to South Africa we will definitely be booking any trips with African Blue. I cannot recommend this highly enough.

Amazing. On the 9th of September we had a tour through the Winelands with Matthew and it was fantastic.We went to see and tast different wine producing places and to see the most beautiful landscapes. This tour was amazing, not only because of the wonderful landscape and wine, but because Matthew was there arranging everything for us. He was a very thoughtful tour guide, making us feel very confortable and relaxed. He also arranged a reservation for us on the restaurante "La Roca", with the most beautiful view and tasteful food!We had an amazing time this day with Matthew and we didn´t feel we were with a stranger but with a friend! Thank you for everything Matthew and we hope to see you soon!

Cape Town Tour. Our tours: Private Table Mountain and Kirstenbosch tour, Private Cape Peninsula & Constantia Wine tour, Hermanus Whale Route tour .Unfortunatly we didn t go on the top of Table Mountain for the strong wind but the Others tours were really interesting (in particular Cape Peninsula and Hermanus Whale). David and Matthew are excelent guides.Just a little remark about Constantia Wine Tour, the tasting was perfect (really good wines) but I hoped to do a visit in the farm and to see the cellar.

Outstanding. We went to the winelands and to the big five Safari with African Blue Tour. Both tours were outstanding. Our guide in the winelands, Matthew, was the best guide ever. He showed us the best places next to Stellenbosch and Paarl. One of the highlights of the day was the restaurant La Roca. It was a great time to remember. Thanks to African Blue Tour for organising both trips in the best way and a special thanks to Matthew.We will definitely return and recommend you!

Perfect Cape Tour. We booked the Private Cape Duet tour with Matthew and it was great, we visited the Cape Peninsula and then we went wine tasting in Stellenbosch. The only issue we had is that when we arrived at Stellenbosch in the afternoon the wine cellar that was planned to visit was closed, but Matthew found another one that was still open resolving the problem perfectly. I fully recommend them.

Fantastic Cape Tour 1st Sept 2014. We had a fantastic day tour with David that made our last full day in South Africa one to remember. David is knowledgeable and is prepared to stop, allow you to sight see and talk you through the history of the region. Nothing is too much trouble.....even crawling through the rocks on the non-tourist side of Boulders Beach to see the penguins. All in all a great day and highly recommended. Thanks

Township & Robben Islands tour. Despite the bad weather and therefore the cancellation of the Robben Islands tour, we still had a great day visiting Langa township and district six museum. Our guides Sugar and David Smith did an amazing job. It was very impressive.

Excellent guide and amazing tours! . We booked three tours and were taken on each one by Matthew. He had excellent knowledge about Cape Town. We went on a peninsula tour, whale watching to hermanus and wine tasting. Due to bad weather we could not go on our whale watching tour the day we had planned but Matthew called in the morning to rearrange our tours for when the weather was better for us to be able to see the whales. This was a very nice touch. We would definitely recommend African Blue and Matthew as a tour guide. Thank you for a great Cape Town experience! Raj and Mary

A good day out with a new friend. My daughter and I had a private tour. Our guide Matthew was great fun and it really was like a friend showing us around. The weather was sunny rainy thundery hailstones and windy but that didn't matter. We had an excellent day out and Matthew made it really fantastic. Can highly recommend and five stars is not enough

Kruger safari. Fanstatic! I made a very last minute request (decided I wanted to see some animals whilst on a business trip in South Africa) and African Blue took care of everything. I contacted multiple people and they were one of the only people to get back to me. They organised the whole thing for me from start to finish (transport there and back, game drives at various points in the day, all food & charges), which took all of the hassle away for me. When I asked questions they replied very quickly. The safari guide that I had was incredible - I saw Lion, Buffalo, Black Rhino, Elephant, Zebra, Giraffe and more all in one day. Thoroughly worth it.

Topnotch service for our tours. We had considered renting a car for our recent trip to Cape Town, South Africa, but with their driving on the opposite side of the road from what we're accustomed to in the U.S., going with David at African Blue Day Tours was certainly the right choice. With tours to a wildlife game reserve and to the Stellenbosch wine region, David took the stress out of negotiating this for ourselves all the while serving as a uniquely accommodating, courteous and knowledgeable guide.

I felt I had a friend in my guide Jan. My own guide meant we could relax and get to know each other. We laughed a lot, shared a lot and of course travelled around. She has trained carefully, and really knows her details, such as the plnats of the area. Brilliant experience.

Cape duet tour a must!. I had a knowledgable and funny guide Marcus show me and a group of others the stellenbosch area, two wine estates, the penguins at boulders beach, lunch at kalk bay and amazing views at the cape of good hope and the drive through chapmans peak. All this packed into one day and we even saw some baboons as we were leaving the cape of good hope. The tour company is professional and the guide gives you enough time to explore things and advises you about Cape Town in general. Looking forward to using them next year when I return.

Amazing!!!. Had a fantastic trip with David touring around Cape Town! He was great- was extremely knowledgeable---as well as easy going and fun! We were a big group with little kids---and David kept it fun while keeping us on schedule---not an easy task! He also took us surfing the next day, and again was awesome as our instructor!Definitely the way to go if you need a tour! If you're reading this- thx again David!Jayne

Fantastic Cape Peninsula Tour. We had a brilliant day touring the Cape Peninsula with David. He has amazing local knowledge and made the trip come to life. He was unphased by an unexpected road closure, and managed to effortlessly get us on a boat to Seal Island despite us arriving late due to road works. He also took us to a fantastic restaurant for lunch. Overall a very low stress way to see the Cape (having done it ourselves the hard way previously some years ago). Much more fun and relaxing than driving yourself!

Excellent outing - highly recommended!. On a recent trip to South Africa we had the good fortune of booking a day trip with David. He was polite, knowledgeable and contributed a wealth of knowledge about the destinations we visited. In fact we had such a great day out with him that we booked surfing lessons with him the next day, and he managed to get the whole lot of us to stand up on the board (not an easy task). He was excellent company - a sentiment shared by our entire group, in fact each of the children enjoyed his company so much that they all wrote in their travel diary about "how much fun they had with David" and how nice he is. Absolutely 5+++++ stars. Wish him the very best, and if we ever have the good fortune to go back we'll hope to tour with him again! Cheers!

Very nice day on the Cape Peninsula . It is little hard to know how to fairly review this trip as several things went wrong which were out of the tour guides hands, a road being closed, some of the other guests being late and the restaurant being slow to serve. All of these meant the tour at times was a bit rushed but the guide did his best to allow enough time at each place and was good humoured and friendly throughout. All in all a good day which could have been a great day with a bit more luck. But I have no problem recommending the service they provided
