it's simple, book with David!. recently back from a trip to SA. David was fantastic. Our large 12 person group ranged from 75 to 5 years old, and David was comfortable, accommodating and at ease with all. He knows what you should see but is always happy top cater to you needs. Having grown up in Cape Town he knows all the history personally, and I always felt he was excited to share that knowledge with us, as opposed to some guides who seem to just read off a script. It all seemed to move effortlessly and next thing you know we were off to the next great spot. And when his wife (who provides surfing instruction/lessons) was unavailable, he even took a group of us out and taught us himself. At the end we all felt we had met a great guide and a friend. He was fantastic and I can't recommend him enough. I really mean it, stop searching and just book with him. You won't go wrong.

Cape Peninsula tour. I had an awesome day with David and the other tour attendees. Unexpected travel caused us to be become behind schedule but David handled it like the pro he is. He phoned ahead and ensured we had spots for the next activity. I was a single traveler and could not have felt more comfortable. Highly recommend.

Cape Town & Magical Garden Route. It's almost a year since we have seen David Smith of Africa Blue, and I still keep telling people about what a great time we had with him.We had several experiences with him over a period of 6 days - all great!Firstly, he got us the Robben Island Tour in the 'nick of time'. We had arrived by cruise ship and were late docking so, with military precision and a casual, yet efficient manner, he made sure we got there in time.He guided us around Cape Town and Table Mountain. I like his style. He gives you enough information and enough time to yourself. Some guides just keep talking and nothing sinks in. He has a healthy balance.A few days later, he collected us in Franschhoek and guided us for 5 days to various destinations and attractions on the "Garden Route".Throughout this time, David had to deal with varying numbers of Aussies as some joined different parts of the activities. In total, there were 14 people.All-in-all, a big "thank you". We thoroughly enjoyed every moment.

Great Cape Town vacation thanks to David!. We had a wonderful experience in Cape Town with David as our guide. We went shark diving and wine tasting, the wine tasting being the most perfect afternoon I could have imagined. He knew exactly the experience we were looking for. David also helped us plan our safari at Kruger National Park. I would recommend his services to anyone!

Winelands Tour. Thanks to African Blue Day Tours for a fabulous day out in the Winelands. We were able to experience all the wine farms on our wish list and were taken from venue to venue in air conditioned luxury. A special day was had by all our guests- thank-you!

Great knowledge and experience!. My husband and I went on the combined Township and Robben Island Tour. Our guide was full of knowledge during the Township tour, this was a real highlight of our holiday and opened our eyes about how life really is in South Africa. This is a must! Robben Island was also interesting albeit your time in the prison was very limited but you do get to go around the whole island. Amazing customer service from David via email prior to the tour- highly recommended! Thanks

Amazing vocation with African Blue Tours. Great service, professionalism and flexibility described African Blue Tours. Thanks to David's flexibility my friends and I could see a lot from South Africa in a tied schedule. Thank you a lot African Blue Tour to unforgettable holidays!

The best Tourism Agency in South Africa!. I don't have words to describe how Africa Blue Tours made me happy! David (our guide) is the best guide that I have had! Great humour, did the impossible for us to visit all the places that we wanted (every time we changed!), super professional person!Of course, I will return with other friends and hire African Blue Tours!

Best of South Africa!. I and my firends had an amazing vacation time in South Africa thanks to all the great support I got from African Blue Tours & Safari! Everything was great since the beginning – quickly responses to all my e-mails and questions, put together a perfect itinerary that allowed us to know the best of South Africa. David sense of humor, flexibility and knowledge of the best places to go and visit made the entire trip remarkable. Obrigada!

David, tour guide above all !!. David took a group of 8 of us on a shark dive and Cape peninsula tour in mid-september that was destined to be doomed from the get go. Weather indicated there would be rough tides and everything looked like all things wouldnt happen. David did such a good job with arranging all activities associated with the tour. He was very engaged (even before we reached to SA) and kept us abreast to all matters that had to do with the dive. Even after our orginal tour was cancelled he made a special effort to arrange another tour for us. Trust me when i say, you will be well taken care of. He is very knowledgable of the area and the history and you will not be short changed. Highly recommended!!

Sharks, peguins, cape of good hope and more. David was really great, when we were in cape town the weather was not good. The day before our tour with David we could not do what we had planned so David agreed to just add it to our tour with him. He was organized and kept our disorderly group in line and on time for our various activities. The day we spent on tour with African blue was the best day I had in cape town. At the end of it all I left something valuable in the tour bus and David ensured its safe return the next day. I could go on and on about the tour ......you just have to do it! I highly recommend African Blue tours!!!!!!!

Sharks whales and Cape peninsula. We travelled to Cape Town as my husband wanted to see Great White sharks. David arranged a Shark Dive Tour combined with a private tour to Hermanus to view the magnificent sight of Whales gracefully swimming by from the cliff tops. This was a fabulous day and the memories will stay with us for ever. We also did a private Cape Peninsula tour with David which again was a wonderful experience as David is a very pleasant knowledgeable person who gets great pleasure out of showing you his lovely country. This tour has everything, penguins, seals, cape point and spectacular scenery. Lunch at the Two Oceans restaurant was made even more special as Whales were passing by. Will be returning to South Africa .I read lots of reviews as they really do help but very rarely write them. Thank you David

Winelands and Cape Peninsula Tours: Excellent!. David was our tour guide for both a winelands tour and the Cape Peninsula tour. Comfortable travel, well-informed and fun guide and everything I wanted to see and more! On the winelands tour, I requested to be able to visit a winery from each major wine-making area. My cohorts, a gentleman from Austria and one from Germany, were great company and we all agreed to let David choose. He did a fantastic job...Fairview, Solms Delta and Tokara did not disappoint in experience, views or taste. Our lunch stop in Franchoek was a delightful break. The next day, I embarked on a day trip with David to see the Cape Peninsula. This time I was accompanied by two American ladies who were a blast! Every stop was worthwhile, and David even allowed us a couple of extra stops on the way by request. He even steered us away from experiences he deemed "too touristy" and encouraged to have the better experience. This is no cookie cutter tour. He was a marvelous guide and it was absolutely safe and fun for a woman traveling alone. I highly recommend anyone traveling in the area to contact African Blue Tours. They are exceptional!

White Shark Dive. WOW! If you haven't done it - do it! My short stay in Cape Town was hampered by bad weather, which meant that most of the shark cage dives were cancelled. However David managed to find me a dive to go on with the only operator who was running the day I had free. I can't thank him enough because it was an awesome experience. Something I will never forget. The operators were excellent and made sure that I got the shark experience I was after. Thank you!

Cape Peninsula day tour. This was a wonderful day tour from Cape Town - our excellent guide Leonard was very pleasant and informative, with lots of interesting anecdotes. Timing was perfect, with stops for photos and wildlife as well as the programmed activities - seal boat trip, penguins at the Boulders, and of course the visit to Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point Lighthouse. Lunch at Two Oceans Restaurant was delightful. A great day, thank you! Lynne & Graeme, Australia

flexible and kind. We had two transfers from PE to Addo and then from Addo to J-bay. Both times the driver was well on time, flexible with stopping at a shop on the way and bringing us right to the door of our chalet (instead of leaving us at the reception which turned out to be a mile away). Great service and would def recommend to anyone needing a tour in the most beautiful country on planet earth :)

The tour company to use in Capetown. I found this tour company listed on the Trip Advisor website and am sure glad that I did. The tours arranged for us were wonderful and the one that the owner, David handled himself, was the best of all. David is an extremely knowledgeable tour guide/owner and you get a first class tour with lots of information and an extremely pleasant tour guide to boot. I highly recommend people consider this company for personal, excellent tours.

4 days in the drakensberg with African Blue. we had 4 days to tour the Drakensberg, and we were looking for a guide and driver. using trip-advisor i found Daviv Smith and got a quote according to my plans. the main attractions that i was concerned were: Sani pass & Amphitheatre. also, "on the way" i asked to stop at valley of 1000 hills, and a glimps of Durban. Not only did we see all, we managed to add the remarkable Drakensberg Boys Choire! . David made our itinerary possible, according to our wishes and we are more than greatful for those wonderful dyas.

Excellent Trip. I wanted to book a quick two-day safari experience for the beginning of my trip to South Africa, and African Blue / David Smith came highly recommended to me by a close friend. David was extremely responsive and easy to reach, and was able to organize a wonderful two-day safari experience. He even upgraded my accommodations in Kruger National Park because the temperature happened to be unusually cold on the day I was to embark. The reserve was phenomenal and the staff was highly knowledgeable and hospitable. I would recommend this outfit to anyone looking to book outings in South Africa.

The Cape Peninsula with David Smith. A wonderful day tour of the Peninsula from Cape Town to Cape Point with a most engaging guide. Up close and personal with penguins, whales, baboons, red-winged starlings, and David himself. By late afternoon when the tour was finishing up, he had us feeling more like long-lost uncles than clients. One of the major highlights of our recent month-long tour of southern and central Africa.

African Blue Was Great!. We booked two day tours with this company and both were perfect. The van was comfortable, the guides very friendly and knowledgeable, and the tours perfectly planned. David worked with us to plan a trip to the wine country and put together an itinerary that suited our needs. He went the extra mile to secure additional spaces for us on a tour to Inverdoorn, and the route he chose for our return to Cape Town was a highlight of our stay. I highly recommend this tour company !

Effortless. David is friendly, professional and keen for his clients to get a good experience during their travels in South Africa. We went on the overnight Garden Route Safari with our two year old son and David was very understanding about the need for regular stops during our journeys to and from the resort. We had a great time and would recommend him and his tours.

White Shark Tour - February 2013. We went on the Shark Dive Tour on the 15th of February. We were picked up at our hotel, on time (at 5h in the morning), and had the best day ever. The tour guide was very knowledgable, and we learned quite alot about white sharks. David was very helpful, and we had no problems with our booking or the service provider thanks to African Blue. Will definately recommend them to anyone!

Wine Tour. David provided us with a fantastic private wine tour. He picked us up right on time, and was able to accommodate our personal requests. He made sure we had a lunch reservation at the beautiful Cafe Bon Bon, and kept us on track to enjoy 3 wine tastings. I can't wait to come back and take more friends.

David the Genie made magic of our adventure, a dream come true.. Having booked us on a luxury safari at Sabi Sands that more than met our expectations David rescued the remainder of our vacation with seamlessly orchestrated adventures to numerous historical and breathtakingly beautiful sites in his beloved country. Very professional, punctual and fun!

Great time on the Garden Route. First, my disclaimer- while I booked my tour through African Blue, my tour ended up being operated by Tompson's Africa. The tour, however, was great, and David (of African Blue) was very helpful. So this review is mostly a review of David and African Blue.We were on our honeymoon and while we were on our own on safari and in Cape Town, we were looking for a Garden route group tour for a few days in the middle of our trip. We booked a great 4 day tour with David, who also helped to arrange our hotel in Cape Town. As i mentioned our tour was great, but David had it provided by a different operator. When we arrived in Cape Town after the tour, there was a problem with the room that the hotel wouldnt fix, so as a last resort, we called David to help us sort it out. He actually came over at 9pm and convinced the hotel to give us a new room for the night, and to fix the problem the next day. What a great advocate!We also booked a private wine tour with David, but my wife was sick that morning so we ended up on a tour of a doctor's office instead. David helped us sort things out, and we booked a second day with him so we could ultimately do our wine tour as planned.In sum, we can't really comment on the quality of the garden route tour, because ours ended up operated by another company. But it was a fantastic tour nonetheless! I can comment on how great David was with the booking process, and how great an advocate he was when we were in South Africa.

Cape Town Tours. We used African Blue Tours for arranging our Local Tours in Cape Town from 28th to 30th Jan'13 and we are extremely satisfied by the arrangments done and services provided.The tours included - FD Cape Point Tour, FD Shark Cage Diving Tour, HD City & Table Mountain Tour and HD Wineland Tour... wish we had more time.We strongly recommend African Blue Tours to anybody who is planning to visit South Africa and wants to have a smooth and hassle free holidays.Special thanks to David and Julia for being so prompt with their responses and for the services provided.Keep up the good work guyz.

Best day in Cape Town. It was the best day of our trip, touring with David around the Peninsula down to Good Hope. David could answer all our questions and made it a very interesting and pleasant day! I would recommend this to everybody. (Petra from Nairobi)

fun time at Aquila Game Reserve. Thanks to David, who not only organized the trip to Aquila Reserve on a short term but also helped us finding a great appartment in Camps Bay, we really had a great time at the Reserve. We booked the self-drive Safari and as David promised it was really easy to find. Rooms where nice, our family cottage was quite big and we had enough time to relax and ejoy the view over the Karoo from the terrace. On our two game drives we saw all the Big 5 and our guide was very informative and funny as well. Unless Aquila is nothing like Krueger Park it is really an outdoor safari experience rather than a visit at the Zoo.

Perfect organization. I used African Blue Tours for a 3-day-safari trip. Although it was on short-notice everything went very well and David did everything to make my wishes come true. The accommodation, transport and safari were exactly like it was described before or even better. It was just an awesome experience and I can definitely recommend to book with African Blue Tours. Thank you, David!
they are good. I used them last time for a tour of the winelands.. guide was really nice and professional. nice tour.

One day is not enough. My husband and I took the Cape Peninsula Experience with David on our trip of October this year. And what an experience it was! David made sure we could tailor our trip to our liking. So THANK YOU very much David!!!! The only thing we regret is that we couldn't spend more time with you.Angelia

Breathtaking Cape Peninsula Tour. My wife and I were on our Honeymoon and we took the chance to go on a one day Cape Peninsula Tour. We had already booked a private 4 day and 3 night Cape Agulhas & Garden Route Tour with our guide David Smith (African Blue Tours Owner) so it was an obvious choice for us to book this one day tour. We were joined by 3 lovely ladies from South America and a cool guy from Italy. The one day Cape Peninsula Tour is must for any visitor to Cape Town and you will find it difficult to beat African Blue Tours. David is a fantastic tour guide, who has lived in Camps Bay all his life, his knowledge and passion for Cape Town is truly infectious. Cape Town and the Peninsula is definitely the most beautiful and most breathtaking places on earth and my wife and I will definitely be coming back.

Our custom day trip was perfect. We had very limited time in the Cape Town area, and standard package tours didn’t meet our need, so we booked a full-day tour with African Blue Tours. Our guide, David, was very knowledgable and flexible, and worked out a great itinerary that covered everything we wanted to see. David is a long-time resident of the area, and his narrative was a perfect accompaniment to the spectacular scenery. Highly recommended.

Informative trip around Zululand. I recently went on a wonderful tour from Durban to the Anglo-Zulu Battlefields. The drive up through cane fields and winding mountain roads was quite beautiful. My guide, Ernie, told me about the history of the region and the 1870s military campaigns, contrasting this with the strategies one learns in the South African Army. After this it was fascinating to walk around Isandlwana and Rourke's Drift. I'm from the USA and I feel like I got to see so much more of South Africa through this tour.

Just Perfect!. My husband, daughter and I had just one week in Cape Town and David with African Blue Tours showed us all the highlights. We took 4 tours, including the winelands, a safari to Inverdorn, Cape of good Hope and a trip to Hermanus for whale watching. Everything was perfectly coordinated and David is a wonderful tour guide. Nothing is too much trouble and he made sure we had a great time . I would recommend African Blue tours in a heartbeat and hope to see you again in the future when we visit Kruger. Thank you again for making our vacation complete.

Good service all around!. My group was pleased with David's effort to accommodate us after a mixup with a pickup from Johannesburg for a night safari. The staff at the lodge was very friendly and personable and did their best to make sure our trip was well worth the time and effort. I am happy with the courtesy of everyone we interacted with and credit Emmanuel for getting us to the airport in time. All in all a great time was had with the credit given to African Blue Tours!

Personalized experience with personality. my group was very pleased with Davids efforts to bring forth the beauty of the western cape. He made calls to help on different excursions as well. Great advice, great prices, and of course knowledge of the areas. We recommend David. Thanks, DRE

GREAT CUSTOMISED TOUR FOR 2 ON THE GARDEN ROUTE. We highly recommend African Blue Tours and David Smith. David went to that extra effort to adapt our 5 day tour from Port Elizabet to Cape Town to our wishes and time scale. We experienced walking tours ,Golf Course visits and off the main road side tracks. David related to us in that he had visited our home country Australia more than once. The tour tour was extemely informative and enjoyable. The only downside was that we ran out of time to see more around Stellenbosch.

Great experience w/ African Blue. Thx for organizing the Kruger tour last minute.. I was headed to JNB on a 21 hour flight from NY. It was a last minute trip and I was trying to book a tour to Kruger the following morning upon my arrival. I didn't think it wouldve been possible, but African Blue made it happen. I shot David an email right before boarding the plane with details of where I was staying along with the reservation form, and also informed him of the possibility I would have no email access for the next 21 hours. I arrived @ my hotel in JNB about 11pm with messages that everything was taken care of, and a scheduled pick up the following morning was also confirmed. It was a great tour!!!I woke up my first night on the reserve to let some light in. It was amazing to open the curtains and find giraffes and zebras passing my window a few feet away. One of the best things to see!!! (pics attached)

Lovely guy with a passion for surfing and watersports!. My husband and I were picked-up at Cape Town Airport by David Smith and we quickly established a lovely rapport from the start of our relationship.He took us on 2 full-day tours but wasn't challenged to offer anything 'out of the usual' as our hotel created our Stellenbosch Winery Tour itinerary which David followed (not his fault but as a result, difficult to provide a review - despite this, he was great company throughout the day!).Our day tour to the Peninsula was very good and David proved knowledgeable and interesting. David is a lovely guy who demonstrates passion and enthusiasm for his love of water sports so if you have an interest in this area, he's your guy!!David returned us to the airport for our departure and despite our very early schedule, he arrived on-time and as enthusiastic and up-beat as ever!

African Blue Tours is the only way to travel - expert service with a smile.. African Blue provided transportation while in Cape Town. Also went on the one day Safari and to Tygerberg Zoo. The Safari was great and David Smith provided history and insight to the area making it an unforgettable trip. The Zoo was nice but small. I would bypass for a trip to the wine country. Dont miss Table Top or a harbor cruise. David's associate Michelle was also extremely knowledgeable and a pleasant guide. Good times and good humor. I have travelled extensively and African Blue Tours is at the top of the list. If you go to Cape Town let African Blue be your guide.

Township tour - an astonishing experience. We tried hard to find a last minute possibility to book a township tour. After being turned down by other providers we've found African Blue Day Tours and they arranged for a driver to pick us up 2 hours later.Ludumo Dwaba was not just a great driver, but also a wonderful tour guide. He explained everything to us with a lot of detail and showed us the real life in the townships and settlements. From goat head BBQ to herbalists and traditional African healers we got to see everthing within the townships. This was a very educational day and we are very glad that we got the opportunity to learn so much about the history and culture of south africa!
David Smith is a true joy, very knowledgable, easy going and great since of humor.. Enjoyed Aquila Safari, Table Top mountain and the city of Cape Town.

David Smith was superb - knowledgable, reliable, and offered great insight and humor.. David set up a day Safari, a trip to the Tigerberg Zoo, and offered service to a fro the airport. He can if requested help with hotel accomodations and other tourist visits. Need data or help - ask David.

Highly recommended for your day in wine country. Trying to plan an event from overseas in a foreign country is daunting and stressful. I was given the task to research and plan a trip through the Stellenbosch wine country: a task that took hours across multiple days cross referencing sites and whittling out the paid tourism posts on the internet. Skip ALL OF THIS, and hire David.David guided my group of 10 through wine country on a 3-stop day trip and it was the most comprehensive day on our South African holiday. I highly recommend hiring a small, local company like African Blue Tours because you get an authentic local's perspective of the area. Aside from showing up on time, providing great, comfortable transportation, the conversations we had with him gave amazing insight into the politics, culture, and geography of South Africa. Had I known better, I would have skipped all the research, worry, and planning and just had David take us to his favorite spots. I highly recommend letting him take the reigns when planning your wine country trip and let yourself sit back and enjoy your trip! African Blue Tours has the range across a wide variety of South African activities so just call them first!

David was Awesome. When visiting Cape Town for my first time a few weeks ago, we decided to spend one of our days doing a tour of a few local wineries. David was recommended to us and we were all certainly glad he was! Aside from the standard stuff, like showing up on time, having a nice van for transportation, and being generally knowledgeable about what he was doing- David was just a hell of a nice guy. We invited him to join us for our group lunch and he spent the meal acquainting us with the surfing ilfestyle of South Africa (another one of his passions). Aside from it being super interesting, you could tell he was just a genuinely good person. The wine tour itself was great, he selected 3 wineries for us that all had attentive staffs and amazing wines. It was a top notch day all around.I'm very happy to write this review for him and support his business in any way I can. I'd definitely recommend him to any friends that are traveling to South Africa and anyone that is reading this review. If you book a day with David, you absolutely won't be disappointed.

Awesome Experience with African Blue Tours. A group of 10 of us hired David and African Blue Tours to take us on an all-day wine tasting excursion to Stellenbosch and Franschhoek and it was an absolute blast. David was punctual, accommodating, extremely knowledgeable (not just about wine, but about local politics, surfing and all things tourism) and just a likable person. We immediately hit it off with him and asked him to join us for a nice lunch at one of the vineyards to show our appreciation (highly recommend asking him to join you, as he's a blast to chat with).I would recommend David to anyone looking for a guided tour. My only regret is that we didn't plan more of our activities through his agency. They apparently do much much more than just wine trips. http://www.africanbluetours.com/about/As an aside, I highly recommend all three of the vineyards we visited: L’Ormarins, Thelema, and Tokara (excellent restaurant for lunch). The wine at Thelema was the consensus favorite and we ended up buying numerous bottles from them.Enjoy Cape Town. We most certainly did!

Did several trips with African Blue Tours. Highly Recommended!. We did several trips with African Blue Tours between February and October 2011: - Kruger Park (February) - 2-Day Kruger Wildlife Safari  - Cape Town (March) - Full Day Cape Peninsula - Half Day Morning City Tour - Half Day Afternoon Winelands Tour - Hermanus (October) - Whale watchingWe booked the first trip with David. Everything was very well organized and professional therefore we decided to book again with David for the following trips and everything was perfect again.We really had a great South African experience. African Blue Tours took care of everything.The above tours are a must if you have never been to South Africa.Enjoy South Africa with African Blue Tours!

I Highly Recommend Africa Blue Tours. "My wife and went to South Africa in August of 2011 and hired David and his company Africa Blue to assist us. It turned out to be one of the best things that happened to us on our trip. David was very professional, all his recommendations were excellent, he has an excellent knowledge of the country and was very easy to work with.Our time in South Africa was made better by meeting David and sharing some time with him.David made excellent arrangements for us to visit the District Six Museum, the local townships and Robben Island.I highly recommend Africa Blue and would tell anyone arranging a personal or professional tour to South Africa to use his services."

Perfectly organized trip arround the cape peninsula. David, owner of African Blue Tours organised a one day trip arround the peninsula for me and my friends. We were picked up on time at our place and we had an interesting and funny day of sightseeing. The programm was varied, we visited the wineyards in Constantia, the beautiful village Kalk Bay, penguins in Simons Town, Scenic route from Noordhoek to Hout Bay, Seal Island in Hout Bay and of course Cape Point. We got many interessting informations about the area and we really appreaciated the way David organized everything for us. We will come back, for sure and can only recommend African Blue Tours.

Excellent- the scenery of Cape Town is superb and this tour shows it all. David and Bianca of African Blue Tours organised most of our recent trip to South Africa- I did all on line from Australia. We were picked up at Cape Town airport by David and taken to the Panorama Apartments at Camps Bay - great restaurants nearby.The following day we did a day tour- going up Table Mountain, then saw the penguins and the Cape of Good Hope- had a very full and wonderful day.David and Bianca also organised our 5 day Wildlife Discovery Tour going to Kruger National Park and also Garden Route TourWe had a wonderful time and will recommend African Blue Tours

Excellent People and Superb Service! The Ultimate CPT experience.... We worked with David on planning our first trip to Capetown and he provided unbeliveable tailored service to meet all our needs. The thing that impressed me most about African Blue initially was how responsive they were to ALL my questions. Every detail was addressed and they exceeded my expectations on delivering. We stayed at the guest house they recommended/provided in Camps Bay and it was our favorite place anywhere to date!!! So comfortable with beautiful views of the Atlantic! Each tour they booked for us was perfect with excellent guides. We made real friendships there. We felt they treated us as family and were really invested in our experience in SA! They made our experience unforgettable and we cannot wait to go back largely because of them!

Very nice tour!. It was a very great tour! Brendan was really engaged in giving us tourist the best tour. Nice local food and sneaks. Very well thought of program, good and cheap way to see both Cape Point and Cape if Good Hope in one day. Overall a good experience!

Great tour, very personal!. Brendan was a great tour guide, he knows so much nice things to tell you. He is very patient and takes you to the right places. Definately a recommended tour! Kind regards, Dennis

An amazing adventure. We wanted to go down to the cape of good hope on our own but when we heard of the company and the itinerary we decided to join the tour. Brendan was incredibly professional, interesting and fun and we had a great time!!!If I could give a higher ranking I would give them a 10 out of 10!Thank you so much (:

Cape Point Tour in South African Spring. It was a lovely tour through the nationalpark! I met some interesting people and saw one of the most famous sights in South Africa. Unfortunatly, there wasn't enough time to take the path to the front cliffs at Cape Point or to go to the beach. All in one, a great tour with a typical lunch!

Fantastic day. Such a great day with a super friendly guide - Ziggy. She had great knowledge of Cape Town to share with us and took us to some awesome places. Seeing the penguins was incredible and also really enjoyed the walk around the Cape of Good Hope and Chapman's Peak Drive. Would definitely go again when I go back to Cape Town!

Fantastic Service. What a great trip! From pick up to drop off Brendan and Ziggy were fantastic. They went above and beyond to ensure that everyone had a great day, very informative and thorough, all advertised inclusions included, lunch was delicious, overall a fabulous day! We would highly recommend Lucky and Lost and very happy with the service provided. Thank you B&Z
A Lovely day. We saw some beautiful places, also hiked up to the light house and then down to the cape of good hope. Ziggy the tour guide was awesome .
Great. How can you not think Ziggy is the bomb, wherever her name came from. We had a great time and we hope all easy people like them too.

The Best tour of Cape Town. A luxury this tour to discover a magnificent Cape Town. In one day you can see the most representative of the city, and believe me if I tell you it's not easy. The beso Brendan And his way of conveying his passion for this beautiful city. Highly recommended .

awesome experience!. they picked us up at time and the bus has been very comfortable and clean:) after heading to the stunning colourful houses in one of the parts in capetown we drove around capetown and saw the muitzenberg beach from above and afterwards we drove to the place where the penguins are living.... but far out my favourite destination was cape point and cape of good hope! I have never seen such a beautiful scenery! and ziggy and Brendan were amazing guides, they could basically answer every question we asked them and prepared delicious food for us! So everything was fine and it was a really good way to discover amazing places in and around capetown :-)
Fantastic!. I recommend to everyone who wants to have fantastic trip through Cape of Good Hope!!! Very nice atmoshere and professionalizm!!! :-)

Enjoyed the day a lot. Brendan was a quite friendly person who answered all our questions and told us lots of interesting things. It was at no time boring and so we had all in all a really relaxing awesome day.
Perfect Day Trip to Cape Point. We had a realy nice trip to the Cape point and area around, with lovely and deliceous meal, lecker views and great guids! Thank you!

Super Erlebnis! Great Experience!. Ganz viele tolle Eindrücke innerhalb kürzester Zeit. Gute Organisation und tolle Guides. If you only have short time to visit Cape Town you should definitely do the tour to get the most out of it!!

Great trip!. fantastic trip for a whole day. Price definitely corresponds to the activities. Great guide with amazing parking and driving skills. Very informative but funny at the same time. Certainly to recommend!

Beautiful Day. This tour was amazing, we got picked up from our hostel and was greeted by our friendly tour guide. It was different to other tours we have been on but I loved it, felt like we were on a mini road trip as traditional South African music played. We stopped at Boulders beach, had a lovely home cooked traditional South African curry and a beautiful walk along the Cape of good hope. And to top it off some lovely local wine looking at the view.

Amazing Day. The Day with Ziggy was awesome. Not only Because of the beautiful places that Ziggy showed us but especially Because of Ziggy. You feel and See that she loves what she is doing and loves Capetown.
amazing tour!. We had a amazing tour with brendan to boulders beach, cape the good hope and lots of other great spots. We recommend them because of the personal caracter of the tour.

Best Day Tour I've Ever Done. A very thoughtful, personal, and genuine trip; it really did feel like a road trip with six new friends. All of the places visited were spectacular, some that I wanted to see but were difficult to get to on my own, and the others I didn't know about but am so glad the tour introduced me to them. What we did and saw throughout the day was incredible, but two weeks after what stands out the most was how personal and honest the day was. Highly recommend!
Fantastic. Such a fantastic tour. Ziggy and Brendan were so amazing and friendly as well. They put some personal touch on this tour. Glad that I've joined this tour.

Perfect Day trip!. If you're looking for a day exploring the Cape, make sure you get onto Lucky and Lost tours. I was torn between a wine tour and a cape tour as I had limited time, but this was a perfect way to combine the two. All bases were covered throughout the trip, with an amazing vibe thanks to our guide Ziggy! Not only due to her extensive knowledge on the area, but also her vast local connections and interest in the passengers' experiences and knowledge. I don't think anyone could not have a good time with guides showing this much passion and enthusiasm for what they do.Amazing scenery and experiences, with the flexibility to cater to groups of different age dynamics. Great South African food also prepared for us by our guide, as well as sampling some of the local delights.Thanks again to Ziggy and Lucky and Lost Tours, couldn't have asked for a better day on the Cape!
Peninsula. Excellent! The guide was absolutely fantastic!! Highly recommend it...for a tour of the peninsula and the wine tasting ended he day nicely.
Great way to see the peninsula. Guide was friendly and knowledgable. Good tour for younger people, has a more hip feel to it. Fantastic lunch as well!

GREAT - PERSONSL - PROFESSIONAL - HOST. For a wonderful insightful day around The Cape and MORE - look no further, small personal tours, with bespoke commentary...! Exceptional Value - SCORE 9/10. Thank you. Antony Around The World TravellerFB: Foxy Boxy Around The World 2016Freelance Travel Writer and Photographer - Hong Kong

Ziggy spread her Stardust !. We had two days in Cape Town , far too short, but "Luckily" we chose this tour . The weather that day was not good , heavy rain , but Ziggy brightened up the day with her love for Cape Town that shone through the rain. Very informative, as being a local, she understands much about the culture and heritage of the place . The pace of the tour was adjusted to make the most of the weather , she took advantage of local connections to work out the best places to visit that day . Great commentary , and music, throughout the trip and after one day we had such an insight to the delights of Cape Town and the Natutionl Park . Highly recommended .
Great Tour. A good mix of knowledge and letting you roam free and wander. I highly recommend this tour even if you are someone who normally does not like having a tour guide.
Awesome trip. We did the cape point tour and it was amazing. Ziggy is very kind and made our visit to Cape Town even better!!
awesome tour. thanks brendon for such an amazing and interesting tour.i loved it, really enjoyed the day☺️also the food was very good, so thanks to bouth of you for the great time i had in capetown☺️

Best day tour in Cape Town!. We had such an amazing day with Lucky and Lost. This day tour is probably the most varied one you can get: culture, nature, wildlife, hikes and amazing view points, good food and a wine tasting, all in just one day!Brendan is a fantastic guide: he told a lot of interesting things, but he also gave us the time to walk around at every stop at our own pace. No rush on this tour!I loved the South African music playing in the car when we were driving through all those beautiful landscapes of Cape of Good Hope.The lunch we had was delicious and is in itself a reason to do this tour.If you want a day trip that is different than a thousand other day trips that are offered in Cape Town, you've come to the right place.Highly recommended!

Fantastic day tour. The tour was terrific. Brendan our guide for the day knowledgeable & easy going. Lunch was a Cape Malay curry made by his gf Ziggy alrhough Brendan cut up the veges ☺ was delicious. The walk at The Point up to the old lighthouse was picturesque & the walk along the ocean breathtaking. Had the best day l'd do it again & recommend it to anyone!! Thank you Brendan

Excellent tour. This tour is one of the best I have been on. Our guide Brendon was really knowledgeable and took the time to answer any questions. We saw penguins, and other wildlife, did some wine tasting and learnt a lot about Cape Town. Thank you for the awesome day!!
A great day of fun. Love our day out and the guide was very knowledgeable and dynamic! Would domit again, no doubt.Thanks Ziggy!

Fun and friendly. Ziggy and Brendan are wonderful tour guides. They are passionate about their home country and will tell you lots of interesting stories about the different places you'll stop. The lunch they made us was delicious and we had the most beautiful picnic spot. Highly recommend this tour!!
Awesome tour. Lots of stops, interesting stories and something for everyone. I would highly recommend this tour. It was a great day.
Funky Van & Pinguins. Never visited the Cape and looking for good people to drive and show you around?Don't look further and book a tour with Funky Ziggy and Brendan Big Man!A good time assured...

Fun day out. Ziggy/Ziggie is a legend. Really nice and funny. There isn't lots of driving and you get to see a fair few of the many highlights Cape Town has to offer.Really good value for money, would highly recommend.

Amazing tour!. We had so much fun on our tour with Ziggy and Brandon! They are super friendly and explained to us many interesting things about Cape Town and its history! We saw many cool places such as Bo Kaap, Chapman's Peak, Boulders beach with the lovely penguins, Cape Point and a breathtaking walk to Cape of Good Hope, Wine Tasting which was our last stop.. awesome!! The lunch was super delicious and the company very nice! I would definitely recommend it to everyone because they are really cool and there's a good vibe!! Don't miss the ice-cream/sorbet in Simon's Town.. ask Ziggy! :)

Cape Town Essential. Had such a great day with Brendan as our tour guide. The tour is a great if you are looking for a more intimate experience seeing as tour group sizes are smaller than others. Brendan had a good playlist of South African music. The highlights of the day for myself were seeing the Penguins, wine tasting and Chapmans Peak drive. Some parts of the day felt a little rushed but we did fit a lot into one day and one tour. Always great to be shown around by a local. Thanks again!

This a must do tour. As a solo traveler met a lot of awesome people through this tour who I continued to stay in contact with. I would highly recommend it to anyone. It's a smaller tour so I'd book with them as soon as possible. Ziggy and Brenden are amazing people, backpackers and just make the experience what it is. Trust me, you won't regret it. Thanks you guys. -Adam from Cleveland

So much fun!. The tour covered great locations and the couple that run the tour are incredibly nice and welcoming. They give you a much less 'tourist' version of the tour and a more relaxed, version of how they would see South Africa. Highly recommend.

Peninsula Tour of the Cape. Beautifully organised tour was a highlight of our stay in Cape Town. Brendan and Ziggy were wonderful hosts and guarantee a fun, friendly and exciting day out! Couldn't more highly recommend them! If a Pennsiula tour is on your 'to do' list make sure you book lucky and lost tours. Kind Regards, Dom

Fab tour. We had a great day. Ziggy and Brandon were fantastic hosts, very knowledgable about their home town. Picked up on time great lunch and local snacks. Beautiful coastal walk, and wine tasting at a vineyard with stunning view

Not just a "tour". As themselves said, this couple were bored of standard tours when they were traveling... so they just wanted to make a different experience to let you know the southafrican culture and lifestyle. If you are not looking for what everybody does, just try this guys! Cool & nice well travelled people, they'll become friends.

Really enjoyable. Lucky and Lost is a great way to explore Cape Town at its most South African! Brendan was our guide and, even though it was his first time leading a tour, was really knowledgeable, welcoming, and fun to be around. We were taken to many of the best spots along the peninsula, treated to a homemade South African style lunch, informed about the history and myths along the different stops, and listened to South African music while on the bus.The small groups make for a much more personal experience and you really feel comfortable. I would definitely recommend them as one of the best ways to see a lot in one day!

Awesome !!!. Really cool and diferent tour. The mood is like you had friends fron South Africa showing you proudly how they're country is. All the stops worth it and Brendan did a great job with us. The spots were amazing .. really a great great tour!
Lucky and lost tour cape town. Very enthusiastic en good guide. They take you to nice places. They don't stay too long by places as you can see by other tours. Good vibe.
A Must-Take Tour. Absolutely amazing! The highlight of my Cape Town week. Ziggy puts in such love and compassion on her tours and you feed off of that energy to have an unforgettable day.

A perfect day tour of Cape Town and surrondings. Lucky and Lost Tours guides Ziggy and Brendan really made this day trip into one perfect day!This young and energetic couple are born and raised in Cape Town and have travelled the world so they know thier stuff and what it takes to make a great day tour of it. They obviously love their city and will gomto great lenghts to share it with you. Our group of backpackers blended really well during a day trip thanks to personal attention from our guides and their talent to connect with people. Playing a great mix of South African pop rock music in the background, sharing their positive energy and giving us personal attention all the time. I could go on like this forever but I'll keep it short and no nonsense instead. To experience this you need to do it. Thumbs up to these honest young people, well done!!!

Best Tour EVER!. I've done many guided tours in many countries and this was hands down the best! Ziggy and Brendan are awesome guides - fun, knowledgeable and chilled - and the whole day felt like I was on a mission with my best mates. The sites we saw were varied and beautiful, the home cooked meal was the business and the local tunes playing were top notch. Highly recommended for anyone wanting something different from the usual boring guided tour with a bunch of randoms!

less tourists, more cape = awesome day out. These two really know the cape. Back roads, delicious food and wine, seeing the sights, and getting (nearly) lost in out of the way places that only the locals know. Do yourself a favour and go and see the Cape with them.. what a exhilarating day out!

Absolutely fantastic Cape tour. My buddy and I did Ziggy's Cape of Good Hope tour about a week ago and we could not have been more pleased with the decision. Ziggy is super knowledgeable about the entire region -- history, nature, people -- and also very friendly. My group was pretty small, but I can imagine Ziggy would make it very easy for solo travelers to have a great time with everyone else on the tour. Other tours have you do a small amount of cycling at the Cape, but Ziggy -- very thoughtfully -- skips this to allow you to take one of the most beautiful hour-long walks I've ever experienced from the lighthouse to another gorgeous viewpoint -- absolutely spectacular! Of course, I enjoyed the stunning scenery, the delicious (and healthy) lunch, and the winery stop, but it was also a pleasure just to spend the afternoon with Ziggy and talk to her about South Africa and her travels around the world. Our day together was one of the highlights of my time in Cape Town and, really, all of South Africa.

A really good way to go all around the Cape Peninsula in just one day!. We had a really good day! We started the tour in Bo-Kaap, then Boulder's beach, Cape of Good Hope and cherry on top: wine tasting! All of this enjoyng some good South African music and beautiful views. The guides were super friendly and the food really good! I would recommend this tour to everyone :)

Cape of Good Hope Tour. This Tour was amazing and i had such a wonderful day. Everything was perfect, the food, the wine, lots of information and an beautiful view in many places. You were great and so lovely guys. i will never forget this awesome day!!! Thanks for that!!! All the best!!!!!!!!!!

From a scale 1-5 ? 10000000000000000000. You can't do Cape Town with out a Lucky and lost tour. Everything's literally perfect. The music, views, wine, penguins and THE FOOD . Not to mention the tour guides, Ziggy and Brenden are beyond awesome! I constantly travel and go on a slew of tours, but this was definitely my favorite. I've done it once, and I'll gladly do it again when I'm back in Cape Town.

Local is Lekker. I got the privilege to go on the first Lucky and Lost peninsula tour and what a fantastic day it was. Ziggy and Brendan, two of the raddest locals you will ever meet, thank you for such a fun filled day. From the local tunes playing in the car to the most delicious local dish for lunch, made by Ziggy herself, to the quirky and fact full info along the way, this was one of the best tours I have been on in a long time. Brilliant way to see the beauty of Cape Town. This is truly a magical city and Lucky & Lost Tours certainly add their bit of fairy dust to the whole experience. P.S. Learnt the word Lekker which is South African slang for great, delicious, amazing, awesome, fantastic, brilliant, awe inspiring, best ever... the list of goodness goes on. So in the words of a true South African this tour was LEKKER!

private tour. My sister and I went on a private custom tour vs. the group offerings because she really wanted to horseback ride. Everything was great. Horseback riding was in a private nature preserve so there were zebras, etc. grazing and roaming and the mountains in the background were a bonus. Appreciated the winery suggestions and the quick thinking when one of the stops was unexpectedly closed. Brought back a few bottles and couldn't be happier. Wish we had more time because would've done a group tour as well.Thanks again!

Great Day in the vineyards. We recently booked a private tour with Lord Wouter who was as knowledgeable as funny and a great host. The tastings were paired with different kind of foods, the estates stunning and the wines quite mixed quality and taste wise which is of course always a personal taste. I can only recommend the private tour! Keep up the good work guys!

Informal, Fun and Informative. We recently spent a day on a wine flies tour of 5 different vineyards. Our guide Paul was knowledgable and gave us background on both the wines and wine making process but also the local area. The lunch braai was tasty and we particularly enjoyed the pairings of wines with the cheese and chocolates. Beautiful scenery throughout and a fun group to spend the day with. Would recommend!

Fantastic. What a fantastic day being shown and tasting numerous great wines, whilst being guided by a Terrance. I'd previously booked the private tour as a present for a friend for when we visited Cape Town later in the year. Communication between myself and wine Flies was excellent as any question which I had was quickly answered. On the day of the tour, Terrance was there waiting on time. During the day we visited several vineyards and sampled many wines. Everyone at each of the vineyards was so welcoming and couldn't say if one was better than another. Each was slightly different though but all excellent. Can praise Terrance enough as he was very informative on the all the vineyards and areas. Also his general manner made it a very memorable day for all of us. Would I recommend this to others ?In a word "Absolutely".Big thank you to the Wine flies team for making this a special day.

Excellent Wine Tour. We took the day long wine tour and visited 5 wineries. The wineries are amazing. Each one is spectacular. Our driver was very knowledgeable and a lot of fun to be with. This is one of the best wine tours we have been on. Not only will you learn about all the wines and the process from the vineyard workings to the bottling, but you will also learn about the surrounding areas you travel through, meet interesting people and have a have a wonderful lunch, sample cheese, chocolate, and taste some biltong. A very professional and wonderful team of people to wine tour with. You will love it! Cheers!

Great time in Stellenbosch with Wine Flies Tours. Fab day out. Ian was a great guide. Like the informal friendly vibe of the whole tour. Good value for money. 5 wineries with generous tastings, ample lunch in a lovely setting and plenty of pairing bites of cheese and chocolate along the way. Very professional. Made booking via email at the last minute and they were very prompt in their response. Highly recommended.

Best trip of our stay. I cannot recommend Wine Flies enough, they do exactly what they promise, they were punctual on all of their pick ups and delivered a fantastic day out around the Stellenbosch area. I also had the embarrassment of being so tipsy that I left my phone on the bus, and the driver returned to our hotel after his last drop off to return it to me, I was very impressed. Our driver for the day was BIG G, he was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and very impressive. He took us for an unscheduled drive around Stellenbosch pointing out places of interest and we could not have had a better guide. Wine flies takes you to 5 vineyards which is one more than most tour companies, and I really cannot praise them enough. The food , the wine and the whole day with a bunch of happy mixed nationality guests was just fantastic.

Great day and fantstic value for money. We were picked up from our accomodation and whisked off for a fun-filled day. Ian was a great guide and the whole day was very informative and well arranged. Our group of 13 were of mixed nationalities and we all got on so well, singing all of the way home in the bus. The wine (plus cider and beer) tasting was excellent, as was the lunch that was included. Would definitely recommend!

Wine connoisseurs in the making. If you are young at heart and have a taste for wine. I could not suggest a better wine tour.At the start of Oct, my wife and I joined a range of international tourists on our Wine Flies tour around the Stellenbosch area.  Our guide Terrence was amazing from the start, with his passion for what he does, showing up in how he explained everything, from his knowledge of Cape Town to the production of wine in our country. He treated us to a history of how wine first started in SA, and explained how wine grows from the seed to ending up in the wine glass.Each of the 5 local farms we visited had their own sense of uniqueness, and atmosphere; and the wines we tasted at each, were incredible, with special mention to the chocolate pairing in the LovanE cellar.Having the experience of tasting wine direct from its barrel through to tasting an 8 year old Port at the end of the day. This is definitely a tour I will not soon forget and I look forward to joining them again on the other tours they offer.Thanks to Wine flies and to Terrence for an awesome day out in the wine lands.

Enjoyable and engaging tour. Where do you get the awesome meat from!?!. Legend was our guide, and was apparently newish to Wine Flies touring but handled the day like a pro. Very friendly, knowledgeable and professional, and kept the day ticking along nicely. He was always at hand to explain any extra questions we had. The tour was exceptional value for money (heaps of wine pairing with cheeses, chocolates, meats, and also lunch all included). I just wish I could buy some of that biltong and droewors in bulk from you guys! (PM me if you wish to share the supplier name ;) )A couple of suggestions for Wine Flies: 1. Maybe consider a single meeting point for the group in the morning, so as to maximise touring time and minimise the 'dead' time of driving in peak hour traffic picking up everyone from different areas, and,2. A brief stop-off in Stellenbosch town would have been awesome. The building architecture and scenery in the town is a real highlight Cape Town highlight, so perhaps that additional time saved via implementation of Point 1 above could turn into a half-hour wander in Stellenbosch's main street?

Great day and excellent value for money!. Was a great day out with Wine Flies who I would highly recommend! We we picked up first by our tour host on time and collected the rest of the group before heading to the first vine yard. There was no pressure from the tour guide to take part in the activities or the tasting which made for a nice relaxing atmosphere and helped the group to socialise with each other. There was an excellent balance to the day with information on the production of wine in the region as well as tastings and lunch. I will definitely do the tour again when I return to Cape Town!

Great wine tour in Stellenbosch winery. Great organization of the tour by the staff. Everything mentioned in the tour description was respected.The process of wine and MCC is well explained and the tasting with pairing is wonderful (cured meat, cheese and chocolate). The landscapes are beautiful and I enjoyed to do my wine and cheese tasting in front of zebras!I hope that there is more wine tour like that in different wine area!it is a great value for money

Stunning tour!!. This tour is truly a must do, we had a great guide - he was very knowledgeable and entertaining! The tour truly gives you an in depth picture of how wine is made and produced, how to correctly taste wine as well as what the many different wines there is. The lunch was good and very traditional South African. This tour is really a must do!
BEST WINE TOUR. Best wine tour I've been on. Our Tour guide was very entertaining and knowledgeable. Soooo much fun and really good service. Highly recommend this one

Great wine, great guide & all round great day!. Best wine tour I have done so far! I have previously done a few tours in Australia and found that I learned so much more on this tour - got to see behind the scenes and learned about the growing process and history of wine growing in the Cape. Our guide Terrence was lovely, it was obvious that is extremely passionate about what he does! Went to some beautiful Stellenbosch wineries and tasted wonderful wines, cheeses & chocolate. Highly recommend Wine Flies!

Fantastic Time and Great Value. Must do activity. Value is awesome. Fun time.Ian was a terrific tour guide. Very knowledgeable and friendly. We visited five wineries. Each one was unique in locale, specialties of wine and overall ambience. Cheese pairing at one. Full lunch (food was outstanding) at another. Chocolate pairing at another. I can't recommend this highly enough.

RX: 1-region per day x 3-days for a great wine experience!. My GF & I booked 3-days of private tours with Wine Flies covering (1) Paarl/Wellington/Swartland (2) Walkerbay/Hermanus and (3) Stellenbosch/Franshoeck areas. In the months and then weeks proceeding our arrival, the fine tuning of wine "estates" (not wineries) were narrowed down based upon our personal preferences. We requested smaller, more personal tasting locations vs large commercial properties, which the WF were able to arrange. We stopped for lunch each day in each region at 1:00/13:00. Lunches are not a covered expense and as such we selected where we wanted to go based upon a list of recommendations from WF. Our morning pace was a bit heavier than after lunch which made for a great balance. Our guide for all 3-days was "V" who provided insight into not only the wine regions but was able to field questions about the history of Cape Town as well. V was a pleasure to travel with over the three days and took great care to provide just the right amount of attention and handling without being a bother. Whether you have extensive wine experience or very little, the Wine Flies is an excellent company for tasting while in the Cape Town region.

What a day . This is a must do to see the wine lands.Sure, we were landed with 5/6 fun Irish girls who would rather shot wine than taste it and learn but our guide Ian was a legend and made it fun and inclusive Superb wineries and the only issue we had was having to re pack from all the wine we had!

Fun Wine Tasting around Stellenbosch :). We had so much fun on that day tour and spend it with the other guests in many wine estates around Stellenbosch. We tasted different kind of wine, cheese and chocolate. Also we had some nice South African Lunch and met some funny animals along the way - such as a wine drinking cat :D It is definitely worth it since it is a very personal and welcoming atmosphere. Most of the wine estates are family owned and run, so that makes it even more authentic.My friend and I had a fantastic day with Wine Flies Wine Tours to the lovely landscape and surroundings of Stellenbosch.So worth it! MCC Methode Cap Classic - yes you also learn about making wine, so listen carefully to your guide... ;)

Sunday Funday. Visited 5 wineries, each one different and special in their own way. Tour guide Lawrence was knowledgeable and fun. Had only about 10 people doing the tour which was nice, made for a more personable and fun tour! Would book again!

Absolut great day. After a not so good start, the bus was late by 1 hour. Then it startet with a brief "what will happen". Our Tour guide James did a GREAT job! During the stops he told a lot about the wine making, the Wiens etc. No need to say, but the tour Got more and more happy, after each stop. So after 5 stops, James drop US off at a restaurant for more wine and Food.All in all a superb Day and Tour!And yes, would love to do it again ;0)

Fabulous day out!. What a lovely day! I am a UK medical student working in Cape Town as an elective student so I attended this tour as a solo traveller on my day off and it was amazing! I was with a group of 14 people from all over the world and every one was super friendly. It didn't matter at all that I came on my own. The vineyards for fabulous, the wine pairings were great. I ate and drank so much I left feeling very warm and satisfied. The tour guide was so knowledgeable I learnt so much about Cape Town and the surrounding areas. I would recommend this tour to anyone, a very enjoyable day out.

Great day in Stellenbosch . Spent a great day with Wine Flies in Stellenbosch, visiting five different wineries. We were looking for a fun filled day with the opportunity to buy some wine and this tour was perfect for us. Returned home with 8 bottles of wine, wished we could take more with us back to Holland.

A great day!. We went on a day's tour of the wineries - 5 wineries and, we reckon, 28 different wines, ports and sparkling wines! It was a great day with 6 of us altogether. Lunch was good - including the best butternut squash soup that I have ever tasted! There was plenty of opportunity to buy the very reasonably priced wines we had tasted - just a pity we couldn't take more home with us!

Fantastic experience!. We did the full day Classic Tour for a friend's Hen Party. Our guide, Lord V (Wouter) was really great and amazingly patient with our gaggle of crazy females. We had a lot of fun and actually learnt a lot as well. Definitely worth doing!!!

Excellent Tour, Fantastic Price!!. Five wineries, comfortable transport, amazing tour guide, great food...all for roughly £40! Crazy good! We travelled in a group of 4 guys, complete wine novices, and had an incredible experience. Big G our tour guide was brilliant fun and humour throughout the tour, full of knowledge, insights and stories. Each stop had its own heritage and story and made for a wonderful all round experience. Fully recommend this trip to anyone wanting to embrace the culture of the area, have a real laugh and enjoy some great wines!!

Fantastic day of wine tasting! . Our trip with Wine Flies was fantastic, and the price is amazing. We visited five places, sampled many great wines and had some lovely food as well. Travel is also included, and the tour leader we had was excellent. We met a great group of people, and continued the day/evening once the tour had finished. I would definitely recommend this company!

Simply the best !. We joined Ian Saunders (tour guide) on Wineflies Paarl/Stellenbosch wine tasting and cheese/chocolate pairing day tour. Amongst our party were beautiful people from The Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, Australia and India. We were blessed to have a knowledgeable and informative guide like Ian who went the extra mile to make our day an unforgettable one.Will definitely recommend Wineflies to all our overseas guests who are interested in being spoiled on a more than reasonably priced wine tour.

Phenomenal value for money. This was a really great day out. Lord V was our tour guide and he was brilliant. You get great value for money on this tour as it is not too expensive, you get picked up from the hotel if it is central enough, you go to 5 farms in one day with cheese tasting, chocolate tasting, lunch included and we had 22 glasses of wine and the portions are extremely generous. It is well organised too with quick responses to emails. One thing I would say is I would happily pay more to get a bigger portion of cheese. The cheese was really good.

Great day out. Was very pleased we took this tour - it was fun and informal - visiting smaller vineyards with really great wines. Our guide for the day was very helpful and the other folk on the tour joined in the laughs.The tasting with chocolate was memorable. Its a long day though (we left at 8.30 and did not get back till 6) so go prepared for that.

A superb, fun and informative day out. A fantastic time was had by all. Lowrens was a fantastic guide, good fun, full of facts and knowledgeable about the industry. The vineyards visited were all good, interesting and diverse in their wines, and you will likely want to take a few home with you! All in all, five stars and an excellent day out in stunning countryside?

An incredibly fun experience. It was very comfortable getting picked up from our hostel and then being driven around all day. Our driver and guide Lord V was funny and knowledgeable and could keep the information about the ways of wine tasting interesting and fun for everyone. The food and wine was very tasty (especially the cheese!). The other people that came along for the tour who we didn't know beforehand were awesome and the tour was an excellent way of getting to know them. After we were dropped of back at our hostels we all went out for the night and had a great time.

A must do in Cape Town. Wow! If you can only do one thing in Cape Town this is it! I actually did three tours in one week! I coordinated/booked via email. I received prompt response and confirmation. the van picks you up at 8am ish, that is when the fun begins, you instantly start meeting new friends and are given a bit of history/info on the way out to wine farms. Depending on the tour you will stop at 5 wine farms or a combination of wine farms, cider makers and breweries. At the wine farms you are surrounded by scenic hills and valleys great for some awesome pics. You get to taste 4-6 wines at each farm. Some paired with, chocolate, biltong, etc...such an awesome time I highly recommend

Great fun, friendly driver and lots of wine. This was one of the best things we did in South Africa. A day of driving around 5 beautiful wine estates, tasting 4-6 wines at each one and having them paired with cheese or chocolate on occasion. Lunch was at the 3rd estate and consists of a braai and a glass of wine of course. It's a full 10 hour day in total and so not bad for money. However after the first estate the tastings did feel slightly rushed and so I would be tempted to say just four estates would be better to allow for a bit more time. That said, I wouldn't want to miss any of the five!All in all it was a great day and would do it again in a heartbeat. Thanks

Fantastic. We were part of the clan that toured on 31st August. Everything was fantastic. From the sing along Beatles songs playing on the way to stellenbosch, and 80s hits on the way back, the wine farms, food - everything 100%. Would highly recommend this tour operator. Wouter and his sidekick were the best hosts.

Loved this trip!. This tour was fantastic! Our guide, Louwrens was very knowledgeable, friendly and fun. We stopped at 5 wineries, each had their own little uniqueness to them and each were paired with some sort of food including chocolate, cheese, meat. They served us a traditional braai lunch that was amazing! On our trip we met people from all over the world and as the day went on we all got more talkative and loud thanks to the several wines. At one of the wineries we were able to order a box of wine and have it shipped to the US. Overall, fantastic tour of Stellenbosch Wine Country!

Lord V and Lord Legend Rocked!. My feedback is the same as everyone's here - V was fantastic. He knew answers to every question asked by the group and was interactive yet stepped away to give the group time to get to know each other in an atmosphere other than a "classroom". He was training a new employee (Legend) and they were a pleasure to spend the day with.As others have outlined there are 5-6 stops for the day, lots (23?) tastings (so pour out what you don't like!) and some nice cheese and chocolate parings. Neither of these tastings are "all you can eat" as someone else stated, so don't plan on loading up on this stuff. There is a nice traditional lunch at a wine farm complete with loads of animals though so you won't go hungry. (but do bring some nuts or a power bar to have as back up if you want a sense of comfort - it is a long day)I'd do this again in a heartbeat and would recommend to others. Our group of 11 was a mishmash of US, UK, AU and Japan and within an hour or so we all got along famously. I was a single traveller and didn't feel left out or isolated at all.

What a day!! Loved it all!. Lord V picked the seven of us up from our house in camps bay for our private tour. First was a champagne and white wine tasting at Villiera estate. Next to Remhoogte Wine Estate for a wine and cheese tasting. Then to Middelvlei estate for the best lunch before our next set of wine tasting! Next onto Lovane for chocolate and wine tasting. These were amazing! Last but not least to Annadale Wine Estate for red wine and port tasting with more chocolate. All incredible!!

Day Well Spent!. This tour was awesome! As a solo traveller, I wish I would have done this my first day out, only so I could have fit another one in during my stay! We visited 5 different wineries and tastes over 23 different wines. It was a wonderful day! Our tour guide, Lord V, was fun and knowledgeable. He kept the crew moving, but still gave us plenty of time to enjoy. The food we had for lunch was fantastic and the wines were incredible. We tasted wines that you cannot get anywhere other than at these wineries. I would have booked another tour immediately if I only had time left in my stay in Cape Town! Thanks, Wine Flies!

Lovely day!! So much fun. We had such a great day, I'm very happy we went for the Wine flies tour! It was the perfect amount of information about wine making, food and wine tasting! All included. We met many nice people on the trip, everyone felt at ease. We tried not only wine (a lot!) but also cheese, chocolate and braai. So very delicious!! Totally recommend :)

Fun Day!. We were a group of 12 friends wo went on the tour.. our guide took us to 5 wine estates with 5 wine tasting at each estate.. needless to say that we were more than a bit tipsy by the end of it.. we did cheese pairing..and chocolate pairing.. all the wineries were good.. we loved the demorgenzon winery the most.. and their wineries were spectacular.. it was a well organised tour both informative and fun.. would recommend.

Fantastic day out. We were picked up by our tour guide Lord V ( easier to pronounce than his full name!) And whisked away to five beautiful and uniquely individual wineries around stellenbosch. Along with there being plenty of wine to try we also did cheese and chocolate pairing and had a lovely tradition Afrikaans style lunch. It was a lovely relaxed day.What I really liked is that the places we visited had a really comfortable feel to them,not stuffy at all. Lord V had an excellent playlist to serenade us between wine farms and he was very informative and happy to answer our questions. All in all it was a great tour.

A fun filled day!. My husband and I had a great day with our tour guide Ian. He was very friendly and entertaining. He also tried hard to educate us from our cluelessness about wine. He was very knowledgable and passionate about his job. We had a lovely tour group of 8 of us in total. The 5 vineyards we visited were all unique and beautiful in their different settings. At the first winery we tasted 2 champagnes, 2 whites, 2 reds and 1 port, all by 11am. But we were well supplied with nibbles and snacks too. At the second vineyard we had a cheese pairing, lunch at the third, then chocolate tasting at the 4th. At each their was an opportunity to purchase any of the wines and we got the chance to look around the cellars were the is produced, learning about the process. We had lots of fun and would definitely recommend it for any lover of wine!

Great day out!. Just returned from a really good day out. Lots of wine to sample and good pairing. .. biltong,cheese, chocolate. Nice lunch included.We were lucky, small group and nice people. I am not sure it would be so good on a 40 seater bus and in the summer but thats speculation, our day out today was great.Learnt some interesting information especially about neck labelling. Ian our guide was good, mixture of knowledge/chat etc. Picked up on time which was great. Only negative was i would have like more MCC, sparkling stuff, but that's personal taste. Great day out.

Wine flows with Wine Flies!. I scheduled the tour for my husband and me from the United States via the website and email. We landed in Cape Town on Sunday night at 9 PM and it was 11 PM before we were "lights out" at our hotel. We were asked to be ready for pick up on Monday morning at 8:30 for pick up between 8:30-9:00. We were picked up during that window in a clean shuttle bus with functioning air conditioning, including in the back row. The group was approximately 12 adults including couples, co-workers, singles, and siblings, and our guide Terrance. We were the only two people from the United States which was great; other countries represented were Belgium, Germany, the Netherlands, and Australia (we got some great advice for a future trip to Australia :). This was a fun and informative tour. I ended up sitting up front with Terrance after the first stop since I can get motion sick easily. That was awesome as it gave me a chance to talk to him about a lot of other things about South Africa, not just the wine. He was a wealth of information about the wine region and each winery. The first stop was the only one that included an MCC, the South African "champagne". That was a bummer for me since I loved it, but that was not a surprise and the other wines didn't disappoint. With the first wine, you get a little biltong (if you don't know, it is a dried, cured meat similar to beef jerky). At the second stop, we paired cheeses with wine. When the wine tasting was done, there was an opportunity for people to purchase a beer flight of locally made beers. My husband did it and was far more impressed with the wine than the beer, but it was still fun and worth a taste. The third stop was wine and lunch. Both of the first two stops included decent sized tasting portions of five wines so the lunch and water break was well timed (and with wine, of course). Your fourth stop will be to a great place with my dream basement bar. There you will pair local chocolates with wines. The "berries only" Cabernet was outstanding. We left with one bottle, but I wish we had purchased more and chanced it in our luggage since shipping to the U.S. is outrageously expensive. Lastly, you stop at a small, very rustic family winery where we were served another five really great wines. We ended with being dropped off at the front door of our hotel with enough time for a rest before our evening dinner plans. This was really a perfect tour for the first day since we were tired and didn't want something strenuous that first day, but couldn't afford to take a day off to just sit around and rest. We learned a lot, enjoyed the company, and our guide was fantastic. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Wine Flies to anyone looking for an excellent, hassle free, wine tour of the Cape region!

Enjoyable day. My sister and I decided to book a wine tour to save the hassle of driving ourselves and not worry about driving and drinking. We learnt a lot about wine. We met some lovely people. We enjoyed the wine, chocolate, and cheese! Great guide. Delicious lunch. Good price. All in all a memorable day

Wonderfulness. I had a private romantic romeo tour and it was one of the most relaxing romantic days of my life. It was raining so we couldnt ride horses but we did a lot of wines,cheeses and marvelous chocolate.The tour guide was awesome. He was really instructive and fun to chat with.I hightly recommend this tour.

One of the best wine tours. My husband and I have been on several wine tours (Napa, Sonoma, Spain, Italy, etc) and this was one of the best. Our tour guide, Clinton, knows a lot about wine, has a great personality and kept the entire day fun and engaging. How can one not love visiting the beautiful area of Stellenbosch. learn about South African wine and a great guide. This place is highly recommended and ask for Clinton!

Lovely visit to Sellenbosch!. Had a great time with Wine Flies day tour of Stellenbosch. Very much enjoyed the 5 wineries we visited. I learned a lot about the process of wine making as well as various types of wine specific to South Africa. We had a full van of about 13 people - each is picked up at your hotel. The group never seemed unwieldy, though as people bought more wine the van did get a little cramped!We chose this tour b/c it visited smaller 'off the beaten path' wineries as well as served lunch at one cheese and wine at one and chocolate and wine at one - so even my friend who doesn't like wine as much enjoyed the chocolate! A couple of the wineries had their tastings out on picnic tables with the mountains and vineyards surrounding which was especially nice. Definitely enjoyed this day and would recommend!

Awesome day of wine tasting!. Excellent day out with a top guide! I stuffed my face with food, enjoyed lots of excellent wine and had a wonderful experience checking out the different vineyards! Would recommend to anyone else :0)
