Great wine tour. I had a wonderful day exploring the wine country and tasting nice wines. The guide was a pleasure to be with.
A great experience. Had such a fun day wine tasting and learning about the various wines! a great experience to anyone who loves wine!

Excellent Experience. The guide was amazing, the stops were as well, we gained a lot of information and expertise on wine. I was not a big fan of it so I was skeptical about the whole trip, but it absolutely exceeded any of my expectations. The food was excellent as well, the wine yards beautiful and we got a complete explanation of everything we did and tasted.

Awesome wine tour!. Had a great day experiencing heaps of different wines! Beautiful country side, great lunch and cheese and chocolate pairings! What more could you want? Paul was very knowledgable and made us all feel welcome! Usually I am not a red drinker but I managed to try a lot today and may well be converted! If you drink all the wine you will definitely be drunk!!

Excellent Customised Wine Tour. I booked four days of wine tours on an individualised basis. Lord Wouter took great care and chose amazing places. His ability to select from high end, technology equipped vineyards to organic or home made/garage type farms was truly rewarding. I can highly recommend to book a tour with Wine Flies. My choice of four days was filled with trips to Stellenbosch/Franschoek, Robertson valley, Hermanus and lovely Swartland. Great places, great wine, superb food/chocolate pairing and wonderful lunch options. Thank you for a memorable time!!

A very satisfied customer. Definitely sufficient wine provided- there were about 5 wines to sample at each stop so there was plenty to go round! Beautiful day with very friendly tour guide and some beautiful vinyards. The convenience of being driven around there was well worth it. Only downside was the "unlimited cheese" advertised did not materialize. Great lunch too! Perfect day, would definitely recommend.

Best one-day wine tour available. My girlfriend had been given the wine flies tour as birthday present. Our driver and tour guide Wouter picked us up in the early morning with an old-school Land rover. After picking up the rest of tour participants, we went to the Stellenbosch winelands to visit five consecutive wine farms. This included a cheese & wine tasting, biltong & wine tasting and a chocolate & wine tasting. A lovely farm lunch was also included. Each farm offered a unique experience, even the ones that we had visited before. Our tour guide Wouter was very knowledgeable, friendly and witty. Wine flies tours offers an amazing one-day experience for everyone, especially for people that stay for only a little while in Cape Town and don’t have time to explore the winelands themselves.

Good organised wine tour with great stops. Based on the recommendation of a hostel receptionist I met during the Garden Route I booked the tour with Wine Flies. When I first contacted them by e-mail the were already so friendly. The company kept their promise: 5 farm visits including wine tastings on each farm, cheese tastings, chocolate pairing, cellar tour, a nice lunch (including local treats) at one of the wine farms, a good local guide and free pick up service in CT. I highly can recommend this tour!

A first-rate tour with a fantastic guide. Based on the recommendation of a local in the tourist trade, we booked a one-day Stellenbosch tour with Wine Flies. It ended up being one of the best things we did during almost a week in Cape Town. The wines were good, the wineries themselves were lovely (including the dogs who greeted us at each one), the other tourists were all pleasant, but what really made the experience was the guide, Louwrens Fouche. He could not have been much better -- incredibly knowledgeable about wine, generally very intelligent, and an interesting character.

Fun, friendly and relaxed tour with plenty of wine. I went on a great tour with Louwrens in June. He is a great guide, friendly and with lots of knowledge of the win, the region and also about the history of Cape Town and the Stellenbosch area. The trip was a lot of fun, and although it was relaxed we did actually learn a lot about wine and food-pairing also. All the locations we visited were great, with opportunities to buy products at great prices, but with no pressure or sales pitch.Louwrens also provided great service, accommodating various drop-off requests and changes of plans on the way home, to make sure everyone got safely where they needed to be.The trip was great value for money, including all transport and lunch.

Wine flies to Stellenbosch . Well planned tour with experienced guide.
Loved the wines pairing with chocolate and cheese pairings. Wish the chocolates and cheeses were also available on sale by vineyards. The best wines were in the last 2 vineyards in my opinion.

Relaxing and engrossing trip through the wine country. You don't have to be a wine connoisseur to enjoy a day Stallenbosch wine country. The group size is small, was 11 people including myself. The tour driver and guide, Ian was well versed about the 5 wineries/estates visited and went an extra mile to make sure everyone got personalized attention. Granted not all wineries were memorable but the ones that were stand outs, had the selection of wines that were great as well as magical backdrops that made you feel like youre in another world. Well worth the ~ $50/person.

A fabulous excursion discovering SA wine. We had a fabulous day. Picked up directly at our hotel by a pleasant guide who initiated us to wine making by guiding us through 5 fabulous wine maker sites. If you love wine, or want to know more about it and discover the beautiful wine area of Cape Town - don't hesitate contacting WINE FLIES.

A great day out. I can't recommend Wine Flies highly enough. They looked after us very well. We went to 5 different wineries, tasted some great wines, had a wonderful lunch, and overall had a great day. I would recommend it to any one visiting Cape Town

What an amazing day!. Loved the experience, right from the pickup to the drop. The guide was informative and fun. Should have had breakfast before we started the tour, but that only added to our overall happiness and good cheer!

Customized Wine Tour - Highly recommended. We have had wine tours with Wine Flies twice now, first time back in 2011 and now in 2016. Both time we went with their private tour which we could customize exactly as we wanted with the wine guides very good inputs as help. I can highly recommend taking a wine tour with Wine Flies, their choices of wineyards to visit, the car we had to our disposal and the friendliness of our guide was all at highest standard!

Amazing day trip. Definitely recommended!. I was visiting Cape Town alone and so decided a guided tour would be a good way of seeing the area. From the get go Lord V made everyone very welcome and encouraged us all to chat and get to know each other. The vineyards we visited were stunning and the wine and cheese/chocolate pairing was excellent. I especially liked the idea of sitting beside someone different each time we got back on the bus. A brilliant day with a knowledgeable and fun guide. I would happily do it again.
Beyond amazing!. The trip was amazing! I still get butterflies just thinking about it! Amazing views, great wine and the guide was awesome.

Great day out. I arranged this tour the night before without any hiccups, even with the short notice. Louwrence picked us up on time and made sure we all knew each other's names before we got to the first winery.We leaned a great deal about wine making and wine tasting in very pleasant company. A great day out and would highly recommend.

Great tour and guide, so much wine!. The tour guide was fun and very knowledgeable. You will visit five wine estates on the day tour with a lot of wine served. The food was a nice South African braai selection. Great opportunity to try out the local wine and meet some great people.
Great Cape Town Day. Great guide, great tour. Lots of young people on our bus but we spoke to a couple at our resort who did the same tour a day earlier with a different crowd.

26 tastings and a lot of fun.. V is the man. We were brought around the Wine Farms of Stellenbosch tasting 25 different wines. The first wine far were were given the 6 s of wine tasting. i can remember 4 which is an accomplishment considering how much fun I had.

Nice day of tasting at a variety of wineries. Our family (2 adults, 2 teens) enjoyed our day touring the winelands. Our guide, Ian, picked us up at 9 and I was a little dismayed to see that our van was packed to the gills (13 of us). Thankfully our very diverse group (Americans, Canadians, English and Cuban) quickly bonded. We did the wineries in reverse order which did a number on my palate (started with heavy, delicious reds and finished with sweet cap classique). We visited Annandale, Lovane (with chocolate pairings), Middelvlei (with a fab braai lunch), Remhoogte (not Fairview) and finished with Villiera. Ian was warm, informative and very engaging. We liked the quiz at the end but would have appreciated cups for the winning bottle we drank on the way back. Thanks for a fun day!
Great wine tour!. Great trip with value for the money! We visited 5 different wine yards and tried 23 different wines. We learned how to pair wine with cheese and chocolate which was great fun.

Fabulously - highly recommended!!!. When you consider the price of all other wine tours, there is NO competition for this company!!!! Wonderful service, maximum size of 8 per tour, and you go to smaller, greener wineries! Some of these wineries don't even sell wine in shops. Definitely definitely worth it! A highlight of our trip...including for my friend who doesn't even like wine! If you're Gluten Free, be sure to ask for a GF lunch! They'll provide GF bread to accommodate :)

Wonderful day!. Went with my girlfriends (all in our late 20s). We all had a wonderful day-especially because of Granwell (Big G!). He was kind, informative, and patient! He also has great taste in music. We went to five wineries, four had food pairings. The lunch that was included was excellent. We highly recommend this tour and Big G!

Good choice. It was a really good choice. Wine Flies organizational issues were very smooth, and it is always nice to have company of 8 people while tasting the wine, that to sit in any bar and just trying to find your about South African wines yourself.

Great day in the winelands. We visited 5 vineyards with lots of wine tasting. A wonderful day out experiencing the region and amazing wines. We learnt lots about the wine making process and also what makes a good wine taster! A must do - thanks Paul for a great trip.

Surpasses Expectations. It is a perfect all day event for wine lovers. You taste over 2 dozen wines, including a cheese, food, and chocolate pairing. Our guide was Ian, who came with a fun and enthusiastic attitude. A must do if staying in cape town for even just a couple of days.

Not your average wine tour!. When looking for a wine tour, we wanted something that would be more than just sipping wine in touristy hot spots. And, that is exactly what we found in the Wine Flies Wine Tour. Our guide was quite knowledgeable about the wine making process and the wine making history of the region. The vineyards we visited were mostly smaller, family-owned vineyards, which gave us a beautiful taste of the local flavor. We loved that the tour gave us the opportunity to taste a wide variety of wines from white to red, even bubbly and Port. The cheese and chocolate pairings added such a nice touch to the tastings. And, as if that wasn’t enough, we were surprised and delighted to find that for lunch we were getting to experience a classic Cape Town braai. A good time was had by all, and we would definitely recommend a Wine Flies wine tour to anyone looking for something above and beyond a simple wine tasting tour.

Absolutely Amazing Experience!. My girlfriend and I went with Wine Flies on our trip to Cape Town. Our guide was Terance, and he was AWESOME! He picked us up from our hotel perfectly on time and we had about 8 other people in our group. At first I thought it would be a little impersonal with so many people, but after the wine starts flowing it was great to have a good group of people from all over the world. Terance was incredibly knowledgeable and took us to 5 different wineries (Big and Small). I'm glad they didn't take us to just the name brand big ones, since honestly our favorite was one of the smallest ones. 5 star service all around! Definitely doing it again when I get back to Cape town!
Great Day. Visited 5 vineyards , fantastic guide, great lunch and some really good tasting prompting the purchase of 26 bottles across the 5 sites . Well recommended ....

Fun and informative. We did a one-day tour with Wine Files as part of our honeymoon. Our guide, Paul was great and so informative. We've done a lot of wine tastings in the states and we still learned a lot over the course of the day. Loved seeing some of the smaller winers, and had some amazing wine. It was great that there was lunch, chocolate and wine pairings as well. Overall, it was a great tour.

Wonderful Wine tour at an Amazing Value!. We booked our Wine Flies tour on short notice after arriving in Cape Town And they were extremely prompt in helping us make a reservation. Ian, our guide, picked us up in Camps Bay and after picking up the others on our tour it was only a short drive to the Stellenbosch region. Included in our tour were five wineries, cheese pairing, lunch, and a chocolate pairing - an incredible value for the price we paid. Ian shared his knowledge of South African wine history and was helpful over the entire tour. We would recommend Wine Flies to anyone looking for a introduction to South African wines!

Private wine tour with Louwrens!. My aunt and I came for a wine tour with Louwrens and had an absolute blast. He shared much knowledge about wine and the history of wine in the region, and took us to five fabulous farms. 10/10 would go again :)

Great way to spend a day just outside the city. We booked with wine flies last minute because our trip to Cape Town was a bit of a spontaneous thing and the company were great at accommodating us. We chose wine flies because the website looked good, the schedule for the day had lots included and the price was reasonable. Their Facebook page has positive reviews and photos so we booked with them and glad we did!.We visited 5 vineyards:AnnandaleFairviewVellariaLovaneMiddelvleiGreat vineyard choices, our guide was very knowledgeable providing tours around the various estates and cellars and made sure we all had a good day.Would recommend and use again next time we visit!

Wine flies made my day. My first Wine tour with wine flies was 2013 and I totally loved it and this is why I planned on doing another one.This time we were 4 girls and we had an amazing day. We stayed at an private apartment and we got picked us up right in time, the vibe in the bus was really good and our Tour guide was amazing. He knew a lot about the area, wine and South Africa in general. You stop at 5 different vineyards , which are very beautiful in their own way and you taste and learn a lot about wine. The tour also includes a little cheese and chocolate tasting and a Braai for lunch. Even on the way back home our tour guide made sure to keep us entertained and made our day memorable. All in all I would do the wine tour with wine flies over and over again - so if you plan on having an incredible day with good wine and great people you should give it a try!

Fun and interacting day with my 'family' of wine livers. Got picked up on time and entered the van to see each chair topped with a variety of hats, each very stylish and welcoming :) Had a tour of five wineries and had a ball. Many had dogs who joined us for some tastings. Lunch was a braii and tasty. Highly recommended.

Great wine, great tour, great value. Fantastic day out and wine tour - our guide Paul was fantastic, good fun, friendly and very knowledgable about wines and SA in general. The tour was really well organised visiting 5 vineyards in and around Stellenbosch, a cellar tour, cheese and chocolate food pairings with some of wine and a braaii lunch included - great value given most other tours we looked at did not include cost of lunch and were more expensive. A really good mix of vineyards too from larger estates to small boutique farms - would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Cape Town - they pick you up/drop you off directly at your accommodation as well.

A lot of wine!. We had a great group and Ian, our guide was entertaining and knowledgeable about South African wine and the area. A fantastic day touring the Stellenbosch area wine "farms". We visited 5 wineries, had a great "local" lunch at one of the wineries, and by the end of the day had tasted 20+ wines! A happy sing-a-long in the bus home!!!

Best Wine Tour in South Africa. I can't really claim that it's the best because I've only been on one in South Africa but wine flies was superb. Our guide Laurence was extremely knowledgeable and tolerated our wine filled national anthem singing shenanigans quite well. On the ride to Stellenbosch he filled us with historical knowledge of the area, at the vineyards he took us through the wine making process, and on the way back he dropped us off at a bar so we could continue our festivities. Can't recommend this tour enough!

Two words: Excellent tour!. I am from Mexico, and I never thought I would be in South Africa, but when I did I wanted the best. This was the best wine tour to learn about history and wine in around Stellenbosch. Beautiful country, beautiful landscapes. One of my best experiences!

Great wine tour and Stellenbosch experience. The wine tour was a great insight into the wine culture of the Western Cape, and a glorious drive around Stellenbosch. There was no shortage of wine, plus we got tasty cheese and chocolate pairings (and a chance to try some craft beer "for the guys" - #groan). All in all it was a very good experience and you probably couldn't go wrong to give it a try.

Wine Flies Tour. I took my mom with on the tour to give her a treat and did we have a treat! - We met some USA students and had an absolute blast! The tour guide was so amazing and so friendly - I will definitely recommend Wine Flies to anybody going to the Cape who wants to see some stunning wine farms and have a blast at the same time.

Fabulous and Fun day out!!. We all had a fantastic day out and Terrance was a true star who made the events of the day run smoothly. Very entertaining. Would definitely recommend. Thanks so much for a great day out!

NOTHING TO WHINE ABOUT. Perfect wine tasting tour from start to finish. From Champagne, white, reds and even brandy, five wineries all told, each unique. Cheese and chocolate wine pairing, lunch included. Our guide / driver kept us entertained. Great way yo spend a very relading day here in SA.

Best day ever. Had an awesome day! We did a private tour and it was well worth it! Really loved going to the smaller vineyards and enjoyed the pairings with fruit, biltong and chocolate. Found some new favourite wines!My only constructive feedback would be that the 'luxury' 4x4 was a landrover defender and had no aircon. Guide was great and we tasted brandy, sparkling wine, port and even a little brandy!

Fun, informal wine tasting with the best Wine Lords!. Just walked in from a fantastic day out with my Wine Flies family. Terrance is a true Wine Lord who really made the trip. If you want fun, relaxed wine tasting this is definitely the tour for you.

Fun and informative . This was my second wine tour, the first being in New Zealand. There we went to wineries and learned how the wines paired with different foods. This tour was so much more thanks to our guide Ian. Ian explained how the grapes were grown and processed and how the wines were bottled. There were also wine pairings with cheese and chocolates. At one winery we ate lunch. Of course we had opportunities to purchase wine at each location.Our winery tour day started off early at about 10 AM with a quiet busload of 13 tourists. However, after the first winery were much friendlier. After the fifth winery, we were old friends.I'd highly recommend wine flies wine tours. Just hope you get Ian for your guide.

An amazing day of wine and country. We went on the wine flies tour driven by Granwell and had an amazing time. It was an informative and delicious day that starts off with a pickup at your hotel and trip out to wine country. At the first vineyard we went thru vineyard and learned about all the steps involved in making the wine. Our guide knew so much. We were even able to see some bottling. Then we started the tasting and learned the five Ss of wine tasting. Then the great South African wine favors began to flow. We had stops with cheese pairings and chocolate pairings a great lunch and of course more wine. It was a great day and value. Several of the vineyards even had animals running around so you could check out some zebras with your Chenin blanc or warthog with your Pinotage. It was the perfect balance of wine and info. I would defiantly recommend it and I would do it again for sure.
Wineyards. Very nice, relaxed and interesting wine tour. Recommended. Mr G was an excellent guide, knowledgable and friendly.

Great day out!. We chose the full day wine tour with Wine Flies following recommendation from our guesthouse owner and were not disappointed.Day started with pickup from our guesthouse at around 8am followed by pickup of around 12 others at different places in Cape Town. Minibus was comfortable and our driver and guide for the day Terance made everyone feel welcome.During the day we visited 5 farms, with a combination of different styles/sizes (our particular favourite was the smallest estate we visited)Each farm had a different pairing (one with cheese, one with chocolate, one with biltong) which added variety as did different talks from our guide (one explaining the vines and growing process, one in the production cellars etc)We had a group with average age of late 20s and the tour felt aimed at those who are not experts both of which were perfect for us but may not be suitable for more knowledgable wine drinkers who may be better off doing a private tour (Wine Flies do such tours as do multiple other companies in the area)Thanks Wine Flies for a brilliant day out and special mention to Terance!

We loved Wine Flies!. We chose Wine Flies based on positive Trip Advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. Visiting 5 different wineries--we felt it was a great value! Louwrens was knowledgeable and had a great sense of humor. The trip felt tailored to a younger crowd, and it was fun to tour with students studying abroad in Africa. The drive through Stellenbosch is beautiful! We loved that there were both cheese and chocolate pairings--the chocolate was provided specifically by Wine Flies. Thanks, Louwrens!

Wonderful Wine Tour. My wife and I booked this tour after some great reviews on here. We had a great time! Our guide was a lot of fun and very knowledgeable. The day was very interesting starting with some of wine that is very good but not award winning and working our way up to the award winning wine. The pairing of the wine with cheese and chocolate was delicious. We learned a lot of helpful tips when picking out a wine and how to properly drink wine. Highly highly recommend, this is a very fun day out in the countryside even if you're not a big wine drinker.

Excellent wine day trip. We booked a private tour for the day with Wine Flies and were picked up at the house we were staying near Bantry Bay. Our tour guide, Ian, picked us up at 8:30 AM and we were able to visit 5 great wineries in Stellenbosch along with enjoying a beautiful lunch. The best part of our trip was our guide, Ian, who was extremely knowledgeable about wines and the wineries. He was very humble and would chime in when he could tell that we were strugglingly a bit on our selection. You could really tell that he enjoys the region, and the tour, and he even pulled together a great play list for our day. I thought that 5 wineries may have been too few, however it was just about too much. I would highly recommend this group to leave the driving to them.
Awesome. This is a must see. Awesome people. Awesome tour guide. The style and culture is just amazing. Beautiful nature scenes and the wine is pure and cultivated.

Fabulous Day!. We found Wine Flies Wine Tours via Trip Advisor - reading all the impressive reviews we booked a last minute tour (24 hours notice given) they were extremely accommodating. We were picked up approx. 8:30am - picked other guests along the way and made our way to the Wine region Stellenbosch, Franchloek and Paarl.The Vineyards visited we all fantastic. The cheese, biltong, chocolate pairing was something I was really looking forward to and it did not disappoint.Our tour guide was very informative and served as a fantastic host! (I cannot remember their name - I think it was Ian....??)Overall, it was a fantastic day. The wine flowed all day long, food pairings worked perfectly, lunch provided was fresh and filling and guide was fab!Thank you for a lovely day...!! :)

Great day with Wine Flies. Louwrens was our guide, It really makes a difference when you hear about the area's history from someone whose family has been a part of the country for so long. We visited Fairview, Villiera, Middelvlei, Lovane and Annandale wineries. We had wine with cheese, chocolate, biltong and a braai lunch in the middle. Was afraid I'd regret doing the whole day tour, but it went fast.I just really wish I brought an extra suitcase for wine...

Time flies with 21 tastings........... A fun day visiting 5 very different vineyards. Lawrence was a knowledgable and engaging host. Plenty of wine with interesting food pairings. Considered value for money and would thoroughly recommend.

Super impressed, and I'm a local!. I decided to be a tourist for a day and joined some foreign friends on a wine tour (Stellenbosch and Paarl). Having done many Stellenbosch wine farms in my day, I didn't think this tour would be any different. Boy, was I wrong!Not only was it a thoroughly enjoyable day, but the farms we visited were fantastic, and there was a little surprise at the last farm (I'll stop there and leave it as a surprise for you too). Our guide, Ian, was another level of good! He has a vast knowledge of wine and the area, cool taste in music, and is a friendly, fun, down-to-earth guy! The best!I'm not sure if it was planned this way, but everyone on the bus with us was within about 10 years of each other, so it was a "young" group and it was easy to chat and enjoy ourselves as a group. The lunch (braai) wasn't that amazing (I felt there are nicer menus available - e.g I think a potjie would have been cooler) but it was still tasty, and added to the South African experience. All in all, a wonderful experience, and good value! I would not hesitate to recommend WineFlies to anyone looking for an organised tour. Well done, guys. And thank you!

a truly memorable and fun tour. What a fantastic day out! We went to 5 different vineyards from what I remember. Lunch was great. As for our driver and tour guide, Ian, well what can I say!!! He was brilliant. I would definitely recommend it and do it again when I return to Capetown.

A wonderful day with many new wine experiences. Wine Flies vineyard tour was a wonderful experience visiting 5 wineyards with so many wines to taste, on their own and with cheese and chocolate. Our tour guide Ian was great company and his knowledge of all the wines made the day. It was also an experience to meet the actual growers and wine makers - it put a different aspect on how wine gets into the bottles and to the customers. we had a very friendly group on the tour and Ian made the day perfect.

Grape day out!. We had such a great day with our wonderful guide Terrence who picked us up from our accommodation in Stellenbosch. We went round 5 different wineries, which included cheese tasting, biltong tasting and chocolate tasting as well as a lovely lunch at a farm. Terrence was brilliant and made the day extra special! There was even a quiz at the end with a bottle of wine up for grabs! A brilliant day out for those looking for a light hearted introduction to wine!

Forgotten Route. After being on an awsome wine tour with the 'Flies' in 2013, it was clear that during the next trip to Cape Town it had to be the 'Forgotten Route' which would be done... What to say about this tour? It's another amazing journey those guys have created. If you are interested in the earlier days of South Africa's history which are normaly barely mentioned in all travel guides this is the tour to do! Just don't want to go too much into detail to not spoil all the small surprises along the way. But one thing I can promise: if you are going on the trip to Matjiesfontein, you do not receive a long-winded history lesson but an interesting and fun inside to some of South Africa's secrets... and of course you get some wine as well :-) Thanks again for two great days guys and keep on going!!! Cheers Simone

Excellent wineries, great tour guide, wonderful day. We were taken to 5 beautiful wineries and also driven through the historic part of Stellenbosch. Ian was the perfect winery tour guide, and taught us a ton about the history of wine, how it's made, how to taste it, etc., all in a down to earth, humorous way. He was also great about making sure we had enough relaxing time while also generally sticking to a schedule.The tour group was a lot of fun and the perfect size (12 people). Lunch was excellent, as was the plethora of cheeses, chocolates, billtong, etc. that we got to sample along with the wines. All in all, an amazing day.Thanks again, Ian!

Great experience. Very pleasent experience that we can strongly reccomend to others. Our guide, Terrence, had a lot of knowledge and made the tour very interessting. The people at the different wineries were also extremly nice.

Relaxing and Fun. Our guide and driver for this tour was Terrence, and we had a wonderful day with him and the rest of our "family for the day". We were picked up promptly from our hostel, and got to see a bit of Cape Town getting all the other tourists. We saw 5 wineries, and they were all lovely. Lunch was good too. The day is informative - you will learn how to properly taste wine and about how wines are made. The day was very full and went from about 8 am to 7:30 pm. I was travelling with my adult son, and he is no fan of wine, but he still had a great time. Terrence's great sense of humour and friendly attitude encouraged everyone on the tour to relax and enjoy themselves.

The perfect Saturday. Wine Flies was better than I could have hoped for. Terrance our guide was friendly and funny, and the tour was not only professionally organized and well thought-out, but had elements of 'fun' built into every stop. The chocolate and cheese pairings were absolutely fantastic, and it was one of the best day tours I have ever taken. Will highly recommend to any friends!

The best wine tour of all the many tours we have been on.. These guys are great. One the most enjoyable, informative and varied wine tours I have ever been on...and we like a wine tour :-)Great wines in smaller boutique wineries where you don't feel like cattle but are given the time to enjoy the tasting, the spectacular views and the good company. In addition to the wines, there were more than a fair share of food accompaniments and all accompanied by an amazing tour guide. Lunch was a traditional BBQ and again this was more than enjoyable

Highly recommended!. Lovely trip. Ian was very entertaining and knowledgeable. Our group was of mixed ages (from 19 to 58) and all were interested in having a lot of fun. 90s music on our travels with sing-a-longs and general jollity. The wineries were all lovely although the Annadale winery did give noticeably smaller samples - barely enough to cleanse the pallet between wines. Overall a great day.
Nice selection of wineries. Good wine, cheese, lovely lunch. Our guide Ian was mostly just a driver and coordinator. He's knowledgeable but not anxious to share more than the basic facts.

Great Tour. The tour took us to some really nice places and was informative in a good way. We learned much about how to make wine and the area itself.The chocolate tasting was fun and sth. new.Cheese tasting was nice at well.But I have to admit 5 Spots may be a bit to much. But I would definitly go on the tour again. I bought some really nice bottels.

Would definetly recommend!. I went on this tour with my girlfriend during March, and it more than fulfilled our expectations.This tour will have you visit five different wineries of different sizes around the city of Stellenbosch. During your visit to those wineries, you will be offered a plethora of all kinds of wine (red, white, sparkling, sweet, brandy...) paired with things like cheese, chocolate and meat! In addition, you will be guided around the wineries and wineyards, learning about the history of wine in South Africa as well as the production process!Also remarkable was the lunch; a flame grilled traditional South African braai barbecue (vegetarian options were available). Definetly would recommend!

Enjoyable day out in Stellenbosh. After a slightly chaotic and time consuming start to the tour (changing busses + extra pick ups because of a guide off sick) the tour turned out to be a lovely day out in the Stellenbosch wine region. We tasted wines with cheese and other foods, heard stories about the wineries and region and even toured one of the production rooms. Our guide was very knowledgeable and entertaining. The only downfall was Lunch was a little rushed due to the earlier dramas which was a shame.

Group of 11 in 2016. They told us we could book then cancel before the event which we did , then they wanted us to pay the total for those who didn't come , at the end we ended up losing deposits for those who cancelled .

A friendly personalised way to tour the area. We took a full day tour to the Stellenbosch vineyards with Wine Flies after a different tour company, PG Tops, was fully booked that day. Wouter was our guide for the day. He was friendly, enthusiastic and accommodating, and planned the timings just right to fit in the places we wanted to visit. Thanks Wouter!

Wine and whales trip - Great day!. This was a real highlight of our stay in Cape Town. Our guide was called 'V' I believe :) he was great. Really knowledgeable and enthusiastic and during the drive shared his tips for the rest of Southern Africa from his previous guiding days. I'm not really into wine but my girlfriend assures me the wine was splendid. For me, the day was great regardless - the food, guide, views were well worth the money. Lunch was at an incredible spot - which was worth the money (get the burger) even without all the wine and whales thrown in! My favourite was the cider farm and the local butchers to learn about the various cured meats. A must do for wine lovers and wine agnostics alike :) which says a lot for a wine tour

Amazing wine tour, fantastic guide!. The wine tour is a must do day trip when you're in Cape Town! The scheduled tour took you to some great wineries, each with something different to offer. Our guide, Ian was extremely helpful and made the tour extraordinary! He went out of his way to help us, and was by far my favorite guide I've had.

Fine Wine, Fine company. I did a full day wine tour. It was a great tour around Stellenbosch with 8 others from a variety of countries and variety of ages. Perhaps it was the vibes, or the beautiful town, but most likely the wine, that we all had a great time with each other and ended up extending our day by visiting a few bars in the night for some more wine/beer.

Great small group tour, great value. My partner and myself with 4 others took a wine tour in a Land Rover on Valentines day to an excellent selection of five different estates, all excellent. Had a nice lunch and lots of cheese and chocolate tastings. The guide, Terence was excellent and taught us all a great deal about wine making and the process of wine tasting, as well as a great deal about modern South Africa. During the tastings we had some excellent presentations from the vineyards. We enjoyed the smaller estates, where there are some great wines. A really good day with this great little company. Would fully recommend this for a good day out.

Fun day out for a group. Did a wine tour with Ian in Valentine's Day with a group of my partners workmates. Ian was a great host, knowledgeable and fun. Three of the four vineyards visited were lovely - just one disappointment which Ian acknowledged during our tour. Lunch was delicious and the bus trip was a giggle with an 80's music singalong that added to the atmosphere! A great end to my week in Cape Town. Just trying to organise getting my camera back - left on the bus after one too many wines tasted! Thanks Ian.

Excellent!. we had a really great trip, lots of good wine and an outstanding guide!5 different wine estates. each with a perfect wine tasting. cheese, chocolate and biltong where great companions to the wine.the guide had a really good knowledge and we had a lot of fun during the day.
Personal and perfect!. For one day we went arround with other people to 5 different winemakers. Mostly small and personal. Not for the fine-tasters but this tour creates a very good atmosphere!

A great day. Lord Terrence hosted our ‘family’ of travellers from around the world last Sunday. Having done a similar tour last year, I was keen to try another group for a different selection of wine farms. Apart from Fairview, where every tour goes, the other wine farms were all unique and interesting. Coming from Australia, the wines were so cheap. The hard part was limiting it to the 3 I can take home. Informative host and a good group for the day. I liked the fact that the bus seating was mixed up at each stop. Made it easier to meet everyone on the tour.

A fun day in the wineyards. I enjoyed the day and our little group had so much fun together that we ended up dining together after the tour. Terrance was great, providing lot of info in an unpretentious way and with a South African sense of humour. All the farms visited were quaint and not commercial except one of them and that was a great way to see how the company carefully chooses its farms to visit.Highly recommended.
Great Trip and Tour Guide. Terrance was a lovely guide, we learned a lot about wine that we wouldn't have learned otherwise and there was even a fun quiz at the end so pay attention!

Wine route. We did the a cape town wine route with this company on the 31st of January 2016.We were totally satisfied with all the 5 farms we visited.Very good wine served,affordable price for the wine bottles and welcoming persons on all the 5 farms.We even had an excellent lunch at the 3rd farm we visited.As for the guide,Granwell Farao,he too was excellent.He mastered everything he was explaining,very helpful and has a pleasant personality.I recommend him as guide and the wine flies company for this tour.Totally satisfied

Romeo Tour was Overpriced. My wife and I did the Romeo tour, which costs about 4 times more than other tours, but is private. I thought we were paying for a more immersive experience. However, our time at the wineries was no different than the people the arrived on the tram. Our guide was fine, but not great. At times he seemed like a bit of a third wheel on what was supposed to be a romantic day. Not trying to be too hard on the guy, I think he did the job he's asked to do, but it was a reality of the tour. There was quite a bit of driving involved in this particular tour. Which I suppose more savvy travelers than myself would have expected to spend nearly half the day in a car. My final verdict is -- The extra 3000 Rand we spent to go on this tour was not money well spent. There wasn't much value added.

Not for the wine enthusiast. I've taken 3 wine tours in the Cape, and Wine Flies ranks a distant 3rd. This is a tour for someone who doesn't know much about wine. We visited a strange and inconsistent grab bag of wine farms, missing some of the real gems in the region. Imagine a full day without visiting Franschhoek (stopping at the historic prison wher Nelson Mandela was released) and seeing Stellenbosch from the window of the van. Imagine also a braai with a pitiful plate of food. By the last winery I wanted to ask to go home. This is an extraordinary wine region. On my previous wine tour, our party visited 3 carefully chosen wine farms over the course of a full day (with an exquisite lunch at one of them) and time to shop Stellenbosch. If you are going on a wine tour, do your homework. Ask about the wineries you'll go to, then look them up. Ask if the tour will be augmented by visits to what makes the region special besides its wine farms. Time is to precious to waste.

More than a wine tour. Booking was easy, picked up on time, got in the bus and the party started. 12 people, different ages, different nationalities, all walks of life. Our guide – Gman – was amazing...thank you, sir. We visited 5 wineries with 5 generous tastings at each , a BBQ lunch provided at just the right time - hic! At each stop we learned a little more, how to taste, how wine is made, how the bubbles get in the fizzy stuff. We had such fun, made new friends and sang all the way back to CapeTown. Who knew when we booked wi9th Wine Flies it would be more than just a wine tour. Thank you.

Best wine tour ever!. I love a wine tour, but I have to say Wine Flies was the best wine tour we have ever done. Our guide Ian was great fun and set the tone for the day right at the start. We visited some beautiful wineries and got to sample so many wines, delicious cheeses, chocolate and a wonderful South African lunch. We also learned a fair bit about wine production as we went behind the scenes to see how the wine is made. Ian was also very patient with our slightly rowdy group and did not try to put a dampener on our fun in the slightest. Thank you Ian for such a hilarious and fun filled day.

Great day tour ! . This tour is a great value ! They come pick you up at your hotel and take you to Stellenbosch to visit 5 different wineries ,plus lunch ! Every winery gives you around 4/5 different wines to taste and there where snacks at each winery as well. Make sure you pace yourself ,I had to learn to not to drink every glass after the 2nd winery . Our guide was very informative and open to any questions . Wine flies is awesome , they even gave my husband & I a free bottle of champagne bc we were on our honeymoon , thank you !

Amazing day out. We had G man taking us for our tour and he was awesome. full of insightful knowledge about the vineyards. The wine on offer is quite cheap and very delicious. Most vineyards we went to were also quite generous with their samples.

Such a fun day!. Rochelle was our guide for the day. She took great care of us and is very knowledgeable.We went to five different wineries that were all so beautiful. We had people from Denmark, Canada, Great Britain, Germany, Australia, Finland and then us from America. We had so much fun with our group that we ended and up out till the wee hours laughing and having more wine!

Great experience - great guide - great wine. We had a wonderful guide with a broad knowledge of wine, a fantastic sense of humor and we tasted the most wonderful wines in breathtaking sceneries. And all that for a very reasonable price. Just Great!!!

Fun and Friendly. Excellent wine tour at a great price. Hits some important wineries with great commentary along the way. They also visit some wineries where they are practically family. And as an added bonus there are dogs and horses to interact with for those of you who, like me, love animals more than most people! :-)

An incredible day of wine tasting. Lady Sune was our host for the day and she proved to be extremely knowledgeable having grown up in Stellenbosch, and made the day very entertaining as well as informative.The wineries we visited in general were stunning and the food we were given for lunch was far better than I expected as it was just an interim.I highly recommend these guys for anyone visiting to cape town, just be prepared to get suitable sloshed

Fun, passionate and knowledgeable guides. This was the ~3rd wine tour I took across North America, Europe, and now Africa and it was great. The guides are very passionate about the local wines and are personal friends with the makers. Our guide even took us to his favorite local bar afterwards which was an unexpected treat, especially since we didn't know any locals in the area.

Truly first class day tour of SA wine growers. We booked a private (two-person) tour of wineries around Stellenbosch. Our guide, Gramwell, was really excellent: knowledgeable, friendly and flexible in tailoring the day to our requirements. We visited a good selection of wineries, some our choice and some Gramwell's. Lunch at Neethlingshof estate was fabulous. Our primary reason for visiting Cape Town was to see England v. SA cricket, but the day out with Wine Flies was a really memorable detour. Highly recommended.

Louwrens was awesome!. Louwrens was an excellent guide, friendly and knowledgeable. The vineyards were varied and was great to taste the different wines cheese and chocolates. I would suggest if you like white wine buy this from the first farm Fairview as the vineyards after this are majority red wine. I don't normally like red but I enjoyed tasting them all!

Excellent! . Our guide was fantastic from the start! Very friendly and engaged in conversation with us all on the bus. He was full of knowledge on the surrounding area as we travelled from one vineyard to another. Excellent wine choices and knew his stuff!

Awesome. The nice thing about this tour is that the guides grew up in Stellenbosch area. So they know the area well and don’t only take you to the big commercial wineries. They’ve got a couple of hidden gems in there.

Wine Wonderful!. The Wine Flies Tour was probably the highlight of our trip to Cape Town. Ian picked us up perfectly on time with no hitches in finding our place. He was a very informative, yet laid back guide, which was perfect for the day. The wineries all varied in style and character, and the contrast was nice throughout the day. It was simple to book through them, and no complications ever arose, making our first day in Cape Town a smooth transition into our vacation and experiencing the city on day 1. If we come back to Cape Town we will definitely book a tour with Wine Flies again.

Great day to be had. We had the lovely Rochelle as our tour guide. She was FANTASTIC.Really lovely day. Loved the food and wine pairings. The lunch was great. Can't big up this trip enough. A must do when in CT.My only disappointment was that the pick ups took FOREVER! We were asked to go to the office to be picked up because they didn't have tiome to come to us. It was the best prt of 2 hours later that we were on the road. I would suggest that they insist on people being very precise with the pick up point.

Fun & Informative. Thank you Ian for a splendid day. The sun was shining and the wine was flowing. We went to 5 very different wine producers and had the opportunity to taste a wide selection of reds, whites and sparkling wines which were paired with cheeses, chocolates and meats. We were gently educated though the wines with humour. Lunch was a lovely BBQ/salad also paired with wine, set under parasols on the lawn of a lovely colonial manor house. Our tour continued on late into the afternoon with more pairings. If you don't like wine, now's the time to start or you can have the soft option. At the end of the day we were light-heartedly quizzed on our knowledge absorbed during the day - the winning team winning a bottle of wine - so pay attention! All good fun. A great day out. Ian was an excellent host and the team at Wine Flies were excellent in answering my emails prior to making my final choice and booking and then arranging the collection details from our guest house. Highly recommended.

The best experience in wine tours. All the vineyards we went to were brilliant. Not the big well know vineyards. Our tour guide Lord Riaan was excellent. He made the tour enjoyable. Not once did I feel that I'd had, enough, every person on the bus was made to feel special. I was picked up in town 9:00am and and dropped of at the front door of the lodge I was staying at 5:30pm it was a full days tour but time just seem to fly by. Riaan has taught me so much about wine and how to enjoy it. From now on when I get home from a days work, a glass of wine and the memories of my Cape Town Wine trip will relax me. I'm now looking to do the tour to No Where . Thank you Lord Riaan for a wonderful experience. Thanks Penny Clark

Great day, terrific wines/wineries, but CROWDED bus!. My friend and I spent a day wine tasting with Wine Flies. The guide was very knowledgeable, kept us on pace to visit five wineries, organized a tasty lunch, and we ended up buying about 12 bottles between the two of us. We didn't book the personal tour, and were squeezed into a 12-passenger bus with 12 people, all of whom were lovely, but the bus was very cramped, and if you are someone who gets carsick or claustrophobic, you may opt for the personal tour as the vehicle was really tight on space and the roads curvy.

Brilliant day. Let me start by saying that I hate wine and this tour did not convince me otherwise. However, the day was absolutely fantastic. There was a massive selection of wines combined with chocolate, cheese and other goodies. It was so much fun and I had a brilliant time. I cannot praise these guys highly enough. If you want a proper wine tour without the pretentiousness then I highly recommend Wine Flies.

Fantastic day!. My wife and I had a fantastic day on the full day tour, with Grenwell (G-man) acting as our very informative host and guide. Five vineyards, with cheese pairings in the morning, a braai lunch and chocolate pairings in the afternoon. Cellar tours and a real insight into the production techniques and differences between each wine made the day very educational as well. Plenty of chances to purchase wines, all at excellent prices. Would thoroughly recommend this tour to everyone who enjoys the odd glass of wine.

Go Once, and then Go Again!. This was an absolutely amazing experience. They keep the tour so personal, fun and I still can't believe it was R700 for the full day including lunch and tastings. We didn't shell out anything extra over the course of the day which was unbelievable.Our wine Lord, Lady Sunay (Suney?) - sorry I know I am spelling that wrong! - was phenomenal. My favorite part was that we learned just enough to make it really still enjoyable and not overbearing on the facts.I do not drink red wine, I've tried it a handful of times and never enjoyed it. By the afternoon, I was drinking all of the red wine tastings which was pretty cool for me and I will continue to try tasting!Favorite vineyard was the one which we paired wines and chocolates - I literally wanted to dump the chocolates in my purse and have them forever. Unfortunately, the chocolate place is closed on Sundays which was the only day we had free we would have been able to get some. I plan on seeing if I can order some online...that's literally how delicious it was. Please do make sure to tip the tour guide - we found most people in our tour were leaving around R100 per person but that's because we found that she was really phenomenal and deserved it. We also had the pleasure of meeting the guy who started the company which was great he was really down the earth and chill explaining how the business got started and such. All in all, if I go back to Cape Town I am for sure doing this again!

Can't wait to take this fabulous tour again. We have tasted wine in Europe, Australia, South America and our own home state of California, but the Wine Flies tour from Cape Town was the most fun by far. Nine of us met as strangers as we were picked up at our respective hotels for the scenic drive to Stellenbosch, but we parted as friends who shared dinner and drinks together at the Waterfront upon our return. Our guide was witty, very informative about the wines sampled, and an excellent driver. We visited five wineries, each very different, and all with a special bonus such as cheese or chocolate tastings. One winery served a home-style African barbecue lunch (braai) which was unique and could never be duplicated in a traditional restaurant. The wines were better quality than we expected and the day was simply fun, fun, fun. We can hardly believe that they charge so little and deliver so much. When we return to South Africa (and we will!), we will definitely sign up for another Wine Flies tour. It's the best day out ever.

The best Wine Tour ever. I went on the this tour and th out it was terrific l enjoyed the information and the matching of food with wine it was also educational and I highly recommend this to anyone who wants a wine tour. I have been on many and this was the best ever. Paul was our tour guide and he was fabulous

Nice tour, fun tour guide!. We had a great time with our tour around Stellenbosch. Truly beautiful experience. The lunch wasn't the best, but the rest of the tour and tasting overshadowed the lunch. I recommend this.

Excellent tour :) . Had an excellent day out with the Wine Flies tour.Picked up promptly by our guide in the morning who introduced himself and told us what we would be doing today then we headed off to the wine farms all day.Our guide was very knowledgeable and humerous and introduced us to a large variety of wines, cheeses and chocolates throughout our tour.Had an incredible tour today thanks for the good memories Ian, we would definitley return.

Fantastic wine tour. We were browsing through the countless companies that offer wine tours around Cape Town when we were recommended Wine Flies and what an experience it was. The staff was incredibly attentive and helpful, we booked our trip via email and were picked up from our flat the following morning. The guide was really engaging, funny and we learnt a lot about South African wines and Cape Town itself. The tour stopped at five different wineries, were we visited cellars, tasted around 35 different wines and had food tasting as well, from cured meats to chocolate and cheese. The tour included lunch in one of the wineries, which was absolutely delicious. Really could not recommend them enough.

Amazing 🍷🍷🍷🍷. Really had a memorable experience last year's December! !!You guys are doing an ex event job . ..Had so much fun, tasted a variety of wine and the pairing with cheese nd chocolates was delicious. Lunch was really chilled and delicious. Definitely worth it !! And very affordable! !!Go for it ☺☺

Good Trip!. My wife and I are not really wine lovers or have great knowledge with wine, but the trip opened our eyes and taught us better how to appreciate them! It is definitely informative, fun and casual! We love the pairing sessions for the wine tasting sessions :)

Wine Flies. We've had a great week in Cape Town and with so many things to do and which have been amazing. When we were deciding on what we enjoyed the most it was definitely the Wine Flies tour though - learned a load and had so much fun! The lonely planet was spot on here and for a very reasonable price we had a fantastic experience. Credit to the company and particularly Ian our wine guide!

MUCH to do on this tour and AMAZING customer service!. Not only is this trip great from the second they pick you up (which they do, at your place, regardless of where you're staying in Cape Town), as the driver is engaging, informed and helpful, but the tour itself takes you to many different places and through many different tasting menus.There is wine not quite old enough to be bottled sampled directly from the barrels (awesome!), a tour of a cellar, a cheese and wine tasting, a CHOCOLATE and wine tasting, a lunch with wine AND a tasting at a farm that only bottles a few hundred bottles a year (small and local--a unique experience).I am from the SF bay area and have been on COUNTLESS wine tours in Napa, Sonoma, Livermore, Santa Cruz and Sacramento, and this was by far the best.Here is the icing on the cake. I was the first person they picked up, and I live WAY up on a hill in a remote part of Cape Town. As we drove around to pick up other guests, I started getting motion sick. I realized that I hadn't taken my pills with me (TOTALLY my mistake!), but the driver phoned one of the staff members, she came of her own accord, picked me up at a central meeting place, TOOK ME BACK TO MY HOUSE so I could get my pills and then drove me 20miles outside of town to meet up again with the bus.I have NEVER had service like this in the US and probably never will again.If I could give them 10 stars, I would!THANKS WINE FLIES!!<3

Fun and Informative, One of the Highlights of our Cape Town Trip!. When my wife and I booked our trip to Cape Town one thing we were both sure we wanted to do was a wine tour, but with the expansive amount of tour operators to choose from it was difficult to decide who to book. After doing some research we decided to go with the Wine Flies Wine Tour and we are so glad we did because it ended up being one of the most fun days of our trip! Our "Wine Lord", Ian, was superb. Our group of 13 was fairly young (between 19-35) and no one was that knowledgeable when it came to wine and wine tasting so Ian really took his time in explaining such things as the history of South African wine, the way wine is produced, and the proper way to taste. His tour was very informative but he kept it entertaining throughout so I never felt even the slightest hint of boredom. There was even a fun pop-quiz at the end where the winning team was given a special prize (which I won't spoil!). The tour itself was also well structured. Pickup from our hotel was early (around 8:30a) and we reached our first vineyard in about an hour. You will begin tasting around 10am and continue tasting throughout 6 vineyards spread across the stunningly beautiful Stellenbosch with a delicious lunch served at the 3rd or 4th stop as well as cheese and chocolate tastings mixed in. By the end of the tour you will have had a fair amount of wine so you'll likely have a good buzz going and that just adds to the fun!

Great wine tour. I was a little apprehensive before going on the wine tour as I am quite picky with wine (I only drink dry reds) and wasn't sure if the wineries would hold up to my expectations. Other than the first winery I would say all the others were great! It is a lot of wine so bring water and make sure you eat breakfast! Lots of fun!

Wonderful, interesting day. Every aspect of this one day, wine, chocolate and cheese tour to the Stellenbosch wine area was delightful. We were a small group of 8 people. We were picked up at our hotel at the scheduled time. Took about an hour to get from Cape Town to the first winery.In all we went to 5 wineries - each one was different and interesting. At one we got to drink wine out of the barrel - even got to raise it ourselves. One winery also did cheese so we got a nice tasting of different wines and cheeses, We ate a really nice included lunch at another winery. Our guide for the day was terrific - very knowledgeable and pleasant to be with - he obviously enjoys what he is doing. The cost for the tour was ridiculously inexpensive - great value.

Nice day with "W". We made a private guided tour Gourmet tour and it was spectacular! The wines was very good, also the food. Our guide W was very friendly and helpful and let us know a lot for the wines, the region and the country. If you wanna do a tour we recommend the privat tour, have more time and learns more about country and people. Thank you for this wonderful day!

Best wine tour. Unlike most that do this tour, I'm an South African. I've done many wine tours but this one is truly exceptional. Its convenient and well organized. Our guide Rochelle Gouws was well informed, interactive and fun. I would recommend this tour to anyone!! Really a fantastic experience!

Amazing! . Great day, amazing people and tasty wines, don't need to ask more. Roshel and Sune, the guides, were great, lot of knowledge and great attitude. We were a small group of 6 totally young people and it was amazing. Great wineries (5) and very nice people. Includes lunch (bry) and don't cost that much, only 700R pp. White wine is only available in the first 3 and we didn't know it, wanted to buy more white wine but couldn't, so pay attention to it. Very recommended!!

Excellent trip made better by the guide. I did the Wine Flies scheduled tour of the Stellenbosch/Paarl wine region on Saturday 15th November. I was a bit apprehensive at first as I was doing it on my own. However, our guide Ian was fantastic. He made it a fun experience (we won the quiz and he handed out hats) and the other people on the tour were just as amazing. Ian was extremely knowledgeable and clearly loved his job (who wouldn't love drinking wine and getting paid for it?!). Also, Ian's music collection is one to behold... he has something for everyone! By the end of our tour we were all singing alongThe vineyards we went to were great - everyone will always have their favourites as it all depends on taste. Fairview and the matched cheese tasting was my particular favourite. All in all, I'd highly recommend Wine Flies especially in terms of value for money. In fact, next time I am in Cape Town I plan to take another tour with them and visit some of the other vineyards/tours they offer.

Good fun and Great wines! :). We were collected from our apartment & taken on a full days tour of some of the best vineyards Paarl and Stellenbosch has to offer, along with 8-10 others sharing a mini bus. Together we visited 5 vineyards in total and in addition to the expected winetasting, the tour also included pairing white and red wines with different cheeses and chocolate, as well as lunch along the way.Our guide Laurence looked after us superbly and in addition to knowing his wines and the history of the vineyards visited, he also knows Cape Town and the surrounding area intimately, sharing lots of interesting and useful information en route.Given the quality of the tour, the excellent wines and the food provided this was exceptional value for money and I would highly recommend Wine Flies to anyone thinking of taking a winetasting tour.

Wine and whale watching. We have finally return to Singapore safely! Would like to take this opportunity to thank Riaan for his excellent hospitality and taught us how to appreciate wine better. I have been going around gurgling the wines and blowing in like a "pro"! I truly appreciate the effort to cook some vegetarian sausages to accompany my cider and they are delicious! The lunch was excellent, the chutney was one of the best. Though we had not have much luck in getting close up with the whales but at least we get to see a few split seconds of their existence! Oh, did I mention we had 'champagne' as well? and the coastal drive was a memorable one=). Hope to drop by Cape town again and I'm gonna stay at Stellenbosch!

Good but Can Improve. Wine Flies was a great wine tour of Stellenbosch/Paarl wine region. We visited a total of five different wineries with a total of around 20 wine tastings. The lunch was great and our guide, Ian, was very knowledgeable. There was an issue of the dropoff - one of the guests was staying in Table View (30 mins away from Cape Town) and we had to stay in the car for more than 1.5 hours picking up and dropping that person off. I would suggest that you dropoff passengers in the order they were picked up so that the amount of time spent in the vehicle is the same for everyone.We also weren't told that our second winery was the last one where we can buy white wine so some of the white wine lovers didn't purchase enough wine.Overall the experience was good, but the hour that we spent in traffic at the end of the day didn't end the day on a good note.

Fun trip, nice wine and beautiful scenery. I really enjoyed this trip. I don’t know much about wine so it was good to learn a bit about the process of making it. Our guide Suné was fun and informative. I thought the pairings of the wine with cheese and chocolate was a great touch and clearly a lot of thought had gone into it. Overall the whole vibe of trip was fun and social. We visited five vineyards and tried a lot of wine on a very hot day. The lunch we had was really tasty as well. I would definitely recommend this tour and Wine Flies.

Totally recommended!. Our host was Clinton and he does love his job and wine! He made the tour very special and didactic. The wine farms were all different and wines of good quality. I come from a wine land and have to say that this is a true experience! We were supposed to do whale sightings and got cancelled because of the weather. We made the best choice!Thank you Clinton for such a great day, dropping us to the airport and working the extra mile!

Excellent day trip out of Cape Town. I thoroughly enjoyed my wine tasting tour as a great way of seeing the greater regions of Cape Town and the great heritage the area has in wine making. Our guide was very knowledgeable and provided us with many tips. I would highly recommend. As a caution, you will visit five vineyards (with lunch included) and will definitely need to pace yourself if you wish to see the day out!

Averavge experience. We went on a wine flies day tour, we were 13 people in the combi. The tour itself was great but we had the following dissapointing issues; - The vehicle we travelled in was in my opinion not capable for the job. It was poorly serviced and I could heard hear clangy noises coming from the gearbox or diff... not good if you take into account we have to travel in that vehicle for 8 to 10 hours! Got picked up at 7am was dropped off at 7pm.. - The driver (Wouter) needs to consider the fact that he has the lives of 13 people in his hands, he speeds and there were many times I could see hes was not in control of the vehicle when driving over 120kph or when the wind blows accross the road..- Lasty not everybody likes the music he prefers. It is unfortunate that he thinks everyone must listen to it loudly even after some wine; again 8+ hours exposure to it... I suggest he uses headphones, as I was not the only one that mentioned this It is unfortunate to say but in general on all the drive tours the drivers are very blase and irresponsible with their passenger's lives.

Fantastic Day & something completelly different. After hunting around for a decent wine tour to go on I came across the "Whale, Wine & Wors Tour" that Wine Flies provides. Wasn't sure what to expect from it however from start to finish it was simply amazing, what a great experience and fantastic adventure we all had.If you are looking for something slightly different to your average wine tour then I definitely recommend you get hold of them for the WWW Tour, you won't regret it!!!

Outstanding. We took the day trip, which was absolutely brilliant from start to finish. The wine was terrific, too! There was a marvelous cross section of people on our trip - from NY to Turkey, Spain, China, the Netherlands and South Africa, with ages from 25 to me at 61.Lawrence our guide was positively infectious with enthusiasm. Staggering value for someone from the UK, it must be said. I even got to shake hands with Hempies du Toit (the Sprinbok rugby player) at his Annandale Wine Estate. A day to remember.

The Forgotten Route - Train to Matjiesfontein. Was an amazing trip into history to the little town of Matjiesfontein .... a small town in the Karoo ... Started off with a walk in the company gardens and then to the Kimberley hotel and off to Kirabo - a boutique wine farm in the Robertson valley. From there we boarded the train in Worcester to Matjiesfontein where ghost stories, star gazing, honkey town party and awesome food were the stars of the day! The next morning was an early rise with breakfast, stroll around town and then off for wine, biltong, lunch and ending off the beautiful day with olive tasting before making our way back to Cape Town. Our host, Riaan, was the best ever ... knowledgeable and funny, enthusiastic and a great person in general ... would advise anyone to do the tour!
Fun day trip and excellent guide!. Great our and really amazing tour guide (Sune!). Fun combinations of big vineyards and smaller, off-the-beaten path vineyards. Excellent lunch and overall fun day.

Drink, ride and be merry. This was fun and highly recommended.Our guide V (he told us his full name, but it got blurred throughout the day) was great fun and quite knowledgable. We came out of this day with a pretentious "five steps of wine tasting" ritual and a very nice buzz...Using a great trick of no reserved seats in the van actually made us talk with new people instead of just driving along in quiet, downing multitudes of wine. The wineries were mostly located in really amazing scenery, so we even have a few good pictures; The pairing of cheese and chocolate added a lot, and we almost saw wallabies (did get a risqué shot of a couple of tortoises).

Lots of fun, lots of knowledge.. A great wine tour, with 5 different places and plenty of good wines. Our guide, Louwrens had great knowledge about the wines, winery and the process of making, and a good sense of humor. Which was the perfect setting of an excellent day.

Amazing "off the beaten path" tour. This was an amazing tour, very much worth on the cost/benefit scale. We visited some remarkable places that all the major tours do not visit, leaving the big commercial places and going to the hidden gems in the area. We had 5 lovely tastings along with cheese, chocolate and local "braai". I highly recommend this tour, the guide was amazingly friendly, very informative and so upbeat, he also made a point of getting us to talk to each other and meet new people during the tour, missed that in every other tour we did.

Full Day Wine Tour. I highly recommend the full day wine tour. We visited five unique wineries, all with very knowledgable and enjoyable staff for the tasting. Our driver/guide was excellent; a fun personality whose family has lived in the region for generations, so the history and facts came easily to him. He also had a great skill of connecting with everyone in our group, which was almost a dozen people. Each winery included a snack of some kind (cheese, chocolate, etc) and the middle winery hosted a delicious braai lunch. All in all it was a great day.
Full day of fun and lots of wine!. Excellent day of wine tasting and Wouter was a knowledgeable and fun guide! Visited fantastic wine farms of which Villiera was our favourite.

Worth The Money. Good use of my limited time in Cape Town. I had an enjoyable country tour with a really nice outdoor lunch, and tasted enough wine to last me for a year. The cheese and chocolate pairing was fun too. I found my tour guide Lawrence to be friendly and easy to talk with. I met some very nice folks on the tour as well. After comparing notes with others that used another tour company (ST) I'm convinced I made the right choice with (WF). I had trouble trying to use my hotel WiFI in order to confirm pick up so the hotel connected me to (WFs) via phone. I was able to clarify payment options for the next day pick up. All went well and Lawrence found me waiting in my hotel lobby the next morning. I recommend this company because of the fine tour, pleasant tour guide Lawrence, and the excellent value compared to my fellow touring groups comments on the company they used.

Interesting and Full Day Wine Tasting Excursion. Big G was our guide and driver, a very friendly and knowledgable host. We had a full van of 12 which was a good sized group. We stopped at 5 wineries and were guided around the grounds where Big G explained the growing climate, varieties of grapes grown and the typical growing season. We also were given tours of the wine making processes at different wineries from picking and juicing, to primary fermention and storing and finally bottling. Each of the winery stops included tastings of 5-6 wines (generous pours, so be prepared to drink) with one providing a cheese pairing (my favorite stop), one lunch (ok - not gourmet by any means and served family style; my favorite was the squash bisque) and another providing chocolate pairings with wine. Of course there is the opportunity to purchase wine to take away with you and our group was not shy with the shared "road soda" between stops, Big G buying our first round. While the tours may seem a bit pricey, it is well worthy the cost to have a driver to help enjoy the wine tasting worry free and have someone walk you through the wine growing and making process.

who knew you could have too much wine sampling. quite frankly you really rally need to like and be interested in winestarted to drink by around 10am by lunch I was thinking- oh dear more wine tasting stillwas disappointed did not see any of the towns such as Stellenboch etc just wineriesa half day tour would have been great or a whole day tour but with a break from the wine to see the towns too

What a fun and informative day! . Lourens was an excellent guide! He looked well after each and every one of us, and included everyone in his tour and talks. Very knowledgeable, and an all round fun guy. The tour was a lot of fun, and will definitely recommend it to all my friends.

Fantastic WineTour. I cannot recommend this tour enough. Tastings at 5 vineyards with cheese, chocolate and lunch. Our guide Laurence was brilliant and very informative. I have been on various wine tours in California and Tuscany but this beats them hands down. If you want a fun and unpretentious wine tour you must book Wine Flies.

Best. Day. Ever!!! You can't beat a day full of great wine, food sampling and interesting facts!. What could have been extremely disappointing ended up being the best thing that ever could have happened when I booked my day trip with one of the Wine Flies groups. Unfortunately(or maybe not), my reservation was misplaced and all the tours that day were full. That sounds sad but...the owner made arrangements for me to experience a private tour! We visited five different wineries....one winery paired the five wines with five different kinds of chocolate; another winery paired the wines with different varieties of biltong(S,A,'s version of jerky make from beef, elk, etc.) and Droeewors(dried sausage); another winery served a great wine with a beautiful lunch served on the grounds followed by a cellar tour and tasting; one of the five wineries served the wines in a formal dining room and paired the five wines with eight different cheeses; and the final winery served wines no longer available anywhere. I was able to sample some Chalbert- a lovely Merlot bottled for the wedding of Prince Albert and Charlene(from Monoco).All is all it was a fabulous day....I was treated like royalty at every stop....I think due to the fact that I was travelling with Riaan, who was a wealth of interesting and entertaining information. To cap off the adventure, I was privileged to try one of their own wines "Little Dry Red", which I thoroughly enjoyed! I couldn’t imagine a better experience. The prices charged for the tour are extremely reasonable and I am hoping to return to try their other tours.Thank you to everyone.

Great Day. Fun day in a casual, relaxed group without a pretentious opinion of enjoying wine. A full day visiting 5 wineries, including chocolate and cheese pairing .Great guide (Clinton) Highly recommended.

Excellent tour with a great guide. An excellent tour of the wine country, various Estates and excellent wines. Clinton was excellent and knowledgeable, next time we might get to try some Clinton brew :)

Great day out with fantastic guide. Wine Flies did a great tour, we were picked up from stellenbosch on time and headed off to see 5 wineries. Clinton, our guide, was brilliant. So knowledgeable of the area and wine. We enjoyed the cheese pairing and chocolate pairing, so different to other tours I've have done.The wineries visited were both boutique and large estates so received a good variety. I would highly recommend the tour.

a variety of wines and an enjoyable day. quite the variety we had gotten to try, and many more available for purchase. I was satisfied with the trips to the 5 different wineries. the tour not only gives you a sense of the great wine that cape town has to offer but also a look into south african culture. our group had a great wine lord as well.

A must-do tour!. This tour far exceeded any expectations we might have had!! Fabulous tour guide! Will definitely be recommending to any friends visiting Cape Town!! Would be more than happy to do a repeat!!
Stunning. Clinton was amazing I was worried that the tour was going to boring but he made it so fun and I learned so much it inspired me to do my wine degree :-) thank you so much
Great value, great wine, great tour!. This was a fantastic tour. I went in with high expectations and those expectations were exceeded. V. was amazing. Strongly, strongly recommend.

Off the beaten track your find treasures. This tour takes you to famous vineyards but also once that you will never have heard off. these are the once that will amaze you. where you will find the true pleasure of passion of making wine.during tour you get to taste many of the local treasures and food is also provided for.big thanks to our tour guide Wouters

Amazing tour!!! . We joined to wine day tour and had a lot of fun!! Our guide, Paul was very nice and funny. We visit 5 different winery which was very good and off course we tasted a lot of wine.. This tour is very recommended! And very chip for his value! Thanks Paul! It was pleasure...

Great guide, great wine, great tour!. Had a fantastic wine tour with these guys. Our guide Clinton was very knowledgable, interesting and most of all fun! We had some great wine, saw some beautiful scenery and wineries, and learnt quite a bit! The tour included cheese and chocolate as well, so how could you possibly go wrong?! Amazing, thanks Clinton and Wine Flies :)

Great Trip. This was a fantastic tour. Clinton was amazing. He was so knowledgeable and energetic. When our last winery had to cancel he did not miss a beat and took set up another wine tasting. Great day tasting wine. Thank you Clinton for an amazing day

Unique tour. I really enjoyed the tour as it offered much more than just wine tasting. I like how our guide, Paul was very knowledgeable about the vineyards we were visiting and about wine in general.I like how the tour incorporated chocolate and food pairing, and insights on wine in general.

Perfect tour on a rainy day in Cape Town . Lord G was an awesome tour guide! We toured five different wineries throughout the day. Everyone had a blast! I would highly recommend this company. We took our time and soaked up all of the information and education about the wine from each winery.
