We will always remember (bits and pieces) of this tour! ;) it is THE perfect activity to do while the weather isn't cooperating for table mountain.

My Big Fat Whale Wine & Wors Tour. This tour exceeded my expectations. Lord V, our tour guide was brilliant he kept us all entertained by playing musical chairs in the bus on the way to the different vine yards he was always pleasant and open to questions.In Stellenbosch we were taught how to tell whats in the wine by it's smell. How the wine was made and obviously got to taste all the different types of wines. From Stellenbosch we traveled to Grabouw and went to taste all the different wors and biltong and got a little history lesson from the butcher himself which was very interesting.We then got to go to Everson wine and cider farm where I tasted the best cider of my life ( I will never have Savanna again after tasting Everson ) while we learnt about the Everson farm from Mr Everson himself Lord V was making a BBQ for us with some of the wors he bought while we were at the butcher.After Everson we had lunch at a restaurant high in the mountains called Ell, which was a hidden germ, being vegetarian I had the vegetable curry which was so delicious, we got to taste more wine at the restaurant which was paired with some chocolate, so yummy :)We also went to Hermanus to spot some whales, it was so beautiful to see, after whale watching we had even more wine at another farm. All in all, a fabulous day with spectacular views and a brilliant tour guide great food and wine. Thank you Wine Flies. I definitively recommend this tour to anyone and everyone! <3

My favorite wine tour ever!. Big G was right on time to pick us up at our B&B. Very upbeat and friendly. We picked up 7 others and we were on our way. Myself and my husband have been on many wine tours including Napa and this was by far the best. The wine was delicious and had a ton of variety. Big G was very knowledgeable and provided a lot of information on the wineries and the process of making the wine. We went to 4 different wineries. One they served us a yummy lunch with sausage, chicken and cypress grilled cheese. The wine tour in total was about 10 hours but so worth it to experience these different places.
Such a great wine tour. Our guide was very informative, you could see that he is quite passionate about the wine making industry. I would definetly recommend it :)

HIghlight of our Cape Town Adventure. Lord G (Granwell) took our family of ten on the most wonderful wine tour during our visit to Cape Town. We can't recommend this tour highly enough, it was the best thing we did as a group on this part of our vacation. Booking and communications was easy and Lord G was a fantastic guide to the five wine farms we visited. He was very knowledgeable, personable, and enthusiastic. We never felt rushed and the day just flew by we were having so much fun. It was the perfect mix of good wine, information, and beautiful scenery. The stops were each unique and interesting. Great job Wine Flies!

Lourie, jou doring!!!. Wow, what a great experience. Pickup at our place of residence, our guide a jewel, immediately memorising everyone's names (16) and sharing snippets of information and history regarding the sights, wine and so forth. These guys are really professional and have chosen a great selection of farms to visit on the trip. Food and entertainment accompanied and complimented the great experienceThank you !!
Great Tour, Great Farms, Great Guide. I can't reccomend this tour highly enough. Lourens was excellent, the farms were great and cannot wait to do it again. Thanks for a lovely Day!

Forgotten route tour. Highly, highly recommended. Knowledgable and enthusiastic guides make this quirky tour a must. They showed me some undiscovered gems in a part of the country that I know really well

Amazing tour and guide!. The best wine tour we have ever been on! Our guide was Laurence who was very knowledgeable and he made the day great fun. We met some lovely people on the tour and Laurence made sure everybody was included in events throughout the day. We toured 5 vineyards and they were all different. Thank you for a great day out.

Great fun and educational too. Clinton hosted our trip and was very informative, not too technical but enough to help you choose a wine. My wife and I really enjoyed the trip. Well done Clinton a great day out

A 21st birthday to remember!. My daughter celebrated her 21st birthday with a private Wine Flies tour and it was "one of the BEST days of their lives". They loved every minute of the tour and thought the guide was charming, super-informed and very indulgent which made for huge amounts of fun for her guests. Everything was brilliantly organised at every stop and she was even spoilt with a delicious bottle of wine, as a birthday present from the tour company. We can't say enough wonderful things about this company and HIGHLY recommend them to anyone who comes to Cape Town. Best day out you can possible have!

Great tour around fantastic vineyards. I was picked up on time with no problems, there was a nice mix of people on the bus and the guide was fantastic, Clinton was very knowledgable and I certainly learned a lot of wine facts I never knew!! The wineries were a good mix and there was no pressure to purchase, we also has cheese and chocolate pairings which was an added bonus.Overall very smoothly run and a very enjoyable day out!!

Perfect wine tour with a perfect guide!. This wine tour was one of our best days of our trip to South Africa. We were picked up on time and the van was comfortable and clean. Highly recommend this tour, you will not regret any minute and if possible ask for Clinton as he was one of the best guides I have ever met. Not only his passion and knowledge about wine making but also his charm and friendly personality added to this great day. So, I can only say great tour, great guide and great scenery with lots of fun :) entertainment guaranteed if you end up with Clinton. Thank you for making our day unforgettable…
Great wine tour. Great mixture of wineries and the stop at a local farm with a home made lunch was lovely. We have been on lots of wine tours and this was definitely one of the best!

The only way to enjoy safe wine tasting - you must do this when in the Cape!. We were a group of adults and teenagers. I was concerned that the younger folks in our group might get bored. NOT AT ALL - everybody loved it. Wouter was great - played the best music and taught us a whole lot about the area and wine. Not having to worry about driving was a huge bonus. The lunch was delicious. This was great - thank you!

Fun, food & lots of wine.. Just returned from an entertaining day trip with the very knowledgeable Clinton. This man's passion for wine made the tour educational, enjoyable & a great way to view the beautiful Cape Winelands. Add in the other tour guests, we had a ball.Who would have thought we would be drinking wine by 10am? By the end of the first winery, everyone were best buddies and the fun kept coming. Wine paired with cheese and chocolates were a highlight.Clinton went out of his way to make us all appreciate the history, techniques & processes involved in wine making.Neither of us are big wine drinkers but we still thoroughly enjoyed the day & the friendships made. Take plenty of water with you to make the most of the experience & to guarantee you last the distance! Highly recommend this tour & Clinton.

Highlight of our trip!. The entire day was filled with a plethora of wine, scrumptious samples of crackers cheeses, chocolate and better yet new found friends! Our guide was entertaining and each wine farm was remarkably unique. Definitely a must if you're in the area!!

Highly Recommend!!. 2 friends and I had a blast on our wine tour with Big G as our guide. He had a huge smile on his face when he picked us up (despite it being pretty early in the morning) and was very knowledgeable about the whole wine making process and had us try some delicious wine, cheese, and chocolate. We also had amazing people on our bus and had an amazing time getting to know each other and exchanging our thoughts on what we liked and didn't like. The places we visited were: Villier, Fairview, Middelvlei, Lovane, and Annandale.

Highly recommended. We enjoy wines, but really do not know enough about them. The day was a great mix of 5 medium and smaller vinyards. Our host V, had good knowledge of the history of wines in SA and added individual information about each wine during the tastings. Day also included lunch with traditional SA foods as well as chocolate and cheese tastings during our wine experience. Wine was available for purchase at each stop .Tour was a full day, lots of wine, fun for all.

Great day. HiWe went on the winelands tour on the 21st of July 2015 with Clinton as our guide. We had a fantastic day, Clinton is a very knowledgeable guide and made the day a blast. His honesty about the wines was refreshing and you knew exactly what to expect from each farm.Great day, great experience and great way to learn more about wine making.

Wine flies when you are having fun. Thank you for an awesome day! Our guide(Clinton) was exceptionally knowledgeable and ready fun. We got to see a wide spectrum of wine farms and estates that gave us a cross section of wine producing methods and outputs. This is the perfect introduction to SA wine for beginners and lovers!

The highlight of our Honeymoon!. Thanks to the great day planned by Wine Flies, our guide Wouter van der Merwe was just great and very pleasant. I planned this as part of our honeymoon as it was recommended - and I can honestly say that it was the highlight of our 2 week trip and since this was a unique experience...we will surely do it again in future.Wouter made it interesting, giving us a new look at South African wine. Not only was this affordable but there is SO much included that one forgets how far Wine Flies makes your money go :)Cheese, Chocolate and Biltong - taste so much better with wine now. This tour is a must for anyone looking to have a day full of treats and knowledge.

The perfect way to explore the winelands. We knew we wanted to visit some wineries outside of Cape Town but didn't really want to worry about renting a car, so we were so happy when a friend of ours recommended Wine Flies. The tour was great - Clinton, our guide, was an aspiring winemaker himself, so he gave us a lot of insight into the entire process, and knew the owners of the wineries very well, so we often got some extra perks along the way. As other reviewers have mentioned, Clinton did a great job of spacing out the tour, and making sure we were eating here and there, so even though you were trying alot of wines (most wineries offered tastings of 5-6 wines at least), you didn't feel like you were overly drunk at the end of the day. I would definitely recommend this tour for anyone who wants to check out the winelands, but doesn't necessarily have alot of time, or does not want to rent a car and drive around themselves.

Good Buzz on a Great Day. The day started with a bottle of rose passed around the van at 8:00 - a good way to kick off any day of drinking. We toured five vineyards throughout the course of the day. Clinton, our guide, is very knowledgeable about the history and process of wine making in South Africa. The tour included a lovely midday lunch.The start of the tour was delayed by a couple of late arrivals. We ended up waiting at a gas station for 30 minutes while they were dropped off from Cape Town. This cut our time a little short at the last vineyard.

Perfect Day in Wine Country. My sister and I did a day-long visit touring a total of 5 different vineyards, which included 4 tastings, 2 with pairings (cheese, chocolate), and a delicious traditional South African barbecue lunch. Our guide was incredibly knowledgeable, and was very attentive to our every need. He even brought bottles of wine for us to enjoy in the car during our visits to ensure that we could keep a "good buzz going" throughout the day.This was far from a booze cruise, however. I learned a lot about the historical role of viticulture in South Africa, techniques for doing a proper wine taste, wine, port, and brandy production, fun facts about the families that run each vineyard, etc. Everything was perfectly managed from beginning to end and the vineyards selected gave a wonderful range of styles, tastes, landscapes, and history for us to soak in.

Good fun. I was looking forward to a nice wine tour of Stellenbosch and I got it, however I was pretty surprised that the tour descended into a massive sloppy wine crawl, as that's not the impression I got from the website and other TA reviews.I'm pretty sure this is because we had a group of eight uni students on school break, and all they wanted to do was drink, drink, drink. They bought wine from the wineries and kept passing around open bottles in the van for everyone to share (very kind of them, I won't lie). I didn't drink any because I had plans that evening that I couldn't show up very drunk for, but I also wasn't prepared for a big booze fest.I had fun, for sure, but I think if I were any older than 30 I wouldn't have enjoyed myself much on the loud, drunk party bus. I think it would be different if it were a more mixed group or one that wasn't full of students, but I'm not sure.Our guide, Granwell, was great, the wineries were very nice, and the lunch was delicious.

Magical tour!. We went on The Forgotten Route trip to Matjiesfontein.What a wonderfully enchanting little place!Clinton,our guide, was knowledgeable and friendly. He made sure we all knew the stories behind the places we stopped at and pointed out interesting facts as we went along the route.real value for money and loads of fun!

Great Tour of SA Wine Country. I enjoyed a great tour of Stellenbosch and the surrounding area with Wineflies. We visited 1 large winery and the rest were all family run, smaller estates. Each stop,included a tour of the winery and information from the very knowledgable guide about wine and wine making. Lunch brain at a family farm and winery was a true SA I will not forget.
Forgotten Route - excellent. Action packed, fun-filled and informative. Guides go out of their way to make it a truly memorable experience. Would recommend to anyone !

Great wine tour. I think the tour way great value for money, especially as it included a generous lunch and 5 wineries. I loved the added touches of the chocolate, meat and dried fruit pairing that the tour provided (this was not put on by the wineries), they really think about the itinerary and overall experience for their guests. The tour was recommended to me by a friend and I'm very glad I chose them

Cape Winelands Day Tour. We really enjoyed our Wine Flies Tour, but then again this would be a tough tour to screw up. It tours 5-12 people from various parts of the world around 5 distinct wine operations all the while mixing in a health dose of wine for a fun, social, unique, carefree day exploring the finer points of life. Apart from the tastings that each differed enough in style and flavor that we never felt like we were doing the same thing over and over, our favorite part of the tour was actually the traditional South African wine farm lunch. We got a sampling of soup, different salads, chicken off the braai, and ostrich sausage! D-licious! Also, this winery let us sample wine straight from the cask! believe it or not, it tasted very good unfiltered and paired well with the chocolate we were offered. Great day! Great times! Recommend!

Fun Day. Really enjoyed Clinton, our guide. He was really knowledgeable and a total joy to be around, he really made for a great experience. The wines were good, and had especially great time at the last place we visited. the only thing I would improve would be the food offering but for the price we really can't complain too much.

Learned a lot and had fun!. I originally wanted to go on a biking wine tour but that wasn't available so I booked this instead through my hostel and I'm glad I did! Clinton made it a very special day - including a warm-up bottle of wine to drink in the van and different South African music for the drives. He taught us a lot about the history of the wine region and wine production, including tasting wine in the steel tank and partly aged wine from a barrel. There was a great mix of larger commercial wineries and smaller family estates, and the cheese and chocolate pairings were also great. Clinton also made the day special for our one group member whose birthday it was. Don't miss this while you're in Capetown!

A really enjoyable day - Well planned and executed. We booked this tour based on Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. A small group of 12 and a few well chosen wineries (or 'wine farms' as they call them in SA). We started with the large commercial wine and cheese farm - it offered a wine and cheese pairing, and ended with Annandale, a farm that had a very interesting history and the most engaging Pierre. Pierre was unassuming, a great story teller and extremely proud of the wine that Annandale produces. You need to go and try these wines for yourself. We were blessed with good weather that allowed us to enjoy a braai for lunch outside in the sunshine but this tour will be great in any conditions. Laurence, our guide was knowledgeable and clearly had a passion for wine, food and providing visitors to the Cape with a

The best tour ever. For St. Valantine's day went on the tour. We were a part of a group with female American students in Cape town.The selection of wineries was great and it was concluded with Annadale, small wine producer with great red wine left to settle in barrels for seven years.Ryan, our guide was fabulous and the group connected fast with his guidence. The organisation was great too.I do travel a lot and have lots of excursions but I had to admit that this was far the best one. Thank you for that experience.

Fun tour. My husband and I went on this tour during our visit to Cape Town and had a wonderful time! The wineries we visited were great (nice variety in the types of wineries and wines), the wine was delicious and cheap (all tastings included in the price), the trip was well-organized, the tour guide (Big G) was really fun and knowledgeable, and the lunch was great. One thing we really liked about this tour company was that our group was small (maybe 10 total), which was really great for getting to know some people but not having it feel like you are part of a large herd. I would definitely go on this tour again if we were back in Cape Town.

Awesome tour. Really good bang for your buck. Learned a lot. Went in believing wine tasting was a scam, came out knowing so much. Big G, was the best tour guide and made me a believer. I would bring other people with me next time and specifically ask for him. The lunch was good and the pick up and drop off at the hotel was a plus.

Fun, fun, fun!. I booked this tour as a solo traveler. However, the four other people who also booked this tour plus our wonderful wine guide, soon became my friends. We did a lot of wine tasting and we also had lunch, which was included in the price, along the way. It was an altogether fun day and if I ever return to Cape Town I will do it again.

AmAZing Experience with Lord V.. Thank you for the great experience. Wine Flies is definitely the best at what they are doing. You would not find better quality for your money so there for it is a must go for all wine lovers or all wine beginners. Have a great time guys with most experience wine lovers in SA.Special SHOUT-OUT to Lord V. Keep on being the great guide you are!!!Thank you Once more.Bjorn

THE BEST WINE TOUR EVER!!!. This wine tour will always be remembered. Wine Flies is doing a fantastic job and I would recommend everyone to take their wine tour if you plan to visit Cape Town. They make you taste a lot of wine and when I say a lot of wine I mean 25-30 different kinds of wine. They have the best team of guides who explain the whole process of wine making. Cape Town itself is magnificent but the locations they have chosen for their tour are just picturesque. They serve a delicious lunch at one of the most beautiful vineyards (I could just take this tour again for the lunch :-D). Highly recommend for anyone visiting Cape Town.Thank you Wine Flies for the amazing memories.Cheers

Best way to experience Stellenbosch!. This was such a fun day! Not only did we get to sample more wine than on any other wine tour I've been on, but there was also cheese, chocolate, biltong, and a wonderful braai for lunch. We were stuffed by the end of day! Also, our guide was very humorous, knowledgeable, and he really helped a group of strangers bond together...the wine helped too! Would highly recommend it for anyone looking to explore Stellenbosch through its wines!

Fun, Educational, & Tipsy Day in Cape Town. Wine Flies does a REALLY good job with their wine tour. They offer a very quality service at a very reasonable price. They've got everything down to a perfect science, including the timing of the tastings so you're happily buzzed without being wasted or even forgetting the cool stuff you're learning about wine and wine making. Lord V was our tour guide and he was an excellent mix of fun, laid-back, professional, educational, silly, and responsible. I would imagine that Wine Flies has other quality guides, but I would definitely suggest requesting Lord V - he was the man! If you're thinking of going wine tasting and want to do something fun that doesn't require much thought or effort on your part, I cannot recommend Wine Flies enough.

Thanks Clinton!. We had accidentally booked our tour on the wrong day, and Clinton stepped up and gave us a tour on his day off! He customized our itinerary to fit our needs and offered us a vast amount of information on not only wines, but history, nature and any other question we threw his way. He's very knowledgable and the exact sort of person you want showing you around the beautiful wine region. No complaints! Great day, great memories! Thanks!

Great tour-just book it!. The Wine Flies Wine Tour was excellent. You learn plenty without feeling like you don't belong. It's perfect for those that enjoy wine but not the snootiness! We tasted a lot of wine and plenty of cheese, chocolate and biltong. Plus, lunch is filling. I'm a vegetarian and was accommodated with a wonderful substitution. Pickup and drop off from your accommodation is an added bonus as most tours charge extra or require you to get yourself up to Stellenbosch.
Great wine tour. Had the best wine tour with Wine Flies. Only go with them if you like biltong, cheese, chocolate,fun and of course wine, wine and more wine. Drinking hats rule.

Heaven in the Cellars. What an excellent experience. Doing this Wine tour was the best decision making concerning our trip. Fairview cheese and wine lovely, chocolate pairing lovelyaand Braai kos "lekker". Wine farms double the fun... Thanks Big Gee!

Wine Flies Wine Day Tour accessibility. My name is Nick Westermeyer. I am a quadriplegic from a gymnastics injury sustained at Michigan State University in April 1991 who is interested in global travel and participating in activities not normally associated with disabled people. I’m currently on an adventure that will explore worldwide handicapped accessibility. Many people have travel blogs, but there are none that I know of that come from the vantage point of a wheelchair user going off the accessible path.I get picked up at my hotel by Granwell from Wine Flies Wine Tours. We are on a Toyota mini bus that I transfer to the floor then to the seat closest to the door. There are 13 people on the tour today. Our first stop is in Paarl wine region at Fairview Wine & Cheese about 45 minutes away. The parking lot and walkway at the winery is gravel, with a slight up hill. Granwell helps push me to the entrance. Once to the entrance it is paved and easy to wheel around. Brian is the presenter for the wine. The tasting is a pairing of 5 wines, 5 cheeses and one sweet dessert wine.We have a 15 minute drive to the Stellenbosch wine region for the rest of our wine tasting tour. Villiera Winery is our first winery in Stellenbosch. Granwell gives us a tour of the wine making process from vine to bottling. He also is our wine presenter. We taste 7 wines at Villiera. The tour and tasting room are all accessible.Lunch is at Middelvlei Wine Estate 15 minutes down the road. The lunch area is accessible but I get help from Granwell up the hill to the cellar. I could have done by myself but it was much quicker with his help. In the cellar we taste a 2013 Merlot straight from the aging barrel and a great group photo opportunity with the wine barrels in the background.The next tasting is at Lovane Boutique Wine Estate about 10 minutes away. There are 3 steps I need carried up to the entrance. The tasting room is in the basement. Two workers help me down a very steep ramp with wood rungs. This is the ramp they use to roll the wine barrels up and down to the cellar. Lovane only produces red wine, about 2000-3000 bottles per year. Our tasting was Cabernet Sauvignon from 4 different years and a sweet red wine. I am helped back up the ramp by Granwell pushing the back of my chair and the two workers from before pulling from the front. I’m helped down the 3 steps then we’re off to our last tasting today, Annandale Estates Winery about 15 minutes away.We head to the tasting area that’s accessible, our presenter is Pierre. We taste 4 different wines and a brandy. Pierre was the best wine presenter of the day. We have a 45 minute ride back to Cape Town during which me and a few people on the tour make plans to continue the drinking. This was the best wine tour I’ve been on since I started traveling in January 2014. This is the first tour I’ve went out with people after the tour. Granwell did a great job as our driver and tour guide. I would recommend this wine tour to anyone who visits Cape Town. This tour is possible for an active manual wheelchair user who is able to transfer from their chair the floor of the bus then to a seat. Most places were accessible, but Granwell and people on the tour were more than happy to help when needed. Paving the parking lot and walkway at Fairview Wine & Cheese would make this stop accessible. Building a ramp at Lovane would make it easier to get to the entrance but there is no way to make getting to the tasting room accessible without the installation of an elevator. It would not be economical with very few wheelchair users doing the tour.Photos of Wine Flies Tour can be viewed at http://offtheaccessiblepath.smugmug.com/Africa/South-Africa/Wine-Flies-Tour/Wine-Flies-Tour/Accessibility wise this tour would receive a 3/5 rating.

Nearly perfect. This is an excellent tour of the Stellenbosch region, and Clinton is a great tour guide. It's reasonably priced, albeit on the more expensive side for SA. However, it's worth it. The wineries are beautiful and have great wine, and the cheese and chocolate and lunch are excellent complements. The penultimate winery on the tour, Lovane, has the best wine. Annandale, the last winery on the tour, should be excluded from the package based on the bigoted comments of its drunken proprietor. Otherwise, the tour was perfect.

So Much Fun. A friend and I did the Stellenbosch Wine Tour back in September. We were picked up at our waterfront Capte Town hotel in the morning and spent a wonderful day touring 5 different wineries. We had a beautiful lunch with some puppy Mastiffs as company and sampled a lot of wine. You will not go thirsty or hungry on this tour.The day's soundtrack warrants a shoutout - our driver had an incredible mix of sing-a-long classics such as Meatloaf's "I'll Do Anything for Love", Celine Dion's "All Coming Back to Me", Ace of Base's "The Sign", Aqua's "Barbie Girl", and many other songs that you know every single word to whether you admit it or not. Our driver was WONDERFUL...but his name is escaping me...Grantham? He looked like he might've been Samoan and was tall and broad and rocked a black tophat w/ khaki shorts. He divided our van into two groups and administered a written exam after our creative thoughts were well lubricated - good fun. ProTip: Do not overindulge the night before...you would be underestimating how much you are going to drink on this tour and might not make it through the day. We had a girl on our trip who only slept 2 hours the night before sleep through two wineries. Don't be that person.Bottom Line: Great Price, Good Fun, Highly Recommend.

A great experience on "The Forgotten Route". We joined the "Forgotten Route" last weekend and what a brilliant experience it was. From the moment we were met in Cape Town to being dropped off on the 2nd day. Our guides Riaan and Clinton kept us informed with endless stories and facts about South Africa of many years ago. Their knowledge was endless . Every aspect of the trip was well organised and faultless.One of the many highlights for us was the stop at the local biltong factory where we had the most delicious and traditional lunch of beef shin and Karoo lamb stews. Then the most delicious puddings all for the cost of 100 Rand per head.For the price we paid for this trip we found to be excellent value for money. It was one of the many memorable things we have done on our holiday .Thank you so much Riaan and ClintonKind regardsMalcolm and Ann Green

Excellent Day Full of Good Wine!. I've lived in Cape Town and have done wine tastings many times all over the cape winelands and this tour was one of the best experiences I have had! Not having to worry about driving, especially after 5 vineyards with 5 very full wine tastings (this wouldn't be possible in your own car as the driver), was absolutely fantastic! I have only ever been to one of the wineries previously, otherwise the rest were new for me and the wine of course was great! A hearty and delicious lunch was also provided at a small family winery which was a wonderful experience. It was amazing how much our guide was able to fit into a single day and we were all having a jolly time by the time we returned to the city. Also, as a single traveller it was very easy to meet everyone else on the tour and I quickly became friends with the other guests (wine can be a social lubricant lol). Our guide was also very knowledgeable about wine and wine making so if you're a connoisseur I'm sure you can ask any questions you may have in mind and he would be able to answer. Overall it was an awesome day with lots of delicious South African wine and I will definitely recommend this tour!Thank you Wine Flies!

Unforgettable Forgotten Route. You can't skip wine tasting while in South Africa. And there's no more pleasant way to discover the good wine places and spend an entertaining and informative time than by booking a tour with Wine Flies. These guys have something more than knowledge for wine: I believe it's called passion. I did a classical one day tour with them and enjoyed every minute. But the tour that fascinated me the most was the two-day tour they call the Forgotten Route. It's a jewel of a journey, combining travel with the Shosholoza Meyl train, Karoo desert, yummy wine, braai, fun, breathtaking landscape and most certainly plenty of information about the region from one of your dedicated Wine Flies guide. That leaves me with one more tour to go with them, for which I'll then have to come back to South Africa. Look no more, the Forgotten Route is one you will remember!
Great info, wine and fun . Went to five wineries and had cheese and chocolate pairings too. The cheese was amazing! Our guide "G" was so knowledgeable and passionate. It was a great day!

A perfect day!. A group of volunteers and I did this tour on a Sunday and had an absolute blast! The wineries they take you to are beautiful and the wine just seemed to keep getting better and better at each stop! The tour guide was amazing and definitely made the trip! Great job!

what a awesome day. Came across this tour on Trip Advisor and was taken my the rave reviews it got and the large number (5) of cellar doors visited and was not disappointed,Our bus was full but the group only numbered 14 and our guide, V was fantastic, giving us just the right amount of detail to allow us to fully appreciate what we were seeing and tasting. The 5 wineries we visited were all different and so we got a great overview of the fine wines of the region. Lost count of the number of wines we tried but it was well over 20 and there was no pressure to buy however we all managed to get a good stock to bing home.The scenery was also spectacular and the whole trip was just one great event after another.

Best Wine Tour. Small group tours, guides with great personality and very knowledgeable. An extremely fun experience! We learned a lot about wine, the region, and the culture and we had a great time along the way. We stopped at 5 wineries and tasted something like 25 wines total. We had snacks (biltong, cheese, chocolate) at a couple wineries, and lunch (a braai) at one of the wineries. Plenty to eat and drink throughout the day. We could not have asked for more. It was a fantastic day!I just wish we had been in Cape Town long enough to try some of their other tours, which I've heard are amazing! They're definitely on our list of things to do on our next visit to Cape Town.
great wine tour in a small group. did this great tour in a small group of four people, which was great. we visited several different types of wineries - really great experience!

LOTS of wine in a relaxed environment. If you are looking for a wine tour that is fun and not pretentious stop the search you've found it! We had a wonderful day exploring five vineyards with V. My 4 year old accompanied us and she got to enjoy all the food pairings and even some sparkling grape juice. I will give a word of caution it is a LOT of wine, around 25 samplings by the end of the day, sipping is important! We enjoyed the variety of choices and extensive history of the vineyards. We were served a delicious home cooked meal. Great (drunk) day!

Excellent . Had a lovely day with V on our tour. Learned so much and overall had a really enjoyable day. We lost count of how many wines we tasted! We had great variety on the tour - red, white, MCC, dessert wine even brandy! We visited 5 unique vineyards. Lunch was delicious and our minivan was comfortable.

Simply amazing with Wine Flies. I did a wineries tour with Wine Flies for the second time in a year and it was simply great. Lady Sune organized everything perfectly. Even though I do live in Germany, the organization and the communication per email was easy and very friendly since the beginning. We had our tour with Clinton who gave us very interesting explanations about wines, organized everthing efficiently so that we could see 5 wineries in 1 day! It is those kind of experience that make you happy and relaxed and that you wish to repeat again. I believe that my experience with Wine Flies has been special. I would suggest to all my friends who go on holiday to South Africa to book a day through them. It really makes fun!

Fun!. We had so much fun on this wine tour. Our guide (forgot his name) was nice, funny, and knowlegable. The day was great from start to finish we got to taste some excellent wines and lunch was yummy. Would def do again.
Perfect Day. This tour handpicks the wineries you visit and the guide was very knowledgeable. We had an amazing day.

Wine, Wine, Wine and more Wine. Oh and some cheese...... Very impressive tour. We went for the private option but also saw the group tour and they are only in groups of 12 in a nice small minivan. We had our own Land Rover what looked like a brand new.The tour transport was great, the tour guide was amazing (V). He was very knowledgeable on the vineyards, the wines, where to go and even had a damm good selection of music for the journey.Our only issue was the booking as I did request for a tour of just the Franschhoek region. However we were booked for Stellenbosch when they arrived. This was 100% fine as we had been to neither. Also we went to loads of Boutique vineyards which was great.Nice wines (even bought a few), good cheese, great company. Also no pressure at all to buy anything from anyone.Very happy with wineflies. Would 100% use again and recommend to others to use.Thank you

Best day out!. We had the G man looking after us in our day tour and it was amazing! He was very friendly, funny and knowledgeable and really got us all pumped for a fun day ahead. Absolutely loved visiting Fairview wines! The whole day was amazing and am happy to say I made lifelong friends that day - god bless wines!

Great wine trip!. I looked up a variety of companies and am so happy I chose wine flies. Our guide was great and the group was young and fun. The five wineries were adorable and not overly touristy. I would highly recommend this trip!

A great time with Wine Flies. We were picked up at our hotel by our guide (Lord V). We picked up a few more people before heading out to Stellenbosch - about 45 mins drive. We visited 5 different vineyards. We tasted probably about 25-30 different wines (mostly red.) Lord V was very knowledgable, professional and friendly. I definitely learn something new from him about wine. All the vineyards we visited were all great. Some are with cheese and chocolate pairings. We had lunch (included) at one of the vineyards (with a glass of wine of course.) Everyone on the tour had a great time! Highly recommended!

Utterly superb wine tour. Had an amazing day touring five great vineyards with Granwell from Wine Flies. There were 12 of us on a comfortable minibus; the places we visited and the wines we tasted were superb -- as was lunch, which was included! I cannot recommend this company highly enough. Would love to go again!

Tons of Wine. Our guide was right on time to pick us up and always took great care of us. He was knowledgeable and fun! You drink a LOT of wine on this tour. The first place we stopped served an amazing honey wine that I highly suggest buying (it was at the first place, so we were hesitant to buy anything right away in fear that the other stops would be even better, but the honey wine is unique to this vineyard and is amazing!). Your guide will drop you off wherever you want after the tour, and our whole group ended up going out for [even more] drinks. We ended up becoming friends and met up throughout the rest of our trip around Cape Town. This is definitely a wine tour for younger people and you will have a great time at these locally owned vineyards. You get a better feel for the culture of the area with this tour instead of just going to the huge corporate wineries. We met the owner of the winery at our last stop and he showed us the porcupine he caught that day in a cage and let us taste Prince Albert's wedding wine. The cheese tasting at Fairview was amazing! You will definitely end up buying cheese and wine to celebrate with your new friends on the rest of your trip.

Great way to spend your day. I went on the Wine Flies tour with a group of friends and it was one of the best things we did in Cape Town. We went to five different wineries. One with a cheese pairing and a shop to buy the delicious cheese, another we did a chocolate pairing, had lunch on a beautiful vineyard where we got to taste wine from the barrels and the one where we were able to try brandy. Oh and one even had a goat :p. Our guide V was incredibly knowledgeable about wine and we learned a lot. Each winery was unique. They have a policy that you have to sit in a different seat each time you get in the van which is great because you meet everyone on your tour which makes if more social and fun. I can't praise it enough. Must do in Cape Town.

Wine Flies Tour. It was the highlight of our holiday. Riaan was our guide and not only was it very informative with regard to the wines but a lot of interesting history around Stellenbosch, the mountains etc. Very enthusiastic, relaxed atmosphere and just a wonderful, fun day. I will and can recommend any visitor going to the Cape to include this in your itinerary. It was worth every cent !Elsa Blom en Doreen Swart

Value for money. The whole experience was a first for me as i didn't know what to expect. The tour guide is so friendly and truly well informed about the wines. I enjoyed visiting all the vineyards, it was a truly an educational tour for me. I will definetly recommend it to all my friends.

Best tour I've ever been to. Warmest welcome we've received - Riaan introduced himself, then us to the rest of the group on the minibus. That created some sort of a chilled out atmosphere from the very start. Always smiling, with a fun way of explaining the tour details. Yet, professional as it can get, with great wine knowledge, as well as local history and trivia knowledge.  The tour itself consisted of visiting 5 different wine yards, accompanied with wine tasting and food pairing sessions. Visit of a nice farm with braai for lunch was also included. Not to go into details - every person (whether you do like wine or you don't) will enjoy themselves on the tour.  We've been on quite a few tours - wine or other type - over the last couple of years. But THIS ONE WAS THE BEST. First time ever I've noticed every tour visitor smiling all the way from the beginning till the end. Most recommended. Thank you guys

Best, Bestest :). Wine Flies is the most professional, yet extremely fun, spunky, rad…… and the list goes on, wine tour company in the WHOLE of SA, & I have been on quite a lot of wine tours. The tour Guide, Lord Wouter van der Merwe, even though it was his first day at Wine Flies, was the most clued up guide ever and he brings somewhat a unique “Jenesequa” to the tour.Even though I have not met her in person, Lady Suné, exceeded my expectation when it came to responding to my queries. She is such a friendly and bubbly person.Lastly but definitely not the least, Lord Francois van Binsbergen, is the hippest Boss to work for. He gave us the experience of a lifetime, without stealing the show from his tour guide. We weren’t even aware he was the “Boss” until his even bubblier sister told me in secret. A very big Thank you Fransie, it was awesome meeting you and your Sis aswell as Andrew. Thank You for making our “10th Anniversary” so special. We will cherish our “Methode Cap Classique” and think of this experience when we toast a glass.“Au Revoir”Keep having fun, while drink wine!Viola and Eddie Nesmith

Great Tour. Top notch tour from start to finish - five wineries, with different varietals; some wines paired with cheese, some paired with chocolate. Driver/ guide Laurens was very knowledgeable and contributed to the fun atmosphere. The trip included a good lunch with more wine. Highly recommend.

5 star day tour. I don't think you can beat wine flies for a tour of the Stellenbosch wine region. Granwell was a fantastic host and was great at explaining the wine making process - and on this tour, you see a bit of it in action too. The wineries were all fantastic and what makes this tour extra special are the wine and cheese pairings (cheese was amazing!!!) and the chocolate and wine pairing as well. I really enjoyed those. Also, lunch is included in the price and the BBQ lunch was great and very yummy. In the end, we visited 4-5 wineries and that was the right amount! Definitely had had enough wine by the end of the day and was very happy. Great tour company, keep up the good work!

Best tour in CPT. Great day out. Our guide (Granwell) collected us from our hotel and after few other pick ups we were on our way to Stellenbosch. 5 farms all in all ranging from small to massive corporate owned. Wine was excellent, cheese was divine and a great tour operator. Group was just the right amount of people (10) to be enjoyable and personal.Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys wine.

Great tour, lads of fun. Would definitely recommend!. Me and my hubby booked the wine flies tour as part of our honeymoon. From start to finish the day was fantastic! The guide was excellent giving us lots of info on the local region as well as tons of knowledge on the wine making process. The tour visits 5 vineyards with around 6 wine tastings at each. The cheese, chocolate and biltong pairings all add to the experience. Lunch was delicious, the scenery amazing but most of all such a fun group of people from all corners of the globe :)

Brilliantly boozy day out. The antithesis of a snooty wine tour - loved it! Lots of laid back tastings paired with yummy food and like-minded people (if you're youngish, like to think you're still pretty cool and enjoy your wine). We visited five vineyards with Lord Vee and they were all very different but each great in their own way. Don't miss Fairview for the homemade goat's cheese or Lovane for the best reds! An excellent value day out and the perfect way to explore the Stellenbosch wine region.

Best experience. We went on a scheduled wine tour the 30th of December, G-man were our wine Lord, his personality made everyone feel so relaxed, we were a large group of 24. G-man had so much insight and made the trip so enjoyable. They were on time when picking us up, and after the whole day of drinking wine and sparkling wine, cheese tasting, and a lovely meal at Middelvlei wine farm, they dropped us off. Everything was just awesome! Thank Wine Flies and G-manBen

So Much Fun...gone on 3 tours with them!. After three tours with Wine Flies, I realized that a review was definitely overdue! Wine tours with Wine Flies aren’t quiet, relaxed and slow… more exciting, fun and cool. I experienced different levels on each of my trips—it definitely depends on the group you go with—but all three have been awesome. I have done their traditional tour twice (they were slightly different both times, which I appreciated) and their Wine & Whales tour once. The team focuses on good wine, not big overly-commercial estates, so you go off the beaten “tourist bus” trail. They throw in biltong (dried meat) and chocolate pairings with some wineries—and a few other small surprises too! The Whales tour was really cool because we went to some fairly far-off wineries that most people miss on the typical Stellenbosch area tour—but some of the wineries we went to on this tour are favorites of my local Cape Town friends (and now mine!), so you know they are good.The most special thing about a tour with Wine Flies is the people—Riaan and Granwell were phenomenal hosts and guides—very well versed in wine (could answer any question I had) but more importantly, they were just plain awesome guys—so funny and friendly to everyone on the tour. Sune was also fabulous—she organized our bookings flawlessly every time—and even joined one of our tours! As an American living in Cape Town, I’ve brought 3 different groups of visiting friends on a Wine Flies Tour—and they all raved about the day! I have another group coming in April/May and I’m already including it in our itinerary!

Much Fun. My wife and I did the tour with Riaan and it was awesome. First off Riaan is very knowledge and really fun to hang out with.All the farms were great stops with great wine and great cheese from Fairview. I highly recommend doing a wine tour with Wine Flies.

Fantastic day out. We went on the wine tour with Lady Sune and Lord Riaan. Both were extremely informative and were absolutely brilliant from the time Lady Sune picked us up until we were dropped off. Fairview is very pretty, and the goats are a sight! I love their cheeses and their breads and wine were fantastic. Particular highlights were drinking wine straight from the barrel at lunch and meeting Hempies Du Toit! What a legend. His port is a must try We all throughly enjoyed the day out.
Terrific. Tour was excellent, and the guide was fantastic. Highly recommend. Participants were mainly young people (20s/early 30s), everyone finished drunk and very happy.

Amazing tour. Went for the tour on the 28th of December 2014 and it was teriffic. Me and my husband were clue less about wine but we came back very knowledgable. The tour guard was so sweet, humble and he answered all questions asked.

Fantastic and fun. Riaan was an absolutely brilliant wine Lord. Incredible day in winelands. Totally worthwhile and great value for money. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a fun, educational day out. As the only locals it gave us great insight to the market. Go with a group of friends to make the day so much more fun

Authentic and original experience. It is generally the guide that makes or brakes the tour and in our case Lourence did a fantastic job explaining the history of the Stellenbosch and Paarl wine regions and how the Dutch and French Hugenots came to grow wine in the part of the world. Fascinating.We toured Fairview, Muratie, Middelvlei, Lovane (chocolat) and lastly Vergenoegd estates with a braai at Middelvlei. We had our kids (11, 13 yrs old) with us and they were kept reasonably occupied by the animals at Middelvlei during lunch. Little reduction (100 Rand only) of tour price given for kids, bit of a disappointment. Costs per adult 650 Rand.Well done Lourence! Full day activities from 08.30 am pick up through to 17.00pm drop off at your B&B or backpackers motel.

Poor. This is the email, I wrote to them:Dear wine flies,my friend Burghart and I took part on the wine trip on dec. the 16th.To say it first: W is a very nice tour guide.The selection of wine farms was cool, BUT:1. Fairview: only the simpliest wines to taste - poor!!2. Villiera: they are famous for their bubblies, only one of five possible to taste - shame!!!3. don't remember the name: 1 (one) bottle of wine for 13 (!) peoplefor lunch- incredible!!!4. don't remember the name: first and only Zulu winemaker - respectbut room without window and nobody to guide us through (the poor woman that filled the glasses had no tallent to entertain)made it a weired cave experience. ??????????5. Annandale: the best you could do. Cool Hempy, cool Pierre, best wines.!!!!!!So 1:4, not so cool!Is there so little money in the tour, that you have to do it like this?MarcPS The wine that was given with the quiz was so bad, nobody drank it

Highlight of our Capetown stay. A wine trip during our 1 week in Capetown was one of our must do's and we were so happy we picked Wine Flies as its the best tour we have ever done!!! Our guide was Lourens. He provided heaps of interesting information about each of the vineyards and wines without being boring or textbook-like. The day trip we did was also fantastic value for money. The group was a great size (12) from all around the world so its nice to be able to compare travel & wine notes from all over the place. There were some kids on the trip with us - they were really lovely, but we weren't expecting kids on a wine tour.

A fantastic day out. . Went on this trip 8th December. Lord V was our guide and was a superb host. Some of the best wines ever were sampled (and bought) and the cheese and chocolate tastings (not together) were delicious. Met some great people on this tour from across the globe. You would be taking a gamble by not going with these guys. Top marks.

Not just tasting. Granwell (or Lord G) was a wonderful guide through the wine country of Stellenbosch and Paarl. He made sure we not only appreciated the wines we were tasting, but also how they are made and the history of the area. The cheese at Fairmont was an additional highlight. It's a full day of tasting and experience, and it's very worth it.

Learnt all the ins and outs about wine. Tasted some of the best I have ever had all with so much fun and laughter!. It was worth every second. Nothing needs to change about this adventure. Met so many different people from all over the world (meeting people becomes very easy after some glasses of wine!) Went to some great estates especially the last one and that shiraz!!! And the factory side of producing the wine was fantastic to learn about too! Its a must do activity!

Time FLIES at Wine Flies Tours. This was definitely worth every bit! Really enjoyed the knowledge and charisma/humor of "Lord V" and the places we visited were stunning stunning!! Many wines were tasted, much food was offered and enjoyed and so much was seen and learned on this trip!! I would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to try South African Wines or learn more about wine in general... OR those who just want to drink a lot of wine, haha! Thank You Wine Flies!

Granwell is the Man!. One of the best tours I have been on while travelling. We had an awesome group, which definitely helped the experience, and LordG was a great guide. He gave us the ins and outs of the wine process and how to better taste the delicious products. Having the paired tastings, one with cheese and one with chocolate, really helped to identify how foods affect the flavor of the wine. Highly recommend for anyone looking to get a sampling of great local wines.

Great tour!. We did the five winery tour while on vacation in Cape Town. Our driver and tour guide was Lord G, and he was excellent! He really made the tour both fun and educational, with just the right amount of time spent at each winery. It was 11 people in our tour, and we all got along well; low drama and all types of interesting discussions were held. Highly recommended!

Such a Fun Day Out. We went on the all-day wine tour on a Sunday in October. It was so much fun. We met people from around the world and learned a lot about wine making in SA. Our guide was Granwell, aka Lord G. He promptly picked us up from our hotel in Camp's Bay and entertained us throughout the day. He makes the tour really great. Obviously the wine tasting at five different locations is stellar, but Lord G's knowledge and personality made this day superb! We had great wine, no worries about transportation, and were given the luxury of experiencing the wineries and vineyards in a VIP way. I loved this tour and want to do the Wine, Woers, and Whales tour when we visit SA again!

All for wine and wine for all!. This was a really fantastic day out and reasonably priced considering how much was included. We toured 5 different wine farms and were given some sort of snack at each including chocolate, cheese, biltong etc and lunch at one of the farms. I enjoyed the variety of farms that we saw from the small and bespoke such as LovanE and the large commercial ones such as Fairview. I booked this tour through the BIG backpackers in Green Point and I would do it again! No I can taste test wine like a pro!

All day wine drinking. I like wine. So before the tour even began the day was off to a good start. The 5 wineries Wine Flies takes you to - and even the drive in between them - is all insanely beautiful. The wine itself was also great quality. These factors were all brought together by our fun and knowledgable tourguide Granwell, who whilst controlling inceasingly rowdy tourists, still had enough time to have a bit of banter with everyone on the tour! If you only have a couple of days in Cape Town this is a must do. It can also still be enjoyed equally in rain or shine!

Loved it!!. I went on this tour recommended by my hostel in 2012, I decided to review it just now because I recommend this tour to all of my friends travelling to South Africa and have a hard time remembering details. This was one of my favorite parts of South Africa, the guides are very knowledgeable and friendly, had so much fun, the winery's they take you to have a wide variety from small to historic to grandeous, I ended up shipping 24 bottles of wine home. Also enjoyed the quiz at the end of the tour hope you were listening :) great way to have fun make friends and have amazing wine

A must-do in Cape Town. I booked this tour through my hostel in Cape Town and it was worth every penny. The guide was fantastic and really knowledgeable. What is included in this tour makes it incredible value for money as you visit 6 vineyards with tastings in each and it also includes an excellent braai for lunch. I feel like this tour also allowed us to visit some vineyards that would not have been open to the usual visitor and to really understand the variety of wines on offer throughout the region.I will definitely do this tour again when i am back in Cape Town.

Don't miss this Wine tour. I booked this wine tour and it was just great. Cool people, a great and knowledgable guide and lots of good wine. Had a perfect day. I will definitively join again if I am in back in the Cape Town area.

Fun day. I did a tour with Wine Flies yesterday. It was the five winery wine tour. It was a great, fun-filled day for my friend and I. In our group of eleven we had eight different nationalities: Irish, Russian, American, Canadian, Italian, English, Scottish, and of course our South African, wine-wisdom-filled guide Granwell.All the wineries were beautiful and interesting and they chose a varied assortment for us to visit – from the famous and fancy to the small and rustic. The food (barbecue lunch) was great and we also had a bellyful of cheese at a Fairview tasting. There were chocolates, apricots, biltong, brandy and other little treats throughout the day. And by the end of the trip I had a bunch of new friends and warm blurry memory of a wonderful day. Thanks guys!

Excellent daytrip to learn a lot and have a lot of fun :). If you have the chance, then you must do this trip :) The daytrip with Wine Flies was just perfect. Well organized and a very good structure.We visited 7 wineries (if I remember it right) and tasted around 7 wines at each farm. In the morning a little bit ligther wines and after lunch we went a little bit more into the heavier red wines :)They also matched the wines with food, like at the one farm we tasted wine and cheese and at another we had wine and chocolate....hmmmmRiaan our guide (I hope I spelled it right :)) was a lot of fun and knew everything and answered every question we had. I also really liked that the farms we visited where not just the big, commercial farms, but mostly small, cozy family runned wineries.The average age on the tour (as we know now after the quiz :)) was 37, ranging from 23 to 70. Also the knowing level was quite different. From people who know already almost everything about wine to people who are glad to be able to distinguish between red and white wine :)And this group of all different people made the day so interesting and we all had a lot of fun together and really enjoyed the day :)Thank you so much Riann :)

Fantastic!. What a fantastic day. One of the best wine tours I have been on. Our guide was knowledgeable and energetic. Loved how we started the tour with a guide around a winery and explanation of the wine making process. The wineries we visited were fantastic and had a real 'family owned' feel. Highly recommended.

The Forgotten Route tour was unforgettable!. The Forgotten Route tour was unforgettable! Our tour guide, Riaan was excellent. The first stop was the Kirabo wine estate in Rawsonville where the winemaker gave a refreshing talk on winemaking & blending. Their 1NE (One) & Cupcake wines are lovely and a good buy. The train between Worchester to Matjiesfontein runs past the most beautiful landscape. Once in Matjiesfontein, the Karoo magic took over. The 5 minute bus tour, lamb chops under the Karoo sky, star gazing and the sing-a-long in the pub will be lifelong memories. Next morning stroll through the hotel gardens & a visit to the transport museum and off again to Cape Town. Beautiful scenery through the Keisie & Kogmanskloof regions and the lamb & shin potjie at Oupa Batt's was a highlight and really delicious. The last stop was at a brandy distillery and the only time we felt the day became a bit long. The tour is highly recommended and the team at Wine Flies is doing an excellent job!

Loved our wine tasting tour but others were much younger than we are. My husband booked our wine tour with Wine Flies from the states. It's was very reasonable priced and a lot of fun. I expected a sophisticated group of people on the tour. When we got into the mini van, I almost died. The people ranged from 19 - 60s most of which were younger rather than the 60 age range (my husband and I are in our 60s -- thank god for another couple who were around the same age. Having said that, the young people were fabulous and it was as though we were partying with our children. Granwell, our tour guide, was fabulous. He's extremely knowledgable about wines and a very interesting man. The vineyards that we were taken to were very good and it was a wonderful way for us to sample South African wine.

A Fantastic Day. I would 100% recommend this. We booked this before we went away. They picked us up on time. We went to 5 wineries and our guide was superb, he really knew his stuff. We had some good generous tastings (and sometimes a few extras). The cheese and chocolate was also good, as was the BBQ lunch. A lot of the wineries were quite quirky too which we liked. We had such a fantastic time. Also, even if you have a bit of weird mix of people, by the end everyone is so hammered they all have a good laugh together! Thanks Wineflies!

Best tour day ever!. Hands down the best tour I’ve ever been on! Loved every moment. Full day 7AM pick up – 7PM drop off. This particular tour was called “My Big Fat Whale, Wine & Wors Tour” with stops in Stellenbosch, Grabouw and Hermanus for whale watching! Wine tasting stated before 10AM, but we stopped in Stellenbosch for coffee and cookies before that. Lunch was in a spectacular setting, in a marvelous restaurant (very impressive). We picked up some local boerewors and had a wors braai at our cider tasting. Whale watching in Hermanus was also a treat. We had the best guide ever: Riann! I would definitely book another tour with this company on my future visits to Cape Town. Highly recommended! Thanks for a great day out guys.

Excellent!. 100% recommended! Great wine tour very laid back and unpretentious and very educational and with great wines. We visited 5 wineries all family owned, all spectacular. I have done many wine tours around the world and this is the best one I've done. Louwrens, our guide, was great, very knowledgeable and a lot of fun!Thanks for the great time and happy birthday Louwrens!

Excellent full day wine tour. I just wanted to drop you a note now we are back home to say what an excellent tour we had with you. Myself and Anna were picked up by Granwell on Wed 1st October but the great service didn't just start there - firstly a big thanks to Lady Sune as she was very accommodating with me moving the date of the trip, responded to every email quickly and gave great customer service. Granwell was exactly what every guide should be - fun, knowledgeable, let the group run with things whilst knowing when to reign them in to stay on track to deliver the extensive information he has in that head (and big hat) of his. Our full day trip was truly memorable and it was great the way Granwell got the group interacting and enjoying wine together. I was last in SA 6 years ago and a friend and I drove the garden route, the trip with you guys is undoubtedly a better way to do it and I am recommending you to everyone I know and anyone who is coming to SA to visit. Thank you again for such a memorable day and all the hard work that goes into doing what you do and you do it so well!! Scott & Anna

So much fun!!!. We LOVED this tour! It was a great experience that visited major wineries and ones that were "off the beaten track." The group of fellow tour goers with a fun, exciting group from around the world. Our guide Lowrence was informative, but more importantly, entertaining. This tour is and excellent money value as well. 5 wineries, 20 or so different wines, cheese, chocolate and lunch all included in the bargain price. Highly recommend!!

Wonderful Wine Tour!. We had a fantastic day exploring the wineries of Stellenbosch with Lord G and Wine Flies Winery Tours. The tour was very relaxed and informative, with lots of generous wine tastings. There was great diversity in wines and vineyards that we visited, and I loved exploring the tastings with the paired cheese and chocolates!

Great fun!. Awesome day out without any of the pretentiousness that comes with some wine tours. Granwell is a great tour guide, a good laugh and really knowledgable about wine. We loved the fact that he also demonstrated how to properly test wine. Going behind the scenes and drinking from the barrel was also a highlight.

3 W's ~ Wine, Whales, Wors. What an amazing amalgamation of "W's". Guided by RiRi (Riaan) who kept us entertained with facts, great stories & music from "the good years". Highly recommended for people with a taste for life (not a Spur punt- a genuine statement ;))

Fun day with Wine Flies. Wine Flies was a very enjoyable day. It was relaxing and easy after being out in the bush. I know nothing about wine and do not really care for it, but was looking for something relatively affordable that would take up a day. Wine Flies was perfect. Our guide Lord G was very knowledgeable. We went to 6 different wineries with a variance of wine. Our group was a lot of fun and everyone ended up going out after the tour. I recommend Wine Flies for young couples and singles. It is a great way to meet people.

The best wine tour I've done in 15 years. I've always made it a point to do a winery tour wherever I travel (if there is one). I've done countless winery tours throughout the years and this definitely is the best. I was supposed to be doing the Stellenbosch with another tour company, but when they ignored my email queries, I decided to leave it to the concierge at my hotel to plan my day trips. And am I glad he picked Wine Flies!We were a full group of 13 (which surprised me since it was a Monday!), with G-man as our Wine Lord. Our group happened to be a young one and it was so much fun learning about wine-making as we toured the wineries in Stellenbosch - almost as much as we had drinking the wines .I've never tasted wine fresh out of the fermenting tanks or from an oak barrel - but G-man made it possible. This was a truly eye-opening experience for me personally, as it made me realise just how much differences there can be when a wine is not ready for bottling versus one that is already retailing on the shelves. We played musical chairs as we moved from one vineyard to another (so everybody knew everybody by the end of the day), and even had an exciting and intense quiz competition as we headed back to Cape Town. G-man even brought us chocolates and biltongs from his personal supplies to enhance our wine-tasting experience - and I have to admit, that this is a first in all the wine tours I've done throughout the years!If you're looking to do a wine tour in Stellenbosch, please do yourself a favour and do it only with Wine Flies. You won't regret it, I promise!

The guide......makes the tour!!!. Firstly our tour guide, I think his name was Louwrens (not sure if I've spelt that correctly), he simply made the day! Nothing was to much trouble, his depth of knowledge and passion for the tour and wine farms really came across in his story telling, facts and great sense of humour! It made me feel completely at ease from the start and made the tour as a whole so much more personable and fun.Choice of farms was excellent and the cheese, chocolates and lunch came at all the right times. It seemed like Louwrens had a personal relationship and connection to each of the farms which made it all the more of a friendly and enjoyable atmosphere! Would I recommend??.......yes, in a heartbeat. If I had more time I would go again. Thanks must go to Louwrens and all the wine farms for their knowledge and hospitality.Anthony

My Big Fat Whale, Wine and Wors Tour. I think this is the most varied tour I've ever been on, and certainly one of the best value for money tours I've ever seen.The full day tour included wineries (with very generous pourings), a small family-run cider business, a butcher that makes traditional bors, a fancy restaurant with spectacular views in the aptly named Heaven on Earth, and to conclude it all - whale watching in Hermanus. The guides were full of fascinating local knowledge and told things from the perspective of the pioneers who first arrived in this part of the world, pointing out old ox-cart trails as we drove along roads with grande vistas. And there were a couple of surprises thrown in too, but I won't mention them....One of the most impressive things for me on such a cheap tour was that Wine Flies seem to have chosen the farms and businesses they work with based on sound ethics. From restaurants that use locally grown foods, to the butcher who only uses the highest quality ingredients, to donating money to whale conservation with each trip. It cost R650 and I really think that price will go up soon as it seems way too good.Our guide even joined us afterwards for some "beer tasting" on Long Street and we had some more fun.

so much character. We had a nice small group that we went in so we had lots of attention from the winery staff and our guide. Our tour guide was witty and laid back, very knowable and informative. The tour was great value for money, the wineries that we went to had beautiful wines and were all different from each other and excellently priced! my day with wine flies was the high light of my trip to Cape Town. I thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone and everyone! even if you are not knowledgeable about wine you will learn a lot and no one is snobby or pretentious. The Braai lunch was so awesome and by the end of the day we were all fast friends. definitely didn't feel like a number or just another tourist. We even got a crash course in Afrikaans so by the end of the day I was greeting and thanking everyone in Afrikaans. Best day ever!

Great Fun and Value Wine Tour. A wonderful full day tour of a number of lovely wine estates passing through some extremely beautiful countryside. Fetched on time by "Lord G" , our extroverted , very friendly and knowledgeable guide who keeps you interested from the moment you step into the bus. Plenty of different wines to be tasted , chocolate and cheeses to eat as well as a truly delicious South African lunch. Learnt a huge amount from G about wine making . Probably not for the "connoisseur" but if you want a fun , no frills no fuss great value tour then this is the one. I am not a wine drinker and I loved it!

Fantastic unpretentious wine tour. Big G was our guide, an extremely knowledgeable and very friendly South African. Saw many of the local vine yards, tasted lots and lots of wines cheese and chocolate. A very fun and unpretentious tour, perfect for the young at heart. Loved every moment.

Great winery tour. Wine Flies gave a great tour of several wineries in the Stellenbosch and Paarl areas near Cape Town. We tried lots of wine, had a delicious lunch and learned a great deal about wine making. The farms were beautiful and historical. The group was small enough that it was very personal, including meeting two wonderful dogs- very large and sweet at the farm where we had lunch.

Wonderful day. We spent a wonderful day in the winelands and visited 5 differenr farms. All the different wines, the food ans pairings as well as the guide made our day very pleasant! Excellent choice to explore the winelands.

So much fun! Great Tour!. This tour was fabulous! We did the wine, whales, and wors tour with Riaan as our guide. We learned a lot about wine and a lot about cape town. This all day event was informative and so much fun! The places we went had really great wine. We visited local wineries and a cider house that had great quality products. We loved that they supported the local places that take pride in making quality over quantity. The place we stopped for lunch was outstanding(lunch was included). Best burger I have ever had. I definitely recommend this tour.

Awesome wine tour!. We got picked up by a really nice southafrican guy and in a bus with about 10 other guests we drove to the wine lands. The guide descriped a lot about capetown and its history and we started with a cheese and wine pairing on the first farm. All the wines on the farms were delicious and the group was fun too! I relly loved it and I can recommend it to anyone who is visiting capetown!

Amazing Experience!. My girlfriends and I spent our day with a great group of locals and fellow travelers and Lauwrens our guide. Lauwrens was very knowledgeable of the wines and a great host taking us through 5 different wine farms. I enjoyed the variety of wines, a tasty farm to table lunch, barrel tasting and the several tasty foods that paired very well with the wines. Our company on the tour made this experience enjoyable as well so glad to share stories and laughs with our van! I would definitely add this to my itinerary if I visit again and will recommend to any friends traveling!!

best possible wine tour. I've taken wine tours in a half dozen countries, and this was by far the best in terms of the amount of information provided by the guide, and the selection and quantity of wines available for tasting. Most experiences I've had, I'll visit five or six houses and taste two or three wines from each. All told, with Wine Flies, we tasted about thirty different wines, paired with a wide variety of cheeses, some chocolate, and some meats. Lunch was delicious, and on a beautiful farm, and there were all sorts of extra treats, like getting to pull immature wines from a variety of casks to taste the differences between them, and a visit to a very high-end boutique winery run by an ex-rugby player for the Springboks. All in all, a great time, and an exceptional value for the money.

Great Tour, False Advertising. We really enjoyed the wine tour. We had a great and knowledgable guide, and the wineries they chose were a great selection of different types. The complaint is in relation to the flyer, which states "endless cheese" and talks of cured meats and chocolate. While there was cheese, it was only about 8-10 little cubes of it at the first winery. The meat was just a sampler of biltong passed around the bus in-between two wineries. The chocolate was a total of 4 small pieces at the last winery. Also, some of the wineries were a little skimpy on the tastings, even though we were buying bottles.

Brilliant day tour. Great first experience of wine tasting; G-man was both knowledgeable and entertaining, and despite not being great wine drinkers, we had a fabulous day. We would definitely recommend this tour to both newbies and more experienced wine drinkers.

One of the best tours in Cape Town to do. I went with them on a wine tour and it was so great. The people we also picked up were so nice and also our tour guide Granwell made the tour a perfect thing to do. There was a lot of wine that we were able to taste and our guide could give us information about everything and answered all our questions. Also I wanted to buy some wine for my familiy, but I did not know which ones. So he helped me and I am pretty sure that my family will like it. The service was perfect. This is a tour that everyone should do. Also the chocolates and cheese during the tastes were great. Had a lot of fun and would do it all the time again. Also there is a little quiz on tour, but just for fun and it brings a lot of fun. So it was really great and I am so happy that I did it.

Fun days, lots of wine!. My wife and I went on this wine tour after reading the great reviews and hearing how amazing the South African wine country was. We had a great time overall. Our group was 13 people and we were each picked up and dropped off at our hotels. Lord Granwell was our guide and he was great. Very friendly, fun and knowledgeable about everything having to do with Wine. The drive out to the first winery was about 1 hour and from there the other wineries were close together - 5 to 15 minutes apart each.We got to visit 5 different wineries in just one day (picked up around 8:30am and dropped off around 6pm). It was a long day, but fun. Stellenbosch is beautiful and the wine at the different wineries was excellent. We got to taste about 6 wines at each winery, so a total of about 30 different wines - red, white, ports and dessert wines. We also got to pair with cheeses and chocolate at some of the wineries. It was great to visit the smaller wineries that are much less frequented by tours - very intimate and personal experience. Lunch was at a great farm/winery and was very good. It was funny how everyone in our group was so quiet in the morning and after all the wine by the afternoon we had quite a rowdy and loud group on the way back. Having 13 people (which is the max for the tour) was a lot. Overall, the value was excellent - price included everything (pickup, drop-off, entrance fees and lunch). If you want to see the winelands of Cape Town, then Wine Flies is a great choice.

So much fun!!. I had the perfect welcome to South African wines through this trip! There is definitely a lot of heavy pouring going on that adds to a memorable day, but the wines are great, our guide (Granwell) was extremely knowledgeable and knew how to create a fun atmosphere, the scenery is beautiful, and the lunch and snacks are delicious. I went by myself and easily made friends and had a really fun time! Highly recommended! And as someone who has done a bunch of wine tours, these wines are really good and the tour is worth the expense!

Book this Wine Tour - NOW!. Several friends and hostel operators recommended Wine Flies, and it did not disappoint. Very professional company, Granwell was a fantastic guide, perfect balance between informational and entertaining. Made some great friends in a short amount of time.

“My BiG FAT WHALE, WINE & WORS Tour!”. SUPERB!!There just is'nt another Word to better describe what a PHENOMENAL day we had.Transported to three beautiful regions of the Cape, STELLENBOSCH ( wine country Capital)GRABOUW ( boerwors and dried meat capital) HERMANUS ( best land based whale watching destination)....we had a day packed with endless wine tasting, food pairing, amazing lunch in the heaven & earth valley and beautiful sceneries of the famous whale watching spot Hermanus. Very Lucky to have done all 3 tours under the Icons of South Africa umbrella and still can not decide which is my favourite :) lots of unforgettable memories , Riaan our guide is nothing but WORLD CLASS.

Highly Recommended. Our host Louwrens was very informative and entertaining and provided lots of interesting tidbits about the city and history of the regions. We visited 5 wineries had a great outdoor BBQ and sampled some cheeses and chocolate paired with wines. It was a great combination of wineries with some more traditional, some more modern and both small and large scales. I would definitely recommend this well-rounded and highly enjoyable excursion.

South Africa Wine Tour. Our recent trip with Wine Flies was absolutely wonderful. We were picked up at our guest house and and we were on our way. Our group was great with people from all over the world. My fiancé and I had such a fantastic day touring all the wineries from different regions in South Africa. Louwrens was very entertaining, accomodating and most importantly he was knowledgeable of all the places we visited. We couldn't have asked for a better experience!
