Wonderful day out. My recent trip through the winelands with wine flies was superb. We had a packed day with Louwrens. Our fascinating group of people and tasted many many different wines at 5 wine estates. The day was wonderful value and a great flavour of different parts of the region. I can't recommend them highly enough. And to top it off they were kind enough to drop me in Paarl, my next stop.

My Big Fat WHALE, WINE and WORS Tour!. Lucky to be one of the first to enjoy this new tour offered by Wineflies. What an amazing experience from wine to cider from Elgin apples to whales to more wine. Definitely a must not only for tourists but also local Capetonians. Thanks Francois, Riaan and Sune

A superb way to spend a day in the Fair Cape!. From start to end we were immersed in fun facts not only on wine making but on the historical features of the towns we past from our awesome guide Lord Louwrens. An educational and fun day out tasting a great selection of reds and whites, cheeses and chocolates. Something for everyone! Thank you Wine Flies :-D

Fantastic way to spend a day. If you like wine, this tour's a must! Sure you can visit most of the vineyards on your own, if you know where to start. Going with these guys though has the advantage that everything is very well taken care of, you can just sit back, relax, drink wine and enjoy. And there's a lot to enjoy. I got the feeling it was going to be a great day the moment I contacted Suné for a booking, as she was already exceptionally friendly and helpful. I wasn't to be disappointed. In a very fun and easy atmosphere, you get insight in the workings of very different vineyards. The vineyards visited are carefully selected to give the full spectrum from boutique to big, white to red, and different processes of wine production. Lots of wines to taste, also with chocolate/cheese pairing, which was really interesting! I learned a lot about wines that day, but in a very fun, entertaining way. Louwrens managed not only to give a lot of info on wines and the Stellenbosch area, but also to create a fun atmosphere and get everyone involved. In short, it's an experience not to be missed! (Even my friend who came with me, despite being the opposite of a wine enthusiast, enjoyed it tremendously).

One of my best times in South Africa. I traveled solo and signed myself up for this tour with Granwell, and it has been one of my most memorable fun experiences in South Africa - definitely in my top three favorites! Granwell is super knowledgeable about wine and having him as the tour guide is just so fun and chill! I was totally relaxed and ready to learn something about wine/wine pairing - and this guy, dude, he can really teach you soooo much! He also kept everyone happy and encouraged a lot of mingling between mini-groups in the same tour. Besides having an awesome tour guide, the scenery along the way through Stellenbosch is just amazingly beautiful, the wineries are all so sophisticated and relaxing, and you got to taste 20+ wines. The transportation includes pick up and drop off, and the included lunch on a beautiful farm (one of my best meals in SA) was also splendid. To sum up in two words: DO IT!

Phenomenal!!. Just spent eight amazing hours with guide Laurent and the most wonderful eclectic group of travelers. I am 55 and went solo as my husband was due to shark cage dive today and thoroughly enjoyed spending time with fellow wine lovers from England, Madagascar, Mozambique, Portugal, Illinois, New Jersey and Singapore. It was a United Nations wine tasting tour to five fab wineries!! We visited rustic Annandale first where Pierre gave us a delightful tasting of four red wines; then we drove past scenic mountain ranges including Stellenbosch mountain to Lovane boutique winery where we tasted five more excellent red wines each with a different chocolate pairing; then to Middelvlei where amidst stunning rolling hills, large dogs, chickens and a wallaby (yes a real wallaby!) we enjoyed a delicious lunch of butternut squash soup, grilled cheese and tomato sandwiches, salad, chicken skewers and beef sausages followed by hot coffee while petting lovely friendly dogs including a huge black Great Dane, a Boer Bull and a little dachshund named Grappa! We had Chardonnay with our lunch as well as a Pinotage/Cab blend followed by a tasting of merlot direct from the barrel. We then drive all around Stellenbosch town viewing the University, the oldest house, lovely churches as we made our way to Villiera winery a young farm where we enjoyed 8 wine tastings of white wine and the South African "champagne" known as MCC "method cap classified" which included some delicious white wines and especially the Chenin Blancs were outstanding! Our last stop was the beautiful Fairview winery where we saw goats, a garden in the shape of the South African flag and polished off our outstanding day with five wines (white and red) paired with superb cheeses. Each winery had it's own unique flavor and the whole day out was so memorable and lovely despite rainy weather. Young or old - if you love wine make sure to take this tour. Very professional and Laurent gave just the right mixture of commentary and info. To all of those on my tour today it was a great pleasure sharing this wonderful day out with you! Thank you Trip Advisor as I would never have found Wine Flies tours without you!! Awesome wine tour :-)

Awesome Big Fat Whale and Wine Tour!. Loved this full day tour with wine, cider and biltong tasting at awesome places you probably wouldn't find on your own and you get the real taste of South Africa. On top of that you drive through beautiful landscapes ending at Hermanus with the Big Fat Whales and the one and only Whale Crier. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and great fun. Thanks, wine and time flies on this tour :-)

More than we hoped for. Our day out began promptly in the moring when Granwell "G-man" our wine lord for the day picked us up where we were staying. A couple more pickups after us and we were on our way to Stellensbosch. G-man was the whole package: driver, guide, and wine expert. He clearly knew his stuff. It was truly a great day despite the tropical storm like conditions. After our third winery and lunch things started to cheer up more when the sun started to peek out. After the last winery we were welcomed back to Cape town with the most gorgeous rainbow! We visited a total of 5 wineries and each was great, and each was different in some way. One place had cheese pairings, more than one place we had a full tour of the cellar even sipping straight from one of the barrels, one place we had brandy, one place we had lunch. Some places were big, some were small, some were very small, but each was well chosen and together made for a great day! Obviously a group of strangers who all chose to go wine tasting all day are bound to become fast friends, especially when drinking brandy and coke on the way home! You'll have a great time on this tour!Heads up if you have allergies: one of the wineries we visited has a tasting room cat, and another had a few very friendly dogs. I loved both of these places as an animal lover, but someone else on our tour had a cat allergy which did not go over so wel for him. Thanks Wine Flies! Highly recommend!

Full of fun. We had a great day on this wine tour with Granwell. He is really knowledgable about all aspects of wine making and the tour is a great mix of food (including a delicious cheese tasting/wine pairing and a yummy lunch) and all sorts of winesThis was not pretentious at all but we certainly didn't get raucously drunk at the first winery either. They ease you into the day and by the end you are all best friends drinking brandy on the way home!Totally recommended. Five stars

Couldn't Be Better. I read a few reviews of wine tours in the Western Cape and chose Wine Flies. I love it when I am right! It was a good tour in all respects -- informative, fun, well-paced, complete, and priced just right (approx. $60. U.S. per person). I was picked-up at my hotel on-time, and we were on our way for a narrated tour to Winelands. Our group of seven ranged from backpackers to a retiree (me). Everyone got along from the start, thanks in no small part to our friendly driver, Riaan. We started at a larger, big-distributor sort of place to get a soup-to-nuts tour of state-of-the-art wine-making. Then we tasted some wines -- the first of many tastes. Another taste was at a sizeable winery featuring cheese pairings as well. The remaining wineries of the day were smaller, family operations. We ended at very small places that you would not likely find on your own. Riaan made sure we got a good taste of the offerings, starting with some bubbly in the morning and a nightcap of local brandy before he bundled us back into the minivan. This is a perfect tour if you want a range of tastings, an excellent day in the country-side (including a vineyard/farmstead lunch), and a friendly (not snobby) attitude toward wine. Be prepared to sip conservatively (or spit) or you will consume a LOT of wine.

Best Winelands Tour Ever. We had a brilliant day with Wine Flies from beginning to end! We were picked up on time and the journey was comfortable. Granwell is full of fun and very knowledgeable about the different wines, how they are made and how to drink them. All the snacks were delicious and the braai was very tasty - absolutely delicious chicken kebabs! I would recommend them 100%!Ed and Heather from Via Volunteers

Great day out. What a great way to spend a day in the Cape wine lands. A completely unpretentious fun trip. We sampled a good deal of wine of varying qualities and had a laughter-filled trip. The experts were helpful and some of the wines, particularly at the Annandale vineyard were superb. We had such a great day that a number of us who had just met on the tour bus hooked up for dinner to carry on the fun. Give it a go.

Down to earth, good fun. Wine Flies aims to take pretentiousness out of wine and achieves this with style. Our beautiful guide Louwrens made the day informative and interesting. He provided valuable insight not only into wine and the SA wine industry but was also a great resource for SA social history and culture - a real credit to the Wine Flies team.Feeling delicate from a previous night out, I was unable to sample many of the wines but can vouch for the quality of what I did have. Having done wine tours in France, Spain, Australia and NZ, this ranks as one of the best. Where else can you see a goat in a tower, kiss a (dead and stuffed) springbok and meet a rugby legend. Epic.

Great value, not to be missed!. A really great tour- we visited 5 wineries and got plenty of information in each, as well as a lot of wine to try! Also included was cheese tasting, chocolate and a fabulous lunch with wonderful scenery! Extremely good value and lots of fun.

Awesome wine tour for down-to-earth people. I went on this wine tour at the end of May and had a wonderful time. The guide, Granwell, was awesome, full of information, outgoing, and entertaining. We had a great group-mostly young people 20's-30's and a few middle-aged women in our group- and very diverse, coming from New Zealand, Australia, Holland, and the US. The wineries were all very unique. My favorites were Fairview, where they pair wine and cheese and the last stop with a rugby player's personal vineyard. It was a very relaxed atmosphere, not a "stuffy" wine tour. It lasted all day an included a lot of wine!! The mid-day meal was also very delicious and the animals there were very cute, including some nice dogs walking around. I highly recommend this tour!

Time flies when you're having fun with Wine Flies. This was my second trip with Wine Flies and once again I was highly impressed with their ability to professionally guide us through the history, culture and tasting of some of the best wines I have had in a long time, whilst still maintaining an element of fun. I would strongly recommend touring with them if you have a day off in the Cape. It will change your life!

Great tour. Terrific all day tour of a range of wine producers, from the large commercial to the one man operation where all the grapes are hand picked and lovingly turned into wine. Includes cheese tasting and lunch. Many other nibbles along the way to go with the type of wine being tasted. Great guide and a fun filled day.

Exceptional!. Our guide, Gramwell, was outstanding. This was a great wine tour! Our guide was great, the vineyards were interesting and the wine was so delicious. Do this wine tour! You'll be sorry if you don't!

Great day trip!. What a wonderful day out! Highly recommended if you are visiting Cape Town. Even if you are not a wine lover, you'll still have great fun, lots of laughs and you'll learn a lot. We were taught how to compliment wine with certain foods (there is yummy biltong and chocolate involved!!) , had the most divine lunch and then onto the last two wines farms which are amazing and well worth the wait. We had Lord Granwell as our guide who is superb and really knows his stuff! Thanks Wine Flies!

Loved it!. This wine tour was so much fun! I learned a lot and met some really great people. G-Man was knowledgeable, informative and entertaining. We went to five different wineries and had a good lunch. However, since we went on a Sunday, the winery that they normally have the brandy tasting at was closed, so we drank it at the end on the trip back to Cape Town. So - if you're really looking forward to that, don't schedule your tour on Sunday.

unforgettable experience. We had the most amazing time on this day out. The wine and cheese tasting, then wine and more wine. Our guide Laurent, was so friendly and funny . He played good music all the way and shared his Biltong with us. We bought 3 bottle of wines , we liked them so much. At the end Wine flies was part of a Poyke competition that we were invited to, free food and beer and socializing. it was great. we promise if we come back to return to them because they gave us an unforgettable experience and feeling of true cape town friendship all in one day. Thanks Laurent!!!

great day out. We did the wine tour in May with Granwell, who was an absolutely great guide, extremely knowledgable and a great host. We visited five vineyards, each different, and learnt a lot about wine production. Tasting different wines with different cheeses was great, also the chocolate with wines good.Lunch was brilliant.Mostly white wines in the morning, and reds after lunch.Great wines and great fun.If you want to enjoy wine tasting ( also port and brandy ) go with Wine Flies, a great day .

Awesome Wine Flies Tour. With this not being my first Wine Tour, I can truely say, this was the BEST guided wine tour.Our tour guide, lord G really did an awesome job in explaining it all to us and made us all feel welcome and the trip enjoyable. This was truely a great experience. The fact that everything (tastings of wine, chocolate, chease & a lovely lunch) is included in the price you pay, just makes it so much more worth it.We were a great group from all over the world, and me and my partner really enjoyed it and were impressed with the quality of service delivered.A truely awesome experience!! I would recommend Wine Flies to anyone.

Unforgettable Forgotten Route tour by Wine Flies. My boyfriend and I did the Forgotten Route overnight tour and I can't recommend it more highly, whether you've lived in Cape Town for years or are planning a visit to the region. The tour began in Greenmarket Square and continued with a walk through the Company's Gardens, during which our guide Riaan gave us a brief history of Cape Town and pointed out interesting architecture that most locals would never have noticed.From there we were driven to The Kimberley Hotel for a refreshment stop and then hit the road to begin our journey to the Karoo. The first day of the tour takes you to Kirabo winery for a wine and cupcake tasting (you can buy great value wines and experience family hospitality when you do the tasting), after which we boarded the train at Worcester to take us to Matjiesfontein. Well, actually, there was a bit of a delay in the train arrival, but rather than leave us languishing on the platform we were whisked off to a local pub and then back to the station in perfect time to hop aboard the train. You eat lunch on the train with beautiful scenery drifting past and can either take a nap (as some of the more sensible members of our tour did) or shoot the breeze with fellow group members, or retire to your cabin if you're not feeling that social. We arrived in Matjiesfontein and were checked into our rooms at The Lord Milner Hotel, after which we did probably the world's shortest (and funniest) red bus tour of the "town" (which is about two blocks long by two blocks long). While Riaan cooked us lamb chops on the braai for dinner, our group hung out in the hotel bar mingling, singing, dancing and having a good time to the sounds of live piano music. After a fantastic dinner you do a tour of one of the local museums (at night, spooky!) and then have the option of hitting the sack or heading back to the pub.Day two started with a great breakfast at the hotel, after which Riaan took us on a walking tour of the transport museum and the town itself. From there we departed in our tour bus back towards Cape Town, stopping along the way at a local graveyard, followed further along by an amazing home made lunch at Oupa Batt's shop (they also have the best biltong and dried fruit and we all stocked up with bags of both). After lunch we visited Kingna brandy distillery for a tasting (brandy lovers should make sure they budget so they can stock up on these superb brandies that are probably a third of the price of brandies from other distilleries that are equivalent in quality). From here we headed home to Cape Town through (more) beautiful scenery.The whole tour was so much fun, with Riaan keeping everyone's momentum going as well as providing us with loads of interesting history about all of the spots we visited. The best thing about the tour is that although you are part of a group, you can either revel in the fact of having a designated driver and go for that second (or third) glass of wine, or you can take things at a more moderate pace, anything goes and everyone was made to feel included and like they belonged by Riaan's hospitality. You could do the tour alone, with family, a partner or a bunch of friends, and have as much fun either way. What is more, it is amazingly good value for a two day tour, and that's coming from a local South African. If you live in Cape Town, do this tour, and if you're planning a visit to Cape Town, factor this in when making up your itinerary, you'll remember the experience for years to come.

Cannot Miss This Tour!. If you are interested in going to the famous wine lands of South Africa/Cape Town region, you cannot miss this tour with Wine Flies. We visited 5 absolutely beautiful wine lands, tasted the most amazing wines & cheese I have ever had, and on top of it all - our driver and our guide (brothers) were outstanding. I learned so much about wine, the process, the tasting that I had never dreamed of! These guys were incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about what they do. Funny guys too! Oh and I can't forget to mention the delicious BBQ lunch we had, wow that food was awesome!! I couldn't imagine going to the Cape wine lands with any other tour company. Thank you Wine Flies for an amazing tour!

Great day out!. A wonderful day trip to experience some of South Africa (possibly the world's) best wines! This full day trip takes you to 4 vineyards, teaches you the process of wine making and tasting in a fun and non-pretentious way! I went as a solo traveller but was made to feel so welcome and made some great friends.If a day of wine, method cap classique (like champagne) and braai isn't enough we all went for beer after.Such a fun day, would really recommend it!

Lots of wine!. Great tour! Included 5 wineries. Note that first few are white wines and later ones are only red if planning to buy. Cheese tasting was great, loved having seconds! Lunch was also filling. Guide (Granwell) was great and laid back, and gave us a lot of great wine tasting tips. He was good at gauging what the group wanted to make sure everyone had fun. The samples seem a bit slow at the beginning but be patient, it’s definitely enough by the end of the day!

Wonderful Day Spent in Cape Town's Wine Country. My friends and I had a wonderful day in Cape Town's wine country with Wine Flies. Our guide Gramwell was quite knowledgeable about the wine making process, as well as the five different estates that we visited. The wine that we sampled was delicious, as well as the chocolate and cheese pairings, and our midday meal. I would highly recommend this company to anyone who desires to have an authentic wine tasting experience at a very reasonable price.

Wine, food, fun!. A fabulous, non-stuffy approach to wine tasting. Great wines ( and 'champagne') , cheese, biltong, chocolate in the company of new friends with a great commentary in a lovely place, finished off nicely with a drink in town. I'd recommend this tour to lone travellers and groups, all are made to feel welcome and I'll definitely book again when I come back to Cape Town, thanks 'Lord Riaan' for a memorable day and the introductions to some superb wines that are just getting over the shock of travelling home!

Great fun, even if solo. I was in Cape Town for work and found Wine Flies here on Trip Advisor. Despite joining the tour solo, I met some great people, had fab wine, cheese, chocolate, brai, and more. The transition from mega vineyard to boutique craft vineyards was great. I was able to try amazing and unique wines with people from India, South Africa, Sweden, and the US. I highly recommend Wine Flies flying solo or in a group!

Most enjoyable, value for Money in Cape Town!. I highly recommend including this activity with Wine Flies in your CT trip. It was a lot of fun, well organised, interesting and also a great way to meet others. Riaan, our guide, was brilliant! Really made our weekend in the Cape. I felt it was value for money as a once off payment included so many tastings and a full on lunch. Brilliant day!

One of a Kind Tour. I had a really nice time on this tour and loved the friendly, welcoming vibe with no pretentiousness. We got to see some beautiful wine farms and I particularly enjoyed visiting Lovane and Annandale. You learn so much more visiting these smaller, family run farms than you would the larger, commercial farms and the experience is certainly far more memorable.The value is incredible! We got to taste so many wines, sample some cheese, chocolate, and biltong, and have lunch.I have to say I was a little disappointed with our guide -- I'm so sorry I forget his name! He was friendly and easy to talk to, but he was around 2 hours late to pick us up and sometimes his information sounded a bit "scripted". He was very apologetic and I understand these things happen sometimes, but this just didn't start our day the way we would have liked. Once we began the tour, things moved along quite well, but I think because of the initial delay we had to rush through some of the farms. It would have been nice to have been able to take some more time to explore them a bit.We toured on Good Friday which was a holiday, so some of the farms they normally visit were closed. When I originally booked I completely forgot this was a holiday and I may have considered booking the tour for a different day had I remembered because we didn't get to do a cellar tour and the spot we went to for lunch was okay. Our guide improvised well though and we still got to visit 5 farms.Despite the hiccups of our tour, I would recommend Wine Flies. I just kind of wish we had booked on a different day. The experience is certainly one of a kind!

Unexpected and Informative : Lord Riaan's Fruity Wine B******!. Upon booking this tour I was slightly worried - another boring wine tour. Being native to Cape Town the last thing I wanted was for a bus driver to stop at commercialized wine farms with no character. I was pleasantly surprised to see Riaan (or Lord Riaan) showing up at the hotel that I work at to pick me up for the day tour. There was no pretentiousness and he was very warm and welcoming. We picked up several other traveler from around the globe and we headed off for our day of excitement. A day of excitement may be an understatement - it was the most fun I've had in ages! Riaan is a wine expert so there was no rambling on about uninteresting facts, but rather well informed discussions with the group. We visited lesser-known farms and we were provided with an authentic experience. My favorite was the lunch stop at Middelvlei where we had a traditional South African Braai and Annendale where the person who conducted the tasting was informative and relaxed. Make sure to have a big breakfast since there is a lot of wine tasting and very little to eat - this was my fault of course for not having breakfast. I will suggest adding something more to nibble on than the biltong, dried fruit and chocolates. Something in the car (including water!) would have been appreciated. All in all the best wine tasting experience Ive had and I will gladly recommend this to anyone. It is best suited for a younger crowed and single travelers (you meet alot of people).
Best wine tour. Off the beaten path and 'get close and personal'. Best wine tour I have been on. Do it and don't regret it. Book online, the email communication with the was great.

Best wine tasting trip. Wine Flies is the best one can imagine for a wine tasting tour. The tour includes absolutely interesting vineyards and wine cellars. The first-timer that I was in South Africa, found the tour leader quite knowledgeable about the local history and the wine making.

Not Enough Cheese. Don't get me wrong -- my husband and I really enjoyed this tour and highly recommend it. Our guide was garrulous and energetic. He imparted an enormous amount of information, though his knowledge of French champagne was a little fuzzy. We did learn a lot about winemaking, saw absolutely beautiful scenery and had fun. The website however is misleading - I love pairing cheeses with different wines, and we did this at the first winery, however nothing to snack on at the second with the "champagnes" which were very disappointing in quality. The 3rd place was our lunch, very nice. The 4th and fifth, no cheese, nor anything else to nibble either. So , they say "Endless cheese tasting" -- this is false. So if you're reading this Wine Flies, give your guests a little bit more.

Superb. We had a private tour with Wine Flies and were not disappointed. We were able to visit 5 vineyards and sample wines, ports, brandies and cheeses at a leisurely pace as well as having a tasty lunch included in the day.A special shout out to our guide Lourens who was very friendly, passionate and knowledgeable about the wonderful wines sampled throughout the day. Cheers!Philip
Awesome. Learnt so much, and a lot of fun. Our guide (feel awful as i cant remember his name but he is the big guy in the black hat) was brilliant. !!Highly recommend it Peter

Fantastic private wine tour experience. We had a private full day wine tour with Louwrens, our guide extraordinaire. He picked up right on time from our hotel in Cape Town then we were off to the wine country, namely Stellensboch and Franschhoek. Louwrens was extremely knowledgeable, both about the Cape Town and the surrounding area as well as the process of making wine and the different things we should pay attention to at the tasting. We had such a great time with him and focused primarily on all small, family run wineries where he seemed to be well acquainted with the staff as well the wines they produced. Highly recommended!

Excellent Wine Tour. We used trip advisor to look for a wine tour with good reviews, and that is why we book Wine Flies , We didnt regret it , it was such a nice day out visiting different wine farms around two main wine states. In the first one they show you how the process of making wine takes place and the tour guide gives you some advice on how to taste a wine and what properties to look at , there are different options of wine to taste in each farm so you will feel satisfied. In The second wine farm we had the opportunity to do wine and cheese pairing this is also really good, the place is called Farmview and has a really cool decoration you could also buy cheese , pastries , olive oil , marmelade. We had lunch in the third farm in the open the food was good and the views fantastic , I really enjoyed it. After lunch we visited 2 more farms and tasted more wine, the good thing about these farms are that they are small and family owned so they are very traditional and their wines are not mass produced or commercial , what i think makes them more exclusive perhaps. I recommend this tour as it is a good day out visiting different farms , tasting different wines , buying wine to take home , enjoying the views as we drive through the farms, it is a whole experience.

Honeymoon wine tour. We had the pleasure of spending the day with Lord G in January. Could not have asked for anything more. Were looked after perfectly throughout the day. Ten of us on the tour mainly backpackers. Swapping seats allowed us to talk to all and a welcome opportunity for the group to bond. Five wineries in total including drinking sparkling wine at 10am. The lunch was a very nice farmhouse, homecooked meal with more wine. Tasting out of the barrel was a highlight. Lord G was very knowledgeable and passionate about wine as well as a great host. We found this a better alternative to the more rigid tours in terms of price, enjoyment and that lunch was included not an extra. Highly Recommended!

You must do this wine tour!. This was the best wine tour I have ever done. We were looked after by the team at Wine Flies right from the start of booking the tour online, till the end when we choose to get dropped off in a different location (than originally planned) in Cape Town. The tour guide is fun, full of facts and information and was genuine. We had a wonderful time, learned a lot and met some lovely people. I recommend Wine Flies as it is fresh and seems to know how to run a great tour really well. Below the options ask what type of visit this tour is, we went as a couple, but all options (family 18+/friends/going solo) apply.

Fantastic Wine Tour. We joined a tour of 10 people in total. My wife and I are 60 and the other 8 were all young ladies under 30 so we were a little concerned but "no worries", we had a blast! The tour is one of the most reasonably priced tours we found. It included 5 wineries with extensive tasting as well as cheese and chocolate pairings. It also includes a BBQ, all you can eat, lunch which was great! Our guide, Louwrens, was fun and very knowledgeable. This was a full day tour picking us up at our hotel at 0830 and dropping us off at 1800 and was priced lower than many half day tours that don't include lunch. Fantastic value and experience! Highly recommended!

A memorable day out. What a day that was ! visited 5 estates. Got good food and lots of in depth explanation about wine making, South Africa's history and culture and a great and very passionate guide (Granwell) who's very knowledgeable. Memorable moments with the whole group and lots of loughs. The tour is perfectly organized, there is just nothing negative to say ! Just, thank you !

Best wine tour ever. We've been on several wine tours around the world (California, Germany, France, South Africa), but this one was head and shoulders above the rest. We visited 5 estates, which were all very different to one another - from the larger commercial to a couple of little boutique ones. This gave a great variety of experiences and also of wine styles. In total we tasted 22 wines (I think because I lost count), often pairing them with foods such as cheese, biltong, and chocolate. The guide was friendly, knowledgeable, and funny - and he made the day special. The tour also included lunch, and a few drinks on the way back to Cape Town - just in case we hadn't had enough during the day. We came up with a little rhyme to sum the day up.Eight tourists went up to PaarlThought wine tasting was a ballThey started at 9By lunch they were fineBut by 5 they were starting to fallOverall and excellent day out, and fully recommended to anyone who likes wine.

Enjoyed the experience from start to finish. We spent a day with Wine Flies Wine Tours and got a very nice experience with both educational elements (early in the day) and got to taste all kinds of wine, and even some cheese and chocolate pairings, not to mention a few interesting sights as we were driving to the different locations. Food stop at the farm was as good as the company - excellent! Highly recommended!

Really awesome day. Just had an amazing day out with Granwell, saw some great places, tasted some great wines and met some great people. Highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to have a great time in the Cape.

Amazing time. We booked our wine tasting trip with Wine Flies due to the really good reviews on here and we werere not disappointed. Granwell was our Wine Lord and was great company from the moment we jumped in the minibus. We lost count how many farms we visited but i believe it was 5/6. The wine tasting was great and informative. Granwell was extremely knowledgeable and gave us a great understanding on how wine was produced and how to distinguish different wines. We had a great lunch at one of the farms in the company of some huge (but friendly) dogs. We cannot express how pleased we were with Wine Flies and Granwell, who made our day with his warm and friendly personality and being an all round nice guy. Thank you, Tom and Francesca.

Wine tours of all wine tours!!. Brilliant day! Brilliant wine and company. The mix of knowledge, education and pure fun was great! Loved the chance to visit some of the beaten track wine yards - and the wines got better and better through out the day. The combination with cheese and chocolate tasting was a nice touch!As somebody else wrote - if you are looking for a wine tour - this is the one to pick!!!Wine lords - keep up the good work and spread the SA wine knowledge around the world!:-)

I want to do it all over again!!!. The Wine Flies wine tour was brilliant. It was such fun - our tour guide Louwrence was so friendly and entertaining (he knew so many interesting facts about wine but also the wine-lands and Cape Town). The day was full of surprises and the wine was divine!

Absolutely fantastic! . Couldn't recommend this wine tour highly enough, it was brilliant. Our tour guide Riaan was so knowledgeable and fun, he taught us a lot about wine and how to taste it. You can tell this guy loves his job. The wineries and wine tasted along the way were all top notch. Worth every cent, thanks for a great day!

Mad Hatter Day in The Winelands!!. Off the wall day trip to a commercial and many off the beaten track family owned wine estates. Riaan was an absolute scream and a fountain of knowledge to boot!!! Do yourselves a favour - recommended.

Unforgettable tour - thank you Granwell!. Our winelord Granwell was not only extremely knowledgable - we learned a lot about the history and culture of South African wines - but also fun, relaxed and friendly. He organised an excellent selection of vineyards with fantastic wine tastings. Highly recommendable!! A great Cape town getaway.

Hands Down the Best Tour Ever!!!. I was the lucky one this tour as some poor sod backed out at the last minute and I happened to be on the backup list...Luck for me! From the instant I was picked up Lord G eased me into the group (being the only American.) Great Hospitality during all 5 tours! The other reviews posted say it all so no need for me to repeat. I will say on tour I happened to be on, I think we went into overtime for about an hour and a half to two hours but Lord didn't care...seemed he was having as much fun as us. In fact we all ended up having an after party (the whole group) later that evening as we did not want it to end!!!

Worth the time to see the Wine Farms. Had a great trip with Lord "G" he was very informative and allow us to ask questions and tried to pace us as much as possible. My husband loves wines but even he had a hard time tasting so many wines. We must of had at least 35 different wines to taste averaging 4-5 per stop! We had a lovely family from So. Africa on our trip and they made it even more fun. We had cheeses, choc pairings with wine all very good. The only thing I would recommended to make it better is that the Lords offer guest crackers, bread and water in between wine farms as in our case we started at the first wine farm at 10am and didn't have lunch till about one. So I suggest you bring a snack. As I bought bread at the 4 th wine farm that had something to sell. It gets a little hard just drinking wine with no snack. But overall, I would highly recommend!

The Best Wine Tour!. This was a highlight during our 11 day trip to South Africa. From the moment we were picked up to the time we were dropped off we wouldn't have changed a thing.Lots of fun, great selection of wineries (5 in total), stunning lunch location, and actually managed to learn a thing or two about wine. Lord G definitely helped make the day a success.I have been to Napa, Burgundy France and have done wine tours in both of these locations. Wine Flies is just as good and probably even better than these.

Absolutely fabulous!!!. None of the other wine tours comes close.None ever actually taught me how to experience and taste wine till Lord Riaan and Lord Francois van Binsbergen showed us the way. Was an awesome day out.

I can't recommend this trip highly enough!!. Took the Wine, Cheese & Chocolate tour, with Lord Riaan on a Sunday. Easy booking & good communications from the UK.From the moment we were picked up to the moment we were dropped back off in the evening, we had a right laugh.Riaan is a top bloke, very funny & more importantly, he has a total passion for wine. His knowledge is incredible & we learnt so much about wine tasting of wine & more importantly the drinking of wine!Same itinerary as others have detailed before. Beautiful scenery, great wine farms & some really interesting & delicious wines, fantastic cheeses to compliment & a nice BBQ lunch.If you like wine, book with these guys, it was a fantastic day at a reasonable cost.

Cheese, chocolate and wine!. Lord Riaan was our guide and from the moment he picked us up we knew this was going to be a fun day! He is very friendly, funny and has such a passion for wine. We went to 5 different estates and all were so unique in their own way. We first started with Champaign, then onto cheese pairing, then lunch, chocolate for dessert and finished with brandy! Oh, and tons of wine, even straight from the barrel! What an amazing recommendation from our hostel! Book with Wine Flies...you won't regret it!

A total experience in South Africa. If you are a bit bored with the scala of daytours on offer in Cape Town, and get the feeling that all those tour companies have the same repertoire: go with Wine Flies ! ! ! Those guys make it their business to do things a bit differently. I went on their Forgotten Route trip on 22 november, and it was my best 2 days of an already fantastic week around Cape Town. Lord Riaan jampacked our tour with tidbits of culture, biltong, landscape, dried apricots, local history, cricket stories, biltong, oldfashioned trains, a homely waterblommetjie lunch, singing around the old piano in the pub, great lamb chops from the braai, stargazing in the beautiful and quiet Karoo night. To name just a few of the things we did. It is jolly, it is authentic, it is beautiful, it is tasty, it is festive, it is highly original. GO !
Best wine tour experience. Wine flies was amazing!! Well done! Very friendly & well prepared staff!! Baie dankie Rian & Francios (Jacques) :D

An unforgettable day!. I went on a tour with Wine Flies a few days ago, and I must say it was one of the best days I've had in SA so far! Our guide was just awesome, full of energy and knowledge about wine making and tasting. I was also quite impressed with the quality and the quantity of wine we tasted. This day was memorable also because I got to meet lovely people from all over the world and share drinks with them during the whole day. I would definitely recommend Wine Flies to anyone wishing to know more about South African wines while enjoying a great day!!! Thanks again Wine Flies for this amazing trip.

A great fun day out!. My partner & I booked the 1 Day Wine tour with WineFlies via email before going to S.Africa. The date & pick up time were confirmed in advance. It was a really fun & informative day out. Lord G was our guide and he looked after the group very well throughout the day. We tried over 20 different wines during the day & tasted cheeses, chocolates & dried meats to go with them over 5 different wine estates. Each place was very different to the last so u get to see a very different selection of vineyards in the area and try very different wines. The whole group enjoyed the day out and it was great to have some fun. Wine tasting doesn't have to be so serious so this was a refreshing change from what I've experienced in other countries.

A Perfect Day Trip!!!. We booked the Wine Flies because our hostel recommended them and we were not disappointed. "Lord G" or Lord RhiRhi was fun, knowledgeable, patient and made the trip the great day that it was!! We visited 5 different wine estates and they were all amazing!!! Lunch was included which was really good after a solid morning of tasting numerous different wines :) I've been on a few other wine tours in other countries and always found them informative but a little to serious for my taste. Thanks Wine Flies for putting fun back into wine tasting!!!

Great wine tour - big emphasis on fun!. I took the Wine Flies tour earlier this year in May and had a fantastic time. The tour was great value, encompassed 5 different wine estates and lots of different wine tastings - the wines were virtually all excellent as well.I've been on wine tastings before that took themselves a bit seriously but this tour was definitely about having fun! I would recommend without any hesitation.

A day trip to remember. My husband and I went on the Wine Flies tour during our honeymoon in Cape Town. We couldn't have picked a better company to tour with. It was not your run of the mill tour. Lord G is personable and informative making wine tasting fun and accessible. Im happy to report that my husband now really enjoys wine. Lunch was included as well. Best deal for the price. We only wished we were in town long enough for the Forgotten Route. Thanks Wine Flies!

Very interesting and entertaining. The morning rain almost made me back out and I'm glad I didn't. I had an amazing time! Our guide Lord G is very knowledgeable and entertaining at the same time. We had some guys in the group who were not listening and would ask questions on stuff that had been discussed. Lord G was very patient and did not show any sign of annoyance. The farms chosen were really good and offered interesting information. Lunch was very good with generous portion. I am not fond of wine and to be honest I signed up for this tour to tick it off my checklist of things to do in Cape Town, same as when I visited France. But with the way the tour was conducted and the educational bits with it made me appreciate wine! I like wine mow and I even have my favorites. I must say Wine Flies changed me!

Great tour and amazing day, highly recommend!. Five of us friends did the tour last week (Nov. 2013) and loved the experience. From the booking until the end of the tour the staff was amazing and Lord G (our guide) was a very knowledgeable and fun host. He made the whole day fun and learned a lot about the area while also having a blast tasting, drinking, and eating. The wineries were also lovely... they also varied a bit from each other which was also something we liked since you got to see several different ways wineries work in the region. All in all an amazing day and we highly recommend! ***also, I left my camera in the van they took us around in and Lord G was nice enough to come meet us at a restaurant we were at that night and give it back to me!
Perfect day. An excellent trip. . Wine flies brings u to 5 amazing wineries. . Well worth it. . Great guide and great wine. .

Best Wine Tour Ever!. Wine Flies provided a tour of wineries near Cape Town. The tour was a highlight of our 2-month trip to Africa. The tour was professional, fun, and the portions were generous. The participants became friends who continued the fun after the tour. We all wore drinking hats and actually learned a lot about wine and tasting during the tour. We highly recommend this company.

The Forgotten Route - Wine Flies Tours. If you haven't yet visited Matjiesfontein, get your passport from Wine Flies Tours and take a tour down memory lane. The tours starts in Cape Town & makes it's way to Worcester, stopping along the way for a Wine tasting at Kirabo wine farm. Thereafter you board the train to Matjiesfontein where you stay at the Lord Milner Hotel overnight, before making your way back to Cape Town. Riaan, our guide kept us entertained with interesting facts relating back to the history of the area. We enjoyed our trip very much and would recommend it highly. Thanks Riaan for a great trip.

A total disappointment. Do not use this company if you want a wine tour. We booked this prior to our holiday to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. We received an email confirming our booking and telling us that we would be picked up at our hotel at 8.30 am this morning. We waited for 30 minutes at the front of our hotel before deciding to call the telephone number on our email. We spoke to Francois Van Binsbergen who had sent the email (which stated 'it's great to have you guys on board') and he was still in bed! He said he hadn't got us down for. Tour and couldn't fit us in today on any of the tours they had. He sounded completely disorganised and said that there booking system was letting them down. He said he may have been able to get us on a tour with another company tomorrow but he sounded so vague that we declined this offer. We lost complete faith in anything he could have said. Thankfully, we hadn't paid in advance as we were told to pay on the day. We were so disappointed as we were looking forward to an alternative wine tour. We have now been to book a car so we can take ourselves to the Winelands. Thanks you Wine Flies for nothing but disappointment!

Don't Bother Looking at the Others, Go Wineflies!. Wine Flies is an excellent organization providing an excellent tour covering a wide range of wineries and tasting experiences. We had Lord G as our guide, and he was superb in that role going out of his way to answer our questions, make us feel welcome and special, and fostering a fun, friendly atmosphere while remaining professional. You get it all on this trip: the full tours of the barrels, vats, etc., cheese tasting, a lesson on wine tasting, a delicious lunch, explanations on the different processes, different types of wine, and regional wine history, and most of all, a lot, lot, lot of wine. When we were first looking, I thought "I don't want all that other stuff, I just want wine," but the truth is that the "other stuff" is very interesting, breaks up the wine tasting nicely, and in terms of wine-for-your-money, this is still the best option if that's all you're concerned about. On that last point, watch your consumption and maybe even go like a pro and spit after tasting sometimes. Otherwise, it is really easy to get waaaaaay too drunk. Regardless, when this happened to us, Lord G still handled it like a professional and got us home safe and sound without flinching. He earned his tip on that day! Another piece of advice: don't make any plans for that evening aside from crashing out. Go for it and enjoy!

Great Value for money.. Great Value for money. Great trip to some pretty cool wineries. Granwille, our 'WineLord' for the day was very knowledgable and funny! Top notch and would highly recommend. The Demorgenzon vineyard was awesome!
great trip. loved this trip, not your run of the mill wine tour. great tour guide, interesting wineries. well priced. definitely a recommended tour....

I would go again and again and again.......and again. My boyfriend and I had an amazing day with wine flies! I would highly recommend this company if you were interested in a wine tour in South Africa. One of the main reasons I liked this company was because of the relaxed and friendly approach. It was very informative and I felt that I learnt a lot but it wasn't too serious or formal. We tried lots of wines and we also did cheese pairing and Tried chocolate and dried meats with the wines too. The areas and vineyards we visited were absolutely picture perfect and the farm we went to for our BBQ lunch was lovely. Food yummy too! :-) I could keep going on but I think anyone doing a wine tour should pick wine flies. If I come back to South Africa I will be doing this again. Thanks for a great day wine flies and not even a headache ;-)

Best Wine Tour Experience!. coming from California, we are lucky to have Napa, Sonoma, Santa Barbara and countless other wine countries that I've done tours at... however none compare in the care and knowledgability that Lord G shared with us on this tour. We were provided with Wine/Cheese pairings, a delicious lunch prepared at a little establishment on the countryside, countless tasty wines, and overall an unbelievable experience that my friends and I consider to be one of the highlights of our stay in Cape Town. I would and will be certainly be recommending Wine Flies to anyone heading to Cape Town.

Lord G is Lord of the wine flies!. Had an incredible trip sampling the wines and cheeses of the Cape. G was informative and friendly and just wonderful as a guide. He really knew his stuff! Couldn't have asked for better and so happy we went with Wineflies!

Just great. My wife and I did the wine tour today with our guide "Lord G". What a great experience! The tour started off at one of the more commercial, slick and professional wine farms and then slowly goes 'downhill' from there during the course of the day until it ends up in an almost surreal experience at Hempies du Toit's Annandale farm. Let me be clear: 'downhill' in terms of commercialism, but 'uphill' in terms of realism (and good honest South African values and offerings). Both sides of this coin were excellent: the professionalism at the start was superb and the 'real characters' towards the end maybe even greater. Of course, the cheese, food and wine were also excellent throughout the day. Every part of experience is exactly what we would have wanted. Throughout all of this, "Lord G" did his thing just right - starting off the day as a professional tour guide and slowly becoming a friend (in the positive unforced and 'real' sense of the word). So, in one word: "great"! (and thanks).

An absolutely incredible day!. We had an amazing day with Lord G! I would recommend this tour to anyone!! We went on our wine tour yesterday with Lord G and had an absolutely amazing time! Even though the weather was terrible, he still made our day enjoyable & memorable. We were the only South African's on board but met nice people and had plenty of fun and good laughs! We really enjoyed the last stop at Allendale, as it was relaxed and fun - really South African! We will definitely be back and refer your tour to anyone we know, we will also post on your facebook wall! Thanks again, and we will see you all soon! Kindest Regards, Maxine & Danielle

Forgotten Route = EPIC. Me and my girlfriend went on the Forgotten Route and to sum this entire tour up: Amazing, interesting, wonderful sights great guides! This is a tour that I would definitely do again! There is so much history given over in such a fun way with interesting sites along the way! Hand picked stops that provide you with an amazing experiences and we even went "ghost hunting". This tour ended too soon to my liking, but gives me more reason to do it again! Thank you Lord Riaan and Lord Granwell for an epic journey!

Loads of fun. We did an overnight tour called The Forgotten Route to Matjiesfontein in the Karoo. Even coming from Cape Town, this isn't something I usually do – it was so interesting and loads of fun. We stopped at a micro wine manufacturer called Karibo, took the train from Worcester to Matjiesfontein, and went on "the shortest tour in South Africa" on the red London bus in the tiny town. On the way back, we also stopped for homemade potijekos and vetkoek on the side of a random road as well as a micro brewery in Montagu. Over too soon.

Beautiful day in the winelands. This is the company you want to go with, if you plan on doing a day tour in the wine country around Cape Town. Our guide was super friendly and gave us some insight into the wine business in South Africa. We saw a variety of different wineries, tasted a lot of different wines and cheese, had a great lunch and were picked up and dropped off at our hostel. All in all a great day!

An Unforgettable Experience with Lord G. What a day! We cant say enough about Wine Flies tours and, more specifically, our knowledgable, friendly, and genuine tour guide, Lord G! We saw five wineries and had a great lunch at one local vineyard. Our group particularly enjoyed the butternut squash soup... a real highlight. The wines were excellent and we have many souvenirs to enjoy for the rest of our stay abroad. We give a sterling recommendation for Wine Flies and our fearless leader Lord G. We'll be back.

Great deal on a full day of wine tours!. This is a full day. Maybe too full. We went to five farms: Villiera, Fairview, Middelvei, Lovane, and Annandale. There were full tastings at all but the middle one, Middelvei, where was stopped for a delicious lunch--a boerebraai (farmer's barbecue). Some folks had a vegetarian option with pumpkin fritters and they loved it. Also, the butternut squash soup starter on a drizzly, cold day was excellent. I think if the weather had been nicer, I'd have given them five stars, but as we were often seated outside during some tastings or as most buildings don't have central heating, it was just a long, chilly day tempered by a lot of great wine (6 different wines at each full tasting). Louwrens was a great guide and for R595, so much is included (like lunch and full transportation, and a little friendly quiz among teams with the winning team taking home a free bottle). I might have settled for three farms and a shorter day (pick up around 8:15, drop off around 5:15). Well worth it!

Thelma and Louise do the Winelands. We were two local girls looking for a fun day out in the winelands and Wine Flies gave us all that and more. Excellent transport service (door-to-door), knowledgeable, friendly and fun-loving guides, expertly chosen routes. Would recommend it for foreigners and locals alike. Thanks for an awesome adventure! We will be back.
Everything I expected and much more!. Fantasic tour, excellent guide (granwell), well run and great selection of wineries. Also very well priced and excellent transport

Fabulous tour, good wine, good company. I was on the same tour as nfriesen1 (review below) and just as he said, it was a great day from start to beyond-finish. We visited five wineries -- one in Durbanville, two in Paarl and two in Stellenbosch -- plus another Paarl winery for a delicious lunch. The wines ranged from commercial to beyond excellent, and the price of the tour was made back with the value of the tastings many times over. Stunning scenery, good atmosphere and lots of great info in a relaxed, unpretentious setting. The group of people couldn't have been better -- we all hit it off right away and ended up going out together later for dinner and more wine. The only problem was the rather painful morning after; I haven't had a hangover like that in years. Worth it, though.

Great Wine Tour!. We took the Wine Flies day tour to Stellenbosch and had a great time! We visited 5 excellent wineries and tasted great wine and food all day. Our guide Lord Granwell was great. We had a memorable and fun day and I would highly recommend Wine Flies to any one visiting Cape Town.

Great day of wine, fun & new friends!. Lord G was an awesome tour guide for the day. We hit up 5 wineries in a few different regions around Cape Town. The group got along so well that we all went to dinner afterwards and ended up back on the ocean front balcony on my hotel room drinking the wine we had bought during day after dinner. None of us had met before that day. It was one of the best days of my entire trip to South Africa and I highly recommend Wine Flies wanting to have a fun day out wine touring in the Western Cape!

GREAT!. Such a great tour. Picked us up at 8 and had a wonderful tour with Lord Granwell! Extremely knowledgable in wine and wine-making and very fun all around tour. Great vineyard selection and delicious lunch! DEfinitely recommend using Wine Flies for a tour!!

Amazing wine tour!. We took part in a wine tour with Granwell, and had an amazing time! We visited 5 stunning wineries, and were never left thirsty or hungry :) It was such a fun day, and we could not imagine doing it again with another company.

Beautiful day out!. From the amazing guide, to the beautiful landscape..Wind Flies makes for a truly well spent day of fun. The guide was really knowledgeable and full of South African "one liners". The chocolate, cheese and wine-of course, was delicious, and I found the paring of the wines at the farms great. The Braai lunch was really good and uniquely South African. I loved the atmosphere on the drive there and home, by the drive home everyone is so well acquainted that you cant help but continue the fun elsewhere afterwards. I look forward to going again in future with friends!

unpretentious way to see the vineyards. Wine flies was an exceptionally run day wine tour. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and approachable. We visited a great sampling of wineries with exceptionally made wines to sample. We had a great day and I would recommend this tour to anyone who enjoys a nice glass of wine in an informal, friendly setting.

Best Wine Tour in Cape Town!. This was such a fun day! From the moment the guide picked us up, to the moment we were dropped off, it was an absolute blast! Even though we started the tour with strangers, a community atmosphere was quickly developed and the laughs didn't cease. Having been on a few wine tours around the Cape, this guide (G Man!) was the most knowledgeable I've had and I thoroughly enjoyed learning new things about wine and Cape Town's wine history. We were also able to taste more wines than on any tour I've been prior. If you enjoy wine and making new friends... this is the tour for you!

A wonderful winetour. Wine Flies Wine Tours is an amazing oppurtunity to discover the south african wines!Last friday we went to do this beautiful tour to 5 wine farms. It were all different kinds of wine farms, big ones and small ones, which gave us a really honest and various image on wine production in South Africa. All the wines I tasted were delicious, such as the cheeses and chocolate. I would really recommend this tour to everyone who wants to have fun, a nice guide and a stunning travel in the vineyards of South Africa!

A must see during your time in Cape Town.. Wine Flies was recommended to us by a friend and we in turn would highly recommend it to others. Our guide, Lord G, was terrific. VERY enthusiastic and knowledgeable. We visited 5 different wineries in the Stellenbosch area, each unique in their own way. Lunch was also planned on one of the wine estates and it was scrumptious. We have traveled twice to the wine country in California and loved the experience but I have to say there was something very special about wine country in South Africa. Beautiful area!

Totally worth it!. Booked the trip through Atlantic Point Backpackers Hostel for R595. We visited 5 different wineries, mostly in the Stellenbosch area.Definitely learned some new things about wine and the history of wine making in South Africa. Had excellent braai for lunch at a scenic wine farm.Our host, Laurens, was a most informative and entertaining dude. Made new friends and discovered a love for wine.Excellent overall, would recommend.

a perfect day. It was a very good value for money tour !Our guide was interesting and nice , the wines testing really good (for me the best at the end!!!!)The BRAAI (lunch) was deliciousNothing more to say : excellent !!!!Vanessa from France

Great Day. A friend and I booked this tour based on Trip Advisor reviews, and we were NOT disappointed. We visited five wineries, each with a different feel - there were large-scale, classic, small, boutique, and extremely high quality wineries. The cheese at Fairview was an extra treat. Lunch was served at a small winery with a vineyard, lots of land, two cute dogs, and a beautiful view of the mountains. Lord G was a fantastic leader and made our experience really wonderful! He encouraged the group to get to know each other and interact. We even had dinner together that night! A note that this tour tends to be better for those who want to interact with other tourists and is probably geared toward a younger crowd, although our group was certainly not rowdy. If I am ever fortunate enough to visit Cape Town in the future, I will certainly revisit Wine Flies!

Really enjoyable. Had a great day at about 6 different wine farms. Tasted so many beautiful wines in gorgeous settings. I suggest buying any bottles early on, as later in the day it all tastes the same and those bottles we bought later and took home weren't as we remembered them!

Super Day Tour. The staff are knowledgeable, but make sure that the day is more about enjoyment than about learning to be snobby about wines! The landscapes are beautiful, the farms authentic and welcoming, and the pick up and drop off to your hotel makes the whole day easy and carefree. I would definitely recommend these guys! I couldn't help but buy some delicious wines in spite of baggage constraints...

Great day out. Great day tour from Cape Town, going to some great vineyards. I especially loved the wine and cheese tasting at Fairview! We had Laurence as our guide and he was very knowledge with a great sense of humour

Great day in Cape Town. This tour is a must. I had a wonderful experience with our tour leader, G Man. He was very knowledgeable and taught us all about wine growing, wine tasting, the history of wine, and much more. We went to 5 different wineries and sampled 5 or 6 wines in each. We had cheese/wine pairing in the first, a delicious lunch after the third winery, and chocolate/fruit and wine pairing in the last. A wonderful day and a great way to experience the beautiful wine region of Cape Town.

Top rate tour. We booked a last minute tour for 3 of us and were delighted by the trip. Our excellent, friendly guide led us through a well planned itinerary through a varied choice of vineyards. Everything about the day was fun, informative, stress free and delicious. Highly recommended!

Brilliant does'nt even begin to describe it!!!!. 5 wine estates in three different regions of the Capes' winelands, food & wine pairing- chocolate and wine pairing, yummy different cheeses to taste, brandy tasting, a hearty prepared meal on a wine farm ....all that in a days work- ta very much you lot of magicians :) Absolutely brilliant tour, hats of to the wine flies crew!!!!! Cheers to lord Granwel who was nothing but fantastic. my personal favourite wine farm was fairview but the last one with wines kept in barrels over 10 -20 years was amazing too. Cant rate you guys enough, cant even fault what you do....Will recommend you folks to everyone i know xxxx - Lisa

Great!. I cannot recommend the Wine Flies Wine Tour highly enough. Me and my friend learnt so much about wine and enjoyed all these beautiful farms. All of them were chosen so well, so we had a good impression of more "industrial" farms and also could gain insight into how boutique wines are produced. The wines were great, the cheese lovely and the lunch wonderful.If our guide G-man had not told us that he was rather new at the company, we would never have guessed that. He was so knowledgeable about wines and charming and easy-going with the group. All of us had much fun.The tour was actually my birthday-treat and I liked it a lot. What a nice way to spend my birthday. Thank you Wine Flies! Thank you G-man. You were phantastic.

What a memorable day!. We had such an amazing time on this wine tour. This was definitely the best wine tour I have ever been on by far. Full of knowledge, great music and good times.The wineries we visited, were ran by extremely passionate owners. Great tasting wine! Thanks for the fabulous time!
Amazing day!. Fantastic tour! First time I've actually enjoyed wine, brilliant host, knowledgeable and approachable! Best thing to do from Cape Town! Would definitely go again!

Great day out - can't wait to come back. Lord Rian is a total champ who is super knowledgable. The wineries we visited were superb, and the included braai lunch so delicious. This introduction has just left me wanting to see even more of the Cape's wineries...900+ incredible. Had the best day, thanks so much!

Lots of Fun. Rian is a very friendly and informative guide. I had a great time and learned a lot about wine. He teaches you nearly everything he knows, and he is very passionate about his job, which makes for a great experience. The tour is a good value and you go to some excellent wineries.

Great Day!. We visited 5 winerys in one day. They warned us to spit out the wine after tasting it, but we didnt. At the end of 3 wineries we had to slow way down! But it was really fun and Riian, our guide, was very knowledgable and interesting. It was a great day!

So much fun!. Three girls from Joburg decided to explore what the Cape has to offer, and we were so lucky to stumble upon Wine Flies!Granville (or G-Man) was a great host for the day. We never could've dreamed that we would learn so much, while having such a great day out.We learned all about the wine making process and history at Villiera, and had some great bubbly and biltong. Fairview cheese and wine pairing was delicious (as well as the fresh baked croissants). Lunch at Middelvlei was yummy and relaxing. We ended up having a bit of a nap in the grass, and also met the adorable dogs and other farm animals there. Lovane - the smallest wine farm in SA - was a lovely experience. Very intimate with a great chocolate pairing. Our last stop was Annandale wine estate, where we had some of the most amazing wines we've ever tasted! Ending off the day with a brandy and coke was a phenomenal idea. Lots of shenanigans on the way home :)Even though the pick-up was a bit late (thanks to some of our guests who were feeling "under the weather"), Granville phoned us in advance to explain the situation, and did a good job of keeping up the pace of the day, without rushing to make up for lost time.Thanks so much for making it a fun and memorable day for us. We would recommend this to anyone who wanted a true Cape wine experience!

Fun friendly and informative. This is exactly what we wanted out of a wine tour, very casual very fun and involved lots of good wine! We went to wine farms that were a little more off the beaten track - thus avoiding the big tour buses! The groups are also small making it a lot more personal. Enjoyed it a lot and also learnt a lot. Thanks!

BEST WINE TOUR EVER!. we had the pleasure of lord Rian and what can i say, what a champ! started the morning with a big of knowledge (over a glass of bubbles) then just got on to tasting heaps of wine. also had some tasty food along the way as well. great lunch! went to check out some small family run wineries which where the best. anyways cant back this tour enough, you have to book it, but be sure to book early!

fantastic day out!. We booked on this wine tour on the back of reviews on Tripadvisor and very pleased we did. The mini bus picked us up from our hotel and then travel around 45mins to the 1st vineyard, it was a full (13 people in total) but to be honest once at the 1st vineyard you don't spend that long in the minibus, plus you get brandy on the way home so the trip home goes very quickly!We visited 5 vineyards in total, all were very good in different ways although as you'd expect we liked the wine more at some of them. For us the best wines were the Fairview ones, but as mentioned they were all very good vineyards and the food at the Middlevei was very good.Louwrens our tour guide was excellent, giving us an insight into the sights as we passed them in the bus including history of the area and also history associated with the wine. He created a day that had a great atmosphere about it, relaxed but thoroughly enjoyable.Overall would recommend this tour, and really enjoyed it, in fact still enjoying some of the wine we brought back as well.
GREAT!!!. It was great thank you, we enjoyed it very much. Just not the second small farm (after Fairview). Food was great and our tour gide Masimo, was also a treat!

Wine flies when you're having fun. As with the other reviewers, we had a most enjoyable time on this tour. It started off sedate enough, with the participants subdued and quiet, but Lord Louwrens expertly got us talking (and plied us with some fantastic wine, from a good selection of big and small wineries, of rustic vineyards, of different varieties (eg, champagne, the South African pinotage), and of places where discussions were welcomed (especially the winery owned by the former Springbok player) - and the brandy tasting to finish also helped).The scenary in Stellenbosch and Franschoek was lovely, Lord L gave us some brief history, entymology, geography and horticulture lessons, the food for lunch was superb, and a good time was had by all.

best wine tour in the world. having had the opportunity to taste wines around the world from south america, australia, new zealand, tuscany, austria, us and canada this must be the most informative and fun. our guide lord rian was legendary, the 5 wineries visited were all unique and wine doesn't get any better! great job-want to come out again!

Wine Flies gets the balance between being fun and informative perfect. We are fairly big wine drinkers and have done many wine tours before including in France, but Wine Flies were the best we have seen. These guys are serious about wine and about having fun. I liked the small size of the tour group, the choice of big and small vineyards, the opportunity to sit down and chat with a winemaker and to tour vineyards, the fun and friendly atmosphere created amongst the group, awesome big Braai-style lunch, and last but not least the wine- and Capetown-passion exhibited by Lord Lawrence. Oh and this tour is relatively cheap too! Thank-you for an excellent day in the wine farms of Capetown.

Wished it would never end!. We've done many wine tours in SA and the US and this was by far the best. We were collected promptly from our accommodation and after picking up other guests (10 on our tour but up to a max of 13) we headed to the first place. We visited a number of different places- starting with larger ones and ending up with smaller boutique farms. Something different for everyone! Thrown in was cheese tasting with wine as well as chocolate tasting. Our guide Lawrence (apologies if the spelling is wrong) was a real gem - kept us all entertained, fed, watered and educated in the history of wine making in the Cape. We want to do another before we leave! The group size was just right and all good craic. Excellent value for money as all tasting and lunch included. Transport was very comfortable. Don't let the wine go too much to your head as there is a quiz at the end with a prize to the winner. Wonderful day out - highly recommended

amazing day. I had such an amazing time with wine flies. It was a friend from the hostel and I that did this tour and couldn't have been happier. The tour guide, Louwrens, picked us up promptly at 8:15 am, and we picked up another 11 people. The wineries were beautiful and varied from a larger scaled winery to smaller more boutique wineries. I think the highlight was the braai lunch at Middlevei with spectacular views of the vineyard/farm. I would recommend this wine tour in a heartbeat to anyone else that wants to spend the day in Cape Town's wine country.

A Big Day Out. I learnt more about wine appreciation in a few hours on this tour than I have in thirty five years of drinking. Wine Flies Wine Tours put on a great day. Our introduction to South African Wines and Wine Farm practices was most informative. We got to taste some magnificent and unusual (and still magnificent) wines. The group of people that we travelled with were an absolute delight and topped off a perfect day. Thanks to guide Riaan for his knowledge and sense of humour. Highly recommended.

time well spent!. my boyfriend and I had a wonderful day in the sun, sipping fantastic wine. the guides are knowledgeable and you DEFINITELY get your money's worth!hot tip: check out cape point vineyards for stunning views and picnic lunches! baskets need to be booked 24 hours in advance but their meat and cheese platters are to die for!

Good day.......very good day!. I was travelling with 3 friends. We joined another 10 and got on the bus. The buss was well kitted out with a PA system and a friendly driver. We had a lot of laughsGood day out.

this was cool. We had loads of fun and bought loads of wine! We learnt about tasting wine and how to match it with cheeses. It was set in the gorgeous vineyards in the beautiful weather. One of my favourite things to do in Cape Town

Amazing Day with Wine Flies. I cannot recommend Wine Flies enough. We just got back from a 10 day trip to Cape Town, and this tour was without a doubt one of our top experiences. For starters, its a tremendous value: 5 vineyards, countless wines, lunch, cheese tasting, and scenic drives through the winelands around Stellenbosch. Lord Rian, our guide, was both hilarious and informative. This tour would be great for anyone looking to have a fun time - regardless of their level of wine expertise. The average age on our tour was 27, and we had a perfect mix of people from different countries and backgrounds. If you want to have a lot of fun while also enjoying and learning about delicious wines, you shouldnt look anywhere other than Wine Flies. You wont regret it, I guarantee it.

Friendly, knowledgeable and unpretentious. A great day out.. We found Wine Flies just by searching Google and we wanted a small personable wine tour but also a bit more than just a glorified wine bar crawl. Wine Flies was perfect for what we wanted.They pick you up from your location and the maximum group size is 13. Everyone is friendly and the tour guide is very knowledgeable without making it pretentious. We visited 5 vineyards in total, ranging from a large commercial farm to several small family run vineyards. There was a lot of wine to taste (always good) and lunch was included.At the end of the trip, there is a quiz with the prize being a bottle of wine - listen carefully throughout the day and it's easy winnings!Overall, great day out!

Outstanding day. These guys do an excellent day tour. Good humor, packed full, lots of variety. And very good value, was R 200 less than another tour that didn't include lunch. Our 13 person multinational, multi-aged group visited 2 wineries in Paary, had a brai lunch on a delightful farm/winery, drove through Stellenbosch town, and visited 2 more wineries in Stellenbosch. Excellent day.

My best wine tour ... ever. Today was a wine tour with Wine Flies. We visited 5 “farms” ranging in size from a couple of acres where they hand press the grapes to a rather large very commercial venture that had some very good cheeses. Unfortunately at the end of the day I left a package of apricot brie in the van at the end of the day. Our group of 11 included a couple from Alaska, a German woman, a couple of Danish women, 3 or 4 Brits and a Belgian. Our driver/guide was a very knowledgeable Italian.The wines are very inexpensive, ranging in price from about US$5 to under US$20 for the most expensive. At on farm I asked the cost of shipping a case back home and found that the shipping cost would have been about $350. I just couldn’t justify spending R(and) 267 to ship a bottle of R125 wine, granted, even with the shipping it’s not particularly expensive wine. For reference, yesterday at dinner I paid R35 (about US$4) for a glass of one of the more expensive wines on the menu at a nice restaurant.

Fun tour!. Pros: - Fun, laid-back (yet informative) owners/guides -- they really eliminated the "snootiness" that is often associated w/ wine tours and wine drinking, especially by having everyone wear silly hats and partake in team trivia!- LOTS of wine tastings (maybe even too many, if there is such a thing!) - Complimentary cheese, chocolate, biltong (!!), snacks in the car, and brandy (as if we needed more to drink!) - Tasty lunch included- Beautiful scenery/beautiful wineries Cons: - None. It was a great, awesome, memorable day!

Fantastic Wine Tour!. Our guest house in Cape Town strongly recommended Wine Flies for our Stellenbosch wine tour, touting their festive hats and knowledge-ability. The experience far exceeded our expectations! The tour was crafted to balance boutique Wine Estates with larger vineyards. We learned all about wine country through a colorful history told as we passed by landmarks and the information actually stuck. Our guide, Raiin, brought the group together through his sense of humor and deep knowledge of Stellenbosch and wine making. At every Wine Estate it was clear that the owners and managers knew our guide well and were all the friendly and more helpful to the group for it. This was a fantastic Wine Tour and I would recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Wine Flies Stellenbosch Tour. The Wine Flies Team have taken care to ensure that you have a fun and memorable day. A lovely lunch was included but take your wallet to buy good wine. I had a wonderful day and learnt and drank a lot. You will too! Judy Kraidy, Auckland, NZ

Wine flies....and is plentiful!. Went with Massimo as our guide, was shocked when he told us it was his 2nd tour as he knew so much! Great day, lots of wine, too much if anything. Drinking wine with royalty and ex international sport stars certainly had its bonuses! Fully recommended. George and Andrea
Spent a wonderful day. We spent a very nice day. Laurence a tourguide - spot on!Thank you very much for this interessting day.Sylvia & Rolf from Switzerland

Great experience!. We went on the Wine Flies wine tour on a Sunday and it was really fun! They take you to some of the most beautiful vineyards in the area and you get to try a multitude of different wines. They provided all the transportation throughout the day, which was also really nice. Our guide was great as well. Definitely recommend.
