PG Tops received such positive reviews so we decided to book with them and are so happy we did. We booked a day trip to the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point along with a day safari to Aquila Game Reserve. Working with Barbara to book the 2 trips was a charm. She responded promptly to all our questions and offered services we didn’t even request. Aquila does not confirm pick up times until the evening prior and we had no cell service in Cape Town. Barbara followed up with Aquila the evening before (outside of her working hours) and emailed us with the pick-up times. This type of customer service is what makes a company great!Our trip to the Cape of Good Hope was with a private guide, Andrew. He was prompt in picking us up and was a wealth of information on the Cape Town area and South Africa in general. It was so interesting spending the day with him. Our “schedule” for the day was very flexible and we were able to spend as much, or little, time at each stop as we chose. The Aquila trip was an amazing experience. It’s a small park but that offers the opportunity to see many animals. The staff is friendly and the 2 meals we had there, breakfast and lunch, were wonderful. So, if you’re having difficulty deciding on which tour company to use, look no further. You can’t go wrong with PG Tops.

PG Tops Cape Tour/Vineyards/Shark Cage. First and foremost... Fantastic Service all around.Was referred to PG Tops by a friend who had visited Cape Town previosuly. Barbara Wild was the main point of contact for setting up this unforgettable trip. She appointed Jamie as our tour guide. She was perfect. The scenery was amazing and Jamie was super knowledgable. She did such a wonderful job. Nice, friendly, funny - what more can you ask for?If you are travelling to Cape Town - you need to book a private tour. If you are booking a private tour - Choose PG Tops and Jamie (although I'm sure everyone is equally as professional). We did both the Cape Point and Vineyard tours. Both were perfect. They even helped us set up a shark cage diving day through a different company because we hadn't booked ahead of time. That is true customer service. No need to look anywhere else.

Great experience; magic really. I reached out to PG Tops based on a recommendation and was very happy with everything from booking through to the end of each day. I booked two private day trips--Winelands and Cape Point--and both were wonderful experiences. Jarred drove us to Cape Point and he was perfect for us as he had the conservation/ranger background; very knowledgeable about the unique floral kingdom of the Cape. Bianca took us through wine country and she was also terrific. Both helped make my spouse's first visit to Africa a special experience.PG Tops will help recommend a specific itinerary and your guide will adapt the day to the weather and/or your interests. I organized everything by email (and PayPal) and all we had to do was stumble into the lobby of our hotel at the right time on the right morning and we were off. Magic.

Township tour - Not to be missed !. Barbara at PG Tops was the first experience I had of the company before we got to South Africa. She was super helpful on her emails with me giving all sorts of advice on the best tours to do whilst we were there. She even took time to answer my questions about what restaurants to eat in! From the very start she kept me fully updated with ultra-quick responses to any questions I asked. On the day we were picked up by Godfrey who lived in the Township we were visiting. The tour was really great and an amazing experience from start to finish. We used three different tour companies whilst we were in South Africa and I would say PG Tops gets the best marks. Ten out of ten! Thank you so much

Very good and organized tour. We booked two days for touring Capetown. PG Tops' Barbara Wild was very responsive and dedicated on every single detail of our visit. Our guide Jarred was very knowledgeable particularly on the Wineland region, where he is from.

Interesting day with a local guide. our Tour Guide Andrew Penn brought us to the must sees of Cape Town with a lot of back ground information. Unfortunately table mountain was closed as it was too windy and so we even extended the tour to hout bay where we ate some wonderful calamari chips. Barbara with whom I was in contact was very helpful and arranged a very nice day for us. She even reissued the tickets for the table mountains for us to be able to use them on another day. I can definitely recommend this agency!

Great Insider Tour. Our tour guide Andrew Penn was more than an expert on the Cape Town area. We wanted to take a city tour and a tour of table mountain. We were more than impressed with his knowledge of the area and he was a lot of fun with a great sense of humor. We enjoyed the best meal of our trip when Andrew took us to Dias Tavern for some authentic peri peri chicken. If you want to spend a day with a local that knows everything about the area ask for Andrew!

The best trip!. It was our first visit to South Africa and thanks to pgtops we had the most amazing trip.Caren and Yolanda were the planners of our itinerary and booked the most special and unique accommodation for us for 11 days.Peter the owner of the agency was our guide. All that we asked for he did for us. He even manged to cook dinner for us at the Atlantic guest house and persuaded the owners of the De Denne guest house to cook a "poyke" for us and serve it on our room's veranda.He went with us to all our walks and outings, brought us to wonderful restaurants and eating places on the way, and took us to addition attractions that were not included in our trip.Thank you all for an unforgetable vacation you are the best!!!

Big thank to Bianca and Rudi. We spent a week in Cape Town and this was a fantastic experience thank to Bianca and Rudi.Bianca was helping us in planning the vacation and Rudi was a fantastic guide. I will definitely ask for them support again next time.

Cape Winelands Tour and Cape Point Tour. I booked two private day tours for 6 people to the Cape Winelands and to Cape Point and the Penguins with PG tops, having seen other customers comments and we were not disappointed.Both tours were exactly as planned, with very knowledgeable friendly guides using a modern, comfortable air conditioned SUV.Bianca, our guide to the Winelands, took us beer, chocolate and cheese tasting (as well as wine tasting!) and a cellar tour at Fairview, for an excellent lunch in a great surrounding (with more wine to test!) at Blueklippen and then, as we were golfers, to Ernie Els to test further wines. A relaxing day for the passengers!Joe, our guide to Cape Point, took us via Camps Bay, Hout Bay, Chapmans Peak and the National Park to the Cape of Good Hope, where we decided to do the 40 mins or so walk to Cape Point. After a nice lunch (with yet more wine), we visited the Penguins at Boulders Beach and the Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. Again another very relaxing day, Joe certainly knows all the best scenic photo spots.

Excellent day trip. We have taken a full day private trip to the Cape with Joe as out driver and guide - this was excellent. The area is very beautiful and Joe is a great guide. Great service by PG Tops Tours all together - everything was on time and smooth

Peninsula Tour. We were a group of 16 who did the full day Peninsula tour with Johan. He was friendly, well-informed & we thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our day with him. He suggested the option of doing a mountain top hike (about 20 minutes duration) which was breathtaking. Highly recommend this tour with Johan.

Great Way to See the Cape Town Area. My wife and I had three days to see Cape Town and vicinity. One can easily spend another several days there so we wanted to make the best use of our time. Moreover, it was high season during the Christmas holidays, which meant we would need to work our way among many other tourists. Therefore, we opted for a private, day-long Cape Peninsula tour and chose PG Tops due to its high TripAdvisor rating.Reserving a place with PG Tops through Barbara Wild was easy. Our guide, Andrew Penn, who was subcontracting to PG Tops, was superb. He was timely to our downtown hotel at 7:30 am. He wisely got us started early because the Cape of Good Hope park becomes crowded. We headed right to the Cape, arrived at the park entrance with a short queue of three cars ahead of us, then viewed the lighthouse and the several capes there including the Cape of Good Hope. In later morning we headed to Seaforth Restaurant in Simon's Town for an excellent meal on the deck and then viewed the penguins at Boulders Beach. Andrew then drove us over Chapman's Peak Drive to Constantia Glen Winery, a good choice with a wonderful view from the verandah. From there we returned to our hotel between 5 and 6 pm.It was a full day and Andrew ensured it was a productive one. He expertly steered us away from traffic. For example, when we left the park around 11 am, the queue to enter the park probably stretched for a quarter mile or more Just as importantly, Andrew, as a native of Cape Town, knew the city and vicinity intimately. He provided us with historical, natural, political, cultural and other information, and he was able to answer our many questions over the course of the day. Moreover, he was a delightful companion over lunch and at the winery.Based on our very positive experience, I recommend both PG Tops and Andrew.

A perfect day! Two Oceans, Cape Point, Sushi and fish deluxe!. We booked the Private Cape Point Tour with PG Tops and spent an overwhelming day at Cape Point together with our guide Bianca who did a wonderful job. We enjoyed besides all the natural wonders a very special birthday lunch at the Two Ocean`s Restaurant with Sushi & fish deluxe - and due to Bianca and her good guiding we will never forget that day! Super arrangement - super timing with an early morning start - special pickup service at our Rosedene Guesthouse near Table Mountain. All perfect! Hope we can make it back!

Cape Town tour with two fantastic lassies. We arranged two trips - the first was conducted by Bianca & we cannot fault anything. The information given was first class & as good as you get anywhere if not better. The tours were loaded with interest & for a stranger to Cape Town we certainly got full value. The trip to the District Six Museum & Robben Island was extremely informativeThe second tour by Yolande was excellent with a vast amount of knowledge of the area given to keep us well informed. We were introduced to all of the major points of interest around CT & the Point to which we are extremely grateful. It is certainly a pleasure to have been shown around by two fantastic tour guidesTo be picked up & dropped off at your door step was a cherry on top of the cake since to drive into an unknown part of the city would have immediately stressed us out which would no doubt have dulled our experience. The final point is that by having done the two organised trips, our lay out of the area was enhanced to such an extent that made our own ventures very easy to follow by having been given a heads up on routes to followWell done to Bianca & Yolande plus all of the background staff for having arranged the tripsCheersD A RAMSAY

5 stars - highly recommended. I booked the Private Cape Point tour for me and 2 friends. That's was the best day-tour we had in Cape Town. Andrew was very friendly and we really enjoyed the time with him.The booking process was easy and they were very flexible with all our requests to customise the trip to our liking.Thanks PG Tops!!!!!!

THIS COMPANY IS A CLASS ACT. I booked a three day land tour of Cape Town with PG Tops, but I had to cancel. The cruise ship we booked - heading to South Africa - had a fire and cancelled the entire cruise. I notified PG Tops (Barbara Wild) and they cheerfully refunded my deposit. I am so sad that I did not get to go to Capetown and see Capetown with a PG Tops guide. Please note: I can assure anyone planning to book PG Tops - these folks are a class act. Trustworthy. Honest.

First rate. I pre -booked my tours online for a visit over Christmas and New Year. The office staff were very friendly and efficient and couldn't have been more helpful. We booked two private tours and a group tour . The private tours were tailored to our needs and our guides Joe and Erica were knowledgeable , obliging and lovely people. They were completely at our disposal for the day. It was a treat not to have to drive . I would recommend this firm to anyone.

Great Solo Private Tour. A couple months ago (end of October) I traveled solo to Cape Town for 4 nights. As a traveler that generally hates group tours, I was looking for a company that offered private tours for a solo traveler. Cape Town is not like European cities where there is a large infrastructure for public transportation, especially to the peninsula areas of the cape. So I wanted someone to take me around for the day that would hit some key places I wanted to go to such as Cape Point and Boulders Colony, but also show me some off the beaten path stuff. The company I had booked a wine tour through for a separate day actually recommended PG Tops to me for booking a private tour. I reached out and Sofie was quick to respond with a wealth of information. She was great in giving me options and setting up my tour! Pieter was my tour guide for the day, which was surprising as he's the owner of the company. I felt a little bad he was stuck with just me for the day but he was great and extremely knowledgeable! He offered up more recommendations, discussed how I like to travel and took me to a great whole in the wall place with tasty samosas on the way to our other destinations. Pieter was spot on for timing (getting to places before the crowds landed) also did a good balancing act of showing me around while also giving me space to venture out on my own at times. Oh, and he also has a great soundtrack in the car. We ended the tour with Wilson Phillips, Release Me. How awesome is that?! Thanks to team PG Tops for a great day!

Exactly What we Needed to do Cape Town in 2 days. Our driver Dion was patient with our inquisitive boys and knowledgeable of the area & history. Using a private driver saved us tremendous time & hassle (we drive on the opposite side of the road). He even accompanied us on our hike at Lions Head. Price was roughly the same as other quotes I received. Very reliable driver. Would do it all over again!

Cape Peninsula tour and Wildlife outreach. My family and I recently visited Cape Town and we used PG Tops tours for two days of tours around Cape Town. Our tour guide for both days was Bianca. Our first day was a wildlife tour with just myself and my two sons and we visited a cheetah outreach, an eagle outreach and a crocrodile farm. Bianca was great and very energetic and myself and my boys had a great time especially at the eagle outreach with the owls! The next day, we did a Cape Peninsula tour and again we had a great time. We will definitely use them again when we visit Cape Town again in a few years. Hopefully, we will be able to do a drive up the Garden route!

3 great days with private tours. We were a small group of 4 people going to Cape Town for 4 days. We wrote PG Tops and asked if they could help us out with the things we wanted to do/see (Cape Peninsula, City tour which also included Langa Township and Table Mountain, and the wine country). From the first e-mail reply, we had the feeling that this was a greaet company with a high service level and fair prices .When we told them we wanted to do Robben island on "our own day" in the city, they offered to buy the tickets, so we wouldn't have to deal with that - I know it's a minor thing, but I really enjoy those small details.We had Rudi as our guide for the Cape Peninsula and the city tour - he was very pleasent company, and was very well informed about everything. He made our days very flexible, helping make sure we got the most out of it. One of the other "small details" they had arranged, was a booked table at the nice restaurant at Cape Point - a very nice place to enjoy lunch.Peter was our guide on the wine tour, which also was both funny and informative. None of us had any wine knowledge - we primary went on this tour for the beauty of the countryside (and it really is beautiful), but Peter shared all his wine-tasting knowledge (in very entertaining ways), and brought us to some interesting places. He had also picked a great restaurant for our lunch, and helped us book a table for dinner as well (at a restaurant he recommended after he had learned what kind of food we were looking for) - again minor details that just added to the whole experience.We had 4 great days in Cape Town - and 3 of them were with great help from PG Tours. If ever in Cape Town, I'm sure I'll contact them again, to help me go experience some of the things we didn't have time to do during this visit.The service were excellent in all aspects, and we all agreed that the guides were really good as well - we felt very comfortable and well taken care of, so all in all, I highly recommend contacting PG Tours and let them help you get the most out of your Cape Town visit.
Friendly, flexible, informative. Bianca and Rudi of PG Tops Travel were absolutely wonderful. We did Cape Point + penguins + Botanical Gardens with Bianca and wine+cheese+chocolate tasting with Rudi.

Many Options, What is the Best?. I spent time going through reviews and looking for the perfect tour guides for our trip to Cape Town. My choice out of my research was Clive's but he was booked and he referred me to PG Tops. I did some research on their reviews and the offers. Pretty much everyone offers the same and there were a lot of reviews of every tour company that sounded like all tour companies in Cape Town are the best yet all the tours were sort of packaged deals that everyone did. Long and short of it we did 3 days of day tours, Wine Country, Cape Peninsula, and Cape Town City tour. The only one that I would recommend for a private tour would be Cape Peninsula the other two I recommend a small group and you will save some money and probably make new friends. Bianca was very pleasant to spend the 3 days with and I believe she will make a great tour guide. I will rate each day tour individually.

Great tour of Langa. We took the 1/2 day tour of the Langa township. First time in SA so this was a must. Very interesting and our guide was very knowledgable being from Langa himself. It felt a bit like a safari walking around the neighbourhood as other tour groups were exploring the same streets and houses as us. But overall a truely moving experience.

Decent, but nothing extraordinary. Paid for a private tour and had them pick me up at the airport. Guide was nice, and shared some good information. He was very flexible in what we did that day (as that is what I paid for!). However, he didn't really bring anything special to table and dropped me off at my hotel an hour early. There are so many guides in the area, I would probably try a different one next time (if I was going to use a guide at all again).

Cape Peninsular. We spent a great day on our private tour guided by Bianca. We was picked up from the hotel on time and shown many amazing things including an ostrich on a beach which we never imagined to see. Feeding an ostrich was also a rather funny experience but one we all saw the funny side of.Bianca was very informative, knowledgable and a pleasure to spend the day with especially our amazing lunch at Cape Point. Thanks for everything it was the best way to spend our last day in Cape Town!!!Darryl & Sam UK

Cape Peninsula Tour. Yolanda was a great guide! She shared a lot of information, tailored our stops to meet our needs, and provided a very enjoyable day. We were very pleased that we chose PG Tops for our tour!

Fantastic Day Trips. My husband and I were in Cape Town for the first leg of our honeymoon and as we were not hiring a car we wanted to do a day trip to the winelands and to the Cape Penninsula, so before we left we booked two trips with PG Tops. We booked two private tours for each of the trips and both itineraries sounded amazing. Our guide Jamie was just fantastic. Knowledgeable, friendly, funny and reliable both of our trips were highlights of our honeymoon. Our first day trip was to the winelands. Jame picked us up at 8.30am and we drove to Stellanbosch, along the way she filled is in on landmarks, townships and any other points of interest without ever bombarding us. nd the beauty of it being a private tour was that we could really do what we wanted and didnt have to fit in with anyone elses schedule. At Stellanbosch we got about an hour to look around and then we headed to our first winery. We then drove on to a second one near Paarl, and then drove to Franschoek where we stopped for a browse and a lovely lunch. Jamie even filled us in on where not to eat after some of her previous guests got food poisoning in one particular cafe there! Then we went to one more winery where they did wine and cheese which was a real find and our favourtie visit of the trip. It was a wonderful day we thoroughly enjoyed. The second trip was to Cape Penninsula and again Jamie picked us up early and we made a couple of stops to some really cute little towns along the way before going to the Peninsula. It was a really windy day, so it was hard to see the difference between the two oceans, but none the less it was a great experience and Jamie was wonderful taking pictures for us and telling us about all the widllife in the park. We had lunch at the two oceans restaurant, while the food was good the service was very peculiar so I wouldn't recommend it but that was nothing to do with Jamie or PG Tops.If you are going to Cape Town and looking for a private tour I couldn't recommend Jamie and PG Tops highly enough it was really wonderful.

Cap Peninsula Tour & Cape Town day Tour, Townships, Table Mountain. My son and I spent 2 full days traveling around Cap Town with Gottfrey. He picked us from hotel on time, he is very friendly and knowledgeable. we visited two museums, and It was a highlight to go to the townships and learn about the social programs there, meet people..Our schedule was very tight and we managed to see everything. We also arrived on time to go to Robben Island on the first day.On the second day we did the Cap Peninsula tour. The landscape is fantastic! Gottfrey made his best to show us the maximum. Ostrich farm, The Cape of Good Hope, the Pinguin colony... we even went to a flee market.The car was comfortable, Gottfrey drives smoothly.. we enjoyed very much our tripsThank you very much Gottfrey you made us want to come back very soon!

Excellent Cape Peninsula Tour!. We booked a private all-day Cape Peninsula tour for our group. Yolanda and Tabo were our driver and guide, and both of them were very knowledgeable about the area and accommodating to all our needs. They kept our group on track to ensure we were able to see everything on the schedule and adapted to our group's requests. They arrived on-time to pick us up and drop us off at the hotel and were very professional throughout the day. We really enjoyed our tour and highly recommend PG Tops for your tour needs!

Winelands and cheetah reserve tour. My colleague and I took a half day tour to Stellenbosch and stopped along the way to pet baby cheetahs. PG Tops was wonderful every step of the way and our tour was one of the highlights of our week in Cape Town. I'd recommend them for families, couples, singles - anyone - and ask for Yolanda, she's truly a lovely person and incredibly knowledgeable about South African history, the winelands, etc.

Great service, excellent value. Bianca from PG Tops acted as our driver and guide for a private day trip to Cape Point. We were picked up exactly on time from our Cape Town hotel and spent the day travelling in a new(ish) comfortable Nissan SUV. Our tour took in Hout Bay (boat trip to a seal colony), an Ostrich farm, the Cape of Good Hope and Boulder Beach African penguin colony. Bianca was friendly and knowledgeable and the day was a real pleasure.

Two day-tours in Cape Town. We spent two days with Rudi and had a great time. All of our interactions with the company were very efficient, professional and friendly. The vehicle was clean and comfortable, and Rudi was very knowledgeable. We learned a lot, saw a lot, and best of all, it was like spending time with a very knowledgeable friend, not just a guide. I would highly recommend PG Tops Tours to anyone visiting the area!

Brilliant. Rudi is a fantastic guide with a wicked sense of humour. Very interesting to listen to and very helpful when it came to suggestions of places to eat etc. Being scared of heights Table mountain was a challenge, he however made sure i expericed the top!. Would highly recommend using PG Tops.

Cape Town. We were a group of 12 and only had one full and two half days in Cape Town in October. We made all our arrangements on the internet and found Bianca wonderful to deal with. She took care of everything from transportation from and to airport and all tours. She even found a way for us to visit Robben island on the day we arrived. Now for our tour guide, Rudi. He was so fantastic, personable, knowledgeable, and just an overall pleasure to be with. Basically, he took care of all our needs, including walking us into our hotel which he wasn't responsible for. He was both flexible and kept us on schedule without ever feeling rushed. He even took us on a tour of the botanical gardens. My only regret was that we couldn't spend more time in Cape Town and more time with Rudi. Without any hesitation whatsoever, I highly recommend PG TOPS TRAVEL.

EXCELLENT Cape Town Experience!. First time to Cape Town, first time on a private tour and I have no regrets! I booked the tour because with a short trip to Cape Town I wanted to be able to see and experience as much as possible and PG Tops did not disappoint. Our guide was Rudi and I have to thank him for his laid-back, relaxing atitude and great sense of humour! I am also grateful for his extensive knowledge and travel tips. Our trip was on the first day and he was extremely helpful in recommending places to eat/see, as well as guiding us in the places that we should be more careful in/avoid. It was a fantastic experince and I would recommend PG Tops to anyone who has not experienced this part of the world before. When I return to cape Town agaian, I will not hesitate to use their services again. Thank you.

Great tour. I so recommend PG tops! Sofie answer all my emails right way and she was always kind and efficient. My family and I had a great experience with Joe (tour guide), He was punctual, ready to answer all of our thousand questions and He made everything he could to give us the best experience.

An amazing Cape Town Experience. The trip started with a very efficient pick-up from the airport and from thereon we were in for a great experience. Our guide for 4 days, Rudolf van Rensburg, deserves 6 stars. He was accommodating to an elderly couple that travelled with us from Ireland. Everything went as planned, everyday on time and he really made our Cape Town visit a memorable experience, even for me as a South African. All in all I can recommend PG Tops Travel and Day Tours to anyone that requires a guide to show them the best of Cape Town and if you want a specific guide, ask for Rudolf. If we ever we plan to bring other international friends to South Africa we will definitely make use of their services again and we have already recommended them to our friends. Al wat ek kan se, is baie dankie aan PG Tops Travel and Day Tours, maklik die beste geld wat ek aan 'n vakansie gespandeer het. Rudolf, jy het verseker die Iere se harte gesteel. Sofie, baie dankie vir die reelings, dit was alles perfek.As they say in Gaelic, Gurbh a maith aguit !! (Thank you very much).

2 great trips. My wife and I recently did two trips with PG Tops. The first was whale watching at Gansbaai with Paul, and the second was the Cape Peninsula with Jamie. Both guides were good company and informative.Both trips focused on wildlife, as we had said that was one of main interests. So we saw penguins at both Betty's Bay and Boulder's Beach. The whale boat was run by Dyer Island Cruises and we got really close to some whales, as well as seeing some seals at Dyer Island. Because the sea was a bit choppy, the trip took longer than expected, and we only just got to Betty's Bay before it closed. If the weather is a bit rough, I'd recommend asking for seasickness tablets, as one or two people were sick. The Peninsula trip was really pleasant, but watch out for baboons at Cape Point, especially if your are female and carrying food.All the organisation went really smoothly, so I am happy to recommend PG Tops for these personalise tours.

Great day out. Me and Maria never did a private tour like this before but it definatly wet the appetite for another more personal experience. Our guide was Godfrey and I couldn't be more happy with having him bringing us around the cape for the day. Godfrey collected us on time and gave us a real understanding of the area and greater south Africa. He was very relaxed and we felt totally comfortable for the day. The tour around the cape hit a lot of great sites and since we had the personal touch we were able to get in and out of places a lot easier. I would totally look at PG Tops tours again for any touring needs.

Couldn't have asked for a better tour!. We had originally arranged an all day wine tour with PG TOPs but due to a mix up by our hotel, we accidentally had a wine tour on the day we were supposed to have a Cape Point tour. It couldn't have worked out better! PG TOPs was more than accommodating and changed our wine tour to an all day Cape Point tour, and the weather cooperated, too, by being perfectly clear, sunny, and warm. Our guide, Yolanda, was very personable, and took us to several sites (such as a locals' market in Hout Bay) that weren't filled with bus tours. Yolanda arranged a table reservation at Two Oceans and out table was waiting when we arrived from our hike from the Cape of Good Hope up to Cape Point. The tour was timed well, and it ended just when we expected it to. We can't think of any other tour we've taken that would rank more highly than our tour with PG TOPs. You won't be disappointed, either.

excellent - wish I had used them for all our Cape Town needs. We booked a day tour with PG Tops during our recent visit to Cape Town. In hindsight I wish that I had used them for everything as they were reliable, professional and a pleasure to work with. Bianca was our guide for the day and we first went to Tabletop Mountain - a good thing to go first thing due to the crowds and the rest of the day we spent driving to Cape Hope and all the sights on the way. Bianca arrived at our hotel exactly as promised in a lovely BMW, she was knowledgable, professional and a joy to spend the day with. I had emailed with this company prior to our arrival in Cape Town and together they helped put together a day tour that was doable and enjoyable. The perfect weather was just luck but helped make it a most memorable day. We highly recommend this company and would use them again without hesitation.

Look no further for Cape Town trips. We travelled to Cape Town for a week September 2014 - PG Tops organised collection from the airport and the return trip as well as a day out with the Great White Sharks. All of the people we dealt with were very nice and helpful, and the day with the Sharks was incredible - it was also nice that Bianca explained all of the areas we passed through for the journey to the Sharks.We are already planning a longer holiday next year and will going with PG Tops for Sharks again, their excellent looking Safari's and anything else we decide on.Alex & Family.

Fantastic Day with PG Tops. We booked an airport transfer and a full-day tour with PG Tops for the end of August. I set up the details with Caren who was very responsive to all the questions I had and I had a lot! Our driver was waiting for us when we arrived at the airport and our transfer to the hotel went well.Our full-day tour was scheduled for Robben Island in the morning and the Winelands in the afternoon. PG Tops’ driver, Bianca, picked us up at the hotel on time. There were four of us and we were very comfortable in the van. Bianca brought us to the pier for the ferry to Robben Island and purchased our tickets for us. Unfortunately, the ferry was cancelled after we boarded so we called PG Tops and our driver came back for us. Bianca had several suggestions as to how to spend the morning and we opted for a visit to the District Six museum before going to the Winelands which was no problem for Bianca. She even made a quick stop at a pharmacy for us. We then picked up our guide (and owner), Peter, who was fantastic. He is a walking encyclopedia on the history of South Africa as well as more current affairs and on wines of the region. His selection of wineries for our tasting tour and lunch was excellent.We would not hesitate to use PG Tops again. They were flexible with our arrangements and their service and tour content was excellent.

Personal Tour of Cape Town. My wife and I toured three days with Rudi from PG Tops. Yolanda setup the tours on 9/20-22/14 and made sure that the tours were tailor made for us. Rudi was most professional, knowledgeable and most of all personable. It was like touring with a family member. The first day we toured the town and Table Mountain. The second day we drove to Cape of Good Hope, and the last day we toured the wine country with a side shopping trip. Rudi made wonderful lunch and dinner recommendations and all were exceptional. PG Tops made our Cape Town visit memorable and stress free. We would highly recommend PG Tops.

Amazing, candid tour guide. Yolanda was our 28 year old guide. She could not have been more engaging, thoughtful, fun, candid about herself, Cape Town and its history. It is simply her personality. The result was we got a sense of the history and evolution of Cape Town and its culture from a real local, whose first language was Afrikaans. We saw the peninsula, Signal Mountain, downtown, the penguins, with someone who was honest about shortcomings of the area, but had an undeniable love for the area and country. If one wants to mix fun with a tour, and end up with a real sense of the area, Yolanda and her company will be a great bet. And this from a couple of seniors!

PG Tops is tops again......... Well, what can I say.... anymore that has already been said by the others here. We were taken around by the wonderful Nicolene on tours of Cape Town for three days, from 4/9/14-6/9/14.Nicolene was wonderful! She was punctual, pleasant, attentive and knew all that needed to be known as a tourist guide.She also knew the best restaurants at every place we visited. She was a great conversationalist too.....We made it to all the sites on time as per the visiting hours. Our tours were a little cramped up I believe, but we managed to cover it all.Thank you PG Tops and especially Nicolene for a wonderful three days. We really had fun and will recommend your agency to others.And thanks to PG Tops for the efficient airport transfers as well.

Two day tours, two guides....perfect!. Six of us were visiting Cape Town prior to the start of a long safari journey and wanted to spend one day wine tasting and one day touring Cape Penninsula. Deion was a wonderful guide to the small wine producers of South Africa. All of us are from San Francisco and are used to wine tasting. Deion heard that and picked out some excellent wineries where we had private tastings. Rudy was a terrific guide of the Cape and as the day dawned with perfect weather, he said we should begin with the cable car ride up to Table Mountain and we were so glad we did! Both guides gave us great insight to South Africa and were excellent companions for the day! And a special shout out to Sofie in the office who organized everything beautifully, Thank You!

TAble Mountain, The City and the Township. Yolanda and Richard gave us a most complete intro to Cape Town's history, geography and cultures. As tour guides, their professionalism created a richly engaging, comfortable and flexible day. Through the stroies they told we felt so much better connected and can see that through people like them SA will have a great future. Thank you for such an indepth visit to your community and your neighbours, Richard.

How many ways to say "awesome" ?. We took 2 tours, each for one day. We took the wine lands tour and the cape tour. Both were top notch. Our guide was Johan. He was prompt, personable and very informative. He steered us to a very memorable lunch in the wineland. I do not walk very quickly, so we frequently hire city guides to take us about (Paris, Barcelona, province, Rome, etc) he was one of the best...anticipating our interests and providing intriguing insights. Our drive to the cape was spectacular. I highly recommend their services!!

Great trip on the Cape Peninsular. Had a great time with Peter on the trip, hes very knowledgeable and flexible. Provided us with a few options to choose along the way which was what we liked! Had lunch picnic at a scenic place and ended the trip nicely at a local cafe. He also gave great recommendations on where to go to for dinner and we truly enjoyed our day with PG Tops. .

Great Touring Experience. My daughter and I spent four days in Cape Town. Our guide, Rudy, was awesome. Very knowledgeable, friendly. Made sure we got great photo opportunities! He picked us up on time, kept us on schedule and made our trip really great. Would HIGHLY recommend this company.

Great trip to the Cape of Good Hope and the winelands. We loved our tour of the Cape Of Good Hope and the Winelands with Paul. He was knowledgeable, funny, arrived on time and picked great wineries for us to go to. The restaurant for lunch was also fantastic-like a French country inn. He was very flexible-we even split up-some wanted to walk around the town and one wanted to go to another winery so he drove one to the winery while the rest walked and shopped.We learned not only about the city he loves but about the culture, politics, and people. Thanks, Paul.
Excellent. Really friendly and experienced tour guides. Bianca was just lovely helping us coordinate our tours - Got Rudi on the Cape Point tour and he was just great!

Everything we hoped it would be. Our first time in Cape Town, (for only a week) was made memorable because of our guided tour with Jamie of PGTops. We made initial arrangements through Yolanda some months before our holiday, and everything worked out perfectly. The exchange rate (UKP/Rand) worked in our favour too. Would highly recommend PGTops to anyone seeking a well informed guided tour.

Lovely Private Tour of Cape Town. This was our first time doing a private tour and we feel so spoiled by it already. We had Pieter as our guide the first day and he showed us around the City and gave us an depth history and background on Cape Town and S. Africa. We wouldn't have learned so much if we went around on our own. Pieter showed us the local eats also which was wonderful. We went back on our own to get the bunny chow on our last day. Jaime was our guide the second day to the Constantia Valley & Cape of Good Hope. She was again extremely knowledgeable and funny. She had all the answers to the questions we asked. We highly recommend PG Tops if you want a personal one on one service. Their vehicles were clean and comfortable as well.

The Best of the Best. We visited Cape Town only for a couple of days and wanted to make sure to make the most of our trip. We were recommended to PG Tops Travel and have to say they were The Best. From the first email communication before our holiday to the pick up in Cape Town, everything was perfect. Our tour guide was Rudi and he was simply amazing and very knowledgeable. We clicked with him from the first minute and it was never quiet in the car.For our tour we chose to go from cape Town to Table Top Mountain (sadly closed weather wise), to some fisher villages, Simons Town plus Beach Huts and Boulders Beach. Simons Town is a must for every dog lover because of Nuisance the Great Dane. We had an amazing day and our tour was just outstanding!We can highly recommend PG Tops Travel and Rudi and would book him again!

Rudi and how him and the staff with PG Tops made our Cape Town visit AMAZING. PG tops facilitated exactly what we wanted over our 3 day stay at Cape Town. We began working with some of the staff months prior to our trip, inquiring on all the different options of things we could do while in Cape Town. Ultimately, they coordinated tours fit our interests.Our guide, Rudi, was a true professional and an ambassador of service excellence. He was knowledgeable on the vast amount of history surrounding the Cape and his insight made us appreciate everything we were touring that much more. The door-to-door service that this company provides paired with the private touring (in our case, with our fabulous tour guide Rudi) in the areas YOU would like to see made our long journey to Cape Town unforgettable!I recommend PG Tops and Rudi to all who are visiting Cape Town and South Africa, & we hope to return in the future and use your services again! No doubt! -David & Monica Echezarreta

Outstanding 3 day trip in Cape Town!!!!. Outstanding private tour with Rudi and Yolanda as our guides. Sofie and Bianca were great with helping to customize the trip to our liking. We did a Table Mountain/Cape Point tour, Shark Dive, and city tour and had a great time. Rudi and Yolanda were both very knowledgeable guides and kept the tours fun and interesting. If you are looking for a completely customizable tour and a hassle free time, PG TOPs is the place to go with. I would definitely recommend PG TOPS and their excellent team members.

PG Tops is top notch!. I am a 70 yr old woman traveling alone who just spent three great days in Cape Town. PG Tops arranged to pick me up at the airport and devised a three day itinerary based on some of the activities I was particularly interested in. Rudi, my guide, was knowledgable, flexible, and friendly--a delightful companion. We packed a lot into three days, but I never felt rushed. The PG Tops office staff, primarily Yolanda, was responsive and helpful. I recommend this team highly! I hope to return to Cape Town and I would work with them again in a heartbeat!

Great experience with Rudi in Cape Point. Great private tour for my wife and I with Rudi. We did the Cape Point tour and had a wonderful time. My wife was initially hesitant about the tour because guides can be hit-or-miss, but Rudi was very good! He shared lots of insights about the areas and the people throughout the trip, and answered our millions of questions. He struck a great balance between being present and giving us space to explore places while he waited outside. Very flexible as well. I would highly recommend Rudi and PG TOPS. Great experience.

Great day trip to Cape Point. We took a day tour to Cape Point for my family. It was great. Rudy was our tour guide. He was friendly and provided us with a lot of useful information. We all felt very safe with him behind the wheel. I also was really pleased that he was flexible. We wanted to do something that day before we started our tour and he altered his planned itinerary to allow this. Same thing at the end of the day -- he took us by a site in Cape Town that we wanted to see when he could have easily just dropped us off at our hotel. He was very accommodating. I highly recommend him and this company. (I do wish they'd take credit cards instead of using PayPal...but I'd still recommend them.)

Great tours and great people!!. My husband and I used PG tops for 3 days of touring and airport transportation. From our first emails with PG Tops; they were very professional, friendly, and SOO ACCOMMODATING! We had originally booked with Pieter and due to an injury, we had Yolanda for 2 days and Godfrey for a Township tour. and they both were amazing!EVERYONE at PG Tops is very accommodating -- especially when our Robben Island tour was cancelled (tickets we booked on our own) and PG Tops rearranged our tickets and their schedules so we could still do everything we wanted when we were in town!! Thank you Sofie!We spent 2 days with Yolanda for a Peninsula Tour and Winelands Tour. She is young fun and very nice to answer all of our questions. We had never done private tours before and were worried it would feel 'strange' but Yolanda is so open and nice and we could do whatever we wanted! We had reservations to paraglide and due to weather it was questionable; so yolanda even picked us up early and switched days around for us due to Robben Island cancellation and Paragliding weather. Thank You Yolanda!We spent a day with Godfrey at his home of Langa Township. This is a tour where you want Godfrey. He grew up there and still lives there; so you definitely get a personal insight to the townships. This is a very different tour than others; more of a cultural tour and not the popular tourists sites of Cape Town.Overall PG Tops was GREAT in helping us organize our 4 days in Cape Town. Yolanda had some recommendations for restaurants, shopping, and truly personalized our days. Sofie and Bianca's organization on the front end was SOO very helpful! Pieter, I'm sorry we missed touring with you -- but we had an AMAZING TIME! Highly Recommend.

Excellent tours!. My family and I had the pleasure of spending a day and a half with Rudi, from PG tops tour. We went to Robbin Island, along side a visit to table top mountain which was very enjoyable. our guide was excellent and very helpful.We also did the township tour which is recommended.overall, an excellent tour company- I would recommend them!

Magical Day!. My family and I had the pleasure of spending the day with Rudi, from PG tops tour. We had a private tour of Capetown. Rudi was not only a very knowledgeable expert on his city; he was also very pleasant and we enjoyed his company immensely. I always knew I would like Capetown, which is one of the most beautiful cities in the world, but I do believe Rudi made our experience even greater. I would return in a heartbeat and will recommend this company very highly to anyone I know who's lucky enough to visit South Africa.

2 day tour with Erica. Great tour. We needed to maximize our short stay in Cape Town and they made it work beautifully. Erica was great and retrieved us from airport and straight to Table Mountain with pre purchased tickets. Then quick city tour Museum visit and on to Romney Suites Hotel which they recommended and reserved for us. Great stay. Started early next day with stops at Cape of Good Hope and Boulders beach and back to airport to pick-up van that they had arranged for us. Could never seen so much in such a short period of time on our own.Only slight glitch was final payment confusion, but we worked that out with help of wifi at coffee shop along tour route.Would recommend them without reservation.Very professional organization. They clearly take pride in providing an outstanding experience.Erica should be commended. Her efforts made our trip memorable.

Rudi was a great guide!. We did several tours around Cape Town with Rudi and he was awesome. He was very knowledgeable about the city and surrounding areas. We enjoyed that PG Tops allowed us to customize our trips. We also employed PG Tops for rides to and from the airport (with Yolanda and Peter), and they provided friendly, prompt service. You can't go wrong with PG Tops!

Very nice way to discover Cape Town and surroundings. I've been visiting the lovely Cape Town and the also lovely city of Franschhoek, doing wine tastings and trips across the region. We selected this agency - and we couldn't be more happy with our choice ! The services are provided exactly as booked, and the overall felling is that our expectations were exceeded. A special remark to one of our guides, Jamie-Leigh Stafford, who was immediately converted in our good friend. A lovely person, very enthusiastic and with a deep knowledge about the region and - specially ! - the wineries we visited. We really enjoyed a lot our trip, and I'm sure that a big part of it was caused by Jamie and PG Tops Travel. I recommended it very emphatically !!

Never a Dull Moment with PG Tops. PG Tops, represented by Yolanda, Rudolph and Jamie, did a great job at touring us around Cape Town. We were a party of 10 and all first timers in Cape Town. The tours were all very informative and entertaining. Rudy brought us to Camp's Bay, Hout Bay, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point and Boulders Beach. Yolanda and Jamie brought us to Franschhoek and Stellenbosch for some wine tasting and we did a bike tour to 2 wineries. On our last day, Yolanda took us around the city and gave us a brief history of Cape Town and she saw us off to Robben Island. Due to the weather, our visit to Table Mountain was cancelled. This gives us a reason to go back next time. They also made sure we got reservations to the restaurants we wanted to eat in and they also took care of our transfers to and from the place. They were always prompt and they accommodated all our requests even with short notice. I recommend PG Tops. Their tour guides are very friendly, warm and funny. There wasn't a dull moment with them. They were also such good sports because they all agreed to do some jump shots and silly photos with us. Thank you Yolanda, Jamie and Rudy. We had a lot of fun with all of you and we are looking forward to seeing you all again soon.

City and Township Tour. We spent the day with Godfrey taking in the best of the city and Langa township. The township tour was a particular highlight or our trip. Godfrey lives in Langa and was full of knowledge, it was very interesting to meet the people and we enjoyed the visit to the kindergarten. Highly recommended.

Top of the pyramid!!!. First time in Capetown you need somebody you can trust on! From the first contact, during the period of planning, from the Organisation to the warm welcome at the Airport, from the perfection of the different tours to the invoicing, from the recommendation of fantastic Restaurants to the selection of Wineries, from the explanations to the safe journey across the beautiful landscape everything was perfect. We spent 7 days on 6 different tours with Pieter, Sophie, Yolanda and Ralph. Each of them an Expert, Colleague, Entertainer and Guide through a versatile Country with multicultural People. Apart from the flow of Tourist we discovered the best South Africa has to provide. (No possible without the Team of PG Tops Travel and Day Tours! Big value for reasonable rates. As a Family of 4 persons it is much more advantageous (Price, Flexibility, Individuality, Comfort) than with one of the big and expensive Tour-Organisations!We spent one of the best times in our life with the guys from PG Tops. Thank you for the hospitality and all the unforgettable impressions. We will come back soon!

Outstanding Langa Township Tour. We spent this half day tour with Godfrey and what an informative tour it was. We were picked up at our hotel by Godfrey. We stopped on route to Langa in District 6 and the history lesson began. Godfrey informed us he grew up in the Langa town ship and still lives there and his passion for this area shown through in the history lesson we received. We got to see a lot in the Township including a project where they make nice pottery, a preschool, a traditional pub, and different types of living areas and also got to interact with the people. It was very interesting to see the other side of Cape Town and I would highly recommend this tour. The highlight of this tour for my wife was the visit to the pre-school. Highly recommend this tour!

Really good tour. We did the Cape Point & Penguins tour. It was a great day of beautiful scenery, knowledge, and food. Our tour guide though, definitely exuded an air of superiority when providing us with South African history and discussing the local people. We understand there is still some tension with the history but the way it was communicated, I found it almost offensive. She also made me feel bad about the way I was dressed, implying I wasn't dressed properly for the tour. We did have an amazing time though on the tour as it was personalized.

AMAZING company…. We are a family of 6 adults and I needed transfers and tours while we were in Cape Town. I found PG Tops thru tripadvisor and was hesitant to use a company without personally knowing anyone who used them. It was the BEST decision I made. We had Yolanda for 2 full days of touring and Roelf for another day. Spectacular guides. We had private guides before but Yolanda and Roelf were better than any we ever had. We got a tour of Winelands, Cape town area and the Penninsula tour. Roelf was even able to get us a tour of Langa the township at the last minute and it was one of the highlights of our trip. They were great about brining us to airport and picking us up. Very helpful in assisting to get tickets for activities we wanted on Robben Island and Table Mountain Vans were really comfortable too.Very informative, friendly and flexible…I can not recommend them enough. If you want a tour guide that keeps your interest, is very knowledgable and is a pleasure to be with..this is the company to use.

Excellent Wine Tasting Trip. We had a half day wine tasting trip with Roelf, he was very knowledgeable guide and it was good to have him on the trip with us we learn't a lot as well. My family and I enjoyed this trio very much an we would definitely recommend you to the rest of our family and our friends.Thank you for a lovely day!

Very informative and worthwhile. We had two days out with Pieter and then Erica - Friday and Monday which gave us the weekend in between. The only thing we missed was the trip up Table Mountain but then you can't control the weather, and whilst we could have gone on the Tuesday, the queues were horrendous so we'd have simply wasted a lot of time. We visited Stellenbosch and the winelands in close proximity with Pieter, and then Capetown and the southern area included yet another vineyard with Erica - not that I was complaining !! Both trips were relaxed and informative, aided by discussions of our own views and feelings on the general state of affairs of the country which I was interested in having lived in Zambia some years ago. I can honestly say I found Pieter and Erica very easy to talk to and they maintained a relaxed but professional attitude throughout. I felt it was worth paying the extra against a bigger tour company for the simple reason we're not going to be visiting the area in the near future so make the most of it with the personal service.

Loved the cape of good hope tour. We loved the tour with Pieter today! He was a knowledgable guide with a good sense of humor. We enjoyed his company and learned quite bit about Cape Town and South Africa. He was also very brave in scaring away a baboon that opened the car door in search of food when the rest of us was distracted by taking photos of ostrich.

Worth every minute!. I'm so glad that we saw all of Cape Town with PG Tops! We spent three days with Roelef who was an amazing tour guide - incredibly knowledgeable and attentive. He listened to everything we said and spontaneously designed activities that suited our needs. We saw the city, Kirstenbosch, Cape of Good Hope, the wine country, and everything in between. We learned so much about Cape Town and Roelef was able to show us all the amazing viewpoints that the city has to offer. The company is incredibly flexible and has a very relaxed yet professional attitude. I would highly recommend their services!

Outstanding Cape Town and Peninsular Tours. PG Tops is an outstanding tour company in Cape Town. Roelf Hamman was a fantastic guide who was knowledgeable, prompt, and professional. We spent two days with him and felt we really saw the sights of Cape Town, the Peninsula, and the wine country. He shared a lot of information about each locale and gave us the flexibility to enjoy everything at our own pace. We would definitely book with PG Tops and Roelf again,

Excellent Cape Town and Peninsular Tours. I would highly recommend PG Tops. If you choose one of their tours you will be pleased with your decision. It was the first time my wife and I had booked a private tour. We normally either drive or go on group excursions -but having read the previous reviews on trip advisor decided to give it a try and our time in Cape Town was so much better as a result. We booked two full day tours - the Cape Peninsular and Cape Town City Tour which included Table Mountain. Our tour guide for both was Roelf who was excellent - very interesting, knowledgeable and friendly, it was a real pleasure to meet him.Both tours were excellent. We got to learn so much about the Cape Town area. The tours are flexible and paced to your own choosing, Roelf even managed to fit in a bit of wine tasting for us at the end of one day. The Peninsular Tour is a great trip with a fabulous coastline. Without having to drive you can really take it in and still be able to stop where you choose. The tour of Cape Town included a walk around the City centre (the main City centre is not that big so it was not a big trek). This was a really fun option and it was really enjoyable to able to walk around and get to understand so much about what you are visiting. Thank you to PG Tops for a fantastic time.

Creative and Caring with a Can Do Attitude. Having travelled to 60 countries over the decades, I can truly say that PG TOPS is the “Best of the Best” and has earned my 5 Star award. I arrived in Cape Town with spiral fractured leg. Caren met us on the tarmac at Cape Town Airport and turned the next 3 weeks in a wonderful and memorable vacation. Caren, Roelof, and Pieter have you covered be it: preparing you for a Big 5 Safari outing; Murphy's Law; a fabulous day in the wine lands; or going the extra mile on your behalf with vendors.Caren, Roelof, and Pieter, as they say in South Africa "My Pleasure" and "Dankie".

Cape Town Experience. We found Yolanda to be very knowledgeable about all things in the Cape Town area. She was prompt about everything while providing us with great flexibility in our tours to deal with the weather and our interests. While being a complete professional, she also gave us delightful insight into some aspects of her life and became someone we would love to see again. We would give her the very highest rating.

Truly First Rate!. Thank you Pieter for making our visit to Cape Town a wonderful experience. Pieter ensured that our visit was comfortable, informative. We were 2 couples (in our 70's) that have done extensive travel together, but had never been to South Africa. We had 3 days with Pieter: Table Mountain, Cape Town environs, Robben Island; Cape Point and the peninsula tour and a day in the wine country. Each day was well planned and well paced. Pieter is very knowledgable, interesting and entertaining. His vehicles are clean and well maintained. As we were in Cape Town during the New Year's holiday, PG Tops even ensured that we were able to secure dinner reservations at the top restaurants. Great service, thinking of every detail. Hats off to Pieter and his team!

Great service and very good guides!. PG Tops gave us a very good balance between activities and "alone-time". Relaxed and knowledgeable guides. Early morning Table Mountain climb "India Venster Route" with Pieter was great. La Colombe, Gourmet boerie, Pot Luck Club, Franschoek etc. were delicious. Three wine-tastings in one day with Roelf was maybe one too much :), but we had a really great time. Woodstock with Old Biscuit mill, Woodstock Exchange etc. is becoming a hipster-area with nice restaurants, good shopping and Baristas with beard.

2 Tours. We booked a wine tour last Friday. Our guide Rudi was a very nice chap and tried his best to listen to our interests and choose the winery's accordingly.We went to Fairview first, which is commercially run, and at the slightly cheaper end of the market. You can taste goats cheese as well, which was very good. A popular wine in the UK, Goats do Roam, is produced here. The grounds are nice, complete with goats, and the staff were helpful and knowledgeable.As particular red wine lovers, we went next to Rust En Vrede, which I don't think is a usual stop on the tour. The wine was more expensive, but really very nice. They have a restaurant there which looked inviting, but we were already booked to eat elsewhere.For lunch we went to the Graff estate. The restaurant has fantastic views, but we thought the attitude of the staff was a bit snotty. Finally we went to the Warwick estate, but we were not keen on their wine, and the service was very poor.We did buy wine at 3 of the estates to be shipped back to the UK. Its worth noting that there is a huge variance in how efficient each estate is in making this transaction straightforward (or not). We would have expected the process to be streamline !If you are considering a wine tour, it is well worth doing research in advance to identify which specific winery's may be to your taste. There's a huge variety.Our second tour was the following day when we went horse riding on the beach at Noordhoek. This was just something I wanted to do having seen horses on the beach during our last visit to Cape Town. The beach and sea are beautiful and deserted, so a lovely way to spend a morning. Our driver, Joe was very pleasant, although I'm not sure it was necessary, as he just spent 5 hours in the car waiting for us.All communication with PG Tops was dealt with very efficiently by Sofie - thank you :-)

One of the best tours ever!. We did the day tour to Cape Point / Cape of Good Hope.Everything was excellent!! Private car was clean and neat and comfortable.Guide was a great guy, funny personable and very knowledgable and interesting.Very flexible as they picked us up at the hotel and had us go earlier than other tours so that we could see the penguins without the big crowds.Took us to a great place for lunch...nice sites and good food.I would very much recomend these guys for an excellent day!Well worth the money!!!!

PG Tops is Top Notch!. From my first communication with Peter, I knew that PG Tops was no ordinary tour service. How often do you have people respond to your email at 4:00 am? That's the level of service we had the entire time with PG Tops. We were fortunate to spend several days with Yolanda and she was outstanding right from the start at the airport pickup! We did a Cape Point Tour and Winelands tour with Yolanda and enjoyed every moment of her enthusiasm and knowledge of the areas. She did an excellent job of customizing the experiences to our interests and made the days extremely enjoyable! I would highly recommend Yolanda and PG Tops to anyone visiting Cape Town. Par Excellence!!!

Winelands Best Tour!. My husband & I took this fabulous tour with Roelf as our guide. He was very prompt in picking us up at our hotel. He took us to a fantastic chocolate tasting. Than after to several different wineries. Each one had it's own distinct style and many varieties of wine. It was an absolutely wonderful day. Roelf was just a pleasure to tour with. You can really see he is passionate about wine. He is very knowledgable just about everything including South Africa. We were very lucky to have him take us on this tour. Don't miss it the wineries are beautiful.

Peninsula Tour. My mom, brother, and I arranged a peninsula tour with PG Tops with Joe as our guide. Joe was very friendly and knowledgable about the area and the history of South Africa. He also was flexible to where we wanted to stop and for how long we wanted to stay. We had a wonderful time traveling throughout the beautiful peninsula. A tip for the peninsula tour is to wear some walking shoes-there is an optional trail to walk/hike from the Cape of Good Hope to Cape Point that would be great to do. Thanks PG Tops!

Wine tasting splendor. We arranged a day to the Cape Wine lands. Our guide Roelf was not only a very friendly and accommodating guide, but was also very knowledgeable about the area and its wine.We were able to choose which wine farms we wanted to visit and Roelf made sure we enjoyed each of them to the fullest. Roelf also suggested some of the cheese and chocolate tastings to go with our wine, which was enjoyed by everyone.Our guests from the UK had never been on a wine tour before and say they are going back to their friends now as wine buffs. (Lol)We will take this tour again next time we are down in Cape Town. Who knows, maybe after a few years we will have been to all of the farms.
Stellenbosch. Excellent again, great mix of casual and very upmarket, wine, plus chocolate tasting. And Yolanda was great company and guide.

Fantastic Tour Operator - Day Tour of Cape Point. We arranged a Cape Point Day Tour and had the most wonderful time with our guide Rudi. Rudi was extremely kind, professional, and answered all of our questions. We really enjoyed the flexibility as we were able to visit the Jewish Museum at the end of the day. This tour is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town! Such beautiful scenery along the way. Booking the tour with Pieter over email was completely effortless and prices are very reasonable.Would certainly recommend to all!

Perfect way to see the Cape area in one day. I highly recommend PG Tops Travel and Day Tours if you only have one day in Cape Town. Roelf was our tour guide and did a great job! He picked us up promptly at our hotel and we were off for the day. Roelf was very knowledgeable about the area, the culture and the history of the area. Although we spent the whole day with Roelf, his engaging personality and his knowledge made the day go so fast. I highly recommend if you book with PG TT, you ask for Roelf.

PG is definitely Tops!. Last September, Peter and his crew guided our group of twelve through Capetown, its' environs, and the wine country. We were a well-heeled crowd from Pasadena, California, and Greenwich, Connecticut--which means to say we are a bit fussy where we go and fairly demanding for qualityservice. Peter and Yolanda delivered! Of particular interest to most of us were many of Peter's insights into the culture and history of South Africa--a country that he clearly loves and which he shares with great sensitivity.I would say there was enthusiastic unanimity in our group for the excellent and inspired services we received from this group and all of us would love to return to a place PG made indeed a Tops destination!

PG Tops is TOPS. We enjoyed our time immensely in Cape Town, due in no small regard to PG Tops. Rudi treated us more as visiting friends than as clients, and his tours of both the coast and the wine country were splendid. He took us to favorite places we'd never get to on a normal tour and we learned more than we would have riding in a bus. A great value for the money. We can't thank you enough for introducing us to Cape Town and, should we get there again, which is entirely probable, we'll for certain be in contact. Thanks ever so much again, PG Tops, Doug and Anne Wilburn

Great Option for One Day Tour. Last November (2013) my boyfriend and I took this tour and the service was excellent. We selected the private tour option.They pick up us at 9:00 am at our hotel and in 8 hours we visited the all the spots we wanted.We went to Cam´s Bay, Cape Point, Boulders Beach, to a craft´s market and as an extra our guide took us to a vineyard for a wine tasting. Our guide was very kind, he was a local resident so he explained us everything we wanted in order to understand the life and culture of the area.This is the best option to have a complete view of Cape Town in just one day. You will not regret it.

Best two days of our time in Cape Town. We had two full days booked with PG during our stay in Cape Town - one for a day in the wine lands and one for a day driving to Cape Point. Both days was great and beyond what we could have imagined. Our guide Roelf was the best guide ever - he knew everything and pointed out things along the way. He knew about the wines, the fauna and the histories. We started out as clients and ended up as friends. On the last day we arrived early back from the tour and he took us up to Table mountain even though we had not booked this - it was our last chance of visiting the mountain and he was more than happy to help us by driving us up to the cable car, joining us up there and driving us down again. It was a great experience and if we ever come back we will def be booking PG and Roelf again!

PG Tops is a middleman, my tour was outsourced. Pros: Responsive to email, friendly staffCons: Throughout my email communications, there was no indication that PG Tops is actually just a middleman. After I confirmed my reservation, they sent me an email with all the details, and it was then I realized my actual tour operator for the Langa Township tour was in fact with another company called African Eagle. If I'd wanted to choose African Eagle, I could have booked it with them myself! I specifically chose PG Tops because of their high ranking on TripAdvisor, and African Eagle had a much lower ranking on TripAdvisor. Needless to say, I was not surprised when the tour turned out to be mediocre (eg. the pick up was 1 hour late, our tour guide kept disappearing and handing us off to other people during the tour).If I had to do it again, I would not choose PG Tops or African Eagle.

Fantastic Tour Guides!. My sister and myself visited Cape Town 3rd December to 14th December 2013. We had three complete days out with PG Tours, as well as pick up and drop off from airport, and could not be more pleased with them. Our guide was Rudi and we could not have asked for anyone more professional and knowledgeable he truly made our days out and we got much more out of them than we would have on our own. Prior to our arrival, I gave them a list of things we would like to do and they arranged a complete itinerary for us covering everything and giving us suggestions. We did so much! Cheetah Sanctuary, winelands, Cape Peninsula tour, horse riding at Imhoff Farm, chocolate and wine tasting at the most stunning wine estate, and a horseback safari plus more! They also arranged for us to go on a group Shark Cage Diving experience at Klenbaai. He made the journeys to and from our various destinations go very quickly by giving us detailed explanations of everything we saw and answering our endless questions. If you want to get to see what Cape Town has to offer this really is the best way of doing it. We would definitely ask for Rudi again as well, nothing was too much trouble for him. Special thanks to Yolanda also who sorted everything out before our arrival and kept in touch with us whilst we were there even though she was on holiday.

Great Day Tours in and around Cape Town thanks to PG Tops. I was recently in Cape Town on business but added a few days to enjoy the warmth and to see the area. Was I ever glad that PG Tops was recommended. I did the following day trips: Aquila private game reserve safari; the Cape Peninsula Tour and; Robben Island / Table Mountain and City Tour - they were all great. My guide was Yolanda and I couldn't have asked for a nicer more engaging person - she was a wealth of klnowledge and great fun to be around. I recommend PG Tops without any hesitation - well organized, client focused and simply good people! Next time I'm back i will certainly call them up and do other tours. Russell, Canada

Awesome tour. I had a 14 hour layover in Cape Town and wanted to do a tour of the top attractions. I was actually referred to PG Tops from another tour operator I found that wasn't able to accommodate me (which speaks to reputation of this operator). I scheduled a day trip to see Table Mountain and the Cape of Good Hope. Everything was done over e-mail and Pieter (the owner) was very responsive and coordinated well. The tour guide, Rudi, was great. He was on-time, very professional, and had interesting facts to share about the area. Overall, I had a great time. Highly recommended.

Can't get any better. If you are looking for a reliable and enjoyable tour experience, PG will come up tops! My family of 2 adults and 4 young children were fortunate enough to be accompanied by Rudi for my 11 days adventure in cape town and the garden route. Everything was well organised. We had good food, great wine recommended by Rudi and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Botlierskop private game reserve that we stayed in was awesome and we had a chef to personalise our dinner menu. Rudi is a gem of tour guide and you should ask for him if you are considering a private tour.

Capetown tours. My husband and I and two of our good friends had two wonderful days with Roelf of PG Tours. He picked us up right on time at our hotel in Capetown and took us to the wine country and shopping the first day and a tour of the peninsula the next day. We toured two wineries, had a great lunch at one, and when we were on the way back to the hotel, my friend mentioned that she would be interested in some jewelry. Roelf knew of a wholesale diamond store, who stayed open late for us. Yes, she did buy a gorgeous ring! The next day was also fabulous. Roelf recommended an excellent seafood restaurant right on the water, where we ate fresh fish and prawns until we were ready to burst! Roelf was very knowledgable about the area and patiently answered all our questions, stopped for pictures, etc. We would not hesitate to recommend PG Tours to anyone.

Fabulous Service!. Seriously, you can't do better than PG Tops and if I'm ever in the Cape or have friends going there I will recommend that they use this service. Punctual, flexible, courteous, friendly and responsive! Yolanda was the absolute best and totally knew what she was doing! Everyone in our party appreciated her knowledge and expertise...we managed to see so much in the short time we were there! Hats off to PG Tops!

Great Time. Went out with Pieter on the Cape of Good Hope Trip for the day. For those who are interested in more than just sightseeing, he surely knows his SA history and politics - I didn't stop asking questions. He took us to a great locals lunch spot as well. Great day.

Fantastic week in Cape Town with Yolanda from PG Tops. My wife and I spent 6 days in Cape Town with Yolanda who showed us around and went the extra mile every day to make sure we discover the nicest parts of her city and culture. Yolanda has been extremely friendly, very knowledgeable and really attentive to all our needs and expectation. She really took care of all details during our stay and this has been, by far, our best guided tour ever!I used other companies in the past to do the Peninsula tour, whales watching or visit the vineyards and none of the previous experiences I have had so far has been as good as what we experienced with PG Tops. They are actually selecting their partners and the places you visit so that you consistently enjoy the best available options. We'll for sure come back in Cape Town in a near future and we'll of course ask PG Tops, and in particular Yolanda, to guide us again. Thank you so much for this fantastic week in a fabulous town!

Discover Cape Town. I highly recommend this fantastic whole day tour through Cape Town and Langa with Roelf and Sugar! The guides make all the difference and these two were absolutely great. Very knowledgable about the town and its inhabitants, eager to answer all questions and curious to learn more...there is so much too see in Cape Town, this tour is definitely a great way of making the most of your stay!

PG tops - top tour guides!. we've just visited cape town and did both the townships and wineland tours with PG tours. both tourguides were friendly, knowledgable and attentive and we thoroughly enjoyed both trips. the township tour provides a very personal insight into a very different side of african culture that you wont get on any other tour. godfrey was our guide for the morning and was from the township he took us to. he made us feel very safe and comfortable and looked after us at all times. the highlight was definately getting to go to church as we went on a sunday. if churches were more like that in england im fairly sure attendance would be higher!!wine tasting was obviously very different and great fun. we hadnt a clue about wine tasting but had a good laugh and rudy took us to 4 very different estates to give us an idea of the range that is available. only complaint was he couldnt join in the tasting with us as he was designated driver! would definately recommend this company if you are lucky enough to be visiting the area

PG Tops -Yolanda is awesome. Friends traveled to Cape Town in April and recommended PG Tops and Yolanda. We took a private tour of Cape Point with Yolanda in October and we were NOT disappointed. Yolanda is personable and knows her stuff. She clearly loves her job and doesn't tire of driving around tourists and taking photos. Great attitude. We had a great day with her and we would recommend any of the tours offered by PG tops. Wish we had time to do more of them!

Really convenient and fun tour. Roelf was our guide for the Cape Point and Penguins tour. Really fantastic. He was informative and fun, answered our questions, treated us to tons of snacks, and when we told him a couple of fun markets we wanted to hit up, he made sure we made those stops on our tour. It was exactly what we wanted on our honeymoon as we ran around the cape. You gotta ask him about the koeksisters...i am pretty sure we got diabetes after hosing those bad boys down.

Amazing Adventure !!!. We spent unforgettable time with Roelf, our tour guide from PG Tops. We had 4 visiting days : City Tour : Castle of Good Hope, Signal hill, the Company Gardens, Bo Kaap and more; The Winelands with 3 wine tastings and the great region of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek; The Cape Point day where we saw zebra, baboons and pinguins at Boulders Beach and much more.. 4. We went to the Hermanus whales festival which was just an amazing and wonderful adventure. There is much more to do with PG Tops and we will definitely come down very soon to explore more deeply this fascinating region of South Africa! A big thanks to all the PG Tops Team! BBZ - VC - GP.

Worth every Rand!. We just spent 4 days in Cape Town and can highly recommend the PG Tops guide services. They have great vehicles, are very accommodating and will taylor your day to what you really want to do. We did a full day trip to the Cape of Good Hope, then another full day touring the city and then out to the wine country. They keep you safe, informed and guide you through such things as the best places to curio shop and what is customary for tipping at restaurants. We had a wonderful experience and would choose them again.

PG tops- was the tops!. Guides were professional, knowledgable, insightful and very nice!Pieter was our favorite! Took my wife and step-son shark cage diving and to see whales!Had a great time, guiding was reasonable and well worth it! Would recommend anyone to use PG TOPS, classy company!If we go back to Cape Town, we are definetly using this folks again to guide us!Ruiz familyBrownsville, Texas
